reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Wow! I can't believe I forgot to review this place.  Drinks are great, atmosphere is chill. All outdoor seating but they have fans, fire pits, outdoor games and the owner has a ranch with cool animals next door.   A must see!

reviews.author: W C.
reviews.description: Ah man, we really wish that we loved this place better than we did. We came here on Sunday with our two friends and their kids for the first time and the space is just gorgeous: lovely old oak trees, plenty of open space and tables, a little area with slides for the kids to run around and enjoy.  That's where the compliments stop. Everything else about our experience was wanting, starting with the GRUMPY woman who helped us at the bar. We ordered the burger--they were out (thanks for letting us know!). The winter smash cocktail tasted like it had zero whiskey in it and was poured from a spout. The IPA on draft was fine. The food that we did end up getting was only OK. The cucumber salad was runny and mealy, and the chopped brisket sandwich seemed like it could have been tasty that morning but by 5-whatever pm, it was dry as hell. We also didn't get the BBQ sauce that it was served with (our friends did for theirs). Our kid's quesadilla was standard. And bagged chips galore!  Also, they close at 6:00 pm. On a Sunday before a holiday. OK, fine, bad business, but you do you! Here's what's not cool: coming over to our table hot and heavy and telling us you're closing in five minutes with an attitude and demanding our food trays. We're happy to be accommodating! You just don't need to be jerks about it. If you've had a long day and just can't handle the customer service, then have enough self-awareness to ask a coworker to do the corralling.  Honestly, we went over to Fitzhugh afterwards which had good food (desserts at least), better service, a better play area for the kids, and we had way more fun there. We'd love to try Treaty Oak again, but we need to have enough time to forget the less savory aspects of our experience.

reviews.author: K S.
reviews.description: Good liquor and good atmosphere. As mentioned, plenty of space to spread out.   However, there's no simple way to just stop by to pick up a bottle. Even if you're not buying a mixed drink or anything that requires work other than handing you a bottle and paying for it you have to stand in the line that's serving cocktails and drinks.   Further, when you do get service, it's been rather dismissive the last few times we went. Expect to spend time there- no way to quickly pop in, grab merch and a bottle and leave.

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Took my second trip out to treaty oak and was not disappointed with the day spent here. Treaty Oak is the kind of place that you want to spend the entire day at, and you totally can! What I love about it too is that it's a massive space with so much to do while on the grounds. It even has a playground where the kids can play, and an indoor space with plenty of TVs to watch football on game day.  We started off with a tasting, which you can either do Gin or Whiskey. I actually highly recommend the tasting, it's only $10 a person but gives some great background on how each different flavor/bottle is created and made. You also can put the $10 towards a bottle if you end up wanting to buy one to take home.  We then went into the bar area and got drinks, which is a huge variety of cocktails! They have plenty of picnic tables, and multiple boards for cornhole on the grounds. The restaurant on site it BBQ and was amazing! We got the brisket sandwich and pork sandwich and loved them both. What I also loved about it, was that there's multiple places where you can get drinks, foods, etc. on the grounds but your tab stays open for everything. Love this place and highly recommend making a day trip out of it if you haven't been!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Here for a wedding reception. Top notch facility with top notch service. Bartenders were great! Exceptional craft cocktails all around. Catered BBQ was spot on.   Highly recommended for your special event. We'll be back for a visit.

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: A gem in the Hill Country area. Great outdoor seating with plenty of room for kids and adults to run around and play. Pet friendly.  We had the white sangria... which was just perfect for a summer afternoon with some brisket nachos that were yum yum yum! The kiddo had a blueberry lemonade with mac n cheese that disappeared in so little time. He couldn't stop exclaiming how good it was.  We'll definitely be back to try out the cocktail bar for a date night.  They didn't have live music but they were playing music of varying genre throughout the evening. Great way to relax and leave your stresses behind.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Treaty Oak Distillery in Dripping Springs is a great Texas distillery getting most things to make their bourbon and gin from around Texas. It has great covered patios and outdoor space throughout the property with a delicious restaurant- Alice's Restaurant, a tasting room, and a covered bar/lounge as well as an outdoor stage and small playground. We did the tour and tasting which allowed us to see the inner workings of the distillery. Cody was an excellent tour guide answering all our random questions as he showed us around the distillery. And I bought an old barrel, which I have wanted in my house for quite some time. I would highly recommend you get over there...today! Such a great time. Thanks Treaty Oak!!

reviews.author: Liana W.
reviews.description: I want to give this business a better review but unfortunately they had some major issues.  We went last weekend on Sunday and there was a sign to scan the QR code the for menu, we waited in a long line to order food, once everyone got to the cashier she told us that only the brunch menu was being served (it was like 2pm or something).   So everyone had to quickly change their order!   Talk about poor communication!! It should say on the menu very clearly what's being served.   Then, I tried to order vegetarian nachos but my cashier told me they were sold out of beans and that I should just get chips and queso instead, so I did. THEN my brother in law who ordered after me got his nachos which were vegetarian bean nachos (not meat like he ordered). I said "they told me they were sold out!" Again, bad communication.  Then, my brother in law ordered sangria and got a big pitcher, my dad went to order the same thing and they gave him HALF the size. So weird and confusing.   This place seems very confused internally and each worker seems to have their own message.  Also nothing for gluten-free vegans on the menu.

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Another great distillery to add to the list when in Dripping Springs! This place is huge and perfect for a group or date or even solo! So much space for you, your kids, and your dog! Bring the family! LoL  It was actually recommended to me at my last stop, and I love me some bourbon and whiskey so it was a no brainer. However, if bourbon isn't your thing they also have options for the gin, vodka and non alcoholic lovers in your group! Something for everyone I'd say!   That being said, I took off a star mostly because the line was stupid long. They definitely could have, and should have had more than just one single file line for us to get a drink, I spent half my time in line.   That being said though, once I got my drink and was able to enjoy the drink and the vibe it was great! They have live music and a restaurant if you get hungry and I ended up getting the day tripper drink! I loved it, it was so good. I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: I'm back home in FL whining about how upset I am that we can't just go to Treaty Oak anytime we want! :(   Seriously, grab your gang and head over to this literal farm full of whiskey and great BBQ. If you don't get the brisket nachos, you're making the biggest mistake of your life. But don't eat too much, or you'll be too full for the delicious drinks!   The vibe is relaxed, the food feels almost TOO good for the rustic setting and the live music is pure Texas charm. I could stay here all day!

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: The grounds are very nice. Plenty of room to spread out. Lots of picnic tables available in the shade. A playground. The food at the restaurant was pretty decent, if a little expensive. The staff inside the restaurant are very friendly, but it all seems very inefficient.  The reason for the 3 star review is really that both of the drinks we ordered were cocktails that are premade and then dispensed. They were....ok? A little too sweet and a lot too weak. I couldn't taste the whiskey/bourbon in either of them. For $9/drink at a distillery, I just expected better drinks made to order and I left feeling disappointed. If we had known the drinks we ordered were batch cocktails, we would have tried to order something else, but there was nothing on the menu to denote that.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: I headed out to Treaty Oak pretty reluctantly the other day. I'd been invited out there for a friends birthday and the idea of heading all the way to Dripping Springs on a hot Saturday afternoon to try bourbon (which in general all tastes like burning to me) wasn't really my idea of a great time. Man, I was wrong. First off, they have a wide selection of spirits, everything from gin and vodka to wine and beer. The setting is bucolic with wide open spaces and clusters of shade trees. A friendly staff, great bbq (try the brisket nachos) and some tasty signature cocktails (try the Pineapple Express) made for a great afternoon that turned into a lovely evening. Did I mention they also had live music? I will be back.

reviews.author: Shourjo D.
reviews.description: A really nice setup: good bbq and similar food offerings alongside their own whiskey and gin offerings.  Seriously, the cocktails are worth it, as is visiting the beautiful property and spending an afternoon there with friends.  Each time I've been, I've really enjoyed the Hill Country Dreaming cocktail.  Also, the root beer they make is delicious and will totally hit the spot on a hot day.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: If your looking for some outdoor patio vibes during this gorgeous spring weather then this is your place! Just about 30-40 minutes outside of Austin lies this beautiful distillery. There's so much space and more than enough seating but even on the weekends this place can get pretty busy. As for food you can expect Texas bbq from this place as I tried both the brisket and Turkey which were both very good. If your not a booze person they also have their own in house wines and beer but if you do like a good cocktail I'd recommend hill country dreaming. Im anticipating come back here to check this place out in the evening for some live music or Sunday brunch!

reviews.author: Kaeleigh S.
reviews.description: The perfect spot for a sunny day hang, celebration activity, or date! We came for my best friend's bachelorette weekend and we are so glad we did!!   Parking was ample and so were the picnic tables! We didn't do a tour but put our name in for lunch at the restaurant, Alice's. It was about a thirty minute wait on a Saturday around 1, which really went unnoticed because we just grabbed drinks at the Cocktail Bar and sat in the open seating area until they called us saying it was ready. There was live music, lots of space and tables , cornhole, and you could go do a distillery tour too.   The bartenders were helpful in finding a gluten free drink option for me, as well as our waitress at Alice's. Our waitress was especially friendly and attentive--didn't get her name but a recent HS grad going to UT! She made sure to ask about gluten and dairy free options for me, and there were plentiful. Everyone devoured their food and were happily satisfied. I had a delicious club sandwich on gluten free bread with some salt and pepper chips. SO good. I also loved the white sangria.   All in all, I am so glad we found it and the bride said it was the perfect way to spend our day. We definitely will be back!

reviews.author: Denniz S.
reviews.description: The food, the cocktails (they are sooooo GOOD!!), the biggy canvas painting. I love it all. Treaty Oak is accommodating to everyone. We bring our toddler and she runs around on the playground while we eat and drink. They have sports on the TV inside a/ indoor dining. A tasting room and tons of outdoor seating.  If the weather is nice and we have friends in town treaty oak is an absolute obligatory stop.

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: We love this place!  The drinks are always yummy and very innovative ideas - the frozen ones are my favorite!  And the FOOD!!!  My favorite item is the Cold Trio appetizer!  It is delicious!  But, the atmosphere is what is really cool!  It's spread out - dogs are welcome - and it's beautiful!  If you are in the area - you should definitely check it out!  If not, it's worth the drive!

reviews.author: Hannah M.
reviews.description: CAN I LIVE HERE?! I am obsessed with this place. The restaurant had some of the best food I've ever eaten (their Mac is addictive) and all of the staff was amazing. Zach was our main server but they all work as a team so you were never once waiting around. The drinks were great, the bakery items were great and I think I've already said enough about the food. This is first on my list next time I'm in town!

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Cool place to come to.   Went through the distillery tour and it was very personalized. The guy leading the chat was fun and engaging. Ended at the tasting room and we had a chance to try a number of really great flavors. Also had some cocktails. The manhattan was a bit weak and watered down but the old fashioned is very good. A but on the sweet side but still delicious.   We then went down to their restaurant and had food and drinks. The bbq is very good. Brisket is a little more moist than i would want so i would recommend the turkey and ribs. Very good. The chips and queso are also delicious.   We ended with the bourbon pecan pie. Truthfully it was not all that special. I love pecan pie and this was a bit of a letdown. Not sure where these come from but store bought would be better. These were a bit bland and under whelming.   Property is beautiful. Great place to go and hang out and relax, get a cool drink and enjoy some music on a cool day.

reviews.author: Lance O.
reviews.description: Does Heaven touch earth anywhere? There is a beautiful place in the Texas Hill Country where the grain meets glass and the bourbon is distilled on site alongside a menu that will make any true Texan proud.   Classic features paired perfectly with great service and a family friendly vibe. This is great might, great food and a little slice of Heaven here tonight in the Hill Country.

reviews.author: Roz S.
reviews.description: Our visit to the Dripping Springs Distillery was extraordinary. We hosted a group of 12, many were visiting from the UK. The tour and tasting was fantastic. Talon, our tour guide was so knowledgeable, engaging and witty. We started with drinks prior to the tour and Miley was so outgoing and welcoming. The follow up lunch and drinks topped off the afternoon. The food was delicious and our server Jake was so accommodating. Everyone enjoyed the beautiful grounds and tried their luck with the cornhole boards. It became a bit of a competition! The group said the day was superb and the quality of the gin rivaled the best from across the pond.

reviews.author: Carlos V.
reviews.description: My wife and I had scheduled a tasting and tour of the distillery several weeks before we were arriving in Austin.  Unfortunately, our plane flight was cancelled the day of our arrival.  We were very disappointed.  I called the manager, Kristi Quick, and she accommodated us completely.  Seldom do you see such actions any more.  She took some time our of her busy day to let us sample the spirits and even gave us some great local restaurant recommendations for lunch and dinner!  Her gracious hospitality was very much appreciated.  This is now going to be my vodka of choice...

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Dripping Springs Distilling is just now opening its spanking new tasting room, patios, entertainment venue and production facility, and it is splendid. I went there four years ago, when the tasting room was essentially the lobby to the distillery. While I great.y appreciated what they were doing with their gins and vodkas, the ambience was like drinking in the lobby of Atscott manufacturing in Pine City, Minnesota. This new facility reshuffles the entire deck.  It has taken them a while to complete, but it was worth it. The new venue is spectacular -- well designed, comfortably modern, spacious and welcoming. It's not only a tasting room, it's also a credible restaurant with an interesting menu, specials, and a exceptionally friendly staff.  We went on the second weekend of the 'soft 'opening', but they seemed to have already worked all the kinks out. They were welcoming and prompt and attentive. Our server, Jack, went out of his way to answer questions, including about plantings on the grounds and ingredients in the dishes, and to offer suggestions about cocktails.   I had the street taco daily special and an Electric Lady cocktail. My companion had the jalapeño cornbread muffins and a French 75. The street tacos were small but fully packed. The spice mix could have been spicier,  it then I like hot. The flavors though were indeed special. Nothing dominated, so you could appreciate the protein and still enjoy the comity cheese and the light drizzle of sour cream. The tortillas were a bit small, but you expect that in a street taco. My friends jalapeño corn muffins were excellent. A well constructed corn muffin with one slice of jalapeño that came up and kicked your butt on the after palate. There were plenty of them, so we took lots home for later. The regular entre menu is interesting enough (two different pot pies, additional comfort type foods) that I'll be back.  I should not forget the flight of spirits. I've always respected their two gins, and I often buy them as they are available at Twin and Specs. Very solid, unpretentious and well crafted. I'm not a vodka guy, but my friend liked their offerings. Their 1876 bourbon still needs some maturation and work though. But such is the case with whiskey.   The full grand opening is coming up, with all the hoopla expected. Once the noise is past, Dripping Springs Distilling, with its multiple brands and spirits, will be a destination you'll want to add to the itinerary.

reviews.author: Mark S.
reviews.description: Only go here if you like amazing food, drinks and people!  Otherwise this place isn't for you. Only ask: later hours on Fridays!

reviews.author: Marya B.
reviews.description: This was a fun afternoon outing for us.  We had tasted the orange vodka at a local restaurant, and we were intrigued at what else they had to offer.  We booked a tour, which turned out to be very informative and Talon was a great guide!  The only (teeny) downfall of the tour was the distillery was operational that day and was a little noisy and difficult to hear our guide.  We enjoyed a cocktail and lunch on the patio.  I had the Basil Sour and my husband had an Old Fashioned.  We both had the grilled cheese and tomato soup.  Everything was delicious!

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: This place is amazing. The food, drinks, service, landscaping, and all the above we nothing short of awesome. If you're in the area and are looking for a good distillery to visit, then I highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Terra B.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful time at the Dripping Springs Distillery. Talon led us on a great tour and tasting, and then we enjoyed great drinks and lunch. I actually commented to my husband that everyone we encountered there was positive and friendly, which can be rare these days. Highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Alex B.
reviews.description: The tour was great and our tour guide was awesome. It was great to see a distillery that truly cares about their products and that people enjoy them. Will definitely go back. Dripping spring will be my choice of vodka now saw a lot of previous review commenting on size but has plenty of room indoor and outdoor. We enjoyed sitting and having a cocktail for awhile after the tour.

reviews.author: Heather A.
reviews.description: We had a great experience at Dripping Springs Distiller.  Not only was the tour interesting but the staff really went out of their way to make us feel welcome.  The tasting was wonderful, especially the vodkas- so smooth.  We look forward to visiting again soon.

reviews.author: Kathleen K.
reviews.description: A tour/tasting at Dripping Springs Distillery was such a fun way to spend a Saturday afternoon.  Our guide Talon was so informative and we learned so much and had a lot of fun!  The vodka was amazing especially the Orange!  The grounds are amazing too--thank you!

reviews.author: Matt P.
reviews.description: Great venue to visit.  The tour was informative and everyone was super friendly....not to mention good drinks and food.  Poking forward to bringing more out of town guests there.

reviews.author: Morgan J.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out and have awesome craft cocktails and delicious food.  The tour and tasting is well with it too.  Love this place!

reviews.author: Twisted Texas T.
reviews.description: Lovely space, friendly folks, great spirits. The new renovations are beautiful, and the quality of the product hasn't change at all! Great place to spend a couple hours relaxing.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Still awesome as always, but even better. You don't need appointments to visit anymore and they have a great indoor/outdoor seating area where you can enjoy cocktails. They also make whiskey now. There is alot of construction onsite to build a restaurant and much more.

reviews.author: Samuel B.
reviews.description: Cute little spot. On the outskirts of Dripping Springs. Simple and clean. Taste some vodkas and their new Bourbans

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: This is a cool distillery. They have several cocktails for $8 each on Thursday to Saturday. There are tables and chairs inside the distillery. It is worth stopping when going on a distillery tour. There is lots of parking and the staff is very friendly. However they do not have food.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: This was a fun way to kill an hour or so on a Saturday. The tour is very simple. You walk to see the stills and they do a quick run through on how they make their vodka and gin. You can see how they soak the herbs for the gin and how they do their bottling. It was interesting to learn how labor intensive their orange vodka is to make since they hand zest the orange rinds.   Obviously, the highlight is the tasting. You get to sample their vodkas, gins, and their brand new 1876 bourbon.   All in all a fun tour and tasting. I was super happy to get the last bottle of their first release batch of their 1876 bourbon after the tasting and the gal doing the tasting was great as well.   For $11 you get the tour, tasting, and a shot glass.

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: Best vodka hands down. The grey goose of Texas and not to compare with grey goose because grey goose can't come close to Dripping Springs vodka. Great tour and staff are very friendly.

reviews.author: Ali C.
reviews.description: I love their vodka.  My husband and I did the $7.00 tasting.  You get 6-7 samples and get to try all of their product.  They have 3-4 vodkas and a couple bourbons.  The vodka is so smooth.  You can tell they use high quality water!    My family is a Tito's family but after coming to the tasting, I bought 5 bottles for my family members. We'll be using Dripping Springs vodka from now on!

reviews.author: Amie M.
reviews.description: Great indoor/outdoor space. Friendly staff and a great cocktail! I choose the Gin Rickey with the Dripping Springs Artisan Gin, cucumber, limeade and sparking water. It was crisp and refreshing and the fun was super smooth. 5 star gin drink in my book!

reviews.author: Fana T.
reviews.description: Great sotol, hip environment, nice and clean. Kelsey our server was lovely, will come back for the river Rita next time.

reviews.author: Jill C.
reviews.description: First time trying Sotol, and there wasn't a cocktail on the menu that wasn't incredibly delicious. We sat outside in the lovely fall weather, enjoyed some acoustic tunes by a talented duo with a female vocalist, and tried several cocktails -- all of which we enjoyed. My friend tried the frozen Bartender's Choice which was like a frozen apple cinnamon cocktail, and I tried the Comanchero, the Yipping Coyote, and the Rugged Flower. Each were so smooth and well-balanced. This place not only makes a flavorful Sotol with a smooth, clean finish but transforms it into mouth-watering mixology masterpieces!   Aside from the bus loads of out-of-town tourists who looked like they were part of an Instagram filter for an "Ashley/Ashleigh" compilation (complete with brimmed hat, scarf, and boots), this place is a must-visit if you're in Austin. Couple it with a trip to nearby Fredericksburg and you've got yourself an amazing day!

reviews.author: Mahesh P.
reviews.description: This is their Sotol Tasting Room. Which may not seem all that great, but boy howdy, is it ever! They've got their sotol, of course, but also a whole bunch of (sotol and other) cocktails, food, and a pretty cool outdoor space with plenty of place to chill. Best of all, there's pretty much always some sort of musician doing their thing (this *is* Austin after all!)  If only it wasn't a decent drive away....

reviews.author: Rosario F.
reviews.description: My friend who knows all the hot spots invited me here during the stricter COVID times. It's a heck of a drive but I was really impressed with how lovely this place is. Very Instagramable location with the truck outside and the silo.   PARKING I went when it was pretty busy. I found parking but I did have to wait for like 5 minutes so cars could clear the road. It gets pretty tight once the parking spots are all full. It's all free. A lot of cars parked on the road. Just be careful crossing the road.   FOOD When I was here they only had one food truck. The options were limited. The prices were a bit too high for the food options available. I didn't try it out. My friends ordered a few things and they felt the food was just ok. I'm not sure on the current food status here.   AMBIANCE  They only had outdoor seating when I was here because of COVID. I sat on the covered outdoor seating which was great since it was around summertime. It was HOT! Really cute tables, friendly/helpful staff, and live music! I don't remember his name but there was a gentleman playing guitar and singing. He was fantastic!   DRINKS I ordered 3 drinks. The first two were the Comanchero and the third was The Copperhead. I'm glad I stopped there. They are strong!   I'm giving it four stars because I felt like the size of the drinks didn't coincide with their prices. I hope I get to stop by here again. It's a bit of a drive for me. It's a really beautiful drive though. Keep kicking butt y'all! I want to try everything!!

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Finally decided to take a day trip down to dripping springs and had to finally stop at Desert Door. To start, this place is designed so beautifully. I wish I could steal the décor and put it into my own home. Both the inside and out were so inviting, I don't know how someone could go and not spend hours enjoying the ambiance, food, and drinks. What I thought was so cool about Desert Door was that they educated you on what you were drinking and the history of Sotol. What I did not know, is that they are actually the only Sotol distillery in the US.  We started off with the Sotol flight, and two drinks. Although we did enjoy tasting the Sotol by itself, it was a lot to start the afternoon off with! We also ordered the The Copperhead (my personal favorite of the day), the River Rita, and the Sotol'd Fashioned. I loved each drink but the copperhead was definitely the star of the day, which was a Sotol version of an espresso martini. They also have a food truck on site serving out very unique food. We ordered the tacos and vegan "queso" and both really surprised us by how unique and amazing it was. We loved this trip out to Desert Door, and will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Corianne O.
reviews.description: Honestly great environment. Good drinks AND live music. So much fun. Really loved the drinks and the tequila. Nicole gave us our drinks and she had the absolute best service. If you can request her, I would. 10/10 experience.

reviews.author: Deborah C.
reviews.description: So glad we stopped by Desert Door on our way to a Getaway cabin.  The mixed drinks are on point! The entire staff were so friendly. Cozy/desert vibe inside! Huge outdoor covered area with plenty of picnic benches and  lounge seating.  I can't remember who our server was but she was freakin awesome! She brought our pup a pupsicool (bone broth frozen pup treat) to keep cool and occupied lol. Pup also sported a DD bandanna : )  We didn't order any food from the food truck, but appreciated the option to order quick bites.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: I'm generally not a huge fan of tasting rooms and find them gimmicky and far from truly experiencing the spirit of the spirit. See what I did there.   But every rule has its exception, or exceptional. Desert Door is a destination in itself. Beautiful southwestern interiors and stylish furniture. The space is cozy but didn't feel crowded, though every table was full. They do have a large patio for outdoor seating and bigger groups.   Now, the sotol. I had never heard of it and didn't know what to expect. The best way I can describe it is an agave spirit, clear, between a vodka and a tequila in its thickness/smoothness. In plain English, it's delicious.   We did the tasting flight, which was a great way to get introduced to a new spirit, followed by a round of cocktails. The cocktails were excellent and reasonably priced.   They also had a lovely food truck on site but we didn't have enough time to try it.

reviews.author: Meaghan S.
reviews.description: Ended up at Desert Door after a lunch at Saltlick. Doot, the host, got us seated right away at a cozy soft seating area outside. Great patio vibes: chill, mist fans going , and live music about to start. Inside is nice too, super clean and cute/trendy.   The sotol is great and their cocktails are delicious, as well as unique. Had a difficult time deciding which one to get but our attentive and extremely friendly waitress, Nicole strayed me the right way with the Comanchero. Hubs got the ranch water (served in a Topo Chico, gotta love that)!   Nicole our waitress and Erin the bartender are solid assets at this establishment! Thank y'all for a great Saturday afternoon!

reviews.author: CARLA B.
reviews.description: OMG!  Where do I start.  Stumbled across this gem riding to the Salt Lick in Driftwood.    Staff was great with explaining Sotols and provided amazing  recommendations.    The Sotol Flight is great.  My fav was the Gin forward Sotol as I have gravitated towards Gin in the last few months   Love band outside play with amazing indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Mckenna R.
reviews.description: OMG this place was something we happened to stumble upon and it is a Austin must! This is a great cocktail bar that is modern and very desert chic. We are so so happy we stopped here and will be buy thing their Stool back home to make our own delicious Palomas. Also whatever their berry cocktail is, is a must try.

reviews.author: Shelly M.
reviews.description: Had an amazing hour enjoying sotol cocktails! Erin and Nicole are amazing. So glad we decided to stop in and can't wait to come back with friends! Facility is gorgeous and has a beautiful West Texas vibe. Can't wait to enjoy music on the porch!

reviews.author: Erin D.
reviews.description: Just left here with our crew! Here for a wedding and this place was recommended to us. It did not disappoint. Kelsey was the BEST waitress. She was so nice, helpful, and friendly. We all talked about her and how great she made our experience. The drinks were awesome and the vibe of the place is great. Highly recommend you come here! Be sure to request Kelsey for the best service!

reviews.author: Melissa M.
reviews.description: Our favorite spot in the Dripping Springs / Driftwood area. Obsessed with all the cocktails - specifically the comanchero. Obsessed with the interior decor  - please do my house next. Obsessed with all the servers - Nicole, Kelsey + Erin* are WONDERFUL. This place is the best!!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful, can't-miss distillery in Texas Hill Country!   We were absolutely shocked by how much we loved Sotol after trying it first as a standalone shot. And they sure know how to do a cocktail, too! I got the River Rita and it legit blew my mind.   Sit and stay awhile, listen to the live music on the patio and if you need to cool down, the interior is a WHOLE mood.   Be sure to visit their gift shop to buy an adorable handmade clay shotglass (SO CUTE) and a bottle of their famous Sotol.   The staff was also astoundingly friendly and the kind of people you want to hang out with.

reviews.author: Ang B.
reviews.description: I would give this place 10 stars if I could. Love these folks and I know some day we'll go out there and there will be a wait, for now it's still somewhat of an unknown. We've only had wonderful cocktails and bought several bottles of Sotol from them. I like that it has less carbs than tequila! Anyway, the choice of food truck out there is solid (Eden).  I wish I could live next door!

reviews.author: Hannah K.
reviews.description: This place is great! Good food, great service, even better drinks. Kelsey was our server and she was so friendly and attentive! We'll definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Michelle R.
reviews.description: If you want a unique drink, great atmosphere and amazing staff.... Go here. We were able to get different but classic drinks and cozy up to fireplace. The food truck made the best fries and quest, perfect for sharing.

reviews.author: Anh N.
reviews.description: So glad we finally stopped in to DD! Great distillery with ample patio and outdoor seating! Loved all of their cocktails. They also have live music.  Try the food truck Eden West on site, their quail bites are delish!

reviews.author: Leah C.
reviews.description: So I actually had a taste of their goods at the total wine and me an my mom decided the distillery wasn't too far and we should check it out. Very unique sotol experience, I want to say they are the only distillery in the states, but could be wrong! Very nice outside space, they have a food truck with some very good food! It is a bit of a drive but worth the trek. Had a lovely time here and would certainly come back! Just have to be careful on not enjoying too many beverages as it is a drive!!

reviews.author: Brittney T.
reviews.description: So fun! This place is huge and dog friendly.   They have flights and all sorts of different cocktails for you to try. I do love vodka - so this distillery is a lot of fun.    The staff is fun and knowledgeable. They made a lot of good recs for drinks.    They have a little food stand inside for some small bites.   Would recommend to stop by if you're in Austin!

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Finally I was able to make it out to the distillery with my good friend early on a Saturday so that we could get some direct tasting vodka notes from Deep Eddy themselves rather than me taking shots at bars around Austin.  Parking was easy for us but do note that we showed up around 11:20AM on a Saturday so we didn't have any issues.  The later you arrive parking could be a thing and you may have to wait/stalk someone who is leaving to get a spot. Also as the day got later there were many buses and charter vans parked in the front and roundabout chilling out as the company they are driving around are inside getting down too.  Cocktails in a paper cup runs $8 with plenty to choose from the menu that is thoughtfully laid out in sweet, sours, spicy, etc. A nice mason jar with the Deep Eddy logo is $12 and slightly larger.  Do know that they will not refill your mason jar after you buy your first one so be prepared to be clanking around the distillery with your extra mason jars if you keep going the $12 route. Also be careful with your glass too - I saw many people let that mason jar slip out of their hands and the mason jar just crash on the concrete floor. So sad! Also frozen drinks / cocktails can only be purchased downstairs so be ready to wait in a little line if it is busy.   Loved the areas to sit inside the tasting room and even in the 2nd large downstairs area.  The pillows, decor, and the small touches around the sitting areas on the first floor are super cute and selfie-worthy.  I can imagine in the winter, with the large fireplace going, this space is cozy AF!  We didn't go outside at all as it was super hot in July but it looked like there are plenty of tables, shade, and seating for some large groups both in the front, side, and back areas.  After 2 cocktails in a mason jar we were feeling a good buzz and knowing we still had to trek back home (south Austin) we cut it off there. By the time we left around 2pm the place was buzzing with people, all 3 bars had 10+ waiting to be served, and I wasn't planning on waiting to close my tab in a long line.  I was super surprised to find out you can close your tab at the merch area with the cashier there so don't fret and add in that mug, stickers, shirts, bar additions, and Deep Eddy cool pool lady in red signage to your basket to check out while you close out your tab. You will save yourself some time and be out of there in a jiffy!  We plan to come back especially now knowing they are opened on Thursdays at 11am!!!!

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Deep Eddy Vodka Tasting Room is a great spot to hang with friends while sipping any number of their flavored vodkas. My favorite is probably the peach vodka and they have many cocktails to choose from. We went on a Sunday where there were local vendors there too as well as live music. Head to Dripping Springs for the great tasting room. Unfortunately, the distillery near Buda is not one that is open to the public, so the tasting room is where to go.

reviews.author: Angela R.
reviews.description: We started our bachelorette day here. The Bloody Mary was so yummy! I got it spicy. Sometimes they're a hit and miss but here... not a chance. The bartender made it to perfection! I also loved my souvenir glass I got to bring home with me. The vibe and atmosphere of this tasting room is super chill and cozy. 10/10 recommend !

reviews.author: Valerie V.
reviews.description: Wonderful space for great and unique cocktails. Both indoor and outdoor seating are roomy and spread out. They were already decorated for Christmas when went today 11/6. I loved the Spring Sling and the Ruby Red one with the jalapeño. Definitely a must do in the Austin area if your are distillery and brewery

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Like I was saying earlier, I find tasting rooms gimmicky and this one is a perfect example of it.   We chose to come here because I have deep respect for Deep Eddy as a company for their commitment and contributions to the local community. They've gone above and beyond again and again. Respect!  The tasting room is a large hall, with flights consisting of tiny cups of flavored vodka. You don't taste the actual spirit because the fruity flavors are so sweet.   The "Colombian" food options on-site is a joke. It's an old school concession stand (movie theater of the 80s style) with heat lamps keeping nacho chips warm on a folding table. Don't expect tacos or empanadas.  The space, both indoors and outdoor, is quite large. And they have a cute performance stage inside.  We stayed a total of 15 minutes.

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: A lovely farewell brunch was held here in the tasting room. There was ample seating both indoors and out. The bartenders were attentive and the drinks were tasty too. We'd like to return and sample other beverages.

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Spacious - great for large groups!  Food - one small food truck  Drinks - the vodka is a bit harsh; personally preferred the cranberry flavored vodka best (smoothest). Bartenders are very friendly and fast but the drinks are simply made and during Covid they are all touching the mint in their hands by smacking it. Id rather a gentle crush/roll in a glass... felt a bit gross (others commented too).  Wish there was live music Saturday afternoon at 4  Games outside like giant connect 4 etc  Parking- gets full on weekends so a bit tight  The decor was cute  Sheriff at the door to handle anyone getting a little too cray

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: My Husband surprised me with a day-date to Dripping Springs, Texas. I am a huge fan of Deep Eddy Vodka and this was an amazing way to try all of the flavors.  The set-up is gorgeous and feels so clean when you walk in. You get a behind the scenes taste of where the best Texas vodka comes from. The staff was kind and knowledgeable. They answered any questions we had about the drinks. I ordered a $10 flight and my Husband got the Orange dreamcicle drink. You have the option to get your drink in a mason jar as a keep sake.  There is a great gift shop on site, so we got matching shirts because we are cheesy like that.  There was a delicious food truck out front that had Vegan and Meat Eater options available. I like that they cater to both.   There is so much to do in the surrounding area. We went thrifting and enjoyed the nature that Hill Country has to offer.

reviews.author: Bret B.
reviews.description: Huge fans of Deep Eddy's grapefruit vodka.  Great with soda for easiest of easy beach drink.  Fun first stop before three winery visits nearby.    They have a responsible pandemic process in place managing number of folks going through and requiring masks.    Highly recommend Deep Eddy's as first stop when in Dripping Springs.  Cheers y'all

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed our short visit to the Deep Eddy distillery. We are already big fans of Deep Eddy's vodka and all of their flavors, so we had no doubt we would enjoy our time there. The cocktails they serve at their bar are innovative and refreshing. I ordered the Spring Sling and he ordered the Austin Mule. We both enjoyed the drinks next to the patio where they had multiple groupings of chairs spread out on the lawn. Other than drinking, there's not much else to do here, but it's definitely a lively place to enjoy a drink with friends! Our bartender was also very kind and helped us choose the right cocktails for each of us.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: The Deep Eddy Tasting Room is making some delicious cocktails! We found ourselves here with friends on a Saturday afternoon. The weather was perfect and they have a nice little patio area. The spot is family friendly meaning you can bring your kids, but there isn't a lot for them to do except run around in the patio area. I would have liked if the patio area was fenced off and not open to the parking so I could relax a bit more. I had to keep a close eye to make sure my kid didn't wander off. I enjoyed both of the drinks I tasted and would definitely stop in here to explore more of the tastings, but will likely leave the kid at home next time.

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: No complaints here. You can take home the souvenir cup or jar whenever you order. Try the Texas tea and you won't regret it. Everything here is made to order with frozen drinks being located downstairs. The service is also great! We went on a Sunday and had a wonderful experience. They also have a nice selection of merchandise.

reviews.author: Ara A.
reviews.description: Excellent service, great drinks with all their offerings. They don't charge for mock tails which is very nice if you don't want alcohol.

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: In our multiple trips to central Texas, we kept missing Deep Eddy although we tried each time; just unlucky timing. FINALLY this past weekend we got there when they were open! Oh we were so excited and the place lived up to the hype. The seating atmosphere both inside and out is very roomy and comfortable. All the staff is friendly and easy-going. Everywhere including the bathrooms were incredibly clean. The cocktails... the cocktails are downright amazing. They're inventive, delicious, and fresh. You're going to have a hard decision to make no matter what kind of drinks you like... I actually ended up ordering two at once because I couldn't decide! On the way out, we stopped at their little gift shop and man do they pack that area with goodies! Talk about variety and options. The shirts are awesome and made very well to boot, and they have tons of other merch. I left with a soft tanktop, a wicked fun tin can that I plan on using for a cactus or succulent vase, a magnet, and a collapsible dog bowl! We'll be back every chance we get. Loved it, loved everything, love the vodka.

reviews.author: Garrett F.
reviews.description: Definitely go during the week no crowds. Get as many flights as your table can handle. Upgrade your first drink to get the mason jar!  Merch area needs works, better options, pricing. Looks like the area was an afterthought.  Overall we had a great time. No tours still, Covid.

reviews.author: Kylie W.
reviews.description: If you have the time definitely a cool spot to check out. Indoor and outdoor seating with a little gift shop. Got some flights to taste and a frozen drink

reviews.author: Riley B.
reviews.description: ‼PSA: NEVER go to the Deep Eddy's Vodka Tasting Room!!‼ HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED AS A REGULAR DEEP EDDYS ENTHUSI  My friends and I went out to celebrate Maddy Montgomery's 22nd birthday and were harassed by the manager for being "underage".   The whole group willingly gave our ID's for inspection and the birthday girl's ID was "questionable", so she was taken to a cop car by a Sheriff, put in the back and questioned.  While Maddy was at the cop car getting her ID verified, the rest of the group had our full drinks/cups (that we paid for and were able to take home), snatched out of our hands. We all requested a refund for the drinks and were denied??  After the Sherriff verified that Maddy's ID was real, the manager proceeded to threaten tresspassing charges against us??   I have never experienced anything like this and would love to be contacted/reimbursed for the mistake that was clearly made.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Our Jeep club organized an event at this establishment, anticipating a fun and enjoyable experience.  Wrong!  I will preface that this whole COVID thing has still, for some reason, has some still on edge.  However, this place has taken it to new heights.  While the great state of Texas has opened to 100%, this place seems to have missed that memo.  We literally got yelled it for actually standing up at our tables and told that if we do stand to have a mask on.  Additionally, we got yelled at for moving a table.  The guys exact words were "I'm picky where our furniture is placed."  Additionally, if you want to get a beverage, you actually have to MAKE A RESERVATION just to go in get one.  That is ridiculous!  By the way, the Hays County police are on site to enforce all of this over-the-top nonsense.  Most of us stayed for a single drink and then left for better and more fun pastures.  It's obvious that this place has forgotten all about who the consumer is and how we should be treated.  Not only will we never go back, but I am never going to purchase any of their products again.  By the way...the Jeep community here in Texas is very tight-knit and we will talk...

reviews.author: Holly T.
reviews.description: This was nice and the drinks were great. It was crowded so keep that in mind and call ahead. No one was wearing masks...including myself. Normally, I would though and as an afterthought, I probably should have.  Just FYI, whatever your choice.

reviews.author: Carl W.
reviews.description: The owner Colonel Phil W is a true American patriot. His drinks all have names that conjure up military maneuvers of yesteryear. He cares deeply about this country and is willing to defend it even in the face of a lousy subpoena issued to him by Cheney's witch hunt from the House select committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol. Jeez. Why don't these libtards give up already! They should instead enjoy a refreshing beverage from the establishment owned by Colonel Phil Waldron. A man who realized the election was rigged and had constructed a plan for throwing out the results. What an American hero!!

reviews.author: Delia S.
reviews.description: Let me preface my review by saying that I'm not an avid beer drinker and only like non-hoppy varieties. I can't really comment on their beer other than to say, the three I tried were not to my liking, but what I can say is that I love this place!  I've been here twice now, with friends, and with my man and both times have been great!  The place is spacious and covered in tree canopies with a sprinkle of fire pits, Adirondack chairs and picnic tables. The service is good and the mules are divine. I love that they serve cocktails as well as beer so there is something that I like and something for the beer drinkers, like my boo.   We were lucky on both occasions to have great weather and this time around, live music. I've been to several of the breweries and distilleries along Fitzhugh and so far, this is my favorite.

reviews.author: Rodolfo R.
reviews.description: What a disgusting excuse for an establishment. If you like the bitter taste of sedition and treason with your drinks then feel free to patronize this "s-hole" of an establishment, as a true American... I prefer to spend my American dollars elsewhere.

reviews.author: Chris L.
reviews.description: I didn't care for the place or the drinks at all.  The staff was rude and one of them insulted my wife when she asked for some more ice.  Will not return when I'm back in Texas

reviews.author: Kevin D.
reviews.description: This place is a joke.  Spirits taste like rubbing alcohol and staff are incredibly rude.  Much better places to drink in the area.

reviews.author: Robert B.
reviews.description: Many people are saying that it's just Costco booze sold as house-made, and the owner is a traitor.

reviews.author: Bill D.
reviews.description: This place is owned by a seditionist traitor, a person complicit in attempting to subvert the results of the last election and install a dictator. He dishonors himself and his military service, having taken an oath to defend the constitution and then taking a big dump on it. I'd say shame on him, but people like him know no shame. There are much better places than this to spend your drinking money

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: So long and short. Rock solid 5 stars.   Our waitress Chloe was super sweet and delivered us a round of all 4 rums. The Gold had a little bite to it, but all were delicious.   The wife's hurricane was potent but delicious.   I snagged a raddler which was a little different to a traditional one, but delicious and dangerous as you can probably down 6 before the Lord almighty gets the news.   The brew house and distillery are open and outside seating is abundant.   Bring your 4-legged friends for the ride as they are super dog friendly!!!!  You would have to be drunk and mad to pass this place when visiting Dripping Springs. Wait...they might be able to take care of that for you...responsibly of course.   So. Great drinks? Check. Great staff? Check. Great atmosphere? Check? VETERAN OWNED BUSINESS?!? Affirmative. God Bless y'all for your service.   Rock solid 5 stars.

reviews.author: Tia H.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem!! We stopped in by chance, having never heard of it, and we're so pleasantly surprised. Not only is the owner a super friendly fella, but the alcohol is legit on point. I don't remember the last time I had such a smooth vodka. And the hurricanes- wow. So. Freaking. Good. The place is adorable, by the way. Super super cute. Veteran owned is a huge plus. We'll be going back again and again.

reviews.author: Maine R.
reviews.description: Literally bugs floating in our beer, this place is disgusting!

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: I'm giving them a three star, because I like the location and that there is outdoor seating... And that the staff is attentive. Otherwise I probably would not come back here, the drink I got was literally all syrup and made me extremely sick to where we had to leave... Kind of completely ruined the day. My boyfriend enjoyed the drink he ordered, which I believe was the hurricane. They have a wing food truck that you can order from, unfortunately we didn't get to try it because the drink made me so sick. We plan to go back in try the wings and will review the wing food truck. Great location for the spot, nice and relaxing... Just be careful what you order and avoid anything that has syrup in it.

reviews.author: Thomas C.
reviews.description: Thirst quenching beer. Great cocktails. Superior customer service. Everything is fresh and home-made. Definitely a must visit location. Can't wait for our next visit

reviews.author: Paula M.
reviews.description: Just go!! It is awesome!! For those of us that would prefer vodka over beer but have friends that love beer. This is the place!!

reviews.author: Tara S.
reviews.description: Had beverages here this weekend! AMAZING! Excellent service and drinks on point! We had the pirates punch and then a couple of their other cocktails...all were worth it!

reviews.author: Julie R.
reviews.description: We stopped here after to trying to get into the cluster called Deep Eddies. This was a hit, the cocktails were amazing. We decided to buy a whole bottle of vodka. The atmosphere was amazing, lots of trees, lots of space and delicious wings! Our friends enjoyed the craft cocktails! We highly recommend if you want a wonderful experience! Skip Deep Eddies and spend your time and money here!

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: Staff, management are super friendly and the big red one salty is the bomb of drinks. Always have great music and love their outdoor setting. A cigar lounge next door, fire pits and food makes this distillery a great venue.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: We made our first run to One Shot on a Friday afternoon recently and thoroughly enjoyed it. They are presently distilling rum and vodka and brewing several varieties of beer.  My spouse tried a Big Red One with salt -- a vodka drink -- and a Cuba Libre.  She was pleased with both. I had their amber and liked it so much I had another.  They have a clever solution to social distancing. The two young, friendly order takers are stationed under a canopy at the edge of the parking lot by their outside seating. You place your order with them, and one goes inside to fetch your drinks. There are plenty of shade trees and picnic benches so it's a pleasant experience. The owner , Phil, came out to say hi to a fellow vet (me). Nice, congenial guy.  The Dripping Wings food truck is stationed there now, so I went back for an order for dinner. Excellent wings, particularly the Asian sweet and spicy.  Glad to have a new convenient venue to enjoy.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: We decided to get out of the house today and do a little driving. Came across this place in Dripping Springs, and stopped for some drinks. Nice, large, shaded outdoor area with lots of oak trees and picnic tables.  I had the Cuba Libre cocktail that has Star Bullet rum, splash of lime, and coke. Delicious!  Husband loves IPAs and had the Panzer IPA, said it was great.  Inside of distillery and brewery were closed, but they have two food trucks on site. Service was awesome and friendly. Would come back!

reviews.author: Robyn G.
reviews.description: I love hanging out here.  Awesome outside seating and Dripping Wings is also there.  I'm a fan of their amber beer but they make delicious drinks as well!

reviews.author: David H.
reviews.description: This is truly one of a kind! There are so many amazing things to say about One Shot. The owners and staff are so personable! Great drinks and wonderful location! This is one of the most memorable places I have ever been to!

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Great stop on your trip to Dripping Springs. A family owned and run business. The owners are super friendly, and it's such a relaxing atmosphere. I had the blackberry smash with vodka and it was so good. They have the option of vodka or gin in your cocktail depending on your preference.   Definitely a great way to spend a day!

reviews.author: Dave M.
reviews.description: We spent the weekend visiting distilleries and this was very disappointing.   It's not busy at all but they still gave us gin instead of vodka.  It would be okay to play some music as it's awkwardly quiet due to the lack of patrons.  Finally, the people at the counter seemed annoyed with people overall.  Another couple in  the parking lot stopped us and asked if we had the same bad experience so it was not just us.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: Had a great stop here. The blackberry smash was amazing. The Helen's were amazing too. They are very eco friendly, affordable and yummy. And the people were friendly. Win win win trifecta! We left with four bottles.

reviews.author: Jeff P.
reviews.description: Family owned and operated distillery makes for a welcoming experience.  Not like other local "corporate" locations.   Patio is large with plenty of comfortable chairs.   Vodka and Gin are amazing.   My wife enjoyed the Gin sample which was truly surprising.   She a vodka gal.   This is a must stop.  Bypass the corporate spots and come here first.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: Definitely a hidden place with a great view! Glad we stopped at this place after seeing a sign off the side of the road and following a winding path down to see this gem.  Very homey vibes with a great patio for outdoor seeing that just has a fantastic view of the hill country. Decently priced drinks consisting of either gin or vodka.  Seating is pretty limited inside, but the outdoor space is just amazing and honestly makes the experience really that much better. I'd highly recommend 'The Bullfrog' with vodka. Tasty drink, but not overpowering and has a nice kick (smooth vodka that doesn't burn like gasoline).  P.S. They have some cool looking merch! Make sure to take a look at their terrariums...they are wicked!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Frog Pond Distillery was a pleasant surprise.  I have been wanting to come here for a while now, but always drive-by, and don't get a chance to turn around.  However, this time I made a trip purposefully to stop in.  I am glad I did.  Frog Pond is a family-owned business and passion project. The entire family was behind the bar the day my friend and I stopped in except for mom and I think a daughter.  The family owns the land and has slowly overtime built the tasting room and production area themselves.  They currently make a vodka and gin.  They offered us a free sip of each to determine which we would prefer in one of their handcrafted cocktails.  Both had a nice flavor profile that blends well in cocktails.  Their cocktails were creative and they mentioned the family came up with the recipes together.  The cocktails were delicious and very reasonably priced.  Their space has a fun modern 50's theme.  They have an outdoor patio you can sit back and relax on a nice day.

reviews.author: Rachel A.
reviews.description: This is a family run business, which is a major plus!   Love supporting local, small family operated businesses. Their vodka is top notch and their featured cocktails are great.  The views from the porch are amazing and so serene. Definitely coming back for another round.

reviews.author: Anastacia R.
reviews.description: My friends and I were doing distillery/brewery tours in Dripping Springs for a cute birthday celebration. We tried Deep Eddy's but they were closed so we decided to give Frog Pong a try and we were not disappointed! The guys at the front were helpful and kind. The drinks were so affordable and flavorful, I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Wanida S.
reviews.description: I've always wanted to stop in and check this place out. It's got a great view and their vodka and gins were tasty. They weren't overpriced and had great service. **only open on the weekends.

reviews.author: Arko G.
reviews.description: On our way to a wedding, we stopped by for a cocktail, and this was the perfect spot. We were debating between here and Deep Eddy, and we picked here for a more off the beaten path option and chill atmosphere. And we were definitely not disappointed. The staff were very helpful and welcoming and knowledgeable about their product. Outdoor seating is spacious with impressive views. Cocktails were highly affordable and very tasty. Unfortunately, tours were closed due to COVID, but we hope we can come back for tours some time soon!

reviews.author: Christina M.
reviews.description: What a nice change of pace from the better known distillery down the road. Instead of an overcrowded atmosphere with way overpriced drinks, this place is relaxing and affordable. There's a great wrap around porch to take in the landscape around you, while sipping a delicious cocktail. I definitely recommend stopping in if you're in the area!

reviews.author: Glenn R.
reviews.description: What a beautiful facility!  Stopped in for their grand opening and was amazed at such a sparkling clean, friendly place.  It's very obvious that a lot of careful thought has gone into this place. The actual distillery is incredible. The whole place is just beautiful. Even on a scorching Texas Summer day, there's a strong breeze out on the porch.  It's a very "Austin-esque" type place, down-home and friendly. Although I don't drink, my wife enjoyed a cocktail very much and we bought a bottle to take home. They had some nice lemonade and infused water for me too.  Great design of the logo, bottles and everything. Really worth stopping in if you're in the area or just feel like a nice drive from Austin.

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: While driving into Dripping Springs for an anniversary get away we spotted this beautiful building set near 290, decided to turn in and see what it was. We weren't disappointed, Super cute place, nice patio to hang out on while sipping lovely cocktails. Really reasonably priced drinks (mixed drinks either $5 or $6 depending on choice). Has an area to play games out front, and indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Steve T.
reviews.description: They put advertising stickers on your car without permission, which is astonishing. I left the one on my trunk and added a sticker that says "sucks" under it. Unbelievable that they would do this.

reviews.author: Christiana F.
reviews.description: I stopped by after a recommendation from one of the wineries in the area. The owners were very welcoming and their drinks were fantastic! I ended up buying a bottle of gin on the way out. It was chilly and the sun was going down so we weren't able to sit outside but the view was great and seems like a fun spot during the summer.

reviews.author: Lochness P.
reviews.description: Delicious drinks! Vodka is super smooth. I recommend the Helen! And the patio with the view is beautiful!

reviews.author: Claire K.
reviews.description: Walked in was greeted and made to feel like I was in my own home. If my home was a sweet Distillery like the Frog Pond. Patio and chair were peace on Earth. With a amazing Texas Breeze. And the Gin and Tonic was just perfect. My sister got the cocktail of the day with lavender and gin and it was amazing. Color and all. I highly recommend a stop to this Local Distillery. They are A must try.

reviews.author: Carey D.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem. We started off at another well known distillery down the road and googled what else was close by and found this awesome little spot with a great view. They make small batches of vodka and gin at the distillery and make a few different drinks to try. Their porch was a great place to hang out while playing giant jenga and relaxing. I noticed cornhole as we walked in as well. We watched deer randomly wandering in the distance. The drink I had was great, a cranberry vodka fizz, so I had another. The indoor space is fairly small and the patio could fit maybe 30 people comfortably. It was not crowded at all when we were there on a Sunday afternoon. We'll go again next time we're in Austin!

reviews.author: Devin C.
reviews.description: I am very new to the Gin world, but I was truly in need of an alternative to Dark liquors. I heard about this place from a coworker and decided to take a chance. I am very happy to say that the product that they are offering, not only the liquor, is amazing. They couldn't have picked a better location to place their distillery. The hills of Texas, day or night, make relaxing on the patio with the variety of gin and vodka cocktails that much more relaxing. The bright pops of color when you venture inside of the distillery are such a delight and really made my girlfriend and I feel happy to be in such a welcoming place.   The gin was delicious and I plan to buy more bottles very soon. Don't think that my lack of praise for the vodka means that it isn't good (I am just not a fan of vodka..rough nights in college) but I definitely suggesting venturing out to this family run, local organization. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: Love this place!! Their gin and vodka are amazing. Their cocktails are on point. The views are phenomenal. I am never going back to deep Eddy's when frog pond is right here?!?

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: This is a must stop place. Don't drive by without going inside for a sample. The vodka is so smooth. The creams are out of this world and the elderflower liquor is perfect for a spritzer or to sweeten that mixed drink from Brad. I can just drink it on its own but I am tough like that.

reviews.author: Kristy C.
reviews.description: The place has great potential. Very cute and good drinks.  But they have a long way to go when it comes to customer service.  The bar tender seemed to be really put out that we were even there.  Didn't welcome us, when we asked if we needed to go to the register part of the bar to order,  he looked at his phone and rudely said, I'll be with you in a min. Then continued to be annoyed that he had to take our order. The place was empty only 1 pinter group of 4 so wasn't like he was super busy.  They even said he didn't really seem to want to be there and definitely didn't want to be taking our orders.  The AC was also very lacking we were all fanning ourselves with the menu which seemed to be the best use of the menu since he didn't want to serve us. The sink in the women's bathroom barley had water coming out if it and they were out of toliet paper but we dare not ask the 1 bar tender as that would have really put him over the top. I wouldn't recommend this place and if I was the owner I'd want to know how bad my employee is. No wonder there was no one inside.

reviews.author: Ardie S.
reviews.description: Just a quick update (which I intended to post in December).  Stinson is alive and well in their new digs--now fronting FM 150. Much more spacious. It'll be a great space to spend an afternoon once the pandemic ends.  Call ahead if you want to pick up some of their fabulous Texas Holiday Nog, but remember, only 2 bottles per person per month.  Careful though and drink responsibly. This is not your father's Oldsmobile eggnog. It will sneak up on you and kicks you in the noggin like a freakin' mule.

reviews.author: Claire A.
reviews.description: Quiet little distillery to visit down south, great selection of cocktails. Was hoping to find some wine as well but was told the wine is mainly used for the brandy. This place had board games, friendly staff and is dog friendly! Highly recommend checking it out. Planning to come back when they restock their whiskey and egg nog

reviews.author: Karie B.
reviews.description: I have loved this place in the past.  Drinks were always measured and made to perfection-  delicious!!  The two female bartenders we have had in the past were amazing.   However I think they missed the mark on this expansion.  Sadly this is NOT the same place.  Total different vibe.  The new 'bar manager'  (a dude) made me a Mojito that I couldn't drink. He also told my husband that he is planning a lot of new drinks to put on the menu

reviews.author: Deborah M.
reviews.description: We went on a distillery drive in Dripping Springs and this was our last but BEST stop!  We sampled and bought the premium vodka and then went back and got the coffee based liquor Carajillo and the Texas Holiday Nog.  I highly recommend these and a trip out there to visit the friendly staff.  I might have to buy the holiday rum based egg nog for all my friends for the holidays!

reviews.author: Laryssa B.
reviews.description: This spot is a Awesome. When driving from Austin to San Antonio, we stopped for bbq up the road and then came here to taste. All the liquors were good, the cocktails were too. The gentlemen working were friendly and knowledgeable. (Also patient with all our questions)   We bought two bottles of the Carajillo, which is ten times better than any baileys or other coffee liqueur we've ever tasted.   These guys had a great playlist rocking, and the wood wall behind the bar is beautiful!

reviews.author: Taylor W.
reviews.description: Won't waste your money on this place, service was terrible, female bartenders are rude

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Cool place with great staff. I had never tried anything like this before and a nice change of pace from the wineries. They have a neat setup inside a metal building. It's not the easiest place to find but would be a great place to just hang out for awhile. They have some outdoor seating and corn hole games set up too. Really different experience.

reviews.author: Joe B.
reviews.description: So, stopped in at Stinson's and met a couple of the owners.  There is so much to love about the place.  Good drinks. Original takes on standards like their take on the margarita: The Brandyrita.  Had a great time. But the star of the show was their Texas Brandy, and the Carajillo, which made me a fan.  Can't wait to go back and find out what else they have cooked up.   Great stuff.

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: A cool little distillery with very friendly staff. Quaint and chill spot to have a drink and relax. My friend and I went on a whim after eating at the Salt Lick and seeing signs to this distillery. We hung out for an hour. We talked with the staff, drank a dram, and played some corn hole. Great little spot with awesome drinks. As a whiskey guy, that's what I wanted to try, but it wasn't ready. Nevertheless, brandy was good. Great time at an awesome location with good people.   Enjoy.

reviews.author: Michael G.
reviews.description: Come check out Stinson Distilling. Amazing drinks and staff. Lots of refreshing drinks in this hot heat.

reviews.author: Arian E.
reviews.description: There is only one downside to this place: they make you bring your own funnel for doing Rumstands from the big jugs.  Otherwise this is a fantastic young distillery and one of the best after-hours swingers hangouts in Austin!!!  You can't loose with booze!!!

reviews.author: Kelvin T.
reviews.description: Elderflower liquor is legit! Highly recommend! And try the Citrus Fizz. Had to pull around the back of the building to part and enter the tasting room. Good setting!

reviews.author: Nicole C.
reviews.description: Delicious variety of alcohols to try and great mix drinks. We also had a tour of the distillery process. Tried the Passionate Lady, Citrus Fizz, and reserve tasting- all very good! Love the tasting room decor and environment!

reviews.author: Rafael V.
reviews.description: Love this place. Best mojitos around. Vodka and rum are really off the charts amazing.  The inside is nice and cool and you can play games while you drink. People that go are very personable.

reviews.author: Al G.
reviews.description: Great little secret of Driftwood. These cocktail concoctions are simply amazing. If you want a place that's unique and specializes in great spirits this is your go to stop!

reviews.author: Wanida S.
reviews.description: Lots of choices and table games. It's hot out but they have a big fan to help keep you cool. We will be back soon.

reviews.author: Keri B.
reviews.description: We passed by this place heading to the Drip yesterday and since I'd never heard of it, I immediately yelped it.  A new distillary only about 10 minutes from my Casa?  Hell yes, I'm curious.  And I'll admit I became even more curiouser after reading Arian's review....I intended to ask them about this "one of the best after-hours swingers hangouts in Austin!!!" sitch.    The tasting room was a little hard to find as it's around the back of this little warehouse strip but it's open and spacious and we were only the 2nd couple there on a Friday evening.  We were warmly greeted and bellied up to the bar.  Our bartender (and all the staff I think) are in the Stinson family.  She was very friendly and gave us all the history of the place and explained each tasting in length.  They are currently offering a tasting of 4 of their liquors for $7 (these served quaintly in communion cups) and have cocktails they can serve as well.  We sampled everything (of course), the vodka, the white rum and dark rum, the elderflower liquor (think St Germaine) and the Holiday Nog.  She also threw in a sampling of their Bailey's style coffee liquor that's not quite "ready" yet.  I immediately fell in love with the Holiday Nog, which doesn't actually have any egg in it (thank goodness) and is made more with rum than whiskey (again, thank goodness).  This will go great with holiday gatherings.  I will keep an eye on their FB page for release of that coffee liquor!  All of their bottles run in the $25 range.  Hubby and I each had a cocktail, him the mojito and me the Citrus Fizz, and both were made well and were tasty.  We also bought several of their cocktail glasses as they are sturdy heavy glass, perfect for Bourbon.  Which, btw, they are still perfecting their whiskey recipe and will offer that in the future as well.    We really enjoyed talking to everyone and after getting a little liquid courage, I did ask about the swinger's parties.  She laughed and said that was just a friend making jokes....I wonder......

reviews.author: Dewey L.
reviews.description: We came across this distillery accidentally, and so glad we found it.  It may not look like much on the outside, but inside, the drinks were great.  Nice variety and options.  Will definitely return!

name: Revolution Spirits
address: 12345 Paul's Valley RdBldg G and H

reviews.author: Alvin D.
reviews.description: good drinks, good food, good folks!  so I first came here on a Sunday and was disappointed to learn that I wouldn't be able to buy any bottles - so came back the next day!  but that first visit got me hooked. once we sat down we had a little baby flight presented to us...I've never had a gin this good at room temperature. it was so surprising! I was also really intrigued by the damiana, and generally enjoyed the cocktails we tried. also, was pleasantly surprised that the kitchen food was also quite good. all in all if I lived here I'd hang out on the weekends.

reviews.author: Charlene P.
reviews.description: I've been here twice and I have to say they are just the nicest people! The sprits are amazing as well. Cocktails are very well priced. Stop by. You won't be disappointed!

reviews.author: A E.
reviews.description: This is a chill place. Tried to go to Jester King down the road (and didn't get to, for the 2nd time in a row cause it's always so damn busy) so decided to go here instead. Glad we did! They were very attentive to us as soon as we came in, and we loved the complimentary tasting flight. Ended up buying a bottle of the coffee liquor we can't find at the liquor store. And I love the virgin pineapple drink they made for my toddler. Matt was fantastic! Very attentive, not pushy. Good vibes all around.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: It's gin and gin cocktails. Not my thing but since I drug hubby to wine tasting had to give a little. Nice space indoor and out. Friendly staff. Dog friendly. Hubby and other patrons raved about the cocktails.

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: This just a covid update. These guys are the shnt when it comes to keepng their customers safe. Frequent sanitizing, rejecting anti-mask morons, and STILL they providing kick ass service and product. They've recently added food service and arguably have some of the best bbq in the area. If u haven't been, ur missing out BIG time.

reviews.author: Anastasia D.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this place after a visit to Jester King on a Sunday. There was no one there, creating both a serene and deserted vibe. The tasting was free, while the cocktails were in the $8-10 range. The gin, coffee liqueur and pecan liqueur were amazing! However, because it was Sunday, we couldnt buy bottles, which was very disappointing. The cocktails were a bit of a let down that didnt let the spirits shine. The best was the gingery take on a White Russian. The service was very friendly and attentive, yet again, we were the only customers. I definitely recommend picking up a bottle of their gin and liqueurs if you can find them!

reviews.author: Tim G.
reviews.description: Upon walking in they gave us a flight to taste their liquors. This place is a hidden gem and will soon explode. I'm so happy to have experienced this place. Their home made liquors and sodas made for a great day. But then they had amazing food. BBQ 2 lb turkey leg awesome queso. The only issue I had was that I couldn't try more because I was driving. I will be absolutely making this a reoccurring stop.

reviews.author: Ray R.
reviews.description: Love the drinks and now BBQ available! Outdoor seating with heaters. Had several  hot and cold cocktails, all were fantastic. Brought home excellent brisket, ribs, and chili con queso. Amazing what these guys are doing here.

reviews.author: Maria M.
