reviews.description: Excellent gin - we bought a bottle with their homemade tonic as well and it an absolutely delicious. The tasting was a pleasant surprise!   Free cocktail and tasting was included with a stamp from Jester King down the street, so glad we stopped in.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Stopped by after checking out Last Stand and I was really impressed by what these guys are producing here: High-quality gin and other spirits, and beautifully crafted artisan cocktails. These folks are some real artisans who are passionate about the craft they're putting out there.  Now is a great time to be in the Austin with so many talented chefs, artisans, and craftsmen putting out some really great products out there! There's no doubt in my mind that Revolution Spirits will soar into greatness.

reviews.author: Elaine M.
reviews.description: Visited here on a Sunday.  We loved the super friendly staff and the spirits too!  Upon entering the tasting room they asked if we had ever been before.  When we answered no they immediately brought over for a tasting - no charge.  We enjoyed most of the different offerings.  Then we picked out some cocktails to enjoy - both with their gin.  Daughters was with grapefruit and mine with cucumber.  We also purchased a cheese plate which we were told was made up for them from the local grocery store.  Nonetheless, we enjoyed our cocktails out on the picnic tables and had quite a lovely time.    Not being from Texas we were unaware of the law prohibiting liquor sales on Sundays.  We certainly would have bought a bottle if  we could have.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: We hit the jackpot when we found this place. Not only is there a liquor pretty good, but the staff is super nice. The area is pretty small, so it's not ideal for big groups, but don't let that deter you. After our tasting, they offered us a free cocktail. If you're a fan of coffee, you must try their cafecito or chocolate cafecito spirit. My favorite was their gin. If you like mezcal, try to their gin reserve in mezcal barrel. Definitely a must when you're in the area

reviews.author: Aparna B.
reviews.description: While we were sipping our ciders at Argus pondering about where we should go next, Revolution Spirits popped up on Yelp and so we of course headed there without any second thought!  This place is really amazing!! There was quite a bit of crowd as it was saturday but we were still given a great deal of attention during our tasting! My favorite was the cafecito coffee liquer and the chocolate cafecito. They're so good, that I could probably drink an entire bottle all by myself!  The best part of this place is the amazing people who own/work here and they didn't even charge us for the tastings and also gave us a free cocktail made with their gin!! So as appreciation from our end for all that they did and shared with us, we gave a nice tip :)!! Definitely, going to look for Revolution on my next trip to Spec's!

reviews.author: Sarah W.
reviews.description: You have to come here - if you have never had a gin you can sip room temperature without a mixer, you have never had a good gin.  Beautiful floral gin, wonderful amaro, and the most amazing other items.

reviews.author: Suzanne H.
reviews.description: Its sooooOooo smooooth. Gin is excellent and tasting is generous! The guys are informative and friendly. My only complaint is the place isn't air conditioned...but Gin= EXCELLENT, SUPERB, LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!

reviews.author: Chris C.
reviews.description: Avoid the crowds, get the good stuff.   This place is small, but the selection is pretty solid--everything from fruit liquors to their flagship gin and several mixers. Best of all there was no need to pay $$ upfront for a tour--just walk in and start tasting and talking.   The gin was the standout here, but all the stuff we tried was excellent except for their own cherry-limeade mixer--that was kind of a letdown, but the alcohol itself was great.   Can easily walk from here to Last Stand Brewing and Argus Cidery. There was a food truck outside as well.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Everything was done right - great customer service, clean flow for visitors, and the quality and uniqueness of the distilled liquor itself was great. To elaborate, samples were provided for the different options of their distilled liquor while an explanation of the flavors was provided, which was particularly beneficial for the 100 proof gin such has notes of grapefruit, lavender, and juniper. They also have a coffee liquour which is 50 proof, so a bit stronger than the traditional but still very sweet and flavorful. Even after the tasting, it was a nice place to hang out and was well ventilated and shaded.

reviews.author: Cait K.
reviews.description: Excellent local distillery!  My favorite alcohols were the gin and cafecito; also, the tonic they use (Springwood) which I had in a GandT I ordered after the tasting is also locally produced and top-notch.  The cherry on top is that the distillers are extremely friendly and knowledgeable.  Will be visiting again soon.

reviews.author: Vicki M.
reviews.description: We loved this place.  We stopped by during the last hour last Friday eve as one set of customers was leaving.  John Henry, owner, was so very friendly.  Had a delightful time talking with him about his distillery and spirits while sampling as well as general conversation later at our table.  We were given samples of gin, amaro, and two coffee liqueurs.  All were very good.  We then picked our cocktails, which he made and brought to our table.  Very tasty and reasonably priced.  We were not rushed out and time was not even mentioned by the owner.  I realized it was 15 min. after closing so we finished our drinks and bought some small size bottles.  We will be back!

reviews.author: Thom And Vicky H.
reviews.description: Revolution is a tiny little gem manned by some very knowledgeable and passionate makers. Upon visiting, we found their doors swung open to a single long room that had spirit-making equipment and two booths set up.  At the first booth, we had complimentary tastings and a saga-sharing session with their amiable bartender. The tastings were amazing: their hibiscus gin and tonic cocktail was incredible (the taste you crave days afterward). After the tasting, you can meander on to taste some of their specialty liquors (fruity ones too). We found their eau de vivre to be phenomenal, lovely aroma and as smooth as butter. Would highly recommend stashing oodles of their spirits away for safekeeping!

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: If you look up the definition of 'hidden gem', you will see a picture of Crowded Barrell Whiskey and their Fang and Feather tasting room. Period.  What's the big deal you ask? Let me offer a few reasons to stop in:  - whiskey tasting flights of 4 for only $11   - also offering other gin or vodka mixed drinks  - great tasting room with some cool, historical architectural elements   - wonderful deck under the shady oaks to enjoy the quiet Hill Country ambiance  - for beer or wine lovers, they also offer those (and snacks) in an adjacent  building  So this is simply a great stop off the beaten path if you are headed out to the Hill Country or just want something different that is just down 1826.

reviews.author: Christina G.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem, tucked away in the hill country. This spot is funded and supported by crowdsourcing. Very cool concept. You'll more than likely have new products to sample every time you visit. There are flights and a great variety of coctails. Today, there were 5 whiskeys to pick from. Only outdoor seating. The scenic views are amazing. I recommend walking around and checking out the grounds.  Friendly service, great drinks and chill environment. I'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Eleanor C.
reviews.description: A little piece of heaven off the beaten path. Definitely stop in for an Eleanor New Fashioned! It's the best twist off a classic you'll ever have. These people are awesome!

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: We had a stop here on our dripping springs tour. If you like whiskey, this is the place for you. The whiskey tour itself wasn't that impressive, but you do get to taste whiskey right out of the barrel which is really cool.

reviews.author: Kevin S.
reviews.description: Absolutely fantastic. Had a private tasting with Daniel and Emma. Got to meet Rex, Fancy Dan, John and Brianna. One of the best days I've had. The whiskey is a bit young, but pretty good.

reviews.author: Kate R.
reviews.description: I'm gluten free so could not do a whisky sample. My husband did and enjoyed enough to buy a bottle. If you're not into whisky, there's a trailer on the property that serves beer, wine and some mixed drinks, plus snacks! Great outdoorbtables, lights, etc. Pretty

reviews.author: Marzio O.
reviews.description: This is really for Fang and Feather since the Distillery was closed when I went.  The Eleanors do NOT disappoint! Nor did the Black Walnut Cocktail mixed by the affable and amiable Richard.  I figured to spend about an hour or so but instead closed the joint down! The bourbon is delicious and as a Magnificent Bastard it was a real trip to find my name on the Wall of Magnificence.  The grounds are lovely and well worth wandering. If you get the chance to stop in and sample the whiskey you will NOT be disappointed! If you are a Magnificent Bastard, it is so much fun to see where our favorite videos are shot.  Alas, I couldn't finagle my way into the Vault! ;)

reviews.author: Jeremiah D.
reviews.description: Amazing pilgrimage to drink magnificently! I was in town for a work trip and had to visit the physical location where two of my favorite YouTube channels are recorded. The whiskey was delicious, the tasting room/patio didn't disappoint, and Daniel even spent some time chatting. Still blown away by the experience.

reviews.author: David M.
reviews.description: This is, quite simply, and awesome little place, nestled in an awesome little spot, surrounded by beautiful country, and serving awesome whiskey.  I had seen the videos on YouTube, and I had some time before my flight out of Austin, so I drove up on a Friday, had a cigar while I waited for the place to open (they have seating for cigar smoking on the porches!), and then sampled some of their wares.  It's excellent, and I really can't say more than that.  Try the whiskey neat, or in a drink - everything we tried was wonderful.

reviews.author: Kim M.
reviews.description: We spent an incredibly pleasant evening with co-owner Daniel, his wonderful wife Katie, bartender Emma and the wider team at Crowded Barrel this week. Delicious whiskies and cocktails, outstanding property which was both beautiful and comfortable. If you're able to make the trip you'll have a terrific time, and if you're a magnificent bastard you'll have the time of your life!

reviews.author: Grant M.
reviews.description: Everything about these guys is first rate!  The tasting experience, the education, the environment and most importantly, the Whiskey!   I hear they make good cocktails too if that's your thing.

reviews.author: Brent M.
reviews.description: We had a fantastic afternoon at crowded barrel. The bourbon is delicious and the cocktails are really good too. The property and the deck are beautiful with lots of seating. My favorite thing was the people though. So welcoming and friendly. Definitely check it out if you're a whiskey fan!

reviews.author: Jenny P.
reviews.description: Went there for a wedding was a very beautiful location, staff was great! We are from California and will definitely come back next time we are here in Austin!

reviews.author: R L.
reviews.description: Being a MB, it's not hard to imagine that I love this place and the people who make it happen. If anyone is curious about what joining the tribe looks like, check out the Whisky Vault and Whisky Tribe...it's a great group of people who love learning about and enjoying whiskey. Join us!  Crowded Barrel is nestled in the beautiful Hill Country of TX and we enjoy sitting on the deck and tasting what's up for the day. If you are curious and want to learn more about whiskey, you will enjoy this adventure.

reviews.author: K. B.
reviews.description: Great place off the beaten path located at the Wizard Academy.   Wonderful tree covered wood deck and gear drinks.

reviews.author: Charles G.
reviews.description: Found this jewel in the hill country Sunday and the place and patio are awesome!  The views are amazing and the bourbon was smooth.

reviews.author: Jon C.
reviews.description: First! Big fan of the whiskey vault. If I make down to the Austin area, I'll drop in for sure.

name: Goodnight Loving Vodka Distillery + Tasting Room

reviews.author: Victoria T.
reviews.description: Goodnight Loving Vodka is definitely the most smooth vodka I've ever had. The tasting room is also fun and beautifully designed. Definitely worth a day trip. Dogs are welcome too.

reviews.author: Vicki M.
reviews.description: My husband and I were on a weekend getaway when we came across GoodNight Loving Vodka. After we found our way in through the secret entrance we were immediately greeted by co founder Tim Osburn and invited up to the ultra cool 70s style bar for some tastings. Frank Sinatra playing in the background and Great conversation kept us there longer than we planned on but what an experience!!! I even went home with my bottle signed by Tim ... Loved our visit so glad we made the stop ...

reviews.author: Zack C.
reviews.description: Super smooth Texas hill country vodka! The tasting room is an amazing mid-century modern throwback with a relaxed vibe. Definitely an awesome stop on a Saturday!

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Great place, great people, great vodka.  Tim and the crew are dedicatEd to creating a top-shelf product with incredible customer care.

reviews.author: Lisa R.
reviews.description: Love this place and the owners! Margarita's and old fashion are great! Hubby likes the Andalusia white whiskey.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: We went in for the first time and found a very helpful staff. Good whisky flight. Very nice crafted cocktails. Pleasant atmosphere.

reviews.author: Saliba Q.
reviews.description: The head Distiller gave us an awesome tour, we had a ton of fun being walked through the steps of Andalusia Whiskeys creation. Thanks Moose!!!

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: Great venue, whisky and service.   Unique styles of whisky so well worth the visit.  Try the flight so you can sample all their styles.  Single malt so more like irish or scotch whisky vs bourbon.

reviews.author: Trey R.
reviews.description: A great tasting room experience.  You can try flights of their whiskey or try a specialty cocktail.  Even though they only make whiskey, their "white dog" (unaged whiskey) makes a great base for a wide variety of drinks.  We had a jalapeno margarita, blueberry margarita and a mule.   The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and helpful.   All this based on award winning whiskey.   A must visit if you're out in the hill country.

reviews.author: Kayla S.
reviews.description: We had a great experience today at Andalusia. The property is very nice, and the whiskeys are each very unique. We ordered a flight of 5 and a flight of 4, so we could try one of each of their 9 products. Each one had very complex flavors, but my husband loved the Revenant Oak and Stryker. He had an Old Fashioned and I tried an Irish Coffee. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly.

reviews.author: Vanessa B.
reviews.description: This place is a MUST!! The people there are so helpful and cool, the cocktails are amazing, and the vibe is so laid back yet fun. We stopped on our way south and enjoyed a few cocktails. Highly recommend the margarita!!! And the cucumber cocktail is refreshing on a hot day. Definitely worth stopping here!!

reviews.author: Jeanne P.
reviews.description: It's a little slice of whiskey heaven in a land of wine.   We discovered the distillery on a girls' trip to hill country recently. We had a large group, but the bartender was not bothered with us at all. She made some great recommendations. I opted for the Bloody Mary as I'd never had one with whiskey before. It was flavored perfectly.   The ambiance is a classy casual - be sure to check out the cute little room in the back. I grabbed a comfy chair and perused the book selection, finding some really good reads. I could see myself setting back there with a cocktail and a book for hours.   I would highly recommend a stop here for something a little different than the wineries around you.

reviews.author: Tiffany S.
reviews.description: I love the blue barn!   If you like whiskey and you're in the area, you need to head over to Andalusia for a tasting and ask for Riki. Make sure to stay for some amazing cocktails as you chill on the patio. ***The Old Fashioned is incredible and so is their Irish Cream! I can't wait to return during my next trip to Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Todd P.
reviews.description: This place was a breath of fresh air. Riki was an absolutely delight. Fun and informative. Moose took us to the smoking room to see the wheat being smoked. Fun, relaxed and great products. There is nothing like these smoked whiskeys. Go, you will be glad you did.

reviews.author: Stephanie P.
reviews.description: This review is for the actual whiskey (Texas single malt). Due to the Covid virus, only curbside is allowed. They also sell hand sanitizer (smells delightful - like whiskey) by the gallon, which was a life saver for my friends business. Smooth, rich flavor. I drink whiskey neat - and this was pretty perfect.  Real Irish style single malt whiskey  Can't wait to try the rest!

reviews.author: Shonda M.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! Came here for the first time with a group for a friend's birthday and it was amazing! The space isn't too large, but it's comfortable and clean. The staff is super friendly, too. The cocktails are reasonably priced and you can buy bottles to take home.   We were here on a Saturday afternoon and it was chilly outside so we stayed inside, but there was a nice seating area outside. There was also a really wonderful Bluegrass band upstairs that was playing while we were there. So here are 2 levels, but the second isn't really accessible when a band is there. Totally worth having the band play, though.  Definitely will be back at this place. We are all from Austin and it's a super easy drive to get out here. Great for people to add to their winery tour.

reviews.author: Mike G.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place.   I came here on Tuesday around noon (before my flight in Austin), there were only one other customer there, so I spend a lot of time chatting with the bartender.   I did the the 4 tasting, with two additional tasting of the Reserves. My favorite is the Stryker and Stryker Reserve, they are just a heaven in a glass.   The environment is very relaxed, there are couches inside and patio seatings outside.   I would love to bring my friends here next time when I'm in town

reviews.author: Cesar R.
reviews.description: Oh boy, this is going to be my favorite place to visit when I'm out in the Texas Hill Country!  New to the Wimberly area Andalusia is a welcome addition focusing on Whiskey and helping break the overpopulated brewery scene.  Step inside and head directly to the bar I suggest ordering the Whisky flight to familiarize yourself with their three very distinct spirits.  Done in the Scottish tradition their Peated will remind you of a well balanced Scotch while the Stryker will flood your senses with mesquite, oak and apple wood much like good BBQ.   Once you decide which of the three you like order your cocktail and wander around the beautiful space or sit outside and enjoy the scenery. My favorite cocktails were the Whiskey Mule and the Cherry Cola.  Holding the fifth star until I try the food which I hope will be soon.

reviews.author: Lou Ann M.
reviews.description: It was wonderful news to hear that Andalusia was opening back up. Sounds like they have several restrictions still for social distancing however we will be able to get our cocktails again. The owners are doing everything to meet the requirements. We will be there this weekend. We cannot wait to see your friends again.

reviews.author: A F.
reviews.description: Happened to stop here in the way to Real ale and glad I did. Charming atmosphere with lost of cocktails on the menu. The team work here are super friendly and really make you feel at home.  Plenty of sitting and setup in the back as well as in the second floor. Great place to meet friends and relax.

reviews.author: Kevin H.
reviews.description: Had a great time at their 3 year anniversary party. Highly enjoyed bottling my own barrel strength whiskey!!

reviews.author: Mac M.
reviews.description: But I'd like to have known that this was Scotch whiskey and little on the interesting side to the white liquor was the only one that what was of my liking the two other scotches were a little strange. Thank you to advertise that on the sign that there have scotches it's not just whiskeys Anna went out of our way to stop and it was okay but not great I'm usually not one to leave without a bottle from Brewery or Distillery but skip those that day little too pricey and strange.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: If you want REAL TEXAS WHISKEY then look no further. This place is doing it right and intends to keep making fine whiskey. Follow these guys on Facebook as they expand. You will hear from these guys more often.

reviews.author: S W.
reviews.description: Cute place even though we had to sit outside. Service was really great at first, but then friends of the owners came and we weren't asked if we wanted a second drink. We did, but decided to leave.

reviews.author: Ruthie W.
reviews.description: Yesterday, I decided to do a day trip to Spicewood today. It was first to Krause Springs then found out Iron Wolf would be open lunch time. After a refreshing morning at Krause Springs, we headed to Iron Wolf Ranch and Distillery for lunch and drinks.   They have a wide variety of spirits with several award winning ones. Tiann was great in making our drinks! I had the New Fashion made with Hotscotch (a little sweet and spicy). My husband had the Luna-tic made with vodka and several fruit juices. We enjoyed the drinks while we waited for our lunch from Craigo's. We ordered the specialty pizza (sausage, pepperoni, green peppers, mushrooms and onions) and barbecue wings. Truly phenomenal pizza and wings! We also had the Giddy Up Mary with horseradish-infused vodka and Wild and Tea, an Arnold Palmer with bourbon.   We'll have to come back another time for the tasting and meet Luna, a wolf adopted by the family (she's usually there on Fridays). Most Saturdays they have live music. Definitely check their calendar online.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Made the trek for a friend's Bday get together. A little off the beaten path but worth the drive.   Beautiful venue. Plenty of seating under the oaks. Playground. Disc golf. Cornhole. Food truck (Craig O's). We had a great time.   Specialty cocktails are a little off (and a little weak). Order your preferred cocktail and you'll be fine.   Didn't do the tour or tasting. Maybe next time.

reviews.author: Stephanie M.
reviews.description: I almost don't wana leave such a positive review because then more and more people will find out about this AMAZING spot and I want it all for myself!! Hahaha kidding but really this place was awesome, even though it was a day with drizzle still enjoyed it! First off the staff is beyond sweet, so warm and welcoming! The drinks were great and good price! Such a fun vibe with good music. Very mellow way to spend a Sunday afternoon. So happy they had a kids area because both my 8 year old and 2 year old had a blast and stayed busy so I could enjoy a delicious Bloody Mary. They have awesome lawn games to keep busy and a delicious pizza food truck parked on site. We will for sure be back!! Do yourself a favor and pay it a visit it was a lot better than most of the distilleries I've visited.

reviews.author: Rosalind C.
reviews.description: I mean what's really hard? It's liquor and a open space. That's all you really need to have a perfect distillery. The service was great and the staff were nice. I would recommend the bourbon and the gin because they were both smooth and delicious. This is definitely a chill and relaxing place to visit

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: This place is not set up to be a serious event venue. They have ONE indoor bathroom and a lousy pizza truck. They might be an ok distillery, but I don't know, that's not what I was there for.

reviews.author: Ken G.
reviews.description: Stopped by here with some local friends, and it definitely was the best spot we went to of the whole night. The bourbon was awesome!!! They had a little fair going on, and that made the whole experience even better. Live music as well! If they had rooms we would have stayed. Haha. Definitely recommend stopping by this spot. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Sepid M.
reviews.description: We got stock there during a storm and they were the best! People are so nice and the drinks are awesome!

reviews.author: N S.
reviews.description: We were excited to go here. That quickly faded. There is almost no shade. I'm sorry but this is Texas. It's hot. You need to put in adequate shade. It has one indoor bathroom and one little pizza truck -which the pizza was Okay- the kids play area is huge tires with again NO shade. Please don't even say you have a play area when the only thing they could climb on are tires that would give them second degree burns. The solo artist singing was probably the only good thing as we also got 3 different drinks and didn't even finish half of it because it was gross.

reviews.author: Rick B.
reviews.description: This is the fanciest metal building distillery I have ever seen!  Very shiny stainless steel still, immaculate polished concrete floors, easily the fanciest metL building I have seen!    And they have good liquor!  The tasting is informative and interesting, even if all of the idetails on the fancy bottles is a bit overwhelming.  But the real wolf is interesting.   Try it al!!  The Giddy'Up (horseradish) vodka is better than it sounds - and it makes a fantastic Bloody Mary!  Several things were good, but you must BUY this - it is excellent!

reviews.author: Christina D.
reviews.description: We stopped by here as one of our stops during a brewery/wine tour. It became our last stop, the owners were super friendly and attentive to us the whole time. We started out with a tasting and even though the weather was not in our favor we still enjoyed our time around the fire enjoying their great drink options. It's a pet friendly family atmosphere and we will definitely be returning!

reviews.author: Molly F.
reviews.description: I have visited Iron Wolf many times and never had a bad experience! Staff is very friendly and hospitable. Great environment and drinks! Must try the Hotscotch liquor!

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: Great distillery! I'm actually not typically a whiskey fan but I like theirs! Love both the Hotscotch and Iron Hot.  Plentiful parking. Big outdoor deck seating. Live music stage. Food truck on site. Awesome Hill Country views.  Family-friendly events. Highly recommend Iron Wolf!

reviews.author: Missy L.
reviews.description: This is an amazing venue!  The family is so kind and attentive to all of their patrons.  We have been coming here since they've opened, and enjoy every single minute!  It's a must try!!

reviews.author: Shelby B.
reviews.description: Sought out this lovely facility while vacationing nearby based on the reviews of fellow yelpers. Excellent facility! The owners were super sweet and knowledgeable. My boyfriend and I did the tasting - $8 for a taste of 4 spirits with 6 to choose from:  Corn Vodka - hint of sweetness and great consistency Clear Molasses Rum - not my kinda thing but this was good.  Citrus forward Gin - also not my type of spirit but I actually really liked this. Clean and fresh - perfect for Texas summers! Horseradish Vodka - you really must try the Bloody Mary with this. Yum!  Hotscotch - butterscotch pepper whiskey. We loved this so much we are bringing a bottle home.  Iron Hot - cinnamon pepper whiskey. Good if you're into cinnamon spirits.   We also had two drinks. I had the Bloody Mary with horseradish Vodka and my boyfriend had the wild tea (Arnold Palmer with bourbon). The owners have big plans for this facility and you can tell a great deal of thought and planning has been put into this establishment and spirits. I look forward to watching this place grow and develop. I'll be back next time I'm in the area!

reviews.author: Brian E.
reviews.description: Happened upon this place as we are staying in the area. Great logo, catches your eye and makes you want to check it out. One of us had the bourbon, very smooth. Nice taste. The other had the special, The Irish Wolf, it was good.  Found out there isn't a full bar, so they are making drinks out of the liquor they distill.  They are engaging, entertaining, try to sell you a tasting but don't oversell if you don't show initial interest which is nice. You can take a tour if you get the tasting.  Great areas all around the distillery to just hang out with friends and chat, or play games, chill and listen to live music or wander around the grounds a bit. Beautiful location to be out in nature. Family friendly place, folks were there with their kids and everyone seemed to be having a good time.

reviews.author: Alyse H.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this sprawling alcohol paradise on our drive back to Austin from San Angelo.  We originally stopped because the BBQ food truck they have on the premises is rated very high, but the liquor turned out to be the real star. Hubby partook in a liquor tasting that cost $10 for multiple samples.  They have some very unique flavors that I've never heard of anyone incorporating in a liquor before.  I ordered a bourbon and lemonade drink that hit the spot in the Texas heat.  This was a Mecca for bachelorette parties and large groups of friends.  There is plenty of room on the property to spread out and enjoy the weather.  They also host concerts on their stage next to the tasting room.  They are planning to expand their offerings here, so stay tuned as to what they build!

reviews.author: Laura V.
reviews.description: This is by far my favorite place to visit in the Hill Country. It is a party place. Large group specialty. Large area. Room to spread. Dog friendly. Great patios and food trucks. We had the Ginirita and Cucumber Cooler. We Tasted the butterscotch Vodka and bourbon and the rum. Everything was superb. My Fav Place.

reviews.author: Brian A.
reviews.description: Amazing place and people, family friendly even your Pup can come out and enjoy!  Recommend this place!

reviews.author: Prince H.
reviews.description: I'm rounding up to 5 stars because it is a family run business working hard to make a go of it. Small but nice distillery has tours and tastings with a large outdoor area for hanging out and a stage for occasional music acts. I didn't play but the frisbee golf looked great.  Rum, gin, fireball, and few other mixed spirits to sample.  I personally liked and purchased the gin. Low juniper the way I like it.  Odd wild eye logo is off putting but very friendly staff.

reviews.author: Ashleigh L.
reviews.description: I had a lot of fun here! The drinks were great and I loved the vendor fair they had. The owners were very nice and I hope to return next time I'm in the area visiting friends. Thank you!

reviews.author: E R.
reviews.description: Good pours, tasty rum, a lovely shaded deck to sit out on, and congenial staff. Perfect spot for a quick cocktail or a wind down and a nice chat.

reviews.author: Pam S.
reviews.description: Great spot to enjoy a drink and relax! We arrived on a Thursday afternoon. Bartender greeted us warmly and talked to us about the rums are made. I appreciated feeling welcomed in spite of the lack of traffic in the out there location. We ordered drinks and sat among the trees on their awesome deck for a bit. My husband bought all three varieties when we left. Worth a visit!

reviews.author: Raymond J.
reviews.description: Been here twice now and really just stopped this time to get their bourbon filled chocolates for my guests on our drive by.  Great place to seat and enjoy the outdoor country view and have a drink.  Sample their Bourbon and have some chocolate filled Bourbon.  Come visit this place when you are near by

reviews.author: Jazz C.
reviews.description: The rum was delicious! The guy behind the bar was so nice and welcoming. It's a great place to relax and enjoy a delicious drink! There's lots of outdoor space perfect for social distancing.

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: During a recent car club event, I called Cypress Creek from a restaurant in Wimberley to tell them our arrival was eminent. The lady on the other end of the call was quite nice suggesting they had PLENTY of space for our cars to park.  Well, they weren't wrong. Quite possibly the best photo opportunity of the entire weekend. Our attendees overlooking 24 cars perched in the beautiful trees of Hays County overlooking some of Mazda's genius. Free samples of crafted rum too?   I'd call that a win! Owners were quite attentive as soon as we arrived. Telling us the story of the brand; walking us through each tasting. Some drinks were ordered; maybe a bottle or two bought. Not sure we were the most receptive group being on a car tour in the Hill Country. Service was excellent!

reviews.author: Dolly S.
reviews.description: Such a nice staff.  We were i Impressed by his knowledge.  He was very compliant the tasting was good they serve 3 different varieties we enjoyed the vanilla. The gentleman was very helpful for other things to do in the area.

reviews.author: Dustin C.
reviews.description: Tucked away behind Wimberely mear Jacobs Well stands a small distillery with a small bar and large patio.   They offer free samples of the three different whiskeys with one of them being bourbon barrel aged using Rebecca Creek barrels.   The staff was friendly and well informed on the products. Currently they are distributing to smaller local stores and will start distributing to more stores in the future.   As it is August right now we couldn't tour the distillery because it was too hot but we were informed that the tours would start in October when it cools off.   The bottles are decently priced for hand crafted rum like this.   There are plenty of tables and chairs for groups, drink cocktails were decently priced, and property is a great change from the city.

reviews.author: Rach C.
reviews.description: We made lots of stops in the area and this was by far my favorite! We made it about an hour before they closed and the guy at the bar was so nice and welcoming. The patio area in the trees was beautiful and they had this nice swing. I had the drink with the pineapple and vanilla rum.....sooooo good! It was so good my husband grabbed a bottle so we can drink it at home. If you're touring the area i would recommend coming here early and just enjoying the scenery and the lovely conversation with the guy at the bar!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: We found this place on our way to Jacobs well. This place has great drinks and a great atmosphere. The rum is  very good. We did not take the tour, but it is offered. They have a food truck on site. Their mojito was refreshing. They even let me be part of the cocktail making process. The owners were super friendly. For those that want to taste before buying, they offer free rum tastings.

reviews.author: Mike G.
reviews.description: I cant' say enough good things about this place. It is in the middle of Hill Country, and it was our last stop before heading home.   Personally, I'm not a big rum drinker, it is too sweet for me, but it tastes great in mix drinks, and they have some  great and fancy mix drinks here.   Swing by and hang out on their patio, it will be great!

reviews.author: Samuel V.
reviews.description: This place is awesome. Not only do you get to enjoy some very delicious rum, but the scenery is beautiful. My fiance and I really enjoyed getting to hang out on the raised deck and just relax for a little while. The guy at the bar was really polite and knowledgeable. Will definitely come back.

reviews.author: Kelsey D.
reviews.description: Give these hard working folks your money! The rum is delicious, affordable and local. The owner gave us a quick, free tasting so we could decide what kind of rum we wanted in our cocktails. Do yourself a favor and spend an hour or two sitting on the gorgeous upper deck catching the breeze and catching a buzz!

reviews.author: Mallory M.
reviews.description: Family run rum distillery. We visited on a weekday and were the only ones there. Great customer service! If you like rum, then this is definitely worth checking out for a tasting!

reviews.author: Amber N.
reviews.description: The vanilla rum is fantastic. Perfect place to spend the afternoon to relax and have a drink. Patio sitting is great. Lots of shade

reviews.author: Katy B.
reviews.description: This place is the cutest, most quaint little gem.  If there's a local distillery, I always want to try out their goods.  I didn't expect it to be at someone's home, though!  Not that it's a bad thing.  Rum, for me, is a take it or leave it type spirit.  I typically use it only in cocktails.  I don't think I've ever wanted to sit down with a glass of rum.  Now bourbon?  That's a different story.    On arrival, I just expected a tasting only, but they actually make cocktails.  They have a small menu, or you can request whatever you want from the mixers they have.  Mojito?  Of course.  Want to go dive with a great rum and just some Coke?  They won't judge you for that, either.  They make their own version of Rumchata in house and it was SO DELICIOUS.  For real.  And they'll give you the recipe.    Pick your favorite of the three varieties: Crystal, Gold, Vanilla and buy a bottle.  Then pick up a bottle of vanilla extract.  If you don't cook, make your mom very happy.  That stuff is fantastic.  In the hotter months, don't be a jerk and demand a tour of the actual distilling barn.  We all know how distilling works.  If not, the internet is your friend.  They don't want to be in the high temperatures, and neither do you.  Let them explain the process to you while you sip a nice, cool drink instead.

reviews.author: Lindsey C.
reviews.description: Stumbled upon this little gem by accident when we were looking for a winery, it was a happy find! Friendly people, good rum, and a good deck! It was a little expensive and no tours are offered but the tastings are free which is a nice change to the other places we have been.   Make sure you try the vanilla rum and take a turn on the tree swing! My nephew loved it.   Wish they would have more signs.... the first was easy, then we were feeling lost.

reviews.author: Michele G.
reviews.description: The best part of this distillery is the location...a country vibe that is beautiful. Now for the bad news...The rum is a strange flavor. I have been to other rum distilleries and have never stumbled upon such a "harsh" flavor that could never be drank alone. That being written we decided to have a drink on the patio...I'm glad alcohol kills germs because the guy serving us had the dirtiest hands and fingernails I have ever seen in my life and I have children. For example when he grabbed our glasses from the cabinet it left a dirty grip mark. I was pretty much grossed out. It's too bad because again the location is great.

reviews.author: Deji M.
reviews.description: How sweet is David, distiller, maker, and bottler of Cypress Creek Reserve? Let's examine the facts:. -- He led us through a tour of his small but highly functional distillery. -- He answered all of our questions about the process he uses, and even showed us some of the machine parts he's made. -- His wife made us two (nicely sized) tasters: a mojito, and another thing I drank even faster than the mojito that tasted like a lemon drop.  $5 each later, we skipped right down to Wimberley Valley Spirits to get ourselves a bottle, because the law is mean and David can't sell any of the goods on the premises.  Stupid Republicans, or something.  Now we check out our unopened souvenir, plotting and planning, totally giddy that we pulled into that questionable-looking lot with the signage for rum. Who were we to say no?

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: This last Friday I went to the distillery to taste their rum. All three of their rums are VERY tasty. I purchased a bottle of the aged rum. The owner's daughter-in-law (I can't remember her name) was very friendly and very knowledgeable on the rum. She made the tasting fun, and I highly recommend anyone in area to go visit. I know I'll be back!

reviews.author: Ali E.
reviews.description: Love the vanilla rum! Make a side trip on the way home from Stonewall to pick up a bottle!

reviews.author: Jennifer W.
reviews.description: Such a cute place! Loved the outdoor and indoor areas. Brewery is right next door and you can order from either and pay at one. Wine was good too!

reviews.author: Ara A.
reviews.description: They have a winery and a brewery which is great when you have a group with people who like different taste. Lots of games and seating areas. You can have a flight or the tasting menu, lots options.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: My friends and I had such a fun time this past Saturday! Wine and beer is well priced, and the space is great to spend a summer day with your friends. I really liked the rosé wine, and my friends and I ordered truffle fries from the food truck. The only thing I would change about our experience is that I wish we had made a reservation 24 hours in advance because you can't order charcuterie boards and wine flights without one.   Everyone is really nice, and on a chilly day, they even have blankets. I highly recommend making the trek out here!

reviews.author: Jaclyn L.
reviews.description: It's beautiful! The rose is perfect for a summer day, there was live music, food truck, axe throwing and an amazing outdoor landscape!   A wonderful summer day spent here!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: We had a great time relaxing in the beautiful sunshine at Bell Springs! There is a winery and a brewery on site so everyone likely has an option they'll like = Best of both worlds. They have plenty of outdoor seating, which you could choose to sit in the sun or under the trees in the shade. We split a glass of rose and their sweet white and I would recommend either one. The sommelier was super sweet and helped us choose our wines. Would definitely recommend a stop here to relax and enjoy nature with a glass of wine in hand!

reviews.author: Anthony L.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to hang out with friends!   The wine is pretty good. We shared a bottle of Rosé. The real appeal of this place is the setting itself. There is ample outdoor seating under big shade trees! It's a pretty place.  There is also a brewery on site, but I cannot speak to the quality of the beer. We stuck with wine on this trip. I would definitely come back and try other wines and the beers offered!

reviews.author: Luke P.
reviews.description: Completely unacceptable management. For about 2 hours a group of individuals where shouting at two tables, yelling sexually explicit language, swearing profusely, and were clearly unable to drive. At a place that prides itself in a family atmosphere, where kids are running around playing in the grass and trees, this is completely unacceptable. I am looking forward to management/ownership response to this review. In a region where wineries, breweries and distilleries are a dime a dozen, plenty of opportunities to take my business elsewhere when we come visit.  What should really concern the owners and management about what happened at Bell Springs is the fact that:  1) The Hays County sheriff was called after the incident because it was so egregious. Enough of these reviews and they will be lining up outside the parking lot for DWIs.  2) The staff (7:00 pm on 6/19) did absolutely nothing to cut off a clearly over-intoxicated group that was negatively impacting people around them  3) The staff's response (blonde and burnette hostesses), ver batim, to the vulgar language and rowdiness was "free speech" and "you are the problem - I know those people".  Fantastic - best of luck in your future endeavors . Your stellar response caused one of our group to cancel their wine membership.

reviews.author: Shanita F.
reviews.description: They have three long tables for guests to sit and enjoy the tasting. It snowed the weekend we went, so of course we were inside. However, they do have an outdoor patio, bar and high bar seating. The outdoor seating probably really nice in good weather.   Call ahead or make reservations online. It's very easy and they do allow you to amend reservations over the phone.   They produce really great wine and there's a great selection to choose from. The staff is very knowledgeable about their wines and answered all of our questions. Testing comes with a **small** array of cheeses, nuts and crackers.

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: This is a beautiful winery. Plenty of tables spread around the grounds under trees. Lots of room for kids to run around out there. We sat up on the patio with our dog and enjoyed a lovely wine tasting. We chose the solo tour which was $15 for 5 generous pours of delicious wine. All the staff we interacted with were very friendly and helpful. The one low point is the food truck. We got the currywurst for $10 which was good, but not a large enough serving for the price. The more upsetting part was the pretzel we got (also $10, which is very expensive). The prestel was small, hard (even though it was supposed to be a soft pretzel), and flavorless. The mustard cheese dip did its best to save it, but it wasn't enough.

reviews.author: Alexa S.
reviews.description: Cute spot and their brewery next door is awesome too! Bell Springs is in a nice location and it is so green! The wine is yummy, tastings are nice sized pours! Only reason I am giving 4 stars is because when you make a reso for wine tasting and charcuterie, don't expect a lot of cheese and meats HA! It was so small, we were cracking up. I would recommend bringing your own snacks and food! Otherwise, awesome spot and I can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery and relaxing porch. However most wines are sourced from Lubbock and not from Austin.  montepulciano is from the region and pretty bold.

reviews.author: Jalise F.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed my visit here. I'm not much of a wine drinker but they were able to answer any questions I had about the wine. Also it was snowing when I went and that made the experience all the better. Will most definitely return on my next trip to Texas!

reviews.author: Anna O.
reviews.description: Nothing  but amazing things to say! We recently hosted our Dripping Springs 10 Year High school reunion at Bell Springs Winery and it was a great experience. Nate and Laura were wonderful to work with and they took care of everything making it super easy for me. The location is perfect and off the main road and the layout of the outdoor and indoor areas are well suited for any size group. Defiantly consider Bell Springs for your next event!

reviews.author: Manuela A.
reviews.description: What a little surprise! I liked their porch and plenty of outdoor seating. They have a great brewery on location so there is something for everyone. They did generous pours of 3 wine tastings for $20. We got a bottle of Cab with grapes from Washington state. No surprise as Texas cab grapes do no yield good wine. We enjoyed our time here!

reviews.author: Anna M.
reviews.description: I have been here numerous times and always had an awesome experience but today was the most unacceptable experience I have ever had ANYWHERE. I was here with my family, parents, and my brothers family with a total of 5 kids (not unusual to see kids here). While here, we became aware of a group that was likely overserved and using foul/vulgar language that we tried to ignore for a long time. Once we heard the phrase "fat c*ck" at a ridiculous volume my husband asked them to please keep it down, which resulted in a huge altercation with various threats/insults from their end. Despite their behavior management still allowed them to stay. What's worth noting is multiple people had already complained about this group and others joined my husband in attempting them to quiet down- so they were affecting loads of people at the winery. Eventually things calmed down and the argument broke, but as we were leaving they said loudly for us to hear "I'm so glad that douchebag is leaving" so I gave them the finger as I was walking away (I will concede this was adding fuel to the fire but I was so fed up at this point) and they screamed to me "FUCK YOU MOM" across the grass. Managements response? Free speech allows them to say whatever they want. Apparently this nice hill country spot is going for the dirty 6th vibe. Save your money and go somewhere with enough pride to expel those who can't keep it together while I use my own right to free speech to notify everyone this place doesn't care about their patrons.

reviews.author: Michael P.
reviews.description: Understaffed.  Cannot manage overserved men and women who are creating bad examples for family customers there as members to enjoy the facilities.  Staff is useless.  Take my membership; we are out.  There are many Other places to enjoy.

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: I am a resident of Dripping Springs and have been a frequent patron of Bell Springs Winery. I found this family-friendly venue to be welcoming and beautiful. It was for this reason that I suggested that my kids, with their families, join my husband and me for a Father's Day celebration on Saturday evening, June 19th. When we arrived just before 5 pm, we found a good picnic spot in the shade near the bag game. We all noticed, or rather heard, a very boisterous group of 12 to 15 people sitting near the brewery. As the evening progressed, and I am assuming more alcohol was consumed, the group became louder and more profane. We attempted to ignore them, but soon it was impossible due to the volume and the increasingly prevalent and disgusting language. At that point, and because we had 5 young children with us, my son-in-law went over to the group and respectfully asked them to turn down the volume so that my Grandchildren would no longer be exposed to words like "F*ck and C*ck". He was immediately met with a barrage of personal slurs and threats. 2 staff members (2 young ladies, one light-haired and the other dark-haired) working that evening came over to the group, however, incredibly, the inebriated party was allowed to remain on the premises. Shortly after, every family packed up and went home, including our group.  When walking to the parking lot to leave, a particularly vile young woman yelled obscenities at my son-in-law and daughter. I turned around and went over to the group. When I arrived, I was also barraged with a variety of slurs and called a "C*nt". Once again, the 2 female staff members came over to the table to intercede. At this point, the dark-haired staff member shared with me that she "knew the group" of offenders, which helped me understand why these folks had not been asked to leave. If you happen to know staff, you can act like filthy pigs, with the knowledge that your actions will have no repercussion, regardless of the profoundly negative impact on everyone else looking to enjoy wine and food with their families.  To add insult to injury, staff had the unmitigated gall to suggest that I was the problem, not the drunk and vulgar group. When I questioned staff (dark haired young lady) why they permitted such obnoxious behavior from any patron, she suggested that hurling profanity toward others was protected under free speech. Staff continually suggested that our "conversation was over", indicating that they wanted me to leave. Clearly, the privilege of free speech isn't applied equally to all patrons visiting Bell Springs.  In the past 15 months, I have recommended Bell Springs to dozens of family and friends. Now, I plan to exercise my right of free speech in every forum available to tell acquaintances and strangers alike about my experience, advising that Bell Springs is not worthy of anyone's patronage.

reviews.author: Robert R.
reviews.description: The wine was good.  The lawn for tasting was ample.  The amount of things to do was tremendous.  I highly recommend this, but the wine is a little over priced for its taste and quality.

reviews.author: Genette G.
reviews.description: One star is too much for this place. I have seen several people treated badly. Everyone who works there look down on people. I have witnessed people harrased and the winery does nothing about it.

reviews.author: Amanda B.
reviews.description: Owner is very rude and unprofessional. He was very short with me and disrespectful. I feek bad for the staff as they are not trained well and over worked.

name: Sidecar Tasting Room
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: Went today with friends. Had the red wine flight...rose', montepulciano and the Tempranillo...liked them all but not enough to buy.  Had the meat and cheese plate...yum.   Ann (sommelier) was sweet and knowledgeable.  Flagship winery is Big Springs winery (which we visited today as well)   BUY LOCAL  SUPPORT LOCAL

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: Had a great time at Sidecar. Stopped in for lunch and a flight of wines as our first stop in Dripping and really enjoyed the setup. Lunch is from a food truck (trailer) on site. My group tasted reds and whites and all were very tasty. Food was good - had burgers and they were good quality. Setup was nice with covered tables outdoors or an indoor option. I didn't check out the brewery onsite but did see some guys partaking in the brews. I would not hesitate to return.

reviews.author: Cory Jo M.
reviews.description: Super cool environment and beautiful decor! The vibe here was awesome! The wine was okay. I like sweet wine and the wine flight was dry so I didn't enjoy it like a wished I would've.

reviews.author: Lacy B.
reviews.description: This place is so cute!!! Amazing service. Delicious empanadas. Love the rosè! We sat outside under the oak trees and enjoyed the scenery. Perfect first stop of our bachelorette weekend!

reviews.author: Tiffany Y.
reviews.description: Visiting from California and we wanted to go wine tasting and this was a winery nearby so we decided to give it a try. No regrets! Anne was very welcoming and friendly. She also gave us information on other wineries/breweries/distilleries to try. I had the $15 flight of reds and she also gave me an extra cup of red wine, Needy B*tch, I ended up buying a bottle! I finally found a great bottle of red that I actually enjoy, sad that I can't get it shipped to me in California. Drippin' Sweet is also great, bought a bottle as well. Love the descriptions given to the wines it made them sound all delicious. And they were! (According to all the ones I tried).

reviews.author: Jules A.
reviews.description: This little place is amazing!! A very welcoming and clean environment and have a nice selection of wines. Also the cheese and meat platter is so good!!  We stopped by on our way to Dallas. You definitely have to check it out!

reviews.author: Tracy M.
reviews.description: Great little place to go taste and snack! We had a flight of the white and red and they were great. We had one of each of the empanadas and all three were so good! I'm not sure where they get those things but they are amazing. My favorite was the bbq one. They also have games you can play. Would be a good place for a date!

reviews.author: Jeanette D.
reviews.description: Pretty good wine tasting. We did the red wine tasting. My favorite wine was the Tranquillo wine. $15 for 3 wines which is a little weak for wine tasting but the cool ambience made the trip worth it and the portions weren't weak.

reviews.author: Briana N.
reviews.description: Talk about southern hospitality. So we came here from a airbnb in dripping springs. It was a little far for an Uber to pick us up, but we got one. So we are there enjoying wine glasses, wine flights, food, the atmosphere. Everything about this place is so cute and amazing. But trying to get an Uber home seemed unlikely. Everyone kept cancelling on us and the bartender Ann or Annie (plus the last two customers) kept telling us that we were not gonna walk the 2 miles home. Annie made sure that we stayed till she closed and literally DROVE US BACK TO THE AIR BNB!!!. She was the sweetest thing and didn't even want to take any money from us. We had a back and forth of take it, no keep it, take it!! Haha I'm 80% sure I got the money in her cupholder before I left but I was the tipsy one so who knows haha. I really hope I did because driving us back to our Airbnb was above and beyond.

reviews.author: Mallory Y.
reviews.description: Absolutely great place to stop by if you are in the Dripping Springs area. The service was top-notch and the decor is really eclectic! They have wine flight options or you can enjoy a glass if you chose. The server was incredibly knowledgeable and had great recommendations for everyone in our group. She let us try what we wanted before committing to our drink of choice. I ended up going to wine cocktail called the Texas Kiri and it fresh rosemary in it which I though was a nice touch! They also have live music outside and plenty of areas to sit and enjoy listening to it. Definitely try this place out!

reviews.author: Jenni S.
reviews.description: Super cute little place in drippings springs, but I wasn't a huge fan of the wine. Sad, because I really wanted to love it. Maybe next years harvest will be better!

reviews.author: Tanna L.
reviews.description: My friend and I were looking for a bar to hang out at. We came across Sidecar. Everyone is so friendly and enjoy the time we spent here.

reviews.author: Steven A.
reviews.description: Great experience for a weekend visit by friends from out of town. They had a great selection of delicious wines as well as live indie folk music. Will definitely come back and would recommend!

reviews.author: Jesse M.
reviews.description: Being in the Industry, it was a pleasant surprise to visit the Sidecar Tasting Room! Claire was an awesome Host, knowledgeable about the wines, and gave great info on recommendations. Clean and tasteful Wine Bar and I enjoyed the Red Flight! Took a few bottles home to enjoy!

reviews.author: Marilyn M.
reviews.description: Great ambiance, really good wines! We did the tasting and bought a bottle to take home! Hide gem in Dripping Springs!

reviews.author: Jennifer E.
reviews.description: We were in town for another winery quarterly wine pick up party.  That winery no longer allows you to open your bottles of wine at the party or allow dogs.  As such, it wasn't a great day.  We decided to go some place else.  We showed up around 4pm on a Sunday and had the entire place to ourselves. It is so cute.  I love the decorations and the vibe. We did the wine tasting which is $7 or waved if you buy a bottle of wine.  Megan was wonderful.  She was full of information and funny.  We had such a wonderful time we decided to join Bell Springs wine club.  Three bottles a quarter. No sign up fee. They have a wine pick up party that allows you to bring your dogs.  20% discount the first year and the discount increases every year you are a member.  Free wine tasting for you and four people either at Side Car or the winery itself. You also get to pick which three bottles you want. We signed up on the spot. What is NOT to like! We enjoyed many of their wines but really it was Megan.  She made us feel so welcomed and was so friendly.  Bell Spring treat her right, she is a HUGE asset to you.  We can't wait to attend our first wine pick up party.  Hope to make it to first Thursday soon and hang out at the Side Car.  If we lived in Dripping Springs this would be a weekly stop for us.  What a great place in this sleepy town.  We are so glad to part of their wine club and excited for the many cool events moving forward.  This should be a place to stop if you are in Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Paige M.
reviews.description: LOVED the atmosphere! Such a cute place and great dry whites. The girl working there had a wonderful personality.  She was so easy to talk to and very knowledgeable. If I'm just hanging out, looking for a nice place to chill with a glass, this will be it!

reviews.author: Peter V.
reviews.description: This place has a great selection and wonderful staff. Claire (taller with blonde hair) is absolutely fabulous. She really gets to know the clients. Also very knowledgeable. I recommend the Needy Bitch red wine.

reviews.author: Aaron M.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and wonderful selection of wines. Don't let the road it's one stop you from enjoying this spot.

reviews.author: Claire P.
reviews.description: This was the perfect stop off while driving through. They had good wine, good service and great ambiance. We would definitely recommend to anyone driving through Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Kory C.
reviews.description: My wife and I have been on many of the Bourbon Trail tours in Kentucky, so we know what a "good" tour looks like. Jason did an excellent job of showing us around the distillery, while providing great details of the distilling process. While Still Austin knows it isn't a mega distillery, it embraces that and makes the tour and experience feel personalized. We were able to sample several different whiskeys and one gin, and we even sampled a few unreleased items, which were all very good. My wife and I would recommend this tour to everyone. Thanks Still Austin for a great experience!

reviews.author: Carlson Z.
reviews.description: We booked the whiskey tour for $15 per person and had a great time on a lazy Sunday afternoon. Our tour guide was incredibly knowledgeable and was able to answer all our questions. I felt like I got a lot out of the tour and now have a basic grasp of how whiskey is made.   The distillery is pretty small and they currently sell bourbon and gin as their bread and butter, both of which you'll get to sample at the end of the tour. Highly recommended to check it out as it's just a fun atmosphere.

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: The best whiskey tour I have been on!   I booked a tour to surprise my boyfriend. When we arrived, the place didn't have electricity or AC due to an electrical issue in the area.   Rather than cancel, they treated us to some complementary drinks to make up for the electrical and AC issue.   The staff was very friendly, professional, and turned a bad situation into a very fun and amazing time. Couldn't have imagined it being any better!   The guide was very knowledgeable, the tour was insightful, and the tasting at the end was great! Go support this local Austin business!

reviews.author: Tony P.
reviews.description: Good austin outdoor spot. Came here for Sunday drag brunch bingo.Good time and the drag host was pretty funny and friendly. Dog friendly. Got an old fashioned for 6 bucks so that was a solid deal. Didn't get any good but it looked like a bunch of fried options which my friends seemed to enjoy. It was about 60% full on a Sunday afternoon. I will say that the music was way too loud during the bingo so that made it hard to talk. Outside of bingo, the volume was fine. Overall I'd recommend it. If not, St Elmo brewing is next door.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: The tour was fantastic and very informative.  Well worth the $15.  More than that, at the end we ended at a tasting room where we sat with others on our tour and chatted.  We ended up walking down to a winery with some of those on the tour with us where we sat and chatted and then ended up going to dinner with them.  I highly recommend visiting the distillery and taking the tour!!

reviews.author: Mikhael W.
reviews.description: Our guide was pretty freaking awesome. I don't remember her name but she was a pretty red head with cool tattoos. I'm a tequila girl so I wasn't too eager to learn how gin and bourbon are made, but she really had my attention the entire time!   We were in a group of 10 which was just right. Everyone could get a few questions in if they wanted...laid back...chill...ITS AUSTIN!  Now, to the best part....and boy I was a bit disappointed. I've been on several tours in distilleries and the tasting at the end could get you about 2 shots away from tipsy. Typically there are about 4 samples....1.5-2 ounces each.....  Here....there were 2 samples with 1.5 ounces TOTAL!  I know all they do is gin and bourbon but can a SISTA have a bit more?! The tour is around $15pp, but I'd be happy to pay the standard $30-$40 for a tad bit more licka.    The gin and bourbon are still yummy!  Get a cocktail.....The old fashioned will have you stumbling!

reviews.author: Dan G.
reviews.description: If you are looking for a unique and cool place to taste various whiskeys, try Still Austin Whiskey Company.  The staff was fantastic and knowledgeable and we tried some of their whiskey as well as some mixed concoctions that were fabulous.  There is a great open patio area that shares space with a food truck and the Bearded Bread Company, but the winds were blowing like crazy and the temps were too cold to be outside long. Definitely try this place!  And then explore other spots in the same Industrial Park!  The artwork on the buildings is also great to tour on its own.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: So, we decided to just stick with tasting their liquor instead of getting drinks. They don't have tasting flights, but they do have an option to order a taste of any of their liquors for $2 each. That's not bad at all. We were able to taste the whiskey and gin. The two year whiskey was the winner. I did see some yummy cocktails that I would love to try in the near future.   They have inside and outside seating. The outside patio has a cover for shade, but you do have areas where you can get sun   There's a food truck on site.   Parking is available on site, but shared with the other businesses. For those that want to make an afternoon or day out of your visit, the other businesses are all drink or food related.

reviews.author: Katie S.
reviews.description: Maybe the Bummer and Lazarus distillery on treasure island in San Francisco has bumped my taste in gin up a bit, but this place was pretty alright.  Considering they only have one gin, I think this place is still workin on it. I didn't try the whiskey so that's probably what this place hits outta the park.

reviews.author: Mark J.
reviews.description: Wow.. I have tried a number of Texas whiskeys and while they are all pretty good, they tend to have quite a bite since they don't have time to age. Still Austin has one of the smoothest Texas whiskeys I have had. They also have a nice gin. Their tap room is nice and the staff was great.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: Employees are friendly and extremely knowledgeable about their products.  Knowing very little about the best ways to drink whiskey, I really appreciated the education they gave me and the ideas.  I absolutely love their Straight Bourbon Whiskey!

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: Really great atmosphere. Cute decor. They have their own made gin and bourbon and offer $2 tasters of each.

reviews.author: Malinda F.
reviews.description: Still one of our favorite outdoor hang outs!! But have to like gin or bourbon  Bearded guy food truck had awesome snacks!

reviews.author: Cynthia D.
reviews.description: Wow. This place is making some serious showstopper whiskey. Buttery and caramely and ever so lightly sweet, it's so satisfying to sip on this while listening to my vinyl collection, which I've decided is my latest "thing."  They are currently running a live music series, which is how I became aware of them -- they often do cool giveaways with samples to promote local musicians.

reviews.author: Ken M.
reviews.description: We enjoyed the whiskey tour and the group agrees it was the best and most knowledged guide, Jason, and presentation we have seen.  Very educational despite having toured many others.   Very exciting to have Still here in Austin and the gin and whiskey's were all great.  Can't wait to try their newest creations.

reviews.author: Bethany S.
reviews.description: Still Austin is my favorite Texas bourbon, the distillery and tasting room did not disappoint. Take the tour of the distillery with Jason. He's super fun and informative. Fantastic drinks in the tasting room!

reviews.author: Rishma P.
reviews.description: This is our usual hangout spot with our friends and we love it! It's a chill spot where you can have a drink, eat great food and it's not too overcrowded. However our experience today was really disappointing and it was simply based of the service provided. I wish I got the gentleman's name because he was awesome and his drinks were well balanced. There was a female bartender who made the drinks extremely sweet and when we asked to have them remade, she was extremely rude and confrontational in her demeanor. The other male bartender took it upon himself to remake our drinks and when he tasted what she had served us, he also agreed with the taste being off. Kindness goes a long way and I wish she adopted a more graceful attitude.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: Cool establishment with great product, be careful of glass containers purchased a bottle to bring home and shattered in Transportation. Not sure if it was specific to the containers they used as other bottles purchased from other distilleries did not.

reviews.author: Markeisha T.
reviews.description: This was a hidden gem. Loved the scenery. They have a food truck, everything done electronic through the QR code. Drinks were amazing you can tell they like there product.

reviews.author: Spencer S.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed the tour and the opportunity to not only sample Still Austin bourbon and gin, but to try it in various mixed drinks.  Barbara is incredibly knowledgeable and enthusiastic as a tour guide and in her knowledge of the product. The home town feel of the staff coupled with the loyalty to their state and region in all of their ingredients and products is outstanding.    I highly recommend Still Austin bourbon and gin!

reviews.author: Tazer V.
reviews.description: Was out antiquing with my wife. She spotted "moonshine" and "tasting room" on the same sign. I said, "we gotta go!"  Walked in and tasted three different types of the variety. I left with three bottles, one of each variety I tried. I recommend Moonshine Ridge. I will be back for more!!

reviews.author: Danielle N.
reviews.description: Can't say anything about the actual moonshine but the owner is very rude. He said we couldn't sit on the lower edge of the sidewalk which was pretty much the street. Any time anyone would stand in front of the store for more than 30 seconds he would also tell them to stop "blocking the sidewalk" when it would literally be 2 people and the sidewalk is wide. Not a way to bring in business.

reviews.author: Joshua R.
reviews.description: Traveling through town and found this hidden gem. We took my mom there who doesn't drink anything other than wine. Her exact words were "this is so smooth, no burn, very tasteful".  Made slow and right, uses all Texas ingredients, including the rain water!! (Talk about being resourceful!  The gentleman helping us was one of the owners/distillers. He had one recipe that was his great grandfathers!  Bought a bottle to take back to Phoenix with us!

reviews.author: Ashley F.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and service! We were in town visiting for a wedding and had a local recommend this place, so we decided to go check it out.  The owner was very friendly and had some great stories to tell.  Definitely a place you would want to go visit and grab a drink when you're in town.

reviews.author: Julie W.
reviews.description: What a cool place to wander in to! Such a relaxed vibe, the owner is an awesome storyteller and a generational moonshiner. They have a variety of moonshine to sample, but definitely sit a while and enjoy one of their cocktails!! Perfect pit stop for a day tripper!

reviews.author: Mitchel R.
reviews.description: Jason was fantastic! I highly recommend him to anybody looking to take a tour of wineries/distilleries.  Great communication, easy to work with, and deeply knowledgeable of the area. He made great suggestions, was flexible as needed, and took great care of us! He even got us a private tour of the cellar at Hawk's Shadow Winery.  Absolutely reach out to him if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Rick M.
reviews.description: Jason was very professional and did a good job planning the day. Could not have asked for a better experience.

reviews.author: Jonathan S.
reviews.description: While driving through the area to our destination, we found this gem. We decided to stop in and visit and we're not disappointed. The entrance can be easy to miss if you're not paying attention. Once you turn in, there isn't much parking and the entrance is tucked in the back off the road.   When we got there, the staff were in the bottling area filling, sealing and packaging fresh bottles. It was a cool process to watch from the bar. If you are a whisky fan,definitely stop in.

reviews.author: Shirley P.
reviews.description: This was the most delightful stop!  You won't Be disappointed.  A hidden gem with excellent Whiskey.

reviews.author: Jim B.
reviews.description: I was in Blanco camping at the state park right before Christmas. I was drinking eggnog at another distillery in the area with my wife and friends  when my buddy, John, mentioned they were stopping here on the way back to camp, as well.  When arrived, we were welcomed by a very friendly young man. We sampled all of the products on hand. I was blown away by the full-flavored taste of the gin that they only sell on the property. It is like sipping the essence of a hike through a juniper forest. I have never experienced anything like it. It is destined to be my favorite late night sipping beverage.   I left the distillery with a bottle of Ben Milam Barrel Proof Bourbon and a bottle of Provision Distiller's Gin. I've been sipping on them ever since. I will definitely be back for more!

reviews.author: Michelle C.
reviews.description: Made it back Heather! What a great experience at this quant little place. Brenda was a fabulous host and shared the history of Ben Milam. Thank you!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Great little distillery that I expect will be  going places before you know it. It is fairly new and doesn't have much business, but I don't expect that to last too long.  We stopped by on a Saturday afternoon. The tasting room is small, but quaint. Their single barrel bourbon is smooth and subtle. It was our favorite whiskey of the day (we were on a self guided distillery tour). The tasting was $5 for two. Definitely also the cheapest tasting fee of the day.  If in Blanco, don't miss out in trying this whiskey out. You may just find yourself a new favorite spirit.

reviews.author: Marissa A.
reviews.description: Had a great time with friends trying Whiskey. ( I'm not a whiskey drinker but, my friends are) they do have different cocktails to choose from and they also make gin(if you're into that)   Cute outdoor space and spots inside as well

reviews.author: Mac M.
reviews.description: Thank you for your hospitality I loved your whiskey look forward to staying in contact with y'all. Dee Foster and Rikk T. Munroe thank you very much for the tasting!!!! McAllister Family

reviews.author: Matt F.
reviews.description: Driving through Blanco last week and I've always noticed the road sign but I haven't stopped in before. Check them on Yelp and Google and couldn't find much info, so what the hell, turned around to check in out for myself.   First thing I noticed was the large shade tree, several chairs, and lush grass. I could just see me and a group of friends sitting there having a few drinks and enjoying the cooler fall temperatures because here in South Texas 91 degrees in November is just that, cool Fall. I'm having a hard time getting used to that.   Inside is a small tasting room that is put together nicely. The guy working the counter could have been a little nicer. He was busy taking in inventory and obviously working but I'd like to have heard about their process, why are they better than other distilleries in the area, what sets them apart? Who is Ben Milam, I asked and he said it was the grandfather of the owner. I know who Ben Milam was, and that is a leading figure of the Texas Revolution. I'm not a Texan but I am a history buff and there is a lot to know of Ben Milam and he's great a cool story. I purchased a flight and a bottle, roughly $56 for both. At least pretend that you care a little bit more.   The bottle I took home, it was, and I say WAS fantastic. Unfortunately, Game 7 of the Houston/Dodgers game was a little stressful and the wife and I put a huge dent in the bottle on the first night. Ha! I now have to go back and pick up another, darn. Can't wait...

reviews.author: Vince M.
reviews.description: This rating is for my visit, not for the product. I'm walked in and the lady that was in the tasting room barely greeted me. I looked at the menu and she just stood there. I ordered the flight and, again, nothing. I was the only one there and tried to make at least some small talk, but she was too busy with her cell phone to even speak. She told me NOTHING about the spirits, the distillery, nothing. She seemed put out to even be there. Finally, I bought a bottle, THEN she decided to speak. It was a horrible experience and I wish I had waited to buy the bottle at the local liquor store where it was actually cheaper. Can not recommend this place at all. The products are good, but get them at the liquor store that is right up the road.

reviews.author: Phil M.
reviews.description: I am not a Texan nor a bourbon drinker.  I picked up a bottle of Ben Milam last year.  I think this maybe the best bourbon I have ever had. I plan to visit Texas this coming year and I will visit Ben Milam again.

reviews.author: Eileen S.
reviews.description: Lovely distillery, very knowledgeable and very good! You would def taste their whiskey. Highly recommend

reviews.author: M S.
reviews.description: One of my favorite things about exploring small towns is sometimes you find the most unexpected gems.
