We traveled to Blanco, TX (pop. 1700) today for Old 300 BBQ, and by chance decided to take a different way out of town than we'd come in. Right off 281 we passed by Ben Milam Whiskey, just opened since March. We had a very pleasant visit and enjoyed their whiskey flight, along with a sample of some of the best gin I've ever tasted. Everything was outstanding, but I couldn't stop thinking about their rye whiskey and had to take a bottle home with me. This is worth a trip all on it's own, even if you have to go out of your way. Nice people running the place, and fantastic whiskey.

reviews.author: Ron R.
reviews.description: We just found out about Been Milam Whiskey a couple of days ago and decided on a road trip to check it out. Rick, the Master Distiller, was friendly and informative. He not only knew about the bourbon and rye, he was able to discuss whiskey from other distilleries, places to eat and other topics.   We enjoyed the bourbon and rye enough to buy both before we left. They both had nice aromas and smooth tastes. We will definitely enjoy these bottles and try to spread the word about them.

reviews.author: STEVE C.
reviews.description: I unexpectedly bought a bottle of this whiskey while we were in Johnson City, Texas. The liquor store proprietor said people really liked this smooth bourbon and he sure was right. I like to buy local and support small businesses. I may try to order a case from Blanco.

reviews.author: Sandi D.
reviews.description: We stopped by today and absolutely loved the place! I am not a huge whiskey fan, but i enjoyed their whiskey to my surprise! My husband is a big whiskey man and said it was some of the best whiskey he has ever had.   They also make a gin they was great.  The men who helped us out were very friendly and informative with the tasting.  Thank you!! This place is a must stop!

reviews.author: Christine Y.
reviews.description: I'm in love with Fierce Whiskers! The main interior tasting room and bar area is gorgeous with deep tones of dark blues, leather and wood textures, and moody lighting. The large glass doors open up to a spacious outdoor seating area. The drink menu is fairly priced with cocktails that allow you to taste their very own whiskey, gin, and rum. If you prefer straight whiskey, they have flights/tasting samplers you can ask about.  I loved the food truck parked in their lawn (Char ATX) with delicious yakitori (Japanese meat on skewers).  They have tours of their facilities which sound really interesting. I think those tours are about $15/person (please verify with Fierce Whiskers for most up-to-date pricing).  Good-sized parking lot  This place is a hidden gem. Drive past Meanwhile and head straight to Fierce Whiskers. ;-)

reviews.author: Joanna S.
reviews.description: Super excited about what's going on here and what's to come! We visited while in ATX for our anniversary. Sophie gave us an incredible tour of the distillery. She was excellent and we learned a lot! The interior of the main tasting room is so beautiful and well thought-out with details we learned from the tour. The drinks were superbly made and delicious. Definitely will be back when visiting in the future :)

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: Came here for a distillery tour and stayed to enjoy the taproom. The tour is $15 and includes a tasting. Fair warning their whiskey is new aged and won't be ready to be bottled for sale for another 2+ years. This made the tasting a littleeeee rough, but I learned a lot about whiskey so it was worth it. The tasting room is really nice and they have a great cocktail list - standard and seasonal. They host events regularly and there is a food truck on site.

reviews.author: Heeteak C.
reviews.description: This is the first time this place. Cool tour and awesome bar. Still getting thing ready for full on bourbon sell but theyvhave a lot of great drinks. Must come by and experience it.

reviews.author: Matthew N.
reviews.description: Such a cool local Austin spot. Disappointed I have to wait 3 -4 more years to buy a bottle. If you are looking for something different to do go check it out!

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: Very cool new spot! I went on the tour and learned so much! They are using state of the art, green distilling techniques that were super interesting to learn about. Beautiful interior and on a beautiful plot of land for outdoor drinking. And Great cocktails of course!

reviews.author: Linda H.
reviews.description: I have never felt more minimized for being a woman, more reduced. Standing next to blacked out men (drunk), being cut off told I'm raising my voice for simply responding. While I'm four drinks behind. This place is the definition of Trump Texas. It's disgusting!!

reviews.author: Yer M.
reviews.description: My friends and I did a tour. Sophie was an awesome guide and I learned a lot. Thanks!

reviews.author: Ari D.
reviews.description: What a great find! Drinks are tasty, beautiful space and very friendly staff. I recommend the Marshmallow World, feels like the holidays!

reviews.author: Lesley R.
reviews.description: Great way to spend an afternoon with family, friends and loved ones. Informed tour guide, great history and amazing cocktails.

reviews.author: Makenzie E.
reviews.description: We went for a tour and had a great time! Sofia was our tour guide and was very informative. The distillery was very clean and the bar area was very nicely decorated. The bartenders were excellent and helped us with drink recommendations. I absolutely recommend coming out here!! Will be back!!

reviews.author: Shea B.
reviews.description: Went on the whiskey tour and our guide was great, awesome place! We had a great time and will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Thep T.
reviews.description: New distillery in Austin proper. We did a tour of the facility, sampled some whiskey and rye. Worth checking out before they full open with cocktail bar and picnic grounds

reviews.author: John G.
reviews.description: love this place, great service and food! we did the tour and will definitely be back. Great atmosphere inside for a cocktail and convo.

reviews.author: John D.
reviews.description: We had a great tour with Sophie. We got to hear all about the distillery's history, as well as its future. Definitely a must do in S. Austin!

reviews.author: Rachel B.
reviews.description: I love Whiskey and my wife mentioned we needed to check out Fierce Whiskers. Harry was so knowledgeable and going through the whole process was so interesting. The alcohol is good and I am excited to see how the product changes. Check out Fierce Whiskers. Do the tour, have a drink and enjoy the nice place. They also have a Yakitori truck. We will check that out next time.

reviews.author: Justin P D.
reviews.description: Sophie was an amazing host  + beautiful facility and tasting room! Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Mandy G.
reviews.description: If you're looking to visit some wineries in the outskirts of Austin, I recommend it with Arlen!   Arlen was sweet, knowledgable, and funny. He picked us up from our Airbnb and drove us 45 mins out and back, while we blasted some rachet songs to sing haha. He would check in on us during the winery to see if we needed anything or have any questions, and he would offer to help us take multiple pictures. He also got one of the wineries to allow us to explore their cellars!   On our last day in Austin, he drove by our airbnb to pick up someone else and honked at us as we waited for our uber. We were all so happy to see him again, as we all enjoyed our experience with him.   I recommend Texas Tipsy Tours with Arlen ;)

reviews.author: Brittany Z.
reviews.description: I have so many wonderful things to say about this company. I set-up an appointment online to schedule a private driver to Fredericksburg. Ashley called right on time. She was friendly and very informative.  She helped make the experience exactly what I was looking for. I wanted less sweet wines and a winery with food options. Arlen was our diver and was so knowledgeable and friendly. He picked us up right at the hotel in Austin. I felt the price for the experience is definitely worth it. If you were considering this experience, I highly recommend this company. They care and that is important.

reviews.author: Rolanda H.
reviews.description: If your looking to visit wineries or distilleries in the  outskirts of Austin like Dripping Springs and the surrounding area I highly recommend Texas Tipsy Tours. They are organized and timely. If you're an out of towner like myself and decide to book accommodations in Austin they will pick you up from there and bring you back.   All of my future bookings I will definitely request Wade. He was very professional and personable, he made sure we were taken care of at each location on our tour. He also was more than happy to take our pictures along the way.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: We were on a girls trip and were lucky to have Arlen as our driver. He was exceptional, friendly and knowledgeable! He gave us great recommendations for places we were unsure about.

reviews.author: Stephanie T.
reviews.description: Y'all BOOK WITH THEM!!!!! I literally do not have one negative thing to say about this company. From the minute I called to book to the minute I said goodbye to our driver the day of the tour they were fantastic.   So when I called there actually weren't any times available. They worked with me to make sure they had a tour time and sprinter available for our group of 6. I had a million questions; they were patient and kind.   Our group was 6 but one of my friends asked if we could add an additional person. Reached out to TTT and they said sure no problem. Literally 3 HOURS LATER I got a call that another girl tested positive with covid and wouldn't be able to come with us obviously- they were so nice and made the switch back to 6. Very grateful for their exceptional customer service.   Day of our driver Bryant was early which was great! Got on the bus and let us have free range of the radio, answered any wine questions we had or any questions about Fredericksburg. He was a fantastic host. Always texted 15 minutes till our time at the winery was up and took as many pictures as we wanted. He was so sweet! He also made sure we were never thirsty or hungry. Which for a group of girls is very important- smart man! Haha   I've heard things about other companies having hidden fees and people getting charges after leaving Fredericksburg and we had none of that. Texas Tipsy Tours was very transparent with all of their pricing and they had no hidden fees.   Thank you TTT for making our trip perfect. You won't regret booking with them.

reviews.author: Mia L.
reviews.description: Sent a request in and received a response on a weekend afternoon in less than 5 minutes. Incredible customer service, they only fit up to 14 on their vehicles so we were unable to use them, but their owner takes quotes seriously!!

reviews.author: Kelly F.
reviews.description: My experience with Texas Tipsy tours was nothing short of perfect!!! From pickup to drop-off, Courtney (the owner) made our experience amazing! When I initially started inquiring about a tour a few months ago, many of the companies only offered private tours for a minimum of 4 people. However, Texas Tipsy Tours offers small group private tours (i.e. 2-3 people). This was perfect for me. She also made planning our trip so easy, and she promptly answered all of the questions I had.   On the day of the tour, she picked us up from our hotel in Austin in an Infiniti SUV (it was very clean too)! She even made a pit stop for me at a CVS on the way to our first winery. Throughout the 6 hour tour, she made sure we stayed on schedule. She even let us change a stop last minute because we wanted to check out a brewery!  One thing that was amazing was the comfort she provided! She allowed us to pick the music, provided phone chargers, and let us control the AC! She even opened our doors for us AND dropped us off/picked us up right in front of each place we went!  Overall, I highly recommend Texas Tipsy Tours, and I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Audrey C.
reviews.description: Wow!  What an amazing day our group of ladies had with Texas Tipsy Tours.  We chose the half day option and were picked up right at our vacation rental (Farmhouse on Elder Hill) We wanted to just stay nearby so we visited Driftwood Estate Winery and Fall Creek.  We were planning to also see Vista Brewing (all in Driftwood), but we chatted and laughed so much that we ran out of time and Eric, driver/owner was flexible with our change of plans and let us just extend our time enjoying the fabulous view at Driftwood Estate.  The tour service was absolutely awesome and professional.  Everything done with excellence.  Thank you Courtney and Eric!

reviews.author: Ally H.
reviews.description: Awesome experience for bachelorette. Seamless communication with manager Courtney. Helped us make a great itinerary-2 wineries and 1 distillery. Group loved every minute. Driver Keaton was so friendly and professional and best of all company was affordable. Can't recommend enough

reviews.author: Ashton M.
reviews.description: I booked a private wine tasting tour with Tipsy Tours for a bachelorette party and it was seamless right from the start! They took care of everything and even placed our lunch order for us in advance so it was ready when we arrived. It was honestly one of the best tour experiences I have ever had and already booked another tour with them for later this year!

reviews.author: Erin J.
reviews.description: We booked Texas Tipsy Tours twice in one weekend. I have taken quite a few van tours around the hill country and Texas Tipsy Tours sets themselves apart by not just being drivers but they truly host you the entire day. I will ALWAYS use this company going forward. We did a private charter from Driftwood to Austin, TX and back and Keaton our driver was a delight. He made sure we were picked up on time and each of our stops were easy and flexible. We did a mixed tour around Driftwood and Dripping springs the next day and our guide Eric executed the BEST DAY for us. He even picked up on what we were liking and recommended a change to our final stop to Vista Brewing and we were SO glad he did. At each stop he made sure we had plenty of water, snacks and chairs to enjoy the gorgeous venues. This is totally above and beyond what we would have expected from a driver. Courtney was so easy to work with and she helped make recommendations for our group ultimately making our weekend get away FLAWLESS. I promise if you don't use this company, you're wrong.

reviews.author: Chelsea C.
reviews.description: AWESOME! I worked with Courtney at TTT to plan my Husband's 30th birthday brewery tour. It was as easy as getting on the phone, explaining what I wanted, and Courtney took care of literally everything else. We picked the breweries we wanted and even included a food stop. She coordinated the bus pick up, drop offs, schedule, and even reserved tables for us at each stop. I love that we had our own bus (very nice one, by the way!), and had the flexibility to create our own tour based on beers and food my husband liked. It was the perfect Saturday in Austin! Payment was very easy as well - they sent me an invoice to my email and I was able to pay directly online for everything. Highly recommend, and thank you Texas Tipsy Tours!

reviews.author: Kylie H.
reviews.description: Texas Tipsy Tours was absolutely wonderful. They curated a wine tasting for my best friend's bachelorette, and were so helpful and knowledgeable. Courtney and Eric are just the sweetest people! Would highly recommend if you're looking for a relaxed tasting without the hubbub of big party buses, AND if you're looking for a more personalized experience with people who can really throw a party. Fredericksburg can be confusing because of the many, many options, so Courtney's expertise in the wineries proved incredibly helpful. Highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Christy C.
reviews.description: We had an excellent experience with this tour company.  They were easy to work with and to plan our day.  We selected the premium wine tour and stopped at 3 wineries and picked up lunch at Hye Market.  The entire experience was well thought out and planned thoroughly.  Courtney is one of the owners and helped me figure out which wineries to taste.  Keaton was our driver and he was great!  I would definitely recommend this tour company.

reviews.author: Nancy R.
reviews.description: Our driver, Keaton, was amazing! He was so polite and kept us on schedule. The places we visited were amazing and so welcoming. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: D H.
reviews.description: We loved our wine tour with Taste of the Hills. We visited three wineries with two other couples on the tour. Each stop was unique and Jodie was especially knowledgeable and friendly. She is completely worth trying the tour!   Bonus: we got engaged after the tour!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Jodie was the best!  I found Taste of the Hills on yelp.  I messaged Jodie in April to see what her pricing and availability was for Memorial Day weekend and she responded quickly. Paid deposit through venmo and paid the other half day of our tasting. We did one winery, one distillery and one brewery. She gave us a small history of each of the places we went too. Her cheese board setup was amazing! Very sweet and easy going. I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Chandler W.
reviews.description: Jodie made my day all I could have dreamed of. Her bus is super nice, well air conditioned and plenty of space, her knowledge of each winery was very cool to hear and she made sure we were always comfortable! On a warm summer day we were kept cool, fed, and full of wine! Must book with Jodie for a trip around the hill country. Delicious wine and charcuterie board! Thank you Jodie!

reviews.author: Cheryl J.
reviews.description: OMG, Jodie is FaNtAsTiC! My bff and I were on our annual girl's trip and wanted to book a wine tour before we left the Hill Country of Texas. We were staying in the adorable town of Wimberley so I researched tours in the area.  Jodie's Taste of the Hills Tour got great reviews and went to wineries close to the Wimberley area. The day of the tour ended up being chilly and rainy. As soon as Jodie pulled up with her spectacular shuttle-like van she was out like a flash with pretty umbrellas for us! We went to 3 different wineries which we thoroughly enjoyed! After the first one, we returned to Jodie's vehicle and she had a gorgeous tray for us of cheese,  sausage,  crackers,  grapes,  olives, dips.....simply divine!!! The tour was also just the 2 of us and we loved that Jodie still did ALL of this for a tour that I believe takes up to 12 people! The next time we plan a trip to the Hill Country we are going to do one of Jodie's Beer tours!! We had such great conversations with Jodie too! Thank you sooooo much for the GREAT time! Sooooo much fun!

reviews.author: Samantha K.
reviews.description: The owner, Jodie, went above and beyond to make sure my birthday with 12 of my friends and family was a moment to remember and it was just that. She recommended the best of Driftwood and ended up going to Driftwood Estate Winery and Vista Brewery. We spent around 5 hours commuting, tasting, and even an impromptu cellar tour. Thanks again, Jodie! I highly recommend Taste of the Hills to everyone.

reviews.author: Kyle D.
reviews.description: Amazing tour!!! My wife and I came into Wimberley during Spring Break to relax from teaching and this was the perfect trip to do so! Jodie made us all feel like we were old friends, even though we had never met anyone else on the bus.  She was very detailed with the stories of each winery, and explained all the different varietals, answering our every question along the way. The bus was very comfortable and clean, and she stored each bottle we purchased until the trip was over, but we could have had the bottles on the bus had we chosen to.  The wineries all seemed to know her, so they were expecting us and were incredibly friendly. We were not rushed anywhere, and still managed to make it back into town to enjoy shopping on the square.  My wife and I were pretty hungry by the time we had lunch, since we didn't have breakfast, but the tapas style lunch was perfect for the glass of wine we purchased to have with it. The lunch was delicious and filling.  Overall this was an amazing experience and I will be recommending this tour to everyone I know.

reviews.author: Jeffrey R.
reviews.description: Jodie is an exceptional chauffeur.  We had a blast for a friend's birthday! She knew all the great stops and her ride is smooth, comfy, and had a great sound system. We had so much fun!

reviews.author: Sona E.
reviews.description: This wine tour with Jodie is a must.  We got Serenity Inn on a Wednesday so we were lucky to be on the wine tour with only one other couple.  Jodie is such a pleasant and inviting soul. She asked about each person's preferences as to be able to personalize the tour and pick which wineries she decided to take us too.  She is very knowledgeable of the town and the wineries.  The lunch she provides is just amazing. By the time we were done I felt like I had made an incredible new friend. I can't wait to go back and do more tours.

reviews.author: Amber N.
reviews.description: This was such an incredible experience. Jodie picked us up at the Serenity Farm House Inn. She was so friendly and knowledgeable and super sweet. She knew all the best places to go. The picnic lunch she provided was amazing. I wouldn't change a thing about today. I would love to bring some friends and do it all over again.

reviews.author: Brooke K.
reviews.description: Myself,  my Aunt and my cousin took Jodie's winery tour yesterday and had an absolute blast! Jodie really personalized the tour based on our taste in wines. She has an extensive knowledge of wines, the wineries, the towns, etc. Our favorite part was lunch because of the views and the wonderful spread that was provided for us. I highly recommend this tour and in fact will probably we doing it again, soon, I hope.

reviews.author: Amber D.
reviews.description: Perfect - the highlight of our trip!  Jodie was the best, most fun, knowledgeable and coordinator.  We went to Driftwood, Duchman and Fall Creek Vineyards.  We were fortunate enough to have great people touring with us, and it made the tour all the more fun.  She prepared the best picnic lunch I've ever had.  Sugar Shack cake balls, meats, cheeses, crackers, hummus, a goat cheese something served on crackers (that I LOVED, and I hate goat cheese), spinach feta rolls, and I'm sure I'm forgetting something.  She was fully prepared for everything.  Boxes for the wine we bought, umbrellas in case in rained (it didn't), plenty of water...this wine tour couldn't have been more perfect if she tried.  Thanks, Jodie!

reviews.author: Charles J.
reviews.description: Jodie was amazing!  Very knowledgeable and informative.  Has some great stories and makes it very fun.  And the wineries she took us to were fantastic!  I've been to some bad wineries and the Wimberley area has a lot of options and can be daunting to do yourself.  Plus, nice to have a driver.  . Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anita Y.
reviews.description: Jodie was amazing! She asked what our preferences in wine were and brought us to wineries that best fit our palate. She had a delicious charcuterie board waiting for us. Super friendly and very knowledgeable on various places in Wimberley. I highly recommend Jodie!!!

reviews.author: Gwen L.
reviews.description: This was a Fantastic tour. The winery's were lovely and Jodie was the perfect host. Would do it again and recommend to anyone visiting Wimberly.

reviews.author: Amer S.
reviews.description: Jodie was an amazing host and she really made the evening perfect for my wife's 40th birthday! She took us to amazing tasting locations, she knew everyone and we received first class service. She even helped with dinner reservations! It really was an amazing evening largely due to Jodie and the exceptional service she provides! If you are looking for a fantastic wine tour, get in touch with Jodie and she will ensure that happens.

reviews.author: Vicky W.
reviews.description: Ahhhh! So very relaxing! Jodie Meyer knew all the tourists' names and made sure we got to know each other. She provided an excellent variety of foods including a hot portion and gluten-free (just in time `cause I was lit after the 1st vineyard). The three vineyards for that day were selected based on the wine preferences of the tourists that day (A+ perk). We never felt pushed or obligated to buy wines, but we all did because they were very good (!), and Jodie kept our purchases organized and stored for us. She also gave a good background on each vineyard and on the Wimberley area in general. We learned a lot about Wimberley and wine and were able to get tipsy knowing Jodie was an excellent driver of her comfy bus. And have you been to Wimberley? That hilly countryside is beautiful!

reviews.author: Linz N.
reviews.description: We recently went on a fabulous wine tour with Jodie on 4/15 and had a great time!  Our tour was originally scheduled for 10:30a, but got pushed back to 1:15p due to shuttle trouble (we had the option to receive our money back, but actually liked the later time).  We stopped at three wineries, including Driftwood Estate and Duchman Family Winery.  The views at all of the wineries varied, but each were unique to their locations.  Jodie provided an amazing picnic-style lunch, including a charcuterie (meat and cheese) board, chicken salad, nuts, walnut and feta salad, grapes, chocolate cake balls, bottled water, etc. At the second stop, Jodie was kind enough to call in people's orders to Salt Lick BBQ and had it all ready to take home by the third stop.  We can't wait to return again!

reviews.author: Debbie V.
reviews.description: Fantastic wine tour with a knowledgable , fun and personable guide. Jodi made our first wine tour experience a memorable one. Nice travel accommodations   We went to 3 local wineries chosen by our wine preferences. She provided a great tapas lunch and even accommodated the gluten free guests.  I would highly recommend   I will be coming back and doing it again!

reviews.author: Stephanie H.
reviews.description: My mother and I had the most amazing time with Jodi. She was a perfect tour guide and took us to three great wineries. She gave us a lot of background information on the wineries as well as the town of Wimberley. She had a delicious assortment of snacks for us to munch on while we rode to and from each winery. She helped package our wine purchases and brought us umbrellas as it started to rain. She even went the extra mile, literally, and drove us back to our hotel since it was raining as we had walked to our meeting spot earlier in the day. We had another couple on the tour with us which was really nice since we had people to mingle with. It was a very personal experience and I felt as though we were all just great friends spending an afternoon together. Who needs Napa, everything is better in Texas!!! We will definitely be repeat customers.

reviews.author: Lindsey W.
reviews.description: My husband surprised me for a birthday getaway to Wimberley, and we went on this wine tour and had the best time! I had been on another wine tour before in Wimberley, but Jodie made this tour worth it. She knew exactly where to go and even suggested certain wines at each location!   The length of the tour was the perfect amount of time as well. I would definitely recommend this tour and can't wait to go back and visit again!

name: Dripping With Taste Wine and Food Festival

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: This was my first, and sad to say, my last time doing this festival. A friend who had been a few times before highly recommended it and when I balked at the $40 (plus a $3.50 processing fee) "pre-event discount price" with the at the door price being $50, he assured me it was well worth it because there were so many great food and wine vendors, you get your money's worth.  This was absolutely NOT the case! Firstly, this whole thing just seemed disorganized at best and I am sorry, but for $50 ($40) they could have gotten a much nicer location than a dusty, stiflingly hot cattle stockyard!   As for what you get for $40, 6 drink tickets and 10 food tickets when drinks and food run you anywhere from 1 ticket for a meager barely 1oz pour for most of the wines to several tickets for very small portions of the food, you barely get $10 worth of food and drink! You can purchase ticket for $1 a piece, which is most definitely not worth the portions or pours you receive.   As for the vendors/vintners at the festival, there were not nearly as many as you would expect for the price point and the layout was just haphazard. Also, there were several vendors that were out of food by the time we got there just after 2pm...the "festival" was supposed to go until 6pm...so how the heck were vendors running out of things w/4hrs left!?!   The only highlight, for me at least, was the grape stomp, but even then, they ran out of tshirts to "stamp" with your grape-soaked footprints.   In any case, my $43.50 would have been better spent and enjoyed at an actual local restaurant where I could have gotten multiple full pours of wine and actual food instead of leaving this joke of a festival hungry, overheated, more sober than when I arrived, and feeling like I had just been scammed somehow. Lesson. Learned.   I am honestly shocked this "festival" has lasted 10yrs let alone one!

reviews.author: Valerie S.
reviews.description: I had a lovely time as the guest of a coworker. However, I felt like the overall value wasn't quite there for this event. Drink and food tickets went way too fast when some places asked for multiple tickets for less than an ounce of wine or a small sample of food. The actual value was about $1 per ticket. There were also some vendors that were somewhat rude or rushing. The whole point is to get business by having people try your product, right? Well there's some wineries I'd think twice about giving my money to after their lack of friendliness.   The options for food was more limited than I expected and many ran out of food even though we got there just an hour after the event started. There are lots of raffles going on and free koozies and pens galore. The arena was stuffy inside and though fresh near the doors you ran the risk of also eating dirt.   The music was good but there needed to be more sitting areas to relax and open a bottle of wine. I will definitely go back next year, but I do hope to see more offerings.

reviews.author: Ella D.
reviews.description: This was by far the most awful "festival" I have ever had the misfortune of wasting money on.   First of all, in 2012 it was held at the Texas Hill Country Olive Company. So all advertisements this year were of a gorgeous event at this lovely vineyard - The photos were of a classy event, surrounded by olive trees and rolling hills, adorable art booths scattered about the lovely property, smiling faces holding wine glasses. I was so excited based on what I was reading of the Olive Company event that I had my mother travel up 3 hours on the morning of Saturday the 14th to accompany me. Then I convinced another girlfriend of mine to join. We had our tickets in advance, $40.00 online purchase, and my girlfriend paid at the door - $50.00.   Now, regardless of where the ACTUAL event for 2013 was advertised as being held - between the advertisements on Yelp, on Facebook and scattered about Dripping Springs, it was VERY unclear to anyone coming from outside of town where the hell this event actually was.   So we arrived at the Texas Hill Country Olive Company to find no tents, no events, no nothing but a beautiful building surrounded by beautiful land. Inside there were very few customers. But we were greeted warmly, given amazing samples (DO go there and DO try their olive oils and balsamic vinegars and DO check out their $55.00 romantic date night packages).   Making the best of what was already frustrating, we had a few samples and they sent us on to the Dripping Springs Park Ranch - or something like that, up Ranch Road Twelve.   We were still optimistic until we saw the HUGE metal pavilion looming ahead, situated in the midst of probably two square miles of plowed up red dirt which will eventually be a parking lot. As we navigated in, driving through dirt among hundreds of cars, we noticed piles of dirt, bull dozers, caution tape... this entire venue was a.) an agricultural fair pavilion and b.) UTTERLY UNFINISHED.   I was mortified. I brought guests, I paid money, and we were supposed to be in the midst of lush, rolling hill country sipping wine and sampling cheese. Not walking through 300 yards of dirt to get to an unfinished metal building. This was already so embarrassing and already not worth the money.   We had to enter at the back of this enormous, godawful construction, walk through the art vendors, then across MORE dirt on the rodeo floor (where the paying guests tables were and the music) where we were given six drink tickets and ten food tickets. When we reached the one interior part of the building, we were encountered by swarms of casually dressed, generally rude, pushy guests who were buzzing around a square room with no proper traffic flow. There we found out that each drink ticket gave us ONE OUNCE of wine, which was poured by rude and distracted vendors. We also found that each food ticket did not entitle us to a sample - samples cost anywhere from 2 to 5 tickets. One ticket got you the likes of ONE chip with a dollop of something on it.   I was blocked and almost run over by a RUDE and completely OBLIVIOUS staff member who was blocking the only entrance to the tasting room. Other guests were hogging the only FIVE standing tables in the are, they'd put their purses up there and stand around and send other guests to get them samples, so there was no where to set down your things and you had to juggle a glass of wine, your tickets, your purse, and a plate of food and in order to eat it, back through the ONE door you went, down the stairs to the dirt on the rodeo arena floor.   We left without even using the tickets we had - not worth the paltry return for what we'd spent and what we had to endure to get there.   I will never return to this event. I want my money back from this event. The Dripping Springs Chamber of Commerce should be ashamed of the overall mess and disappointment this fiasco was - they don't deserve a dime of the money they raised from it.   TERRIBLE.

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: This is probably more of a 3.5 than a 4, but the low ratings to date are unjustified so I'm bumping it up.  I enjoyed the wide variety of beer, wine, and liquor to choose from, but I wish there were a few more food options. What made it worth the price of admission was the sommelier talk at 3:30 where there was no-ticket-required wine comparison tasting, and I learned a few things. Take advantage of those demos if you go next year. Also there were a few food stands with free samples no tickets required (pecans were a favorite, olive oil, chips and salsa, etc). I wish I had hit the liquor area sooner, they seemed to have generous pours. I may hit this event again next year, or I may not, but I definitely had a good time.

reviews.author: Miranda E.
reviews.description: This was disappointing. I've been to many similar food/wine tastings, but this one was very low value- you received drink and food coupons instead of the usual unlimited tastings most events provide. Also, expect to experience long lines in a hot event center. I'd recommend treating yourself to a nice dinner with wine over coming here.

reviews.author: Chrystal W.
reviews.description: I thought this was an awesome event!  Yes you had to pay $40 for entrance into the event.  For that money you receive a twin Iiquors reusable bag, some goodies inside the bag including a wine glass, 10 food tickets and 6 wine tickets.  Each wine ticket was good for a 1oz pour.  And the food tickets could be used at more than 10 food vendors for various amounts.  It is called Dripping with Taste because it is supposed to be a "taste" not a full glass or full meal.  I will tell you that I had plenty of food for my 10 tickets!  And got to try 6 different wines!    I will say that a previous post about volunteers having to work 2 hours and then getting unlimited food and drinks is absolutely false.  Volunteers had to work a minimum of 3 hour shifts but most worked many, many more hours not only the day of the event but also prior to the event and they got the same 10 food tickets and 6 alcohol tickets.  I learned a lot about local wineries, breweries, and distilleries and tasted some awesome food from some local restaurants that I had not yet eaten at.

reviews.author: Jared H.
reviews.description: If you choose to attend this festival, DO NOT PAY. You get 6 drink tickets and 10 food tickets for $40. 1 oz pours. That's about 1/6 of a glass of wine. So you pay $40 for a single glass of wine. HEB gave away 2 chips with salsa for 1 ticket, empanadas were 5 tickets. I was denied BUYING a bottle of water, so that the volunteers could have them.   This brings me to the point, if you want to go to dripping with taste, volunteer. They treat the volunteers far better than paying guests. They do their jobs for 2 hours then get to enjoy UNLIMITED drinks and food and get cool shirts that aren't available to buy to us regulars.   I was very unimpressed Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Brandy E.
reviews.description: I was really excited for this, but sadly disappointed. Paid $40 ticket, which included 10 food tasting tickets and 6 wine tasting tickets. Get there and see that almost every vendor is charging 2-5 tickets for food tasting and the wine tastings are  only 1 oz pours. What??! What did my $40 pay for?? A couple sample size appetizers and a few gargle-worth 's wine samples! Furthermore, it was inside and stifling!! I'd much rather pay a little more and get unlimited tastings, at least I'd feel like I got my money's worth. Sorry Dripping, won't be back. Huge disappointment.

reviews.author: Chris T.
reviews.description: They did a good job this year except for signage. There was a huge lack thereof at the back entrance where they were having everyone park when I arrived.  Everyone parking had no idea where to go. Other than that, the new Ranch/event center is nice. There were lots of vendors and lots to choose from. The tickets were more than enough to try things and the staff were friendly. Dripping Springs is a gorgeous city that should be visited by all.

reviews.author: Holmes S.
reviews.description: A piss poor event.   It was raining when we arrived, I know that no one can help that, but we were one of the first to arrive and we directed to park at the back end of a mud field. Instead of filling up the lot nearest the event, we had to walk though a water logged muddy field.   Then the signing up volunteers, one of the online register volunteers, was the rudest person I have met in a long time. She reminded me of one of the Orks from Lord of the Rings.   So you get 10 food tickets and 6 drink tickets. What you fail to learn until you have paid ($50) is that 10 food tickets doesn't mean 10 small samples, all of the samples were multiple tickets. Essentially, your $50 gets you two tacos and the six drink tickets equal about one glass of wine.   A truly crap festival.

reviews.author: Charlene N.
reviews.description: This year was my second year to attend the festival. I loved it. I did volunteer this year to help and I am glad I did. I saw more of what hard work goes into making it a success. I still had time to taste wine and food and work to help this year be more successful than the last. I had fun and really love this part of Texas. Perfect place and lot of hard work went into making this a fun day.  Good job all who make this happen!!!!

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: After reading the other reviews I felt that I had to write one myself. Just how many wine festivals have these people attended?!  I have attended literally dozens of wine festivals, mostly in California. Believe me that the Dripping with Taste Festival is, by far, the best value on the market. Spending $40 for the initial tickets is next to nothing compared to the analogous events in California. AND purchasing additional tickets for a buck each is very cheap compared to other such events.   I have attended the last two Dripping with Taste festivals and plan to continue to attend every year. I look forward to this event based on the quality of the event and the very, very low cost. Both years I have come away with the feeling that I got more than my money's worth and found several Texas wines to add to my wine cellar!

reviews.author: B L.
reviews.description: Went to this event for my birthday and...gee...what a rip.  Like the other person said its located at a huge agricultural pavilion for horse and gun shows.  I live in Drippings and saw this massive structure being erected.  Its quite the eye sore.  That'd be fine if it wasn't so expensive.  Worse, it is actually held in a tiny closed off indoor part of the complex that's maybe a 1/8th the size of the whole place.  Needless to say, it was over crowded, people packed in like sardines.  My family wanted to leave rather quickly because it just flat out sucked.  Some the vendors were generous some were stingy and acted like it was a chore to deal with you.  Stay away from this event.

reviews.author: Elizabeth N.
reviews.description: The last time I went to this event was several years ago and I was very disappointed with the venue and the offerings and had not gone back. I decided to try it again this year since it sounded like a great venue but I was very disappointed here as well. The place was nice and large but very hot and had a messy, red dirt floor. Really, I spent $40 on a cattle pen?  The wineries were nice but there were not enough food vendors and most were over-priced. My legs and feet were disgustingly dirty by the time we left. It also made me wonder how much of that dirt ended up on the food.  That's two out of two disappointments with that event and I will not be going back until a better location is used. If it happens a third time, well it will be third time and your out. There are plenty of nicer wine events around Texas that don't charge that much for entry and are much more fun.

reviews.author: Laurie H.
reviews.description: We thoroughly enjoyed our day at Dripping With Taste. Having missed the event last year, we weren't sure what to expect at the new venue. Mother Nature decided that we needed some rain, and she was right! Though we were a little soggy when we arrived, that didn't dampen our spirits. We sampled food from most of the vendors, the quality was outstanding and we found everyone to be warm, friendly and knowledgable. As always, great wines, loved the beer garden, and glad to see the addition of spirits. The music added a nice ambience. We enjoyed our beer, wine and food sitting comfortably watching the shows. We had a wonderful day, we're looking forward to next year's Dripping With Taste. The Chamber should be very proud of this years event.

reviews.author: G C.
reviews.description: Definitely not worth your money. 50.00 per person with very little vendors for the money. 10 food tickets and 6 wine/spirit tickets. Filler vendors for example Sysco and HEB to make the place appear fuller. Don't do it.

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Love this place. They have live music too so check their calendar! Great relaxing vibe.  Great drinks, great staff, and tons of games to play with friends:) just wish they had paper straws. We loved Ashley the bartender on staff. Super friendly and made sure we loved our drink choices (all the drinks here are great).  Special note: They also rescued a baby cow named Moonshine who is like a little puppy- she loves some pets and will lick your hands a few chickens running around too.   Drink suggestions: great bloody Mary's! I also really like their passion fruit vodka!  Food: mmmk they have the best Mac and cheese! This is a must here. It's super smokey I loved it. They have lots of meat options too.  They have fans blowing water/misting you in the heat and twinkle lights everywhere.  Kid friendly? Yup, although I didn't see any when I went they gave a big play structure behind the car!  Parking on site

reviews.author: Josh B.
reviews.description: This place is an absolute knockout.   We went as a thing to do while staying nearby, and wow! We will go back just to hang out some more.   We got there for lunch time and to try a cocktail and eat BBQ as it's really near the local RV park. The vodka is delicious. They offer samples and have a broad selection of flavor profiles. We tried a good number of cocktails each of which was fantastic and flavorful. Jackie the bartender was wonderful to talk to and kept my wife ms drink full, my kids happy with mock tails and unsold me on a bottle of vodka, and a cinnamon vodka ( I hate cinnamon). Catfish, the master distiller came by the bar and had some awesome stories and insights into how Planet Rock became a thing.   If that's not enough to get you there for a taste, the BBQ truck does great food. Get the Texas Twinkie. The ribs were great as was the quesadilla and the stuffed potato but trust me, get yourself a Twinkie.   If you are anywhere nearby try this place. It's pet, child, and adult friendly. And they have live music. How can you go wrong?

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem out on Hudson Bend. Catfish is distilling some of the best vodka anywhere, and his staff are mixing up cocktails that rival the trendiest places downtown. And this is all in a laid-back, dog-friendly, wear your comfy jeans, no pretension atmosphere. It's like hanging out in someone's backyard... if that someone had great live music, acrobats, and world class spirits.  And while all the drinks are amazing (you seriously can't go wrong), the Bloody Mary selections are out of this world.

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: What a fantastic venue!! So much open space, seating, fire pits, heaters, swings...great stage with live music... Delicious vodka cocktails served up by really fun bartenders...BBQ food truck on site. Dog-friendly, family-friendly...clean bathrooms. We can't wait to go back!!  (*Covid note - not many masks were worn, but there's plenty of space for social-distance and hand sanitizer placed on several tables)

reviews.author: Kimberly S.
reviews.description: My husband I spent the afternoon at Planet Rock Vodka Distillery and had an amazing time! We are visitors to Austin and Planet Rock was recommended by a local family last night at dinner, so wanting to experience local places rather than tourist spots, we decided to give it a try. It did not disappoint! I have to say that we enjoyed the BEST Bloody Mary we've ever had! Planet Rock's vodka is so smooth and with the added Bloody Mary mix combination and a piece of brisket, heaven! Service was excellent and the live music by Sharon Bourbonnais was very enjoyable also. I'm thinking we'll be back before heading home!

reviews.author: Jacqueline L.
reviews.description: Such a cute find! We bring most of our out of town guests here. Live music on the weekend, friendly staff. Near Lake Travis. Only vodka is served here FYI!

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: This place had the feel of my backyard, with a great musician, food and of course vodka infused drinks. Highly recommend. Don't forget to pet the baby cow.

reviews.author: Kendall M.
reviews.description: This place is very disrespectful to its neighbors. We asked kindly for them to keep it at a respectful noice level and they did until around 10PM on a Thursday and they started blasting it.

reviews.author: L.R. L.
reviews.description: Fun place to get the demonic alcohol that has served to drive me to ruination and lead directly to dissolution to my many human and extra terrestrial relationships.  The demon vodka is a terrible mistress that can weaken your soul, lead you astray and give you many hangovers. The prices of vice, in its many forms.  But I ask, are we to avoid the rich experience of human vice, or is this pursuing human vice that gives us meaning?  Good vodka enables the philosopher that resides in each of us.  Many adventures await us as the consequences of our choices.  Vodka is a choice. Choose wisely.

reviews.author: Karen N.
reviews.description: Just discovered this jewel near home. Great drinks and food. Fantastic service and folks.  We'll be baxk soon. Love you Catfish and Jenna!!

reviews.author: Ryan W.
reviews.description: Great bbq and some of the best infused vodka drinks I've ever had.  Music venue is the perfect size for a killer laid back Central Texas evening.  Here's my checklist for your afternoon- 1. Have a killer drink. 2. Have some killer bbq. 3. Say hi to Catfish, the master distiller. He's the one with the magnificent beard and the hearty laugh likely by the bar. 4. Pet a chicken (there are a few running around)  5. Say what's up to Moonshine, their mini zebu cow that thinks he's a dog.  Can be seen chasing squirrels or prancing around the grounds.  If you're looking for an afternoon to enjoy a perfect slice of some of the best things Central Texas has to offer, this is your spot.

reviews.author: Victoria I.
reviews.description: This is a casual venue with clean bathrooms - a total win! It really is a fantastic place were you can catch some live music. Plus, they have the best BLT infused vodka!

reviews.author: Sheldon B.
reviews.description: Owner and his wife were very entertaining and you can tell they really enjoy what they're doing.  Got a quick tour of the property and the distilling process Saturday morning.  Great product and fantastic mixed drinks, I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Stephanie W.
reviews.description: This rum is the real deal!! It's incredibly smooth on it's own but also makes some fantastic tasting cocktails. The owners are extremely friendly...you can tell they have put their hearts and souls into their distillery and it shows! Also, if you ask, they will usually be able to give you a tour of the place which is a really neat experience in itself!   If you are not typically a rum drinker, this place may very well change your mind (definitely changed mine) :)  Highly Recommend!!!

reviews.author: Joseph R.
reviews.description: Round Mountain Distilling was a great surprise. I didn't expect to be able to speak to the distiller and on top get a private tour of the facilitates for me and my friends. It's a small operation but they make some great rum and know how to make great drinks. This was an awesome place to sit and have a few drinks with friends. Mike (the owner / distiller) was a great host and his brother-in-law (part-owner) was just as welcoming.

reviews.author: Joshua H.
reviews.description: GF and I both came in at 1pm on a Saturday afternoon via a prior RSVP to meet Ron Yates himself and do a full tasting experience with him as our server. This experience was amazing!  The indoor tasting room is large and open, welcoming and chill. Adorned with many award-winning wines of theirs that number beyond what I could count.   We got front-of-house seats together and begin our tasting journey through several whites and reds and sparkling wines. After what had to be 10-12 wines, we honed our picks down to the 'cabernet claret' for my GF and the 'tandem' red for me. However, not one of the wines we tried did we both truly feel we hated or disliked. Normally 1-2 are an easy pass but frankly, every wine we had was very good. My GF prefers sweeter wines across the board so the fact that nearly every wine she had still pleased her was saying something.  Ron was a top-notch host and server for us. His passion and love for wine is all but very clear in his conviction to his craft, knowledge of wine science and methodology, history of the business origins, name creations and labels to the wine bottles... all of it is an adventure with him as the animated storyteller of his wines and how the grapy goodness in the bottle got there and what you can expect to experience when it hits your lips.  I have to mention that they host an annual chili cook-off event every last Saturday of Feb with live music, 15+ chili contenders, and wine tasting all day long. It's their most successful event to date each year. When he spoke of that I made plans to be there for that for sure!  Ron and the team have a solid handle on this wine thing that is for darn sure! We only barely looked over the vineyard grounds so next time we come back, its gonna be charcuterie board, wine and time out in the vines for sure!

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: I am working on a plan to visit all of the Hill Country wineries at some point. I purchased the Christmas Wine Passport to help me with this in December, and Spicewood was one of the vineyards I passed through. The experience was good. The facilities were beautiful, and it was a peaceful place to chill and relax. I got there shortly after opening, and there was only one other couple there, so I was able to get my tastings quickly and easily. The wines were good, especially their dry sparkling, but I was not moved to come home with anything. The selection I was offered was more heavy on bolder reds, and as a matter of preference I would rather have a good mixutre of reds and whites. Nevertheless, this wouldn't be a place I'd cross off my list. Their tempranillos were quite tasty, and I did like their dry sparkling wine.

reviews.author: Priya K.
reviews.description: So glad we stumbled upon this beautiful winery while we were visiting the horseshoe Bay Area. Walked in on Sunday afternoon, they took us without reservations. Beautiful outdoor patio seating or you can sit inside. They have 2 tasting menus to choose from for $15 each. Hubby went for the bold reds. They don't have all white tasting but our amazing server let me taste all the sparkling wines which was so fun! The sparkling Chardonnay was my favorite. Hubby's favorite was independence and tandem.  They have charcuterie boards ($25)  or you can bring your own food. We got the charcuterie board and had a great selection of cheese.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Upon arrival at this gem a couple years ago, we had our doubts. The few Texas wines we had tried were subpar in our view. Spicewood's offerings opened a whole new chapter in our wine lifestyle upon completing that first visit.  When we first entered their tasting room, we noticed a plethora of wine award medallions on display. Being a volunteer on the Houston Rodeo, I was especially pleased to see many Rodeo Houston awards. But that wasn't all - Spicewood has awards from wine contests all around the country! Hmmmmm...  As we proceeded through our tasting, we were immediately impressed. Texas wine? This good? Yes, indeed! So good, in fact, that I joined their wine club without hesitation and remain a member to this day.   We visited again yesterday and enjoyed complimentary tastings of six nice wines and picked up our wine club orders from the past couple of quarters. We sat on their patio overlooking the vineyard and remarked how we are so happy to have found this spot. Oh, and the people working here are gracious and genuinely friendly.  Spicewood is a tad off the beaten path, but definitely worth the trek.

reviews.author: Mop P.
reviews.description: Out of the way a bit but worth it. Staff treats each guest like their experience is important. We came out on a Sunday morning got a couple of tables for our family and did the $15 tasting--6 pours but all around 14% Alcohol. Most are only sold on site from what I heard.  Great for families. Nice slow pace; bring whatever food you want they welcome it.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: I've visited many Texas Hill Country vineyards and this place was just okay. Sure, the tasting is cheap but the wine was nothing to leave me desiring more. Atmosphere and scenery itself was also nothing to boast about. Sorry, not for me. Pass.

reviews.author: A E.
reviews.description: As long time Spicewood Vineyard members we always enjoy our trips to the vineyard On this visit we brought our two sons and his family for a picnic at the vineyard. Of course things were a little different with Covid going on but everything was spaced out and carefully planned out for everyone's safety. When we arrived Ron was in the porch helping the guests with their wine selections. He is always very nice and makes everyone feel at home. It's always nice when the owner with everything he has to do remembers your names. After our picnic we got to sit in the Wine Cellar which was awesome. Highly recommend visiting, enjoying the scenery and trying out all the great tasting wines.   Hats off to Ron and Crew!   Adrian and Cyndi

reviews.author: Jim F.
reviews.description: This premier Texas Vineyard has been around for 20 years now. Their customer service is excellent and their wines are some of the best in Texas.

reviews.author: Michae A.
reviews.description: This review is based on their $15 tasting menu which is a great deal for 7 wines.   We love wine and enjoy going to new areas to try tastings so was really excited to try this place based on their reviews but my husband and I were sadly disappointed.   I will say however that they do have an option for an estate tasting that goes for $30 which could be amazing but we decided to pass on it.

reviews.author: Layle M.
reviews.description: Hmm...it has taken me over a week because I hate to say something bad about someone's business. Last Monday we stopped here after a fantastic visit to Marble Falls. We felt...tolerated...at best. We were met by 3 huge dogs who barked incessantly upon our arrival and throughout the visit. When the host finally came out he didn't offer up options for the tastings like we've experienced at other wineries. I'm pretty clear on what I like and had some ideas of wines I'd like to try with the intent of buying enough bottles to make a case of assorted bottles upon departing. The owner, who has great reviews on Yelp, either wasn't there or was busy. We didn't see this person. But we pushed through the tasting, cut it a bit short, and left much, much sooner than we'd ever imagined we would. My intuition upon arrival was to just leave. We should have done that.  This is our experience. And it just wasn't pleasant. We were the only guests yet felt we were in the way.  Hopefully, for others, their visits will be more aligned with this place's other more positive reviews.

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: This vineyard has a broad range of varietals for producing their many wines.  Some are very surprising like their Tempranillo Rose, Mourvedra, Cab, and Pinot.   Since they seemed to blend grapes from outside of Texas with estate, gives their wines a different character than most I've tasted from Calif and Washington for the same grape varietal.    For non-wine items to consider, the staff is super friendly and knowledgeable, dog friendly, indoor and outdoor seating with a nice babbling brook adjacent.   They do have an event facility and would make a nice venue for any type of occasion.  They have a hearty cheese plate that won't disappoint.  I would not use the spicy cheese however.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: I was pleasantly surprised by Spicewood Vineyards.  Spicewood was originally founded by the Manigolds.  Their vision was to make wine only from estate grown grapes. They were smart when they planted their vineyard.  They analyzed the soil and only planted grape varieties that would thrive in their soil.  Nine of the original 17 acres planted by the Manigolds are still producing fruit. For Texas that means something. That means wine sourced from grapes growing on vines that are now 24 plus years old.  Ron Yates took over from the Manigolds and is now the owner of Spicewood, and with wine maker Todd Crowell is making some good Texas sourced wines.  They now have thirty two acres planted on site, and partner with other Texas grape growers.    I like that the tasting room is a bit off the common path. That means it is away from the hustle and bustle of other Hill Country wineries.  The tasting room is spacious.  It has a homey lodge like feeling that is very inviting. They also have a beautiful tree shaded outdoor space.    The staff here are like family. They are knowledgeable and friendly.  I tasted through a selection of their vast options available. I found them to be well balanced.  Surprisingly I liked their Sauvignon blanc along with other of their wines.

reviews.author: Jenn M.
reviews.description: I only put a one because it isn't there anymore. We drove 20 minutes to it and it was closed, I'm assuming. Darn.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: We love this place. Wine and service is always good. Pretty awesome place to hang out for an afternoon. They have live music sometimes also

reviews.author: Lance M.
reviews.description: My experience was a 4-5 like many of those you will see here. However, our lovely day was ruined when one of the resident dogs or a customer's dog charged us aggressively while I was walking with my 10 month old baby in my arms. I cannot be sure if it was a resident dog or a guest's dog, but it was one of the gray colored Blue Lacey's).  Regardless, the dog was unprovoked by us. I had to hand my baby to my wife while I tried to protect them from this aggressive dog, hair bristled up and darting in at me aggressively as if to bite. Luckily it didn't bite us. The dogs owner chastised me for reacting strongly in defense of my wife and baby, which really frustrated me. We immediately left and I will not be returning. I wanted to post this in case a child is attacked by a dog on their premises in the future. It is documented and the owners have been informed that their aggressive dog or lack of leash laws are creating a liability and awful experience.

reviews.author: Sherry W.
reviews.description: This is better wine and value compared to Stone house winery.  It is $10 for seven tastings and only one wine was not from Texas. They have indoor and outdoor seating. There is no view at this vineyard. Staff is friendly. There was a friendly house dog wandering around.  They have t shirts for sale.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: The Good Guy. Wow. It's an excellent red wine. It's smooth and tasty. It's not cheap. It's $42. I couldn't care less. I'll pay for wine as long as it's delicious and this one is fabulous. I like the patio outside. You can bring your dog and  kids if you'd like. The ambience inside and out is relaxing and fun. It's an excellent place to chill out with loved ones. I'll be back.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: I'm badly remiss in not posting a positive review for almost a year; what's more this is one of my personal favorite wineries in Texas Hill Country.  It's time I corrected this.   Spicewood has one of my personal favorite tasting rooms; while on the inside it's nothing special, the outside grounds and seating mimic an upscale, modern country house that I could see myself living in (*cough cough* once I win the lottery *cough cough*).  There's also a cool little stream they have running through the place so you can hear the sound of running or falling water when you sit to have a sip.  Nice touch.  Spicewood's won a bunch of awards for various wines but the two standouts IMO are their 2013 Syrah and their Riesling, which has a fruity taste and a magnificent green-apple crisp bouquet.  Note: As of May 2016, their site does not show the Riesling for sale, so I'd call ahead if you want to taste it.  As an added bonus, it's only 10 minutes away from It's All Good and Opie's, both of whom have some of my favorite BBQ outside the Austin area.

reviews.author: Bob P.
reviews.description: Great place.  We enjoyed a really nice Cabernet while sitting in comfortable armchairs; it felt like we were sitting in someone's living room, and we had a great time.  Not only will we be back there soon, but we bought wine to take home, a bottle of which I will be having this very night.

reviews.author: Carrie H.
reviews.description: Spicewood vineyards is a very sweet place just off the road in Spicewood. The staff is very friendly, the facility is very clean, and the wines are superb! Our sommelier was such good conversation!  Great events space as well!

reviews.author: Sarita S.
reviews.description: This was a surprise bday gift and it didn't disappoint! Mike was awesome and friendly...took us to some really great spots and on gave us the grand tour through texas hill country! definitely the best way to go if you want to experience the best of the best! well done!!

reviews.author: Ana R.
reviews.description: Definitely recommend! From our initial inquiry to the tour itself they were so accommodating and flexible! I filled out an inquiry form and then was contacted right away. We booked a private tour for a couples trip. Alee was great in providing suggestions and making sure to fit what we wanted as part of the tour. We got to tour Hawk's Shadow, then had a tasting at Duchman and ended our tour with some delicious BBQ from Salt Lick, next to Salt Lick Cellars. Tom, our driver was so nice and flexible with our schedule. He reminded us of how much time we had but did not feel rushed at all. We'll definitely be booking Slowpokes for any future trips!

reviews.author: Alan A.
reviews.description: Amazing tour, Michael was a great host. He was so attentive and helped in every way. The tour was flexible and very fun. The children, 4 and 9, were entertained also. Michael asked many questions as to ensure the experience was what we wanted. Great time thank you so much.  Alan A US Army Ret.

reviews.author: Ana K.
reviews.description: Amazing wine tour. Our group was small but it was perfect. Linda really took care of us and was so much fun. You really need to check it out if you are looking at wine tours.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: This was soooo much fun! We did this for a bachelorette party and we had a blast! Lindsey was our Tour Guide/Bus Driver/Photographer/DJ/New Bestie! She was AMAZING!!!! I would highly recommend this Tour! We did Deep Eddie, Last Stand Brewing Company and Treaty Oak!

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: Linda was fantastic and this wine tour was great! I was with a bunch of rather rowdy girl friends and she was endlessly patient and took good care of us. We had a great time and I recommend this company!

reviews.author: Deryck Z.
reviews.description: Linda is the best!!!! We did a tour for a bachelorette party and it was prefect. The personal touch Linda added made it so wonderful. She provide a very nice lunch and snack trays. Everything about the tour went so smoothly and was planned our perfectly. We even were picked up at our rental house so no one had to drive after drinking. All the girls on the tour said they would defiantly do another tour with Slowpokes Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Thu F.
reviews.description: We have an annual girls trip and decided on a tour with Slowpokes Wine Tours.  There was a total of 8 girls on the tour with a couple that was paired with us and we were the perfect group.  Linda was the best tour guide anyone can ask for.  Our group had a blast and the lunch was an added bonus on the tour!  She kept us informed along the way and gave us the best details of each winery/distillery that we visited.  Linda was very personable and every location we visited had its own special charm!  Thanks for an amazing tour Slowpokes Wine Tours.

reviews.author: Kathy F.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a wonderful day set up by Linda at Slowpokes.  After talking with her she designed a day that was diverse and showed us a number of new things in the Dripping Springs area.  Our day included several of the high country wineries, one brewery and a visit to the quaint town of Wimberly. We highly recommend this group over  other Austin wine tour groups as they create a very personalized day and made sure everyone enjoyed the stops.   Our day started with lunch at Homespuns in Dripping Springs - excellent start to a beautiful day!  The Bloody Marys are highly recommended.

reviews.author: Brit F.
reviews.description: We recently completed a bachelorette party tour with Lindsey as our tour guide and it was the BEST! Lindsey chose our wineries very wisely; we started with lunch at Crowson (whose owner will drop incredible knowledge on you), enjoyed a rainstorm and a glass of red at the beautiful Ron Yates, and ended with cheese and BOOOOM wine at Hye Meadow Winery. It was lovely day of booze, conversation, and sisterhood. And, yes, we loved Lindsey so much she became a part of our wolfpack. Lindsey was fun, energetic, and knowledgeable about the area. I would definitely do this tour again!

reviews.author: April D.
reviews.description: I decided to surprise my mom with a wine tasting tour for her 60th birthday. Linda went above and beyond to make this tour special. She made a wine bottle with me and my moms photo on it with a sweet birthday message and quote.  She took so many photos of us, and really made us feel special. We were able to choose our wineries and she even picked us up and dropped us off at our BNB. She had the most amazing tapas tray, with cheese, mixed nuts, her special dip, crackers, breads and meats. She had this prepared and sat out for us at Wimberly winery,  halfway through the tour. At the end of this stop, she even had cupcakes for my moms birthday. I had actually called around different wine tours in the area and Slow Poke Wine tours offered the best value and I can tell you now, the best service. We wouldn't hesitate to do it again. This trip with my mom was priceless and so special. I thank you Linda for making an amazing memory for my mom and I.

reviews.author: Amanda W.
reviews.description: We used Slowpokes tour for my bachelorette party, Linda was great, she picked us up at the door of our rental house and had a perfect day planned for us. We went to a beautiful winery to begin and enjoyed a lunch spread while there; then we went to a distillery with AMAZING frozen mint juleps, outdoor games and great scenic views; finally we ended at the olive oil and balsamic producer for more snacks and great wine. Linda was very attentive to us and did a great job of keeping us on schedule without rushing us, she picked us up around 10:30AM and we returned around 4:30PM. Hope to enjoy this tour again in the future, a very diverse experience that I think even the guys would enjoy!

reviews.author: Mandy L.
reviews.description: I recently went on a bachelorette party with 9 girls with Slowpokes Wine Tours. It was absolutely perfect. Linda was so sweet and incredibly helpful. We didn't have to worry about anything! As soon as Linda picked us up she took care of everything. We just walked in and started having fun. She went above and beyond to make our day perfect.

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: Wow!  What a fantastic time!  Linda was on time, knowledgeable, NICE, funny, and showered us with attention.  She had everything taken care of - all we had to do is get off the van, taste wines and get back on again for the next stop. What service!  I highly, highly recommend Slowpokes and will definitely be seeing Linda again!

reviews.author: Julie G.
reviews.description: I could have sworn I wrote a review on here prior, but I JUST WENT ON MY SECOND slowpoke wine tour and it was just as wonderful as the first.  While a small group, Linda and Dave do an outstanding job of making everyone feel comfortable, no matter what the group size.  This time we went to 3 different venues and what a great experience.  They don't miss any detail.  They make the day enjoyable and relaxing.  Looking for the best wine tour in the Hill Country?  Look no further.  Slowpokes is the tour to book!

reviews.author: Trey C.
reviews.description: I used Slowpokes Winery Tours to go on a Hill Country wine tour on the day I got engaged, and I could not have asked for a better experience.  My now fiancée and I rode in the Model T Ford, which was all-original except for the brakes. I contacted Linda with any questions, concerns, and booking, and Linda picked up my fiancée in a Mercedes van.  We went to a great breakfast, and then David drove us around in the Model T Ford. The route was scenic, breathe taking, and beautiful.  The wineries we stopped at were great, and, the customer service from Linda and David was unbeatable.  They have a unique business that is more than just a van or limo driving you around to distilleries, breweries, or wineries (although they also have a Mercedes van option).  I am now going on another tour with them for a bachelor party, and they could not have provided more prompt replies to my requests for information related to travel, pick up at different locations, types of tours they offer, and pricing.  What a great business run by some truly nice and professional people who offer very reasonable pricing.  I plan to use their services again in the future.

reviews.author: Kristoffer K.
reviews.description: From pick up, to drop off the experience was phenomenal! Spacious, clean, and comfortable. An unplanned stop to provide a bathroom break before arriving at our destination was provided upon our request and was greatly appreciated. We ended up losing one of our group and our Driver allowed us to wait and look for them. Additionally, a phone was lost in the furniture and again our Driver provided concern, patience, and assistance in order to retrieve the seemingly stuck device. I have now ridden with this service three times and every time has been beyond excellent.

reviews.author: Julia F.
reviews.description: We used ThunderDome over this past Memorial Day Weekend and had a fantastic experience. Daniel was incredible to work with. He was quick to provide a quote and answer any questions leading up to our trip, and was early to pick us up. 38 of us fit comfortably in the 40 person bus along with all of our belongings. The bus was clean, speakers were great, and Daniel truly went above and beyond for our group. We'll definitely be using ThunderDome for all of our future trips!

reviews.author: Traci S.
reviews.description: Daniel was awesome!  Right from the start he was quick to respond with a quote, details, etc.  Easy to work with and has the little extras like coolers, ice, waters, etc. that went above and beyond.  He was prompt, professional, a safe driver, accommodating and just an overall solid guy.  Would highly recommend for a group large or small!

reviews.author: Kristie L.
reviews.description: AMAZINGGGGG SERVICE! We looked into several party buses around the Austin area and compared quotes. Daniel beat everyone's price AND provided ice and cups when that didn't even cross our minds! THANK YOU THUNDERDOME SO MUCH FROM CAPITOL CHEVY! Definitely using your services in the future! The whole process was smooth, and overall satisfying!

reviews.author: Caitlyn L.
reviews.description: ThunderDome Party Bus was great - Daniel was knowledgeable, friendly and super easy to work with. Couldn't recommend him/ThunderDome enough!

reviews.author: Monika G.
reviews.description: I have used Daniel and ThunderDome Party Bus two years in a row and they are awesome! They're communication is reliable and fast. The morning of, he always calls to let you know he is on time and ask if there are any last minute questions. I've recommended his bus to all of my friends. Everyone has always enjoyed their experience!

reviews.author: Brielle A.
reviews.description: Probably the best quote I got in Austin, especially since the cost included everything we needed! They were even able to make two drop off locations for our party which was really awesome! My friends loved the inside of the bus and we had a great night out, will definitely use again in the future!

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: ThunderDome was awesome! Tony arrived on time and supplied exactly what we were told. He even helped us set up the Bluetooth system for us to play our music. The bus was clean, cool, and ready to party! We took it to a river float for my bachelorette party and it was perfect. Tony even stopped on the way home for a bathroom break. I will definitely book with ThunderDome the next time I need a party bus.

reviews.author: Christa E.
reviews.description: My group of 16 had an amazing time on the Thunderdome Party Bus! Daniel was super accommodating, easy to work with, and a genuinely nice guy. I highly recommend this company for your next group night out. Tip: Go ahead and book an extra hour to whatever you think you'll need - you won't want to get off at the end of the night, it's that much fun!

reviews.author: Maggie S.
reviews.description: We wanted to book a party bus to do a distillery tour. I did not have a lot of information on the distilleries and Daniel was incredibly helpful when figuring out where we should go. We had 19 people on the bus and we had SO much fun. The bus was super clean, Daniel was great and we had the best time. We originally had the bus for 5 hours but Daniel was nice enough to let us add an additional hour to our trip for just a small charge. I would recommend ThunderDome Party Bus to anyone.   We definitely want to plan another trip in the summertime to go floating.  Thanks Daniel!!!

reviews.author: Angelie E.
reviews.description: I booked thunderdome party bus to take a big group of us to float the river. The bus was on time, and even made accommodations to pick up a second group at a different stop. The bus itself was spacious and clean, and everyone had an awesome time! Once we were done floating, the bus conveniently picked us up at the exit of the river. I would highly recommend Thunderdome for big group parties.

reviews.author: Martin G.
reviews.description: This review is long overdue.  I booked the Thunderdome Party Bus for a bachelor party back in May 2017.  The bus was perfect!! Seated our group of 15 comfortably.  The stereo system was bumping, and Daniel, our amazing driver, had no issue with us turning it up to 11.  Our group was most guys in their 30's and Daniel gave us good recommendations on spots to check out that were age appropriate.  In between spots, Daniel drove me to a gas station to help me restock on beer. He even came in and helped me carry and load beers into the coolers.  Great communicate from Daniel from beginning to end, and he someone found the perfect spot to pick us up on busy Rainey St at the end of the night.   Great value and great experience.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Ayca U.
reviews.description: Great wines selection to try from, all gluten free.  Friendly service and highly recommend the charcuterie and cheese - great presentation   Clean and well kept Must try

reviews.author: Ria G.
