reviews.description: I'd give this place 5 stars for the interior and overall vibe, but only 3 stars because we were a bit disappointed with the wine itself.   The atmosphere is lively with board games and great decor inside, and a food truck and lots of picnic tables outside for large groups.   However, my group ordered 2 different red wines and 1 sparkling white wine and felt that the wines were lacking in flavor and very watery. Maybe this is how Austin wine is, but if you're looking for deeper, richer flavored wine, I would go somewhere else.

reviews.author: Aditi P.
reviews.description: 10/10 holistically on this place. Everything from wine, environment and experience were on point. We had a group of girls in for a bachelorette and the service did not disappoint. The owners have an amazing story telling ability when it comes to their wine. The ambiance of interiors down to the charcuterie presentation is all thoughtful.

reviews.author: Sametra B.
reviews.description: Pretty laid back spot. A nice spot to grab a quick glass of wine with a friend or 2. For a locally ran winery, I'd say it's worth going for sure. The menu selection for cheese variations are subpar. We did try some octopus and squid, which was an interesting discussion over some glasses of wine. You can only imagine how these convos went lol! All in all, I highly recommend stopping in for an interesting glass or two. Cheers to more wine!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Ok so I accompanied my boyfriend to the brewery and distillery nearby, so of course we had to stop for the obligatory glass of wine for me.  I was not going to get any snacks, but their cheese and charcuterie board was calling my name.  We both got the tasting. Each of us got different wines. Our favs were the Tempranillo, Grenache and spaghetti western. You can get all your wines at once or one at a time. I suggest getting them all at once because staff can get busy.  The cheese and charcuterie board paired well with our wines and it was definitely the perfect snack. Loved the cheese selection. The bread sprinkled with olive oil made my day cause who doesn't love bread They have inside and outside seating available. Parking is onsite, but shared with other businesses.

reviews.author: Dana L.
reviews.description: Went to Austin for a short solo trip and what a nice surprise. This place was so cool and chill. The service was great, the tables were well spread out, the flight and snacks did not disappoint.   I had the:  Friends with Benefits Opening Ceremony Gerwuz  Vermentino   All a selection of whites and sweets.   I would highly recommend this place to get a taste of Austin and also enjoy a quiet spot.

reviews.author: Stefany W.
reviews.description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was just a nice place to relax, drink some wine and read a book which is exactly what I did. I came with a friend and we enjoyed trying all the various wine they had to offer.   They also apparently had a monthly oyster pop up which was fun. I ended up ordering some and they were delicious! Highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Krystle U.
reviews.description: My partner and I first found their wine at Travis Heights Wine and Spirits and fell in love w the malbec, so we decided to visit the winery. The first time we came here, they had a private event going on so that was sad. The second time, we got here a few hours early so they hadn't opened - that's our fault. Finally, our third attempt was fruitful!  The service here is super chill and on top of things. We 2 flights so we got to taste a good variety of samples. Great pours. We ended up leaving w one of their best bottles and now we're saving it for a special occasion.   We got (ranked from 'pour me another' to meh): *Violet Crown *Tempranillo Nuevo *Vermentino *Red-Nat *Picpoul *Piquette - this seems to be a star here but we personally hated it - tasted a bit like dilute pickle juice  A bottle we had before coming to this place was their Hill Country Rosso and that's still my favorite.  As far as COVID safety goes, the tables are super spread out, the staff wears masks at all times, and everything seems clean.   This place is super cool and what seems to be a hidden gem.

reviews.author: Jenni N.
reviews.description: Very cute tasting room within an industrial area. You would not think there would be a place like this there. The Yard is the location and they have several business including this winery, a distillery, a brewery, and a few other places. The wine was good and the cheese and charcuterie board was a good size. I'd like to give 5 stars, but we had to ask for napkins, no plates given either. It was also a bit messy inside. Not sure if they were re-organizing or what. But friendly staff, good wine, and cute space! I recommend a stop in!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I stopped here to enjoy some new wine and some pizza from Lil Nonna's. I made reservations on the way there. During the 'rona, it is recommended to ensure you can get a spot.   My hubby and I did a wine flight a piece. We tried all the reds, the rose, and white wine (Vermentino). We ended up buying a bottle of Malbec to take home which we both had enjoyed. Note, the staff was very knowledgeable and helpful.   I really like the atmosphere of the winery as it is inside a warehouse where they make their own wine and buy their grapes. The winery has a few things to eat or you can buy pizza from Lil Nonna's. The pizza takes awhile but you can always purchase online and set a date. If you are done at the winery you can also bar hope in the area for beer, cocktails, and whiskey.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: It's simple, if you're not pretentious and you like natural wine, you'll enjoy this place. Industrial spot located in the Yard, great natural lighting and some benches outside for the big groups. A truly gorgeous selection with some fantastic small plates as well- tinned seafood, quality cheeses and bread, etc. Always an enjoyable time.

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: We each ordered flights. The staff was knowledgeable, quick, and polite which made the experience even better!

reviews.author: Alec B.
reviews.description: Awesome winery, love that it's so close to the city. All the staff was super friendly and knowledgeable about the wine selection. They had several really good wines, my favorites were the Violet Crown and GSM.

reviews.author: Mike L.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our visit here,  the staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  A must visit when near b Austin.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Star service and a non-judgmental space. I dig you, Austin Winery!  We decided on Austin Winery after we had plans to go to Spokesman next door for some beers. Unfortunately, Spokesman had an event going on that looked a little noisy and full for our study date, hence the change in venues. The winery was very spacious and lofty--I love that in an industrial winery! We asked if we could move a table (to plug in to their only one outlet--score!) and do some computer work with their wifi. The gal at the tasting room was fantastically wonderful. She gave us a large smile and told us to do whatever we wanted. Wonderful service alone will get me to come back. That's for sure.  We each got a flight of wine to try, and got down to it until they closed. They have a good selection of whites, rose's and reds, so fret not friends. All is provided. They also have some light bites like cheeses and charcuteries, so you can definitely go with that if you're hungry. The tastings were a little pricey compared to what you might get at a wine tasting out in the vineyards (I used to work in the industry), but you're paying for the convenience of being in South Austin and lots of space to hold conversations, play board games and just be with your groups. They have loads of seating and an upstairs area (that a Bachelorette party was using). Restrooms are clean and wifi is strong. We also walked home with some Brose (a hilarious take on rose especially because it was a women-lead winery effort). Clean, classy and airy space.

reviews.author: Kan C.
reviews.description: Cute place. Not a huge fan of the wines but the food was great.  Will try again ! Maybe my pallet was off

reviews.author: Hailey W.
reviews.description: Very cool industrial spot. Lots of good wine options and there was a food truck. Good spot to visit during covid due to availability of outdoor seating

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: This place has a great vibe and both indoor and outdoor seating.  The staff are friendly and knowledgeable.  Lil' Nonna's pizza truck is right outside of the door and has fantastic pizza - try the VBR!  The bummer is they only have Texas wines and I am not a fan.  I tried 5 different options and truly am not a fan.  I would love if they had other options.

reviews.author: Jeannine K.
reviews.description: Cool facility but overpriced with impatient staff that seemed unwilling to give any info on their wines.

reviews.author: Amy F.
reviews.description: Liked sitting outside to distance, but the benches were a little rickety. The inside had a great vibe - hope to come back when it's safer to be out and about!

reviews.author: Susan B.
reviews.description: We did a private wine tour for my daughters 30th birthday and had a wonderful time.  Winding Road was accommodating and made excellent picks and recommendations for us.  They planned out all the logistics and kept us on track.  I would highly recommend this company!

reviews.author: Tammy B.
reviews.description: Jaston was so cheerful, professional, polite, knowledgeable and fun!! Katie put together a fabulous charcuterie tray that was such a nice touch mid tour!! We will definitely book another tour when back in the area!!

reviews.author: Polly M.
reviews.description: This was an amazing experience. Katie and Jaston are beyond accommodating to make the trip great. They have access to great vineyards, distilleries, and breweries. Will definitely be using them again in the future!

reviews.author: Michelle S.
reviews.description: This was our first time exploring wineries and our driver and guide Jaston was the absolute best! He was very knowledgeable about the areas and wineries. The places he chose for us were top notch and we will definitely use Winding Road again!

reviews.author: Maria D.
reviews.description: This was such a wonderful experience ! My second time coming . Our driver Austin is amazing I gotta give him "kudos " for being so patient with the crowds aNF being so graceful. The owners are amazing as well .  They are always truing to make things right if you feel a slight bit unhappy.  The tours were well worth it.  Every time I go I'm never disappointed. The  service is impeccable. There are three stops very rewarding and very well thought out and put together and the winery stops are spread out Enough to enjoy each place .

reviews.author: Thaddeus B.
reviews.description: This was a great experience, can't imagine touring with anyone else in the Hill Country.  Katie and Jaston extended every effort to fit everyone's plans together and were great communicating the plans and ensuring everyone was happy.  Done tours previously, but not had as much fun as this trip.  They have access to the good and interesting vineyards, in an area where new places pop up daily it seems.  The bus was comfortable, the ride was smooth, and the mood was great.  They have earned our business.

reviews.author: Leticia E.
reviews.description: Had a great time in Fredericksburg! The complimentary personal charcuterie tray was a very nice addition to the tour. The Winding Road bus is nice, clean, and well prepared for any weather (blankets, umbrellas, and water). I highly recommend Winding Road Wine Tours, and I will definitely be using their services again.

reviews.author: Kara G.
reviews.description: Best wine tour ever! My girlfriends and I booked a wine tour for my birthday. The owner, Katie, is beyond sweet! She made sure everything was perfect for us and we got the experience we were looking for. She even went out of her way to give me a list of fun things to do in the area since we aren't local. Jaston, our driver, was awesome! He was our photographer, server, driver, anything we needed he made sure we got it. We definitely will be using Winding Road Wine Tours in the future!

reviews.author: Mark W.
reviews.description: Wow, What an  incredible time my wife and I spent last Saturday touring the Texas wine country with the help of Katie from Winding Road Wine Tours. Her knowledge of the area was impressive.  We are already planning our next trip. Thanks Katie!

reviews.author: Kathy W.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful time with Jaston on the wine tour. Katie was integral in helping plan our event. She even made a guest appearance at the end of trip. We loved every minute of it. Thanks for helping us put together the perfect Hill Country Wine Tour. We look forward to many more.

reviews.author: J A.
reviews.description: We had an awesome time with Jaston! He was very knowledgeable, accommodating and explained all aspects of of the tour. The bus was comfortable and super clean. We highly recommend this tour! Thanks Jaston!!

reviews.author: Becky D.
reviews.description: Just had an amazing wine tour with Jaston and Winding Road Wine Tours! Very accommodating, took all the pictures we asked and was very knowledgeable. Would recommend to anyone wanting to spend the day in wine country!

reviews.author: Katie O.
reviews.description: BEST WINE TOUR EVER! Billy is so acccomodating and thoughtful. The wineries that were on the tour had amazing wine and atmospheres. Most certainly  would tour with them again!

reviews.author: Adam S.
reviews.description: My wife and I took this tour and really enjoyed it. A relaxing afternoon in the hill country tasting delicious wines. Billy was a wonderful tour guide.

reviews.author: Jerry S.
reviews.description: Absolutely great trip!  Visited 3 vineyards and all 3 were phenomenal!  Billy with WR tours was a wonderful host!  100% recommend Winding Road Wine Tours!  His bus is very comfortable and very roomy!  And he knows a great deal about the wines!!  Will definitely come back to Wimberley and use Winding Road!!!!!!

reviews.author: Heather T.
reviews.description: Awesome day and Billy was a great  driver and organized everything perfectly.  We would love to do this again!!

reviews.author: Lori C.
reviews.description: We had a great time today with Billy.  A great time with friends for a bachelorette party. Wonderful safe driving, good food and wine!

reviews.author: Paula B.
reviews.description: This is a wonderful wine tour with Billy in the Texas Hill Country. Billy was on time, friendly and very knowledgeable! There were 7 of us on a family vacation trip and we wanted to have a fun but classy wine tour where we got our money's worth and then some. As a new resident to the area, it's important for me to know what high quality tour guides are available. Well, Winding Road Hill Country Wine Tours with Billy is definitely the way to go, folks.

reviews.author: Don M.
reviews.description: Looking to experience great Hill Country wines and barbecue - we had both taking Winding Road Wine Tours Salt Lick Sunday Wine Tour.  The tour picked us up in Gruene in a new luxury bus at 10:30. We were greeted by the tour owner Billy Martin.  The bus was very comfortable with a u shaped seating arrangement and a table in the aisle.  Should seat around 12 people comfortably. The bus has a great sound system that is Bluetooth enabled - Billy played whatever we wanted from sources such as Pandora and Napster music service. First stop was Driftwood Estate Winery. Driftwood has perhaps the best winery views in the Hill Country.  I really enjoyed the reds and came away with a bottle of Longhorn Red to enjoy at our next stop Salt Lick Barbecue. Yes, Salt Lick is byob. It was beginning to rain and Billy dropped us off near the check in stand. He's thought of his customer's needs providing us large golf umbrellas. It was busy with people waiting to be seated. However, he got us seated right away. Our final two wineries were Fall Creek right across the street from Salt Lick and then Wimberley Valley Winery. Fall Creek has solid wines and the service for our group was outstanding. Wimberley Valley Winery was an unexpected pleasure. Their tasting room is roomy and comfortable with plenty room at the tasting bars and a comfortable seating area facing a large stone fireplace. They have a variety of wines bottled on site along with other wines from around the world. The grounds were spectacular with numerous large shaded decks to enjoy a glass or bottle as you wrap up your tour.  What a great Sunday drinking Texas wines, eating Texas barbecue and meeting new friends!

reviews.author: Jaimie M.
reviews.description: Absolutely 5 star experience! Billy was a great host and we all had a blast celebrating our friend's bachelorette party. The bus is extremely accommodating with a great sound system, places for drinks and COLD a/c! (Which was great for the warm weather outside). We had an absolute blast! Thank you so much for taking such great care of us!

reviews.author: Terri P.
reviews.description: Clint was a total professional and a wonderful driver.  At our first stop he ordered a different vehicle so everyone felt more comfortable.  What a surprise when he told us!  Didn't see that coming.  Three great tastings with good friends.  Discovered some very nice 2015 Texas wines.  The grapes have matured immensely since 2008 and glad to finally enjoy some good Texas wines.   Can't recommend this company any lower than *****!  Thank you Discovery Wine Tours for a memorable afternoon.

reviews.author: Carlin L.
reviews.description: Used Discover Texas Wine Tours for a 30th birthday. John, our driver, was wonderful. He called me a couple of days before to introduce himself and to confirm the pickup details. He also called me the day of and was on time. He made sure we were settled at each location and made it a great experience. Felt very safe - John wore a mask the whole time. Also, Kathie helped plan the itinerary. She's familiar with the wineries and distilleries in the area, and was very friendly. Couldn't recommend them more!

reviews.author: Lori M.
reviews.description: A.wonderdul time, from reservation phone call to driving away from the limo.once the 6.5 hour tour ended.  John was our driver...we knew from the get-go we were in good hands.  Discover Wine chose the wineries for us and all were unique, fun and obviously tasty (as was the restaurant they selected).  We'll be back!

reviews.author: Lynlee S.
reviews.description: Our driver John was amazing!!! Very sweet and professional. Gave excellent service and ensured my group of 2 had a great time at each location we choose. Booking with the owner Kathy was easy and she ensured the whole private tour experience was exactly what we wanted. Could not have had a better time!!! John the drive wore a mask the whole time and gave us a detailed tour of town while he drove! Excellent and safe driver. Perfect perfect perfect! Thank you!! If you want an intimate experience with lots of sights and great food and drink, chose this company to take you!!!!!

reviews.author: Lindsey H.
reviews.description: I was so impressed with this tour the first time we booked that I had to book it for another party! Well, this time it wasn't as impressive. I don't know if the business has just gotten bigger than the owners can handle but communication was subpar. It took several calls and emails to get answers sometimes.   At our first tour, Kathie took tons of photos and would pose us at the wineries. This tour, we had to prompt her. It was a cloudy day so not the best for outdoor pics but I was disappointed we took most of them ourselves or had to ask her to take the pictures.   Our tour was April 11, it is now almost 2 mths later I haven't received the few pictures we took. I emailed twice and have finally heard back that the SD is apparently not working. I'm not sure why I had to email to find this out, seems like this info should have been divulged as soon as the problem presented itself.   I hate to downgrade the star review but my second time with this company just wasn't as epic as the initial tour I took with them. The wineries all seem to love this company though.

reviews.author: Jessica C.
reviews.description: I would recommend you take your money elsewhere. The owner Cathy is the rudest person to deal with  and doesn't know manners or customer service. She is unprofessional and just straight out rude. Highly suggest on another place to go to.

reviews.author: Barbara H.
reviews.description: We had a small group of three, but did it right with a Discover Texas Wine Tour limousine. DTWT was very accommodating, scheduled the wineries we wanted to see, ordered the lunches, and then confirmed our selections a couple of days prior to our tour. At the last minute after visiting with a couple in our third stop, we changed our fourth stop to a different winery. Jason (our driver) was happy to accomodate us. My only regret is that we didn't choose a few wineries a little further out of town, so we could spend more time in the limo listening to our Willie Nelson songs. Jason was awesome, and I highly recommend this tour.

reviews.author: Vicki C.
reviews.description: We started researching half-day wine tours for my BFF's bachelorette party several months in advance and chose this company because of its good reviews and cancellation policy (full refund up to 7 days in advance).   First, the bad news. The booking process is way more arduous than it should be. My initial discussion about the tour plans happened over the phone, so I asked for a written, e-mail confirmation of what we had discussed - specifically how the deposit and refund policies work. It took me more than three weeks to get that first e-mail confirmation of our booking and deposit payment. I then went back and forth, back and forth, back and forth with the company, hammering out the details, like setting a pickup location and our choices for the winery stops. Many times, three weeks would pass and I'd have to make multiple attempts before I would get a response to my e-mails. Sometimes, the responses would be incomplete and we'd repeat the process of trying to get information confirmed. Seriously a pain for an experience that costs $129 per person.   Now, the good news. The online payment portal for each attendee was a breeze to use and eliminated the need to handle money all through one person. As for the actual tour itself, we couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our driver, Bobby, was on time and wonderful on the day of the tour. He was funny and polite and had good knowledge of the area. Also, very importantly, he was a good and safe driver! The Mercedes bus we took was very clean and spacious, and they provided water, cups and napkins. They also allowed us to bring our own food onto the bus. The three wineries we visited, Driftwood Estate, Duchman and Fall Creek, were all accommodating and fun. The views were lovely and we never felt rushed and made it back on time. It was raining when we got back to our car, and Bobby was so nice and helped us get our stuff back into our car in the pouring rain.   All in all, despite a wonderful wine tour, I'm not sure I would recommend this company, only because I spent way too much time hounding them throughout the booking process. While the wine was excellent, I NEEDED to drink after dealing with their horrible communication. Discover Texas Wines should strongly consider re-evaluating their communication practices and hire more people to keep up with the demand for their service. It's the only way they will stay competitive in the long-run!

reviews.author: Tara K.
reviews.description: We had an excellent experience with Discover Texas Wine. Kathie was wonderful to coordinate with, and took care of all our tour requests. Howard was a great driver and had fun music. Lunches were very tasty. Would definitely recommend for any bachelorette party.

reviews.author: Abby S.
reviews.description: We had the BEST time today on a wine tour for a bachelorette!! "Magic Mike" was the best driver and so much fun. Very reasonable price for the amount of time we spent, and an awesome car. Thank you!!!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: We booked a wine tour to Dripping Springs for my bachelorette party. It was so great! Our driver, Roy, is what made it all so wonderful! I would highly recommend him!! He took lots of photos for us and kept us cool with cups of water.  We went to Driftwood Estate (beautiful views and grounds), Duchman family winery (beautiful Tuscan architecture), and Driftwood (had the best wines!). We did a half day and it was the perfect amount of time.   Couldn't have been any better! Thanks Roy!!!

reviews.author: Cyn H.
reviews.description: Had a great time on my stretch limo wine tour.  Hawk's Shadow was the favorite of the wineries we visited.  Bobby was our driver. Polite and helpful and knew to not be too chatty. Made our wine tour effortless and fun. An event to remember!

reviews.author: Carly J.
reviews.description: Wonderful private winery tour with Amanda.  So much fun!  Amanda was awesome and knowledgeable.  We had a great time!

reviews.author: Calley N.
reviews.description: We used this company for  a bachelorette weekend the company was extremely hard to work with. Communication with the company was extremely difficult. However, Mike (magic mike) completely turned a ruined weekend around. He was so nice and fun he sang to us and played guitar. I have never met a more generous and kind person. It might take you sending 3 emails to get responses from the company but definitely use Mike for your tour!

reviews.author: Kate E.
reviews.description: First off our driver, Roy, was the absolute best! He picked us up on time, was incredibly friendly, and funny even though we were a bachelorette party and knowing the possibility of it getting crazy with 7 girls. Seriously, request Roy. He made the trip a blast. There was cold water for us in the bus. Oh did I mention it's a Mercedes bus? Super nice! An AUX cable was available to play our own music too. The selection of wineries was amazing, perfect mixture between red and whites/dry and sweet, so every one of us could have something tasty. The drive was beautiful and not too far out of Austin. Overall, I am very impressed with this tour and the wonderful employees. Would definitely go again.

reviews.author: Jessica J.
reviews.description: I booked a Discover Texas Wine Tour last weekend for a Bachelorette Party. It was amazing! We had such a great time despite the somewhat unpleasant weather. Noel was so great and answered any questions we had before the tour. He was so accommodating and recommended some great wineries to us! I would definitely book with them again and recommend them to friends!!

reviews.author: Becca R.
reviews.description: Held an event with Discover Texas Wine Tour for my business and wanted to thank them again for a wonderful day. We booked this as part of a fundraiser/auction and it was such a success. The bus was wonderful, the driver was great and everything was timed perfectly. Highly recommend Discover Texas Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Dominique S.
reviews.description: Absolutely do not recommend using this company. I made the reservation back in January, gave my card for deposit and was told I'd be emailed a link for everyone to pay. Over the next two months I called and emailed asking about the link so my friends could pay their part and I was repeatedly told they were having issues. Okay fine, no big deal- I also emailed again saying we can just pay the day of if the link wasnt working and never received a response. The day before our tour, as I was driving from Dallas to Fredericksburg I get a call from Some guy at the company and he seemed very annoyed with me saying no one had paid yet. Um.. I'm sorry I didn't realize you finally sent it after months of my asking. (He had sent it the day before calling me to tell me no one had paid) The vehicle I requested was not the one that showed up. The driver Julia was late bc she did not write the address down correctly. We also had 3 girls cancel last minute, so we were down to 5 instead of 8. Considering there minimum is 5 I wasn't expecting that to be a problem but Julia felt the need to bring it up multiple Times as if it caused some inconvenience for her. Rude people, horrible communication.

reviews.author: Kyle D.
reviews.description: We had a great time on our full day tour! None of our group had been to the Texas wine trail, and our Driver Roy was absolutely spot on picking our 4 stops. Roy was a true gentleman and really took good care of our group all day long, making this a truly great experience. Noel was very helpful in booking us, even with a last minute addition to our party. I will be using these guys again in the future, and would recommend anyone who is looking for a first time trip to do the same.

reviews.author: Holly T.
reviews.description: What a fantastic time! Organizing a full day wine tour for 50 people in the Texas Hill Country may not sound like an easy task, but Noel at Discover Texas Wine Tours made it smooth and most importantly, unforgettable. His main goal is to make sure everyone is comfortable and has a good time! Most companies were not able to host a group this size, but Noel made it happen. He made sure our bus was the best he could find, worked to have a lunch catered for us at one of the stops, set up private tastings with many of the wineries to accommodate a group our size, even stopped to let one of the guys who didn't drink wine buy some beer. I can't say enough good things about Noel and how hard he worked for our group. I highly recommend him and look forward to another tour with him soon!!

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Highly, highly, highly recommend!  Planning to visit four wineries on a Sunday afternoon, I hired Vintage Car Service so we wouldn't have to worry about becoming safety hazards on the road. Prior to our visit, Josh offered advice on where to go. Lezli picked us up at our BandB right on schedule. We were impressed with her knowledge of the area and its wineries. She helped us rearrange our schedule a bit when our visit at one winery went longer than planned (that's on me - I tried to cram too much into an afternoon).  THIS is the way to do a wine tour. We will be regular customers when we return to Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Jo Y.
reviews.description: Lezli and Josh gave the best service! Communication is great - prompt responses. This was our first time uses a car service in Fredericksburg and we had an amazing experience. They had suggested stops prior to the day and got an idea of our plans but they were totally flexible too, even offering to call ahead to a winery to see how busy they were in the moment. We had 6 people and we had plenty of room in a comfy and spotless car. Josh was johnny on the spot, carrying all our wine bags and more. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Susan M F.
reviews.description: Josh was a great tour guide, picture taker, wine enthusiast and all around nice guy.  We thoroughly enjoyed our day with him and the places we visited.  They can work with just about anything you may want to do and that's nice to know.  It's worth every penny to not have to stare at a GPS while trying to take in the sights and if you are doing the wine/distillery tasting, which we did. We will use them every time we go to Fredricksburg.

reviews.author: Holley M.
reviews.description: My mom and I went to Fredericksburg for a fall getaway. I was going to hire a shuttle tour of wineries. I discovered Vintage on Yelp. I'm so glad I did.   1) personalized service. Josh took us to 4 wineries personalized to our tastes. Your tour is likely going to be nothing like ours. If you want a distillery tour they can do that too.   2) new, clean vehicle.  My mom has mobility issues. Getting in and out of a shuttle isn't the easiest. We could relax in this SUV and she had no issues getting out of it.   3) private service. Josh was our photographer, tour guide and even purse holder for the day. He knows a lot about wine! At the end of our tour he brought in all of our wine! We could do things at our own puce.   4) the price was comparable to other services. The price does not include tastings but that is ok. Sometimes you just want a glass or two.   Overall, I would highly recommend this service!

reviews.author: Alyssa S.
reviews.description: This was the perfect service for a weekend get away with the girls! A safe alternative to driving around to wineries and our driver knew the best kept secrets of Fredericksburg. They were on time, polite, fun, and knew how to make a day of wine tasting feel like a 5 star experience!

reviews.author: Rachel V.
reviews.description: Great value, great service! The driver was so friendly and helpful, with water, coolers, good tips on wineries, and keeping us on schedule!

reviews.author: Elise L.
reviews.description: We had an absolutely amazing experience with Vintage Car Service. Lezli helped us arrange tastings at amazing wineries (Signor and French Connection), and Dena, our driver, made sure our entire day was seamless and super fun! She even gave outstanding recommendations for things to do the next day at our trip. We could not recommend this company enough and encourage you to book with them when your in town!

reviews.author: Jen V.
reviews.description: Josh and Vintage Car were absolutely the best way to tour wineries in Fredericksburg! Josh is polite, knowledgeable about the area and wines, prompt, and super easy to get along with. The car he drove was really nice and clean. He took some great pics of us during the tour, both staged and candid. Plus it was raining when we started, and he had umbrellas and did all he could to make it comfortable for us. I couldn't recommend this service enough. We'll def hire him again and rec to everyone. Thanks, Josh!!

reviews.author: Mitra C.
reviews.description: This was the best decision I could have made for a wine tour.  Lezli was so helpful and gave me tons of ideas for our itinerary.  Josh was the best driver.  So kind and personable.  He kept my mom and I on our schedule but never made it feel like we were being rushed.  Also, if we were enjoying more time at one place, he called to rearrange our other tasting times.  He had snack and water in the car.  The best part is we didn't have to worry about anything, which was a huge relief when you're suppose to drive from place to place AFTER drinking wine.  I'm going to plan another trip in a couple months with my husband and I will definitely call them again.

reviews.author: Aly A.
reviews.description: Highly recommend Vintage Car Service. Josh is very knowledgeable about wine and the best places to enjoy a good time in Fredricksburg!

reviews.author: Eric W.
reviews.description: We didn't want to drive ourselves to the wineries, and didn't want to take the bus with a strict itinerary. Glad we heard about this new service. The driver took us to the few wineries we wanted to try but also suggested a couple of wineries we weren't aware of that were awesome! Very clean, new SUV, knowledgeable and friendly driver. Would use then again.

reviews.author: Matt N.
reviews.description: Had a spectacular time! This team was Great! Beautiful vehicles, impeccably clean, and friendly drivers got our group safely from winery to winery (and even provided night time transportation to Luckenbach). The drivers were flexible with our group and provided some custom solutions for a safe and fun weekend!   Awesome and friend drivers. Would definitely use again and recommend to others!

reviews.author: Nick A.
reviews.description: My wife and I celebrated our "mini-moon" in Fredericksburg.  We were lucky enough to have Vintage Car Service gifted to us by a family member.  Vintage Car Service made our mini-moon such a special experience.  We had enough time to explore four Vineyards, three of which were recommended by Josh.  Josh was a great driver, knowledgeable of Texas wine, and was a pleasure meeting.  The Volkswagen Atlas was very comfortable and a great ride.  We highly recommend Vintage Car Service if you are in Fredericksburg for any occasion and want to explore some new Vineyards without worrying about driving.

reviews.author: Lindsay F.
reviews.description: THIS IS A MUST WHEN WINE'ING IN FREDERICKSBURG!!! Everything from our amazing chauffeur, Josh, to the spacious and clean car, to the hidden gem wineries he shared with us, and the beyond polite and gentleman service of carrying our purchases to the car. This made our trip and we are already planning to use these services in the near future. Thank you so much for everything. Even the added professional photos which were a bonus surprise! Made us feel Famous in Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Sonia N Casey G.
reviews.description: What a great day today with Josh!!  Thanks for making our day memorable and easy going.  We will definitely call you again!!!

reviews.author: Dan T.
reviews.description: Josh provided:  Great customer service.  Excellent knowledge of the wine country.  Feeling of comfort and confidence in driving skill and safety.

reviews.author: Chase C.
reviews.description: My wife and I used Vintage Car Service for my wife's birthday.  We had Josh as our driver and we had an absolute blast. We were picked up on time and the car was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. Josh met all of our demands and had some awesome suggestions of vineyards to try based on our tastes.  We ended up changing our schedule to fit in one of his suggestions and had an amazing time.  Overall, the experience was well worth the price and was great.  We will definitely be booking Vintage Car Service in the future, it is the best way to enjoy the wineries and not worry about drinking and driving.

reviews.author: Ziara H.
reviews.description: We had the best time on our wine tour with Josh! It was super easy to make a reservation, we told Josh a few of the places we wanted to stop and he made reservations for us in advance. Josh picked us up on time from our Airbnb, the car was spotless and we made a few adjustments to our itinerary along the way which Josh was super helpful with! Snacks and waters were provided in the car, which came in very handy between the wine stops! Josh took pictures for us and even mailed us the most amazing large postcard with our pictures from the trip. Great attention to detail from start to end! Will definitely make a reservation with Vintage Car Service next time we're in Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Jorge U.
reviews.description: We had an awesome experience with Vintage Car Service! After a quick call to plan the trip out, Vintage took care of everything for us. They picked out some great tasting spots to suit the different tastes of everyone in our group. They called ahead and made reservations where needed and offered us lots of great tips along the way. Even with a little rain shower, our entire group had the best time and we felt like VIPs everywhere we went! Comfortable. Professional. Affordable. Worry-free. We can't wait to book our next Texas wine adventure with Vintage!

reviews.author: Brandon M.
reviews.description: We sent the kids with Grandma and headed out for some fun. Josh was our driver and he was awesome. Good people, great service, nice ride....I highly recommend !!

reviews.author: Laurie H.
reviews.description: Austin Wine Tours made my booking reservation easy and I'm a difficult customer. They worked with me on the wineries and Distillery the group chose to ensure that the time worked within our tour, so everyone could enjoy the tasting and lunch without feeling rushed. Austin Wine Tours also provided us with a great driver. I have to say our driver Charlie was awesome, he called before arriving, he was prompt and ensured we had everything before leaving the pickup spot. Charlie made our tour very comfortable, the ride to and from the wineries and Distillery was amazing. Charlie ensured that we were taken care of.  We will definitely be booking another tour with you folks and requesting Charlie.   Thank you again,  Laurie

reviews.author: Carli A.
reviews.description: 10/10 would recommend Austin Wine Tours! First off, booking and choosing our agenda was super easy and they even let me adjust the headcount when that changed. On the day of, I got a heads-up call to confirm the time and pickup location. We had a larger, rowdy group of gals on a bachelorette trip and our driver Song took SUCH good care of us! She immediately asked us what music we wanted to crank and encouraged all the "wooing" from the back of the van. She also offered to take pictures of us, scouted out the best locations for group photos and even took TONS of candid pics of us while we enjoyed the winery and distillery we went to. She helped with all of the logistics of checking in at each stop and making sure we were taken care of. She also let us make a pee stop on the way home...and overall she was just SUPER nice and was basically hyping us up the entire day, making sure the bride felt special and making sure we all had fun. By the end of the day we all felt like she was part of the crew. Thank you again Song!!

reviews.author: Laura R.
reviews.description: I booked a wine tour for my sisters bachelorette and we had such a great time! The wineries were beautiful and we were able to schedule a stop at the salt lick for our private tour. Kyle was the best tour guide ever!! He was very personable, took numerous pictures for us at each winery and made sure we were having fun! I would def. recommend if you are looking at different companies to pick Austin Wine Tours (ZWay Tours) since I called 5 others and they were the most accommodating with what we wanted for a private tour and their price beat most of the other ones too!  Would def. book them again and request Kyle!

reviews.author: Rakeba S.
reviews.description: Omg! We loved our experience with Austin Wine Tours! Our tour guide Kyle was amazing and made sure we had a great time. Kyle was on time and made sure we arrived safely to both our locations. Overall our experience was amazing and we will definitely book again.

reviews.author: Devin H.
reviews.description: The review that I left in regards to the services booked through Austin Wine Tours was in no way false. I will stand firm by what was written.   I even received a call back in May while on a business trip from the shuttle service company asking if we would pay the overtime for Hugo because AWT had not paid them yet. We even tipped Hugo an additional amount for his extra time spent with us.   The response just posted (almost 4 months later) is also extremely unprofessional and misleading. We were promised a great time for a bachelorette party and were let down. Plain and simple. Those employed by AWT that we spoke with were rude as well. Secondly, I never said that AWT hosted prom events/transportation. I was told that the company that is usually utilized was completely full (by Brad) and that prom happened to be a priority and the school bus that was sent was all they could get us even though we were promised a party bus.   At the end of the day we were completely dissatisfied with the services offered by AWT. Calling a client a bridezilla (who in fact actually never spoke to any AWT employee), claiming your company has gotten PTSD from our group and falsely accusing our group to be racist by saying we told "blackie to leave" is unprofessional and disrespectful amongst other things said in response to our reviews. All of those involved would be happy to discuss this event again in a professional manner since you mentioned that we were offered a full refund when that in fact was not true. We were offered maybe $350 (I could be wrong on this amount since we haven't heard/spoken to anyone from AWT for several months) in return if we removed our reviews.  As a company you should take responsibility instead of blaming others for your mistakes that way you can fix the problem and do better for future patrons. Especially since there has been no money refunded at this point.

reviews.author: Christopher Jon M.
reviews.description: We had a great time this past weekend with Austin Wine Tours. I initially booked online and didn't know what venues to go to at first but they recommended the ones that we ended up going to even though it was completely up to us where we wanted to go which I liked. We decided after to tastings to go eat at Salt Lick BBQ and the food was amazing and hit the spot in between tastings. After that we went to our final tasting at Fall Creek which was right across the street and the service there was great. It made our bachelorette party very fun and we didn't have to worry about anything other than having a good time which I liked.

reviews.author: Julie B.
reviews.description: Austin Wine Tours is one of the best limo tours to see the wine country we have been on to date!  They were not only flexible with our dates and our last-minute reservation, they even upgraded our package with no additional charge!  We were celebrating four birthdays and  wanted a girls night out  where no one had to drive. The limo driver was prompt and worked with us and our pick up and drop off times.  When one of us left the charger in the limo he even offered to drop it off... We Are definitely looking forward to using them in the near future!

reviews.author: Kelli C.
reviews.description: Had the absolute best time on our Bachelorette party!! Hill Country was so much fun to see and the wine made it even more enjoyable. Sara was very helpful with planning the itinerary and gave us exact times so we could keep track along the way, and the vehicle was exactly as described and in excellent condition! Myron was an excellent driver. You should definitely plan with Austin Wine Tours! Amazing service!!!

reviews.author: Courtney M.
reviews.description: Austin Wine Tours is amazing! I just had a bachelorette party for my sister this past weekend and it was so smooth! From Sara's communication to Lance's chauffeuring day of, the entire experience was great. I highly recommend utilizing them, you'll be glad you did!

reviews.author: Blythe H.
reviews.description: If I could give this company a negative star review, I would!!! Completely unprofessional and was hung up on!! They sent an incorrect party bus for a bachelorette party, contracted out at last minute to another company (who were amazing), sent us to Deep eddys where we were turned away!!! Brad would NOT let me speak and kept interrupting me. The professionalism of this company was simply awful. And they still have not refunded anything from this trip!!! Disgusted and I will never recommend this company to anyone. Spend the extra money and go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Tara B.
reviews.description: We had such a great experience with Austin Wine Tours. They had everything taken care of for us, and our driver Lance was awesome! We went to Fall Creek and Duchman, Fall Creek was my favorite!

reviews.author: Linda T.
reviews.description: Booking our wine excursion was stress free the moment Sara answered the phone! Sara was very informative and laid everything out, giving us a doable timeline for the afternoon we wanted. The itinerary we received gave us a good idea of how long to spend at each venue. There were only 4 people in our group, so we were able to do a very flexible hourly option, with appointments at the wineries.  Since we had less than 5 passengers, our tastings weren't included (informed that going in) however, that did not deter our experience... it was awesome! Buying a bottle of wine at each venue was very affordable when we split the cost among us.  George, our driver, was professional and friendly; and the limo experience was awesome! You might want to bring snacks just in case someone gets a bit tipsy, but most wineries offer food of some kind. Thanks Austin Wine Tours, for making me look like a champ with my high maintenance friends... I'll be back!

reviews.author: Karen O.
reviews.description: After leaving the previous review, the company finally contacted me and issued a full refund.

reviews.author: Debbi R.
reviews.description: A Full and Wonderful Day   Our tour with Dale was fabulous. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it didn't take long to realize that not only is Dale a great tour guide, he's also a very personable and knowledgable man who makes you feel like an old friend.   The points of interest were superb and the last stop we made provided one of the best meals I've had in my life and most likely the best ribeye ever.   The day lasted longer than expected, but it was a wonderful day and ended up being just perfect. We are planning to use his rental venue for a retreat in the coming months and looking forward to it. I highly recommend his services.

reviews.author: Jaylan B.
reviews.description: First I would like to start with the facts.  1. We booked this tour months ago but unfortunately had to reschedule to a later date. (due to Covid19) This was not an issue for anyone attending the tour and the company got all $2800 paid for in full. 2. Yes $2800. We had 28 people in our group, It required two buses that were at their max capacity.  3. I would give a HUGE ZERO if I could.   The buses arrived at the pick up location 25 minutes early and expected us (all 28) to load up. Not all 28 people were even there yet. The male driver already seemed annoyed at this point.  We ended up pulling out at the agreed on time. When trying to leave the 2nd winery we couldn't. The drivers HAD LEFT and weren't there to pick us up. We waited outside in the sun outside for 30 minutes before they even got back.  But that unfortunately is not why I am writing this review   As we were loading the bus to go home the male driver said that would be charging us for a cleaning fee ($300) because someone spilt something on the floorboard. Pretty steep for a small spill that could be wiped up with a Clorox wipe but she agreed to pay it she sat down. Comments started to be exchanged about the steep fee and how the day had been complete chaos up until this point. The man began to get pretty heated and slammed the door. When he opened the door to his seat he said "who the f**k spilt something in my seat." Nobody had spilled something on his seat. Upon looking at the "spill" it appeared to be sweat from Him. He continued to cuss and yell and eventually told us to "get off his bus." We all piled off and the other bus also unloaded.  Now it is important to note the other driver said we didn't do anything wrong and that she didn't agree with how he was handling things. He told her he was in charge and that he would make the call. She became quiet after that. They ultimately left us there to find our own rides.  The male driver was rude and didn't speak unless spoken to the entire day. A beautiful day with amazing company was RUINED by this company and I will not recommend them to anyone!

reviews.author: Stacy L.
reviews.description: I booked a birthday trip for 6 people, hoping to add 2 more. Dale told me I could book the trip for 6 and then add the 2. When I called to add the 2 he told me he would have to see if that was even possible. I didn't understand why after he assured me it would be fine and a sprinter van hold more than that. He had given the sprinter van to a larger crowd and downgraded us to an SUV without asking me (same price). I asked him when I would hear back and he said whenever he located another vehicle. I made some calls and found a better business who really wanted to host me and our guests. I called again to cancel with Dale and was told I am not the type of customer he would want. I guess a customer who wants to pay more money to add more people isn't good... very strange. Talking to a woman like that is not ok. I hope that he was having a bad few days and that he doesn't always behave like this, but I was really shocked how rude and unprofessional he was. Pros: I got my money back.

reviews.author: Blair B.
reviews.description: The owner/driver we had was terribly rude and very unprofessional. He only spoke when spoken to and when he did talk he seemed annoyed.  Do not waste your money on this company! I've had Uber drivers converse more than this "tour guide."  Worst experience ever by far!

reviews.author: Marcia H.
reviews.description: We were celebrating our wedding anniversary. The tour was nice. The driver was great! We visited some interesting wineries. Seeing the Texas wine country off the beaten path was well worth it. We would use this company again.

reviews.author: Doug E.
reviews.description: We had a great time.  Well worth the money our driver Laura was great.  She was helpful and was happy to be there.  When I do this again I won't change anything.  I would use the same driver and tour service.

reviews.author: Amanda G J.
reviews.description: One of the WORST experiences I have ever had with a "wine tour" company. I have been on many wine tours in my days, across different parts of Texas, and their unprofessionalism and lack of customer service and just blatant disrespect was appalling.   This "wine tour" had a total of two buses and a party consisting of 28 people. A group of people that I have known for years that have the utmost of respect and common courtesy for any company that they hire or work with.   From the start of our experience, both drivers were incredibly rude and unfriendly. The bus lacked any amenities one would think this "Premier Hill Country Wine Tasting Experience" would consist of.  The first winery.  * We arrived at the first winery at 10:48am to learn that the winery doesn't even open until 11:00am and that they WEREN'T expecting us at all... * Not the wineries fault. They were fantastic.  The second winery.  * Again, wasn't expecting us, causing us to have to sit at a tent down a road from the winery. Again, not the wineries fault, they handled it incredibly.  * When trying to leave the second winery, we couldn't. The drivers HAD LEFT and weren't there to pick us up. We waited outside in the sun outside for 30 minutes before they even got back.  The third winery.  * As we were loading the bus to go home, the male driver said that they would be charging us for a cleaning fee ($300) because someone spilled something on the floorboard. Pretty steep for a small spill that could be wiped up with a Clorox wipe, but she agreed to pay it. (*To clarify, open containers were allowed as stated on their website: "Consumption of alcohol on the bus is allowed unless there are minors present.") Minor spills like this are inevitable when providing a service as they do. Comments started to be exchanged about the steep fee and how the day had been complete chaos up until this point. The man began to get pretty heated and slammed the door. When he opened the door to his seat he said "who the f**k spilt something in my seat." Nobody had spilled something on his seat. Upon looking at the "spill" it appeared to be sweat from him. He continued to cuss and yell and eventually told us to "get off his bus." We all piled off, and the other bus also unloaded.  I know these times are hard, especially for small and locally owned businesses, and by no means and am I trying to make it harder for them; in fact, I am going above and beyond to support them. After yesterday, I do think that they need to take a step back and re-evaluate their actions and really think long and hard about what they do and why they do it. In the end, when providing a service, the client always comes first.

reviews.author: Susan G.
reviews.description: Rick was AMAZING! He is the guide with the mostest - a gentleman with a servant's heart, excellent taste in wineries, and a plethora of knowledge about this  beautiful TX region. He is truly one-of-a-kind and I'm so glad we took this tour with him. Thanks, Rick - see you again soon!

reviews.author: Tiffany H.
reviews.description: This could not have been a better day! We highly recommend touring with Heart of Texas Wine Tours. We were so lucky to have found Dale Fortenberry. He is so knowledgeable about the area, the history and the vineyards. Dale went out of this way to accommodate the entire group of women with different tastes in wine. We all know that is not an easy feat, but he did it! Our next trip to the hill country will find us taking another exciting tour with Dale.  -Tiffany Raye

reviews.author: Christi C.
reviews.description: Absolutely best experience from beginning to end!   From ease of scheduling, picking us up on door step, and bringing us back, worry free.    Our driver Rick was great!  Shared info and answered all of our questions about the area.   He escorted us in to reserved tables at each location, pampered us all day!    Already planning our next trip with www.HeartOfTexasWineTours.com!  Thank you, Christi

reviews.author: Matthew V.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I had a fantastic time on this tour. To be honest, the cost seemed a bit high at first but having never been on a wine tour before and I really had no idea. Afterward I realize it was worth every bit of it. Dale picked us up at our BnB along with everyone else on the tour that day and we were off to the first tasting.  He seem to know everyone along the tour and at each place they were very welcoming and grateful to have our group. It really was a fun time and we had the chance to try many different wines that we would not have normally picked.  Lucky for us it was a beautiful day and everything was just perfect. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone interested in checking out some Texas wines, for a nice weekend getaway, or just to try something different.  It definitely helped that we had a good group of people who were also on the tour that day as well. It was a blast...I just wish we had taken more pictures.

reviews.author: Amy W.
reviews.description: Heads up - I'm only giving this one star so I can write a review. It would get a huge ZERO if I could rate it that way. First off, Dale is a pretentious, "underpaid monkey" as he likes to be called. He is rude, unprofessional, and has the audacity to 'hate mail' potential clients and I know I'm not the first one because I've seen the reviews! I don't have much else to say but be careful and do your research before spending any money on this place! The owner seems to not have a care in the world if it's not benefitting him. Also, be ready for rude phone calls and emails from Dale if he doesn't get his way. He was hard to get ahold of from the jump, not to mention I live out of town and couldn't wait for days in between responses. After not being able to make it to my appointment because he had failed to get back to me promptly, I proceeded on with my day. The next morning I wake up to the most rude, despicable email I've ever received. Just be careful and read reviews because from what I've read, if you want a beautiful wedding with NICE, FRIENDLY people, this isn't the place. I'll attach one of many emails. STAY AWAY FROM THE HEART OF TEXAS RANCH ALL TOGETHER!!!

reviews.author: Melody G.
reviews.description: Amazing time with a group of 7 of us girls. Our guide was Christy and she was outgoing and made us all feel like nothing was a bother for her. Picked us up at our hotel in Fredericksburg, went to pick up lunch, and then on to first of 4 wineries. She took care of everything. Even loaded up our bottles/goodies in the back of the bus and kept the AC on to keep it all cool.  Christy went above and beyond to keep everything organized, she set up our lunch, picked up our trash, offered to take us anywhere we wanted to go, and she kept us on time to all of our tastings. We bought a bottle of wine at the 3rd winery and drank in the bus on the way to the 4th. Lunch was a boxed lunch bought at local deli (very good). Everything was included. Everything was professional. The bus was large and comfy. Highly recommend this tour company!

reviews.author: Valarie M.
reviews.description: Dale was great getting everything organized and keeping us on track - and then also helping us change the schedule when we needed to.  very accommodating.  thanks Dale! you were a great host!

reviews.author: Erin K.
reviews.description: We had a great time on this wine tour celebrating my sister's bachelorette party. Dale was very prompt and polite returning my phone calls. He was also very accommodating as the number of girls going on the tour changed at the last minute. We went to Fat Ass, Six Shooter and Fiesta Vineyards which were a blast and everyone enjoyed the tastings. Our driver Rick was funny and a true gentleman. It was raining that day and he had an umbrella to escort everyone in and out of the tasting rooms so no one got soaked. One of the girls left their phone on the tour bus and Rick came back later that evening to return the phone even after we offered to meet him half way. We had a great time and would recommend this tour to anyone!

reviews.author: Tory H.
reviews.description: What a fun and relaxing time! The tour bus was very spacious and clean and the driver was very accommodating. The tour was carefully selected for us with every winery being better than the last! I cant wait to take another tour.

reviews.author: Keith R.
reviews.description: We paid nearly four hundred dollars and it was a joke. What was supposed to be a winery tour was a tour of places that sold wine. We went to a store in downtown marble falls, an art studio, a grocery store and at the very end an actual winery. This constituted our day.   This is NOT a day of going to wineries in the hill country. Everyone was disappointed on Valentine's day.   The guy who led the tour was nice but they clearly got kickbacks where we went.   When we went to lunch no one got their order and right when we were leaving this sandwich shop the tour guide asked, "everyone went to the tasting room, right?" We're talking about a sandwich place being a stop on the wine tour people.   Horribly disappointed. Considering tastings were at most $10 for each of the four "wineries" we went to, it was a rip off in value.  The company clearly avoided going to respectable wineries and instead went to dead end places where they could maximize their profit margin.   Avoid at all costs!!

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: We had a great time on this wine tour. I booked it only two days in advance and they took great care of us. I told Dale our tastes in wine and he sent us to three great wineries. We had the bus all to ourselves too! I would definitely use them again and recommend this company for all your wine touring needs!

reviews.author: Monica P.
reviews.description: Dale is great!! He helped us find some Texas wines that we actually like! We went to a few places I never would have thought to stop by and helped us pick out some good wines to try. He kept the ride fun even though we were with 2 other groups of people we didn't know. The van was comfy and well air conditioned and stocked with bottled water. Would definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Dawn N.
reviews.description: Even a rainy day couldn't dampen the amazing experience the Heart of Texas Wine Tours provided.  We visited four wineries and were treated like VIPs due to Dale's wonderful rapport with vineyard owners and staff.  Dale's knowledge of wine and  the specialities and uniqueness of each winery made the tour interesting and fun.  By the end of the day, I had not only made new memories, but new friends too!

name: Carter Creek Winery Resort and Spa

reviews.author: Kaye C.
reviews.description: Accommodations were very good, the room was super clean and really nice. I loved that they were villas so you're not sharing common space with anyone else during Covid.  The spa not being open was a big bummer. It was partially the reason we chose here so that was disappointing.  The staff was nice, they were super welcoming.  There is no daily cleaning or maid service due to Covid.  Nice location being a short 20 minutes or so to Fredericksburg.  There are numerous wineries between here and there to keep you entertained! I like that they had on site live music (one night instead of the two advertised though) and loved the open area with bandstand, comfy chairs and cornhole games to entertain.  Overall, a solid 4/5 but once spa is open and "normal" post Covid life resumes, I'm sure this will be a 5 star location.  We will come again and will update after we do.

reviews.author: Scott T.
reviews.description: We really wanted to love this place, here goes the story... We had reservations for a Saturday arrival, we called and spoke with the most unpleasant human on this planet named (Becca-Becky-Rebecca) you get the idea, not sure on the spelling so lets go with (B) - The interaction went something like this:   (Scott): Hi, we have a confirmation for checking in on Saturday, we noticed the check-in time is 4pm, we have a wedding to attend at 5pm... is there any chance to check-in slightly early maybe 3-3:30 so we have time to get ready, and also make the 30 minute drive to the venue?   (B): What is your definition of early since you stated the check-in time is 4pm which is the actual check-in time.   (Scott): Oh, ok.. well let me get with the wife and figure it out, thanks. Bye.   (B): Phone Click  Now I'm basically just flabbergasted at that point, like whoa... did this really just happen?   Long story short, we called in the following days and decided to cancel the reservation, we spoke with Susan who was amazing, and apologized! She Stated that (B) comes across that way sometimes, and she will bring it up to her. Anyways, it's sad that (B) was the ultimate factor in the loss of revenue for the resort. Being a Titanium Elite Marriot member, I average over 75 nights a year at various hotels, NEVER in my life have I had a similar interaction. Wish we got to try the wine, maybe another time.....

reviews.author: Susie C.
reviews.description: If you want a best of Johnson City experience, stop here. We had an 11 AM tasting for seven set up and were greeted by Cody. We were able to choose five wines from the extensive list of award winning wines. He graciously poured the wines we chose, with knowledgeable notes and recommendations. The Grenache Rose, dry and tasty. Plateau Red was a delicious blend. Tempranillo true to the varietal. The Brut was a delightful and Dominum Tinto Port so luscious. Cody was Texas friendly and a true ambassador of the wine region.

reviews.author: Cynthia V.
reviews.description: We had a great time enjoying the large patio and lush greenspace here at Carter Creek. Grab yourself a glass of wine (or a tasting) and soak in the beautiful views. There is plenty of space here so you can unwind and enjoy the company of your party. I especially enjoyed their sparkling peach wine - I could have easily polished off more if I didn't have to drive! It was very crisp and refreshing. Service was friendly and attentive as well.

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: 4 star review, mainly for the beautiful setting they've created. It's pretty ingenious to put up a resort and spa out in Hill country. They're going to make a ton when things get back to "normal." It's connected to the 290 brewery and restaurant where we ate dinner. They provided us complimentary wine tasting. I wouldn't go home to mom on the wines but the food we ordered hit the spot. We sat inside where it was easy to socially distance and enjoy our meals and tastings. Outside was packed and people were definitely not distancing over the holiday weekend. I think the brewery could do a better job at pushing tables further apart to try to account for this. The service was a bit slow but nothing to complain about since we were enjoying the AC room.   some of the disappointments were more towards the resort. They seemed to be a little understaffed since we couldn't even check in at 5 when the booking said check in started at 4. The pool was packed the evening prior which meant no clean towels when we went the morning of our check out. The continental breakfast was cheap and limited to individual prepackaged muffins, cereal, cereal bars and yogurt. I understand covid limits what they could cook, but even hard boiled eggs wouldn't be that difficult.  The staffing was otherwise welcoming and friendly and wearing face masks. Parking is limited to the upper area so you have to walk down to your cabin. Would also recommend a better walk way to the restaurant, but we loved the wild flowers and it was a nice reprieve from the day in the sun.

reviews.author: Tocus T.
reviews.description: Great place to stay! Friendly staff, nice and clean lodging. Great wine, live music, and all the food is just ok. EXCEPT.... the Migas from  the breakfast menu, The Migas are terrible. Hands down the absolute worst Migas I've ever had. There is no eggs at all in the meal, what kind of Migas has no eggs? it's just bad.  Their "Migas" are really more like brisket nachos. They need to either rename the meal to Nachos, or revamp it, or just remove it from the menu. So.... Stay here for a great time but just DO NOT order the Migas for breakfast.

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: Not at all what I was expecting! We were very disappointed overall. We planned an overnight near Fredericksburg and booked here fully expecting to visit the restaurant which is only open Thursday through Sunday. We were staying on a Tuesday night. We also planned to book spa services but the spa isn't open yet.  After attempting to turn onto the driveway which has no lights near it whatsoever we had to u-turn further up the road and attempt again. Not being from the area, you cannot see the driveway at all so I'd definitely suggest arriving before nightfall.  Upon arriving at reception, the representative had the personality of a turtle. She was not friendly nor rude. She was merely there. It was a "No, the restaurant isn't open. No, the spa opens next year."  It'd been nice to know this prior to booking as we would've booked elsewhere. The price point wasn't cheap through Hotels.com either for nothing being open at $160 + tax.  Our room was beautiful and smelled like new construction. The room itself was a perfect suite and would accommodate three people perfectly with a twin pull-out couch in the living area and a king bed in the bedroom. We really loved the bathroom with double vanity, large shower and separate water closet.  The room included a small refrigerator, coffee pot and bathrobes. Although the bathrobes are not "one size fits all" and tend to run on the smaller side.  Overall we'd stay here again if the price point were the same or close to the same and the resort is more operational.

reviews.author: Lisa O.
reviews.description: Beautiful vacay spot during the pandemic when you don't want to fly. Sure, the wine won't taste like Napa Valley or Santa Ynez, but beggars can't be choosers during a pandemic. However, the owner started his first winery in Temecula in 2003.  We received two vouchers at check in for either a tasting or a single glass of wine.  The overnight resort is GORGEOUS! I wished they delivered meals from the Old 290 Brewery, but I understand it's covid. Each villa has its own separate entrance so there's no risk of catching covid from other guests. These are brand new villas, only one year old, and they're beautifully built! Beautiful upgraded bathrooms and everything is new. There are two tvs in each villa plus a gas fireplace! Four star hotel which allows dogs!  It's located fifteen minutes from Andalucia Distillery, Hill Country Lavender, and the Exotic Resort Zoo.

reviews.author: Shannon S.
reviews.description: I hope what we experienced was growing pains. We only visited the restaurant on a Sunday night. Had reservations and were seated right away at 645pm.  Our server was great, ordered right away and brought drinks. Meal took over an hour to arrive at the table - salad, flatbread, burger and salmon. When it arrived some dishes were extremely hot while others were like warm. We had to ask for our food several times.   Food was good but higher in price for what we received. Wine and beer were excellent.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: The family and friends came for lunch to celebrate my mom's bday. It was a great experience large tables with what feels like a mile long covered patio. The table ordered various items apps,salad, pizza, burgers, fries, wine, and beer. Everything was delicious we enjoyed the live music.   Suggestions- it has two entrances.  Moose Out

reviews.author: Suzie E.
reviews.description: We had a Great experience for lunch!! All 6 of us really enjoyed our meals.  They were Delicious, large portions, and Sheldon took wonderful care of us, even though they were short staffed.

reviews.author: Eloy G.
reviews.description: Visited this place for a recent meeting and let me say this is one of the few wineries and maybe only winery with resort style accommodations. From the moment we checked in we were promptly greeted and given our rooms. While visiting we had the opportunity to eat lunch and dinner at this place and the food was really great! Kudos to the chef for the wonderful food and great pairings of wines. This was truly a fantastic visit and stay. While having lunch one day, we got to meet and visit with the owner Jim was who a great and friendly man and made us feel very welcome. He introduced to balsamic vinegar and it was amazing! This is definitely a must buy when visiting. Additionally, he told his story about this winery and it was a great story! Some employees who really stood out were Sheldon, Ethan, Marcus, and Dee! Thank you to the entire Carter creek staff for making our stay and meeting an excellent one. We will definitely be back to enjoy the Carter creek experience! If you are in the area, this is must stop especially on Fridays and Saturdays when they have some live bands. Nothing beats a hill county evening with some wine, food and friends.

reviews.author: Erika S.
reviews.description: This place has potential to be great but it's just not there yet. The spa was not open which was hugely disappointing. There were no microwaves in the rooms which is a very basic amenity for hotel rooms. The grounds were beautifully landscaped and the villas were very clean and nice. The restaurant on the property was not open on Monday and Tuesday. This was also a huge disappointment. You receive two vouchers per room for the wine tasting on property. We had 3 people staying in our room and they would not give us a 3rd voucher even though there was no spa and the restaurant was closed.

reviews.author: Kirsten T.
reviews.description: Wow! What a perfect all in one retreat! Wine tasting, brewery, and AMAZINGLY delicious food that I will be craving when I leave. The cottages are so private, and they have their own charming Texas elegance! The pool area is perfect... and they have some special chairs that are extremely comfortable! I want one! :-) The staff is super kind and friendly. The grounds are lush, floral and picturesque.  Great location and not too far from Fredericksburg. Such a wonderful place to visit I can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Erica R.
reviews.description: The rooms come with a tasting at the winery! Cute rooms and restrooms even. Only downfall is price but that's probably not something that can be controlled and not even a biggie. It could be worth it bc it seems like 6 people could stay in one suite. Unsure if that many people are allowed. Dog friendly too!!! They have a whole field with a band.  The aesthetic of the place is very cute! Great drive to Fredericksburg and other wineries.

reviews.author: Deidre C.
reviews.description: Beautiful venue inside, but marginal on all other counts.   For our tasting other than knowing name of the wine, server knew nothing Ordered food, paid 20% gratuity and never deliver our food  Many better places to go

reviews.author: Mike W.
reviews.description: Had a great time at the resort! Which the COVID was causing so many problems. Due to COVID the resort was very limited in staff. Did the best they could under the circumstances.  The area is very nice and clean. Wine, beer and food were all very good.  Will stay again!

reviews.author: Patricia B.
reviews.description: Wine, Beer, Food and Live music what can I say except this place is Aaamazing!! The ambiance  WOW!! This place is a must! Everyone we meet were super friendly. So much room to walk around and take in the beauty of the Hill Country. The owners Daughter is so friendly and kind.  Oh the food is the BEST!! All around awesome place to go. They have Cottages to rent out also.

reviews.author: Ashley M.
reviews.description: My new favorite everything: Hill Country resort, winery and tasting room, private villas, spa, brewery and restaurant, live music, and the team here are simply amazing! I'm excited to return!

reviews.author: Sespina T.
reviews.description: What a lovely, relaxing place - truly Zen. Stayed on a gorgeous November weekend with a group of long-time friends. Staff in the winery were very accommodating and helped us make our selections, which we purchased, and then moved out into large, comfy chairs in the open courtyard/lawn area to listen to music and enjoy the views and conversation. Later in the evening, had dinner outside from the Old 290 Brewery and Restaurant. Staff thankfully moved a heater by us on this chilly fall evening, and everyone enjoyed various dishes. All the food was excellent, and we even caught a glimpse of Mr. Carter himself dining in the restaurant. Later in the evening, we sat around the fire pit at the pool, and made new friends with other guests. Special shoutout to bartender, Taylor, who truly went above and beyond in catering to our group and making sure we had everything we needed. Could not have been a more pleasant, perfect weekend! Thanks!

reviews.author: Jessica C.
reviews.description: So first....let me say that our group totally dropped the ball on planning.  We reached out to Carla 3-4 weeks before but did not confirm until the week of the wine tour.   By the grace of the "wine" Gods, Carla could fit us in her schedule!  She is completely open to letting you choose your places or you can follow her lead!   She picked us up at our accommodations which were several miles outside of Fredricksburg.  We did introductions and she laid out the things that were already scheduled for the day.  On our way to the first winery, we decided to "reroute" the tour to hit some lesser known spots.  TBH, we were excited for Carla's recommendations.    Our first stop was Six Shooter because of their variety of dry wines, sweet wines and meads.  You have to try the Jalapeno shooter!!!  SO GOOD!   Second, we made our tour time at Real Ale and did a beer tasting. Third, she realized the majority of our groups like Whiskey, so we stopped at Andalusia Whiskey in Blanco!  This place met the needs of our entire group (even the non-whiskey drinker) and was by far the most unique stop of their day!  If you go here, try the Cherry Cola cocktail!   We stopped for lunch at Pecan Street Brewing in Johnson City, where we drank lots of water and had really great food.
