reviews.description: Over priced tasting . $17 tasting for very small pours of 6 wines . No water in tasting room. Had to go get it yourself . No crackers or palate cleansers . If it was a free tasting I wouldn't care as much . When I made reservation I was specific about food and was not given accurate info. You are not able to order food or eat during the tasting. Food only available to purchase after tasting was over. Servers poured wine on top of previous tasting . Missed poured twice . Server changed frequently and not consistent. They obviously are not organized to keep track of what wine we should be on . Huge red wine fan( live in Europe for 6 years ) was not a fan of  any of the reds . Surprisingly liked 2 of the whites, Beautiful atmosphere and building . A shame the tasting experience doesn't match . Could be so much better!!

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Nice stop just outside Austin for a wine tasting! The outside setting is very cool, spacious front lawn and some tables/chairs for hanging out. Dropped into this place for a quick wine tasting, consisting of 6 small pours of wine. The whites we tasted were all very smooth, not overly sweet but just the right amount of smooth and dry. Definitely recommend sampling all the whites if you have time, you won't be disappointed!  We didn't go check out Trattoria next door for food, but have been there in the past and pretty good Italian food, pairs well with the winery.  If you come here and the weather is looking good, you can expect a very scenic, picturesque spot to spend some time at!

reviews.author: Afshin D.
reviews.description: I live in California and only an hour away from Napa. I wasn't expecting anything close to what one would experience in Napa. However, I still wasn't fully pleased.   The only way I can imagine that someone would really enjoy it, is to bring your own picnic and use their outdoor seating area. This is of course conditioned on the weather and also whether or not there is gonna be any bachelorette party there during your visit. (We saw two when we visited and they were so loud and they had overtaken all the outdoor seatings)  We tried their tasting. It was only $15 which is relatively cheap. In Napa you pay 2-3x more than that in a good winery. They let you choose your own 5 wines out of their selection or go with their recommendation. The tasting overall was okay, nothing that I disliked and at the same time nothing wowed me. I'm not sure if I'm gonna go back there, but it was worth to try it once.

reviews.author: Ashley K.
reviews.description: Duchman is a great winery to visit near Austin that makes great wines.  I've recently been on a kick to learn more about and try Texas wines.  I've tried wine from several different Texas wineries in the past couple months (all purchased from wine stores) and Duchman is so far my favorite.  I prefer red wines and my favorite Duchman wines are the Aglianico and Sangiovese. Since the winery is so close to Austin, my husband and I decided to visit.  The grounds are beautiful - the perfect place for a picnic.  I appreciate the precautions they've taken due to COVID-19 too.  You can't go into the building (though they will let you in if you need to use the restroom), so they are set up outside selling wine by the bottle and require everyone to wear a mask.  There is plenty of space to picnic and social distance.  They sell some picnic meals on-site, but we brought pizza from Pieous, bought a bottle of wine, and had a lovely time relaxing at a picnic table in the shade.  I highly recommend visiting Duchman.  I'm happy there is a winery that makes great wines so close to Austin.  Even if you can't do a tasting during COVID-19, it is still worth the drive to drink wine in a pretty setting!

reviews.author: Em L.
reviews.description: My visit was 5 years. I opened of the bottles I got there finally... dammmmmmn! Its so good !  Go ! You won't regret.

reviews.author: Alice R.
reviews.description: Really beautiful property. We wanted to go to Salt Lick and wanted to find some other activities in the area so came here for a tasting before lunch. They do $15 for 6, which is pretty good, and was offering 5% off your total bill for following them on Instagram.   There's some beautiful benches set up outside to go with your glass of wine. It unfortunately seemed to be drought season when we visited so the actual grape plants were pretty bare. Once you step inside, there's a small room where the tastings happen and the shop where they sell bottles and all kinds of souvenirs. There unfortunately wasn't any seating indoors so we had to stand the entire time. If you walk in more, you can see barrels and label making rooms. Wish they had given us more history during our tasting but it was fun nonetheless.   It was pretty easy to get an uber out here from the city but be warned getting an uber out here may take a little while.

reviews.author: Devika D.
reviews.description: Staff was really friendly and explained all the wine choices to us. I went with my friends and we're not wine connoisseurs so that was super helpful. You order by the bottle. The outdoor area was beautiful and tables were all well distanced for covid.

name: Old 290 Brewery and Restaurant
address: 4064 W US Hwy 290Carter Creek Winery Resort and Spa

reviews.author: Marcy N.
reviews.description: Love it! Had a great weekend here! Great food and great service. Tatum in the restaurant provided exceptional customer service. Taylor at the bar made great recommendations and gave great service. Alison and Viv in the tasting room are so knowledgeable about wine and made our experience great! What a wonderful weekend. Good beer, good wine and great atmosphere and service. Rooms are comfy and very private! Love it.

reviews.author: Preston T.
reviews.description: Fine dining prices without the quality or experience to match. The food was just okay. My wife and I ordered the $27 shrimp pasta. You can get a much better comparable dish at an Olive Garden or Chili's for half the price. The service was nothing spectacular either. We saw our server maybe 3 times throughout our meal, and had to flag them down each time to wait on us. For these prices, you expect better.

reviews.author: Lisa H.
reviews.description: Loved loved loved this beautiful stunning venue. The food was all on point and the atmosphere was outstanding. We had charcuterie boards, pretzels, ribs, and pizza. It was all outstanding. The "oakmeal" beer that I sampled because I thought it said oatmeal was terrible

reviews.author: Kaye C.
reviews.description: We stayed at Carter Creek so of course we had to try the on site restaurant. The chicken Alfredo was excellent with lots of spices and flavors that you don't normally get with such a basic meal. The stake frites meal was incredible.  The sangria was good but the waitress said all they do is open the bottle and pour it in your cup so that just made it seem much more expensive than it should have been. It was nicely flavored.   The open seating to listen to live music was wonderful. Very comfortable with cornhole and Jenga games while you wait. There is a large pavilion and lots of open areas to hang out in. Great place to spend a lazy Saturday evening   Unfortunately, the spa is not open still which was disappointing.  The front desk said they're having a hard time finding employees for it.    We had room 1710 and it was very nice.  The only downside is that you have to walk down a rickety set of stairs and then through the mud to get to the room from the parking area.  The room itself was very nice and clean. The bed was comfortable and they did a great job of having the room stocked for us. Overall, a very nice place for the weekend

reviews.author: Chassey W.
reviews.description: Had a great dinner with friends on their outdoor patio. It was the coldest night this year yet in Texas but they had plenty of heaters. We had chili, salads and the Brussels sprouts...all delicious. Inside, they had a live band playing good music but not overpowering. On site brewery and wine. Looks like a great venue for a wedding reception. The place is huge. And hands down, the best server I've had in ages...Kimmi. She was attentive, personable and obviously loves kids. Even though they were short handed, she didn't crumble under pressure. Sorry no pics of food!

reviews.author: Lisa O.
reviews.description: I am shocked how upscale the food is at the Old 290 Brewery. I ordered a gluten free mushroom burger with goat cheese, and it was the best burger I've had in years. The chef is definitely top notch and serves exquisite food. They are so short staffed during covid, that even the chef served our food to our outdoor table.  The staff came around to light the outdoor heating lamp but it burnt out after fifteen minutes. I think it might've run out of gas.

reviews.author: Balcones Village A.
reviews.description: Disappointing at Best.   More along the lines of overhyped and not worth the time or money.    Walked in at 2pm on a Saturday excited to order a glass of wine and enjoy a nice meal.  We were told they weren't seating.  Side note:  The place had a number of other tables with menus and staff taking orders.  They close at 2:30 for a mid-afternoon break(?).  Option provided by staff:  Go to the Smokehouse and sit on a bench and eat.  We were starving otherwise this option would not have been considered.    Ordered at Smokehouse and it was DISGUSTING.  If you are smoking beef in Texas it should be at minimum edible.  Ordered a brisket sandwich and bbq tacos.  Brisket sandwich was all fat and no meat with a disgustingly soggy bun.  Fat swimming in bbq sauce.  Absolutely revolting.  Tacos, same.  Fatty, drippy and translucent meat substance in a mini stale tortilla.    Definitely overpriced.  Fast food and gas stopover giant, Rudy's does such a better job!  Seriously, not worth the money for what was served: crap in a paper hotdog basket.    Onward to Hilmy Winery to pickup our quarterly wine allocation.  No need to let a dreadful lunch ruin our afternoon.  I really wished we had passed on this badly needed substance stop.  Hilmy flock allocations had a wonderful pairing!   So glad that we barely chocked down the Smokehouse offering.   The pairings were awesome.  We won't be back to Old 290.  Too many other great places in the Fredericksburg area.  Only good takeaway here was the bag of Miss Vickies potato chips.

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: We are currently staying at the Carter Creek resort where the old 290 is. We went for dinner this evening and were blown away. For drinks, my husband had the pale ale, and I had the rose. Both excellent. For dinner, the kids had the pizza and chicken strips and my husband had the burger, while I had the Tri Tip Dip. The burger was cooked perfectly and the sandwich was a new twist on a classic that I order often when we dine out- this is the best I've ever had. To finish up, we ordered both the chocolate torte and pecan pie. The pie had orange zest in it...a surprising but delicious addition. The best part? The yard in the picture I'm attaching. The kids ran around while we enjoyed our beverages and enjoyed live music. The pricing was fair, service quick and luckily they were able to get us in because I made the reservation via open table for the wrong night (the hostess said it happens often so pay attention to the date when making yours!)

reviews.author: Lisa S.
reviews.description: It was a great evening. The outside was nice and cool with lights and heaters. The food was amazing. Desserts was go good. Had. Prime rib. Stack house burger. Flat steak. Pecan pie and bread pudding.

reviews.author: Marvin C.
reviews.description: Definitely recommend this place!! Beautiful atmosphere and amazing staff... Thank you Steven for making us feel welcome and wonderful customer service..

reviews.author: Agustin Y.
reviews.description: I had to give this place a single star, i am sorry but the five stars it has on yelp is very misleading, must have been artificially inflated by employees or family members or paid russian bots because the food was ok and the service was a complete catastrophe. I think it is unfair to others that trust and have confidence in yelp. I have had some amazing undeniably amazing meals in San Francisco, Chicago, Phoenix and Miami with the help of Yelp, i felt bamboozled sitting in the dining room of the Old 290 Brewery. I understand covid has taken its toll on the industry, take out tables reduce capacity if you dont have the kitchen staff to properly serve all the guests. Our server Josh was triple sat with our table being the fourth he did a great job of explaining his game plan and he waited on his section as it was one large table, i applaud his effort. All of his tables had issues and he was never going to catch up and there was no evidence of teamwork whatsoever. A vast amount of tables received their appetizers and entrees together and and salads and entrees at the same time. I assume the restaurant has a manager i think it was the woman dressed like she was going to the Kentucky Derby she spoke to a table and brought the table water but you could tell she didnt care she just wanted to talk to the regulars, she really enjoyed the sound of her voice we called her Julie from the love boat through out or meal. I understand restaurants like this only care about the regulars that like to name drop and ask if chef/owner/president  is in... that is why i made this review so not another traveler, vacationer, honeymooners, birthday revelers (us) dont fall for the inaccurately described and awarded restaurant. The food was decent the steak tasted great and was perfectly cooked Pittsburgh Rare but there is no way to absolve all the inequities the front of the house presented. Take this review with a grain of salt

reviews.author: Bailey T.
reviews.description: Happened upon this place after our planned restaurant was too busy and we were on a time crunch. Beautiful location although tucked away off the freeway. We didn't even know it existed until google directions told us as we were heading to a winery in Fredericksburg.  Staff was very friendly and efficient. Place is clean, esp the restroom. Food was good. We had iceberg wedge salad, flatbread, Cesar ssalad, tuna salad. Everything was great except tuna slices were from a bag.  Aside from the restaurant, there is a brewery and housing- resort type set up and venue for weddings. Will try again.

reviews.author: H T.
reviews.description: Great outdoor patio for dining. We sat outside each time we ate here. Caught the live band on a Saturday night. The food here is excellent. We tried several things but our favorite was the Angry birds (boneless wings) great flavor and amazing crunch on the breading. The ribs are also good and the tropical mimosa on the brunch menu. We also had the chicken sandwich and a pizza they were both good too. If you are staying at the resort make sure to grab dinner here at least once. The staff is very friendly and attentive.

reviews.author: Kendell C.
reviews.description: Holy crap! This place is the best. Ethan, our server, could NOT be more helpful too. Great beers, great service, clean bathroom- you can't lose here!

reviews.author: Natalia L.
reviews.description: What an incredible winery  with such knowledgeable personable staff. Located on such an extraordinary piece of land. Me and my husband each did a wine  flight and picked our favorite sips and ordered a glass each which we enjoyed on the fabulous patio.  I love that with every flight purchase included is a souvenir wine  glass. Flights and by the glass were very reasonable given the type of wine  served.  We ended up enjoying our time so much that we came back an additional day.  I highly recommend this place to anyone looking to sip on some delicious wine .

reviews.author: Shirley R.
reviews.description: This place is so beautiful! Heads up though, make sure you make rezzies for the tastings, we didn't and were unable to since they were fully booked that day.  However, do not fret if you didn't, because the grounds are stunning. You can order a glass or a bottle, no judgment ;), from their double decker bus, that gave me some serious harry potter vibes. Then take it and enjoy the view. There is ample sitting. I would love to come back with reservations of course, and try a flight in their beautiful tasting room.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: Had such a wonderful time here, we went on Tuesday via reservation and were the only ones there until noon. Plenty of outdoor space to social distance along with animals to interact with: donkies, goats and miniature horses! A decent selection of wines with one standing out in particular to our taste-buds, can't remember the name specifically but it was red wine cherry blend, maybe seasonal?   The staff is friendly, place was very easy to find, there is a bit of construction going on in and around the place but it's not too big of an annoyance to take away from the overall great experience.

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: I truly enjoyed my visit to Wimberley Valley Winery. This was the first stop on my wine tour for my anniversary weekend. The tasting reservation process was pretty easy. The tasting price is very fair (5 glasses for $18) and the pours were generous. The wines were very good. I left with a couple of bottles. I definitely recommend the Christmas Cuveé and the Sangria wine. Once you finish your tasting, there is plenty of space outside on the patio or other areas to just sip more wine and just be.  A lovely experience.

reviews.author: Kasper L.
reviews.description: This is a cool place! I'm glad I had the opportunity to visit here. I'd like to come back and try the tasting.   The outdoor seating area was nice and very spacious. I did like the outdoor patio and the arrangement of all the things. I enjoyed the red wines that they had. I really liked the season fruit wines--tasted like juice with how fruity they were (I mean that in a good way).   The food truck also served some pretty solid food. Really enjoyed the chili and cheese tator tots. The pizza was good too! The burger was a little disappointing though.   All in all, nice place to visit! Come check it out!

reviews.author: Kelli N.
reviews.description: Visited this winery today and enjoyed everything about it! The wines were better than expected and the ambiance was terrific. What I really didn't expect was the fantastic food. Finding something a gluten free vegetarian could safely eat and enjoy was beyond my expectations but wow did they surprise. Best gluten free veggie I've ever had! Lovely afternoon here, we'll definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: I was looking for something Covid safe to do outside and to get out of the house. This winery has plenty of space on the grounds to distance safely from others. We made a reservation for a tasting. Well worth it to learn about the types of wine. The staff is knowledgeable and nice. It is a comfortable environment and you can ask many questions. After the tasting we ordered a glass each and went outside. We ordered a pizza from the mobile kitchen. It was wonderful!  I suggest going on a beautiful day and enjoy wine, good food and sunshine!

reviews.author: Eric W.
reviews.description: We went wine tasting with a group of 5. The collection was big and the server was very inquisitive, informative, and kind. After our hour of tasting 5 wines, we bought two bottles and went out to the property to enjoy the day and the live music. We had a perfect spot beside the musicians (who were very very good) and had an amazing view of the property. I was at peace with all the elements in place. I will be back, bringing family, and enjoying a bottle here and there.

reviews.author: Mahwish S.
reviews.description: This is my second time visiting this winery. I loved it the first time and it left an impression on me to go back. Because of Covid, they are doing tastings by reservations only so that they can control number of people and properly space out in their tasting room. I'm sure you'll love a bottle to buy and you'll have ample time and space to enjoy it on their deck or yard after your tasting. Our tasting guide, Robert, was very knowledgeable about the different wines and a joy to converse with! They do have a good truck on their premises that bakes wood fire pizzas. I didn't try any this time because we already had brunch before coming. The port was my favorite wine. You've got to try it for yourself!

reviews.author: Gloria G.
reviews.description: This place is beautiful. Our first time in wimberly. We had such a great time, so peaceful. The live music was great. She kept it PG for the babies. The manager was walking around greeting everyone. The employees gave us suggestions on where to stay. Over all great experience.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Made a rez (required) a day in advance and was prompted seated for my 45min tasting! I decided to go with 5 TX wines to try, and they did not disappoint! My server gave super generous pours and timed it accordingly. Because I'm a slow drinking, I had the last 2 to enjoy in the spacious courtyard area. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Brittany D.
reviews.description: What a great find!! I recommend the wine slushies! Watermelon was my favorite however the red reserve one was not bad either (more dry). They have a food truck on-site which has delicious thin crust woodfire pizza. We got the Lexus of Lactose. Atmosphere was great and relaxing. Definitely will be back.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: We just moved to the area and recently took our out of town guests to this charming winery...what a treat! The wine was pretty good ( i mean it's not Napa, y'all) but the ambiance, scenery and people are amazing! The tasting was very reasonably priced and the tasting room is full of gorgeous local art. The grounds are stunning with mini horses to pet and love on and plenty of photo ops. Definitely put this place on your Austin wi

reviews.author: Brett J.
reviews.description: A year later and Wimberly Valley Winery is just getting better!  Our friends are members here and we joined them to go out and pick up their wine. While we were there we had a tasting.  They now have a full line up of "fruit" wines like Blackberry, Cherry and cinnamon, honey crisp apple, and others. They are on the sweeter side but for me were seriously tasty! I loved the cherry and the blackberry.  However at this time of year it is the mulled wine that truly wins the day for me! If you haven't had mulled wine I suggest you get off your butt, drive the distance, and sample some right now! It is so worth it!  A hearty and loud Ooooh my Goddie toooo Hottie to this wonderful glass of spiced wine that is served hot! It brings flashes of warm fire places, deep snow, thick sweaters and holiday cheer with every sip. It is my absolute favorite!  They are adding more structures to the location, the outside area is a divine place to grab a bottle and just sit and soak up the outdoors while enjoying a good sip with friends, and the inside is a great lush environment of comfy lodge like decor.  It is a great location with good people and a great selection of wines... not only theirs but a plethora of other wines as well. We always enjoy our time here!   One last note.... try the mulled wine! It is the holiday season in a bottle!

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: This place was definitely a one and done. There wasn't anything bad about our visit but there wasn't anything great about it either. They don't even use Texas grapes so these are all from out of state and only a handful are barrel aged. They were basic and not anything special. We came for a tasting so we tried a total of 5 different wines each (10 between the two of us.) They even serve store bought wines here!!! I've NEVER been to a winery that serves what I can buy myself at HEB. They didn't tell you anything about the wines other than "this is dry and fruit forward," no explanation of the grapes used, how long its aged, etc that we've become used to at other wineries. Also the alcohol content must be very low in thier wines, we went on empty stomachs and neither of us felt a thing which is not the case at other wineries we've been to. I'd give it a try if you're in the area, but don't expect much. The grounds are nice and they have a cute double decker bus they converted but for us one visit was plenty.

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: We came here for our anniversary and we loved it! We'd never done anything like it before, and we were not disappointed! And honestly how often do you see blue wine???

reviews.author: Carly H.
reviews.description: Drinks were good but service was poor. Server Gabriel said we had a bad experience because he works for his ex and that we could leave a review about our "shitty experience" on Yelp. Welllll, here I am. When we walked out we got to speak to the owner and realized our tasting came with a complimentary wine glass that the server didn't provide. Owner brought it out, thankfully. Place is beautiful but had a better experience at other wineries because of service.

reviews.author: Kirsten P.
reviews.description: Nice looking place! Amazing vibes and the patio area is just so cute! I reserved a "table" and when I went in I was very confused. No chairs or tables unless you go in the back (where they don't serve the wine) so we stood at the wine bar waiting for tastings. Wine was delicious and our waitress was so sweet and nice!

reviews.author: Erika S.
reviews.description: Honestly, I'm disappointed in the experience of this place. We saw the reviews of this winery and thought it would be a fun part of our weekend trip, so my three friends and I came in for a wine tasting inside their bar and we were surprised about the snooty service and multiple issues we had. First off, when we were pointed to which bar we'd be tasting at, there was a dirty tissue on the ground that was at our station (which I had kicked away, not wanting to make a fuss out of it). It apparently wasn't cleaned yet before we arrived, so our sommelier wiped it down before placing the menus down. In addition, we were placed right by the exit/entrance door to their storage room where we constantly shuffled away to not block the staff coming in and out.   When she quickly put down some menus and expo markers and asked us to pick 5 wines to try and walked away, she didn't really care to pause and help us with decisions, so I stepped in to help my friends who were less knowledgeable about wines. Throughout our wine tasting process, our sommelier also made really strange comments to us, saying multiple times: "This particular wine is really expensive, so that's why you only get a splash." Not sure why that was necessary to repeatedly state that? It wasn't encouraging us to purchase anything, especially when we weren't enjoying the particular tastes of our wine and she didn't bother helping us give recommendations, other than asking if we had any questions after we already picked our choices. When one of my friends asked about the bathrooms not working, she just curtly answered it was because the pressure gauge was off for the whole place due to the Wells. I understand that's not entirely in their control, but she did not have to respond in a rude way, and unfortunately my friends had to hold their bladders until we got back to our cabin bathroom.  Overall, I recommend people skip the wine tasting indoors and just go straight to the outdoor patios to check out the cute red bus that has the express wine bar service. The person in there seemed a lot nicer, and there were places we could've sat down and enjoyed the nice weather, instead of standing the whole time interacting with our rude sommelier indoors.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places EVER!  I'm a member so I go as often as I can, their member benefits are amazing. My niece and nephew love taking carrots for the horses and donkeys and kicking the soccer ball around. The venue is just beautiful and even when their are tons of people there it just doesn't feel crowded, the layout is perfect.    The wine is top notch. I  like sweeter wines so most on the menu suits me but they have some dry wine as well for folks who love a dry red or white.  Slushes in the summer, warm spiced wine in the winter, fruit wines in the fall ... this place has it figured out!  Grab a Cheese tray and hang out for an hour or stay all day!

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: Who knew there was such a thing as mead but the wonderful girl behind the counter helped us with choices and filled us with lots of knowledge.  My parents were staying at the cabins at onion creek right behind this place and when we stopped I saw a dog inside so I called my parents and said meet us up here and told my husband whoa we gotta pet that dog!  I enjoyed the bead as I had never had it before and loved the inside decor and how the place is set up.  Cozy if you want it, outside on the patio ( not for us since it was raining) up at the bar or in large tables.  If you're in the area its definitely a must.

reviews.author: Liana W.
reviews.description: I definitely recommend this tasting room!! It's right around the corner from Salt Lick and Duchman winery and definitely worth a stop!   We got a cider/mead/wine/beer flight (4 tastings, one of each).  Very cool interior design. A hidden gem- I hope you all try this place!

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: This place was ok. Didn't love it. Didn't hate it. My husband and I stopped in on a random day date through hill country on the way from Desert Door (excellent).

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Been here twice  and both times have been impressed with the variety and quality of their choices for wines and beers. Staff have been knowledgeable and friendly. Prices reasonable.  Met the owner tonight - really earnest, smart and nice guy. Only downer- Geeks who drink trivia. Absolutely despise it. Awkward format, unintelligible announcer, questions relevant only to the very young.  Won't be back for that.

reviews.author: David G.
reviews.description: Big ups to our new friend Jamie and his new place Hill country.  Very quaint place with two stories and plenty of samples for the beer drinker or wine drinker.  Your husband doesn't like wine?  No problem.   They got beer.  And plenty of it.   IPA's and Hefeweizen's will greet you at the door.   Family and pet friendly place. We will be back for sure.  Thank you for the awesome graciousness.

reviews.author: Kami C.
reviews.description: This is a great little place for wine or beer. They have a nice selection of great Texas wine and beer and the owner is a really nice guy.

reviews.author: Tracey N.
reviews.description: We are from the area and stumbled upon this gem.  The owner/bartender was outstanding and the place is out of a Pinterest page.  We bought a few bottles and hung out for a few hours.  We will be back and recommend this spot to anyone in the area.

reviews.author: Trent W.
reviews.description: Big fan of this place. Brand new building and very well cleaned and kept. We were greeted with great hospitality by our bartender. I had never tried mead before and was offered a tasting of it. We ended up having beer flights from their great selection. Perfectly located, close by to Salt Lick BBQ. Come to this place and try for yourself!

reviews.author: Cathy R.
reviews.description: We had my husband's 50th birthday party at Hill Country Tasting Room. Deepa was so helpful with coordinating all of the details. We met beforehand to plan where to place the food, decorations, and talk about special drink offerings. The staff was super friendly, went out of their way to make us feel welcome, and made it a very special night. We had a party of about 25 and the space was perfect! Would highly recommend and will definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Kevin H.
reviews.description: An oasis on RM150. Sort of in the middle of nowhere (for now), this place is a welcome sight for the people in Hill Country who like to drink. Beer, wine and mead only in a warm industrial space. The service was very accommodating, however not as knowledgeable as I had hoped, given the selection and the many questions several of us had as we tried mead for the first time. Prices seem to be a bit high considering we aren't in downtown, but it's a place we'll visit again.

reviews.author: Lisa P.
reviews.description: I loved the staff but they clearly don't want to pay for air conditioning!  Otherwise I would come back in a heartbeat!  Wine is great. They also offer beer, ciders and Mead!  If they don't realize that AC is important they won't be in business long!

reviews.author: Coby C.
reviews.description: Great selection of beer, wine and mead. The staff is very friendly. The environment is nice. We will be back next time we are in town. Thanks!

reviews.author: Nicole G.
reviews.description: Came out to Driftwood Tasting Room while we were on our winery "date day". We met the owner Lindsey and she was so sweet and knowledgeable. The venue is right of FM 150 in an industrial space with a great atmosphere. I highly recommend it for a date day, couples trip, or any kind of party. Locally owned and all products are sourced from Texas! Total perk -- super dog friendly!!

reviews.author: Susan D.
reviews.description: Hill Country Tasting Room is a wonderful find - I strongly recommend it! We rented out the entire venue for our rehearsal dinner, and it was absolutely perfect. We had ~50 people with an outside catered buffet dinner, and the venue was the perfect size - it still felt intimate during the speeches, but there was enough room for everyone to sit, eat, and mingle. The layout worked really well for us - for dinner, people could sit and eat on both the ground floor and mezzanine, and for speeches people mingled on the ground floor while the speeches were held on the landing. We love the atmosphere there - a combination of industrial, rustic, and chic that totally matched the vibe we were going for!  Planning was a breeze too - first Lindsey and then Deepa were both so accommodating and answered all our questions. Especially compared to some of the other venues I was talking to, Hill Country Tasting Room responded so quickly, kindly, and didn't mind when I asked a bunch of questions! I would definitely recommend them for hosting an event.  The drinks themselves were also amazing. We loved that it was all Texas beverages, and there were so many options! We were so glad to find a place that offered such a wide variety.  On the actual night of the rehearsal dinner, the bartenders were so helpful - I even got comments back from a couple of guests stating how nice they were! I can't wait until our next visit to the Dripping Springs area - we are definitely going back!

reviews.author: Joseph F.
reviews.description: Driftwood Tasting Room is tucked away in Driftwood, an oasis, but was a great stop! The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the selections they were carrying and they were able to make great recommendations based on our tastes. They have reasonable prices, they were in line with the other tasting rooms we had visited during the day. Their concept was awesome! Their selection is from local craft breweries and wineries and rotates between different companies. They also had the beverages available to take home if you found one, or more, you enjoyed.

reviews.author: E. A.
reviews.description: Two friends and I went to Driftwood Tasting Room and asked to do a wine tasting. The only employee there, Antonio, said the tasting would be $8 for four tastings. The menu had a long list of beer, mead, and cider as well as wine. We asked if we could mix and match the tastings between these drinks, and the employee said yes. We then asked, several times, if this would still be $8 for the tasting. He again said yes. When we went to pay, we discovered that our bill came out to more than twice that amount. Apparently, the tasting was not $8. He told my friends that we received full pours, and that's why it was more. Here's the thing, WE DIDNT ASK FOR FULL POURS; we asked for a tasting. The employee took it upon himself to give us the full pours, which we did not ask for and shouldn't have had to pay for. We left upset and confused as to what happened. One of my friends went back into the establishment to discuss a refund. We didn't want to all three go in and cause a scene, since the man was kind to us, we just wanted to remedy the situation. Apparently, he reexplained the full pours THAT WE DIDNT ASK FOR and then offered my friend $10 out of his pocket. She felt guilty about this and didn't ask for compensation for the other two of us that did a tasting. I repeat, tasting and not full pour. I'm not sure why he would offer us his own money instead of trying to correct the problem initially. Maybe he knew he was wrong? Or maybe he just wanted us to go away and not complain? I really don't know why he would do that. We discussed it more and felt upset about the whole situation and how it was awkwardly handled. It was a damper on what was supposed to be a nice day out. I decided to contact management through the Driftwood Tasting Room's Facebook page the next day to see if we could be fully refunded for the employee's mistake. I explained everything to the manager, Lindsey Pierce, who, of course defended the employee. I understand this, and I have nothing against the employee, but a mistake was made and I wanted it corrected. I didn't mention the $10, since it went to my friend who spoke to the employee. Apparently, this gave the manager reason to believe that I was lying. She said that my friends could contact her for a refund and I could get one after I returned the $10 cash, which I didn't even get, but ok. I mentioned how she was treating me like I was lying and like I was a criminal for complaining about what happened. Lindsey Pierce then THREATENED to take me to SMALL CLAIMS COURT for SLANDER for writing this negative review. All I tried to do was express my dissatisfaction and try to get a refund, and the manager treated me so impolitely and with such disrespect. I would never want to go to a place where the management treats a customer so rudely. There are better places down the road where the servers charge you what you expect to be charged and the managers are polite and genuinely care about your experience at the winery. I'd avoid this place at all costs simply because of how the management treated me when I tried to explain what happened.

reviews.author: Erika B.
reviews.description: Great place! Just a short, scenic drive out in Driftwood. Owners are friendly, knowledgeable, and welcoming. A great selection of local craft beer and wine that you cant find anywhere else in the area. We will definitely be back and highly recommend to anyone. Must try the Oocheenama Ale or the Mads Red Wine.

reviews.author: Marcy R.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem and definitely a much needed place for the growing area. It has huge potential and I hope they get enough business to stay in business! I live nearby and it's a nice place to grab a drink. Beautiful interior! The glasses of wine were a little pricey compared to the nearby vineyards but everything else seemed reasonable. The guy serving my friend and I was super friendly and helpful I hope they continue to have great service. The only things I would recommend would be to maybe add a couple TVs without sound on to keep some of the guys happy should there be UT games or golf on. The bar is a beautiful spot to hang out. I'd also recommend having some nice big glass jars with some pub mix or nuts in that folks could purchase by the scoop and maybe even a cheese/meat plate or some olives. It's a great hidden gem for us who live nearby to be able to have an upscale bar with great local beer and wines. And sometimes someone in a group doesn't want wine so it's nice to have the options! Something for everyone. Hopefully eventually a food truck or some dinner pairing event would be fun. I have seen some really cool events advertised on fb but haven't had a Chance to make it in to one yet. I will add as I have two kids I wouldn't recommend this a place for kids as there isn't really an outdoor space. A great date spot or place to meet friends for a small birthday. Bonus would be to add a happy hour or special pricing for driftwood locals!!

reviews.author: Lukas S.
reviews.description: We spent a weekend at Lucky Arrow for a friend's wedding. It was such a great experience!  Space: There was so much space that we never felt like we were on top of each other. Everything was kept neat and clean, too.   Staff: The staff were all so friendly and accommodating with requests for more fire wood and such.  Amenities/Rooms: SUCH nice bedding with ample room in the courtyard cabins. Loved having the hot tubs too!

reviews.author: Alida R.
reviews.description: I had a lovely few nights stay at Lucky Arrow. We traveled with friends - 3 other couples and their kids - and stayed in a cluster of four cabins. It was the perfect pandemic vacation: we were able to socialize with our friends and still have our own spaces, without being indoors together. I don't think I'd have enjoyed it as much with strangers staying in the cabin cluster with me, especially since each pair of cabins shares a hot tub (which was delightful to relax in!) and all four cabins share a fire pit.  The rooms were clean and modern looking, the beds comfortable, and the air conditioning great. They have basic toiletries and good towels. There's very weak and unreliable wifi at the cabins; I recommend you come here to disconnect. I had good cell phone service with Verizon. The cabins have mini fridges but no kitchens; if you want to cook, you'll have to grill outside. Bring your own charcoal and lighter fluid!  For shared amenities, there's a lovely outdoor pool, and a big space with a large fire pit, grills, and picnic area with tables and swings (and some covered seating if you need shade). The pool has a 1-foot area with lounge seats, and lots of nice floats. We visited during the week, and it wasn't very busy; our group spent a lot of time at the pool and were often there by ourselves. There's a small walking trail, too.  It is quite pricey; I don't normally spend this much on a hotel. I'm not sure if I'd stay again if I weren't going on a group trip (with pandemic friendly housing.) If you're going with a group, call and see if they'll give you group pricing.  Warning for those who are planning to spend most of their time in Dripping Springs drinking: if you visit on a Monday - Tuesday, as I did, most of the wineries and breweries (including Bell Springs, which is attached to the resort) are closed.

reviews.author: Brittney H.
reviews.description: Wow, what a great stay! The yurt that I stayed in was spacious and spotless, the bath house was always clean, and the entire place is well maintained. The staff is amazing; welcoming and very tentative when needed. If you're looking for a peaceful getaway outside the Austin area, this is the spot and worth the price!

reviews.author: Erika F.
reviews.description: Great retreat close to Austin. Connected to a peaceful winery and minutes away from distilleries. Great staff and beautiful cabins.

reviews.author: Felix G.
reviews.description: Exceeded expectations. I love being outdoors, my wife loves luxury hotels. We stayed in one of the cabins and we both got what we wanted. The grounds are really nice and accommodating to friendly conversation with other guests. The cabins are modern and feel like an upscale hotel room. I appreciated the contactless check in and check out process. We look forward to returning.

reviews.author: Gina L.
reviews.description: Phenomenal! Stayed overnight. Happen to book thru Hotels.com. No issues at all. We stayed in courtyard cabin. My two children my husband and I had a great time hiking, relaxing, hot tub,fire pit and more. Already wondering when I can get more time to go again.

reviews.author: Adam D.
reviews.description: Very little privacy and poor management. Had a grounds keeper hop, that's right hop, on to our patio while my wife and I were changing. Wife was and is still pretty traumatized.  Took us forever to find management to let them know we are out and they told us they would pay for our room at the holiday inn. They did not.  Recommendation to LAR:  If you are going to run a wedding at your retreat, maybe consider additional help managing the facility. Only having 1 worker who is trying to run a wedding at your grounds isn't going to cut it.  * to managements response:  You want me to call you again? I'm sorry, but your response to my review makes it sound like this is the first you have heard about this incident. Is this correct? If so, this is disappointing because that tells me you have not taken steps forward to improve.

reviews.author: Liz K.
reviews.description: Came here for a mid-week staycation. We had the place almost all to ourselves since it was mid-week in September. The weather was amazing! We rented one of the breezeway cabins with views+hot tub+fire pit. There was firewood at the cabin when we checked in. We had a fire and hung out in the hot tub to look at the night sky both nights. It was so quiet and relaxing, exactly what we were looking for. The breezeway cabins are beautiful and fun! The pillows, sheets, and bedding were comfy. The breezeway two-seater swing was cute to sit in while sipping coffee. It would be nice if the room with the couch and wet bar also had soap and a couple dish towels by the sink.

reviews.author: Trey E.
reviews.description: Lovely glamping space close to the Hill Country and within an hour of Austin, but ludicrous pricing policies will prevent a repeat visit. This spartan campsite with tiny houses and yurts (with a bathroom space shared with pool guests) offers a close to the city getaway with minimal amenities. But with a per pet fee of $150 PER ANIMAL plus a nightly fee, they don't seem to understand how out of touch they are with pricing policies of similar establishments. With two dogs under 20lbs, you're looking at $350 just in pet fees prior to any rental rates for just two nights, and therefore Lucky Arrow won't be getting any repeat visits from us.

reviews.author: Mandy L.
reviews.description: I just stayed for an incredible weekend at Lucky Arrow.  Not only was the resort gorgeous, it was super clean and the staff was incredibly friendly.  This was the perfect place to unwind and still feel safe during all this Covid madness.  The check in process was all online, so we didn't have to worry about social distancing.    The rooms were so adorable and you could tell they really put time into every single detail to make sure you have an amazing experience.  We were able to sit around the fire pit, have smores and enjoy the quiet starry night with no city noise or much light pollution.    The location was beyond perfect.  It's just far enough away from town that you feel like you are truly on vacation, but there was still an HEB and tons of food options within a few minutes drive.  The gated access to the winery next door was a wonderful perk.  Highly highly recommend staying here!

reviews.author: Kate A.
reviews.description: There are few things more excellent than Texas Spring, and we were delighted to spend a weekend of the best time of year out in the hill country at Lucky Arrow during their opening weekend.  There is a central event space and bar / pool area at the top of the hill with yurts as well as more conventional accommodation tucked into the trees below. We stayed in a 'courtyard cabin' one of four arranged around a fire pit with a hot tub. Which was bright and airy with the squishiest mattress, soft sheets and plenty of space to set up our travel crib for our three month old son (they also have them there if you're coming from further afield and need to borrow one)  We spent the weekend listening to live music and sipping cocktails by the pool, wandering the shady trails, admiring the view and toasting s'mores on the fire pit.   Close enough to Dripping Springs if you want supper /HEB - but far enough out that the stars are super bright and the night is gloriously quiet. They're well-behaved dog friendly, so we'll be back with our (only moderately well behaved) hound. And for a yurt, I only peeked my head inside one but I'm desperate to stay in one soon!

reviews.author: Brittany W.
reviews.description: I will definitely be back here! My group of 6 reserved 3 porch houses and they were lovely! On the inside, they are totally modern and beautiful. There are no TVs which is perfect for a weekend getaway from the world.   The check in and out process is nice, you're provided with a code to a lockbox so there is no need to wait for someone!   There is a communal area with darts, Jenga, connect four, and more by the pool and firepit area. The staff left out snacks, drinks and smore's fixings for us!   This is a peaceful place that I can't wait to return to!

reviews.author: Jessica N.
reviews.description: Had a great time staying in lucky arrow! We stayed in Yurt 3, which was great. Only complaints were that there was no map provided, nor customer service available, so we had to drive around and try to find outlet yurt at 10pm. Which was fine - we found it fairly quickly. Other complaint is that it looks like the person cleaning might of got distracted and left the room, without putting the ac back together or bringing her cleaning towel. Also not a huge issue. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: April C.
reviews.description: My husband and I chose Lucky Arrow for our anniversary getaway and it exceeded our expectations. The yurt was perfection and beautifully decorated. Even the shared bath house was nice! The complimentary beer and wine tasting was great and the crepe food truck on site was an added bonus. We'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Yerlan S.
reviews.description: Great location, great infrastructure, everything is new and well maintained. A lot of activities to do within an hour range. Hot tubs, hot pool, hot showers. Great breakfast variety w wine n beer tastings. Amazing staff.  Will come again, great place for a grate value.   P.S. A/C in yurts was nice, Operational Manager George is a great dude.

reviews.author: Marisa V.
reviews.description: I have finally fulfilled my lifelong dream of glamping in a yurt!    This place was such a cool experience. I had everything I could ever want. A pool, beer garden, campfires conversations with s'mores, and even a complimentary wine tasting at the Bell Springs Winery located right next door.   As for the staff, a big thanks to Mike, Michelle and Zach! They were all amazingly friendly, kind, funny, and helpful. Your hospitality was greatly appreciated.   This place is perfect for events or a staycation. Either way, I recommend visiting!

reviews.author: Allie W.
reviews.description: Beware of the cancellation policy.  Extremely deceiving.  The first sentence on the website says they have a 10 day cancellation policy but you actually can't get a refund at all.

reviews.author: Liz W.
reviews.description: What a fun place to stay!  We stayed in a yurt and it was such a fun experience. The pool was fantastic and the bathrooms were clean. Everyone was so nice that we saw. The yurt was a great experience.

reviews.author: Andrea L.
reviews.description: For my birthday we stayed in one of the yurts. Super cute and trendy however our sheets had like possible blood stains in them? It was odd and a bit gross. Maybe rust? It turned into a guessing game. Also the communal bathrooms are quite a hike from where we were. Almost had an accident just trying to get to them. Wish they had a couple bathroom options. They had a complimentary beer and wine tasting in the beer garden, however the bar tender or person pouring our drinks wasn't wearing a mask. I didn't feel comfortable sticking around.

reviews.author: Lori S.
reviews.description: Wow!  We are finished up a 3 day work retreat here at Lucky Arrow and, I cannot say enough good things about our stay here and I am super sad to leave.  We were able to have our team join us here (from Austin) to prepare for fall + 2020 goals.  It was the perfect mixture of pleasure and work-- we were close to wonderful Dripping Springs restaurants, wineries and distilleries.  We stayed at the Ranch House were we could spread out and work on our planning during the day and hit up the pool for a quick break. And,  you will definitely want to hit up the s'mores/fire pits because-- yum!  In the morning, we had wonderful walks on the property and even did a mediation session out on the outlook during sunrise.  Incredible.  It would be the perfect place for a wedding ceremony!  I highly recommend a trip out here- I definitely want to come back for a weekend getaway in the yurts or cabins... they are so cute!  Oh and take a dip in the hot tubs!  All in all a definite 5 out of 5-- we will definitely be back!  A huge thank you to Michele, Eva and team for their wonderful service!

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem!!!  Very quiet and gorgeous area!!  Check them out!  Beautiful!!  Surrounded by trees and sounds of nature!  Free popcorn and dogs are welcome!

reviews.author: Chad B.
reviews.description: Beautiful brewery in Hill Country, Texas! Live music on weekends. Plentiful picnic table seating outdoors.  I had a chocolate chip cookie which was fresh and not too sweet!  The nachos had fresh chopped beef--similar texture to brisket or pastrami. Liquid nacho cheese is very warm.   None of the food was exceptional, but down home good.   Great place for a lazy weekend afternoon!

reviews.author: Mandy N.
reviews.description: As good as it gets!! I have always loved their farmhouse ales (Ona is probably my favorite dark saison in existence but I'm also so happy about their lager program starting up.   It's great to have refreshing approachable pilsners for people that aren't quite ready to walk on the (beer) wild side. If you're ready to go a little wild I definitely suggest their cave aged beer (the premiere has a little funkyness but it's not too crazy, like overripefruit and sourdough bread) we loved it and it feels really fun to pop a cork out in the texas sunshine.   You can always count on Roughhouse to make something creative and unique and if you come to the taps with an open mind you definitely won't be disappointed. They have beers to go in bottles and cans too which is lucky bc some of the high abv ones are really the best (but I can't have them before driving, ha!!)   Great food for snacking, we got a bbq sandwich and really liked the bbq sauce, we ended up getting extra so we could dip our chips in it lol  The setting is hard to beat, plenty of shade outside with abundant picnic tables, plus there is an air conditioned loft if you just can't handle the heat!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Absolutely beautiful and peaceful place! I was weary of trying it since the beer sounded very floral, but there is something for everyone! I love the shaded outdoor picnic tables, and there is even a fire pit for s'mores ($3 to buy the kit)! The beer is delicious and fresh and they have a menu of farm to table foods. My husband and I tried the salsa (made from the goodies in their on-site garden) and it is the best I've had with the right amount of heat. We were able to buy a quart of it to take home- yummy!  This is definitely a great place to hangout with the pups and to get some fresh, countryside air while enjoying an acoustic band and some fresh beer served by the friendliest people.

reviews.author: Jan C.
reviews.description: The food was underwhelming.  I was hoping it would be so good. The people were friendly. Good service.  Great atmosphere. Hope to come back for live music and maybe try a different app. Enjoyed the night even though food was unimpressive.

reviews.author: Carolyn V.
reviews.description: The Good:   :: local business!   :: lots of parking   :: lots of space outdoors. in these pandemic times we live in, this is critical to ensure safety and still let you enjoy yourselves   :: lots of outdoor seating options. picnic tables/benches galore   :: outdoor performance stage   :: charming outdoor lights to make the place twinkle   :: outdoor mini rock wall for kids to stay busy   :: great beers! very refreshing. if you don't know what you want, ask them for recommendations   :: great snacks/food options to accompany your beer   :: very clean bathrooms   :: very good pandemic procedures for safety  The Bad:   :: none  The Ugly:   :: none  Would I go back? When I'm in this area of town again, I'll absolutely make my way here for a drink and a snack and to relax.   This place is IN.

reviews.author: Casey B.
reviews.description: What's that saying...?...too much of a good thing? No, I got it: don't drink bad beer.   Admittedly, my hop-soaked beer taste buds may not be par with a more astute beer connoisseur, but bad beer is bad beer. Tis a shame: this place is a true retreat. The Austin-indie-jazz duo provided an eclectic sound which paired perfectly with this serene outdoor haven.   Their flight card/cart is cool...it's dog friendly....there's a cactus.  The point is, what can you do when the beer's bad but move on and find another place.   I'm also slightly irked when businesses refuse legal tender.

reviews.author: Rachel M.
reviews.description: Been many times, and tried many of the Roughhouse beers. Every time was a pleasure. The staff are super friendly and flexible, and I love that the outdoor patio is dog-friendly. Glad to see they're growing and building more outdoor seating. Hope they'll continue to grow and do well!

reviews.author: Susan C.
reviews.description: We were thrilled to find a local craft brewery that was open - so much of this area is still closed or offering limited service. The beer is good, the employees are friendly, and the venue offers socially distanced picnic tables under some nice shade trees. There was live entertainment when we visited. Great way to spend a Sunday afternoon.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: A group of us drove in to get some beers on a hot early evening/late afternoon after shopping at San Marcos Outlets. And if you're debating whether or not to make that drive--do it. You're welcome.  Roughhouse has THE space, service-oriented people backing it up AND...(the most important part for all of us beer nerds) a delicious lineup of their own beers. We drove in and were surprised to find that it was tucked in at the end of this residential street. There is plenty of space here though--it gave us Jester King and TX Keeper Cider vibes with the "outback" far out drive that make you feel like you've escaped the busy city/town life. Parking is abundant in the gravel area, and from the moment you arrive you know it's going to be a wholesome good time.  We could hear the live band out there that day, and we saw people with their dogs and kids. So awesome when breweries allow all people and furry friends! There's a kitsch pickup truck out front and a huge wooden cottage-like space that is the microbrewery. The interior feels much more quaint and modern, so get out your hipster glasses and handkerchiefs, millenials! I enjoyed my flight of beers for $12. My favorite beers were Treeform IPA and Floral Print. I ended up taking a Treeform home, and the label is so tastefully done with an earthy and spritely flavor.   We also ordered burgers (that come with mac and cheese! SO ooey gooey), and I gotta say their black bean veggie burger was not bad. I'm critical of veggie burgers because most people just slap it on the grill and that's it...or they just give you a thick piece of Portobello between two slices of bread. Not at Roughhouse! We also enjoyed a game of cornhole and can confirm they also have large Jenga. They have clean restrooms and serve-yourself water. Wifi is strong and it's a guaranteed a good time. Will definitely be back. Can't wait to see them grow and expand in the community.

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: Loved the outdoor space and entertainment . Not a big drinker so can not comment on the beer but other guests seemed to enjoy themselves. It is a bit out of town yet that contributes to its uniqueness. If you like non-traditional American food then you will like the menu and can try something new and tasty.

reviews.author: Meredith Z.
reviews.description: Pleasantly satisfied with our lunch here. We got a pastrami sandwich and a chicken salad sandwich. The wagyu beef in pastrami sandwich was particularly good!

reviews.author: Dolly S.
reviews.description: The beer is good but the food is great.  There was this lamb sausage that was outstanding.  A little in the spicey side but just enough not to burn.  It came with chips and pickled mixed veggies.   Yummmmy

reviews.author: Nicci C.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, really good beers, and dog friendly! What more could you ask for? Highly recommend the queso with pork.

reviews.author: Captain G.
reviews.description: Service A1, view A1, method for COVID A1, environment is beautiful except for experiment 625 and 626. Worst experiments...

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Very nice brewery. Not a fan of farmhouse ales but, they are actually pretty good what they have on tap.   Love the upstairs hangout.   Suggestions- The place is in the boonies. Food specials or something to entice people to come in would be good.  Moose Out

reviews.author: Ben M.
reviews.description: Roughhouse Brewing is the cutest husband and wife brewing company in Texas!   If you're in the San Marcos area, this is a great place to spend the day drinking some delicious farm-style beer, wine and ciders in an absolutely gorgeous wooden barn.   The building alone is worth the drive, but the Treeform IPA is what kept me smiling ear to ear! One of the best IPAs I've ever had.   Our Saturday trip included some really nice tunes by a local acoustic guitar player on the stage in the backyard. We had a very large group in town for a funeral, and there was plenty of seating outside for us all and the staff was incredibly accommodating, offering everyone samples since we were all first timers.   We don't make it out to San Marcos often, but this will definitely be a place we visit every chance we can. Great job! We wish you nothing but the best!!

reviews.author: Dana C.
reviews.description: Great beer, excellent food and service. We've enjoyed the live entertainment, loft and fire pit too. Frequent beer releases are incentive to return. We will be back!

reviews.author: Robyn L.
reviews.description: Seemed a little out of the way, but most certainly worth the trip. Great property and atmosphere. Wish it had not been so hot and we could have enjoyed the outdoors. We enjoyed flights of beer and overall the quality of the beer was really good. Pretzel appetizer with cheese sauce and mustard was a terrific accompaniment. Staff was very informed and friendly, we had a great visit.

reviews.author: Jess H.
reviews.description: Absolutely everything you want in a brewery.... even if you're with people who don't want beer! Great food, great beer, wine, and ciders. This place is gorgeous with great spaces- cozy upstairs, picnic tables outside, live music, and kid friendly spaces. Everything we tasted including a lot of the menu was delicious. This place makes San Marcos and a Wimberly look goooooood. Pay em a visit. You'll love the vibe. You won't regret it.

reviews.author: Dawn S.
reviews.description: We had rented a little house at the Lighthouse Hill Ranch which is part of the property so decided to check out the Arc near sunset.   The building itself IMHO is an odd shape but the views are amazing. The staff were super friendly and knowledgeable. We took the elevator to the roof and we're not disappointed. The views on both sides were spectacular.   We went back down and grabbed a glass of wine and found a nice quiet spot on the bottom floor overlooking the ranch property and the pool area. (See pics)  My friend loved her wine so much she grabbed a bottle on the way out. I can't remember the name but I do know it was a white wine and it was from Slovakia. Who knew right?    Next time you are on 281 and you see the oddly shaped building on the hill, go grab a glass or a bottle and enjoy the view!

reviews.author: Lauren M.
reviews.description: It's a FIVE star view, y'all.  If you are out in this area, do yourself a favor and STOP here.  Grab a drink and enjoy the view! You won't regret it.   Even though this is out near the Texas Wine Country, they carry non-Texas wine, beer and bubbles.   Their are two patio areas- one on the first level and one a few floors up on the roof. In between the first and top floors are small rooms you can rent. The pool access is a perk for staying there.

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: On our way into Fredericksburg, we saw a sign for "wine and views!" so we pulled on up to this cool-looking building. Most of the time, spontaneous stops are the best, and this was no exception. The views really are fabulous and there is plenty of lovely seating outside to see all around in every direction. They have a great selection of different wines as well as cute cheese/meat platters to snack on. It's a fun and different stop to make while you're on a wine trip.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: I'm definitely not a wine guy, but this is still an awesome place to visit. The views of the Texas hill country are amazing!  The place is perched on top of a hill, so even the terrace on the ground floor has amazing views.  After you order your wine, head on up to the fourth-floor terrace for even more astounding views of this beautiful ranch.  As someone else pointed out, it's a wine bar; they do not make their own wine here.  But don't let that stop you from paying them a visit. I counted 29 varieties of wine on their list.  Choices from Argentina, Spain, California, Sicily, France, South Africa, Oregon, and of course, good ol' Texas wine (and many more states and countries that I haven't listed).  You can order a glass of wine, a full bottle of wine, or do what I did. You can go for the "Wine Tasting" for $14.95.  You get your choice of five different wines (one-ounce pours).  I'm new to the wine scene, so I was expecting to pick all five choices up front and have them served like a beer flight. Evidently, that's not the case with wine tastings.  You make your first choice and the one-ounce pour is served in a regular sized wine glass.  Then, you return to the bar for each choice after that. The only thing I didn't dig, is that they didn't rinse the glass when you returned for your next choice.  So, if you had a red wine, and then returned for a white wine, a little of it was mixed in with the other. Again, I don't profess to be a wine dude, but this doesn't seem right to me, if you are trying to get the true flavor of each wine.  I didn't stay here overnight; I just did a day trip.  But they have several suites you can stay in, and five or six houses on the sprawling ranch that you can vacation in.  I spoke to one of the guests who was staying in one of the suites, and he said it was "absolutely awesome"!

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: It's fun to stop here for a glass or bottle of wine if you're passing through or heading home from somewhere. Prices are fair and the view is nice.   Hideous building though, right? Like, you have all that money to build a hotel and you pick an architect that delivers the ugliest design? I don't get it.   It's funny, so we like it, and it ain't far from home.

reviews.author: Ruthie W.
reviews.description: On our way today to Willow City Loop to see the bluebonnets, we passed by some beautiful wildflowers right by Arc de Texas. The winery piqued my interest but I was really hoping to see more flowers as we went up the way.  Seeing the sign for chocolate made me stop in to see what was waiting for me. There were multiple flavors with pecan in the name. Each truffle is $2.95 and individually packaged. I chose 2 of each - Pecan Rum, Pecan Toffee, and Peach Bourbon. The truffle tasted great but not with a hint of pecan taste or crunch though. I could taste the bourbon but not the peach.   Maybe the next time we could enjoy some of the wine on the rooftop terrace for sunset.

reviews.author: Allison P.
reviews.description: We stayed in the King Louis IX Suite with two other couples for two nights. It absolutely blew our expectations! This suite is the penthouse and while the rooftop is available to all guests during the day, from 10pm-8am it's for penthouse guests only. Needless to say it was so much fun.   During the day we hung out and explored the property and the gorgeous surrounding areas and we made use of the hot tub one night and the fire pit for s'mores. It was really just an excellent and amazing weekend. Johnson city is super close and we had dinner in town one night which was delightful.   The views were BREATHTAKING and if you want to see stars, the rooftop is THE place to see them!

reviews.author: Sherri M.
reviews.description: It is a beautiful place with an excellent view from the rooftop. Staff was really sweet and informative.

reviews.author: Kevin T.
reviews.description: Impressed upon first view.  Majestic scenery. Good first round of wine. 20 year Tawny and a Moscato. Upon second round my jaw dropped when they went to serve us total different wines in the same glass without even a rinse. That alone drops my rating to 3 stars at best.  The view is 5 stars.

reviews.author: Victoria Y.
reviews.description: Very friendly staff and unbeatable views! The rooftop is the perfect spot to soak in the beautiful hill country. I visited for the wine bar but am looking forward to an overnight stay in the future.

reviews.author: Allegre N.
reviews.description: This is a very pretty location and the woman working was super friendly. There were plenty of places to sit and enjoy some wine. The view from the roof is very pretty and definitely worth a visit just for that. The wine prices seemed reasonable to me, with a lot of options in the $40 range.  Due to COVID they will only do bottles, not just a glass which is no problem at all, except that's where my negative part starts. I asked for a chilled red (don't judge me, it's 105F right now) which they didn't have. I rarely drink white so my partner and I finally agreed on a dry rose. There are two on the menu, one sparkling and one non. I wanted the non-sparkling but before I could say anything the lady said "oh, we're out of the sparkling rose, have the cava instead" and popped it open. So, we wound up with cava. OK, I kind like that but it was two levels away from what we asked for.  I realize that sounds slightly petty so the other issue is that we asked for a tempranillo to go. When we got home we realized it was a rioja, and not very good. We didn't get either of the wines we wanted.  I'd be a lot more willing to give a better review if the place had not been literally deserted when we arrived. There was no one there but us so I don't see much reason why the wines got that messed up. I wish we had been asked about the cava before she opened the bottle.

reviews.author: Elizabeth S.
reviews.description: Gorgeous venue! Wonderful selection of wines and definitely recommend going there for tastings but don't waste your money buying from them. They jack up the bottle prices and some can be bought for half of the price at other places online or even total wine!!!

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Do you like beautiful lands streaked with cool blue creeks? Do you like drinking good wine while viewing random friendly cattle that roam about? How about seeing an awesome arc backdropped to a beautiful Texas prairie.  Well then you've found the place! Really I can't say anything bad about this place, great service with awesome views. What more do you want? Bring friends, bring family! Share a bottle of wine while enjoying the view from the upper floors. They also have some delectable cheese plates for $5 or $10. Pretty good stuff on there.  I'll be back to sip some wine and watch some cows :)

reviews.author: Mercedes S.
reviews.description: Gorgeous place!!!! The view is unbeatable. The wine was amazing. The owner was there when I visited and there were 2 doggos. Wine and DOGS!!!! Needless to say I was in heaven

reviews.author: Christopher F.
reviews.description: We have driven past it many times and always said we should stop.  We finally did.  I was pleasantly surprised.  What I thought would be a road side tourist trap was an exceptionally good road side tourist trap.  We met a couple at the wine tasting room who had the same story - they finally decided to stop.  The bartender / sommelier was a very pleasant fellow.  He offered good advice on the wines as well as things to do in the surrounding area.  Although we arrived too late for the tasting (630pm on a Monday), we were able to indulge in a glass of vino.  The wine tasting room screamed of fine Tuscan influence.  The wood was solid.  There was a majestic painting in the room to give it an elegant and distinguished feel.  The commode was fit for a king or queen (unisex bathroom).   After we obtained our glass of wine, we went to the observation deck.  We had 360 degree views of well, I am not exactly sure.   Just rolling hills.  It is hill country after all.  I am sure it would be a great place to watch the sunset, but it was quite cloudy on our visit.   I give this roadside attraction two thumbs up.  It is well done and great place to stop for a glass of wine.

reviews.author: Kirk M.
reviews.description: My first and only visit.  I would have left a ZERO rating if that was an option.  1. We walked up to the bar and the lady behind the bar (late 40's to early 50's with glasses) was not friendly at all.  She did not greet us nor did she ask if this was our first time nor did she let us know if  she would be the one to serve us. Very poor demeanor.  However we let that pass and still decided to give the place a try.  2. While sitting at the bar area we noticed a stale cigarettes and ashtray odor, coming from behind the bar.  Just nasty , not sure if it was the bar area, bartender or trash.  3. We asked for the choice of five wines taster and how that was served The lady behind the bar answered the question by saying we can't use 5 glasses because we don't have enough to serve you all 5 tasting glasses at once.  Never really answered the question we asked. However we did note that the wine glass area had a huge selection of clean glasses. I guess she has an aversion to washing wine glasses [ see #4] .   4. We ordered our 5 tasters. They give you 1 glass of wine  and 4 'poker' chips.  When you order the next sample they take your dirty glass and 1 poker chip and then pour your next sample into the dirty glass. One would think to RINSE OUT THE WINE GLASS  so as to have a fresh CLEAN glass for the next sample.  The lady NEVER  cleaned the glasses after we tried each wine, even after we pointed this out.  5. The worst part about this visit was that the lady [older lady, a younger one showed up to help ]  was eating cheese and crackers while she was working behind the bar , and talking with her mouth full and food was falling out of her mouth while serving people. ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING.  6. The area behind the bar was filthy , boxes on top of the counter close to the bar top where customers sit,  the bar top was sticky, not once did we see the bartender wash her hands between serving customers or between eating her food and serving customers.  YOU SHOULD LEARN PROPER HYGEINE TECHNIQUES.   We had a our taster and left.   We wont be back and we will make sure to tell everyone we know to avoid this business and find a place further down the road.  There are MANY other wine tasting rooms, wineries and more that have clean facilities , better hygiene and friendly staff.

reviews.author: Allison G.
reviews.description: Wonderful place to stop by for amazing views and great wine! I am so glad we were there for sunset, but I would visit to take in scenery any time of day. It was busy when we arrived, but they did everything to serve us in a timely manner and help pick out a perfect wine. We will be back! :)

reviews.author: Cassandra M.
reviews.description: Arc de Texas is a great stop if you're in the Texas Hill Country. Their roof top has breath taking view that allows you to see for miles and miles. Arc de Texas does not make their own wines if that's what you're looking for, they sell different wines from all over the world. What makes this place stand out from being a glorified bar, you ask? The service is GREAT. The tasting room staff are knowledgeable in what they think you like - their usually right. I love that you can do a tasting of 5 different wines. What wine bar do you know that allows you to relax on a roof top patio and really just ENJOY the best parts of Texas? This place also doubles as a vacation spot with rooms and houses to rent. This place was perfect to end my anniversary with my husband. Can't wait to come again.

reviews.author: Gabrielle F.
reviews.description: This is a must-see stop on the way to Fredericksburg with great wine and service, plus amazing 360 degree views of hill country!

reviews.author: Audrey S.
reviews.description: We recently went to the Arc De Texas with a group of friends. Everyone was extremely friendly and let us taste wines before buying the bottle. There were several cheese/meat options to buy to enjoy with the wine. We took the bottles and cheese up to the rooftop to enjoy the awesome views. We liked it so much we went 2 days in a row! Would definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Went for a bday. Got to enjoy a jam session with a washtub bass. That was fun.  Beers were great and the brisket sandwich hit the spot.   Moose Out

reviews.author: S B.
reviews.description: Great place for some feel good American food and cold beer. TX Tech themed and down to earth staff make it a great place to fill up on football, beer, food, and friends..  Wreck'em!

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Man, if you have not tried this place, you are missing out! We were here a couple years ago and it was strictly a brewery.  Outstanding beer and great people. In case you have missed it, RER now has food...and DAMN! I got the pulled pork Cubano and my wife got the Hawaiian Pulled Pork. Her sandwich was really, really good.  She even said once it was gone, "I miss it already." My Cubano was a brilliant twist on a traditional Cuban, with the traditional ingredients, including pickle, ham, and mustard.  The addition of their house smoke pulled pork sent it into the next level. The beer here has been excellent from day one, but with the addition of a killer menu, this is now a one-stop shop that really needs to be on your list.  Summing up, phenomenal beers, next level sammys, and really great people.  Why more does one need?

reviews.author: Raechel T.
