reviews.description: I wish I lived in Johnson City so I could be a regular.  We'll definitely stop when we're driving through.  I loved all the Texas Tech decorations.  We really enjoyed the Pilsner and the Imperial Stout....next time I'll try some other beers.  The grilled cheese was perfectly done and the sausage wrap was tasty as well.  I appreciated the hand sanitizer that's at every table.  Extremely clean restaurant and bathrooms.

reviews.author: Keisha W.
reviews.description: Great beers good atmosphere and good food!  Good people create a great place. Looking for a local brewery. Check ''em out!

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: I revisited this place and found the beers and the temperature much better. This place seems to have stepped up their game, glad to see it. Love local breweries.

reviews.author: J S.
reviews.description: Visited on a packed night and still had stellar service and even got to chat with the owner a bit. Love the red ale!

reviews.author: Chad W.
reviews.description: If you are looking for a great local brewery Reck Em Right Brewery has something for everyone. They have several great food options and a ton of beer options. Well worth your stop. Friendly staff with the small town feel. A must stop for all.

reviews.author: Jeanne B.
reviews.description: Sorry...no pic. But it's a cool laid back place with good food. They temporarily ran out of brisket so I had pulled pork nachos. So good. Their salsa is homemade and it has a good kick.

reviews.author: Cindy D.
reviews.description: I had the Reuben with pulled pork on marbles rye. Super tasty! Very unique and enjoyable hangout stop along the way

reviews.author: Aliyah B.
reviews.description: this place was on our way back home and deff hit the spot! Sandwich was so good as well as the homemade root beer

reviews.author: Nick P.
reviews.description: Came in for lunch on a Sunday.  It seemed like a fairly limited menu to be honest. Brisket and sausage and for sides green beans, pinto beans and potato salad. Idk if that's normal but it's not very appealing. We ordered everything but pinto beans. The food came out and the bbq was room temp. Everything tasted great but I wasn't sure how the food for the only customers in the place as well as the first customer of the day since we showed up at 11:15 wasn't hot. Not bad bbq, just bad execution of the details.

reviews.author: Mark F.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a few brews last month and chatted it up with the owner/bartender. Nice guy and nice selection of brews.  Place doesn't look like much but hey, those are usually the best places, right?  Food truck outside serves up good stuff and the beers are varied and tasty, so get yer butt over there and have a few brews!

reviews.author: Steve G.
reviews.description: Great food, friendly people!  Tim will take good care of you. Terrific biscuit, and the pineapple barbecue pulled pork sandwich was the bomb. Food is quick and easy and reasonably priced. There's a comfortable small patio out front with fans to take the edge off the heat. Great if you've got 4 people or less. Went on a Sunday evening and it wasn't too crowded.

reviews.author: B C.
reviews.description: Hole in the wall with style. Had live music with an artist that was amazing! Classic riffs of great songs and vocals that shock you...thought I was at Austin's music scene! Beer was decent and food too but just a little pricey for what we got. Two sandwiches and two beers plus tip was about $50,  which seemed a bit much.... But it tasted dang good!!!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: Highly recommend the brisket Reuben. As I was eating it I was like "all Reubens should be made with smoked brisket" which is not entire true because I love regular Reubens but that's how good this sandwich was. The beer was also pretty good! And the location is great - they have a nice patio and you can see the LBJ site from it.

reviews.author: Don J.
reviews.description: Cozy place to enjoy some locally brewed beer.  Tim, the owner and brewmaster, is happy to tell you about his craft beers, including the Norwegian yeasts he selected for their compatibility with brewing in hot Texas weather.  To keep startup costs down, he did almost all of the construction himself - check out my picture of the beer flight holders he made from lumber.  Speaking of flights, I decided to try all 7 of the beers on tap. My favorites were the hazy IPA and both of the stouts.  All of the selections were solid.  I didn't see any food on the menu.  The interior space features an L-shaped bar good for socializing, a comfy love seat, a mini pool table, and whimsical touches such as a guitar sitting in a stand, ready for someone to pick up and play.  If hanging out indoors isn't your thing, there are a few outdoor tables under a ginormous oak branch.  While I also love the brewery around the corner, I plan on working Reck 'Em Right into my rotation!

reviews.author: Riki C.
reviews.description: The owner is super personable, the location is close to the shopping that you could sit between shopping, but lots of better parking then right off main/290!  Inside it's such a comfy and classy rustic style taproom!  I tried the amber and it was yummy and enjoyable ! I can't wait to go by when I have more time and to hang out and feel the environment even more! Definitely think you should it out!

reviews.author: Rodney Y.
reviews.description: New menu is sandwiches and chips. Seems food comes from next door. Maybe a COVID deal. Good selection of beer. Not crowded mid afternoon.

reviews.author: Susan G.
reviews.description: Really cute place hidden on a side street in Johnson City. Had the Orange Seltzer and Popper Queso. All yummy! Definitely on the list to come back.

reviews.author: Ardie S.
reviews.description: How have I not reviewed the kind people at this wonderful establishment yet?  I so enjoy the the solace of their old farmhouse venue. And the great ciders they serve up certainly do not hurt the wallet or the ambience.  It's so relaxing sitting at the picnic tables out among the oaks listening to your favorite band. Strategically placed fans hidden among the trees aid in making the glade that doubles as a stage tolerable even on 90º days.  In these seemingly never-ending days of the pandemic, it's also refreshing to see the servers masking up indoors and out. I tend not to venture out too much for exactly that reason, but felt totally safe here even when ordering inside the tap room.  Maybe I should keep it a secret, but it's also one of those places you want to share exactly because it is so very special.

reviews.author: Kaci C.
reviews.description: Wonderful place! We went on a recommendation while we visited family. The ciders were great, as was the food. The only issue we ran into was that we ordered hummus, and the person taking our order didn't let us know that it didn't come with bread or anything else to eat it with. Considering we had just had a conversation with her about it being our first time there, we're about to present she didn't let us know that important bit of info. Not a big deal, and the person who brought us our food outside asked if we had ordered anything to eat it with and quickly brought us an order of a baguette.  Aside from the establishment itself, the vendors selling goods were all friendly and talented, and the other patrons of the establishment were friendly as well. We struck up several conversations with passers-by.  I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Ellen G.
reviews.description: We love Texas Keeper Cider! Their tasting room is out a ways from Austin, but is on the most lovely grounds. They often have wonderful live music and their drinks are absolutely perfect for a Texas summer. They are so refreshing. We got one of the picnic baskets and it was full of yummy cheese, sliced meats and bread. Highly recommend!  It is worth noting, they do not have a full lunch/dinner menu. They basically have an assortment of DIY charcuterie boards, which we really enjoyed. However, if you go expecting a full dinner you may be disappointed.

reviews.author: Devon G.
reviews.description: The cider, the wine, the live music! What amazing vibes! The staff is friendly and it has some farmhouse style that is warm and comfy. They have a layout showing how sweet items are and let you sample, so you pick the right one!  Parking is massive and close to the large lot that houses bee keeper.

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Pretty great ciders! Did the tasting. Eat before you go if you are a fatty like me. I wasnt too fond of the food although i love their jellies! Nice outside area ... dogs and children allowed.  They also have live music!( but I was just there for the cider‍)  Will definitely go again!

reviews.author: Marianne L.
reviews.description: I have been a long time fan of Texas Keeper Cider. I love the Tap Room, the grounds, the staff and especially the cider. The cider is dry and they make a wide variety of ciders to appeal to many palates.  They have successfully reopened the Tap Room and I decided to have my belated retirement party there. I was able to reserve a space for my large group and the staff was very attentive. If I had one criticism, it would be their food choices.  It's now a make your own picnic, and you choose cheeses, meats, and sides. It's not really a charcuterie tray, as they don't prep the plate.  The cheeses,  meats and bread all need to be sliced.  This made eating difficult with a large group. Most of my guests had to leave early so they could go eat somewhere else.  I know this new menu makes it easier for the staff, and they are a cidery, not a restaurant, but I miss their old menu.  I will still go to Texas Keeper Cider, but may not hang out as long.  (Or make sure I eat beforehand!) Overall, it's a beautiful South Austin gem.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: The ciders are essentially tribute to the apple gods, extremely generously priced, and the cidery is tucked away--makes for a great escape from the city of Austin!  Came on a rainy day with some girlfriends after dinner, and we LOVED it. It reminded me of Jester King Brewery because of the fact that it felt very off-road and secluded. If you're driving at night and a little too fast you might miss the entrance, so slow down as your GPS tells you you're near. The stone cobble walkway is so organic and lovely, that it felt like we were entering into a storytale cottage. Upon entering, everything screams wood and warm pinterest vibes. The three of us sat down at their tall barstool table, and started on our flight! What prices! Normally they do 5 for $9, but they tapped out of one of the selections so we did 4 for $7! Such a great price for the variety of ciders. I loved their hefeweizen + cider combo, and the first cider on their flight list (a name I forgot). Everything was so juicy and tasty, would highly recommend coming back.   The staff is very knowledgeable, and the lady doing the taptending that night was so sweet and helpful. She trusted that we knew which selection we were on during our flight. She also told us that there are five cideries in all of Austin! So for my cider lovers--let's hit all of them up.

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: I don't know why it took me so long to get here but now that I've been, I'll be telling everyone about it and making return trips! If you're a fan of Argus Cidery, you'll like this place. I do think Texas Cider Keeper is making cleaner ciders than Argus (nothing was infected or had off-flavors).   It's easy to miss the entrance, but it's right next to the cemetery! The outdoor space is very quaint but all Texas and has tons of picnic tables. The tasting room is beautiful with butcher block tables and plenty of seating.   We opted for the tasting flight menu which is five 2 oz. pours for $9. Their mainstay Texas Keeper Cider No.1 is dry, refreshing and well balanced. I'm not a fan of sweet ciders, so this was perfect.  I also really liked their Grafter Rose -- which is made with Rome apples and some grapes, which gives it the beautiful rose hue. It's also on the drier side, which is nice.   Our least fave of the five had to be the Cider Weizen, which had a bit too much coriander (and this is coming from a girl who LOVES coriander and hefeweizen beers).   The bartenders were all knowledgeable and really try to give you an explanation of each cider they're pouring (a la a wine tasting).   They also have a tempranillo wine on tap because in Texas it all falls under a "fruit fermentation" permit. Apples, wines, it's all the same permit.   I'll be making it a point to come here more often, and I would if traffic getting through downtown and south Austin traffic weren't so bad.

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: My new favorite place in Austin. Love everything about it.  It's basically the only Place I ever want to be. If you haven't been yet- get on the ball!  The cider is so delicious - nothing is overly sweet and they have a good assortment of dry and well-balanced choices. Their sampler is 9$ for 5 generous pours and is a great way to find the cider you like most. For us it's the rose, but the original is a close second. Your best bet is to purchase a bottle and drink affordably. You even get a discount when you purchase bottles to go (although I'm not sure if that's just at the end of the night - we've closed this place down a few times).   We are also big fans of the food. The carrots in a blanket are so yummy and very unique! A must-have. The curried egg salad is a go-to as well. It's made with eggs from their own chickens! They also add pickled veggies on the side which is always a win for me.   The location is so spacious and beautiful. Plenary of tables inside and out. Even a great view from one side where you can watch the sunset over the trees. I've enjoyed live music there and loved the tunes they were playing inside.

reviews.author: Matt H.
reviews.description: We went here with some friends for the first time. It's a beautiful place at night to sit out on the lawn under the string up lights with your dogs and enjoy some cider.  The bartender was awesome and more than glad to educate us on all the stuff that goes into making cider.  Our friends got this HUGE cheese board that was really well priced too.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: One year later I returned for their 1st Anniversary Party and release of The Grafter Blanc.  For $9.50 (w/fees) your ticket included your admission and 10 oz tulip glass (not the standard 12 oz tulip most breweries sell for $5-6). There were no drink tickets included; all cider and other offerings were for purchase only.  Certainly not the best deal in town....a town full of breweries with taproom festivities.  The Grafter Blanc is definitely my favorite of their ciders, with the perfect balance of acidity, tartness and dryness.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Wow! So before coming here I always assumed ciders as overly sweet and flavored froo-froo drinks for those who don't like beer. I have never felt so mislead before! Cider is made from apples (no matter what the flavor), and real, legit cider is found here! It isn't overly sweet and there are many different kinds! Some reminded me of wine and a not-so-Sweet cider mixed together.  At Texas Keep there is room to bring a large group, or even the dogs or kids to run around. There is a small indoor area with games and a huge outdoor area with room to move about and enjoy the Texas sun (or stars).  The people here really enjoy and are PROUD of what they do. They are excited to tell you the story behind the names of the ciders and what they entail. They have seasonals and guest bottles and taps. Normally I would feel gross trying something out of a bottle opposed to tap, but the whole experience was so eye-opening, I didn't care. They told me their 1 bottle of (maybe a 750ml cider) has about 10mg of sugar in it as opposed to he "cider" I knew such as Angry Orchard that has upwards of 50mg PER BOTTLE! Yowza- no wonder they were too sweet!  I was definitely iffy about coming here since they didn't serve "regular beer", but I'm definitely glad I stepped out of my comfort zone- and you should, too!  Only reason it's not 5 stars- the food "truck" setup (not a truck just a station) was out of food by 6:30p on a Saturday night. We had ordered 1 of the 4 items on the menu for our group to try. When we went back to order our favorites, they claimed they were out of everything and turned around and took 1 more order. Annoying. So we ordered a pizza and left early to meet the delivery man at home. Maybe have more food or more options and we would've stayed until the 9p close.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Such a gem that's tucked away in far South Austin/Manchaca! The. Best. Cider. It's fresh, crisp and abundant here. Even a little bit of mead on tap too. We've been here during all seasons of the year and the property is always gorgeous and inviting. Staff is so knowledgeable and helpful. The kitchen is Now built in to the main tasting room. The fresh house made popcorn is absolutely awesome. This is a family friendly establishment as well and very nice of them to accommodate young children in a pretty adult setting! We are very thankful and grateful and it certainly keeps us as loyal customers.

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a quick drive out to TKC on a Sunday. It was awfully hot and there was plenty of shade. We brought our dog too but he could not go inside which was challenging even for ordering. Our favorite cider is the No. 1! There was an event going on that sounded fun so we will definitely check out those options. We did not order food, just did a shared tasting. No one came outside to check on us or offer to pour and tell us about the cider which is common when visiting wineries with our dog and friends. It's a cute little spot for a weekend drive.

reviews.author: Liz S.
reviews.description: Súper cute romantic spot to come with your significant other or girlfriends.  The atmosphere is excellent.  They had live music on Saturday when we ran into this cute spot.  We ordered a flight of cider and had some garlic kettle corn, but regretted not getting the cheese plate because it would have been perfect with the acidity of the cider.  Zach, who served us, made our experience more memorable.  Definitely a spot to visit when in Austin.

reviews.author: Seela M.
reviews.description: This is a great place to bring out of town guests. The 9$ flight is lovely and a bargain. The grounds are beautiful and the staff friendly. You can hang out and play bird games or sit outside on picnic tables. The food is not quite  awesome yet, but decent if you want tot munch along with your cider. The ciders are dry dry dry and not gross apple soda tasting like Eastciders (barf). "Stillage" is amazing.

reviews.author: Vicktoria R.
reviews.description: Super tasty food. Drinks are tops and they have toys for kids in their outdoor area. Seating was nice and the misters keep it comfortable even in the summer heat.

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: I recently stopped by your venue for the first time and I have to say, it was so delightful that we are planning to return as soon as we can! The cheese board was delicious but the cider was out of the world! Your staff was incredibly friendly and helpful; the customer service was very nice! Until next time!

reviews.author: Kurt A.
reviews.description: This cidery is unique in that it has the best cider in Austin per dollar.  The Cider Noir, Grafter Blanc, and Cider Weizen are all delicious.

reviews.author: Joe B.
reviews.description: I've been here four times and will keep coming back. The location itself is beautiful - plenty of outdoor space surrounded by forest and a valley. The ciders are so much better than what you find in the beer aisle at the grocery store, and they have a surprisingly large selection. During the week, this is a great place for a quiet, relaxing evening. During the weekends, especially when they are hosting a festival or band, it's a different atmosphere (but still great) - lively and fun, a good place for friends to hang out if they're tired of the usual bar scene.  The only negative preventing Texas Keeper from five stars is the new food menu. While the ciders are fairly priced, the food is anything but. We ordered a cheese and meat tray for $20 and got a platter with barely enough for one person. When we asked for more crackers, they charged us $2 more. Hopefully, this new menu is still a work in progress and they will make adjustments until it is reasonable.

reviews.author: Chris E.
reviews.description: Very nice place, I came from California to try. Staff was nice, bathrooms were clean and the beer was great!

reviews.author: Dana T.
reviews.description: Love this place. Lots of good options. I think 8.5 minutes abs is even better than electric jellyfish.  The people that work there are great! Also they host watch parties for Austin FC. Go Verde!

reviews.author: Nancy Z.
reviews.description: Always a great time here! They have Meade, to hop water to yummy Lovely Day IPA.  Clean place and clean toilets.   Don't forget to check out their food truck!

reviews.author: Rosie J.
reviews.description: Such a fun place to hang out and grab a beer and some food! The hopwater is an awesome option if you don't want to drink but still want to have the brewery experience. The food truck was great too and prices are very reasonable.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Great patio that's dog and kid friendly, complete with the Austin Steam Train behind it.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Whitestone Brewery is a great place to grab a beer and relax after work or watch an Austin FC game. They have a large patio for all their events like trivia and bingo and plenty of seating inside. Head here for some great Texas beers.

reviews.author: Jim R.
reviews.description: Awesome brewery!, excellent selection. Amazing atmosphere!, great service and the food from Van Dams is Awesome with great prices. Just became a Pub Member for these reasons!!!

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Wow I can't believe I've forgotten to review here. I LOVE their beer and location. Always great beers on rotation and the flight tray is cool.  Only reason for the 4 starts is today we came for what had to be the 6th or 7th  time and got kicked to the outside patio for having a dog. This is ALWAYS the brewery I go to when it's hot because they allowed dogs inside. I've had every other bartender let my dog in, love on him and have had zero problem sitting inside with him. Even their Facebook has a picture of a dog inside. Today we were told that was never allowed and should have been told to go outside. We have also seen many other dogs inside during past visits. I hate inconsistent rules. Also, super sad that we'll have to find a new brewery this summer. It's too hot to be outside and my dogs nickname is the the brewery dog.  I'll still support them during cooler months-- but dog owners should know the rules have changed. Very sad. Wish they would have posted something about this change.

reviews.author: Ryan D.
reviews.description: A nice flight of light non IPA beers. No food. Only a food truck but nice atmosphere indoor/outdoor.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: Great beer vibe. Plenty of seating inside and outside. Parking kinda sucks.  The menu has a really good range of beers that I haven't seen anywhere else. Beer is cold and food options are good too. We had nachos and loaded tots. The Austin FC bold game was on. They had green beer and if you wore green you got a $1 off

reviews.author: Ellie B.
reviews.description: Phenomenal - amazing brewery atmosphere. Came on a Christmas holiday Friday night they had name that tune bingo going, was so fun to watch! Wish I had known would've joined ASAP  God I love Texas

reviews.author: Alexandra P.
reviews.description: Pretty good ambiance. Spaced out seating inside and outdoor seating available. Place was visibly clean and also smelled very clean! We got loaded tots from the food truck outside that were yummy. All the beers that we tried were good but the mango one was my favorite!

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Whitestone Brewery. The environment felt very relaxed and casual and I loved the outside patio area. We got a selection of beers, I personally really enjoyed the Mango Crazy wheat beer and the Keyboard Gansta IPA. The service was also very friendly and they offered some samples if you are in between choices.   The taco truck outside was also very good! I highly recommend one of their loaded fries. The fries were perfectly crispy and tender in the middle, and super flavorful toppings. The tacos were also yummy and I'm a huge corn lover so the elote bowl was perfect.   I will definitely be back to try more of their seasonal beers!

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: It's been a hot minute since I visited Whitestone- I think the last time I was here was in 2016, when it was quieter and a lot more laid back.  Fast forward to 2021 - the city of cedar park and Leander are booming.  There is a huge influx of population. The tables at Whitestone are full, there is a food truck (which is awesome) as a permanent fixture BUT the overall customer experience has left me disappointed.  Maybe because it's a Sunday with lovely weather, the guy behind the bar is done with people, or, he isn't a people person , or, he just didn't like the way I looked? But man was it hard to get him to give me an effing beer without getting hateful glances. Yeesh. Im kinda scared of coming back here now!  That aside, im not really a fan of their beer selection either - the kolsch is OK but I've had better. I guess the biggest advantage is the proximity to both CP and Leander and for the people who live around here.  So, this isn't much of a review rather than a semi rant ?   Also guys- kids have a tendency to move around from one side of the table to the other. They're not capable of sitting still and neither are you. If you'd rather than families stay away, just tell us to our faces.

reviews.author: Nicolette M.
reviews.description: Ambiance - 9/10 Pricing - 10/10 Staff - 10/10 Food - 10/10   Overall, the service is great! The ladies behind the counter are very nice and loaded with insights about the beers. There's a food truck outside that was delish!! (Tacos and burgers) the al pastor tacos were amazing. We did not try the burgers but from what I've seen/heard it's also very yummy! Whitestone is in a great location in Cedar Park, TX. We are heading to Balcones state park to go hiking but saw this along the way and had to stop in. I'm glad we did!

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Huge covered patio! We stopped by while we were in the area and what a nice brewery to grab a beer at. I had the Blonde beer and it was light and crisp. They had a Food truck hanging outside so if you wanted to partake that was great.   Suggestions- In the guys bathroom the keg should be a little bit higher. Pretty tough for tall guys lol. But, I love the concept.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Friendly, on top of it staff and great variety in beer. Love the hop water too! We've been coming here since the opening and it just keeps getting better! Love our Whitestone Family!

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to hang out in Cedar Park but it is in a busy strip mall. The service is good and you can get some beer flights and the prices are very reasonable. My fiancé and I had a good time here and the live music was awesome!  I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Great local brewery!  Friendly and helpful staff, great tasting beers and a food truck out back - what else do you need?

reviews.author: Theresa S.
reviews.description: We like IPAs and we were  able to get a beer flight with 6 IPAs - they were all delicious!  Able to take advantage of happy hour which apparently starts at 2pm.  Seems to be a very popular spot!  Love the beer names too.  Lovely Day IPA and Ray Ray hazy IPA were some of our favorites!

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: I'm surprised I haven't been here sooner because I love their beer. There's ample seating indoors and outdoor, and they have a great selection of beer.   There was also a food truck that sold burgers, where you had to order at the bar. I would definitely come here again :)

reviews.author: Tristan B.
reviews.description: Solid beers, cool space. Bartenders are a little cold and the tap list while usually varied, can sometimes be a bit lacking.   That aside, still a solid vibe and a good place to meet up with friends.

reviews.author: Sherry P.
reviews.description: I like the set up and idea. Inside brewery and seating tables. Outside food truck. Order everything inside.  Comfortable atmosphere, good inside music, and great variety of beers. The tacos and burger are fantastic!   Get you a cold one!

reviews.author: Vanessa S.
reviews.description: A local staple. Everyone knows about this place so don't expect any one on one experiences. Great outdoor area, family friendly, and be on the lookout for events! Don't forget to walk on the right side of the bar for stickers and other treasures

reviews.author: Kasey F.
reviews.description: Visiting on a Sunday afternoon. Plenty of outdoor space. Nice and sunny with umbrellas and patio tables. I ordered a 4beer flight from the 25 or so they offered. They're all good so far. (My only disappointment is that they don't offer a sour. Please, make a sour!!)  Currently waiting on my food order. There's a taco truck here today.

reviews.author: Sam S.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a couple in the tent on a recent chilly Saturday afternoon. The beer is great and the variety of experimental beers makes for a fun beer day. Good beer people!

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Love this place and love that they have food trucks. Great indoor and outdoor seating as welll

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: I feel conflicted giving a fairly low rating given I consistently think of ABW as one of the top handful of breweries in Austin, but I'm giving this as a rating of the taproom experience moreso than a rating of their beers. I've also only gone during Covid, so I'm looking forward to giving them a try in the future when I can comfortably get the full experience.   Compared to other patios in the area I find theirs to be pretty lacking. There were no fans in the summer and no heat lamps in the winter. Their space isn't particularly large so there are fewer tables than other locations. This leads it to be uncomfortably packed on weekends, both in terms of how close tables are and the lack of distancing enforced in lines.   One weird thing working against them is just how available their beer is around town. Every HEB and bar will have at least a couple of ABW's beers available, so they lose out on the necessity of going to the taproom to try their beers. Even their seasonals get around town pretty well both in stores and on tap elsewhere.   On that note, and to not make this review totally negative, their beer is absolutely phenomenal. All their flagships are good to great examples of the style, my personal favorites are the Sun Shovel (think blue moon but with some hop prescence) and Fire Eagle (leans more towards West Coast IPA, but has enough juiciness to be really refreshing in the summer time).   Their seasonals also absolutely knock it out of the park. Sputnik (Coffee Oatmeal Stout) is an absolute must if you're in Austin in December and is probably the best beer I've had since moving here. The Heisenberg (a combination of a Pilsner and Hef) and Black Thunder (Black Lager) are two other stand outs to me.  The food truck is good enough that if you need something to snack on while you're there you won't be totally dissatisfied, but I've usually felt compelled to go elsewhere for food.  Overall, can't recommend their beer enough, but you don't need to visit the taproom to get the full experience.

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: After three months of sheltering at home, Austin Beer Works was a first outing.  They did an excellent job with social distancing, wiping down each table after guests left, and mask enforcement (when not seated at table) in a firm but polite way.    No inside seating right now and the outdoor tables are shaded and a good distance apart. It is reservations only. depending on the time you make the reservation for, you will either get an hour to enjoy your table or two hours.  They go over all the rules with you when you arrive.  They have some great beers, both on tap and in cans. You can purchase some to take home with you as well!  I ordered a sour raspberry-lemon Einhorn.  So summery and refreshing!  I ended up drinking two.  My husband had an Essential IPA and the Small Spoon session IPA.   We didn't care for the Heisenberg Heff-lager (a bit too banana-ish).  The only thing that would have made the difference from 4 stars to 5 would have been some kind of food! Even a bag of chips or pretzels to go with the beer would have been awesome! We saw a food truck parked there but unfortunately it was not open.

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: I don't have anything negative to say about Austin Beerworks other than the occasional difficulty with parking. I've only had that issue a few times though. The staff is incredibly helpful and knowledgable, but I think the best part of the experience (other than the drinks) is the atmosphere. The interior is very spacious which makes it a perfect space for a casual happy hour with coworkers while the exterior has an abundance of seating. I'll definitely be returning if I am ever up that direction!

reviews.author: heather g.
reviews.description: Austin Beer Works doesn't always have Spurs, but when they do, they are THE BEST!! If you haven't tried a Tropical Einhorn and you like spurs, you're missing out!  The staff are AMAZING and the set up both inside and outside are fun. Totally family friendly and they have an awesome food truck on site (permanently)

reviews.author: Novalina N.
reviews.description: Cool that they're open now!  Arrived around 4 and it was busy so waited around 20 minutes before we could be seated  There's no markers on the ground so lines seemed to form in different places when I was there. Didn't particularly like it when people were right behind me (thanks covid). Hope they add these markers soon!

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: I really want to love this place but their service is just terrible. Every single time I come, they make it feel like it's an inconvenience to them that I need a minute to order or if I have a question, they make it seem like I should have their menu memorized.   They do have a larger beer selection for local breweries, parking is hit and miss, outdoor seating is mostly shaded. Inside is picnic seating. There's a food truck here if you get hungry. I feel ok bringing my dogs here.   The service is just that bad that I can't recommend them as much as their beer gives them credit for.

reviews.author: Angelique G.
reviews.description: Terrible service.  Every staff member we came across was rude and unwelcoming. They made it seem like it was an Inconvenience to order water and just ordering in general felt uncomfortable because they seemed in a rush and unfriendly when there was not more than one person else in line. The beer is good but not worth coming back.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: The beer was super mid the best beer I had was a 5/10 and I got a flight. So at least 3 beers were a 4 or less out of 10. I would recommend going to Adelberts instead. Adelberts is a least 10x better.

reviews.author: Savannah W.
reviews.description: We decided to try out a brewery near us since we just moved here. We got here around 6:30 and it was decently busy for a Wednesday night. We waited in line with a mask on and ordered. The man was helpful and recommend the cherry sour to me since they don't have ciders. My boyfriend got two different lagers, one was dark and one was light(I think it was called like the best ever or the most awesome) he liked both a lot but preferred the lighter one, and I really liked my cherry sour. It would be nice to see breweries trying to use class beer cups instead of plastic but with covid most places are doing single use plastic sadly. We took our dog and everyone was friendly. They even give you chips and salsa with your drinks. The ambiance was great, there was a food truck, and a cool courtyard with tables and a kids area. All around a cool place!

reviews.author: Dustin C.
reviews.description: Hidden gem! I'm not sure I would have ever known this place was here. Tucked back in a industrial park it's got good games and great space for groups. Family friendly and even a play area for the kids!  Nice selection of beers, and sell cans to go.

reviews.author: Stella M.
reviews.description: Love this spot! Great little area for kiddos, food truck with yummy Mexican food (impossible "meat" too!) and a great beer section! I'm all about it!

reviews.author: Caroline V.
reviews.description: Excellent citrusy beer with reduced gluten! Really fun environment for hanging with friends and just being around people!

reviews.author: Annie M.
reviews.description: Loving this brewery! It feels and looks clean. There is hand sanitizer on every table, and the staff is friendly. Our beer also came with free chips and salsa! I have never been to a brewery that offered that. I ordered the tropical einhorn sour and it is delicious!! It's sour but not too sour, and it is super refreshing!

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: What a fabulous hang out!  We hung out on the roof!  Food truck has yummy burgers and DELISH tator tots! Wine selection is small but the Cupcake Chardonnay isn't too bad!  Just a bit outside San Mo - cute place!  Live music!!!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Beer seems to be hit or miss. But overall it's a great atmosphere, dog friendly (even fenced areas for them to roam). The road is sort of loud, but it's a nice and relaxing atmosphere. The food truck is incredible! The burgers are great and the tots are extra crispy and perfect!

reviews.author: Rita K.
reviews.description: Our first time and we loved it! Adored the burgers - really hit the spot. The fried pickles were amazing. Beers were also great and staff was helpful and accommodating- your dog is welcome! Chill vibe.

reviews.author: Kaitlin B.
reviews.description: This place is total trash. Don't eat here if you are starving to death. I asked them to at least melt the cheese on the tots and it was the end of the world. They were rude and their food is gross.

reviews.author: Bridget S.
reviews.description: Loved Middleton before COVID, managed to still support them during, and am delighted to be back now that we're on the road back. They spent the pandemic brewing up some tasty new beers to add to their already delicious standards, I think Good might have replaced Third Coast as my favorite while Evil has supplanted my husband's usual Juicy Visions. And have to give a shout-out to the edition of the Burger Truck--wonderful, especially the bacon/Brussels sprout combo (I know, sounds weird but so good!). We were so worried about our local hang-outs surviving the pandemic and couldn't be happier that Middleton not only survived but is coming back stronger than ever.

reviews.author: Jorge S.
reviews.description: Nice brewery with a very nice facility. Staff was friendly and they do allow dogs. It was a little to hot outside to enjoy their roof top patio area.

reviews.author: Rebeca G.
reviews.description: The COVID precautions are great! Tables are spread out indoors as well as in outdoor seating. I was impressed with the table cards that help guest determine if tables are clean or in need of cleaning. Overall very clean space.   As it relates to the atmosphere, like mentioned kept very clean, and customer service is great. Service was great inside was helped decide what drinks to get and given samples of a few to help make decisions. Service was also great outside with the food truck.   For the quality and experience the price for everything was great! The beers taste amazing and the kombucha was fantastic. The burgers were very tasty. Best burgers I've had in a long time.   A sight you just see for yourself!

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: I'm going to get this out of the way real quick.  There was a cat walking around on the bar.  Yes, you heard me.  ON THE BAR.  I knew it was a dog friendly place, but come on - a cat ON the bar?  It even walked over to my side of the bar, sat down, put its leg behind its head like cats do, and then proceeded to lick its butt in front of me.  Hey cat, I'm really impressed that you can do that, but you're not getting a tip from me.  The staff member that it belonged to shooed it away, but it stayed on the bar.  Subtract one star for this show.  Next up:  As I said, it's dog friendly.  VERY dog friendly.  There were two dogs belonging to customers roaming around freely inside the place.  A third dog was on a leash, but it kept barking at the other dogs.  This wasn't outside on the patio, this was all inside.  When I go somewhere to hang out and relax, I don't want to deal with barking dogs (in my book, it's akin to bringing screaming kids into a bar).  Subtract one star for letting the dogs inside.  Keep the cats and dogs *outside* and this would be a five star brewery to chillax at.    Beer:  They have a decent selection of brews and like most breweries, they have some permanent ones and some seasonals that rotate in and out.  They have five or six store bought wines available.  Staff:  VERY knowledgeable about their beer and can suggest something for you once you describe your taste palette to them.  Food:  The food truck out front is permanently hitched up here, the one in the back changes occasionally.    Plenty of seating inside and outside, there's even a spacious deck on the second floor.  Growler refills are $14 and crowlers are $9.40 (buy three crowlers and get 10 percent off).  If your selection is over 8 percent ABV, additional charges may apply.   One more note about the dogs and I'll put this puppy to bed.  There's a fenced off area downstairs to let your dogs run rampant in - put them in there instead of bringing them inside - or better yet, leave them at home.  This whole thing with people bringing their dogs everywhere is getting out of hand.    I was going to give them two solid stars, but now that I think about it, if they let cats run back and forth across their bars, how clean is their brewing process?  It's a cool place with good brews, and I want to like it, but when I think about the animals everywhere, I think twice about what might be in the beer.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Nice spot floor brews and live music. I was told that the food trucks are good.  Maybe next time.    Suggestions- Check music lineup. Surprisingly older crowd spot.  Moose Out

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Was hoping to love this place, but we were pretty disappointed with the beer selection... Love the space and the dog friendliness! Plus we heard the food truck was awesome! But the beers just really fell short... Maybe we are a little too spoiled living in Austin around so many amazing breweries

reviews.author: Jasmine G.
reviews.description: I'm giving this place one star for the burger truck. Our beers were good and I like the atmosphere inside. The guy in the burger truck was SO rude. The table next to us also had multiple issues with their orders that they were loudly complaining about. I asked for the loaded tots with no beef and he said he couldn't ring them up that way. We weren't asking for a discount, just remove the beef???? So then he said to get regular tots and add cheese and onions/jalapeños. What did we get? Plain tots. He was also so fricking unfriendly. The table next to us retired a burger that had the bun top black/burned, and apparently he complained about redoing it. Brewery needs to rethink this employee.

reviews.author: Benjamin B.
reviews.description: Visited for the first time in 6+ years on a quiet night. Jimmy made our vacation sweet as hell and took the best care of us possible. Good conversation and great beers. Glad to know this place has only gotten better since college. Keep killing it, guys.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Middleton is a must if you're stopping by or even in the general area.  We were driving from Wimberley (a fun day at Jacob's Well) towards the San Marcos outlets, and had to double back even to come to Middleton! We were so glad we did. My bf even walked out with their peach crowler...just a warning though, bring a cooler of some sort so it doesn't explode in your car with the heat! Totally speaking from personal experience, sadly.  We shared two rounds of tasters, which come with 5 different selections. So come with friends and try them all! You'll be surprised at how delicious they all are. Middleton is also HEAVEN for Belgian lovers. Good thing we love Belgians. Little did I know that a microbrew outside of Austin would be a great place for craft Belgians. I'm an all-around beer lover--everything except saisons, NE pale ales, and lagers, whereas the bf is a Belgian enthusiast. He always goes for Belgians. So you can imagine why we decided to get a taste of everything Belgian. I also enjoyed their Easy Ride PA, but was not a fan of the chile IPA (to each their own). It was almost impossible for me to compare and contrast the beer quality to the all-around atmosphere of the place. It oozes joy and love--they have brew dogs (and customers can bring doges too) who basically just lie around and nap, PLUS they have popcorn that is self-serve from those tiny machines that you see in Disneyland and other carnival events.  Will definitely be back to Middleton. Clean restrooms, and large space indoors for bigger groups (WITH TV's!) and cool fun outdoors games like human jenga outside. There is plenty of parking in their private loose, gravel parking area, and they had a food truck parked right outside. Awesome spot, great beer, fantastic space!

reviews.author: Cesar R.
reviews.description: Heading to the Texas hill country? Love beer? Make sure to stop at Middleton Brewery!  I will confess I am not a huge beer lover but my friends are and were raving about this place so we  stopped by to watch the Euro Cup game between Germany and Italy.  The brewery is well design with great bar space and patio area. Dogs are welcome so bring your pup, children not so much ;-).   Step up to the bar and build your own beer flight you get five picks of 2-3 ounces each for $12. There wasn't a beer I didn't like! From the Porter to the American Red there were all good!   Live band was great and the two flat screens more than met our soccer watching needs.  So if your looking for a place to get your hops fix in the Texas Hill Country this is it!

reviews.author: Steve K.
reviews.description: A MUST for anyone looking for an essential hill country experience. Delicious beer in a variety of styles. Wonderful atmosphere.   2 world famous brewery mascots; Pinky the dog (as white and large as Gandalf's horse). Dunkel the cat (omnipresent and all-knowing)  Dunkel is the sweetest cat and deserves to be in the brewery hall of fame. Some heartless punk in the reviews below complained about Dunkel. This same guy has a Lonestar beer as his profile pic, so at least we know he has ZERO brewery review credibility.   As a result Dunkel's been banned from the taproom. So, Thank you, Lonestar bro, for driving out from your big city to a enchanting, rural, authentic hill country brewery and complaining about an animal for no good reason.   Knowing the type of compassionate, animal-loving people who frequent this place, I'm sure we can rally together to #FREEDUNKEL.

reviews.author: Lindsay J.
reviews.description: Didn't have a drink, but stopped in for the experience...It is a very cool vibe!!! Singing, dancing, drinking on a Friday night = Perfection!  I was jealous I couldn't stay. If only I lived in the Hill Country, I would do this all the time. There was a live band.  There is a dance floor. There are two food trucks. And, there is plenty of beer to try. The location is between Wimberley, Canyon Lake and San Marcos...As the Hill Country grows, places love me this are a great option for all those migrating South!

reviews.author: James P.
reviews.description: My wife and I took my cousin and his wife for a visit on a quiet weekend. My wife and I are avid animal lovers and thus it's hard to describe our feelings about this place. On entering, there were numerous dogs wandering around and a cat walking across the bar, and after we sat down there were animal feces and urine on the floor. Needless to say, this was offputting to our group. Unfortunately, we did not notice the animal waste until we had already ordered. The service was average and somewhat lackluster. Nobody checked on us after we ordered our beer. As for the beer, it was good quality craft beer but nothing stood out at us. Take him away the issues with the animal waste, we still would not have found this an impressive venue and probably would not return. This is truly a shame, given the place's 4.5-star reviews on Yelp.

reviews.author: Tawnya V.
reviews.description: Went to Middleton Brewery, it was a lot of fun.  The beer was great and the staff was very nice.  They have the floor marked off for social distancing while waiting in line to get your beer.  There was a plexiglass in front of the bartender and the card reader was placed so you put it in the reader to pay and the bartender does not have to touch it.  All the tables inside and outside were at least 6 feet apart and the walkway was set up so you did not have to walk by any tables.  The brewery was very clean and I felt very safe there with this pandemic we have going on.

reviews.author: Priscilla Y.
reviews.description: We made a quick stop here on our road trip to San Antonio. The beers we got were really good and it seemed like a fun atmosphere. The bsrtenders were friendly. They have an outdoor patio out front and also an awesome rooftop deck. Free popcorn! They don't sell food, but there is a food truck outside.

reviews.author: Janeisy S.
reviews.description: Good spot to relax and unwind. They have complimentary popcorn, games such as Monopoly, Cards Against Humanity, etc. It's a dog friendly environment with open mic night from 6-9 on Mondays. (Which was the day of my visit). We were helped by Josh. He gave us nice recommendations about beer pairings/tastings.

reviews.author: Krista H.
reviews.description: A hidden gem! Meanwhile is one of my favorite places in Austin! It is located in the middle of a business park, but once you get on the grounds you feel like you are truly transported. Not only do they have their brewery and taproom on site, they also have 4 food trucks! You can pair your beer with tacos, pizza, bbq, or amazing ice cream!  My personal favorite beers here are their sours. They keep their menu fresh and change it up frequently, so if you see something you might enjoy, go quickly! The best part about their location is the open space and seating area. There are so many tables and benches throughout the back and they even have a stage with live music on certain days. The environment is so fun and you will see lots of dogs and children around too. I appreciate that they have a playground for kids.   If you are not a beer drinker, they also serve cocktails made with seltzers and amazing coffee drinks! I love their vanilla latte and will opt to get that most of the times I go there!  Overall, there is something for everyone here! Between the drink selections, food options, seating area, and live music, everyone in your group will have fun! I will always recommend Meanwhile!

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: One of my favorite spots in Austin. I love the venue under the live oak trees, the open space, and the playground. No hard alcohol, but I feel they make up for it with their creative cocktails and house-made seltzers.   The food trucks give enough variety that there is something for everyone -- pizza, BBQ, Mexican, and the BEST ice cream! But the best part for me is sitting back in the Adirondack, cold drink in hand, watching my little one playing on the playground with a live band in the background.   I hope we continue to get more places like this in Austin!

reviews.author: Dave W.
reviews.description: Wild place, but really fun! Stopped here on the way to the airport for one last beer on vacation, and was blown away at how crowded it was. There was what seemed like a farmer's market, concert, and youth soccer game all happening around this brewery.   Beer was good and there was a lot of food trucks to choose from. We went to the pizza one and it was good, but maybe would go with the BBQ or Mexican next time.

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: Easily my favorite brewery in town.   The food trailers here are all bomb and on point. This is an awesome spot for lunch. You can get everything from world class tacos, great pizza to Texas Monthly Top 50 ranked BBQ.   The beer is absolutely amazing. The collabs with local breweries and bars such as Cosmic and St. Elmo are all cool and tasty -AF.   The to go beer options are always great. You can have a few pints and come home with some amazing beer to finish the night at home watching a movie with.   I've seen a few shows here. Saw Eternal Champion here and had a blast. The venue is great for live music, anytime they have a live show its worth the cover to hang out and see some live tunes and have some amazing beer.   The best thing about Meanwhile for me happens to be that its extremely family friendly. They have a playground a soccer court and large open field that is perfect for flying kites. They are all fenced in so its the perfect spot for me to bring my daughter to play. My family comes here regularly and we really enjoy the family friendly aspect Meanwhile offers.   I could go on and on about how much I love the beer and just this space in general. Its really do not miss Austin location now.   Thanks for offering so much good stuff Meanwhile you rock!  edit: I almost forgot to mention how awesome the coffee and breakfast tacos by Pueblo Viejo are here.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: Here's a secret, a lot of folks who go to these breweries don't go because of how good the IPA or the cider is, they have a long list of other factors.   We had an IPA and a cider, they were good, not life-changing, but decent. I have yet to sample the entire beer selection but I will. And you know why? Because of everything else the place offers ensures I'll be back.  The tacos from the taco truck were really impressive, exceeded expectations actually. The pizza was equally excellent.   The set up for the grounds was spot on. The trees, the playground, the environment with families, dog owners, young people, it all meshed well because everyone had a section that fit their methods of socializing.  You can't tell me this isn't a science because significant thought (and money, I'm sure) went into developing this experience. Bravo!  Now I need to drink some more of their beers.

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: A very Austin brewery, but I mean that in a good way. A lot of thought was put into design, decor and layout - and it shows. Very chic, but also comfortable . Gorgeous outdoor spaces, this is a great place to hit when we get good weather in central Texas. REALLY good beer, tons of styles - but all really well made. Any beer drinker will love a visit here. A variety of food trucks at peak times makes for a versatile dining experience for your group. Very family friendly with a nice play area for kids. Just a great spot. Drink local!

reviews.author: Rachel F.
reviews.description: A MUST go to in Austin!!! Highly, highly recommend. 100/10, great beer, tasty cocktails, delicious frozen rosé and a killer hard kombucha  This is place also has amazing food trucks too (dough boys- out of this world garlic knots with a lemon ricotta dip*drooling) and a beautiful outdoor area for adults and children (there's a playground!). Adults can have a beverage and lounge while their kids get their energy out. Very fun spot!!

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: This is probably one of the best breweries that opened in ATX in 2020 - during a pandemic at that! Since their opening, they've been doing gangbusters business with no signs of slowing.  Obviously, when you visit, you'll notice they have a huge space and $$ was spent to fully build it out. It's not a small brewery that grew up, it was built to be big. There is plenty of seating inside and even more seating outside on the turf + mulch area. But, be forewarned this place is busy. Saturday afternoons are packed with people with pets and families. There is a playscape so parents like this place.   Now, to their beer. Meanwhile brews consistent and good beer. They have a variety of beers from regular German Pils to New England IPAs. Nothing infected and nothing with off flavors. They always seem to have a good rotation of beers.   Don't like beer? They also have wine, cocktails and coffee! Something for everyone.   While they don't serve food, there are numerous food trucks to order from.   Even though the lines can get long, they do move pretty quickly (especially the line that is at the main entrance).   We would come here more often if it were closer to us, but getting across the river is the hardest part. :)

reviews.author: Arlene T.
reviews.description: Third time here.... 5 stars for the outdoor area ... super cool and big play area for kids off to the side which is great so that other people who either want to get away from kids or are not particularly into kids running all over the place around them while enjoying beers won't be annoyed by them. #notthattheresanythingwrongwithkids  1 star to the beer servers.... attitude like snobby coffee barristers! I'm always mystified by ANY questionable servers ... don't they know that if they'd give better service, they'd get better tips?!?!!   3 stars to the beer

reviews.author: Sally D.
reviews.description: Since my last review about Meanwhile's extraordinary support for the community, we decided to return that support and have hung out in their beer garden a few times, enjoying different brews and chatting while people-watching. There are so many trees to shade the area and a playground in the middle for kids to stay entertained and out of their parent's hair. The inside area is clean and modern and very hip with good air conditioning (so important during the summer, well, really 9 months of the year).  We would have been seated there but are still cautious about the Rona. So, good beer, good vibes, good venue. And food trucks though we haven't tried any yet. Cheers!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Amazing place! Love that it's in the warehouse district, so it's off the beaten path. A TON of shaded seating and room to spread out. There was a kid's bday party there and we didn't notice (yay for our dog). There was plenty of water to help yourself to as well as a nice list of beers. They were all incredible (even the German ones)! They also have some cocktails, frozés and coffee available. We got an iced dirty chai on our way out, since their coffee looked and smelled good. WOW! Nice and strong! I am very picky about coffee being too weak and having to add extra shots of espresso, but this was on point!  We will definitely be back! Great, friendly staff, and we especially loved that we could order beer starting at 10a on Sunday! In early and out early!

reviews.author: Hannah B.
reviews.description: Great IPA's! Great atmosphere too. Lots of dogs and kids, which normally the kids might be annoying, but it's a large space and they are spread out

reviews.author: Bill K.
reviews.description: The wife and I have enjoyed the beer in the garden at Meanwhile several times. Its nice to have some variety of food choices with the pizza, bbq, and Mexican food offerings.  It seems no matter the day of week or time of day, one or two of the trucks are not serving food even on weekends.  Speaking of weekends... unless you are into family oriented madness, with kids running amok everywhere, because of the playground equipment and soccer pitch avoid this place. We enjoy dining out or having a couple of beers at breweries to kind of get away from life's madness, not to have to deal with this kind of madness.

reviews.author: Brenda G.
reviews.description: I chose this place for my birthday gathering of around 15 of us on a Friday afternoon and so glad I did!  I wanted to find a Dripping Springs like brewery without making my friends drive out there and this fit the bill.  Some tips below!  Parking - As Austin gets more and more crowded it's hard to find spots for large groups that are quasi central and have ample parking - this place seems to have enough street parking since it is out in the middle of a warehouse district that is empty on weekends.  We were all able to find parking with no issues.  Kids - this place is super family friendly.  My friends with kids felt very COVID safe due to the size of the venue and there is a spaced out area with a playscape.  Drinks and food - I had a few of the seltzer cocktails and they were good enough.  Obvs this is a brewery so I wasn't expecting too much in that dept.  You can order drinks at a window outside which also made us feel safe.  There are a handful of food trucks where our friends ordered.  Also we got there at 2:00 pm on a Saturday and were able to snag a couple large picnic tables.  I think that bc it is new it is not getting too crowded yet.  There was plenty of shade for us once we moved one of the tables around.  There was a ticketed show starting at 7:00 pm that Saturday that required a $10 cover charge so def check their website before arriving if you don't want to pay a cover.  Overall a great addition to the breweries popping up in the southeast Austin area.

reviews.author: Cambrea D.
reviews.description: Me and my husband live close by and come here all the time. This is my favorite place to go on week days in the evening or on weekends. Their beer is so good, especially their hazy IPAs. The vibe is so relaxing and cool, with picnic benches under the trees. I hope they open their indoor seating soon, and extend their parking and outdoor seating area. I always bring my friends and family who visit from out of town and I recommend it to everyone whose looking for a must-try local Austin brewery!

reviews.author: Liz M.
reviews.description: This is my new go-to during the week with my not-yet-school-aged daughter. We're usually the only ones on the playscape, and there's always at least one food truck open, plus the cafe.  There is plenty of outdoor seating (inside too, actually), and it's dog and family friendly. Easy parking in their lot, I've never had a problem finding a spot (again day time during the week).   I can't wait to go here for date night!   Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Darci J.
reviews.description: The space was vibin'. Plenty of tables and chairs. Also a big playscape crawling with tons of kiddos. But off to the side, so they weren't annoying for the hungover heavy drinkers. On-site soccer field with goal, some dudes were playing a fairly serious game while i was waiting in line for the most delightful chicken tacos with guac and fresh spinach from the Pueblo Viejo food truck.  Reason for 3 stars - worst Paloma ever. Like ever. I was suspicious when i realized the Paloma was listed under 'Seltzers' (after i had ordered :/ ). Then grew more wary when the 'bartender' added WAY too many dashes of bitters ((( when a real Paloma is plenty bitter from fresh Texas grapefruit ))) and it was TERRIBLE. Straight gross.  Also one beer was ok, the Tender Robot- Hazy Ipa. Not anywhere near as caustic as Pinthouse Pizza's Electric Jellyfish, fairly enjoyable. But the only other beer we sampled (the Kolsh) was incorrect, no bitter finish, weak and thin.    So, come for the vibe! Come for the food!  Avoid their weird Seltzer Cocktails Choose carefully (or ask for a sample) of their beer before you commit to a full pint.

reviews.author: Tiffany M.
reviews.description: I love this place - day or night. It's so popular that the lot fills up fast and normally flows over onto the street. Parking is still easy though. There's unlimited street parking since it's in a commercial area. The beer is good, staff is so friendly, it's so cute inside, the PLANTS on the shelf are adorable, the food trucks are great...I can't find fault in it at all. Besame is a must-try for ice cream and Dough Boys for pizza. Distant Relative has amazing BBQ chicken!

reviews.author: Andoni S.
reviews.description: Spent a very relaxing couple of hours at Meanwhile a few days ago and was able to try out several different beer options on the menu, as well as fully enjoy the laid-back and friendly atmosphere. The brewery has plenty of outdoor seating, plenty of parking, clean, new facilities and interior as well as nice views of their brewing equipment. To put it concisely, they check just about every box you could ask for!  They have an interesting selection of beer including a few blends I had never seen elsewhere, the most notable of which was their "Moot Point", a coffee-infused amber. Glad to say I can recommend this brewery, the great atmosphere as well as the impressive selection!

reviews.author: Ashley K.
reviews.description: Meanwhile Brewing is a great space in South Austin to hang out with family and friends.  I kept hearing that Meanwhile Brewing was one of the best breweries in Austin to bring your kids, and now I see why!  There is so much open space for kids to run around and even two little playscapes.  I brought my 7 and 2 year old and they both had a blast.  My husband and I were able to enjoy some good drinks and food while the kids played.  I should mention - the brewery isn't just for families.  Parents with kids were in the minority when we visited on a Thursday night.  The brewery is great for anyone.  In terms of food and drinks, I'm kinda embarrassed to say that I actually didn't try any of the beer (I know, I know, I'm just not much of a beer drinker).  I did try the frosé (yes, I'm basic), which I enjoyed.  It had a floral note to it, which I really liked.  For food, there are four food trucks on site and our family managed to try them all.  My husband and son raved about the brisket from Distant Relatives, while my favorite was the Bob-a-rita (margherita) pizza from Dough Boys.  I also had pretzel and strawberry jam ice cream from Bésame.  I know, it sounds weird, but it was awesome.  I loved the balance of salty and sweet.  I highly recommend it!  Overall, Meanwhile Brewing is great and our family definitely plans to go back; there is something for everyone to enjoy!

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: After visiting a very high stress brewery down the road in Blanco, I stumbled across this very cool, laid back, brewery while taking a shortcut through Spring Branch.  I seriously had no idea this place existed - I spotted it when driving by and had to do a U-turn to check it out.  It's been open about a year, has a clean bar and seating area inside, has a covered outdoor patio, and a food truck.    The brew is good and cold, they have 12 of their own brews on tap, including two meades.  64 ounce growler refills range between $16 and $25 depending on the brew you choose.  A six flight sampler is available for $9. You can even purchase six packs of some of their beer to take home with you.  Plenty of room for the kids to run around outside and stay out of your hair.  They have a corn hole washer game, the "ring-on-a-string-on-a-hook" game, a giant chess board (you know who you are), tether ball, horseshoes, and a swing.  Try the Buff Hefeweizen and the Sunset Lager - both are sehr gut!  They have sodas and water for $1.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Discovered on the way home from a day trip to Comfort. Nice setting with plenty of outdoor seating, yard games, and dog toys.  A little landscaping to eradicate the poison ivy around the oaks would be nice.   Tried a couple beers and settled on the Tang IPA. Refreshing on a hot day, with a hint of citrus, but not terribly awe inspiring. Bring your own munchies. As they're a few miles from anywhere, they could use a food truck.   Really like the setting and we'll definitely try to make it back next time we're in the neighborhood to give it another try.

reviews.author: Sara D.
reviews.description: Such an awesome place! I do not remember the name of the beer my husband got, but I tried it and it was delicious! They have a good truck and it was some of the best food around. The animal style fries and bacon cheese burger were 5 stars! The ambiance is very laid back and they have games for the kiddos to play!

reviews.author: Bruce G.
reviews.description: I have been driving by their sign along 281 for a while. Had a little extra time and took the detour. Bought a six pack of Sunset Lager as a compromise to the better half and really enjoyed it. They are certainly off the beaten path but are worth the effort. During times such as we are experiencing we are trying to support local businesses and I highly recommend that folks in the north San Antonio area make the journey and enjoy the outdoor beer garden. Next up for me will be the IPA!

reviews.author: James B.
reviews.description: New place and I'm loving it. It's a bit in the middle of nowhere, but worth the drive.  They have some interesting flavors, but nothing too crazy like some of the Austin Breweries. Every beer was good, but I'm going to say the Kimber Lyte was my favorite. An easy drinking beer with more than 5% alcohol. Tang IPA was finally a great tasting IPA, which I normally don't drink... don't worry they have other IPAs for IPA lovers.  The Stout was pepper flavored but good.  But they also Change things up and now they have a coffee stout.  Plenty of other beers to taste.  They have growlers and some of their stuff is bottled.  Hard to find in grocery stores.  Try HEB in San Antonio. And total kudos to the Bartender, great knowledgeable guy.

reviews.author: Dan B.
reviews.description: Very cool story by founder. Diamond miner. Cold beer good variety enjoyed the rough Diamond IPA. High IBUs but smooth not bitter. Building is clean love the pictures only feedback a little sterile in feel. Glad the are open most days during the week. And open till 7.   Nice bartender and already building a local following.   I would buy this beer as the start to distribute.   Place is  A "Diamond in the rough".....

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: This is the best craft brewery that I've visited in a while. My family and I visited on a Friday evening. The location is just off of 173 (I think) right near 281 and 46. The location is quaint with beautiful trees. As we drove in, the first things that I noticed were the games set up around the yard. They have a large chess set, corn hole, a swing, and a game were one has to swing a ring and catch it on a hook. The second thing that I noticed was a barbecue food truck. We had gotten subway sandwiches to have with our beer but ended up getting a little barbecue also. We headed inside and were promptly greeted by the bartender. The building is really clean and the tap set up is modern. I ended up doing a flight which has 6 samples from the list of 12 beers on tap. All in all, a really great experience and will definitely plan on visiting again!

reviews.author: Valerie R.
reviews.description: Please do not describe this place as kid friendly. We visited this place with friends and their 4 year old daughter was attacked by a massive dog who was situated next to the kid swing. Based off how the facility handled the attack it was clear this dog had been there with his owner multiple times and the bartender actually defended the owner and his dog, saying it was a "good dog" and the owners are "good people", even after the owner made threats to my husband for stating that the dog should be put down. Given how everything was handled, I would not be surprised if that dog is back on the premises next week. Please do not risk your children's safety by taking them here it's not worth it.

reviews.author: Kate A.
reviews.description: I for one love a good IPA or Stout, but this brewery had one of the most unique beers that I've had in a while.... a pumpkin spice beer! I know what you're thinking, typical white girl‍ but honesty I'm not much of a pumpkin spice fan usually.... I say USUALLY, because this one is phenomenal!!! And the atmosphere is super cute!

reviews.author: Britney F.
reviews.description: This is probably my favorite craft brewery I have been to yet. All of the beers they have made have been great. I even like their IPAs and I usually hate IPAs. The best thing to do when you go is to get a flight so you can try all of their flavors. My favorites are the kimber light which has cucumber, their bock, and their Gone Pickin apple lager. They sometimes have food trucks out there as well so I would recommend following them on Facebook to keep up with when you can go and get great food and great beers.

reviews.author: Anna S.
reviews.description: We live this place. They know us by sight snd by the noise we make when here with friends. Plenty of a variety to suit everyone's taste, even this non-beer drinker! They are trying to make it family friendly, bringing in food trucks, too. This brewery has a bright future!!!

reviews.author: Noihad B.
reviews.description: What a beautiful surprise it was to walk in the tasting room at Rough Diamond Brewery. Great atmosphere, very friendly people and above all Great Beer, I sampled all elven brews and what a treat that was. Very well crafted  variety of awesome beers. Will definitely come back!

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: The beer is great and the covered patio makes for a great place to enjoy the hill country breeze. The Viking Water was a pleasant surprise and perfect for a hot summer day. Broad selection and a friendly staff make this a good place to hit up on a weekend road trip.

reviews.author: Jason G.
reviews.description: Solid!  Some nice brews, a few just ok.  Friendly staff (in fairness, during our visit there was just one guy working) and a laid back vibe.  No problem recommending this place to others.  Being picky, I wish they'd weedeat the outdoor areas a bit.  The place has some nice areas to sit under the trees, horseshoe pits, even an oversized chessboard.  But, all of it is under 2 feet tall weeds.  Again, no trouble recommending this brewery to others...and we'll definitely be back many more times.

reviews.author: Rick B.
reviews.description: Good selection. Leave the highway and slow down when you get close. Back to beer six rotate and the other six stay. The oatmeal stout is very good. I will be back to try the rest. The food truck rotates but is smells great

reviews.author: Scott P.
reviews.description: Best beer hands down and I'm a serious beer guy.  I visit ALOT of breweries everywhere I go and I can honestly say that I enjoyed every single beer they offer.  And most times I avoid IPA like the plague but I like these.  I'll make a special trip just to fill up the growler for the weekend. The staff is very nice and helpful and always very accommodating.  These guys have a good thing going for sure

reviews.author: Cody S.
reviews.description: Been driving past this place for a while waiting for it to open. Couldn't wait to try it out! Finally got to go and so glad I did. Nice atmosphere inside and bartender was very helpful. Nice selection of beers. Still feels like it's coming together a bit. Would be great if they had some food trucks outside sometime to get some food as well. Looking forward to trying again!

reviews.author: Sergio R.
reviews.description: Beer was mediocre... I generally don't have high expectations for microbreweries in Texas and I would lump the beer here with the rest of them. Tangerine IPA was one-dimensional, drinkable but that's about it. Facilities were clean and spacious. We chose to stop by here because I had heard good things about it and Yelp claimed they're "Kid-friendly"... This was FAR from accurate for us. I came here with my pregnant wife, my 3-year-old son, my good friend from work, his pregnant wife and his 4-year-old daughter. In the time it took for us to find a table to sit at outside, my friend's daughter was attacked by a large mastiff-labrador mix. In a matter of a few seconds, this dog managed to escape its owners and clamp onto my friend's daughter's torso, leaving several puncture wounds, scratches an bruises in the process. Once everything was all said and done, the bartender on duty defended the dog and its owners. There was little in the way of apologies or effort to rectify the situation. I had to call 911 to ensure authorities were made aware of the attack and dog's vicious nature. I would have expected folks working the establishment to at least handle this; they did not. After EMS and Sheriff personnel handled the situation and left, I witnessed the bar server on duty taking a smoke break with one of the members of the dog owner's party... clearly small-town, take-care-of-your-kin mentality going on here. I do not recommend coming to this place unless you're part of this inner circle.

reviews.author: Allison S.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed my experience! Got a one on one tour of the facility and chance to meet the head brew master. Very cool

reviews.author: Rebecca T.
reviews.description: We have been driving by this place since they began construction. Drove by the other day and noticed they were finally open so we decided to stop in. They had a good crowd  sampling their wares. They have beer on tap, in bottles and growlers.  They also offer flights so you can taste the different beers that they brew.  I got a sample of their IPA and really liked it. Took home a six pack.  Bartender was super friendly. Will definitely stop in again.

reviews.author: Destiny T.
reviews.description: Great experience and ambiance. The deal on Groupon was a plus and visiting was a casual afternoon date idea while on our trip to Austin. :)

reviews.author: Kelly H.
reviews.description: While out visiting Austin for my birthday back in February, we stumbled across this amazing brewery, which ended up being our favorite one of the entire trip!  I had multiple beers from here, but my absolute favorite was the Dye It Black.   It had such great flavor and was very easy drinking.  The other ones I sampled were also really great and it was very difficult to choose.  This brewery is kind of out in the middle of nowhere.  It's got a rustic outdoors-ish feel to it.  There were benches throughout the brewery to sit at and nothing was done up too fancy, and almost felt like you were hanging out in someone's garage (which isn't a bad thing).
