Patty was our bartender and she was absolutely fantastic!  She offered wonderful hospitality and when she found out it was my birthday, she bought me a birthday beer!  Tip - If you check-in on Yelp, you get a free pint glass to take home.  It was a great souvenir to have to remember this great brewery!

reviews.author: Kimberly S.
reviews.description: My husband and I are visiting Austin and stopped at Infamous Brewing Company for a flight. All the beers were good, but we especially enjoyed the cream ale, cider and Hefeweizen. Service was friendly and efficient. An added bonus was the food truck park next door. We didn't eat there, but heard positive reviews from other guests.

reviews.author: Katherine B.
reviews.description: Greeter by a friendly CIci. She explained all the Beer flavors. Three of us opted for SexApeel. Flavorful. Better than a Blue Moon. Sit inside (a/c) or outside. It's a great place to stop!

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: Great beer. That's pretty much all you need to know. Infamous is local, the people are friendly, and you can grab food with your beer.  I really liked they do samplers so you can get a six pack from multiple beers and see what you like best.  Surely I will be going back!

reviews.author: Brandy T.
reviews.description: Great brews with variety, super friendly including dog friendly staff, lots of space to covid friendly hang.

reviews.author: Ross H.
reviews.description: I come here more than I would like to admit. Delicious beer, great atmosphere that feels laid back, relaxing, and enjoyable. Now with the food truck park there it is even better / worse beause I end up staying there all day, with no reason to leave.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Love that their doing a campaign to get the governor to allow breweries to be open Like restaurants. There's so much room to socially distance! Can't wait till were able to go back into the brewery but love that they found a way for us to be able to enjoy their beer and sit outside. Technically they don't own where the tables are so another company is sponsoring it and letting us sit at the tables and enjoy your beer to go. You can't enter the brewery at all so there is a porta potty, you pick up your beer at the window to go and can sit down outside and enjoy. Their growlers are also awesome!

reviews.author: David F.
reviews.description: Phenomenal beer. Great vibe. Fantastic food trucks. Live music kills it!  If you haven't been - GO!

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: Dropped by on a very hot Sunday.  The Dye-it Pills and Jesus Juice (Ressurection) were the perfect remedy.  The misters and fans atound the picnic tables outside were a tremendous help.  Oh--the beer was really good...best lite Pills I've ever had.  We'll be back.  Staff was very friendly.

reviews.author: Andrew T.
reviews.description: This place MUST be added on your brewery tour list. We found it accidentally while we were up seeing the oasis. The beer was fantastic and I actually had a difficult time choosing my least favorite. They occasionally have live bands, from what I hear, but this place is good for a beer in the rustic shade. There are food trucks nearby if you get hungry.

reviews.author: Jessica B.
reviews.description: Great selection of beers that are local to lake Travis. Cici was amazing and gave us a rundown of every beer they had. This is such a great atmosphere and we will definitely be back! Their sex a peel was my favorite and really great for the summer months. 10/10.

reviews.author: D S.
reviews.description: A must for anyone that enjoys beer of any type. The infamous brewery makes and pours FRESHLY made products and sells cans/bottles at the same price as retailers.  Located after Hudson Dam, nestled in a small retail/manufacturing area, you can drink inside a small area with full view to the tanks used to make the product or sit outside on wooden benches/tables.  On weekends, they have great 2-3 person music sets, sitting on top of an antique delivery truck, or inside, depending on the weather.  Personal favorites are the Peanut Stout (think Guinness but with more flavor), the Czech dark lager and my wife loves the Sex Appeal!  The bartenders are all fun, with stories and a bit an attitude, feels like old Downtown Austin.  If you are a local or guest of Austin, Infamous is a must place visit!

reviews.author: peggy e.
reviews.description: Perfect Saturday on the patio! Noodles for the photobomb! LOVE THIS PLACE AND STAFF! Everyone is so friendly, spacious patio, and great local atmosphere!

reviews.author: Mitch E.
reviews.description: You can order a pizza straight to the brewery. Pretty nice. Great beer. Dog friendly. Outdoor seating. Solid prices.

reviews.author: Tom B.
reviews.description: I don't drink much nor often but when I get the urge to have a nice cold beer, I really enjoy going to Infamous Brewing. Their set up in these social distancing days is perfect. Plenty of tables and room at the next door patio area (Shout out to Lakeway Plumbing for opening up their place for folks to relax). Really, really clean porta potties too. CeCe is always ready to offer suggestions or let you sample a brew. She has patience with rookie's questions like no other! And - these are really great people trying to keep a great business viable. Go see them. Don't drink beer at all? Just go there, say "hi" and  buy a tee shirt or cap - Christmas is coming and these make great gifts.

reviews.author: Angel A.
reviews.description: This is a no bullshit brewery. Great beer, awesome owner and great staff. Fell in love with the Cream Ale but every beer is legit. The big plus is that it has a great neighborhood vibe.

reviews.author: Marie M.
reviews.description: Love this brewery.  This is the perfect place to come for a beer after a day on the lake.  Nice wide selection of beers.  Some unique offerings like their peanut butter stout, "Sweep the Leg". The day we went they had a taco truck outside, too. No frills setting for people who want a good beer.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped here for a birthday gathering on a Saturday night. It was a little ways out for us being from south austin. It had many twists and turns and would honest never  known about this brewery unless I went on Yelp or word of mouth. Okay, I am pretty sure Trip advisor would have told me too.   It is a very no nonsense place. They serve beer, 1 cider (decent since not super sweet) , and wine. This place is all about the beer and you can buy a flight to try the different types. Some of them are interesting to include a coconut stout.   You can sit inside or outside on the picnic tables. On Saturday night they had a live band playing who was decent. You can bring your dogs as it is dog friendly. It had a similar feel of Moontower without the additional activities to do. It's all about drinking beer and relaxing here.   FYI, they apparently they have pizza and pretzels. Not sure since I didn't see anyone eating it, I would suggest bringing your own food or having it delivered as you have that option.

reviews.author: Tank L.
reviews.description: Great little local brewery.  Beer is always cold.  They have a great little outdoor venue with live music on the weekend.  Always seem to find ourselves stoping in yo have a beer and enjoy the music.

reviews.author: Adam T.
reviews.description: This might be my favorite spot in Austin right now and it is still pretty chill/not well known so I hate that I'm writing a good review.   Some of the best beer out there I think and they've got awesome food to go with it. Burgers are really good along with all of their bar type things.  Pretty good happy hour specials during the week.   Good amount of space inside and out with a ton of parking and it is right next to Better Half so easy to hit both places without having to go anywhere.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: In this town, if feels like there's a brewery popping in every corner. I'm not complaining, simply making an observation. But what this means though is that you have to do something to stand out. You can't just brew your own beer and sell it in the warehouse, those days are gone.  Hold Out has a unique and very advantageous situation. They're next to Better Half (I think they're the same owner or partners?) and make great use of the property together as well as the opportunity to collaborate.  Additionally, Hold Out has their own food. While their menu isn't as complete as Better Half's, it's pretty decent for a "happy hour at the brewery" trip.  But you can't asses them without considering the Better Half contribution, which I've reviewed separately and loved.  The beer is good, although it lacked range in variety as there wasn't much darker beer. A lot of IPA selections, which I'm sure the market loves...but I don't.   I stuck to the lager and a couple other beers, all with weird names but I guess that's the game these days.   I had the vegan frito pie which was way more delicious than expected and had an interesting mix of flavors.   Of course, it all tied in well because we had dinner from Better Half and I don't need to tell you how good that was. You gotta try the grilled halloumi, trust me.  All in all, good vibe, great property.

reviews.author: Sophia C.
reviews.description: Yummy food paired with good drinks, Hold Out is the perfect spot for a late night hangout with friends. They have a spacious outdoor patio that's great for dogs, and a convenient parking lot right across.   I ordered the fish sandwich and a strawberry sangria, and both were a hit! The sandwich came with delicious fried fish and various sauces (with a bit of spice) in between amazing thick toasted slices of bread. The sangria was refreshing and sweet, great for those who like fruity beverages!

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: We've been waiting for over an hour and still have no food. Please give me my food I am hangry. I got charged $2 for an avocado.  Update: food tastes good and is aesthetically pleasing. Not worth wait. Adding back 1 star

reviews.author: Kaitlin O.
reviews.description: I had about 8 people in my group for Sunday brunch. Was told the food wait time would be less than an hour. It took 2 hours for everyone to get food even though we all ordered right after each other. Food tasted good but definitely not worth both the price and the wait!

reviews.author: Jevin H.
reviews.description: I was holding out on writing this review, but after seeing my friends rate it two stars, I had to go ham. My group was around 8 people. We ordered one dish per person. The food arrived an hour and a half later. I am confused how it could've taken so long for food to arrive. To make matters worse, the waiter said "sorry for the hold out" and laughed when he gave us our food. I held out on my laughter for that one. It should not take that long for pancakes or burgers to be prepared. No clue what was going on behind in the kitchen but the chef definitely holding out on cooking or something. Hopefully this was a one off experience, but I'm not holding out faith for this place.

reviews.author: Bernie W.
reviews.description: Wow, I would say this was our favorite place on our recent trip to Austin, tucked away on a side street off of West 6th it is a true hidden gem although no hidden handshake was needed to enter the converted spacious quonset hut.  Out side under cover were rows of picnic tables, beer was served inside and the food was brought out.  While the beers were outstanding, the food was unexpected, beyond the burgers which we did not try, they had a few interesting dishes such as a Crispy Artichoke  and Pimento and a Indian chickpea inspired take on the chili Frito pie, both were excellent and we are not vegetarians, we just wanted to try something new.  The smoky Rauchbier styled Marzen (?) was unusual and worth a taste but a pint was a little over the top.  Note for those who commented on slow service we were there on a Wednesday and there were no issues, I am sure a nice weekend might be another experience.

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Beer hasn't changed in a long time, 6 packs to go now cost $16.

reviews.author: Evan L.
reviews.description: It took 2 hours for all of us to get our food. The price was okay for the location + what I got, but personally I wasn't a huge fan of the cocoa crumble with the pancakes. Would maybe come here again and try something else if I heard the wait was less than 30 minutes

reviews.author: Kristine C.
reviews.description: Has a couple of vegan options including the overnight oats and sweet potato hash without the sauce and eggs. We waited over 2 hours for our food to come out, portion size was pretty small and it was pretty average tasting. I got the sweet potato hash made vegan and it tasted okay but definitely not worth the wait/price!!!

reviews.author: Jared H.
reviews.description: Super rude staff at the counter harassing me about a mask just to place an order and sit down.  Only place in Austin over a 5 day weekend that refused to serve unmasked people. Apparently covid only spreads when you're in the main building ordering. SCIENCE.  What a joke. Food and beer was OK, but there are PLENTY of awesome open and free restaurants in Austin that don't have arbitrary and ineffective covid rules.  I wouldn't advise walking here with a hungry family in the cold if you're opposed to conforming to mask mandates.  We escaped from Seattle to have a non locked down weekend, super bummed to have caved and supported this place.  They'd probably be checking vax cards like back home if they could.  Disappointing.

reviews.author: Cris R.
reviews.description: I was visiting from Houston and had never been here before. Read some reviews and they all sounded positive so I decided to come. Overall, the food was great and the beers were also on point! Friendly staff and nice ambiance, will be back next time I'm in Austin.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: A modern hip Austin beer scene vibe with a full menu and brews. The beers here were pretty good. They have a spacious covered dog friendly patio. A great food menu that includes brunch. The curly fries were delicious. You can even order food next door at their sister better half cafe and get it delivered to you here. Their restrooms were brilliant. Best signage of this time!

reviews.author: Nan T.
reviews.description: Good place if you're looking for a lively spot to take friends or out of towners into the heart of Austin. Good drink prices and a good selection of beers, but I didn't find the two beers I tried to be anything special. They have a great food menu and the burger is really good, but it took quite a while for my food to come out. The ordering process was also a little chaotic -- long, long lines and loud music at the counter so it's hard to communicate with staff. Parking can be a nightmare if the lot in the back is full, and the roads are very narrow and uneven when you arrive at the brewery. Ultimately I think this is a good place for those looking to get the Austin experience, but I don't think I'll add this place to my usual rotation.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Beer, wings, and curly fries: the essentials to the ultimate chill weekend. I would suggest ordering your own wings, do not share. I am a huge fan of IPA's. Hold Out Brewing's IPA selection did not disappoint.    TIP: Hold Out shares their private lot with Better Half, it's much easier to snag a table here versus Better Half.

reviews.author: Jay L.
reviews.description: The food is always superior here. Always exceeds expectations for presentation, freshness, and flavor. The kitchen sink salad for $6 is fantastic. Vegetables are fresh and crunchy, the beets are chilled, the nuts crunchy, the small pear shaped tomatoes are excellent and the dressing is outstanding.  1/2 for $6 is incredible value. The burgers are great and the crispy chicken sandwich (during the week ar lunch) is one of the best in Austin and for the price is perhaps best value too. Have had some ciders that seemed very vinegary and perhaps not right but food is always great.

reviews.author: Garrett L.
reviews.description: Great beer, amazing burgers. Super friendly staff and great vibes all around. The new set-up with no reservations and the long benches is great.

reviews.author: Sierra J.
reviews.description: Hold out is a fairly new spot in Austin and is next to better half so we had to check it out! They have mostly Hazy juicy IPA's, so if you love those this is the place for you! My husband is one of those people and had a great time. I love sours and got the "syke!" And I thought it was great. They have food as well which we didn't get to check out but it looked awesome! I grab a cute cropped tank before we left. Hold out has a covered patio with a good amount of seating and seating inside. Our favorite part by far was the bartender that helped us. We didn't get his name but he has red hair and a mustache to match. He gave us some awesome recommendations to check out in Austin. Go for the beer stay for the hospitality!

reviews.author: Mark G.
reviews.description: Velvet tang, coolingly refreshing Beet Salad, amongst a New Juice Goofin' IPA was just the start.  A kid devourable kitchen sink salad merried with a happy Dad chomping on a flavour wheel of a Chicken Bacon Burger, essentially a double merry-goround of chicken with bacon, that paired nicely with a Shampoo Horn IPA.  All on the patio, picnicking tabled with a flurry of blazin fans to keep you cool and a melody of tunes.  All to leave me goosebumps for coming back.

reviews.author: Patricia C.
reviews.description: Recently hosted an event here.  Food was amazing and the service was the best ever!  Everyone had a great time.  The Chef worked with us on the menu selection.  We had 200 people show up all at once and the staff kept the food coming for my hungry crowd.    Wish I could give them more stars!

reviews.author: Kristella P.
reviews.description: You can't go wrong with any beer here. This is one of the few places I got a flight and didn't not really like any of the beers.  My favorites were the Violet Crown Black Kettle Sour and Gold on the Ceiling IPA! Such quality craft beer

reviews.author: Kim L.
reviews.description: Cute afternoon day drinking spot that we found via Yelp. Bumped a star bc of their limited seating (one barrel table) outside, the main bartender was not very helpful and some of the drafts we wanted to try were out.   We sat outside and people watched and enjoyed our flights.  Really liked wit-tington ale, weiz of TX, short straw stout and violet crown. Bummed they were out of the Firenze estate.

reviews.author: KC C.
reviews.description: The hubby and I are from Cali, so we are spoiled with some pretty good breweries.  Came here on a Saturday for some afternoon beers.  Was so good we came back Monday to finish off the weekend.    There's a good variety of beers so we did eight tasters and ended up with three separate glasses.  They had a special when we were there called the Apple cinnamon sour; it tasted just like apple pie.  If they reproduce it, I highly recommend a glass.    The place itself is super posh, establishment clean, service was great and staff very friendly.  I would def recommend this brewery.  Oh, met Cooper...he's one of their brewers.  He's really nice.

reviews.author: Mylesha D.
reviews.description: Getting there: Located in DT Austin, walking distance from the visitor center. Street parking is all around and there is a parking garage across the street at the hotel.  Experience: We came here to kill time before our flight, and I am sure glad we did. Their selection of beers were right up my alley. They had a variety of fruit flavored beers. The brewers were super friendly and inviting, I even let him choose my last flight choice. I loved the ambiance of the industrial rose gold with the green wall paint, and the live plant accents. It felt like a relaxing place to go work, study or just hang with friends.

reviews.author: Hani C.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed this spot. Didn't hurt that it was 2 minutes away from where we were staying and pretty much in the center of downtown.   Love any place that offers beer flights, as it's the best way to really know what you like and what your taste buds are in the mood for. I typically go for lagers or Belgian-style beers and personally loved the Lingering Sunshine and Wit-Tington.  The atmosphere is chill, laid-back, and the plants everywhere are totally my vibe. You can tell it's frequented by drinking tours as there was constantly small buses/vans waiting outside for parties drinking inside. Music also made for a nice ambiance and the girls who took care of our order upon arrival were very sweet and informative.

reviews.author: Aaron F.
reviews.description: Absolutely wonderful stop off while walking downtown Austin. The staff was super friendly and welcoming. Tried a flight, Wit, Violent Crown, Texas Skies, Affogate. Went with the Wit. You will taste why it is a gold medal winner.

reviews.author: Desiree D.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem in this area of town.   Stopped in 2 times whole in town for the week.   I highly suggest coming here, their beer is great and layered with flavor. And yes they have flights.   Peep the plants hanging too!  Cute decor.  I came in February and they did not have an outdoor section. Not sure if they ever will.

reviews.author: Lynn D.
reviews.description: This was a really cute brewery with great service. They had some interesting beers and offered flights and snacks. Nice central location. Very clean and Covid compliant. I had a cherry lime made beer, a pretzel and a bbq beef empanada. Pretzel was a little over cooked but the empanada was delicious

reviews.author: Aleah H.
reviews.description: I stopped here on a whim while exploring Austin via Lime scooter, and it was a solid find! A no nonsense brewery where I genuinely enjoyed every beer I tried-- A gem!   We sat at one of the handful of the tables they have sprinkled in the sidewalk outside. The street was pretty low key for being to close to 6th, so it was enjoyable on the sidewalk! You still order at the bar which was no problem, and the service was quick and efficient!   Rhythm is a Dancer stole the show for me! It's a sour, but it is muted enough that I could drink multiple without my mouth being pursed from tartness! The Kolsch was great, as well. We also tried the soft pretzel which was SO airy which I loved. It also came with a garlic sauce so not your typical pub pretzel, but a very tasty take on one!  Employee's wore masks and maintained distancing, as well, which is great. We found this brewery on a list of spots still enforcing safety restrictions, and can confirm they were!

reviews.author: Chelsey S.
reviews.description: Love this small brewery in a great location downtown Austin. The space is bright, clean, and nicely decorated. My husband and I both had flights. The standout was the Wit-tington by far. The Strawberry Wayne was pretty unique and had a nice pink hue to it. The  staff was very friendly and gave great suggestions of which beers we should try. You can get a crowler of any beer, which was great for us to take home! Can't recommend CDB enough!  Really enjoyed the indie 2000s playlist as well!!!

reviews.author: Stephen S.
reviews.description: The 30+ times I've been to breweries I've discovered that they truly are the happiest places on Earth. Customer service and courtesy are typically top-notch because...well...it's a brewery.   First let me point out this rating is based more heavily on service than the wonderful beer they served( I'd give a solid "B" on that spectrum).  Walk in, bartender says "hi" and starts cleaning mugs. We look around trying to figure out when he'll actually approach us. Ok...oh look menus, guess I'll grab one. Standing there waiting for the "what can I get ya?" Or "first time? Here's our menu, let me know if you have any questions." Bartender jargon. Nothing. My wife says "yeah it's our first time here." "Oh, ok" responds bartender. Finally we decide on our own we'll do a flight and order a pretzel. I'm assuming they specialize in IPAs since they have 4! He takes the order.   I return a beer because a random fly fell in one. I tell the bartender I hate to waste good beer but can I get a new one, a fly fell in mine." No reaction, he just asks which beer and refills it.   Good craft beer, subpar service.

reviews.author: Tala B.
reviews.description: I wish we had a place like this near my home -- I would be here every weekend (once the pandemic is over, of course)!   My sister and I were visiting Austin, TX awhile ago and wanted to do an Escape Room -- There is one right next to this little brewery, so after we finished the Escape Room (we escaped, by the way!), we decided to enjoy some beer and celebrate.  This spot is in a less busy part of the city and there were not a lot of people inside, but I was in love with the interior decor and the ambience. Very calm, chill and relaxing. We enjoyed our beers too! Overall, I loved it and wish there was one near my house.

reviews.author: Ryan W.
reviews.description: This is a pretty good brewery. I mostly drink IPAs so I got both of them they both tasted very good and smooth not so hoppy/ dry but very tasty and enjoyable. The ambiance is nice and quite very retro with a "we work here" feel which is a good feeling. The bartender was very helpful and attentive. Overall loved the experience and worth the stop if your in the area.

reviews.author: Lexi M.
reviews.description: Being from San Diego we were excited to try some of the local breweries, but literally from the moment we walked in it was severely disappointing. Not only was the staff rude, unhelpful and basically wanted us to leave at 2pm but the beer was ok at best. The bartender was so rude asking loudly why are there people here right now (during normal business hours) but anytime we asked about the beer he would say it's on the list. I get it might be busier than normal but there was no line other than our group, and all they did was pour beer no food running or drink running. Now to the beer, out of the two flights of 8 different beers 4 were tolerable and this is from people that don't leave alcohol behind. The sour was decent but heavy, the wheats were way to heavy and honest can't even describe them lol. Anywho long story but won't be back; if I want to be treated like crap i at least want a decent drink

reviews.author: Hilary E.
reviews.description: Came here on a Saturday night, and it was pretty empty actually. The guy who served our small group said they're more of a weeknight spot where people go after work. However, I liked that it was fairly empty. We could talk and hear each other, no line for more beer, the guy working was very nice, and it felt like we had the place to ourselves. I'd go back here in a minute, either earlier in the night before the rest of the evening plans or for a break inbetween places. The beer was good, and the place is very clean and pretty inside.

reviews.author: Marc M.
reviews.description: Great little spot in downtown.  They really push the flights which is great because they have quite a number of solid brews.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Came by with good company for some brews on a hot Sunday afternoon. The women-lead space and brewski selections are rockin', but they're missing a key component--wifi.  I know, I hate sounding like your typical phone-using human being, but every time I'm downtown wifi is super handy. It helps us decide where we want to go afterwards! Anyways, Central is set up like your typical clean and succulent-friendly microbrewery these days. They have board games and serve yourself water (sparkling OR still. THAT's a first!!). They don't have outdoor seating, but plenty of seats indoors. They also sell small bites and other drinks like wines and ciders. Their guest list is pretty solid with brews from Zilker and Independence to name a few other Austin loves. I got a taster of Central's own beers. We really did not enjoy the milkshake IPA that had a strong vanilla aftertaste. It was way too sweet, but to each their own.  Their restrooms are clean and they allow outside food too. SCORE! Now if only the owners would install some wifi...our taptender told us that the owners are still getting that set up. So that's a great sign! They also don't validate parking, so if you need to drive to get here...come on a Sunday when parking is free downtown. Pro. Tip.

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Their beer is so good, light and refreshing. If you like sours, they got you covered, ipas? Sure they have that too. You can of course get a flight of beer to taste multiple flavors and I'd recommend doing that...then going back and buying a pint of what you loved the most.   The service was A-1. The woman at the front was very friendly and was open to answering my 500 questions about when they opened, if I can taste different beers, what're those people in the corner with the purple drink drink drinking? In addition to that I'm pretty sure the owners were also just hanging out in there and they were chatting with different guests which made it feel very homey and inviting  Price- on par with other breweries  Great location! Especially if you're just moseying around town ( like I was) and happen to stumble upon it.   The aesthetics are on point. Beautiful Edison bulbs and plan fixtures. Both benches and tables so you can come with a large group or chill on a date.

reviews.author: Andy O.
reviews.description: The jalapeño bread is a must, an amazing brewery right in between 6th st and rainey st with a modern and hipster feel but good for the dad and for the mom looking for a break from The kids as well as the working adults needing a good brew, there's Baird games as well for some quick fun. Electric scooters all around so it's easy to keep bar hoping around. Great spot

reviews.author: Matthew A.
reviews.description: Made a quick stop to grab drinks for a cookout. The brewers were helpful and friendly, made lots of suggestions and let us taste as many different brews as we wanted. In and out in 10min and very satisfied with our selection.

reviews.author: Larissa S.
reviews.description: Adorable. Great cigar selection, and so thankful they have wine and beer to sip with it. The friendliness and familiarity between the regulars and staff, which they'll warmly welcome you in on, is what really makes this place special.

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: I really wanted to like this place - as I need a local cigar shop- but you cannot overlook their blatant disregard for local COVID requirements.   First, the shop is quaint and located in a very cool shopping area off of HWY 12. They also have a decent selection of classic and unique cigars. That is the positive.   However, they are selfishly thumbing their nose at COVID regulations. The staff does not wear masks or require patrons to wear them when they are up and about. There is absolutely no social distancing and it is usually packed to overflowing on weekends.   When a business refuses to abide by local and state guidelines in something as serious and life-threatening as COVID, it makes you question where else they ignore health and safety protocols. I do not trust that they keep their shop or the tobacco products safe and sanitary if they are unwilling to adhere to these basic guidelines. This should be a MASSIVE red flag for anyone thinking of shopping here.   I do not trust an establishment with this mindset, nor the local authorities that refuse to enforce these rules. It is shameful.

reviews.author: Dan R.
reviews.description: Great selection of my favorite stinkers...offers of firewater to those so predisposed. Canine friendly, ashHole suppresion available when necessary.

reviews.author: Levi E.
reviews.description: I love Smokey's Cigar Lounge. Nice people, great owner. I disagree with the reviewer who knocked the location due to COVID protocols. We quarantined with each other for months. We stayed 6 feet away from one another. I know; I was there nearly every day. It's difficult for any business who had to navigate the tricky waters of early 2020's pandemic onslaught. It was new territory for everyone and significantly different messages coming from authorities in the "know".  And with all that being said, you have a fairly recently opened small business trying to survive.  IMHO, anyone hating on this establishment is welcome to stay away.    Great cigars, great beverages, great community support. Don't change a thing.  Levi

reviews.author: Adam B.
reviews.description: Great cigar selection and super helpful and friendly staff to a novice cigar smoker like myself.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: My wingman and I were chilling out at Treaty Oak Distillery having a few cocktails and enjoying watching round 3 of the Masters. When by pure coincidence I met a couple who I have not seen in years. We mentioned that we had cigars but it was too windy to smoke em. They said there was a chill cigar bar right up the street. We watched Tiger make a par on 18 and off we went.  We were greeted immediately by Allison, the manager, and given a quick tour of the venue. There are comfy seats and a small bar area that serves beer, wine, and water. The humidor is laid out very well and their cigars are stored perfectly. Allison patiently explained that there are two sections in the humidor the usual favorites and "her" boutique cigars. I selected a beautiful light Nicaraguan rolled cigar. This baby smoked smooth right down to the label.   The lounge itself is ventilated nicely so you are not smoking in a haze or smoking your cigar and other guys cigar as well. There was also a good beer selection. We had a blonde ale from Two Wheel Brewery in Buda. Good choice.   Smokey's is a chill venue, friendly patrons, and professional knowledgeable staff equal 5 stars all day!

reviews.author: Laura P.
reviews.description: Great cigars! And fabulous owner Chris!  So knowledgeable of cigars and pairing with certain alcoholic beverages.

reviews.author: Jessica G.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I enjoyed this place so much. It was quaint and comfortable to relax and try cigars and drinks. My only feedback is for more variety in cigars - they had a lot of local brands which isn't bad but not a strong selection and to choose from. The service was excellent and the place was clean.

reviews.author: Chase C.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem. Allison is a cigar guru, you give her two cigars you like, she will show you three others to suit your palette. Prices are great, and the beer selection is fantastic. (Try the maduro) And if you like a little adventure, try the port with your next stick, a great pairing!

reviews.author: Lyndsey S.
reviews.description: I'm so glad we finally got a cigar lounge in Drip and Smokey's doesn't disappoint. I didn't get to sit and smoke but I saw how relaxed everyone was. I love that many of the cigars in the humidor are made by guys in Texas, especially the ones by a veteran who lives nearby. How cool is that? Make sure you talk to Allison too. She gives you the low down of every cigar and helps you find the perfect one for you. She's really nice and very helpful in her descriptions. My husband and I are looking forward to a date night at Smokey's.

reviews.author: Dino S.
reviews.description: Great spot for cigars, relaxing, and good conversation. Owner is super nice and everyone inside is friendly.

reviews.author: Henry W.
reviews.description: Best cigar bar and lounge I have been to! Great casual ambiance, super broad cigar selection in humidor, friendly staff, cold beer, fine wine. Music, indoor/outdoor seating, and all the amenities (big screen TV, lounge chairs, cutters/lighters, hand sanitizer, more). Meet you there June 13th from 6:00PM for live music!!!

reviews.author: David S.
reviews.description: If you haven't been, you don't know what you are missing. Locally owned and operated, this place has it all.  Great selection of cigars - my head was spinning with how many options but not to worry -  Allison was there with all of my questions. I'm def not a cigar aficionado but with the staff's help I was able to find a great smoke. I was impressed that they support local cigar companies and go the extra mile to make the everyone feel at home.  Can't recommend this place enough.

reviews.author: Amanda L.
reviews.description: I had the pleasure of meeting Chris while he was at Treaty Oak Distillery.  He is so kind has has a wonderful comfortable and just flat out super neat airstream! It was roomy, place to cut and dust off your cigar, a TV for viewing.  It was such a unique find! I would totally have had this at my wedding years ago if I knew him back then!

reviews.author: Jim P.
reviews.description: Excellent service and selection!  Comfortable lounge chairs, friendly atmosphere.  Indeed a hidden gem!  A great place to relax and have a good smoke.

reviews.author: Chanel L.
reviews.description: I was lucky enough to find Chris for my wedding. We thought their airstream would be a fun "man cave" addition to an otherwise very feminine wedding...boy were we misguided! Half the bridal party and many of our female guests ended up checking out the cigar bar and loved it! As a woman, I feel like creating a space where women feel welcome in what is traditionally considered a masculine space is a clear indicator of the quality and professionalism of their business.  Not only was Chris helpful, very communicative and and priced well - he and his wife were so much fun to be around! They both made our day special and unique and I highly recommend them for events. They definitely went above and beyond to ensure the day was special and went smoothly.   The airstream itself is luxuriously appointed and classy. Their cigar storage and bar amenities were top notch and I'm sure their huge tv would be great for sports games and such. Definitely a fantastic addition to my big day and I'd highly recommend them!

name: Oasis Texas Brewing Company
accommodations: Garage Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: Kyle H.
reviews.description: Very cute brewery on Lake Travis with amazing views.  Had a large seating area inside and out. They have a stage for live music. They also have food, wine, and cider.  Orders their burger with truffle fries. Pretty tasty and those fries were crispyyyy! Would go back just for the views.  The beer was okay but that's not the reason you come here.

reviews.author: Rebecca W.
reviews.description: Made our way to The Oasis during a recent trip to Austin with some friends. It was definitely a bit away from the main city, but a beautiful scenic area. The Oasis is right on Lake Travis, and features a bunch of small stores and outdoor areas in the land surrounding it. We were there on a Friday afternoon, and surprisingly not a lot of stores were open, which was a bummer. Of course though, we were there for the brewery, which we were able to make it to. They offer plentiful indoor and outdoor seating; it was a nice sunny day so we opted for the outdoor seating. It was lovely outside but it was SO windy, even after we tried to switch locations outside. It was hard to keep our food from blowing away! The view was super nice though, so despite the wind, we appreciated the scenery surrounding us.  For food / drink - of course, I focused on beers. I was a bit disappointed to learn that they didn't offer flights - they had a good number of offerings, it would make sense to do flights! Oh well, at least they offered half pours, so I was able to try 2; I went for the gose (kiwi dragonfruit) and the Oktoberfest. Both were OK, not the best ever beer but refreshing; I definitely favored the gose! My friends enjoyed their pours as well. For food, we all split some apps, going for the OTXBC trio, the bretzel, and the truffle fries. The trio was a bit disappointing - it was underwhelming and a little piecemeal (we had thought everything would be mixed together but it was just a pretzel on top of the chips with the dips on the side). The bretzel itself was tasty, but the sauce was interesting; we thought it came with queso, but the dip we received looked nothing like queso and was thick with chunks of something in it (pepper maybe?). It was tasty, but unidentifiable. Lastly, the truffle fries were the best option - they were nicely seasoned and crispy with a large volume. We all enjoyed those! The prices were relatively reasonable for what we got in terms of quantity and quality.   Overall, we enjoyed our afternoon at Oasis Texas Brewing Company. The space is lovely with a great view, but the food and drink is just OK; you're definitely more there for the experience. I would definitely make it back to OTXBC during a next visit to Austin to try more beers and take in the nice view!

reviews.author: Slava C.
reviews.description: Great chill out place with the positive vibe.  Enjoy wide selection of beers and delicious food topping off the amazing views along with the live band performance. What else would a soul need?! Sit back, relax, have a cup of cold one, watch a sunset and enjoy life!

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: 10/10 views, okay food. Heard food was better here versus the Oasis Restaurant. We only ordered apps, so can only comment on these. They were pretty basic, though we really enjoyed the truffle fries. We arrived around 2pm on a Friday and there was plenty of seating. Very windy though FYI.

reviews.author: Jason S.
reviews.description: When I moved from Downtown to Steiner I was a little afraid I wouldn't be able to find enough craft breweries and chill places to have a good burger. This little gem in the corner of the Oasis complex hits the spot for me. Plus the view is stellar.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: The Tap Room on the third floor and the Barrel Room on the second floor both achieve unique ambiance and draw slightly different crowds. We got to experience and enjoy the best of both in a way.   Amazing fresh made as well as barrel aged cocktails, a nice range of food options, and of course, breathtaking views.   The Barrel Room is rustic chic with fancy couches and a pool table. The tap room is plain rustic with a live music stage. The tap room had burgers and sandwiches to accompany the beers brewed on site. The barrel room offered pizza and wings to eat in between cocktail sips.   Oh, don't miss observing the really cool stairs in between the two floors.

reviews.author: Ali W.
reviews.description: Have some family in town and wanted to take them somewhere to watch a good ol Texas sunset. OTBC has some of the absolute best views in all of Austin. Even on this cloudy day the sunset still peaked through and gave us a show.   Drinks are good but food isn't really anything to write home about. Its more about the experience you get here for sure.  They have a large parking garage and parking lot on site with plenty of free parking even on a busy night. There's also a golf cart shuttle to get you from the lot to the entrance if you need it, but it's also a walkable distance.   Really great spot to visit if you want a nice spot to watch the sunset and definitely has that wow-factor for visitors!

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Have a visitor in from California and wanted to show our beautiful sunset by Lake Travis. This is a great place for that and the food is always good.  The space is large and everyone seemed to be following the safety rules while indoors. We were a party of 8 and we had plenty of space.  I ordered the basic burger and they usually prepare it Medium rare. I asked for medium well and wanted only mayonnaise and cheese. It was cooked the way I requested but was very dry since they did not give me Mayo. My wife ordered the Fish Tacos (3) and said they were great. She ended only being able to eat 2 and another guest finished her last one. She said she would order again next time.   All in all is was good just not great.

reviews.author: Van N.
reviews.description: I really really tried for this place. I took my parents here, I took my friends from out of town, and I even came for a birthday party this weekend. The whole experience overall is just underwhelming? If thats the right word. There is always the steps  1. get in line to get on to the wait list 2. once in front be told the wait is 1-2 hours 3. get in line again for the bar  4. finally get seated and wait again for slow service.   One question is Why? Why would you even go here? The wait is 2+ Hours sometimes. The food is cafeteria quality at best. They are SEVERELY understaff. Oasis Brewery has better food and literally the same exact food. The quality of the experience over all does not justify the amount of time, money and effort for this place.

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: An Austin must see! Beautiful views, with many options for eating and drinking. The bartenders were super attentive and nice.   Just knocking one star because I could only find one elevator and it was out of service. I'm in a boot and it was hard to get up all those stairs. If you need help call first to make sure the elevator works.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Views: 5/5. Such a scenic view overlooking Lake Travis. My favorite time to come is when the sun sets. The Texas skies are truly breathtaking during this time and Oasis is perfectly positioned for patrons to see all that the sun has to offer. Come 1 hour early to snag a table next to the railings in order to get the best (unblocked) view.   Food: 3/5. My date and I only ordered the Pico Verde. It was a refreshing snack but nothing special. We would've ordered more but there wasn't a huge selection and nothing that caught our eye.   Drinks: 3/5. Very limited selection of beers. It's almost weird that this place is called a brewery because there are literally like 8 to pick out of. Most people just come here for the view though so it's not a huge problem.   Overall, definitely a gem in Austin. It's a great place for dates or just to hang out with family or friends. It's so pretty here that it doesn't even matter what I'm eating or drinking!

reviews.author: Johnson W.
reviews.description: Family visiting Austin, Oasis is the must go place to see the beautiful lake and sunset!  We were at the brewery on third floor, ordered some beer and food, kitchen was bit slower than normal (they were busy! So that's fine), we ordered 3 items and they only gave us one and the guy took my call alarm and about to walk away, so I asked him where are my other two items, and he looked confused then asked me, else you ordered? So I told him what they were, and took him a minute to look around, and it was sitting right next to the first item, but he just simply looked confused!  I wouldn't suggest to come during busy weekend, unless you don't mind of waiting longer time, and getting mixed up on what you've ordered.  Overall still a great place to take visitors.

reviews.author: Chilly P.
reviews.description: the view is absolutely breathtaking, it's def worth the visit. i went on a random weekday for lunch so it was quite a pleasant experience. the double ipa with a pretzel and beer cheese was really great. my only critique is the service could be friendlier, the employees just seem bothered. i def am looking forward to visiting again.

reviews.author: Jonna C.
reviews.description: Whenever we had friends/family come visit us in Austin, we always bring them here. Oasis Texas Brewing Company has a wide variety of beer selections and delicious food. The views are breathtaking and really romantic especially when the sun sets. With the relentless Texas heat, nothing beats a tall glass of cold brew and a plate of parmesan truffle fries while enjoying an amazing view of Lake Travis with good company. If you're not a fan of beer, they do offer wines, ciders, cocktails, and margaritas. Speaking of margaritas, a true Texan can always tell if a place is good if their margaritas are on point!

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: Just go! You won't regret it.   Everything is was amazing! We had French fries and avocado dip to go with our beers. Fries comes with a truffle aioli.   For the beers we had Grand Cru Dark Ale and Samurai Lager.   The Grand Cru Dark Ale comes in a small cup. The server assured me that was a good amount unless I was really found of dark ale. He was right that was a good amount because that beer is strong.   I pretty sure I wasn't going to finish the beer if I had asked for a double sized cup.   Really nice experience over all.   I would recommend this place a million times.

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: I truly wanted to love this place.. Texas weather is just right this time of year, the views make you want to make the drive from Cali to the lone star state just to get that perfect pic over the lake with a drink your hand in the free state of Texas....but don't be disappointed when you are greeted by a not so friendly mask police manager that wants to wear his mask under his nose ....   the guacamole had zero taste the salsa was watery and had zero flavor... the chips were the bottom of the barrel... all of the guests seated around us were unhappy and didn't receive good service either but were happy with the views. The fellow guests/visitors we met were super cool and that was the best part... the drinks food and service were way below average... what is it with these places? get it together! the views bring us there but you need to pick it up from there... managers are clueless... bartenders were so rude....embarrassing for Austin...  so many visitors and this is their first impression of Austin unfortunately... we can do better.  We ordered 2 pizzas and left 80% of them on the table....Tasted frozen with ragu sauce.... I can't even begin to explain the regrets I have going here... The guy that gave us a ride on the golf cart up was very nice and now I feel he may have been trying to warn us about going there..  Bathrooms were gross and tables were nasty... nobody was cleaning up after people.... trash and masks everywhere and near the water... I follow not unfollowed their social media page and the pictures are very enticing but it's the exact opposite of what you actually get... from the drinks to the food.. Fire pit was a nice touch.. we stopped to talk to other guests there on our way out... Its a one hitter quitter for all..  won't be back... what a waste of location.

reviews.author: Kenny L.
reviews.description: Wow. Just wow. I wish I lived in Austin just for this place, better said, Oasis on Lake Travis makes you want to move to Austin lol. I was really impressed with the scenery and view of Lake Travis, the fact that parking is free and that this location is really affordable.  This brewery offers an immense and spacious interior and exterior to enjoy your adult beverage and your company with a vining atmosphere and beautiful view. Honestly, this place is the place to be to hang out with friends and family or a date. :)  The affordable local brewed beer is amazing. Fortunately, as I am not an avid beer drinker, this place had a Wisconsin sourced stout and I am grateful they had a seasonal stout to offer to those with a stout palate. That just made me so happy because I wanted to drink with my family. They do have a full bar on the 2nd level but we didn't want liquor.  The bartendar, black guy with nice eyes and hair, was so patient and helpful. He even let us taste one of the crafted beer. Reason for this was because the website (menu via qsr code) was not updated to reflect what they had and we had to select what we wanted again lol. So he was just great and patient.  My brother in law ordered some food which I think is not really worth it BUT if you didn't have the chance to eat and didn't want to drink on an empty stomach, then go for it. Otherwise, if you're hungry and you wanted a meal, yeah, no, eat before you come here.  I can't wait to go back just to enjoy the ambience and energy with great, affordable beer!

reviews.author: Candy B.
reviews.description: Come for the views, they're the absolute best in Austin. You won't top this. The only trouble is it's on the 3rd floor and the elevator has been out of service for 3yrs so whatever you have you're carrying. We got amazing pics and they actually have a nice selection of vegan options! We were pleasantly surprised and stayed here a while. Drinks were just OK. My husband has IPA's and I have Rosé and whatever I drank gave me the worst headache. They're not carrying top selections but since people come for the view I don't think they care. Nonetheless - we'll be back for sure! We just can't bring visitors unable to walk 3 flights of stairs. There are wheelchair accessible views on floor one though so still worth the visit.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: There's a reason why the Oasis Texas Brewing Company is the preferred choice. They offer not only great brews, wines, and ciders, but also exceptional food and views. I've been here multiple times now, and every time I've come, I leave with a happy soul, and a full belly.   Patty lovers, the Wagyu Burger. Fries, the Parmesan Fries with Aioli. Brew, the double IPA.

reviews.author: Tim F.
reviews.description: I totally recommend the brewery! Super awesome and chill! The bartenders are very knowledgeable and helpful most of the time. Some of them do have an issue with conversing with themselves and ignoring the customer, but usually are good about that.

name: St Elmo Brewing Company
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Urvashi G.
reviews.description: To say, I love this place is an understatement.  Always, always, always a good time here. Great beers, great food, great vibe/ambience. I completely love visiting here and I try to keep suggesting everyone to go here at every chance I get. Hahahah!   Parking can be little tricky on a weekend evening/rush hours. But we eventually always find it (maybe 5-10 mins of struggling later). They have enough space for free parking.   There is "Spicy boys fried chicken" food truck here at all times, which is just absolute best. Again, I can go and on about the delicious food they carry, but this is about the brewery itself. The food truck is a beautiful perfect cherry on top.   The brewery carries wide range of selection, and I thoroughly enjoy them. The service people are also wonderful. If you sign up for the rewards program, you can save some money down the road. So I suggest to sign up online for it.   Dogs are welcomed and Thursday evenings they have live music performance going on. Enough seating indoors and outdoors.  Definitely visit here and you can thank me later ;)

reviews.author: Ashleigh J.
reviews.description: This is a fun and easy place to grab a beer and hangout with friends. There are a variety of beer options and a ton of parking and seating available inside and outside. There are a few food trucks to grab food from in case you're hungry, including Spicy Boys! I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Matt C.
reviews.description: Great beers, some unique, some standard to appeal to most palates. The best thing of all? Honestly priced. We'll be back with our pup. Love it.

reviews.author: Katrina S.
reviews.description: As we drove to the brewery it seemed like a bit of a strange area at first. The brewery is located in an industrial park that has some other stuff going on. We were surprised by how full the parking lot was.  We stopped by on a Sunday afternoon and decided to sit outside and it was very hot. There were fans but it didn't seem to help much. I will note that there was indoor seating available.    The food truck that was outside was really cool. We got the cauliflower wings with the Korean Buffalo sauce. You can order on your phone or at the window which is nice.   You can order beer inside, they have a variety of different options. I tried out the hop water (no alcohol) which was really interesting. Sparkling with some whatnot a tartness from the hops. We tried the hazy IPA which was pretty hoppy, probably not the best on a hot day. The staff was all very nice.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: This is the perfect place to meet up with friends. They have a nice patio, but they also have inside seating.   They sell beer on tap and beer to go. They don't sell flights, but they can sell you a half pint if you just want to taste a few different beers.   When we arrived, it wasn't too busy and you could just sit wherever even though all the tables had a reserved sign. Later on we returned for beer to go and noticed that you had to wait to be seated.   They have a food truck on site that also sells vegan items.

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: I had a 5 year old gift card when I went to try St Elmo Brewing Company and surprisingly, they still found it in their system. I was treated like royalty here -- the bartenders handed me a binder with tasting notes (that was theirs for reference) and they checked on me as I was working there for about an hour. Great beer, good vibes...I just wish the food options were better. I hope they will eventually cycle new trucks there.

reviews.author: Carolyn A.
reviews.description: I was delighted to discover St. Elmo's in South Austin in a very attractive warehouse district. The venue is modern and the group I was with sat outdoors on the patio. Having Sour Boys food truck a few steps away was a nice addition. Enjoyed the brews quite a bit! Definitely put this neighborhood on your must visit list.

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: Cute spot. Not crowded at all on a Friday mid afternoon.  They don't do flights RN but offer you a tasting of anything you want. The coffe cream ale was delicious, and I don't do beer and after the tasting I got a glass!! Hubs got the hazy IPA-said not the best he's ever had but he likes it. He also got the double IPA and gave it a 7/10. They had 2 flavors of frozen cocktails too: strawberry limeade (tart) and frose.   Cute outside area. Inside smelled a bit like sushi...but they weren't selling any on the premises. ‍

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: Can't believe I haven't hit this brewery up sooner! This area has a lot to offer, and this is definitely one of the great spots in the area. The brewery has a lot of IPAs, I don't really remember which hazy I got but I remember it was really good! They also have lighter options if you aren't into IPAs. Lots of great flavors going into the beer here. They have Inside seating and outside seating, with a food truck on location for some grub as well. Overall great beer and a really cool vibe outside.

reviews.author: Tina N.
reviews.description: Great brewery with a food truck on location. Plenty of seating for humans and furry companions. The vibe is super chill and the beer is even chiller.

reviews.author: Kristen R.
reviews.description: Awesome sandwhiches, huge open patio with lots of seating. Great spot for beers during day or night next to all the other drink spots in same strip (wine, sake, whiskey)

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Nice spacious clean environment, welcoming patio, great selection of beers and ciders - I had an excellent cider and my husband enjoyed his beer.   I miss SourSop as the food truck option outside but Spicy Boys had good chicken wings for my husband and lovely tater tots for the vegetarian me.

reviews.author: Kevin Y.
reviews.description: Very solid selection, mostly on draft. Right now you order at counter and bring back to your table.   My favorites here are the sour and then Gary (which is an IPA). Everyone else I went with were happy with their selections as well.  They have adequate indoor and outdoor seating, depending on what you prefer. There is also a food truck that stops here and pairing fried chicken with beer is a winner in my book anytime.

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: The environment was high energy and had lots of space to grab drinks with friends. We stayed for a while to catch up without any issues which was great!

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: St. Elmo has plenty of beer, outside seating and live music! I recommend their raspberry beer if you aren't a big beet person. For me, it was nice and tart and masked the beer taste. Also be sure to hit up the Spicy Boy's Chicken food truck!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Pretty good beer in a Biergarten setting. Great service. Lots of folks enjoying this beautiful day. Dog friendly outside with plenty of seating inside as well. Food truck on site.

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: This was exactly what I was looking for is a brewery in Austin. Their beers were fantastic and the staff were all friendly and very knowledgeable. The beer garden was well a portion and they had a food truck with Korean hot chicken which was to die for. I ordered a five piece thigh and legs fried chicken and I can still taste of hours later it was that good. The 311 Amber Avenue was amazing and I brought two cans home. I highly suggest anyone in town go here and try them out.

reviews.author: Carl C.
reviews.description: I love this place. I moved to South Austin this past October and my friends recommended this spot as one of their favorites and it's the biggest reason I'm so happy to be in South Austin. The staff and overall vibe have been so warm and welcoming, and it's a great place to chill, chat, drink and eat.  I'm definitely biased because of my name, but I love the Carl. It's a perfectly crisp and thirst quenching beer, and super affordable and easy to drink - especially on Fridays when they're $2. The beautiful Carl merchandise (glass and hat) also makes me cry as a kid who could never find tourist trap memorabilia with my name noticeably missing on the license plates around Carla and Carlos.  The taps change regularly with the updated menu easily available from their site or instagram. I always enjoy the fruity sours they have.  Post-Covid19, I've wanted to keep supporting this spot and the seamless transition to grab and go crowlers and growlers with online ordering makes it easy. I did my first one today and it scheduled a pick up about 30 minutes after I placed the order. Went right in, gave my name, and they brought it out for me.

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: My favorite brewery in Austin!  St. Elmo has consistently awesome beers (focusing largely on traditional stlyes, like their flagship kolsch Carl) and is suuuuuuper dog-friendly.  There's no better way to spend a few hours, in my book, than filling my face with stout and passing out pets to allllll the floof.   Fantastic food truck, soursop, on-site.  Tap list is regularly updated on insta.  Killer coffee shop further down in the strip, Spokesman.

reviews.author: Ingrid G.
reviews.description: I just visited St Elmo for the first time after hearing so much hype about the place, and I'm leaving super underwhelmed and disappointed. The bartender's energy was not welcoming to neither myself nor my husband. We both approached her at different times. I ordered the beers and asked her for recommendations, and she said "The Carl" and nothing else with no smile or anything. My husband then approached her to ask where the dog water bowls were and she said "they're out there," again, with no further help or comment. He tried asking her again saying we didn't see them, and she said "they're out there" again. Not coming here again!

reviews.author: Ju L.
reviews.description: Long overdue review, but I appreciated the gentleman who wrapped my last minute Christmas gift. I just asked for a paper bag but he went the extra miles to make it all nice with wrapping paper and bow. Thanks :) will be back

reviews.author: William D.
reviews.description: Nope, will not return here.  Barely a mumble from store employee after entering their store that was empty of patrons.  I remember coming here at their Grand Opening and they were a lot more enthusiastic about their customers. Hopefully, they will find better help soon.

reviews.author: Mike K.
reviews.description: Will not be returning here. Selection is ok not great, service is ok, however , these days most do not carry cash and to be up charged for using a debit card to pay for the CC service is a joke, and pay attention to the amount  almost 4% of the total, I am thinking another way to profit a little at a time. Just bad business not whiskey business

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: I waked into this store not expecting much.  Boy, was I wrong.  He has a really good selection of bourbon.  I walked out with a bottle that I've never seen on any other shelf, anywhere else.  It wasn't much more expensive than the larger stores, and he actually had it.  I didn't even check out the scotch selection, which I  need to go back and do.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Karen P.
reviews.description: They have a good selection but they are kinda pricey. Perfect if you just need a bottle but not if you're looking to restock several items.

reviews.author: Sarah E.
reviews.description: Came in to make it quick liquor store run, left with two welcoming friends and a much greater appreciation of all the options at my fingertips. Waylon and Weston where more than available to answer questions and make recommendations and overall create a hospitable and enjoyable shopping experience. I look forward to going back and taking some friends with me because I know we won't be disappointed in the party they help supply!

reviews.author: Geary H.
reviews.description: One of the first things when I entered their store, their dog "Whiskey" greeted me, then the owners. Handshakes when you show up; that's Texas! Whiskey Business has a diverse, quality, well-priced inventory. They had everything I needed. Even took home a six of Boerne Brewery's Old Courthouse Ale at the owner's suggestion. It's like he knew what I'd like. He did. One of my favorites is an Irish dry stout {think Guinness}, and I've now found a new favorite. Love it! I'll make Whiskey Business my go-to. Thank you for your hospitality!

reviews.author: Kodi S.
reviews.description: A new liquor store in town! Great selection, I put in a few requests and they had them in by the next visit. The staff is awesome, very friendly folks. I wont lie, I'm a regular now mostly because of their dog- Whiskey. ‍

reviews.author: Nechelle D.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable and courteous service. Definitely where I'll always go and send everyone!

reviews.author: Peyton G.
reviews.description: I went on a Monday and they have the best deals!   A large pizza for $9 bucks or a burger and beer for $10!  The pizza was good and the wings were average. I love wings so they didn't disappoint. The bartender was nice. They have pool and a couple of other games. Beer is brewery price like 6-9. There are sports playing. Single and couple or group of friends. Pretty chill I would come again. They had a stage so I wonder if they have shows?

reviews.author: Yelp Y.
reviews.description: It's a decent spot.  Big warehouse with a nice little outdoor nook populated with picnic tables.  Food in terms of the "loaded" fries leaves a lot to be desired (they're not really "that" loaded, so the price for the product is absurd); the pickles tasted good but the fry was quite irregular; the spinach artichoke dip is delicious but the chips cannot lift the dip without you helping them along, either by doubling up or scooping with a utensil.  Beer is alright.  One of the lagers is so-so but the raspberry sour is pretty good.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Super excited to have another brewery in the South Congress area to go enjoy some tasty as heck beers and get in your order for some Southside Flying Pizza or other tasty snacks and items on their menu!  This location will forever be in my heart as the first time I ever stepped foot here was when we were in desperate need for some warm food, cold beer, and water.  Beers:  I have been enjoying the melon + grapefruit notes in their Simcoe Pale Ale as well as their summer seasonal ale Vaquero Ranchers lager that is just easy and smooth to drink down on a summer day.  Unsure what to get - check out their crowlers to-go and canned beers! I grabbed a sixer to take home with me the last time we were here just so I can try the variety of other options they have here.  OH! Also I noticed they have a frozen drink machine too!  check it out for me, eh?!  Food:  We came here on a weekend and there was a crawfish broil happening to our surprise!  Easy to order online, at your table, and/or at the counter. I really love the option to order directly from your table and be able to pay without having to get up and go to the counter especially if you are nailing that ping pong game against your friends!  We really enjoy ordering and eating pizza here as Southside Flying Pizza nails it every time and there is enough to enjoy with everyone.   Outside / Inside:  all COVID safety measures are practiced here and taken seriously both inside and outside.  There is PLENTY of seating outside and ample amount of space to move around without it feeling crowded at all.  Snovid: When we experienced about 5 days without water we noticed that Last Stand Brewing were offering water fill ups. We grabbed our containers and made the quick drive down South Congress to get our fill.  I am SUPER appreciative of the kindness, ease, and availability to be able to get some water for our needs during the snowpocalypse that all of Texas experienced.  I will forever be in debt to Last Stand as the showed their genuine willingness to help their community out in a time of extreme need.  THANK YOU, Last Stand! You are truly a life saver.  I appreciate your kindness and help always!

reviews.author: Sara F.
reviews.description: I discovered The Last Stand at the original location in Dripping Springs two years ago.  I'm  so happy that they opened a larger 2nd location in my SoCo neighborhood. It's by far my favorite brewery in Austin, they always serve great beer, good service, live music and delicious pizza.  I celebrated my birthday there with close friends and everyone was impressed.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: We weren't huge fans of the beers unfortunately, but glad to have a new option in south Austin! They have a lot of space with games, Southside pizza, and dogs are welcome :)

reviews.author: Brooke P.
reviews.description: Great neighborhood spot, great atmosphere and super friendly staff.  I love the beers here, they have a solid selection.  The space is very large as well if you want to bring the whole crew.

reviews.author: J P.
reviews.description: I love this place.  Beers are great and they have slushy drinks too.  Super large space with lots of tables.  The staff here is also very friendly.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: It is always great to have new breweries on the south side of Austin.  This is a great addition.  They have a large variety of brews as well as some wines and proseccos.  They have a fairly big outdoor area and indoor area.  They also have bar games inside and dogs are welcome.  The beers were cold and some were pretty tasty.  The food was just okay.  Hope to come back and try some new beers.

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: Well we gave it a try, so sister and I stopped here for a nice cold beer last night. We were stopped when walking in the door by a rude ass employee (dark curly hair with glasses) literally yelling at us about a mask from across the room full of people. We are fully aware some spots still require masks and as we tried to ask if we can sit outdoors she rudely interrupted us and continued to tell us she won't serve us unless we have a mask. Shit lady haven't you ever heard of customer service or even normal communication. She could have approached us and explained their policy it was not necessary to demean us for making a mistake.      We walked outside my sister was livid and embarrassed. I talked her into staying and me walking in with my mask since she has forgot hers and her sitting outside on the bench area. I saw the employee again and asked if we could sit outside at a table which was our original plan (if she listened and didn't scold us like children) she said I can order since I have a mask but my sister can't leave the table with a complete attitude. I ordered got the beers, drank them and we left.      The beers are good but not worth the rude inappropriate staff. There are plenty of local breweries with good vibes and good beer! Don't waste your time.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: A great new addition to the neighborhood!! Plenty of outdoor and open air seating, and they are on point with covid precautions. The beers are good and they have some guest taps which is nice. They also serve south side pizza and have tons of games. A great place to hang out; and family friendly.

reviews.author: Taylor P.
reviews.description: If you enjoy being harassed over a mask policy still while you drink mediocre at best beer, this spot is for you! Last stand more like Last Time, cause it's the last time I'll stop in.. Nothing Texas about this place either, decor is lame duck and outside tables are disgusting..

reviews.author: Marc C.
reviews.description: My friends and I enjoy the atmosphere, but we frequently don't get good service here. The bartenders don't seem to be on the same page as far as pour amounts go, either. Depending on the bartender, you may get a tap beer in a small plastic cup or a pint glass. I asked a female bartender why that was, and she said they do either "double" or "single" pours. I went back the following week and asked for a double pour of the same beer from the week before - this time with a different male bartender - and he said they only do beers in pint glasses. I guess there is a lack of communication on that front but it's resulting in customers asking for double pours and being charged more for what should be the normal amount of beer and frankly that doesn't sit right with me.  The value of the food from Southside Flying Pizza is also overpriced. The quality of the food is not equal to what they're charging, and they're frequently out of menu items and condiments by the evening. I've never been for lunch but their "special" is a slice of pizza for $4, which hardly seems like a special to me considering the quality of the pizza.  They make tasty beer, though!

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: If you're looking for your neighborhood bar, look no further. Beer is cold and the food is good! Ashley helped me and I felt at home! Live music Thursday - Saturday! Check this place out! I will be back, again!

reviews.author: Jake A.
reviews.description: I believe this location just recently opened. I ordered a couple of six packs off their site for pick up to see what their beer was like. I tried the Craftsman Light and Texas Forever. Both were great tasting brews. They were both light with very distinct flavor notes from each other. I loved them both! They also went well with food as they are crisp light beers with a smooth finish. Glad that this place is nearby, I plan on grabbing some beer from here on a regular basis.

reviews.author: Paul L.
reviews.description: Nice draft beer selection and a good amount of seating. The outdoor patio is a great spot for conversation and hanging out on a nice night. It's great to have another brewery in South Austin. The overall taste of the food and drinks are OK (there's better beer and pizza in Austin in general), but the staff is friendly, the location is convenient, they're pet friendly, and their prices are fair. Definitely worth a visit and will be back.

reviews.author: Rob S.
reviews.description: Great beer and the best pizza I've had since moving to Austin.   The Southsider pizza and the West Coast IPA were GREAT!!!

reviews.author: Ryan M.
reviews.description: This location just opened and our experience was great! We brought our two dogs and they were able to place some picnic tables out front in their parking lot. Food purchase required with beer so we got chips and queso with our Hefe and Citra IPA. Really good stuff.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: above average beer and a really nice atmosphere  came here for a flight and a little snack after work last Friday. First off, I really liked the atmosphere. there is a bunch of outdoor seating, which is always a plus.  For drinks I got a flight, so I got a variety of beers. Overall, they were pretty good, however, they don't have a lot of variety in the styles available. I also got a slice of pizza, which was much better than I expected for brewery food. All said and done, it's definitely a spot worth visiting, but isn't the best that Austin has to offer.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: This is a Highly Recommend kinda place.   Staff - super friendly and knowledgeable about the drinks and food products.   Environment - lots of seating indoors and out. You can spread out and work. You can dine in and chill. Go alone or with a party and still feel like you have the place to yourself.   Food/drinks - i have yet to have a bad food item from these guys. Everything is delicious and surprisingly thought out. It will take you by surprise. And the drinks. There are plenty of options to taste and enjoy based on your preferences.   $$$ - it is a little pricier then you might expect. But truthfully, for what you get, I will continue to come back here and spend the money.    Give it a shot. I do not think you will regret it. I would recommend this place over Pint House pizza or even Dominoes ;).

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: 10-24-21  As you can probably figure out, I like beer.  This is my drink of choice. And visiting breweries just takes the experience to the next level.  Quality/Quantity - Beer was mediocre. My family did not like the menu here, so I was pressured to quickly finish my beer and sadly leave.  It should be illegal to only drink one beer...  We hit Trader Joes on the way back and realized they carried the whole line of their beer, so as you can guess, I got two more six packs:)  Now, I am happier.  Atmosphere - You need a much bigger parking lot, especially since almost everyone drives a huge truck. We got lucky with a space, but had to share some of the space with the huge truck to the right and the huge truck to the left, LOL. Teri Joyce and the Tagalongs were playing tonight. They did a good job, the place was hoping. Both the inside and outside spaces are large; however, again too large for their parking lot. Can some people carpool? They also had a small outdoor stand to order beer and food. Additionally, there were plenty of seats at the bar. The team seems to be working pretty hard.  Service - The bartender was just okay. Not much to write about, I ordered, he gave me the beer, and I left; still left a tip though :)  Price - $6.50 + $1 tip  Owner Suggestion - Did I say you need a bigger parking lot? Wish I had more time to enjoy your place, but no fault of yours. Hopefully next time. Keep up the good work.

reviews.author: Sj G.
