reviews.description: It looks like a really nice beer garden.  The weather looked like rain so we sat inside.  They do have restrooms and they are clean.  Food is hard to decide if you are lactose intolerant.  We found a Pulled Pork and it came with a pint of beer. We also got two pizzas for the rest to share.  We had the wagyu and 2 choice of the specialty pizza cauliflower. That was a good choice.  I don't care for beer so I had a cider.   They were out of watermelon So I had cranberry.  Very tart but refreshing.  The bar tenders were all so friendly and nice.  I didn't see anywhere to get beer flights and my son had his bday.  Nothing special like a drink or come out to table.   It's a nice atmosphere with nice folks.

reviews.author: Dave W.
reviews.description: Cool spot! Can order inside or outside, and there's tons of long picnic tables to sit at. Beer was good, not great.

reviews.author: Eric R.
reviews.description: Such a great piece of the South Austin community. The food is better than it has to be. The employees at all levels are outstanding. Everyone is helpful and friendly regardless of how busy they are.   Food and service aside, this is just a great place to spend time with the people you love/like. Every time I've been here has been memorable.  Showed up on a Saturday afternoon with a party of 25+ and we immediately found a group of picnic tables and spent the next several hours just enjoying each other's company.   Everyone enjoyed their food and drink but what we'll remember and what I'm most grateful for is the ambiance and hospitality at ABGB.   There's plenty of places to go eat, but when you have a large party and want to make memories with an Austin feel, look no further.

reviews.author: Alex M.
reviews.description: Great outdoor place with plenty of seating for medium size parties. The indoor aesthetic reminds me of a disco roller rink, super groovy.   The food alone is worth coming for, it's upscale apps that are absolutely delicious and they also have pizza.  The con (and why I'm only giving 4 stars) is that this is a beer garden that has ONLY SIX beers available - all brewed in house. I wish they at least had some local options that made the beer list a bit longer, after all it is a beer garden. They also have a small list of ciders and wine available. The "Industry" Pilsner was great and a nice light beer but

reviews.author: Clara C.
reviews.description: *COVID Update*   ABGB is a must visit when in Austin. Parking in their lot is ample. Restrooms are on-site in the corner. Seating is self-served both indoors and outdoors, and there is free WiFi! Masks aren't required here, and most people don't wear them inside or outside. The menu is on a QR code, which is posted on each table. The water station is in the back.   I got the beer flight $15 as it was my first visit. The pilsner is definitely my favorite; it's a popular one! It's odd that there's only 6 choices, but it helps especially for those who are indecisive. If you order one beer, it's about $6. When I visited on a Sunday afternoon, they had live music and many couples were dancing along. I totally missed the memo to bring my boots and hat.   I tried the Calabrese and homemade sausage pizza ($3.50 per slice). Both were delicious.   Obviously with the live music, it's loud inside, but it's a fun place to hang out with larger groups.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Really like this gem of a place. Food was delicious with plenty of outside seating.  They now have ordering outside which is a real win and helps with the lines! Live music is another perk of this spot.  It gets crowded i. the evenings so ride share is a smart way to go.

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: I thought ABGB was a good time! I enjoyed the live music on the night we visited, which happened to be their 8-year anniversary. I had the Day Trip pale ale, and I thought it was pretty delicious. The salad I ordered was also yummy; I especially liked the golden beets. But the star of the show was the pretzel with pimento cheese for SURE.

reviews.author: Melinda N.
reviews.description: Very relaxing place. Smaller than brewtorium but at least you can hear each other. There was no music when I went on a Thursday after work. I did a flight to sample their good stuff. It's 5 five ounce pours so it's filling! The bruschetta was good but needed more salt or balsamic dressing. It was still tasty. But the stuffed peppadews were really good. I'll need to come back to try their pizza. There's indoor and outdoor seating. Staff know their stuff. Parking seems to fill up fast. Right off of south Lamar

reviews.author: Kelsey M.
reviews.description: Great place to take the dogs and have a pint! The beer is great and the pizza is equally as good! Friendly staff

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: We love ABGB.  The pizzas are delicious.  The salad is amazing.  The beer is cold.  Parking is always perfect.  The wait is always minimal.  The staff are super nice and helpful.  The taste of the pizza is ON POINT!  We always have a great time here.  When you first walk in, the smell of the pizza is out of this world.  it's a great place to take friends from out of town.

reviews.author: Josh H.
reviews.description: I have to ability to work from anywhere, which let's me drop on on places randomly. It's nice because I can keep a running list of spots to check out when I find myself nearby and I don't need t hop on a zoom meeting with a client. ABGB is one of those spots. I stopped in here for a quick beer during covid and it was pretty solid, this is my first time back.   The wifi is good, clearly. I'm writing this review and it hasn't faltered at all. The beer selection is small, but what I've tasted has all been solid. Both in flavor and body, they are true to what they are brewing. Quiet and mellow atmosphere is lovely is for getting some work done and maintaining a medium focus. The garlic fries smell delicious.   The only downside is that I'm getting a little bug action. But I'm also sitting under a tree, in Texas, in June.     I'll be back and probably to eat.

reviews.author: Ivan V.
reviews.description: The people in this great hall were happy and dancing, and I saw many children! I had initially come to this village for the sake of disgracing a rival with an extremely low offer. The coward was forced to accept, so my conquerors and I were in the mood to celebrate with ale and song. Our time here was a delight, and I wish them luck for the coming winter.

reviews.author: Takao N.
reviews.description: We ate outdoor.  Social distancing, masks whenever necessary, great food and beer...they've got everything covered.  People were very considerate and we felt extremely safe.  We enjoyed dining out this evening.  Definitely one of the best places if you want to eat out safely.

reviews.author: Jan C.
reviews.description: This has fast become our go to place during these last few months. This is dining during a pandemic at it's best. We have always been happily greeted and shown directly to our reserved table. Servers immediately appear and explain how to order. We write our drink and app order on a slip of paper and they scoop it up and bring it back just as we've decided on our main course. They leave you alone unless you need them but are right there if you place the paper on the stand for more beer or water or a box for leftovers. The website is very clear a reservation is required and it is a 2 hour limit. Once the time escaped us and an employee came by with "a gentle reminder that your 2 hour limit is up" Nothing rude there.   Covid deets out of the way the chef is awesome.  Food is amazing. We used to come only for white clam pizza and beer which is still an excellent choice but there's so much more to be explored on the menu. I had a peach and turkey with brie and avacado that was simply the best sandwich I've had in my life. Specialty pizzas are so so good. And the calamari and stuffed portobello were very tasty. This is better than elevated bar food.    5 stars ABGB. Keep it going! We appreciate you

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Certainly the neighborhood gem! The venue is amazing for live music and dance. The pizza and beer are really good. The parking is a bit challenging, even on a late Wednesday, but the effort is worth it.

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: This is my second time at the ABGB and I love the vibe here! It was super hard not to order more deviled eggs because whoever made those DEFINITELY understood the assignment . There's more than enough room for everyone both inside and outside; literally nothing to complain about when it comes to ABGB, The staff work quickly and make everything' as easy as possible. When we went, there were vendors there with Austin Flea and Hail Marley(Bob Marley cover band) playing outside. Can't wait to go back and try the pizza!

reviews.author: Marco S.
reviews.description: Fun outdoor atmosphere and pretty good food 90% of the time Foxann and Heaven are the bedt!.

reviews.author: Rudy S.
reviews.description: Best beer on the "Planet"  Sad to see original tasting room move. However we are super excited for new location!  When available go for the Silverback!!  Busch League ranks high too.   Every Saturday should have a few Bucket Heads on the menu!  That is all.   Werd

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: Just get the Thirsty Goat. It is a crowd favorite. We stopped in on a recent Pub Crawl and the place was hopping. Since they don't sell food, your pup is welcome and we had fun lovin' on some sweet dawgs! Uh, the four legged ones.  They are great at working the crowd and selling their beer glasses. Katherine was there at the door on the one day (Saturday) that we stopped by to explain how it works. Lots of t-shirts and ball caps to pick through and new fun people to meet. Everyone's happy with a beer.  I also love that Thirsty Planet supports Divine Canines, a therapy dog group that sponsors training for dogs to service hospital patients. Just wish they were open for more than 4 hours a week. Rumor has it this outstanding brewery will soon move to a new much larger space on South Congress.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: Came in on a gorgeous spring Saturday afternoon and enjoyed my free...yes free...beer tasting here. Now, the "free" tasting is 3 tastes of anything they have on the board in the little taster glasses. There is an option to purchase full pours which includes a glass.  I have always been a fan of Thirsty Planet's beer offerings as I have had them at several brewpubs around Austin. Their Buckethead and Double Buckethead are my handsdown favorites! When I was out and about and headed to some other breweries, I stopped in here and was happy I did.  The staff was very nice and there is ample communal seating inside and out. They also offer tours, but I did not take one as I was a bit tight on time.   For a glorious afternoon in a chill atmosphere with great beer offerings and a little roadtrip out of Austin, this is a great place to spend it!

reviews.author: Fernando V.
reviews.description: Nice brewery with a good selection of beers. We happened to show up during an event so we got to hang out in the breezy back and sample LOTS of beer which was great. No food and a little warm so keep that in mind when making a visit

reviews.author: Heihachiro K.
reviews.description: The Buckethead IPA was awesome! 8.9% and full of deliciousness. I was rather impressed by this brewery and how similar the atmosphere and brews were to the San Diego brew scene.  We got a great deal - take home pint glass with three pints for $10! Sweet!

reviews.author: Khiem L.
reviews.description: I came here on the first leg of a drinking bonanza. The weather was behaving and so we grabbed a table outside and started boozing it up. It's cheap to get a few pours and most everything there is close to some ambrosia of sorts. I've definitely had the goat everywhere so I was glad to try the only-found in-house bevs.   I do not like IPAs so what did I try first, the double bucket head IPA of course. Awesome taste. Not so bitter but leaves you feeling good. Pretty strong so it was a great way to start the morning. I can't recall the other beers I tried but I do remember leaving happy.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Stop one of three for a brewery tour...   I had three of their beers: Lemon Bitch - Special beer on tap. I don't have any of the ABV info but it had a nice lemon taste to it. Very refreshing for the hot weather.  Thirsty Goat - American-style Amber Ale, 6.5% ABV. Had a nice spicy finish with the beer.  Yellow Armadillo - Light American-style Wheat, 4.0% ABV. Very refreshing. Had some citrus flavors in there.   There is a nice outside area with picnic tables and plenty of seating inside and out.   The guys there were so nice. Very engaging and informative when it comes to the beer info.   When I make it back to Austin, I'll definitely be stopping by again.

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: Stopped by for a tasting. There are a wide variety of flavors and I especially liked the Palehead. The outdoor "patio" area is lacking but the indoor tasting area makes up for it. From what I understanding they are opening another place soon.  Take advantage of the "Barks for Beer" sale. $20 for a special pint glass that's good for a free pint in several restaurants and other breweries.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: Well, THIS place is awesome.   Heck yeah Thirsty Planet, go you. $10 for three pints + a pint glass + brewery tour = fun Saturday. We stopped by this place and had a swell time. The owner/brewmaster was super nice and friendly, in fact, everyone who worked there was awesome. If you don't want to drink three beers, you get a tasting glass and three free tasters. But then you don't get an awesome pint glass...   Only gripe? No AC (in August, yuck) and it is SUPER LOUD inside. And it seemed that the more people drink, the louder they got and it was just incredibly noisy.   If you like Thirsty Planet beers, or beer in general, definitely worth checking out.

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: Checked out their brewery tasting and tour this past Saturday.  Warning: there are times it will be quite crowded like when bus loads of people stop by.  However, even despite the crowds, the bartenders did a great job of serving everyone.  $10 gets you a souvenir pint glass and three full pints (plus you can taste a few oz of the other beers they have for no additional charge, so really you can taste 7-8 taps for $10).  Their yellow armadillo and thirsty goat are both solid crowd and palate pleasers.  I liked their merch as well, bought a ladies tee for $18.  The tour was about 25 minutes long, but it was the hottest part of July and it was not a/c, so I think they mercifully made it quick for us.  We brought kiddos and the outside area was kid friendly, although not completely fenced in by the side of the road, which was a bit nerve wracking.  I wish I had brought some more small bills as tips collected in the tasting room go to a local charity, which rotates monthly or seasonally.  A fun way to spend a Saturday, would be even better in the cooler months of the year.

reviews.author: El S.
reviews.description: Thirsty planet was the first stop on a brew bus tour I went on.  So I remember it the best.  The only think I didn't like was their smoky beer.  But it's not like I didn't know it would be smoky.  I ordered it anyway and didn't like it so that's on me.  Regarding the brewery itself, it was a well thought out taproom with quality beers.  I liked that they have games to play - always a plus for me.

reviews.author: Sarah G.
reviews.description: More like 4.5. We had a great post-Zoo visit here on a sweaty Saturday afternoon. $10 for a sweet glass and three pints always works for me. They'll also give you a small tasting glass for free, but why bother with that?   I've been a fan of Thirsty Goat amber for awhile, and this visit turned me on to the Hoppy Blonde and Buckethead IPA. I'll be looking for all of them at local bars.  The "tour" is one room, but hey they're a small business, which is cool. Very informative, maybe more than the average beer fan will want, but beer nerds will love it and it's not hard to step out and back to the bar if you get bored.   One downside, it was super stuffy in the tasting room. Not sure if their AC was acting up or just couldn't handle the crowd and the July heat. However, that didn't stop my group for staying and drinking until closing time. I'd recommend Thirsty Planet to any beer lover visiting or living in Austin.

reviews.author: Rachel E.
reviews.description: Stopped by the brewery for a birthday beer crawl. (Is it really a crawl if you only go to 2 places?)  We signed up for the tour online (which is free) but there was no list and it seemed like they weren't going to do the tour at all. You might have to remind them. Once we mentioned our interest, they announced it and a bunch of people joined in. I'm not sure reservations are really needed at all for this. The tour was fine, nothing to write home about. If you've done a tour before you've probably seen everything they have.  I liked a lot of the beer we had, especially the thirsty goat ale. They were out of the wheat but had a rhubarb beer which was interesting.  Staff were friendly and when not totally overwhelmed with people, happy to engage in conversation about the beers.   It did get quite crowded and I understand why. The outdoor patio is lovely when the weather is nice and they have tons of games. For me it was a bit too crowded and noisy, but that's the small price you pay for free - $10 beer. (You can either get 3 tickets for a small glass for free or 3 pint tickets + a keepsake glass for $10.)

reviews.author: Marshall J.
reviews.description: If there were 6 stars...  My family rented the brewery on a Saturday night for a birthday party. Thirsty Planet was flawless in their delivery! They were professional, yet easy to work with, responsive and surprisingly affordable. Jason did a great job behind the bar causally handling the beer orders while educating those who wanted about their beers.  PRO TIP: They use Sonos wireless music system, but do not have an external headphones jack. Download Sonos on your phone and the then manage/update your playlists and you can listin to an iTunes playlist by going to "This iPhone" (I assume the same for Android phones) and then Playlists. If you do not want an iTunes playlist, you can create a playlist in Sonos app ahead of time or play Pandora, Spotify, XM/Sirius, etc).

reviews.author: Holmes S.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time today, its a really cool place. I liked the beers and you really can't beat the price. Staff were really good, I wish I lived closer, i'd be here all the time.   The only downside is it was a little hot inside. But everything else was outstanding, so gets 5 stars from me :)

reviews.author: Evan H.
reviews.description: The tour guide was very knowledgeable and gave one of the better tours I have been on. The brewery has a nice outdoor seating area along with jenga and other games to play while you drink. Thirsty goat is a failry good brew however the other offerings on tap were pretty bland and run of the mill compared to other breweries in the Austin area.

reviews.author: Mara F.
reviews.description: Thirsty Planet is my new BFF.   Seriously, if you haven't gone on a 'tasting' - you MUST.   It's free!  The owners are great, very knowledgeable and you can tell love their craft.  We bring out of town guests to tastings as well as part of our Tour of Austin.  Be sure to ask for their brew when dining in and around Austin.

reviews.author: Itsabout T.
reviews.description: All good.  Very pleasant atmosphere and chill crowd.  Great beer, terrific value and even cool t-shirts.   What else? Well the tip jar goes to the selected charity, this time summer camp for underprivileged kids.  So good, can't wait for next visit.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: This is a great addition to Austin's micro brewery scene.  I first tried their Buckethead IPA at Second Restaurant and enjoyed it enough to look for Thirsty Planet's website, where I discovered they offer tours most Saturdays.  No information about the tours is provided on the website, but here's the deal: sign up online, when you go there's an optional tour, plus four 4 oz. samples for free, or you can purchase the "souvenir glass" for $7 and use it to get up to 4 pints free...a nice deal (although, I don't know about you, but I couldn't consume 4 full pints in 2 hours).  They have a nice large indoor tasting room with communal bench tables and an outdoor patio as well (but it offers no shade).  On to the beer:  * Buckethead IPA - one of my new favorite local IPAs; it is well balanced with the bitter and hint of sweet, with a pleasing Amber color and a mildly citrusy nose.  * Thirsty Goat Amber - a lighter amber, malty but with a slight hoppy finish.  * Double Buckethead IPA - an even stronger bitter taste than the Buckethead...save this one for last. * Yellow Armadillo Habanero - I could definitely taste the habanero flavor, but the spiciness was tempered by a pilsner-like base.  It's surprising how easily this beer can be consumed.

reviews.author: Orion G.
reviews.description: I stopped in here on a Saturday afternoon while out cruising the area. It was pretty busy, but I was able to get in fairly easily.   The place had a nice welcoming feeling to it, and stepping up to the bar got me a friendly greeting. I was not familiar with their brews, but saw one called "Twist and Stout", and being a fan of the dark stuff, went right for it. Oh my... *smiles coyly" This stuff was liquid sex.... and I knew it was going to get me in trouble.  So next up, I explained my fondness of the dark, but felt the need to expand outward, what would they suggest. The man behind the counter said without hesitation - "Thirsty Goat Amber"!  Boyo was he right! After two pints of that, I had an expression similar to the one on the label, so I took some time in my truck to eat a sandwich before driving away.  Yup, I'm going back!

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: Stopped by this groovy place today, and it passed the VIBE check 100^! First the minute you walk in the music is on point! Then there is Rachel, which she's super friendly and beer knowledgeable! Everyone was so friendly! This is the kind of place you can definitely chill for awhile!

reviews.author: Connie H.
reviews.description: First tried this tasty brewery at Terry Black's and was so happy it is served wide and far around town.  I believe my go to was Native but had some Stash at the ball Game.  Yum

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Wasn't a huge fan of their beers (tried a few and was only a semi fan of one) but I like lighter, easier to drink beers and that didn't seem to be their thing- the two beers that sounded like my cup of tea by description wound up being sours, which disappointed me.  I also felt kind of weird about asking for a flight but then being told uhhh we're not doing those right now- seemingly bc the line was long. It was odd.  Small indoor space, kind of lacking something aesthetically - compared to other Austin breweries.   Good truck onsite but it wasn't that good :/  Overall just meh! But they host geeks who drink if you're into trivia!

reviews.author: Danielle F.
reviews.description: Solid variety of beers, some seasonal, and enough space to bring a group (though not as expansive as some other breweries that have more patio seating).  I went for the Beer My Valentine's event and the Garrison Brothers bourbon-aged Convict Hill and Indy's coconut-flavored Midnight Paradise were my faves.  Tonight there was an open area for dancing and the food truck Killa Wasi was there. Really enjoyed our time there though the great event turnout made the beer line pretty long. Will definitely return to sample other beers and see experience it during a "regular" day. Staff was very friendly and I enjoyed the stouts!

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: I was an idiot when I gave this amazing brewery four stars. It's perfect and deserves no less than a perfect rating!   The beer is great, the monthly metal shows kick ass, and it's a perfect location for me.   If you're near here and want to chill at an awesome brewery do so!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Love me some authentic microbreweries.  I haven't been to a solid microbrew spot since moving to Austin, so this was such a breath of fresh air. It seems like there are plenty of breweries that also double as restaurants and music venues--which is cool, I'm all for that, but deep down I'm a plain microbrew kinda gal.  Getting here got me so excited as our GPS took us to industrial surroundings AKA the location of every great microbrewery. There is plenty of parking, and they had a yummy-smelling food truck parked outside, but we already ate so skipped that. My friend and I walked in and immediately felt the warm, relaxed energy that Independence had. I couldn't decide on what pint to get, so I settled on a taster set of four for $10. Not too pricey. The selections were not really in my favor, as I tend to go for wheats, belgians, juicy or hazy IPA's, or oatmeal stouts. However, I knew I would find something I'd like. One can never be too picky about beer.  They also have board games and free stickers! I love that!! Their logo is the lone star on black fire--super cool. Our taptender was a wonderful and friendly man. I just wish he would have been a little more wordy with his explanations of the beer profiles. I'd assume that microbreweries attract devout beer drinkers and self-proclaimed snobs (like myself), so I would love it if he was able to elaborate more. Anyhow, I will be back even with a larger group (yay picnic tables!), but I hope that they have more varieties of beer, or that they rotate their taps often.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: This is Austin laid back recharge drink great beer! Food truck yes (Good Truck) So after much sampling while listening to live music I enjoyed an amazing burger. Employees are fun and extremely knowledgeable! Lots of seating in building and out. Tucked behind a row of office. We like hidden places!

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Indep brewing has been around for 15 years but this brick and mortar is 5 years running. Cool location, industrial feel. But let's get to the beer selection..  Freak power is going for $2/pint right now! Honestly, you would be hard-pressed to find a deal this good anywhere in Austin TX. It's a hefe and goes down easily, very easy to drink.  My personal fav is the convict hill oatmeal stout, coming in at 8% and tastes like coffee. Also very easy to drink and is a nice addition in "wintertime."  Good place, fair prices, decent selection!

reviews.author: Wajih O.
reviews.description: I stopped by this place on a Friday and it was my first time visiting as well as my first time trying their beer(s). I was a little taken back at how low in ABV their beers were but that isn't a deal breaker by any means. In fact, out of the entire selection on tap, only two were higher than 5% and they both happened to be a staggering 9%. The interior is nice and very spacious.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Victoria W.
reviews.description: This is one of my favorite "hidden" gems. I don't know how hidden it is, but the first time I came, I was skeptical because it is tucked behind some businesses and inside a warehouse. However, once we discovered this great, laid-back brewery, we visit it at least monthly.  Our favorite activity is Thursday night trivia with Geeks who Drink there. We've been a few times and it's always fun! They allow outside food, so it's always fun to pick up some bites and enjoy their awesome beer as we Geek it to random trivia.  I highly recommend, especially on a Thursday night! Hope to compete against you soon!

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: Nice indoor and outdoor areas. Nice selection of drafts. I enjoyed the Freak Power Blood Orange. The Crossroads food truck has a nice selection. I loved the spicy chicken tenders and the Brussels Sprouts. Very friendly service. Located south of 71 and east of 35. Tonight I was inside and it was hotter than the hinges of Hell. Air conditioner was blowing cold so not sure why the room was so hot. At sunset they opened the garage door and it cooled a bit. High today was 100 degrees.

reviews.author: Jennifer H.
reviews.description: Super impressed with this brewery! The beer is awesome, the staff are great and the atmosphere is pretty rad! 10/10 will drink there again!

reviews.author: Greshka P.
reviews.description: Last stop of our brewery tour. This is more of what I'm used to in Florida...  warehouse turned into taproom. Beers listed on the wall, not that many options here but still good beers.  One of the beers I wanted to try ran out so they recommended another based on that selection. Good job, I liked it.  It was a bit sour, so it hit the mark.  But the one I liked the most was the End Credit Chocolate Hazelnut Porter. The hazelnut makes it smooth, and the chocolate flavor comes through as well.    The staff was cordial, not overly friendly, but it's patrons sure are. They made room for us to walk up an order, they asked what I had ordered, and made recommendations based on what they had already tried.  They had live music that day too.  Very entertaining, good set, he even dedicated a song to one of my friends.  Very cool!  They have games like chutes and ladders, Rock Trivia, Oversized Jenga, and more.  Beer and entertainment, can't go wrong with that!

reviews.author: Stacy E.
reviews.description: This brewery is an austin staple. I say hidden staple actually because it took a while to find this place, but once you do, you won't want to leave. With awesome craft beer, great hipster service and entertainment usually on the weekends you will have an awesome time. Try the beers on special, but also try the ones that are mixtures between two beers they are special and only unique to this establishment. The bathrooms are clean and there are snacks by the register, but be sure to eat before you get here since some beers are heavy and you might get full which really isn't a bad thing, but good to know!

reviews.author: Gilbert C.
reviews.description: Nice tasting beer selection. The Convict Hill stout is very good! Nice atmosphere with indoor/outdoor seating. The taco from the food truck was very delicious. Will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: This brewery has been around for several years. I'm not sure what their secret it but Hubby seemed to enjoy their beer. I loved the live music and great t-shirts.   It's a little bit of a trek but well worth it. Pups are allowed so bring your four-legged friend on a leash. Aw, you know beer and dogs go well together!  There is, oddly, a Ceviche food truck in the parking lot. Hmmm. Beer and Ceviche? Kind of like pairing Thunderbird wine and a fruit salad.

reviews.author: Lauren L.
reviews.description: We were looking for a quick drink before heading back to the airport. We grabbed a passion fruit berliner weiss. It was light, delicious and refreshing. No frills. Plasic cup.  There's out door and indoor seating. Parking was a bit of a maze. Worth a stop if you are in the area.

reviews.author: Geoffrey C.
reviews.description: Great beer, great people, great vibes. Be careful on where your directors take you. It took us behind the brewery. But you'll find it on the other side. It's a really large place and they set up picnic tables right outside the brewery.  The Sunday afternoon I went, I believe there was some event wrapping up. DJ was playing 90s RandB/Hip-Hop which contributed to the great vibe. All of their beers tasted amazing. I ended up going with their sour beer. Perfect balance of sourness and fruit. I would definitely come here again.

reviews.author: Christopher F.
reviews.description: Cool brewery tucked away in a wearhouse.  It can be a little hard to find from the road as it is behind retail.  But once you arrive, there is indoor and outdoor seating.  There are occasional food trucks.  Plenty of games including jenga.  I like the chill vibe.  This is a great place for an afternoon drink or three.  The bartenders know their stuff.  Ask as many questions as you like regarding the beer choices.  You can do tasting flights or go right to the pint.  I prefer the Stash IPA which is one of my local favorites.  Other beers are good too.  Can't go wrong here.

reviews.author: Alexis B.
reviews.description: When I was visiting friends in Austin last month, a friend and I decided to hit up a local brewery for a couple of hours (it's a tradition of ours). I had to pick up my brother at the airport after, so I was looking for a place that was southeast, so Independence fit the bill. When I lived in Austin, I used to drink Independence beers all the time, but I never made it out to the brewery. I was impressed! It's really large! Tables inside and tables outside. They have several beers to choose from. The line for the bathroom was REALLY long, but we happened to choose a day that had an event (puppy adoptions I think) and it was PACKED. All in all, good beers, they were playing good music, and I had a great time with my friend! Great afternoon, and I'd go again!

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: This brewery is a 10/10 if Yelp let give this opinion I would. The bartender was absolutely amazing giving me amazing recommendations. The GM proceeded to stay late with us and show us the absolute best of the best mead I have ever had. He was amazing the bartender was amazing and if I ever re-vist Austin this is a must have on the to do list. Do NOT miss out on this amazing experience. Do not go to Austin beer works this place is literally 10x better if not more.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: I really like the beer here. I love the $18 flight and the pint glass you get to take home at the end is the coolest pint glass I've ever owned. Unfortunately, they do not allow dogs inside. As a dog owner who lives in the brewery district, this establishment is simply off my list anytime I go out with my little gal.   I do love this place but it's hard to give a perfect score to a place I can't frequent. Especially when they have ~10 competitors in a 5 minute radius and none of them share the same policy. As a result, I am updating my review from 5 to 4 stars.

reviews.author: Cynthia L.
reviews.description: I sampled a flight of their Belgian style beers and enjoyed them all. The staff was polite, and the food from the Emoji food truck was tasty and reasonably priced.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: Cool Staff, great beer, really good vibes all around.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: This place is on my Covid-19 safe list. They will continue to require masks.

reviews.author: Dan P.
reviews.description: Overall vibe: relaxed, quirky Austin  Service: good beer knowledge. Hillary was very nice at the counter.  Beer: excellent quality. Great Friday from raspberry wheat beer to Belgian style ale  Overall cleanliness: above average  Price: average for good craft beer

reviews.author: Chris T.
reviews.description: This is a nice stop. The entryway can get a slight bottleneck, just be patient. The beer is worth the wait. I got the seasonal raspberry beer that was brewed for owner daughter wedding, oh my gosh! Delicious and refreshing. I ended up buying a 6 pack to take home. I think it is gone now, but so good!

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Large spacious venue with plenty of outdoor seating as well. I love that have arcade games and foosball, fun spot for a group. Come thristy.

reviews.author: Alex C.
reviews.description: I'm a fan of dark Belgian style beer that's not too sweet so Adalbert's gets five stars right away.  I love the Philosophizer and the October Rust.  There seems to be good social distancing. There's hand sanitizer on the counter. Growlers are a possibility as are CDB sodas. The people are friendly and seem to know about the beer. I only discovered this place after the pandemic it started so I've never really spent time inside. But I've been sitting on my own porch enjoying it quite a bit and when things get back to normal I hope to spend a few hours at Adelbert's.

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: This was a great brewery to go to after work for drinks with friends or coworkers. I love the idea that's you are actually in the brewery itself.   The neat thing is that they have artwork that's for sale on the walls. The art adds character and is a large variety of different themes all from local artists.   No good is served inside the brewery but there is a really good food truck on the outside.   The beers are amazing and you can sample before you buy.  Liked this brewery and beers are very creative.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Love coming here and just hanging out. The bartenders are always very sweet and willing to let you try things before you get a whole glass. I always enjoy their IPAs. They have a food truck outside with I think chicken I usually just get the fresh popped popcorn it's delicious and great to snack on while drinking beer. They have a Nintendo Wii with Mario kart and two old-school arcade games they also have a Foos ball table and darts. There's also boardgames that you can check out with giving them your ID, an awesome place to hang out with friends, kids and dogs!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: I had my first Adelbert's beer through HEB, with their Naked Nun witbier. I have been hooked since then and finally made it into their tasting room.   It. Was. Heaven. They have an outdoors area that's shaded for those with doggos or who want to enjoy the heat and eat from their food truck. I had the Triple B, which was surprisingly crisp and floral for a belgian. They had a variety of beers which I wanted to taste, but we arrived late with one hour to spare before closing. That just means I need to pay another visit to truly enjoy the place.  They have a private parking area shared with neighboring businesses and strong wifi. The best part is the indoors games like 4-player Mario Kart (WHAT!), darts, and a bunch of board games. They also give free stickers, plus our lady taptender that day was so kind and welcoming.

reviews.author: Tisha T.
reviews.description: Met up with some work peeps for a happy hour of sorts. I originally didn't plan to attend since it's a brewery and I hate beer with a passion. However I checked out their site, saw they had some wine options and a food truck--so I happily tagged along. The bartender who greeted us gave us the rundown of everything. Served us with a smile and was very informative about the beers, of course. I had a great bottle of pinot grigio while my friends enjoyed the various beers available. I had a great time checking out the art that they have on the walls for sale. We also played a game of jumbo sized connect four and Mario Kart on the big screen. A large collection of board games are also available to borrow while hanging out enjoying your drink in the taproom. Very cool place, warm vibes. Great food truck on site as well.  Definitely will return soon and bring my beer drinking friends.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Really good beer at Adebert's. Lots of cool wood barrels and lots of people around for a fun Friday Night. At certain times you can challenge the bartender to a game of Mario Kart which is truly unique but just add the the overall great experience at Adelbert's

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: This place is great! Get the wristband if you're a first timer- only $15 for six "half pours" which are definitely more like 3/4 pours haha  The mango wit, naked nun, and hibiscus saison are AMAZINGGG.   Cool art, live music, food truck (although they left early, which sucked).  The only real disappointment? The brewery closes at 10- we coulda stayed all night!

reviews.author: Christian C.
reviews.description: Awesome beer, and a very chill location to hang out with friends and family.  Children are allowed as well, which is very convenient for fellow parents!  They've got a bunch of cool artwork from local artists, giant Jenga, a foosball table, and live music to keep you entertained.  They also have great food truck options during Taproom hours.    $14 for 6 half pours and a free pint glass is a pretty amazing deal, especially due to the quality and content of the beer.  If you're into light, crisper beers, try the Naked Nun or the Philosophizer.  If you like the darker stuff, the Black Rhino is your friend.  They also have some great sours!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: Three words: Belgium style brews! Oh my goodness, where have you been hiding from me Adelbert's?! This is by far one of my most favorite craft breweries in all of Austin, if not in the United States. For those of you that really know me, you know that I L.O.V.E. Belgian beers...so much so that, yes, I traveled to Belgium JUST for the beers (okay, I ate some mussels and saw some pretty cool stuff too, but...). For those of you not in the know (no insult meant for those who are), Belgian style beers are pretty high in ABV, so amateurs enter gently. Just looking out for my Yeeps! :D  Adelbert's doesn't look like much at all from the outside. Tucked away in a warehouse district, it can a tad difficult to find, particularly at night - just look for the little white lights and the picnic tables outside. Park, walk through the plastic flat "doors" and you will discover a beautiful huge space with stacks and stacks of barrels, merchandise for sale, lots of local art hanging on the walls to purchase adds to the ambiance; plus games to play such as giant Jenga, foosball, and darts and that's one fine outing.   But the beer! Oh my gosh - the beer. Handcrafted at its best. So amazingly fantastic and such a great deal. On your first visit be certain to buy the 6 half pour (really close to full pours - yay) tastings for $13. You get to keep the glass and get $2 off beers when you bring it back on your next visit. Regular prices range from $4-6 a glass, which is phenominal in the first place for such high quality ale.   ALL great, two personal standouts for me were: *Flyin' Monks Quadrupel: 10.9%ABV, aged in rum barrels with hints of spice, deep, dark, and lovely. *Philosophizer Saison: An easy choice. 7.8% ABV, very mild carbonation with a hint of pepper. Fantastic.     To add some icing to this already oh so sweet find, the founder and brewmaster Scott and staff cannot be any more friendly or knowledgeable about the beers and brewery.   Highly highly highly recommend. Simply doesn't get better than this IMHO. Cheers!  TIPS:  *The brewery has a license so you can take a large bottle home for a reasonable price of about $9 to $12, which is average. They also sell retail at area Austin locations (visit their website for exact locations).  *Tours are available (see website for details).   *They typically have a food truck on site on Saturdays.  *Fido friendly pergola area - not allowed inside.

reviews.author: Sam V.
reviews.description: Ya'll are probably already aware of my latest and greatest obsession with collecting pint glasses from assorted breweries. For our first stop in Austin, we stopped by this unassuming warehouse. As we walked in, the live jazz band was jammin' and the beer taps were flowin'.   Michael and his bearded friend were fantastic bartenders. I really appreciated their hospitality. Michael instantly could tell I was new to this particular brewery and proceeded to explain the process to tasting their beer samples. He even noted that I had a minor with me and offered a brewed hibiscus tea for him. They really cater to all ages! We paid $13 for six half poured samples from a souvenir Belgian tasting glass. One yellow wristband later, my siblings and I were playing ping-pong and giant Jenga in the back of the warehouse.  The stringed lights on the ceiling made it feel welcome and homey. They had a wall of local art for sale ranging from $30-$300! I had my eye on a Sinatra painting, and as luck would have it, it was indeed the $300 piece lol. I stared at it longingly for most of the night, but couldn't bring myself to throw down on it. My favorite craft brews of the night were the Naked Nun and the Philosophizer. Brilliant names and great hoppy flavors.  Once it got too muggy in the taproom, we ventured out to get some grub. The food truck of the night was Emoji Grilled Cheese. (See their yelp site for my review) It was mouthwatering and delicious. We visited a couple other breweries throughout our trip, but Adelbert's was my all-time favorite.   Thanks for a great time!   -xoxoxo

reviews.author: Paul K.
reviews.description: Solid, well made beers ranging from wits to saisons to sours to pale ales and IPAs.  Nice range of beers, all done with style.

reviews.author: Geoffrey C.
reviews.description: From the outside, this place looks quite small but it's a lot larger than I thought. Seating inside and outside. Also, what kind of brewery would this be if they did not have board games to play as you drink?  The Mango Wit is good and refreshing. Mango flavor is not as present as I like, but the hint of it is good enough.

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: For a newer-ish brewery this place is definitely headed in the right direction. Sour beers are freaking delish! I wish that they had more food options when you drink and or a bar that you can walk up to, but all good things come to those who wait!!   My second time around I ordered a cheese tray from a local artist and brought it to eat outside. It was perfect. My husband loves their beers and always asks to go their before our date nights! Keep it up Hedgehog!

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Such an awesome place! It's all outdoors with picnic of tables, umbrellas and a few chairs and tables. Dog friendly- they have dog bowls! Pretty flowers and lots of grass for kids to run in. The beer was delicious. I tried 3 five oz pours, all IPAs they were delicious!! You order the beer online and they call you when it's ready. Quick, easy and safe. Will def be back!  They have different food trucks , check their Facebook to see what's there when you're going.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Great addition to breweries in  CP area. Multiple IPA and Farmhouse Ales. Large open patio with picnic benches and yes umbrellas.   They were also cooking up some awesome looking Pad Thai when we visited. Friendly knowledgeable folks and a great beer selection.   CC payment only via their App.  As an FYI this is where the Thousand Oaks brewery was located.

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: Clean, nice owners, great beer! I've tried a few beers here. My favorite one is Mango Tango! It is very tasty! Mango with some habanero (I believe) it is so good! Come out, you can order on your phone and relax outside in the nice picnic table/table seating area! Come on out and give them a visit! You will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Matt P.
reviews.description: Fantastic IPA, Farmhouse, and Saison beers on tap. The beer is really fantastic and the mood is mellow. This place will be hopping once the word gets out.  Thank you for the fantastic flavors. The beer is really above par. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Friendly people, high quality rotating  beers, nice outdoor seating. Like a nice neighbourhood space.

reviews.author: Audrey B.
reviews.description: A great place to go on a summer evening! I tried it for the first time Saturday and loved it! The draft choices were great, Crush ended up being my favorite! Chill vibes the whole night and just overall a fun atmosphere!

name: The Waypoint ATX Food Truck Park

reviews.author: Mousumi Q.
reviews.description: We visited the Waypoint food truck park this weekend and really enjoyed ourselves. We had some great beers at infamous beer co and amazing food from R19 Taqueria! Next time we will try yardbirds and the Italian ice place. Can't wait to see what else is in store. So exited to have this down the street from us.

reviews.author: Ross H.
reviews.description: Incredible food, with different options available, and a place for my dog to run around and play. They have a playground if you have kids, and pleanty of trees for shade. Connected to a brewery which is awesome!

reviews.author: Blaire C.
reviews.description: Great family-friendly atmosphere and delicious food options....and right next door to Infamous so you can grab some craft beers and enjoy the live music on weekends!

reviews.author: Sumie M.
reviews.description: So happy that the awesome Hot Mess Pizza truck in the Tapz 32 parking lot did not serve beverages!  Tapz 32 had 23 beers on tap!  Great selection and the friendliest people ever!!  If you love craft beer you must come and hang out with in this family owned business!

reviews.author: Elliott B.
reviews.description: Hell yeah. A great local watering hole with a story, great ownership and service, and a more than fine beer selection. Local flavor at its finest.  Mike and Leslie used to run a construction equipment rental business out of this location. 2008 hit and they closed their doors in 2010. Years later after the family got into home brewing and good beer in general, they started over with a new business model: a local bar with an excellent beer selection - And wine, too. Local brews, too.  The building is awesome. Repurposed buildings like this make for some of the best bars and restaurants. It's gritty and has character. The decorations are cool. They have a smoking and non-smoking side. Cinder blocks and corrugated metal. The bar itself actually has some great wood and is well done. The patio is covered and was perfect for the family, including a play area for kiddos. (Mike and Leslie have a 3-year old grandson who needed a spot!) Nice breeze out back, too.  Good local hangout. Fun talking to Ron, a 20-year local and supporter of the bar. Funny - most of the locals were enjoying Bud and Whatever Light instead of the excellent draft selection. Hope they have enough demand to keep those great beers on draft! They've been open 2 years, so they're off to a great start. Mike and Leslie themselves work the bar, so you know you'll get great service.  Cheers, y'all!

reviews.author: Wanda L.
reviews.description: As a lover of the Texas hill country and frequent visitor of the wineries, breweries and distilleries out her, I cannot believe we just found this gem. A rustic but clean establishment, it is definitely worth a stop in if you find yourself in the area. The staff is super friendly as well, bonus! Check out my pix for nice selection of drinking options.  Harley riders and bikers of all types should be adding this to their riding route.

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: Great selection of beers, warm friendly place. Only draw back is that the smoke gets pretty thick in there sometime. I understand it's a bar and people smoke in bars, but a lot of them have an area for smokers.

reviews.author: Steve S.
reviews.description: This is indeed a gem of a place out in the Hill Country! Many stop by on their tour of the Texas Wine country and never leave! Great place to hang out and relax! An amazing selection of both Beer and Wine! And the owners Mike and Leslee are the greatest!!

reviews.author: Dana C.
reviews.description: The owner from Austin opened up a beer joint in his family's hometown of Johnson City. Only Texas craft beer on draft. The owner is also a woods craftsmen and the bar and outdoor seating showcase his works

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: A bit of a whole in the wall.  Eclectic furniture collection.  Great selection of beer on tap and the have wine.  Only draw back is that they smoke in the place.  The did have the doors opened so that helped.  Will drop in again next time we are going thru town.

reviews.author: Lauren S.
reviews.description: We stopped out here last night and it was the perfect ending to a long day driving through the hill country. Mike was incredibly welcoming and popped open a bottle to share with us. We enjoyed talking to him about beer and baseball. We'll be back!

reviews.author: Katelyn S.
reviews.description: Love this place. If you're a beer drinker the selection offered is incredible. Whether its your regular Bud Light, Lone Star or unique imported craft beers, the list of choices is impressive. The owner Mike is also the bartender, super laid back guy who knows his craft beers and wines (which he has 6 or 7 of on tap alongside 25 local craft brews.) The atmosphere of the bar is cozy, a little rustic with amazing artwork on the walls. By the way most of the art you will see there were done by Mike. If you haven't been to TAPZ you are missing out on a one of a kind place.

reviews.author: Dawn C.
reviews.description: Great place to try different beers. Plus,  a wonderful atmosphere. I'm excited that soon they will be adding wine on tap.

name: SLAB BBQ and Beer
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Wednesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Robert C.
reviews.description: Food is very delicious and always hot very respectful the place is always clean 100 TOP NOTCH PLACE TO BE

reviews.author: Gretchen P.
reviews.description: The pork rib sandwich is to die for. That's all I've had here, but I've had it 3 times in the past 6 months, and it is great. Sides are just ok. My biggest complaint is that they do not serve wine, the bar keep told me they used to but it wasn't selling. So, that's a drawback for me. I am not a beer drinker.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: Back again to our favorite BBQ place. This time I gorged myself on brisket nachos with no onions or jalapeños.  Man oh man. The crispy chips. The tender, flavorful melt in your mouth, slap yo daddy and kick your cat good brisket. Tasty sweet BBQ sauce. Classic queso and what makes the whole plate a hit...chopped up pickles. A little burst of crisp vinegar to cut the richness of the cheese is a bite of what I hope clouds would taste like.   We drive from San Antonio to eat here and you should too. Call up your boo and tell them it's time to get weird and head to Austin.   What are you waiting on? Go on. Austin is calling.

reviews.author: Julia C.
reviews.description: Didn't want a sandwich, so ordered some brisket in a small salad. Yum! Fresh ingredients, flavorful brisket, and some jalapeño dressing with a KICK. The sides were delicious too. Will probably order a larger size if the potatoes...delicious!

reviews.author: Jennifer W.
reviews.description: Phenomenal! Food was so good. Loved the sauces too. The bar side is cute too. Smart idea to have one side more like a bar and one side a small place to eat inside. Didn't care for the plastic barriers but maybe this is required due to covid. I'm stuffed! We even have leftovers for dinner lol

reviews.author: Brad W.
reviews.description: Great local BBQ place. I had 2 meat sandwiches, pork and brisket with a small BBQ beans. VERY juicy and flavorful. Beans were great but slight on sweat side.

reviews.author: Stan V.
reviews.description: I've been a long time Patron of Slab off of the Burnett Location and this New Location doesn't disappoint.   Sometimes when there's a new location, there's a drop in quality, but not here.   Its actually 2x bigger, nice and bright, just missing the Hip Hop Feel of the original location.   If you like BBQ or BBQ sandwiches, then this is the spot for you.   They gots a variety of meats for your meat eaters, sorry, I'm not a vegetarian so I don't know what they got for folks here.   The Nachos are awesome, prob best to share than eat alone.  If you don't know what you like, give the Trio Sampler a try, its a very nice place to start.   All the other sandwiches are massive (and good), and will prob put me in the hospital if I eats them again, so my goto sandwich is the McDowell, oh man, puts the McRib or any Pork Rib to shame, its executed so well.  Always tender fall off the bone rib mean between your choice of bun, bbq sauce, and pickles, so good.   The Sides are ok, but the Desert is the best, the OG cookie is so drip!   Give this place a try, its great!

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: We were looking for a BBQ lunch spot and SLAB delivers! The meats are smoked to perfection and because we couldn't decide on what to try we got two of the best sampler options on the menu - the slider trio (chicken, pork, brisket) and the epic DONK sammich (all the meats - chicken, pork, brisket, sausage and all the sauces). We also tried two of their sides because YOLO - Gouda Mac and the twice baked potato casserole. Legit, UNBELIEVABLY good. My favorite out of the slider trio was the chicken - sauces were on point, chicken was tender and juicy. The Mac and cheese was EPIC - it's a wet Mac which I love. Super creamy, smoked Gouda is just divine. Twice baked tots were also good (but my heart belongs to the Mac). If you're here for epic then go with the DONK. Single portion was HUGE but it delivers on flavor! Stacked high with meats it's also smothered in delicious sauces, crunchy onions and jalapeños. Honestly, will come back for that! Beer selection is fantastic. Get you some SLAB!

reviews.author: Rosalind C.
reviews.description: I tried the other location and decided to try this one when I came into town. Long story short, it's really good. The service and the food. I got the slider trio and it was good, everything tasted fresh. My only issue, which is a personal preference is they didn't have enough bbq sauce. Overall I would highly recommend.

reviews.author: Tim D.
reviews.description: Stopped by for a Sliced Beef Sandwich and Drink, asked for it to be Lean with no onions/pickles and only a little sauce to go. For nearly $16.00 i was very disappointed to find not a single request was met. 1/3 of meat was fat, onions, pickles and drowned in sauce..

reviews.author: Janelle L.
reviews.description: It was my first time having SLAB so I wanted to try the trio to get a taste of the most popular sandwiches. Let's just say that it did not disappoint!  The portion sizes are HUGE, which is always a plus for me. The trio comes with the Texas O.G., Notorious P.I.G., and the Chicken W.A. All of the sliders were amazing, but my favorite has to go to the Chicken W.A.! Their dank white sauce is addicting!!!   For COVID-19, they are currently doing curbside takeout and limited dine in and patio service

reviews.author: Brianna E.
reviews.description: This place is pure heaven, every single time. The sink sandwich is AMAZING and huge! I also love the slider trio. Mac and cheese is great, and so is the potato salad. I haven't tried anything other than those items because they are just so good every time. They make their own bbq sauces which are for sale I believe, my favorite is the dank white!

reviews.author: Ali R.
reviews.description: Omg so yum! We got brisket nachos, the slider trio and we had to try the potato casserole. Definitely appreciate the queso coming on the side for to go orders. The nachos were big. Between the two of us, we had 1 slider each and about 1/4 of the nachos each. I didn't even have enough room to try the casserole... tomorrow's lunch for sure.   We'll definitely order from SLAB again!

reviews.author: Will C.
reviews.description: Got there early and thankful we did. Fills up even on Memorial Day. Brisket pork and chicken all cooked perfectly. We forgot to add any extra sauce as soon as we started eating

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: First time visit to SLAB (about two weeks ago) and we were impressed by the quality of the food, portion and reasonable price. Service was prompt and friendly.   We opted to dine outdoors and food was served right away. The sandwiches and sides were delicious. I had the Notorious PIG (perfect size for me) while hubby enjoyed the Texas Two Step with a side of potato salad.  I do recommend - can't wait to come back soon.

reviews.author: Lourdes A.
reviews.description: Looked forward to great BBQ with the high ratings and ended up being really disappointed with the food, maybe I came on a bad day. The brisket and buns were dry. The sauce made it better. Mac and cheese had a strong smoke flavor and that's about it. The potato casserole were more like bland mashed potatoes and tasted waterlogged. Banana pudding was an average vanilla pudding. The chicken and pork sandwich were okay.  At least the food presentation was nice.

reviews.author: Christopher M.
reviews.description: Amazing BBQ all around. I honestly can't pick my favorite. Sides are outstanding. The strawberry habanero sauce on the ribs are "loose yo damn mind". And finally the only think they don't put on The Donk is in fact the kitchen sink. Hint: I order the Donk in a wrap so you can actually handle it...otherwise grab and knife and fork for this sandwich. Honestly, when visitors come to ATX Slab is absolutely on the rotation.

reviews.author: Karly E.
reviews.description: Wow, that's all I have to say. Such a fun vibe - very young, very casual. We didn't get the chance to drink any of their beer however out of 6 different items we ordered we all really enjoyed it. They had some fun soda options, and great sauces. It was a quick eat so great if you are going out for a quick lunch or dinner. 8/10 recommend.

reviews.author: Imogen S.
reviews.description: Delicious food, good service, great take out packaging and super specials. Definitely worth a try, we go often. The Texas tornado sandwich/wrap is a real standout.

reviews.author: Lorien J.
reviews.description: This was among the worst barbecue we've tried in the region. Two sandwich combos plus tip was $50. We had a brisket+sausage sandwich and a pulled pork+mustard slaw sandwich, mac and cheese, and potato casserole.  Every dish was cold to lukewarm. Brisket and pork were both cold (some lukewarm bits), extremely dry, without flavor of their own, and severely under sauced. It helped when we asked for more sauce, but the meats were so dry that they soaked up moisture, and there was little flavor imparted. The smoked gouda mac and cheese was lukewarm, pure mush, and tasted like artificial smoke more than cheese. The twice baked potato casserole was just dry, grainy mashed potatoes. The mustard slaw had spice-heat but no flavor.  I couldn't finish my cold meal so I boxed it up and took it home, while my friend forced herself enough to be full and toss the rest. Once home I reheated it in a skillet and added more of the red sauce I'd requested, and then everything just tasted like sugar.   Disappointing.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Went there last night, the place is awesome! Currently they don't have their own beer, supply issues but they have some amazing Austin, Texas and other craft beers. Family friendly spot (a kids play area with kitchen and all!!),good music playlist and eventually some live music. They just have snacks right now but eventually said they'll have a menu. Oh yah and coffee too. We got to meet Derek and his wife, the owners. This is such a great spot to go and work or to relax at after work! Will definitely be back and can't wait to watch this business grow.  We were having so much fun I forgot to take pictures! I'll update with pictures next time I go.

reviews.author: Mina P.
reviews.description: Good spot to chill with friends. I came here last weekend with my husband to meet up with some out-of-state friends who were visiting. Their guacamole and tacos were good and so was their beer selection. I honestly don't remember which one we got, but just had whatever the servers recommended and they were all good.  The outdoor seating area was nice at night with the hanging lights and is dog friendly (always a bonus for us!).   Street parking is close to impossible to find in the area, but there's paid garage parking. It is pricey, but the only spot we were able to find that wasn't too far from Lazarus.

reviews.author: Shaji K.
reviews.description: Thursday late afternoon - stopped by here to check out yet another brewery on the street. Mostly packed with people working on laptops, but the open air setup doesn't make it feel too crowded.  Was able to quickly get a seat at the bar and order from the scannable menus. Decided on the Prodigal Pills ($6) to go along with a Breakfast Taco ($3.50). Pilsener is light and crushable, though not much flavor. Breakfast taco comes out fast - packed with eggs, cheese, pico de gallo, and bacon. Thankfully not a stale tortilla and even balance of ingredients. Finished the day off with the Double Predestination IPA ($7)- definitely more of a kick, possible some overkill on the hops.   Service is a bit hectic as the bartenders work off the many tables. Fine spot to relax, especially outside where there are tables available.

reviews.author: Al K.
reviews.description: First brewery stop in Austin and it did not disappoint. Great options and loved the atmosphere.  Service was great and staff were nice.  Again, the seating options and drink choices were a huge bonus. Coffee beverages looked delicious. Friend got an espresso and recommended it.  Locale is fantastic as well. Very accessible.  Would definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Matthew H.
reviews.description: So fancy! We showed up just in time for the great weather. The beer and the food are both equally good! Great patio vibes and plenty of parking for easy in and easy out.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: A new favorite find! New Year's Eve could not be better remembered. Love the ambiance, including the music playlist. The patio is simply perfect. The beer variety has something for everyone and the tacos are a handy nibble option.

reviews.author: Kayla S.
reviews.description: Loved the atmosphere and bartender. Very kind and patient with our questions! Would come back here for sure

reviews.author: Made B.
reviews.description: This place is great! Lots of beer options and their queso is amazing!!Nice outdoor area with music.

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.description: If I were a local, this would be my hangout spot. The beers were superb. I got a Disco Prophet, a strawberry lemonade sour, and a Big Sky IPA - delicious and refreshing.  But the real star was the appetizers. We got chips and fresh guacamole, which paired excellently with the beer. But the real winner was the fried chickpeas, which were like seasoned corn nuts! I've never had anything like that, and it's enough for 3-4 people to share, despite only being $3.  The place was clean, staff was friendly, and there was plenty of seating. Definitely a must-see brewery if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: Good quality beer with a variety of awesome food. This European style brewery always seems to have something going on.   Showed up on a Thursday evening for dinner and was impressed with the amount of people who were here. There is picnic table seating out back with tents in the front for additional seating. There is also plenty of seating inside. There is plenty of seating but the like to order may take some time to get through, so plan accordingly.   I went with the torta as my meal. The bread was authentic and the fillings inside were great. If I had to change one thing I would have asked to get the torta with chorizo although it isn't listed as a protein for the sandwich.   This is a great local spot to check out and a place I will most likely be a regular at.

reviews.author: Karley M.
reviews.description: This brewery was walking distance from our air bnb when visiting Austin. It quickly became our favorite spot and we went back a couple times. Beer was delicious and staff was extremely friendly. They also offer other things besides beer. There's a lot of space here too. All around gem!

reviews.author: Tandis H.
reviews.description: This place has plenty of outdoor seating with fans that keep the flies at bay mostly. The inside was nice and they have everything you'd need to hit the spot. Tacos and beer.   The beer was pretty good. The only sour beer they had at the time was a Rosé flavored one that unfortunately tasted a little too much like wine, but was still digestible. My hazy IPA was not hazy at all, but was still fine. I wish the beers were served a bit colder.   The fried chickpeas were a good deal for $3 we thought they could serve like 10 people. The 2 of us only made a dent in like 1/5 of the bowl. But hey, they're snacky so maybe someone could down the whole thing if they really wanted to!  The carnitas taco was really good. I highly recommend it. The al pastor was alright but didn't pack the flavor punch of the carnitas. I doused my tacos in the free salsa that was in a mini fridge nearby. The red salsa was so good and added a layer of light smokiness to my tacos. But then after a while I thought I sensed some heat? I assumed it was the green salsa so I continued to douse my tacos in the red. Idk it must have been the red salsa that was hot, because by the end of my meal I was feeling sick to my stomach. Never felt that way from spice but needless to say the beer didn't taste too good after that either. Luckily I recuperated by sipping 2 glasses of their Yeti water until I didn't want to vomit anymore.   I can't place my distaste after this meal on the restaurant since it was mostly my own doing . I assume they label their salsas and I just didn't see it.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Super cute spot to hang out with friends! They have a ton of outdoor seating and can accommodate large parties. We had about 20 people in our group and we were able to pull up tables and chairs for everyone.   The place is really well decorated so we were able to snap a few cute pictures!

reviews.author: KC C.
reviews.description: We must have visited on the wrong day.  There were just 7-8 beers on the menu and nothing really intrigued us.  I went with my favorite kind which is a stout on nitro.  I hate wasting beer but I drank just half.  Not only were the beers not flavorful but they were not cold.    I will say their tacos were really good, and the place is super huge.  For a Monday it was pretty packed at lunch, but still spacious enough to stay 6-feet away if desired.  It's not hard to find a seat bc the place is sooo big.    Wouldn't come back for the beer, but for the tacos?  Yaaassss!

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: My wife and I were in Austin for a long weekend and this could be the best tap room I have been to in a long time. Tons of outdoor seating and great free water. I got the 40 Days and 40 Nights and the Lil' Sebastion Bach Maibock and the Walking on Water.   I ordered 3 beers and they were spectacular and the service was splendid. I ordered an al pastor taco and the carne asada tacos. They were super flavorful and perfect, especially for a tap room.  I got a couple of stickers and the atmosphere was just fantastic. You should definitely try this place!

reviews.author: David M.
reviews.description: Hands down the best brewery experience we encountered in Austin. It's a little bit if everything and that's not at all a bad thing as without exception they are all done well. We saw they were open early so we went in on a weekday thinking we could knock this off our list of a full day planned. We weren't real clear on their hours entailed so there was a not so unwelcome idea of a little day / morning drinking to get the day started. We realized this was going to leave us with the opportunity to have a few small samples or perhaps one nice pour. Upon our arrival we were impressed at how the location spanned the corner of the street and had many "compartments" of seating areas. I'm no way were Amy of them on the smaller side. Street parking was easy enough and we headed on in.   Very impressed to be greeted with smiling faces along with plenty of good morning exchanges. We were very pleasantly surprised to see they offered an array of espresso drinks. What a welcome pivot to our plan. We ordered up and came to realize they had food as well. Pretty happy about that. There were the assorted pastry items and breakfast TACOS! I noticed there was also queso fondido on the menu and that was screaming please try me. I went to order and was told this item is generally served later in the day. I suspect my sadness to hear this news showed as there was a quick offer to fire up the required kitchen equipment to make this happen (the salamander for those curious).   The lattes were delicious. So much so we ordered up a second round. Near completion of those the awesome cheesy chorizo goodness arrived. Bubbly hot and looking superb. It was all I could do to keep myself from grabbing a chip and putting a scoop of this bubbling sub nuclear cheese in my mouth at the price of completely burning my entire mouth. With a little patience I snuck a few small bites being mindful to blow as to not scorch my mouth. OMG was this delicious in every aspect.   Right away we knew this was just fine with a latte but was screaming for a beer to accompany this perfect breakfast fast. Such an awesome selection of beers. The bartender was beyond sweet and gave us many short pull samples of the tappers. I landed on the one that worked for me. My wife found one that worked well for her. By the time the beers arrived it was clear this was not going to be a short stop. Instead it was clear this was our impromptu plan for the morning. Completely five star experience from the word go. So much so we took the liberty of an evening stop later that week. The vibe of this place was so cool with any hint of pretentiousness. I'm no expert on all the brew options in Austin but this was clearly number one for us based on all it included and the absolute outstanding hospitality from the coffee bar to the bartender to the cook who brought us the miraculously amazing queso. No matter you plans I would highly suggest  in fact nearly insist this is a stop not to be missed. This reviews has been locked in draft land fir a while but there is no doubt this place is still thriving and for all the right reasons.

reviews.author: Taylor S.
reviews.description: Beer was good. Staff was incredibly rude, un-welcoming and didn't bother at all to try to accompany our party of 6 when we came to see a friend's band. Instead of leading us to a new table or area, once we sat the staff told us we had to leave or we could stand outside in the 40* weather. We got our beers and were standing off to the side and the cashier told us move out of the way so people can order- we weren't in the way, people were not ordering. While I'm writing this we are witnessing more customers treated poorly in the line. Seems like a lot of non-Texans are working here and it shows. Never will I ever come back to this establishment. Signed- Native Austinite

reviews.author: Alexa S.
reviews.description: I love Lazarus! Awesome vibe, good beer, great tacos/quesadillas and ample street parking!

reviews.author: Yuki I.
reviews.description: Casual atmosphere with a cute outdoor patio area, great drinks, and delicious tacos! I'm not a huge fan of beer, but luckily, they've got ciders! I think the flavors they had when I was there were: paloma, rose, and cherry. I got the paloma and rose ciders, and they were so delicious! Paloma for its fruitiness, rose for its sweetness. I got the carnitas taco with avocado, and that was quite flavorful, hit the spot! :) Definitely recommend for grabbing drinks and bites with a friend!

reviews.author: Tarika K.
reviews.description: I love Lazarus! This has quickly become one of my favorite spots in Austin- whether you're there for coffee and tacos in the morning or high quality brews at night, you really can't go wrong at Lazarus.   I showed up on a Saturday afternoon and ended up staying until after dinner! The ambiance is fantastic- with ample seating both indoors and outdoors and picnic tables for groups of all sizes, Lazarus attracts all kinds, from people working from home to big parties.   The tacos were really great! We ordered the pollo verde and al pastor tacos and they were fantastic. They were a great portion to pair with drinks and while the line seemed long the service was really quick.   Overall, this is a great spot for regulars and I've found myself returning for a reliably good time.

reviews.author: Blake J.
reviews.description: good vibes and what I ordered was tasty. The food menu is limited but I guess that's because it's a brewery lol

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: This place is awesome and maybe a little too family friendly.   So 5 soul owns all the property that the brewery is also on. When we went there, they had 2 food trucks. One did pizza and salads and the other hamburgers and other food.   Inside of 5 souls is wicked cool.  We tried many of the red wine and they were alright.    The staff is super friendly and patient.  They also have non alcoholic  daiquiri  for the kids. Just a few flavors, but the kids enjoyed them. Of course they did they are just like smaller but more expensive Slushies.   The wine itself is pretty good and a tad on the pricey side IMO. $12/glass or $36 per bottle. But the atmosphere is so darn cool. It's probably one our favorite places to go to right now. Unfortunately or maybe fortunately they are an hour away.

reviews.author: Lee M.
reviews.description: 5 Soul is easily one of the coolest wine bars and tasting rooms I have ever been to. Co-located at the same address on Bob Wire Road as Frontyard Brewing, this facility is an impressive one. Their tasting room had lots of space - both indoors and out.   The indoor space was open and airy with tons of natural light from floor to ceiling windows and a modern interior. The service here is also a highlight as we noticed that everyone = the servers, bar managers and the owners were ALL making sure that everyone's experience was top notch. We found them to all be very friendly and personable - like those cool neighbors that you REALLY want to hang out with. One thing I liked is that this tasting room also had great energy to it - something that is missing from a LOT of tasting rooms and even some breweries.   Outside, the covered patio is large with plenty of seating for friends, families. The yard is extensive - an amazing space to bring your kiddos and just let them play and have fun.  This really is the kind of place that you wish was only 5 minutes (and not 45) from your house - so check them out.

name: Flat Creek Estate Winery and Vineyard

reviews.author: Jeff N.
reviews.description: Our party of 4 visiting from the Chicago area. We booked a 3 course meal and wine tasting.  Our server Katie was well versed and very personable. The founder of the winery, Madelyn, visited our table and we chatted for quite a while. Great plans for the future! Our meal was incredible. One person in our party said it was the best meal  she has ever had. That is quite a statement! We asked to see the chef.  Executive Chef Shawn graciously accepted our kudos and applause. We walked the property and will always remember the great experience and fabulous property views. Well done!

reviews.author: Susan E.
