The bartender who was close to my age charged me for regular priced drinks when we ordered 2/3 of our drinks in the happy hour range. When I came to close out and order our (3rd) last drink. The bartender said "do you mind if I close you out?" I thought this was very odd as it was a Wednesday evening and I was purchasing not only alcohol but food. I do believe they have an amazing food truck that supplies great food. I am sure this was a one time fluke as the rest of the experience was great. I do stand by my opinion that the staff maybe biased to certain crowds so be weary.

reviews.author: Patty T.
reviews.description: If I lived in San Marcos, THIS would be my local go-to spot. Great service, I felt very safe with their COVID rules and regulations. Loved the atmosphere and customer service and ice cold beers. My bestie and I had a mini day in San Marcos as a girls trip within in COVID rules and we loved this little spot. We found it while looking at houses in the neighborhood surrounding the bar. The staff was kind and courteous and the misters and fans were a nice cooling off touch with the Texas heat.

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: Love this place!  The Blueberry Sangria is THE BOMB!  Steak night is FABULOUS!  Bartenders are awesome and the atmosphere is fantastic!  I love how diverse the clientele is, and it's just a cool place to be!

reviews.author: Jan B.
reviews.description: I love the queso and fries. I'm addicted. And my bevs are always great. Service is always timely and it has such a relaxing vibe. I always look forward to coming here....

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a great local San Marcos bar that has great service and some really good drinks. It is a fun place to hang out after floating the river! I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Adison H.
reviews.description: Awesome spot to hang out and have some drinks. Breezy open feel with plenty of covered seating as well in case of rain. Service is fast and bartenders are very attentive.

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: My favorite hangout bar for casual day drinking and hanging with friends ! Always something going on from live music , art displays , to crawfish boils! They have happy hour everyday from 2-7 ( and all day on Sunday) which include a big 4$ strawberry margarita that I could dieeee for! If you are under 21 you can't stay past 7 which has always been a little upsetting considering some of my friends are underage and they are very strict about it , but still one of my favorite bars on the square .

reviews.author: Stevie K.
reviews.description: Best Bloody Mary around! Cool atmosphere and love how they have their own herb garden out back. Great place to hang with friends, watch sports, and have a good drink in or outside.

reviews.author: Nathan T.
reviews.description: An extremely laid back bar experience. Great place to either start or end a bar crawl. A little crowded at times but that's every bar on the square. Definitely worth checking out

reviews.author: Kendall M.
reviews.description: Hands down my favorite place to get a drink in San Marcos. Great service better drinks, and atmosphere

reviews.author: Terese O.
reviews.description: Awesome bar that really has something for everyone no matter what your age is. They have a great large indoor and outdoor space making it a perfect spot to hang with friends. They even have a food truck that serves tasty bar eats. I love the michelads and bloodies. They offer many beer variations and tasty cocktails. Also, a bonus they offer HH/drink specials!

reviews.author: Alto G.
reviews.description: Coolest bar in town. I wish it were less crowded, but you can't be a hater when they do so much right!

reviews.author: Cheyanne H.
reviews.description: Great service, the only bar near downtown that's not riddled with frat guys and sorority girls. Dog friendly, but keep them on the leash! Friendly staff, good environment, easily my favorite bar in the area. Also, the neon sign in the women's bathroom is great, I hear the men's bathroom neon sign is pretty funny too. You must visit this place!

reviews.author: Tay R.
reviews.description: The atmosphere here is absolutely awesome. Love an outside bar that can accommodate in weather as well (they bring heaters out / close garage doors etc). I always have a great time here. There's a variety of games throughout the place (corn hole, washers, big jenga) and there's a variety of spread out seating locations / areas. They frequently have a variety of seasonal things on draft as well as a good variety of beers in general. Definitely recommend going to check this place out if in the area and looking for a chill vibe.

name: Taproom Pub and Grub
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: Food was great, beer was cold.  Place is always noisy, but as it is a pub, I can get past that.    We were seated at the bar and were served by the bartender.  He did a great job, was wonderful to talk to, and made great menu suggestions.    Excellent appetizers...great burgers.    A great stop in SMTX.

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: I used to love this place as a young college kid but now that I am older it just didn't cut it for me.   The food is good but it's super sloppy and too much.  The service is okay.  They have a good drink selection.

reviews.author: Lindsey S.
reviews.description: I like to get The Works burger with some barbecue on the side! For fries i prefer the wedge cut fries. my partner tried the mac n cheese burger and chili cheese fries and they were huge! The don't skimp here, and the service is nice as well.

reviews.author: Jose M.
reviews.description: Waited over an hour for food to come out and it was just ok. The brisket didn't really have any flavor.  I would not come back to eat at this place

reviews.author: Sara S.
reviews.description: We love the Taproom! The new owners are great. 5 stars all around! Great burgers, tons of draft selections.

reviews.author: Sanaz D.
reviews.description: Wonderful burgers! We were a group of 19 people, went in all hungry and got out super happy with the food. Amazing taste of burger and really good service in spite of the busy hour we went in on a Saturday.

reviews.author: Hira S.
reviews.description: Mixed feelings about this. I came with a party of seven so I expected the service to be a little delayed. That being said, we all got burgers so I feel like it could have been faster? The food hit the spot after a day on the river but just to get the waiters attention was hard work as they only had 4 people on duty. Then to pay the check again it was another long wait. I can't recommend this place if you're hungry, but if you have the time, sure you should go. Prices were reasonable.

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: This review is long overdue. First time visit last month and we were pleased with overall service and food. The burgers are huge (in my opinion) and they have a nice selection of beers/cocktails. Staff were super pleasant and prompt - it's nice spot for a quick fix at reasonable prices.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: I really enjoy this bar.  It is outdoors and there is ample seating.  I also love looking at the huge variety of plants that cover every inch of this place.  The drinks are good and the staff is friendly. Overall, a great place to unwind and socialize.

reviews.author: Jeremy B.
reviews.description: Salty with a side of Micro transactions.   I have had a few items here and I would have to say this is the saltiest food in San Marcos and not in a good way.  Their menu is very over priced and boy do they love their micro-transactions or add-ons.  Fries are extra with their expensive and average burgers. BACON is like $2 extra.  They charge you for using a credit card and so much more.   Their queso is Velveeta and rotel and not even that good. Most of their chips they serve with the queso is tiny broken scraps and they get annoyed if you ask for more.   The staff is either uncaring or over-worked. I have had many incidences where I am eating solo and am ignored in getting service initially and after.  This is most likely because the server is more interested in dealing with the beer drinking frat guys. Almost every time I have been there I have been left without a basic refill of water. Many times i have also sat waiting for my food with no sight of my server.   The only saving grace of this place is the half price wings on Wednesday, but even then I would get them to go.

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Drove up to San Marcos from SA to meet sister and niece to help move into dorms.  They were running late, so decided to stop here for some drks and grab a quick bite.  Place was not that crowded (in the front) and the tables were spaced out.  View was nice to enjoy those strolling by  the sidewalk.  The sign at the front said $3.50 bloody mary's, so I ordered one and it was the bomb (see pic).  Perfect drink that had all the fixin's.  The Chicken and Waffle Bites caught my attention, so I ordered that to hold us over.  These were really good and worth the appetizer! The reason for 2 stars knocked off were the service that was absent throughout our time here.  He disappeared all the time and couldn't find him once my sister and niece showed up.  This service made me decide to go somewhere else for lunch.  The other star was due to being charged full-price for the 2 bloody mary's.  I didn't say anything, as I wasn't sure when the waiter would come back and also felt small businesses need any extra cash during these times.  I still tipped the waiter, since they need money too but not sure how he was so busy with a light audience in the place.

reviews.author: Pam B.
reviews.description: Most delicious burger I've ever eaten!!  The bun is homemade with a hint of sweetness (think Hawaiian Bread) and the patty is thick and cooked perfectly. The fries were also to die for, crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside and perfectly seasoned. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Rebecca C.
reviews.description: They've got a good selection of beers and ciders (for the non-beer drinkers like myself). I come specifically for the pizza burgers. They are my go to burger when I get a burger craving. However, I have heard that all their other specialty burgers are amazing as well.   My one complaint is the service. It's mainly a bar, it's going to be busy- I get it. I've worked the industry. But every time I've gone, something is wrong with my order, I'm double charged on something, or the waitress hardly ever comes to check on us.   I'll keep coming for the amazing burgers- and they deserve the stars, but the service needs some improvement.

reviews.author: Amber F.
reviews.description: Chad was an amazing bartender/server! He let us know his name and was very responsive when we needed him. I would not say we waited for anything really, the food was reasonably priced, and everything was delicious.

reviews.author: Dori S.
reviews.description: The server was nice but the food took 45 minutes to come out and was bland. My friend enjoyed his chicken club, but the Guacamole Queso Burger was baaaaad. Just a flavorless burger, buns, meh guac and velvetta queso.  The drinks were very good though. I'll probably only come back for the drinks.

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: Look for my previous review y'all.  no resolution was ever made for that experience to ever be forgotten by me or them. They refused to serve me and I refused to stay quiet. I escalated to the owner after his employees all worked together to ensure that customer service is not important to them at all. I spend a lot of money eating out especially to try new things and I support local businesses. But I couldn't try their food because they don't accommodate properly to accept mastercard payment on a to go order (which they now claim they do allow). Hope you all decide to go somewhere else that values you as a customer. Support black owned businesses.  I hope the COVID hits them hard in the pockets.

reviews.author: Tina B.
reviews.description: First time here was a great experience. Tanya was a delight and remembered our names all night even though it was really busy. She is super personable and would make me want to come back again just to see her. Also, the burgers, beers, and fries were all on point.

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: What makes a great bar/restaurant? Great food, service, and cocktails. This place has all three and tons of character. Take a peek at all this history on the walls and someone will share of story of times past. Best burger in town and huge selection of beers on tap tops of the 5 star rating. It's a must visit if you are around San Marcos.

reviews.author: Jaye M.
reviews.description: Their burgers are amazing!!! I traveled from San Marcos to Kyle with the food and the burgers were still hot and amazing. The staff is really nice! While I was waiting a waitress asked if I wanted a water while I waited and I really appreciated it. I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Jada T.
reviews.description: This place is disgusting. When we first walked in it smelled like rotten eggs. There was a roach near our table, our food was gross/cold when it came out. The mac an cheese looks like oatmeal with way too much pepper.

name: Oz. Tap House
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: VP Membership H.
reviews.description: Excellent beverages, food and service! We love this place! The staff is so helpful, always going above and beyond. If you haven't been, get up and go! You can thank me later

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: Oz. Taphouse (pronounced Ounce) is my most favorite neighborhood place to go for a quick bite, a variety of drinks, a place for my kids to play, and the most friendly service. They have a shuffleboard and foosball table inside, a playground and outdoor games like corn hole and hook and ring toss outside, AND live music on Wednesday nights.  We have a big family, a complicated order and the people at Oz. TH make us feel like family. The food is excellent (burgers, tacos, salads, fish and chips, and more). We never have to wait too long. If there is ever an issue they are always quick to make it right.  The adult beverages are on a self-serve system and you pay by the ounce. You can get a flight of beer or wine, but I prefer the Fuzzy Navel Hard Seltzer. Yum! We have loved their commitment to the community and love supporting a local business we believe in. Thank you Oz. Taphouse for being a great place to take my family!!!

reviews.author: Nicole W.
reviews.description: My husband and I were in town for the weekend and found this place a short walk from our hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The Bourbon Berry Cocktail was my favorite! We also enjoyed sampling many different beers and wines on tap. Their crispy chicken sandwich was delicious! Very crispy on the outside and moist on in the inside.   They have crowlers and growlers for 25% off everyday. I really wish they had a smaller to go container as I would've loved to have taken some of the Berry cocktail home - I can't justify the cost of it to take home a crowler or growler. We would definitely go back if we were in the area again.

reviews.author: Melissa S.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed this place which was an accidental find on our way back from one of our activities in Austin. It is a self-serve concept, so basically you are given a card to scan anytime you want to order a wine, beer, or a cocktail from one of their many taps. You also place your food order at the counter and they bring it out to you.   The fried avocado tacos were amazing and my significant other really enjoyed whatever tacos he had, which I believe were the Carnitas. Why four stars then? Two reasons. One is I was really confused on how much I should tip. I usually don't struggle with this being a bartender, but since we had to pour our own drinks and order food at the counter , I wasn't comfortable leaving a full 20%. Second, when you are pouring your beer, the price adds up very quick. There was one point my boyfriend poured a pint glass and the beer ended up being $22. That was a bit of a letdown. Otherwise the staff is VERY friendly and welcoming -they run a very tight ship. The bathrooms were exceptionally clean and the layout with a big outdoor patio is a bonus. Highly recommend, just watch the higher ABV beers because they add up fast!

reviews.author: Traci P.
reviews.description: I've ordered from Oz many times! Today I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with slaw on the side and sweet potato fries.  The fries were cold, the slaw was literally purple cabbage not dressed and there were 15 huge jalapeños on my sandwich! Will have to rethink about ordering again.

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: Stopped by Oz. Tap House for the first time after a Vandegrift H.S. football game, recommended to us by a family member.  "Go to Oz (pronounced Oz, like wizard of Oz) Tap House, is great.  First things first, we realized later it's not Oz it's Oz.  Notice the period after the z.  Oz. = ounce!  Makes perfect sense when you see the concept.  Dozens of self-serve taps, pouring cocktails, beer, wine, etc.  Way cool!  We couldn't tell how much vodka was actually in the Cosmos we had, but they were tasty!  The Community brand ice tea off the charts too.  Any place serving Community products knows their stuff ... oh yeah, the food.  Definitely "gotta go back for more" fare.  Fried cauliflower and jalapeños, nice ranch sauce.  Our server, unprompted, brought some buffalo wing sauce, "dip a little in here, then the ranch."  Awesomeness!  House tacos and cod tacos were delicious, depths of sublime flavors layered into top shelf flour tortillas.  Our only observation was using the house taco slaw on the cod tacos may be a better pairing than the sautéed cabbage... at any rate, the tacos were outstanding.  We'll definitely be back, lots more on the menu to explore.  And a special shout out to James working the register.  Explained the concept, led us through the process, and answered quite a few "newbie" questions.  He was great, no need to hire more employees, clone James!

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: The uniqueness of this place really sets it apart. You are given a card to pour any of the beers on top yourself, which I had seen before and always love. What I hadn't seen was also you can pour wine or cocktails! This experience is perfect for all of those people crawling out of quarantine and not knowing what to do when they cant pour their own drinks. But now you can! And despite the setup involving many hands, Oz. keeps the place sparkling clean.  I can't speak much to the food menu. It's mostly a meat-forward fare. They have a vegan burger patty, but I was told neither of the buns are vegan. Since the patty was really soft, I am not sure it would work as a lettuce wrap. It seems weird to have a vegan patty when you can't have a full vegan burger, but at least there is a vegetarian option.  My mom liked her fish and chips.   I am really just here for the taps though!

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: How lucky are we to arrive in Texas and meet this amazing place! It was like stepping in paradise. Delicious food and a whole variety of beers.   We tried a few of the beers and had some Tex-Mex.   I tried the sangria beer. I believe it was number 32 on the panel. If you like sangria and bubbles go for it, It's like sangria with bubbles (GF)  Husband had a few other kinds of beers which I tried and oh Man, It was very good! Nothing like I ever had before.   I also had the house tacos (3) with chicken, steak and fried avocado. The fried avocado was definitely a hit for me. It was full of flavor, creamy and crunchy at the same time.   If you are visiting Austin like us and want to drive away from the city you won't regret going to Oz Tap House.   Also, one of the owners is supper friendly we had the pleasure to speak with Sean briefly. Staff is also very nice, patiently explained to us how tap works.   Thanks Oz Tap House for such a memorable welcome!   I recommend this place to everyone!!

reviews.author: Michaela M.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place being so close to home and having a huge selection of beers with some wine. The food was average but the outdoor area was super fun for my kiddos.

reviews.author: Kerri A.
reviews.description: I just ordered lunch from Oz tap house. We got fish and chips, fried pickles,  a baked pretzel, a Caesar salad and a cheesesteak.   The pro's: The ranch dressing that came with the fried pickles was pretty good, As was the coleslaw.   The cons:  The fish and chips portion was small and soggy. It was two pieces of greasy fish, that iterally had no flavor. Fish and Chips is one of my favorite foods and I've had it all over the world. Never had I gotten it without flavor. How do you make something taste like nothing? Granted. I asked that the fish and chips have no hot pepper on it. Unfortunately, Hot pepper is the only spice Oz uses.  The fries were cold inside - clearly not hand-cut. The Caesar salad, was spicy in a weird way. It was not good.  The Philly Cheesesteak was very very spicy and greasy.  The Baked Pretzel - Auntie Ann's does a better job, this was a VERY basic, previously frozen pretzel. Nothing special and not worth the price.  The fried pickles - under seasoned and instead of crisp, they were chewy. Again not good.    Everything was extremely spicy, from the fish and chips to the Caesar salad. Food items that traditionally aren't spicy, were all grossly over spiced with hot peppers. Oz Tap House needs to learn how to use spices without making things spicy. Go back to cooking school - Spiced and Spicy! There is a difference! One more thing,  Read dietary notes. There's a reason why people write them.

reviews.author: Katy D.
reviews.description: This place is amazing. Fun for parents and kiddos! The staff is super welcoming and accommodating. Not to mention the owners are awesome as well. Try the tacos or the crispy chicken sandwich. So good!

reviews.author: Sara O.
reviews.description: Ya know what, I loved this place. We came for the patio,but it was kind of crowded so we sat inside. We were greeted when we walked in,had the process explained etc.  Beers, a couple of ciders,and wines on tap. Pretty cool. I did semi accidentally pour myself 9 oz of wine, so it was a $12 glass, not what I'd typically spend on a glass of wine, but I also typically wouldn't be served 9 oz.  Our food came out quickly and it was really good!  I don't know much it was (folks mentioned auomatic gratuity) bc my husband paid, but it was great and we will definitely come back. They had a playground in the back that we saw,which would be great to come to with our lil people.

reviews.author: Beth L.
reviews.description: Fun atmosphere. Good food. Variety of options.  What really stuck out to us last night was customer service - from the front order person to the in-house table bussers, and the "tap Bosses" or so to speak.  They pay attention to what's going on. They make you feel like you are the most important person that has come in all day... and it was great to see lots of customers supporting this small business.  Plus, of course, there are MANY drink choices to sample and enjoy!!

reviews.author: Lea S.
reviews.description: Pretzel charcuterie board is amazing! Great place for families and they also have most sports games on the televisions as well. You can't go wrong with the selection of beers and wine.

reviews.author: Spencer C.
reviews.description: The idea is great, it's a self pour bar, they charge by ounce, only thing they did was bring out my order. Didn't check or see if we were all right. Overall everything is a little over priced. Food was sub par. Even happy hour there was only 5 cents off the beer. Expect around $8-9 for a 14 oz beer, and $15+ for mediocre food. And when I went to go tip, they looked at me confused as to why I didn't give them a big tip. Well the answer is simple. I did everything myself while all the workers sat on their phone talking in a booth.

reviews.author: Allison R.
reviews.description: I got the Brie berry burger. Everything tasted really good and I was so impressed that the burger was actually medium rare and was very pink and juicy! The onion rings were just okay. The breading wasn't very flavorful and kept falling off and the onions were not crispy. We also got the house tacos and the beef was good, and the fried avocado was amazing! Really liked the sauce they used!

reviews.author: Jack B.
reviews.description: Pretty good food and interesting beverage system. Great bar. Overall great place to have a small meal and a beer.

reviews.author: Stacy C.
reviews.description: Cool concept pay by the ounce tap house. Gives you plenty of opportunity to try all types of beers without having to get a full pint.  Food is good too, the ahi salad is delicious and the aren't skimpy with the ahi :).

reviews.author: Steve R.
reviews.description: Way overrated. Gave this place a second chance today. Ordered delivery: 1/2 bbq chicken salad and Kieran's chicken sandwich. Both portions were inadequate and flavor terrible.  Salad smelled like b.o. and sandwich was one of the worst chicken sandwiches I have had. Quality nonexistent. Taking my business elsewhere.

reviews.author: Rosaura A.
reviews.description: Looooved it, absolutely!  Taking my California family there, when they come out for a visit, from Santa Barbara.    Great concept with "brew tastings."  Food was scrumptious!!!  Going back for date night soon!

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: I still remember the first time we went there. It was on the slow end of Dirty Sixth, where the old Havana location was.   I recall it vividly because of an interesting Interaction I had with the bartender.  As I looked at the menu, I asked about the pastrami and he said, "Its good. So good in fact, it's the second best in town, behind Pious Pizza."  I remember thinking how it was honest but cocky at the same time. Sure, you may not think it's the best, but you're sure your second best?  Well, he was right.  Fast forward to a cool, hazy night in 2022 at their South Lamar location. First of all, the building is immaculate, an intentional nod to their style and culture. I love it.  My wife had the prosciutto baguette, which was delicious. Although the bread almost stole the show on that one.  The kiddo had the chicken schnitzel and, man, who puts that much effort into a kids plate? Really tasty and well executed.  I, like always, went with old faithful, the pastrami sandwich. My old friend was as delicious as always, as it didn't disappoint. The bread was great but didn't come close to stealing the limelight.   I've always worried about Easy Tiger turning into one of those Austin brands (talking to you Torchy) that loses its way, and I'm sure some may feel that way, but the experience at South Lamar could've been back at that old Sixth Street basement.   Five stars, folks.

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: This one hurts my heart because I had been so eager to come here.   A big group of myself and a bunch of other girls had decided that Easy Tiger was the place we wanted to support this night! I was so excited because, like I said, this was a top place on my list of places to go!  We had called the day of to make sure they could accommodate a large group. They said yes. We let them know when we were coming that night and how many of us it would be. All good (we thought)!  Our group starts to arrive at Easy Tiger and we realize that they thought we were coming the next morning and not the time we had told them. Okay, no biggie, we can fix this. We had also been told that there were only two servers that night. You could tell they were overwhelmed. We had made it clear that we wanted to make it as easy as possible for our server since there were so many of us. We were told that they would be able to give us two long tables next to each other so our group would be at least semi close. This didn't happen. Again, whatever... It just kind of sucked.  Now on to food! Yay! Most of us were starving. I can't speak for everyone else but I decided on the Pretzel. It looked so good in the IG photos. When it came out (fast if I may say), it was cold and not soft :( The cheese and other sides it came with felt like they were just taken out of the freezer. Inedible. Sad Ashley.  I drank a Peach Mule that was A1!! That was the highlight of my time here!  Would definitely come back, sit at the bar, and maybe order something different. I'm sure this was just a case of miscommunication and I'm excited to give them a second chance!

reviews.author: Sean Matthew L.
reviews.description: Easy Tiger has a warm special place in my heart. When their 6th street location closed I was so sad, but then like gremlins overnight they multiplied in the best of ways. Having an east austin, and south austin offering and more is such a boon.   We love their snacking/grazing boards. What millennial wouldn't? They're basically adult lunchables. Meats and cheeses and nuts and jams, oh my.   The pretzels and beer cheese are also legendary. But so much so that they sadly often run out of pretzels like they did for us the other day.   We love the use of covered and outdoor seating, especially in this time.   Wanting more substantial fare, they got you. The sausages, pastrami, the blt, all incredible. Really you can't go wrong. So, go!

reviews.author: Jelexus M.
reviews.description: Okay so, I ran across this post of super cute bars in Austin. Well of course I had too try them ALL. Starting with Easy Tiger.  Location: upon arrival it looks like an outdoor situation but once you park your car around the back you slowly realize it's a indoor/outdoor vibe. Areas have great coverage from the sun and I love that they have fans as well as Heaters on the ceiling!   Food: The Food was Fan-Freaking-Tastic. I won't lie first glance at the menu I was ehh. Nevertheless I asked my waiter chandler what should I order he made wonderful recommendations.   The pretzel  10/10: crispy outside pillowy soft inside   The Cajun Chicken Sausage 10/10: that prefect snap you want from any sausage casing and the home made Chow-Chow was the prefect topping.   The breakfast potatoes  10/10 : It was like the par-boiled the pots then fried them    Brussels sprouts 8/10 : Great flavor just wanted them a little more tender   Our cocktails 8/10  We order 3 different kinds all three were just okay.   The dessert and bread too take home was also really good.   All in All I would definitely recommend stopping by.

reviews.author: Jevin H.
reviews.description: The beer at here was pretty good. I liked the heavenly haze and my friend got the pog-slammer. Haze was a IPA similar to electric jellyfish from pint house. Pog had very citrus-y flavors which I liked. I also got the pretzel which was decently sized. The dips were good for the pretzel.  The bad part... the service. We ordered three beers the first time around, which took around 15 minutes to arrive. The beers weren't really cold at this point. I am not sure how that would be possible but I expect it to be the waiting staff seemingly lounging around talking to each other doing nothing. We asked for the waitress and it took an additional 10 minutes for her to arrive. We then ordered more food and drinks which took additionally extremely long amounts of time. The kicker was that there were two other seated tables so the place was basically empty. I would really recommend going to the 7th location over this one, at least while the current waiting staff is still doing what they did when we went.   Food was alright. Service was shockingly bad.

reviews.author: Dave A.
reviews.description: I went mid-afternoon to pick up salad and bread. They texted me ahead to let me know they were out of pre-sliced bread but had whole loaf of same flavor. I accepted it but had wanted pre-sliced. There is a lot of construction underway and it makes parking cramped.   Also, I could not locate the curbside spots. I went to the host stand to pick up. Nearly got run over by an impatient driver driving around the "Slow Down, Stay Awhile" sign. Ironic.   The Winter Kale salad seems overpriced for the portion size. It is tasty, just on the small side.   The North side location is much better. Maybe this one will improve after construction.

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: We stopped by for a late lunch on a Monday and this place did not disappoint. We decided to sit in the upstairs area. Our food and drinks arrived promptly and everything was delicious. I haven't visited after work which tends to be more lively.   Overall pleasant experience and menu prices are reasonable. If you're new in town or just visiting, it's worth a trip - I do recommend.

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: I like the ambience. During the day time, you can study, meet up with a friend, or go on a date! There is parking, indoor seating, and outdoor patio.   They have great pretzels and drinks. If you go from 7-10 am on the weekdays, they have $5 special of any coffee with pastry!

reviews.author: Sabrina B.
reviews.description: This is a joint review from me and my partner. We went on two separate occasions. I went with my coworkers on a Thursday for an outing/birthday. The place itself is cute. Allows dogs. Twinkling lates. Cornhole off to the side. Just a cute, trendy, Austin-like place. But the experience was lack luster. The food took very long. The establishment didn't own enough cups, so part of us had to share cups or just didn't have water. The food was mediocre, save the fries. In this kind of weather, you should be prepared for flies to constantly fly around and land on your food. The drinks are also weak and the time between them will sober you up.   My partner went a separate time. This time I had three things to eat: a strawberry and goat cheese salad, French toast bites, and ricotta toast to share. The salad was ok, but smelled absolutely rank. Even the vinaigrette smelled super off, and not in a heavy-in-vinegar kind of way. The goat cheese wasn't the best, and frankly you could see the indentation of the packaging. The French toast bites bad poor texture. You'd expect to use a slightly stale brioche but instead was a baguette style. It was not soaked enough in the egg mix before cooking for it to have a fluffy texture. Instead, it was hard and unenjoyable. A poor quality baguette instead of the nice ones at real boulangeries. The ricotta toast was the best part, but still wasn't that great. Texture was also off, like an overcooked steak that takes too much force to rip apart. Not only that, but the food took 1 hour to get here.  At the end, they took his card and forgot to return it for 30 minutes. Couldn't get a hold of the waiter and left very late due to him forgetting about us.  Twice have they been very disappointing! Don't recommend this place unless you just want to waste money on a company credit card or take your young mother-in-law that you hate.

reviews.author: Vivian C.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed the atmosphere! My fiancé and his dad enjoyed the beers here, while his mom and I happily sipped our latte. All great.   We all shared a sourdough bread and wow it tasted so fresh and tasty! It was as if it was freshly baked (which I believe that's what they advertised) and it was more than enough to take home to enjoy for breakfast the next day. We also all shared the sausage sampler with the sauces that go with each sausage which I LOVED. Each of them had their own taste and they did an excellent job pairing them with the appropriate sauce.   As for my entrée, I ordered the prosciutto baguette which was quite huge! Very delightful, but I ended up not finishing it. Their bread portions are very generous.   Would love to come back!

reviews.author: Kasper L.
reviews.description: We stopped by on a lazy Sunday to unwind and check out the place since I've always wanted to stop by. I'm glad we did! I really like the whole look of the restaurant (even though parts of it were under construction). We had a few drinks and really liked them. We decided to snack a bit and ordered the pretzel. My fiancee really enjoyed it! I thought it was good. The beer cheese was delicious!  I wish we had the stomach and time to stay for a meal since I thought the menu sounded tasty. I would love to stop by for brunch one day too.

reviews.author: Linda M.
reviews.description: Easter Sunday and no reservations? No problem. My friends and I decided to check out the new South Austin location of Easy Tiger. It was my suggestion and, thankfully, everyone loved it!  We started with a cinnamon knot, a soft pretzel with mustard, and a round of mimosas. The pretzel was out of this world! Warm, with a light sprinkling of Kosher salt, a crispy exterior and the lightest, fluffiest interior EVER!  We got it with a nice whole grain mustard; cheese was an optional side. The cinnamon knot was pretzel dough in a different shape with a sprinkling of cinnamon (it was savory, not sweet). Good, too, but it wasn't warm, so it got overlooked as we focused on the warm pretzel. As you can see from my photos, we were overcome with hunger and I almost didn't get a picture of the pretzel at all! It was that good.  We moved on to the Grazing Board, a side salad, and avocado toast.  The grazing board was truly a show stopper. It included a blue cheese, guyere, and brie, Prosciutto, sweet red grapes, dark and white raisins, slices of sour dough and walnut cranberry bread, tiny, tiny gherkins, candied walnuts, apricots, whipped butter and other toppings. It was visually stunning, but equally delicious. The house salad had the best, giant croutons and a light, delicious dressing with fresh greens, cherry tomatoes, radish slices. The avocado toast was a thick slice of grilled sour dough topped with a generous mound of mashed avocado, cherry tomatoes, and thinly sliced radishes. Delicious!  The space at the S. Lamar location is very nice, bright and open. There are several outdoor seating areas, so no problem finding a spot to sit. There might be an issue finding parking, as the parking lot is small (and each parking space is tiny!)  I cannot wait to go back and try some other things on the menu as everything I saw coming out of the kitchen looked good. I want to try it all!

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: Long story short, the drinks were good but the food and service left a lot to be desired. I didn't drink much and I really only took a few sips from my friends beers and most were good. I'm not a beer enthusiast but I have nothing to complain about when it comes to the flavor of the drinks. The food was very underwhelming since it left a lot to be desired. The cinnamon twist was super dry and not very warm. It's like they left it out for a while and just gave it to us because even 10 seconds in the microwave would've made that cinnamon twist soft. The pretzel was a lot better since it was softer and the three dips that came with it were good with mustard being my favorite. However, neither felt fresh. It felt like both were sitting out for a while since a freshly baked pretzel would be much warmer and much softer.  Okay with all of the good or mediocre stuff out of the way, I just wanted to say that the service here was one of the worst I've had in a long time. My friends and I ordered some beers and it took 20 minutes for us to receive them. When we got them they didn't feel as cold as they should be which leads me to believe that they were poured earlier and forgotten there. I question how it takes 20 minutes to deliver the beers when we were one of three tables there and you simply need to pour the beers into a cup. Every time my friends ordered more drinks, there was usually a 20 minute delay before the drinks arrived. When we asked one of the waiters if he could get our waitress, she didn't come until 15 minutes later. There was no urgency in the servers and they were just hiding behind the divider chatting it up. Good service needs to be the waiters and waitresses coming to us instead of us searching for them. I've heard a lot of good things about Easy Tiger and I think I'll be going to 7th street Easy Tiger given how poor the service was here.

reviews.author: Piyush A.
reviews.description: What a gem on South Lamar! There are some business that have survived the pandemic, some that have folded, but there are very few that have creatively embraced it. Easy Tiger has gone beyond that where they started the business during the pandemic and built something absolutely majestic.   Drinks - Ofcourse the beer selection is amazing but the best part is that there is something for everyone. They have a great selection of wine and some really cool cocktails.   Food - This was a pleasant surprise. I have never heard my food snob wife utter the words "This may be the best avocado toast I've ever had" .. not just that the Brussels sprouts are a delight and the egg sandwich is really good too  Ambience - This is where they go from being great to phenomenal.. the outdoor area is a perfect setup and the best part is that they have a little kiddie park for the little ones. All this overlooking the green belt.. does/can it get any better?   One thing to add .. on a good day parking lot gets full very fast so plan accordingly!   A must must go for a nice sunny day or otherwise :)

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: I can't complain about the beer. The cinnamon twist I ordered was 1.5/10. It was hard and stale, and the temperature was lower than lukewarm. If they tried to reheat it even just a little bit, it probably would've been much better.   The service was absolutely appalling. We ordered beers, 1 for each person for 3 people total when we arrived. It took about 20 minutes for our beers to arrive, and it wasn't even busy. There were only 2 other tables at the time.   When they dropped off the beers, I asked if I could order another one. He told me he'd get the waitress for us, but she took another 15-20 min to come get our order. The whole time during the wait, I noticed that a decent amount of staff (4-6 people) were standing around chatting with each other in the back. The whole time they were chatting, we were waiting for our waitress to give her our next order of drinks.   TL;DR: Extremely inattentive staff, with very slow and poor service. Staff doesn't seem to care about the customers at all, and the cinnamon was stale.

reviews.author: Aleah H.
reviews.description: Easy Tiger is a pretty popular spot to come up when planning a trip to Austin, so we decided to see what all the hype was about! We visited as soon as we got to town, so we got a bit of a sampler lunch. The server informed us that their bakery was down so anything with their bread was off the menu for the day. This was a particular bummer because that also meant to pretzels which I'd heard a lot about! Regardless, we find some great bread-free options.   We settled on the kale salad, sausage platter, chicken schnitzel tenders, fries. The fried were amazing-- waffle cut and so crispy!! I am not a huge kale gal, but the kale salad was also amazing and made me feel better about the fries!  The sausage platter is a fun way to sample a few things, but the server dropped a couple pieces of the brat when bringing our platter and didn't acknowledge it or offer to replace them which was a bit awkward and disappointing (why I deducted a star). Overall, the brat was the least exciting option on the board so we just enjoyed the rest, but it wasn't ideal.   We also got a pitcher of one of their Austin pale ales which was a great light lunch pairing! Their beer menu is pretty expansive with both local and classic/safe options.   Parking was a bit tight because this spot is so popular! On a Saturday for lunch our wait was 20 minutes which was very reasonable. They also have a little park area for kids which is fun!

reviews.author: Jenny K.
reviews.description: I drove thirty minutes here to check out the kids play area and the experience of eating and hanging out here did not disappoint!  First off, I love how you sit, order on your phone and the servers bring stuff out. Super efficient and felt safe during these COVID times.   Second, the outdoor seating is spacious and has a great view of the kids play area so you can keep an eye on them while you eat and drink.   Thirdly, the food is delicious! I got the seasonal pasta salad and fried Brussels sprouts and both were excellent.   And last but not least, the coffee is awesome! I'm from Seattle and have high coffee standards, and I just loved my cappuccino.   Thank you for offering a kid-friendly place for us to hang out!!

reviews.author: Andreas S.
reviews.description: Solid choice for a beer garden. It's a bit off of the main street which makes it quieter, but it seems like they could have switched the building / beer garden with their parking lot and offered their guest a view too. Either ways, came here on a good weather Sunday and waited for around 30 mins which is OK, plenty of open seats but I suppose they were careful with Covid. Service itself was also a bit slow - you order via a QR code and your own phone, but the food itself took a bit to come out. We had a large pretzel, Bratwurst and a turkey sandwich. The pretzel was great, warm and soft. Sandwich was also good, with a nice brie, very filling. Could have had a bit more of a side with it than the couple of salad leaves. The bratwurst was also decent. We saw lots of people walking out with baguettes and the likes, so supposedly those are good and worth a try.  The beer selection is OK, assuming you're a fan of smaller breweries that do a ton of hoppy brews, nothing really Pilsener like in the selection.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Great place for casual dining.  Views from upstairs are beautiful. We enjoyed the cheese plate and drinks!

reviews.author: Dawn S.
reviews.description: A beautiful fall evening in Austin deserved a patio visit. We sat upstairs and the view didn't disappoint. We just missed the sunset but the sky was still stunning.  We grabbed some menus and decided on drinks and a giant pretzel. We also got the charcuterie board. My friend got a margarita which is said was 4/10 on a scale of margs. I tasted it and to me it tasted like a melted frozen margarita. Way too sweet for my liking. I wanted a cab (wine of choice) which they didn't have...I got a Malbec which wasn't horrible but I prefer a good bold cab.  The pretzel was great as always and the charcuterie board was well laid out. Neither one of us like the almonds. They had some sort of oil on them. What I really was sad about was the jam. I was hoping for a fig jam but it was not. My first bite was not good at all. I even asked the waitress what it was...she very nicely called down to the kitchen on her little mic and found out that it was a strawberry ginger jam. Those two flavors do not go together in my personal opinion. The ginger was way too strong and over powering.  The cheeses on the cheese board from Antonelli's Cheese Shop were on point. The goat cheese with honey was great. The blue cheese was yum and the Gouda was "Gouda".  ba dum tss.   Overall- this place is a no brainer for a casual night with friends over a pretzel and a beautiful view.

reviews.author: Nishanth E.
reviews.description: Absolutely tremendous sours, possible the best I've had in the country! Would highly recommend any of their sours ranging from iLimetastico to Teeny Hopper. Picked up some cans to go as well on the way out, would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Austin and specifically around that area.

reviews.author: John P.
reviews.description: So I'm a big fan of being fair, so here goes. A friend and I stopped by while in Austin and the place was packed. I think we got there at the right time because we were able to secure a seat inside where it was considerably cooler than the outside seating.   The process for ordering was fairly simple and the lady helping me was kind enough to break it down for a new out-of-towner. We got 4 sour beers and they were really interesting. On this particular occasion I had a new experience after I finished my 2nd sour beer. I learned that sour beer gives me heart burn. 1st time ever. I was asking my friend what this fire in my chest was. She loved the sour beers she ordered and we got glasses to remember the occasion. BOB... you'll always be my first.   I recommend checking it out and if you like sour beers Blue Owl Brewing will put a smile on your face. The staff is friendly and hip, and the beer flows as does the good times.   Prohst!!!

reviews.author: Michelle D.
reviews.description: This was our 3rd time being here....as we live in Dallas....but every time we visit we come.  They always have great brews and flavors.  The staff if exceptionally nice and has great customer service. I'm not a beer fan but I do love their Peach and Blueberry beers!  Their coolest thing is for $20 you get a great glass with beer and 3 others in plastic cups. Cool concept and a lot of beer in pours.  Getting a great following and you should go!!

reviews.author: Kelly M.
reviews.description: We loved coming to Blue Owl Brewing!! When we came, they only had the patio open for drinking at the brewery due to COVID, which was nice and very comfortable.   We ordered a glass and got 4 beers with the glass, if you are not able to finish your 4 beers, they will let you take the extras to go in cans! I believe the size we got was $20 per person. They had about 3 different options for sizes of glasses. The girl said we could even share one order if we wanted less beers per person.  I love all the options of the beers (they are all "sour" and DELICIOUS)!! My all time favorite that I tried was the Jubilberry!  The only complaint I would have was parking was a little hard to find but we ended up parking in a lot close by.  We will definitely be coming back when in Ausitn!

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: Great sour beers! You can't beat their deal where you pay $20 for 4 beers and you get to keep the glass. Honestly, you can't go wrong with  any of the beers they have. I'd recommend the little boss or the van dayum.

reviews.author: Kelsey G.
reviews.description: ONLY SOURS- not nice servers. The girls working were not friendly or welcoming. If you are looking for a well rounded brewery this is NOT IT! They serve only sours + 1 Pilsner. Also, policy is not ideal. You have to buy a pint glass for at least $25 in order to drink. Glass was cute, ambience outside was nice

reviews.author: Madeline C.
reviews.description: I don't know how I've failed to review this place yet, because I literally purchase something from here every week and finally got to sit on their patio during a beautiful sunny Sunday. I cannot recommend it enough -- thought I didn't like sour beer, oh boy I was wrong. Absolutely ADORE the Tangerina, Tiki Hop Totem, Plum de Plume, Limetastico and Jubilberry beers. And they had a Plum de Plume + mango beer slushee, so yum! Patio was very full on Sunday so we had to wait to snag an outdoor table but it was worth it. The staff is always incredibly nice and feels safe for COVID. Every Thursday they spin a wheel for a growler deal -- entire growler of amazing beer for $9! And their merch is so cute, definitely have a koozie collection now. Biggest perk of in-person is if you buy a beer glass (pictured here with a very cool design) you get 4 pours for $16. It really doesn't get better than this.

reviews.author: Rebekah G.
reviews.description: The beer is amazing, but I'm not a fan of the 4-drink i policy. I know you can spread them out over a month or get cans, but it makes it a little harder.

reviews.author: Libby B.
reviews.description: A brewery that does only sours! I was so happy to find this place while exploring East Austin. You know, it's been a while since I walked around a neighborhood without my phone constantly telling me where to go. This time I did, and Cesar Chavez led me here and to so many other amazing spots!   You walk in, order a glass that you get to keep! And then you get 4 beers in that glass! The best part? If you are like me and get the cool goblet at 16 oz. you can't drink that much beer at once. You can keep your tasting card and come back for the other 1 or 2 that you maybe couldn't do at visit #1! I think the limit is about a month between visits, but I'm not sure. Honestly, we came here 3 times. One time we didn't have our tasting cards so just did 4 tasting size glasses. Yes, we are big fans and came back to Indy with 4 glasses!   The patio is covered which is great during Texas spring/summer. If you're lucky, and someone leaves and hands you their card, double bonus!   I highly recommend visiting because even my husband, who does not love sours as I do, found a beer he liked (Van Dayum), and we even passed on the love to my sister-in-law who lives in RR! (How has she not been here yet?!)

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: Do you like sour beer? If you answered yes then why aren't you here already?  If you don't like sour beer, verify by trying the definition of it at Blue Owl Brewing because "The Owls are not what they seem." - yep, they're Lynch fans of the best show to make it to TV.  BOB is your uncle and your favorite sour beer. Come in and select a size, get 4 samples in that glass, and when you finish - keep it! The glass is yours.  Heavy rotation keeps its original and I love it. They have some staples for those trying to have a routine.  Buy some swag and get the brand out there! #LittleBossIsMyFav #BlueOwlSightings

reviews.author: Shelley B.
reviews.description: Listen- I love the beers. But the way you have to purchase them is so weird. You have to buy 4 or that's it. Sure, you can split it or take some home but sometimes I just want 1-2 beers on site and not have to buy 4. My boyfriend and I came and bought the 4 but then wanted one more. Nope, buy 4 more or none. We picked none and left. I just wish we could come and buy one or two beers without being forced to buy 4.

reviews.author: Eliott L.
reviews.description: Came here with a couple of friends on a Friday night because of a recommendation from a friend of mine, and it did not disappoint. For $16, my friends and I each got a normal sized glass to take home and 4 pours of any choice (you can do 8 half pours). There are also different types and sizes for glasses, so you could opt for a bigger or smaller glas.   Beer/Sours: Great quality drinks with a wide range of flavors. If you don't like sours this may not be the place for you, but definitely give it a shot if you like beers in general.   Service: Nothing to be said here, super nice and friendly staff! Felt right at home.   Atmosphere: Great! Nothing that prevents you from enjoying your afternoon or your conversation.   Definitely coming here again, hopefully I'll collect all 4 glasses!

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: If you like sour beers, youll love this place. Personally i find it gimmicy. The sour beers dont do it for me. Also they make you buy a pint glass before you can order.  The main draws are that its in a cool neighborhood, i like that the beers are highly alcoholic. Also their patio is dece, but it could use more seating. Finally, their gimmicky ordering system causes people to leave free beer tickets around constantly. I like free beer.  The big gimmick, which I find annoying, aside from the sour beers buying a glass when you to get a drink. When you buy one, you're basically comitting to four 12 oz. pours and possibly coming back in the future. There are other sizes, but the 12 oz. Is the best value and it feels weird drinking beer from a shot glass.   You can bring a glass you already bought, but overall its annoying to bring a pint glass to a bar. If i wanted to clean my own glasses, i would drink at home. Thats why youre kinda commiting to coming back by buying one.  They give you a sheet to check off the number of pours. The sheets are transferable and can be used on different days so make sure to hold on to them. Also, we usually find a sheet of people who didnt use all their pours so youll usually get a few free.

reviews.author: Ricky R.
reviews.description: When we were walking over to this place from Lazarus brewing my wife said, "I think they only have sours". I was like no way, I will just grab an IPA or something... Oh man was I shocked to see that they literally only had sours. With that being said let me start this shockingly high review for a place that only has sours by saying... i do not care for sour beers. So a 5 star coming from a person who doesnt enjoy sours should say something.  I loved everything about this place. This place is in a cool location, has a great logo, has great aesthetic, and a really cool flight idea. If it wasnt all sour beers... I would live at this place.  Let me explain how the flights work here. You pick your glass size... If I were to guess I would say 4oz, 8oz, 12oz... but honestly that is a guess. Then you get 4 samples in that size. You bring up your sheet, they check off the beer and you sample it. Oh and the best part is that after you are done you get to keep the glass. Oh and the prices are not crazy. I want to say it was $6, $8, $10, but that might also be off. This is definitely one of the coolest strategies I have seen for flights at a brewery ever... Oh and the glasses all looked really neat for sure.  Now onto the beer. Like I have mentioned multiple times already, I am not a fan of sours, but I liked the initial flavor of most of these beers. We had the wee heavy, the red, the earl grey one (lazarus colab), and the cherry stout. Everything had a great crafted flavor, until I hit the sour note. I relied on my wife to drink most of these, but I was very impressed by everything for sure. And my wife was happy with everything as well.  I would suggest anyone in Austin come visit this place for sure. Definitely worth the trip and more so if you like sours!!

reviews.author: Matt R.
reviews.description: Listen I'm going to preface this review with I DO NOT LIKE SOUR BEERS but this place still garners 5 stars.  It's got a cozy set up where you're with in ear shot of your neighbor and can easily strike up a conversation.  So the way it works there is you buy a glass and get four pours in that glass.  All of the beers seemed to be wild fermented...sours.  The sour aspect was not overpowering so someone that does not like that style could still enjoy what they pour.

reviews.author: Jeremy M.
reviews.description: Being a huge fan of sour beers I was stoked to visit Blue Owl. Unfortunately I walked away underwhelmed.  Aside from these sour ipa the beers were just ok. The concept though was something I've never encountered. You can't just walk in and buy a pint of beer. You must purchase a glass, which comes with 4 pours. There are a variety of glass sizes from taster to full pint and the prices are actually pretty cheap ($16 for the full size glass and 4 pours). If you are already in the area and want to try something different it's worth a stop but probably wouldn't recommend going out of your way.

reviews.author: Maritza M.
reviews.description: Spent a whole evening here due to the unusual policy of requiring you to purchase a glass that comes with 4 pours. We drank our 4 14 oz pours over the course of a few hours, but it's nice that we had the option to bail earlier and take home a can instead. The patio is nicely set up with distanced tables, fans, and hand sanitizers at every table. We brought over food from Vegan Nom, a couple minutes walk away. My partner and I each tried 4 different beers. All were delicious! This was our first visit to the brewery despite buying the beer from stores many times. I would definitely come back but with the awareness of the policy that you have to buy at least 4 12oz pours (you can split amongst multiple people though). I think the real highlight of visiting the brewery are the frozen beer drinks. They had a "Mexican Marteeny" available the night we went, which is based on the Teenybopper ale with some other things mixed in. Amazing, and a great final glass! The bartender was lovely and was able to answer all our questions, too.

reviews.author: Ryan F.
reviews.description: Visited Blue Owl Brewing on Sunday evening. Extremely different and very bold beers, but even as someone who loves sours, difficult to get into.  Quality: I visit breweries relatively frequently, and I can confidently say Blue Owl Brewing is doing some very interesting things. From the way you order to the explosion of sour, nothing is familiar. We went with the Half Pint Glass and tried four beers, Little Gose, Van Dayum, Hop Totem, and Professor Black. I also got a sip of Cool and The Gang and Admiral Gravitas. And while you expect a gose to be sour, the red ale, IPA, cherry stout, and imperial oatmeal stout are not things you expect to pucker your lips. Does it work? I don't really think so. The standard sours were good, but the other styles are just overpowered and lose their charm. I give credit for going bold, but I think the experiment went too far. Quantity: Guests choose an 16oz, 12oz, 8oz, or 5oz glass, which then comes with four pours. Value: $12 for the Half Pint Glass with four 8oz pours. Ambiance: Blue Owl Brewing is located east of Downtown Austin. The brewery is in a good sized warehouse, but the taproom is relatively small. Most of the space is taken up by equipment. Out front they have a skinny patio area running adjacent to the street. Inside they have a bar at the center and then a few tables with high tops surrounding it. The decor is very cozy and homey. In the background indie hip-hop played along, which felt like a good choice. I will say the collection of games they had to occupy visitors, much like the beers, strays from the norm. With around twenty games, I had never heard of any of them before. Crowd: A few other people, but most did not stay very long. It is a very niche style of beer, and it is not really for many casual beer drinkers. Service: The ordering method is strange, which I am sure is annoying to the staff. However, everyone I interacted with was extremely friendly. Parking: Limited street parking on the main stretch, however parking can be found along the side roads.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Blue Owl is a sour's paradise--but before you click away my sour-beer-haters, let me tell you that I'm also one of you. I'm not a sour fan, even though I've done my best to try it every time I hit up breweries. Blue Owl is different...here's why.  True, their beer menu is all sours. That usually turns brew lovers like myself off, BUT keep reading the descriptions of the sours. They brew the sours with other beer varieties that some may enjoy more--hefeweizen, lager, IPA, you name it, they make it. It's called sour-mashing here at Blue Owl. I KNOW. I was drawn to their extensive menu and had the opportunity to try two that night. I love hefes, so went with the Litte Boss, which was a session wheat sour. VERY crisp and refreshing, almost like a lager, and exactly the perfect start to my beer tasting here. The great thing is, ALL beer drinkers knowledgeable or novice, can figure it out. Their menu has a timeline that tells you what is lighter on the palette, and what might be harsher. Their Little Boss was on the clean/light side, so I knew that would be a great starter...and it was! I also chose the Hop Totem because it was an IPA sour, and it didn't actually have as bitter hops as I thought it would. It was not as bitter, but the sour taste came out more for me...so I preferred their Little Boss more.  We stood at their standing tables, as all the other tables were full. They have board games (SCORE!) and every beer lover's favorite things to hear--A GLASS FOR KEEPS. Yup. Mine is sitting in the freezer in its new home. There are various sizes of beer selections, so take that into consideration when you're deciding what size of your drink to get. Also, you can ask the sweet taptenders if they have any stickers lying around--and you might get one for free!

reviews.author: Mina N.
reviews.description: The concept of buying a glass (to was an interesting concept as we were visiting and didn't want anything else to lug around. However, the pricing was not bad for what it was. I got the small 5 oz. glass and was able to get 4 beers to try. They were all delicious, even the sour hazy ipa (and I typically do not like iPad due to the hoppyness). Definitely recommend if you like sours like I do. They have a lot of different ones so you won't be limited.

name: Draught House Pub and Brewery
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: This place is still great. They have a food truck now. Lots of outside seating. New bathrooms. Great Pub.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: Cool bar with nice staff on hand, wasn't too overcrowded on a Friday night with most people sitting outdoors. It's dimly lit inside and not too bright outside either but provides an overall chill mood and environment. Food truck outside serves a good sausage and fries but everything else besides that is about $8 or more, with most things averaging out to be $11-12 per menu item, a little pricey in my opinion for food truck foods.   One ask I'd have is that they install some light features above the dartboards so it's easier to see and play on.

reviews.author: Allison C.
reviews.description: Great place to grab a beer and relax with friends. They are doing contactless ordering right now so scan the QR code at each table to order and pick up the drinks from the bar after a couple of minutes. The outdoor patio has plenty of seating and heaters to keep everyone warm. I tried a couple of their house beers which were decent enough but I'll probably try their other options when I come back.

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: As  Supreme Court nominee Brett M. Kavanaugh once said, "I like beer"! For anyone who likes beer, this is the place to be. They have about 15 that are made in house and another 15 guest brews. I tried their Golden Ale and the Blonde.  The blonde kinda tastes like bananas, but the Ale was "Golden"!   Currently there's no indoor seating, but they had plenty of options outside including a giant tent area.

reviews.author: Alex A.
reviews.description: The beer was good but the bartender was slightly rude and definitely didn't want to serve my friends and I. Wouldn't recommend anything when we asked.

reviews.author: Brian T.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to grab a beer with friends, especially during the pandemic since all of their seating is outdoors.  Beer is decent; not the best I've had but definitely a good effort for their own craft brews.  Atmosphere is a good cross between German and Renaissance-y, almost felt like we were hanging out at the ren fest.  They have a contactless ordering system set up - all ordering is done via website and they call your name when your beer is ready at the main indoor entrance.  My main complaint is that every individual order on the website REQUIRES a food order ($3 french fries from the nearby food truck when we were there).  So if you're chilling here for an extended period of time and like me, order your beers sequentially after you finish each one, you have to get an order of french fries with every single beer order.  I understand this is because of the Texas law requiring 51% food sales in order to classify the establishment as a restaurant to stay open during the pandemic.  But don't force me to help you meet your 51% quota with each drink order I place.    If other breweries can do it without adjusting their way of ordering, it can be done. We eat too many french fries, we won't have room to try more of your beers!

reviews.author: Tim W.
reviews.description: Previous visit non Covid great. Disappointing that waitstaff hid inside. Not available to answer questions or converse at all. Yelled out name after order filled from phone, with multiple beers we had to sort out who's beer went with each person, after beer brought out waitstaff immediately retreated inside. Would not go back during Covid.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: I don't do reviews. I love this place. The burger is unreal.   Context, I have gained "some" lbs during COVID. I was an athletic specimen prior.  Now I'm screwed. If I "finally" go Keto, I will live off the burger ( full size newest addition, though sliders are great)  Also: more importantly - I love the familiar faces, my golden retrievers love to nibble on the fries and the beer is amazing too!

reviews.author: Hannah P.
reviews.description: I live nearby and was really hoping this place could be our new spot. Unfortunately I was greeted by the worst attitude at the door by one of the bartenders tonight and I can't get the bad taste out of my mouth.... or is that the beer? Idk I'll keep looking.

reviews.author: Tori B.
reviews.description: We stopped in here on a recent trip to Austin. Great little place. They had a decent selection and helpful bartenders. It has indoor and outdoor seating which is nice.

reviews.author: Jessica S.
reviews.description: The Draught House Pub has been around for 50 years which is unheard of from a business perspective so hats off to them! I'd say there's a lot to like about this pub which exudes a European vibe with all the wooden decor and dark lighting. The first point of interest was their tap board which was operated by Digital Pour. This thing gives you a ton of info! Not only does it list the beer name, brewery, ABV, style, and price, but it mentions the serving size and gives you an illustration of the serving glass and -- the most intriguing feature -- the keg volume status. You're even able to deduce if they have more than one keg of said beer. I have never seen this anywhere before as most pubs and breweries -- if they use a digital tap board -- turn to Untappd. The only downside is that they have a crap ton of taps, so you have to wait for the projection to scroll through a few screens to get an idea of the full tap list.   The initial impressions were already very positive, so the fact that they served tasters was another added bonus. I believe they are known for their nightly specials and there was one going on for that night which I think was 50% off their house beers. The flight wouldn't have applied for this offer, so like we ordered a half pour of their *Triple Double*, an excellent 8% IPA. Very surprising, but the stout they brewed for their 50 anny was fairly normal. Roasty, easy-drinking, and mild.   Overall, this is a legitimate watering hole, offering the variety needed to appease every kind of drinker and the chilled out atmosphere sought after by every thirsty adult.

reviews.author: Chuck D.
reviews.description: No apologies.  There is no Happy Hour despite the web postings. Full fare full time. Good selection on tap.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: I'm thrilled that we finally hit the Draught house for a few cold beers on a hot Sunday. As others have noted this a chill pub with a million (really about 70) beers on tap. They even had a Frose' available, not sure why.... (joke)  There is limited parking on site but on the weekend there is plenty of parking next door. check their website for additional parking Info. You can either hang inside, in the AC, or chill outside in the shade. Be sure to bring your mutt as well.   The beer is king here! If you can't find a beer to your liking then you ain't looking hard enough. Their Summer Ale and Rosedale Blonde was perfect on a hot day.  They were out of their featured IPA but the Bombay IPA was perfectly fine.  This would have been an easy 5-star review except for the bartenders on duty this past Sunday. Maybe I did not have a cool enough t-shirt on, was not a regular, or my 20% tip per round wasn't enough but lose the effin' attitude. When I walk up to order and say hi don't just nod and ask what do you want. when I ask you how would categorize an IPA don't respond with "it's a regular IPA" WTF is a regular IPA there are about 10 different styles of IPAs. When I ask is it similar to a west coast same response...   Seriously, if you just want to serve your regulars put a sign out front stating so. We'll return for the beer selection as it is fabulous but I'll be sure to adjust my expectations regarding the service...

reviews.author: Crystal H.
reviews.description: Came here around 10 or 11pm and it was pretty dark inside. It was hard to see the beer-tenders because of the taps going straight across the counter. The man who took our order and gave us one sample each was unfriendly. He looked like he didn't want to be there at all. Killed our vibe! So we quickly ordered 2 pints and sat down to finish our beers.

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: This review is for 4.5 stars.  This is a beer drinkers brewery.  Seemed like an endless amount of beer on tap (but probably about 60 if I had to guess).  Really hits every variety and they offer tastes even before buying.  I went with a flight to try 5oz of 4 pours.  Good portion but I was charged $1 which is pretty excessive in my mind.  Other than the price, I liked the place and location.  Really a beer forward establishment with no TV, darts, and tons of seating indoor and outdoor.  This is not your new age place - come here to drink and to conversate.  Dogs welcome and parking tough in the lot but plenty along the street.  Overall I enjoyed myself and considering free WIFi I can  forget about the lack of TV.  For beer, this is on the short list in Austin.

reviews.author: Stan C.
reviews.description: A friend who lives in Washington State asked of this place was still around. I haven't been in forever so I told him I would stop by and take some pictures for him. Will have to come back for some brew and food!

reviews.author: Jessica N.
reviews.description: One of my favorite stops on my first visit to Austin! My friend and I chatted with the bartender, who helped us each chose our own flight of beers. We have very different tastes and were able to find four beers each that we absolutely loved. Lots of local options!   They also had a food truck outside, which provided some much-needed sustenance after our flight. We shared the falafel plate with fresh veggies, pita and hummus.   The back patio was a nice spot to relax in the evening air under a heat lamp. We moved inside for a cozier atmosphere once it got too chilly.

reviews.author: Samantha M.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this pub! Definitely an older crowd, but I'm sick of going to bars and seeing fresh 21 year olds drinking until they pass out; you'd never see this here. One of my favorite things about Austin is the craft beer scene and I love going here and getting whatever the bartender recommends. There's some sort of special or price reduction nearly every day, whether it's on IPAs, wings from the food truck, or all beverages. Even at full price, it's reasonable. Inside gets really crowded but parking is much better than other places I go. Would recommend it to any other beer lover!

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: A really good brewery with lots of drinks on tap. A fantastic atmosphere and a great place to meet a group of people. I came here for a  corporate Holiday party and we all had a great time with great drinks and beer. With lots on top from IPAs to Ciders and everything in between, you are sure to find something everyone can enjoy!

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Tuesday night at the Draught House, nothing like it!!!  $2 off everything and the available brews change periodically.  This is the time to try new things.  And after a few beers, go outside and try the S'rooms!

name: Bangers Sausage House and Beer Garden
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Hope F.
reviews.description: Legit the best Bavarian pretzel I've ever had. I'm still thinking about that airy, buttery goodness and the supremo cheese dipping sauce.  Service is excellent and great beer choices. I didn't immediately realize you can order flights, which is always a game changer for me.   Pro-tip: If you're not "eating", you can bypass the wait and go right into the bar... where you can also order a very large pretzel the size of your head. What else could a girl need?

reviews.author: Dave W.
reviews.description: Loved this place! Stopped in here for dinner after going to a bar on Rainey, and got quoted with a 20 minute wait that only ended up being 10.   Our waitress was super friendly and gave some good sausage recommendations. Don't need to add the fries next time though, they were average. The craft beer selection was endless - I was glad to be looking at the options on my phone instead of at the bar because there's so, so many tap handles!   There was live music for a chunk of the time we were there, and some friendly people around us.

reviews.author: Kristella P.
reviews.description: Living in Austin for three years, this is my favorite place to go when I'm back and where I recommend to take out of towers / visitors. The vibe is truly what Austin represents and is in the perfect location.  The beer garden has so many different beers on tap, especially the best local ones. I strongly recommend the Live Oak Hefeweizen. If you're in the mood, they are also famous for their Manmosas which are an entire champagne bottle mixed with Oj. Their food is also amazing too - I always get their jalapeño cheddar sausage. The giant pretzel and Mac and cheese are great as well!

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: Bangers is not only one of the biggest establishments on Rainey Street, but they also have one of the largest beer selections I have seen in one location. The large smokehouse out back provides an aromatic invite right off the street.  Living up to your name is easy for Bangers, they offer a very unique and impressive sausage menu, and if you're not a fan of sausage they have plenty of other options available. Although I did not try the vegetarian options, I was told they were phenomenal by some pretty picky vegetarians!  The sausages are absolutely excellent, they seem to love the garlic aioli here which I do now as well, ketchup isn't the only thing that belongs on a brat. The beer garden is plenty big for any size group and the staff are excellent hosts.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Nicole T.
reviews.description: TLDR; Beer selection 5/5, food 1/5  When you arrive on Rainey street, where Bangers is located, you'll see tons of bars, restaurants and food trucks! The street is really charming. Bangers was super packed at 2 PM on a Friday afternoon, so I was excited to try it. There are 2 options: Full menu and Light snacks/beer  During my first visit, we went with light snacks and beer. Snack selection included chips, pig skins, pretzels. Not much to choose from here. The beer selection however, was a large selection and we were really impressed! Each beer ranged from $5-10  During my second visit, we came back to try the food. It was quite disappointing and really heavy.
