The servers were great though CHARRED LETTUCE: Lettuce did not seem fresh, too much sauce LOADED FRIES: There are a few different options for the loaded fries, but all of their fries are thick cuts and very starchy  DUCK FIG HOT DOG: the sausage was piping hot when it got to our table. The fig and onion were on the top, but only enough to cover the middle of the hot dog. Sausage felt super heavy and my group of 2 couldn't finish it Would probably come again to grab a beer, but pass on the food

reviews.author: Cori G.
reviews.description: Great spot for large groups! The food is pretty good too, was accommodating for vegetarians and gluten free. Recommend starting with their fried pickles that come with ranch ... yum! I loved the veggie dog and make it into a salad, the green goddess dressing is really good too! Ask for their grain mustard and sauerkraut on the side. The server we had (shoutout carissa) was so friendly and helpful!

reviews.author: Taylor M.
reviews.description: You'd think that as big as Bangers expanded location is this place would be accomodating for groups.  Unfortunately over several attempts this year, I've found that not to be the case.  Most recently not only was the ability to split checks super reduced, the waitstaff was also unattentive, ingenuine, and borderline rude.    I've definitely also had positive experiences before their big expansion, but it seems clear that quantity is winning over quality at Bangers these days.

reviews.author: Kat W.
reviews.description: Huge venue with plenty of outdoor seating. Great beer list to find something everyone will like. Friendly staff. I might pass on the pretzel from the bar snacks menu next time. It was needed after a few beers but wasn't great. Spicy pickles were good.

reviews.author: Maricel J.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out and eat. Lots of beer, ciders selections to choose from on tap. All the staffs are nice and very welcoming. Good vibes, nice location on Rainey St.

reviews.author: Jane M.
reviews.description: Love this beer garden on Rainey Street in Austin. They have a hige outdoor beer garden and have plenty of indoor seating as well. They have a wide selection of beers on tap. You cannot go wrong with any selection based on your beer preferences. We tried the hefeweizen, blueberry ale and some belgian dark beer as well and loved it all. Would have loved to try their food cos it looked delicious but unfortunately we had a heavy lunch and had no room for food but just stopped by for beer. Highly recommend this place to hangout with friends and have a chill time.

reviews.author: Kristi M.
reviews.description: The hype is 10000% true: bangers BANGS!   The live music, the food, the service (shout out Derrick! He's the BEST!) 10/10  The new brunch menu is super good. The cinnamon roll could seriously feed 4. It's huge. The smokehouse fries are delish, there is brisket on top that is to die for.

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Came here for a Sunday Funday. We were told that the wait would be an hour so we walked around Rainey and into other bars. The wait was only about 30 minutes so we came back, prepped and ready to chug some Manmosas.   Yes - the manmosa is strong. I don't think I would ever be able to finish a whole thing by myself. But I do love a good challenge.   We ordered a pretzel too. U know, to soak everything up. It was definitely a step up from Auntie Anne's, which is basically the only pretzel I've never had before this one! Banger's was soft and pillow-y. I guess I've now experienced what a real pretzel is, and I don't think I can ever go back to mall pretzels again.   I'll definitely be back with more pals. Maybe to try their sausages next time!

reviews.author: KC C.
reviews.description: Good beer (lots on tap), sausage and pretzel, but a little too busy for my taste.    This place is very lively with a band.  If i was young and single, and it wasn't during a pandemic, it'd be a great place to hang.    As busy as it was, service was great.    Seating indoors is self serve and you can order snacks (pretzel) but not food (sausage).   We sat inside while waiting for our table outside; that took about 20 minutes.  Once outside, as busy as it is, a wait staff will swing by to get your order.    Have to say I'm not a sausage person but theirs was good.  We had the Chinese bbq sausage and it was delish.

reviews.author: CJ M.
reviews.description: Nothing but positive things to say about this venue. Huge spot with multiple ways to dine or drink. From a porch to patio or a typical inside dining experience. The music staff and views were more than pleasant. Actually went twice on our trip! Too good to only go once!

reviews.author: Blake J.
reviews.description: Don't order the eggs Benedict. 5 people from our group ordered it and every single persons eggs weren't runny at all. I'd recommend the chicken apple sausage and the pretzel. The pretzel was so delicious.

reviews.author: Tamara B.
reviews.description: The vegan option was good! I will return for that along with the awesome ginger beer. I also tried the Mac and cheese without the bacon and liked it! Lovely lil place

reviews.author: Ashley E.
reviews.description: This was a cute little beer garden off Rainey street. It is huge so great for parties of all sizes. They have servers, but you can also order at any of the walk up bar areas.   The food was average. Tried several items and they all were just ok. The brussel sprouts and salad were very good, but I didn't feel anything was amazing. But if you're looking for more of a vibe and don't have high expectations for food, this is probably the perfect place. I will say, that they are apparently known for all their sausages/meats, which I did not have so that may have knocked them up a star if I did try those (so, sorry for anyone reading who is a sausage fan here and disappointed I didn't try any since it's a staple)!  They have music, but assuming they also host live music as well, just not the night I was there.  The staff and service was just ok. The wait was long, but it was on a Saturday and they don't take reservations, which was expected and was fine as we popped over to another place and had a drink while we waited. I feel like the service could have been a little better and a few more smiles from the staff wouldn't have hurt.   I don't live in Austin, so I'm not sure I'll be back or I should say it's not at the top of my list when I return, but I wouldn't not recommend it. If you're looking for a German beer garden with a good selection of beer and authentic food, this is probably the place for you!

reviews.author: Prasiddha H.
reviews.description: Had a chance to finally try out Banger's after hearing about it for so long from my friend. It was also my first time visiting and I got a chance to go with her which was awesome! We got there around 7ish and since it was Monday we were able to be seated pretty quickly. Once we sat down I ended up ordering:  *Poutine fries - these came with cheese curds and gravy - altogether the flavors were bomb! I would get these - just wish the gravy had a stronger flavor  *jalapeno cheddar brat - this was really yummy and came with topping of mustard and grilled jalapenos. The sausage was super fresh and the flavors all went really well together  *beer - got this coconut flavored one and this was bomb!!  Overall, really enjoyed the vibe, the warm breeze and the lights. I would recommend one to try this place out!

reviews.author: Khambay S.
reviews.description: My first time at Banger's and had the worst experience. I had placed an order at 4:45pm and waited until 5:30pm my order never came.  One of the worse place to eat. Will be first and last time at this place.

reviews.author: Michelle T.
reviews.description: One of my favorite spots on Rainey Street. Bangers is a fun beer garden, perfect for a relax vibe. They have so many beers and ciders on tap, but they are known for the "manmosa" which is a pitcher of champagne (literally a whole bottle of champagne) and a dash of orange juice. They only allow 1 per person and make you order a snack with it! The options are pickles, pretzels, etc. The pretzels are my favorite. They were soft and so flavorful, not too salty, and comes with mustard. Perfect for sharing. The sausages are quite good as well!   Just be aware that it is PACKED on the weekends, especially Sunday.  I don't live in Austin anymore, but I'll make sure to come back when I do visit!

reviews.author: Sam M.
reviews.description: One of my favorite restaurants in Downtown Austin.  They don't take reservations, but thankfully we were seated right away.  We sat out in the patio area in the back, in which they had the fires lighting.  Ordered the Chicken and Waffles and the Chicken Fried Steak. Food was delicious and portion sizes are huge! I was a hungry boy going in, but definitely needed a doggy bag for this one.  Simply the best Southern Comfort food in Austin. Can't wait to visit again!

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: Let me just share how fresh the food was. I ordered an amazing salad and added a few extra items to set it off.  I believe my friend ordered a steak with grits and I wanted to take his plate as well as mine.    The service was amazing and the atmosphere is on point. I will be returning even if it's a 48 ago but the experience is quite intense and is great for any type of meet up for business and personal.

reviews.author: Lucky N.
reviews.description: Called on Thursday 5:30pm and there was no wait for the patio so the hostess told me to come in. I was there 15 min later and another hostess (didn't get her name but she had a boy cut haircut) told me there's a 30 min wait. When I told her the waitress who answered my call said there was no wait, she then lectured me twice that I should have made reservations. Thought that was rude (before this, I've only ever thought Austinites were super sweet) - my first time here and the waitress on the phone didn't mention I should make a reservation twice. Shouldn't need to be lectured at the host stand and again when seated. Luckily another person came by and said we could be seated right away and luckily, the rest of the experience was fine.   We ordered the chicken fried steak and jalapeño hanger steak. From the photos, I didn't realize how ginormous the chicken fried steak was! It's the size of my forearm and can easily feed 3-4 people. It was my first time eating chicken fried steak and it wasn't bad. I'm not a friend food type girl but it was decent. I could only do a few bites as it was heavy. The jalapeño hanger steak was right up my alley. You have to eat it with the jalapeño; it's the perfect combo. I only wish they gave 2 jalapeños. The mashed potatoes also went perfectly! The popcorn, cornbread and drinks were also good. The Old Fashioned was smooth and the pink drink wasn't too sweet.  The waiter was much more pleasant than that hostess and the ambiance outside was lovely. I love that it's dog friendly and my dog was allowed to sit in my lap at the table (some places only allow dogs on the floor but my dog is a lap dog). They also brought a dog bowl. Overall really like it here and would come back and recommend!

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: New Year's Day, came for lunch. We waited for about 30 minutes, but they have a bar in the back while you wait. It was walking distance from our hotel on Third Street.  We got seated at the patio outside for a party of 5, and they adjusted the shade for us since the sun was in our face.   The service was okay, the food was pretty good. The size of that chicken friend steak was definitely Texas size! The cocktails were delicious. We even got a flight of moonshines, but that was a bit hard to drink. It was way to sweet for me personally.   Overall: Cleanliness: 8/10 Food: 8/10 Service: 7/10

reviews.author: Ria G.
reviews.description: Visiting Austin and decided to check this place out for some wonderful Southern food. Everything we ordered for brunch was extremely tasty and flavorful.   If you're looking for something on the lighter side, go for the Migas. Both the Beyond Veggie Burger and Backyard Chicken Sandwich hit the spot as well. They even accommodated my friend's request to switch the bread to a biscuit. The sauce that comes with the Sweet Potato Tater Tots is phenomenal.   They have great heated outdoor seating (tent style), wonderful servers, and generally a great atmosphere!

reviews.author: Brian B.
reviews.description: On a trip to Austin, we came across Moonshine and really enjoyed our dinner here.  We started with the pretzel sticks and pimento cheese as our appetizer - so good! The pimento was very flavorful and the pretzel sticks were baked to PERFECTION.  For my entree I had one of their fried chicken sandwiches. The chicken patty was very thin compared to most fried chicken sandwiches I've had, but the flavor was still there in every bite. The accompanying fries were yummy as well!  NOTE: on Mondays they have 50% off wine bottles. Just in case that's useful for you ;)

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: This restaurant just kind of pulls you in from the street. Being one of the oldest buildings in Austin, this place is obviously well known, and we were lucky to get in.   The atmosphere inside the restaurant just emanates southern charm and the menu offers some excellent southern comfort food entrees. Any time I find an appetizer not normally seen on a menu, I have to try it, and in this case, it was the deviled eggs.   I typically don't have the courage to try anyone else's deviled eggs because I am very picky when it comes to those, so I swore they better be good and they were very good. They were creamy, flavorful and had no pesky surprises like celery or relish.  One thing I never thought I would eat for dinner is chicken and waffles and being in Austin I decided I had to try. I was impressed with the seasoning of the chicken and the light breading. The waffles were fluffy, they came with plenty of butter and syrup. This entree was the epitome of sweet and salty, and a little bit spicy.  The staff are great, the drinks are great, and the atmosphere is alive. Cheers!

reviews.author: Cal G.
reviews.description: When all the other places to eat were closed on a Monday night. Moonshine was open and bustling.   The shrimp and grits were great. The baguette was stiff and dry.   The beer and bourbon selection is wide and very good.   We had the Pearl Snap Pilsner and the Convoxt Hill Stout.   The devil eggs were beautiful but the egg white had tight flesh. Was either over cooked or too long in the fridge. But we did arrive for dinner after 9pm.   The cobbler dessert looks great. But did not order it. Just admired from afar.   Excellent decor and ambiance in one of the oldest buildings in Austin.

reviews.author: Corrie S.
reviews.description: A fun spot for breakfast, brunch or lunch!  The first thing I'll say...GET THERE AS ITS OPENING. We showed up a few minutes before it opened and had a 15 min wait! Had we gotten there later, I think we'd have had to wait quite a while. Its flooded with customers on the weekend! Curious what it would be like during the week? ‍  Service was wonderful! Our waiter was fun, knowledgeable and attentive! I think that was the case across the staff. They take the service seriously!   The food is decadent! It's heaping portions with a southern flare. I got the green chili hash that was pretty good. My favorite part of the meal was the biscuits we ordered as an appetizer. Delicious!   This is a great spot! My friends and I enjoyed it! The menu is pretty straightforward. You'll walk away full of yummy food.

reviews.author: Alexa F.
reviews.description: Love their popcorn- has really good spice. Had the pretzel w pimento appetizer and it was really good. Had the hoss hot chicken sandwich which I loved but it wasn't actually spicy. Yum!

reviews.author: Amy O.
reviews.description: Moonshine was conveniently located near our hotel. Cocktails were great. Fried calamari was really good and save d the meal. I was looking forward to the fried green tomatoes and devil eggs but was unfortunately disappointed. We couldn't finish either items. The shrimp corn dog was good but the mustard sauce didn't seem to go well with the shrimp. The chicken fried steak was good but a little tough in texture.   I would like to give kudos to the staff! They were extremely friendly, attentive and hospitable. They did an excellent job!!

reviews.author: Mary L.
reviews.description: I hadn't been to Moonshine since before COVID, but am glad to report they are as good as ever.   By the reaction I got from our waitress when I asked, I'm not the only one who misses their legendary Sunday buffet, but apparently it will be back when things settles down, contagion-wise.  I cried a little when my Irish Coffee arrived with no whipped cream on top, but it had Jameson and Bailey's, so it would be churlish of me to complain. And the complimentary popcorn made up for a lot.  My companion was not crazy about her entree, Creole Crawfish and Grits. She was hoping for something along the lines of Shrimp and Grits, but instead got some grits swamped by a sort of stew that had more ham than crawfish. She's one of these incredibly polite people who won't send a dish back to the kitchen for anything less than serious culinary malpractice, so she just picked at it and left most of it.  I was delighted with my choice. The Chicken and Waffles were about the best I've had. The waffles were amazing, as was the chicken, and there was way more than I could eat--and believe me, I can eat!  The dessert my friend ordered made up for any disappointment in her entree. The Peanut Butter Mousse Pie was world-historic, as far as I could tell from the bites I was allowed. And it was huge--most of it went home with her.  The service was excellent, the prices fair, and we even found street parking.

reviews.author: Sandy B.
reviews.description: Got here at 1750 on a Thursday night.  Happy hour ends at 1800.  This place is already packed.  And there are multiple layers and areas to it.  30-45 minute expected wait for a table for 2.  That was about spot on.   Once we were sat, Charlie, the waiter showed up with our waters and a great attitude!   He offered suggestions with details.  I do believe we had to have ordered the two best meals they serve.  The horseradish crusted salmon and hanger steak.   You can't go wrong.     They have a great selection of high end bourbons.  Highly recommend trying the moonshine flight, too.

reviews.author: Ashleigh J.
reviews.description: Moonshine was a great experience all around. We were able to sit quickly. The atmosphere was nice and was a great place to take friends from out of town.   They had a good selection of appetizers and food, all of which sounded delicious. We ended up getting the pretzel, fried green tomatoes and roasted garlic as appetizers. The fried green tomatoes were delicious and I would recommend to anyone!  I ended up getting the club sandwich and it had so much flavor, the bacon jam on it really took it to another level. Portions were good size and each item our table ordered tasted great.

reviews.author: Melody C.
reviews.description: Service was professional, friendly, and welcoming!! Atmosphere was relaxed and clean, yet homey vibes!! Food was delicious and the waiters were very knowledgeable of menu selections which helped when selecting entrees!

reviews.author: Lorrie W.
reviews.description: We recently hosted a rehearsal dinner for 35 on one of the patios and it literally could not have been better. From the event coordinator to the waitstaff, to the food, to the atmosphere, we are 100% satisfied customers. Thank you, Devon, and everyone else, from the kitchen staff to the waiters to the hosts to the owners that made our experience memorable, excellent and meaningful!

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: 10-28-21  Quality/Quantity - Great Happy hour. We ate so much we had to take leftovers to-go. Free popcorn - excess butter and salt, just the way I like it. It also opens up the liquid appetite (beer!!!). Lone Star Beer - refreshing, especially on a hot day Brussel Sprouts - not as crispy as I would have preferred, but the family liked it Fried Green Tomato - not bad, but once you had Lucille's Fried Green Tomato, others are hard to compare. Cathead Biscuits = 6 stars!! This was a hit. Very generous portions, hence we had to take our entrees to-go. The flavor, especially with the butter and honey, took it over the top. Seared Rainbow Trout - Good, but we were so full that we could not enjoy it, no fault of theirs. They also have a Sunday Brunch.  Atmosphere - Both indoor and outdoor dining. There seemed to have more outdoor dining than indoor...? It looked like they had a private event in the back. Men's urinal was broken, and amazingly there was NOT a line for the one toilet for the Men's restroom. Valet parking is offered for $12 by Austin Valet Parking LLC.  Be careful of where you park in this area, sadly there was lots of car vandalism.  Service - All team members were working hard and offered good service. Hannah took care of us, but the "busboy" took service to the next level. He even talked to us while we were waiting in the lobby before being assigned to our table and gave selling suggestions.  Price - If we did not order our entree, then this happy hour dinner would have qualified under one of our "best inexpensive meals".  Owner Suggestion - Please keep your restrooms in top condition. Or, post signs if you have restrooms in other locations in the restaurant. Other than that, great job, especially with your happy hour menu.

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: We stayed at the Fairmont which was very close to Moonshine. We ate breakfast, lunch and dinner here throughout the trip. The food was good and the people were friendly. We enjoyed the drinks and beer as well. The back bar was cute and offered extra room when it was busy.

reviews.author: Mark B.
reviews.description: Moonshine is a great place for brunch, or any meal, as the menu is solid and the service is on point.  Looking for a quick bite to eat before heading out of town (to return home) we arrived at Moonshine early and did not have any lines to deal with. In fact, we were seated immediately and began to peruse the menu.  It was early, so we passed on drinks (though their whiskey list was well populated and the "little brown book", available upon request, certainly peaks a whiskey hound's interest). Ultimately we decided on a couple sandwiches and placed our order with our friendly waiter.  He returned with our drinks and a basket of DELICIOUS spicy popcorn! What an appetizer! I polished off the entire basket without hesitation and it was everything I could have hoped for and more.  Our meals arrived shortly thereafter and we dug in. Everything was very well prepared and tasty. Personally, I had the Sunday House Club and loved it. One point of recommendation though: go without the bacon jam as I found it to only serve to diminish the flavor of the pimento cheese and make the sandwich more messy overall.  As previously mentioned, the service was great. Our waiter and the bus boys were there exactly when we needed them and we were in and out in no time flat. What a great cherry on top of the experience.  Moonshine can get rather busy as the day progresses so I suggest you arrive early and enjoy the food, service, and ambiance. While we didn't check out the patio it looked and sounded very inviting. This place really serves the entire package and you won't be disappointed in your visit.

reviews.author: Amy A.
reviews.description: I would put this place closer to a 3.5, but I can't quite give it 4 stars. They don't take reservations and we were a larger party. By the time we arrived, the wait was 45-60 minutes. We anticipated that and a table opened up in the bar area, so we order a few appetizers and drinks. The bartender got very flustered with us and at one point just walked away mid-order. Being a large group primarily from the northeast, maybe our personalities didn't jive. We did recover, but it was off putting since that was our first interaction with the restaurant.   The biscuits were a hit with the group. The pretzel was ok. We were seated a little over 90 minutes later. By that point I wasn't super hungry, but I ordered the harvest bowl with chicken. Overall, I found it dry. We did sit outside which was really nice as the night was perfect for outdoor dining. Our server was really good and was on top of everything.

reviews.author: Holmes O.
reviews.description: Madison ... Madison... Madison! She was absolutely wonderful today. Welcoming.. knowledgeable and provided an amazing customer experience today. Can't wait to see you guys soon!   - Holmes

reviews.author: Michael A.
reviews.description: Industry leading!  Well I was finally able to get to San Marcos and got to walk around the square. In doing so I found several bars and coffee shops which was great! The bars were still pretty empty being that it was only 3pm and I needed human interaction! That was when I found Industry. It's no secret that Industry is great, based on their reviews and I was happy to have found it to be so close. For me, there were 3 things that really separated Industry. The first being my bartender, Madison. She did an outstanding job making sure I felt welcomed and was quick to present water in which I especially appreciated given the heat. She knew the beer menu and gave me a few recommendations, eventually nailing it with a beer called Easy Rider. I recommend it if you're into a craft blonde ale. I also ordered a dirty martini  and ask her if she would make it the way she usually does, which turned out great. She used Botanist Gin which was perfecto with just the right amount of floral. Thanks Madison for the solid recommendations and the hospitality. Very much obliged. I ordered the Brussel sprouts, of course, which were cooked perfectly and had a wonderful (light) mustard finish. My only complaint was the size of the sprouts, not to be confused with the portion size, which was more than enough for one person. I just figured it had something to do with the season and happily ate up. I was 3 for 3 and couldn't have left happier.  Industry is a really cool, upbeat spot and I will most definitely be back when I get the chance. They are dog friendly, too, with water bowls and treats in the patio area.   Highly recommend!!  Sincerely,  MLA

reviews.author: Heather R.
reviews.description: TLDR a-ok to I'm a fan despite some bumps  My first time ordering for pickup. Everything was delicious, it was ready at the time promised. The big flaw was I didn't get the beer battered squash I ordered and paid for, but as Mr R didn't check the bag before leaving we cannot lay that all on them. It was a very busy night and mistakes happen.  The other error was I didn't get the 30% off to-go booze still advertised on their online menu which is why this isn't 5*  Mr R is besotted with their black bean veggie burger. I think there must be spice in the patty as none of the other listed ingredients explain its lovely low heat. He also likes the texture of the bean patty, he wanted me to mention that.  The salmon burger was good, huge, nice fresh veg, I love the spice in the aioli and poblano ranch, but I REALLY wish they still did the smoked salmon bagel I had one brunch there long ago.  The farm beet salad? Gorgeous. Mr R gleefully ate most of it on his own and he often eats salads with a sense of duty rather than joy. I loved the white balsamic vinaigrette it came with, I'm going to need that more often in my life.  The drinks to go? Hooray! One note, bring your own standard brown pulp drink tray if you think you'll need one because they didn't provide one. The pours were fabulous on our mimosas, The Closer and White Box. Ice was the perfect amount.  The transaction could have gone smoother, but the meal went down great. This remains a place Mr R wants to go *every* time he's in town.

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: This place sucks! It's not satisfying nor flavorful. The chili is like soup no meat or anything in it! Yea it may look good but it's not.

reviews.author: Catherine I.
reviews.description: The Moscow mule was amazing!! So I'm new to exploring San Marcos and I looked up most reviewed or topped reviewed. I am not disappointed. This place is great!

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: Upon entering, I was immediately awestruck by the warm and inviting aesthetic. After this feast of the eyes, my ears were next to hop on the joyride as I was serenaded with a playlist that felt as if it were compiled to induce the ultimate feeling of joyous nostalgia. Then I sat down, had an outstandingly healthy and delicious everything bowl that went extremely well with the excellent recommendation of Pilsner made by the kind and knowledgeable staff. The owner clearly takes pride in the experience and it shows. 5 stars might not be sufficient, I wish I had the ability to allot additional stars. Bravo

reviews.author: Lanette T.
reviews.description: It's for sure a god size. The flavor was alright. The workers were nice when I was there.

reviews.author: Kuracha B.
reviews.description: My first time and the pancakes really really bad!!! everythings burnt! its not even edible. i asked the server and she made me look like im the one at fault tir not letting her know. seriously!!!

reviews.author: Taylor B.
reviews.description: We came down from Dallas and made industry our 1st-night-in-town place for drinks and dinner. We had an awesome time with Thor as our bartender last time we were in town. He was there this time and we got to say hi again. We sat at the bar and Raina took great care of us! We tried 2 lagers from different TX breweries and had some great shots. I could not decide among 3 choices for dinner, so I let her pick and surprise me. She chose the al pastor tacos. They were delicious! We are only staying in San Marcos 4 days and are already planning to go back for dinner on Monday! Ps if you are a whiskey drinker, try this! It was so smooth!

reviews.author: Gem T.
reviews.description: This must be a very popular place. Came in for Sunday brunch and it was packed! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The $11  mimosa carafe special immediately got my attention. I knew I had to have that. Found us a booth on the left corner by the bar. Ordered the mimosa, 2 industry burgers, Parmesan fries and the tater tot casserole. The mimosa was disappointingly room temperature. The burgers were bordering on salty but were good. We especially liked the chips and salsa that came with it. The fries were good but a little expensive for what you get. The tater tot casserole , we didn't like at all. Very salty and the hot sauce did not go with the dish at all. Don't think we'll come back.

reviews.author: Fletcher R.
reviews.description: One of the worst restaurant experiences in a while. Saturday lunch where we literally waited over an hour from ordering food to food on our table and the food I got not only had a sticker on the fries, but the BBQ sandwich was dry and inedible. I've now been here twice and never been happy with the food. I won't be back.

reviews.author: Leslie C.
reviews.description: There were mixed reviews...the adults loved their food! We had the CFC w queso - gave it two thumbs up!! We also had the chicken tacos and the person who had those raves about how good they were! We also had the queso, salsa, fried squash, loaded fries and Brussel sprouts for appetizer and all were a huge hit!! Most of the teenagers had the burgers and did not like them. They said they tasted like sausage. I think the issue is the burgers were very, very lean and smoked so they were a little dry.  The BIGGEST COMPLAINT were the flies...OMG!!! So freaking annoying to have to constantly be waving your hand back and forth so a darn fly does not land on your food!! Do something about that bc we would never come back solely for that purpose!

reviews.author: Bri W.
reviews.description: We have gone to Industry probably about 5 times now and we are never disappointed. I love the unique but healthy food options which sometimes seems hard to find. Prices are totally reasonable and we will keep coming back!

reviews.author: Lindsey S.
reviews.description: I can't believe i haven't reviewed this place yet. its one of my favorite splurge restaurant as a broke  21yr old in san marcos! Brunch is amazing, honestly i feel that no matter what you get you cant go wrong. I LOVE their Parmesan fries and their CFC with queso. Those boozy milkshakes are small but yes, boozy such as the rest of their alcoholic beverages. The industry burger and brisket tacos are also so amazing.

reviews.author: Melyn G.
reviews.description: A farm to table concept convenient for those living in the area..ingredients are sourced locally. which is great for supporting our small  farmers. Masks are being worn by staff and limited capacity allows for social distancing.  There is patio dining however being right off the street with cars passing by frequently Tonight's food was good..Delicious smoked chicken thigh then fried much like a chicken fried chicken..Boy that smoke came through so well. Not a gargantuan serving like a chicken breast but nonetheless yummy.  The Reuben was great-toasty and melty...love Kraut so I would've doubled up. Cool college vibes and can see how this place might pack it in easily on any night of the week

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: This place was very trendy! I actually liked it it has the college vibe too it, of course Texas State is very close, the food was great and San Marcos grew on me after this visit looking forward to coming back.

reviews.author: Nancy B.
reviews.description: My first time here and I love it! The food was delicious and reasonably priced. My boyfriend and I definitely had left overs. My favorite was definitely the sweet benny and chili cheese fries. I'm not usually a chili cheese fry fan but this chili is legitimately so delicious with chunks of brisket in it! The biscuit and jam combo is delcious but it was definitely more suited for 3 to 4 people instead of 2 with other dishes ordered. In hindsight, ordering 2 types of fried potatoes was probably over kill but still delicious none the less. I didn't try the half off mimosas but for sure next time, I'll definitely be getting a cocktail to try!   The staff was super friendly and great at getting our food out in a timely manner. The vibe out there was perfect and a lot of fun with the live music!  They seemed very on top of the cleaning and everyone wore masks when standing.

reviews.author: Magen D.
reviews.description: Industry is such a cute spot! You can really taste the freshness in the food. It's particularly a great spot right now because of its expansive outdoor seating.  This is a place that has something for everyone! The sweet potato fries are my fave.   Bathrooms are clean, staff were friendly, and they followed Covid guidelines for spacing. Will deff be coming back here!

reviews.author: Tim R.
reviews.description: This place is a can't miss, particularly when it comes to the really excellent food.  We ordered the okra, some sweet potato fries and smoked chicken tacos.  In spite of the fact that the kitchen was unexpectedly slammed today, the food was incredible.  I cannot overstate how good everything was and the value was terrific.  Also, since we sat at the bar, we watched Tiffany in full "go-time" mode.  She was professional and personable; making it look easy to provide drinks for a whole bar/restaurant single-handedly.  Although the process was apparently moving slower than normal, the interactions with her made it much more tolerable and it was a lot of fun talking to her.  We will definitely return.

reviews.author: Giselle P.
reviews.description: Amazing food and atmosphere. The live music and ping pong tables added to the experience.

reviews.author: Nickie B.
reviews.description: Cha cha cha cha Changes!!!!  EPBG has made a HUGE change to the menu and quality of ingredients!  #NewChef #GoodFood #NewBrunchSpot #TheNewOasis  A friend wanted me to go to Brunch and said I could pick the place.  I wanted to go somewhere new and saw that EPBG had a great menu for Brunch.  I had recently heard that the food was good now, so why not give them a try?  You know it is difficult to find a great brunch spot, not to mention one without an hour wait or more.  I ordered the Hippie Scramble and was very pleased.  For $14 the dish came with fresh spinach, wild mushrooms (not some cheap white mushrooms), heirloom tomatoes (that tasted like they just came off the vine and red onions.  The dish was topped off with homemade Hollandaise and Goat Cheese.  I told the Chef multiple times that I was in love with his goat cheese.  OMG I think I could have eaten a plate of that alone.  My friend had the Crab Cake Benedict, and I must say that too was delicious.  Tasted like fresh crab (it was not Krab) and the portion was too large to finish.  The fresh dill on top complimented the dish nicely.  Special shout out for the high-end paper plates.  Seriously, they were so nice that from a far they looked like real dishes.  I will definitely be back to try out more dishes on their new menu, enjoy the live music, libations from the bar and take in the phenomenal view.

reviews.author: Nikkita F.
reviews.description: This is a good spot if you're trying to grab a bite or drink close to Just For Fun or the Emerald Point Bar and Grill! The food is pretty basic bar food but good when you're coming off a boat. They have Great Lake Travis views as well!

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: NEVER AGAIN! So sad and sickened at the same time. We need more places on Lake Travis and EPBG is such an iconic spot, BUT they have not/are not properly handling the COVID-19 pandemic. They have taken very few measures to keep their staff and patrons safe from possible infection (sure, I'll take a little hand sanitizer).   As an area resident, I've visited EPBG (and every other name it ever had since Carlos n Charlie's closed) many many times. I want the property to be open and thrive, but not with an owner who apparently places little value on human life. Plus, to be completely honest the food is barely above par (wings ok) and the drinks are $$$! $7 for a CAN of Infamous that I can buy a 6-pack of for $10 two minutes away directly from the brewery. I get, lake prices...look at comps though. Speaking of drinks... color me intrigued that EPBG is labeled as a "restaurant" (i.e., more than 51% food sales). Anyone else ever been the weekend drunk fests? I have. Hmm...literal food for thought. Shame on you Barrett Branam!

reviews.author: Stacy L.
reviews.description: Management is absolutely awful. Overheard him tell his manager to only hire pretty girls so that the local married men have a place to come and look and spend money and they don't want to stare at "dikes".... Unbelievable.  Also, do not use your credit card here.  They triple charge and run your card no less than three times thinking you want look at your bank statements. We have been overcharged so many times it's criminal at this point.  Go anywhere but here!

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: On Sunday, October 27th, I came here with a few of my Yelp peeps after an unofficial Yelp get together we had.   *Note this will most likely be one of my most underwhelming reviews ever (I have very few pictures and I only have our drizzank receipt and I didn't even check-in...dag nab it) as I was really just taking in the scenery when we were there as opposed to focusing on making Yelp a better place!   We ordered a few items to include loaded queso and the double cheeseburger.   The Cheezborger! Cheezborger! You want doublecheez?!?Who's next!?!" -SNL  The quality of an establishment's cheeseburger often tends to be a good indicator of the quality of the food in the establishment, especially if that establishment that tends to have a limited menu which highlights the burgers such as this one. My double cheeseburger was outstanding. It was freshly grilled and the charbroiled smokiness  could be tasted throughout the burger.   The view:  As far as this locations view was concerned, it was simply breathtaking at dusk. If you are in the area on a cool Sunday afternoon, there are very few consumers here and you are sure to get an exquisite shot of the sunset. Even if you don't come here for the food, come here for a relaxing time with some friends, you won't regret it!

reviews.author: Britt J.
reviews.description: If anyone knows Catfish.....it's not Emerald Point Bar and Grill.  It's a new endeavour in a tried and true location so being in the hood we wanted to give it a chance and try the food.....pfffft!  We looked at the menu and most prices were average.  I knew goin into to this that the Catfish Basket was $15.  That almost twice what some other places charge.  So the catfish was something out of this world......in a bad way!!!  The filets, if you want to call them that were not recognizable and they were as thin as a quarter.....yes, a 25c piece, kinda leathery and shouldn't be served as food.    That's a typical drinking straw in the photo.  Real catfish filets are 1/2" to 1" thick.  So sad that this place may not make it through the summer.....definitely won't make it through the next drought.

reviews.author: Elsa C.
reviews.description: I love going to this place, it has great views and great place to have drinks. I'm not too sure about most of their food, except for the wings. I really didn't like the wings here, they are a little different from the traditional ones. Other things I liked was that they have live bands on the weekends!

reviews.author: Khristina P.
reviews.description: Super fun time there for the weekend!  Live music, great drinks and awesome views of Lake Travis!!  Totally love every time I visit!!

reviews.author: Yan C.
reviews.description: Great spot to relax and unwind. Lots of boats chillin around parked in marina ! Good fast food service, poke bowls are amazing. Lots of fun on lake. Good bar/food at right spot and fast easy service. Don't even need to wear mask!

reviews.author: Josh H.
reviews.description: Paying $7 for a can of beer is ridiculous. But the views and convenience can make up for it, kinda.   On the other hand, the food is brutal. Not a very big menu, and the majority of it tastes like a lunchroom from 6th grade. Oh and let's not forget, just about everything on the menu will run you at least $15.   Besides the views and TVs, this place is meh.

reviews.author: Torey T.
reviews.description: Good drinks, great food, and fun music! Huge portions so we split and still had tons left!   We will be back!

reviews.author: Elizabeth Y.
reviews.description: We like to try different restaurants on the lake and were nearby so decided to give it a shot. Bad idea. First, the view really isn't that great especially compared to other establishments on the lake. Second, drinks are pricey. $7 for a bottle of corona and $7 for a Truly is pretty high. Finally, my meal was just awful. I got a Texas Cobb that was missing blue cheese, avocado, and croutons when it came out. It maybe had 1/4 slice of bacon on it and that's being generous. The cucumbers were old and soggy so didn't get eaten.  One very small egg and few bites of weird looking chicken were hardly filling. At $14 this salad was an enormous disappointment. We definitely won't be going back.

reviews.author: Sandee H.
reviews.description: Glad this place was open...but they botched my order after the ticket was tossed out.

reviews.author: Maureen M.
reviews.description: Great bar area but the lower part by the band smells like trash and vomit.  Sorry but you need to hose it down.:)

reviews.author: Stephanie M.
reviews.description: Bartender with dark hair pony tail and a hat on is easily the most unfriendly and i inviting person i have ever met.

reviews.author: A M.
reviews.description: Fun lake side restaurant with bar food.  Don't expect anything but fried and unhealthy food.

reviews.author: Miranda S.
reviews.description: Everyone here makes me mildly uncomfortable. From the ersatz chili to the guy who popped his top off with the leatherback necklace, this wouldn't be "Emerald point bar and grill without the patrons. The moment you walk in, you can take a deep breath of Indiana tobacco vape and sour cream. The "pop your top off" vibe runs rampant, taking each patron by storm. Don't wanna pop your top? Scissors available for a sleeveless option. There is no third option. Can confirm vanilla ice has been here; if you know, you know.

reviews.author: Jil P.
reviews.description: We regularly would come here after a day on the lake for a bite to eat before the drive home. Always enjoyed the poke bowls, tacos and salads. We went Saturday and there was a new menu (no more of most of our favorites) but tried it out. We ordered two pizzas, a burger with fries and the stacked Cobb salad. None of it was good. The pizzas were undercooked and greasy and for the price of $18, highly disappointing. The Cobb salad had a nice presentation and toppings but lacked lettuce. There was no crunch at all. The burger was an improvement from the previous menu but the fries weren't done. You could tell they were undercooked. We won't waste our money on food here again and are super disappointed in the changes made. Bummer for Lake Travis boaters!

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: Mixed feelings for sure. The bad: Twice they've had the wrong band posted on their site AND their Facebook. When you make a 30 minute drive for the music, it's pretty disappointing to find out it's wrong. The food was mediocre. The good: It's hard to beat the view... Sunset over the lake is magical. Bartender Jena is AWESOME. She's smart, sassy, and has great customer service. I wish she'd been there the second time we went back... That might've made up for the music snafu.  I'm not sure we will be back... Maybe if it's a band we want to see, we will call and talk to a manager to make sure.

reviews.author: Jayne D.
reviews.description: No thanks! Two bloody Mary's and a non friendly bartender $40. No paper menus or drink menu. Bartender on the phone! No hello, no goodbye thanks! Bartender could go around tables and ask how people are doing!

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: The Blur is excellent. The food truck serves a mean fish sandwich and cole slaw. The place has plenty of parking and outdoor seating. It was a little chilly so we sat inside. Felt like we were outside with high ceilings and good air flow. Excellent acoustics so we could hear the conversation at the table. Staff was friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Came in this past weekend to celebrate the weekend with my friend at Circle Brewing.  I love their beers and have had them at bars and restaurants around town but had never been to the brewery until this past weekend.   Circle Brewing had easy parking as soon as we pulled up even on an Austin FC Saturday game day. It was pleasant to not have to figure out where to park when they have their own parking lot with plenty of space.   Easy ordering but hard decisions to make on what pitcher of beer we were wanting to try. We noticed they have Austin FC game specials that includes their Austin Anthem draft for $18 a pitcher which is a great deal! I also saw signage on the tables that indicated 1/2 pints during the Austin FC games. Double check that is right because it almost sounds too good to be true, right? I even saw a green cup special going on - ask the bartender what they have on special just to be sure.  They have a lovely and large screen set up right in the middle of their taproom to watch any games including those Austin FC games. They have a couple of tv's as well located above the bar to keep your gaze on during any game not just Austin FC.    If you are coming in the summer especially day time be sure to wear loose clothing and/or be ready to sweat. Even at the bar top with the fans going we came out of here sweaty which is typical anywhere you are during Texas summers. Just want to give you a heads up!  Huckleberry is the food truck that slings all sorts of seafood and burgers (surf and turf!) with some easy ordering from inside the brewery.  We didn't get a chance to try out their food as we ended up brewery hopping around right after we had our pitcher of Blur (hefe) at Circle.  This may be the closest brewery to the stadium (?) but if not it sure looks like it as you can see the Austin FC stadium right from their parking lot.  Excited to come back when I am headed to a game and/or in the area as Circle Brewing beers are divine!

reviews.author: Sasa S.
reviews.description: This brewery had a nice indoor-outdoor atmosphere. We were a bit divided on how we felt about the beers themselves. Some in our group loved certain beers, including some of the lighter bodied and hoppier beers. Others in our group liked the beers but didn't find any favorites from among the fight. Overall it was a nice experience - perhaps not our favorite stop on the brewery tour- but one worth going to again.

reviews.author: Christa S.
reviews.description: I've been here for a Sunday funday and more recently did the 2021 Cookies and Craft Brews at-home virtual tasting with Circle Brewing Beers and Girl Scout Cookies. The vibe at the tasting room is casual and approachable - the staff is friendly and unpretentious. For the virtual tasting I did, they had the packages ready for pickup and hosted the tasting on Zoom. It was fun even if I was tasting solo from home as there were others on the Zoom and the two who guided the tasting were informative and engaging. Here were some notes I took during the tasting:  Alibi Blonde and Shortbread - a nice blend of the maltiness and breadiness of the cookie. The beer is a blending of German Maibock style with American Blonde Ale, resulting in a rich, malty flavor with a clean, crisp finish.  Blue Texas Hefe and Caramel deLits and Peanut Butter Sandwich - this is their best-selling beer (about 2x any other) and is a traditional German Wheat beer with a touch of caramel malt and an emphasis on citrus notes. It's refreshing and definitely a Texas twist on one of my favorite types of beers.  Envy Amber and Toast-yay! - this is a new cookie this year and they paired it with the first beer they ever brewed, although it's not the first beer they released. The cinnamon toast crunch flavor of the cookie worked well with the robustness of the amber. It's an English style amber with an emphasis on dried fruit notes - they use two types of British caramel malts to contribute to the well-rounded flavor of the beer.  Ladybird American IPA and Lemonades - this was one of the pairing favorites of the crowd and I definitely liked it a lot too. It's a West Coast style IPA that is very hoppy, but not overly bitter. Solid pairing and solid beer.  Tuxedo Shirt Black IPA and Thin Mints - the hops in this beer are changed annually, so it never really has the same flavor profile year to year. I was not familiar with roasted IPA malts, but it's basically an IPA with black malt. It has a bold, roasty flavor, with a solid body. It was a smooth pairing with the Thin Mints.  Nightlight Dry Irish Stout and S'mores and Peanut Butter Patties - this beer is the CO2 version of Guinness. There is a slight bitterness to this, but it has a rich flavor with a very light body.   A few other bonus takeaways shared in the tasting conversation: * Epic Playlist is a beer that they created to interact with their fans in the market. It has a QR code on it that connects the drinker to the Circle Brewing Spotify playlist. * Devil's XX is a barrel-aged version of the beer (XX) and is sold in bottles. * They are keeping this tasting room, but also expanding and moving to a location in Elgin where they can grow their own ingredients to put in their beer on the 23-acre property.

reviews.author: Taylor Z.
reviews.description: Tasty beer with a nice quaint outside seating area. They turn on the lights when it gets dark so it's nice and intimate.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: I've come by a few times and always found it to be a good experience. The staff is friendly, the beer is consistently good and they go for styles that are much less popular from Austin breweries. They also participate in some fun events throughout the year, in particular I really enjoyed the beer/girl scout cookie pairing event and the red line brewery tour.  Highly recommend trying the Blur, its a Hefeweizen and their staple beer. I would put it up there with Live Oak's Hef as a common point of comparison. If you're around in the winter time their Doppel Blur is probably the best Hef I've ever had; Imagine if your alcoholic grandmother made banana bread in liquid form. If you're looking for something darker the Tuxedo T-shirt is a black IPA, I really liked the combination of roastiness and hoppiness. It sounds like it would clash but I found the hop flavor subtle enough to work really well.    The one negative I would have is that the interior really makes it feel like they're trying to get you to sit outside, which given the vast amount of space available in the parking lot makes sense. However I don't feel like they do a great job of utilizing it, there aren't nearly as many tables as you would think and the ones they do have aren't particularly well spaced out.  The food truck situation seems to rotate pretty frequently, I've found most of them to be misses but it's a roll of the dice depending on the day. There's also plenty of good food options in close proximity that it doesn't feel like a major negative.  Overall I think Circle makes for a good hang out spot and a change of pace from the typical Austin brewery experience.

reviews.author: Lauren A.
reviews.description: Circle Brewing's taproom is open and they have excellent beers both at the taproom and beer to go. They're known for the Circle Blur, a hazy hefeweizen, but all of their beers are good. The Austin Anthem golden ale is refreshing and "crushable" and the kolsch and IPAs are good too. They have both indoor and outdoor seating and host free pre-events for Austin FC games next door.

reviews.author: Mark K.
reviews.description: Beer is good, staff always friendly... but damn does it get hot as the third ring of hell during the summer in there. Maybe "stuffy" or "swampass humid" is more accurate, but it's uncomfy when busy. I'm from southern Texas, so I'm used to it.. but it's even hot for me. Need some big ass fans or something. But.. the cold beer does help! And the food truck outside always looks good, but I've never partook in the tasty treats.   Gonna be a go to for many (including myself) pre-FC games, just hope they're OK with me only wearing my FC boxers once I've been there for 20 and sweat through my less-than-fancy Target shorts I got for $20, so I'd have more $$ to spend on their tasty beer.

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: We were near this Brewery on a Saturday in early March, so decided to stop in and give it a try.  It just so happened it was a special beer release event and charity donation (for Pink Boots Society and Pink Velvet Collaboration IPA), so it was crowded.  We lucked into a table inside and tried a sampling of beers while we played a game and listened to a few interesting sounding bands that played (standing on the loading platform).  Because it was so crowded, it took a while to get served and the line for the single person bathroom was very long.  The beers we tried were good, and we would definitely stop back by on a day that wasn't quite so crowded.

reviews.author: Mark L.
reviews.description: Decent food trucks and nice experience but seriously can't give it more than 2 stars because of a ridiculously inefficient policy which makes you wait in the long line of people ordering their drinks to simply close your tab. 8 minutes of my life I'd love to have back. Just updated to one star. There is seriously 1 restroom here-for both men and women to share. The place is huge. Need to work out some logistics here.

reviews.author: Thomas M.
reviews.description: I love breweries in warehouse districts! Very friendly staff, fun vibe inside and outside. Big variety of beers - and probably the best English pub ale in Texas that isn't a big brand beer. I personally think they would gain to have a tv or two once the MLS stadium opens. Overall great experience and plan to come back. Oh yeah - super dog friendly!!!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: I was so pumped to check our Circle during a brew-crawl, but the ambiance left me feeling unimpressed.  I had my first sips of Circle after being introduced by every Texan's good friend HEB. I believe it was the hefe that reeled me in, so I was excited to go to Circle during the Red Line Brew tour (check it out online if you've never done it). I was so excited to try a few beers, but knew I could only focus my tastes on one since we were on a crawl. I went with their Cereal Keller kellerbier which I've never tried before. It was described as "unhinged" probably because this stuff is unfiltered and not clarified! I was psyched to try a grittier version of the lager. It wasn't as funky as I thought it would be, but instead felt light, simple and slightly malty/sweet. I enjoyed it. I was pretty curious about all their others like their IPA's and the Doppel Blur, but that's for next time.  The space itself is definitely reminiscent of your small-production and grassroots taproom. They had two porta-potties outside (along with a food truck), but only one restroom inside. It got pretty crazy with our crawl of beer lovers. I can't imagine the staff members sharing one restroom, especially when the brewers are in there doing their thang. Someone's bench with weights and press station was still out, and there wasn't that much open space indoors for the lot of us to all be in there, so outdoors it was! They allow dogs which is awesome and they also have wifi. Parking seemed a-plenty, but we took public transport so that's that. Their gigantic chalkboard menu is beautiful and fully rounds out their super relaxed and earthy vibes. The people here are friendly, chill and the brewery gives off a neighborly essence. It's not an instagram-hotspot like their new next door neighbor Hopsquad. And that's the beauty of it!

reviews.author: Lyndsay W.
reviews.description: Plenty of outdoor space (some indoor too) and good beer. Conveniently located right next to another spacious brewery, which makes for easy bar-hopping. I thought it was funny that the bathroom is wallpapered with 90's CD cover art. It's the little things.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Perfect day to celebrate Circle's 6th anniversary. With the Temps hovering around 90 degrees what better way to while away a Sat afternoon than having a few scrumptious craft beers, street tacos and listening to some great music.  My companions opted for their Alibi Blonde it is a German-inspired beer but it drinks pretty light but with a hint of flowery hops that gives it a good aftertaste. I opted for their Ladybird IPA that also drank surprisingly light for an IPA and was perfect for a hot early spring day. I did see a lot of folks drinking their black IPA but it was too warm a day for that, next time.  The event was top notch 15 bucks, American, got you a cool pilsner type anniversary glass and 3 beer tokens. We gave 3 tokens away at the end as we were getting full and we !had! to attend a friends crawfish party later that afternoon. Got to leave room for dem bugs and more brews!   The first band was a Go Gos inspired female band that rocked and the second band played some great 70s, 80, and 90s cover songs. Since I was wearing a Boston Sports shirt I got to meet some other Massholes which only added to the fun.   Good times, great beer, and a wonderful event!

reviews.author: Emily M.
reviews.description: Super friendly environment and very dog friendly!  I loved the atmosphere and the female bartender that helped us was so friendly and knowledgeable about the different beers. This is one of my favorite north Austin breweries to go to. You'll love it.

reviews.author: Mariah F.
reviews.description: Circle brewing is definitely my favorite brewery to come to in Austin. Not only are there tons of events that are always happening there, just for fun or to support local organizations, all the employees there are so kind and really attentive. They also change/add different beer options often which is great if you're looking to maybe get your favorites and try something new. I'd highly recommend the doppel blur and although it isn't on tap, you can still get a can in a glass of you want. If you're really wanting something on tap then I'd go with the blur! I'd definitely recommend going and bringing your pup because they are very pup friendly everywhere !

reviews.author: Katie H.
reviews.description: I love Circle. Not only is the beer great, but the location and setting speak to the nostalgic part of me that's seen a few little start up breweries begin to flourish out of industrial parks, and often with their taprooms in the brewery space itself. That's what this space is--Utilitarian is too strong a word, but it's comfortable, practical, and cozy. We've enjoyed days playing games out on the picnic tables, and others indoors on the barrel tables. The staff is friendly, and there's always parking available, or you can take the light rail or easily bike from this brewery to others nearby!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Definitely a cute space with delicious beer! I'm also a sucker for any brewery that has a food truck on property- we had some pretty bomb fish tacos :) The only downside was no AC inside?! It's too hot for that!

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Circle Brewing was fantastic, lots of great drinks and lots of great vibes. I thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere at Circle and definitely enjoyed the great beer they had. With lots of breweries in this area, Circle Brewing is still one of the top in the area

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: Lots of beer offerings and you can bring food in as well. So make a day of it. If you like Yoga, for $20 on Sundays join the group of yoga fanatics for, you guessed it, Beer and Yoga. There are t-shirts that proclaim this so it must be true.  Hubby loved his beer choice, Hop Overboard, during Barks for Beers the Divine Canine fundraiser. The atmosphere is easy going and dogs are allowed. I love that they support our local therapy pups.

reviews.author: Frankie T.
reviews.description: Hands down our favorite bar in Austin. Every single person who works here is friendly, badass and great at their job. Management is top tier - Chris, we're lookin at you!   We love this bar and are so glad to live so close and to have y'all in our lives.    Thanks!  Frankie and Mike

reviews.author: Devin O.
reviews.description: Friendly place. Got too many shots were given to me that night. I think.  Was a good time. But be careful in the bathrooms that thing is loud as $h!t! So don't slam anything or people will know... mwahahaha

reviews.author: Carolyn B.
reviews.description: Ok, I want to give the 3.5 stars, but I'm rounding down for the blatantly misleading name. This feels a lot more like a sports bar with some outdoor space than a "beer garden." When I think "beer garden," I picture something with more ambiance (for example plants, string lights, communal tables, music maybe). Instead, here you have a patio with many TVs blaring the game and a dark, concrete/rock picnic area. Yes they have some string lights... on the outer edges of the parking lot #doinitwrong.  That said, they have a great selection of beers and the bartenders are really friendly and helpful. We also enjoyed the food trucks out back. Soooo, if you're looking for a chill spot to catch a game with some great beer, this will fit the bill! If you're looking for a "beer garden," like for a casual date, not so good.

reviews.author: Robert V.
reviews.description: The place has a roadhouse atmosphere, most of the staff looked like they were operating a biker bar which at first made me feel a little intimidated, especially when they ignored me. The gentleman at the bar acted like whatever paperwork he was doing was more important than paying customers.  After getting my beer I walked out to the patio to find a place to sit. I was greeted by what I assume was the owner (but again the biker appearance threw me off). He was polite, welcomed me and my party and let me know that he was there if we needed any help.  The seating was comfortable and fun. There was a food truck where we ordered nachos. They were good.  After returning for my second beer I recognized that the beer was flat. I alerted the staff, they gave me another but it was still bad. I suspect the lines need to be cleaned she apologized said she would take it off my bill, I chose another beer and moved on.  Later when lying she charged me for the bad beer anyway, so confused.  Anyway, overall I was disappointed with their beer selection, and disappointed with the staff attentiveness to customers. Had they taken better care of their beer I could have looked past their other shortcomings, but you have to get the beer right if you advertise yourself as a tap house.

reviews.author: Joey R.
reviews.description: Great spot for a chill Sunday with your four legged friends! Staff was friendly and covered spaces when the sun is out!

reviews.author: Kim W.
reviews.description: Least of my fav BG's in the southside row. Staff is no where as friendly and accommodating as the guys in the other 2 spots. Patio area is fine and well covered w heaters... outside open space is small but allows those w kids to set them free. It's fine if the other two are crazy busy, which they usually are, and you just want to hang. Beer selection is  good.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: I don't live down south but boy does this place make me wish I did! Laid back, chill vibes, CHEAP beer (I don't know if it was happy hour or what, but my local hef (forgot the name, but not Live Oak) was only $4 (feel like I'm usually paying between $6-$8 for local draft hefs everywhere else), and there are TVs everywhere playing all the sporting events televised at the moment.   It's super spacious, there are wooden picnic tables everywhere for seating (covered wrap around patio and outside near the BBQ food truck), and there's also a handful of arcade-y games (not sure if they're operational at this time but they added to the backyard fun aesthetic of the place).  Nice staff, all the safety precautions accounted for, and off the beaten path cool.  Stop by just because or if you're making your way to/from Valentina's ;)

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Fun spot, great staff. Had a few buddies from Ireland in town who all said they pour a "proper" Guinness here. High praise from that crowd.   I just wish there were more food options here, that would get me there more regularly.

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: Honestly this is my favorite spot to meet with friends. The bartenders are very good at getting customers their drinks as soon as possible. I've watched a few pay-per-view fights here and it is always a good time.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Swung by on a warm Sunday afternoon. Apparently Raider Nation has found a So Austin home. Plenty of picnic tables under cover and outback. TVs everywhere with all the games on. Full bar with nice happy hour prices. Friendly staff and BBQ from the food truck was pretty good. Dog friendly.

reviews.author: Brenda G.
reviews.description: The SABG is an Austin gem!  My fiancé and I live less than a mile from this place and love coming here to unwind.  It's so refreshing to get a cocktail for less than $16 in this city!  The vibe is also so laid back.  We've never had issues finding parking but on occasion have walked or rideshared here to be safe.  We also thoroughly enjoyed the bbq food truck that is here last time we stopped by.  Additionally everyone we've seen on the property has been safe and masked which we really appreciate.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: This review is mostly for the food. As of June 2020 the food truck on site is HBQ bbq which doesn't seem to have its own Yelp page - which is a serious problem because it needs some serious love! You know the standards for bbq are high in this town, and HBQ holds its own very well for being virtually unknown. My favorite part of a bbq meal isn't actually the meat, it's the sides, so I was excited to see the selection! I ordered a little of everything (well, not everything, but about half the menu... enough that the cook asked if it were for one or two people when he saw a tiny girl come to pick up all of it!) I ordered what I thought would be a chicken salad sandwich, but maybe I ordered wrong or maybe their idea of "chicken salad" is different than mine, because what I got was a typical chicken sandwich - sliced chicken, slaw and what seemed to be mild hot sauce on a hearty roll. Despite the initial disappointment, it wasn't too bad for a chicken sandwich. It was huge! A good deal for the price. However, I didn't want to fill up on it, so I was glad when my friend's son expressed interest in the other half of it. More room for the sides! The hatch creamed corn was amazing - other friends raved about it too. It had a bit of a kick after a few bites, but nothing a spice wimp like myself couldn't handle. The mac and cheese was billed as "sriracha mac and cheese" but was not spicy. It was average in a good way, slightly on the not-so-cheesy end, that would be a disappointment to have alone as a meal, but definitely enjoyable as a side dish. The cucumber salad was surprisingly good. I didn't expect much. Who gets excited about cucumbers? I ordered it out of curiosity and so I could feel good about eating some token vegetables. It turned out to be a real sleeper hit! It was a bit like eating pickles, toned-down enough that I could eat a whole cup of them without being overpowered by brine. When they loaded the "loaded potato salad" they weren't messing around! It had a lot of cheddar cheese and bacon, and some green onion. Apparently they rotate their pie selection, and this time they had peanut butter ice box pie. The cook asked how much whipped cream I wanted on it and I told him not to hold back! It was obviously delicious. Obviously. You're probably wondering about the meats, because this is a bbq truck. I was with a large group, so I got to hear everyone's review of just about everything on the menu, and everyone was impressed. I know they tried brisket, pulled pork, ribs, mac and cheese loaded with meat and queso, and queso as a dip. All servings were a pretty decent size for their price. The queso was the only unusual thing - it was more like movie-theatre nacho cheese that most Texans wouldn't call queso. However, apparently once it was mixed with brisket, it was good, and I saw several servings of it get finished off.  Like I said, I was with a big group, and the venue accommodated is well.  Drinks seemed satisfactory. (I only had water.) I think I heard live music coming from inside. Kids enjoyed the small playground. (And to tell, the truth, at the end of the night, I went and climbed on it too.) Picnic tables, shade coverings, parking bathrooms and all those important amenities were good. I wish this place was closer in to town, but if it were, that might ruin what they've got going. Despite the long drive south, I'll be likely to return! Update: I checked their menu and they have two chicken sandwiches. It looks like I ordered the wrong one. No wonder I was disappointed, but that's good news for the rest of y'all to know that their chicken sandwich is a decent take on a typical chicken sandwich. But I'm still craving a good chicken salad sandwich...

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: We tried this place a while back and we probably won't return as their tequila and vodka options aren't that great. We each had one drink and left. Way too many smokers and even though we sat outside, we left smelling like a cigar shop.

reviews.author: Chris M.
reviews.description: Good service, that's about it.  Shitty management.  Sat at a table for 3 hours worth of drinks and food, then a young group of kids in Halloween costumes came in, slapped a "Reserved" piece of paper on our table and management told us we had to move.  Shipping container restrooms reeked.  Food sucks.  Won't be back.  Much better options.  in South ATX.

reviews.author: Allie T.
reviews.description: The new bartender Ralph is AMAZING super attentive and makes stiff drinks! Love this place will be back!

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Went to the S Austin Beer Garden just on a whim, and was pleasantly surprised. It was a nice chill environment for those living on this side of town. The majority of the building has a patio area, so it's a perfect place to grab a beer after work, on the weekend or even mid day even during Covid. The bartenders are super friendly and helpful. Definitely check them out.

reviews.author: Sandi G.
reviews.description: I came here to watch UFC 248 with my friends and had a great time.  It was rather cold that day but we opted to sit outside so we can have prime view to the TV screen.  They brought out heaters for the outdoor seating so there was some warmth to be had.  The drinks were a bit on the expensive side but they're showing the fight with no cover so it was worth it.  What I really enjoyed was the food trucks out back.  The food was amazing!  I had the BBQ plate and the cream corn and mac and cheese were so delicious!!!  The BBQ itself was great of course.  The atmosphere was really fun and I definitely would come back to watch the next UFC fight.

reviews.author: Rosa F.
reviews.description: Visited for a couple of rounds, and we're glad we did.  It delivers in all the watering hole fronts. Their frozen / machine premix drinks were refreshing.  Their Mexican Martini was a bit tart, but we enjoyed it. Lots of places to sit outside in the shade, and out by the sun (by the food trucks).

reviews.author: Joe Q Pubic F.
reviews.description: First visit... Disappointed... rude manager   Men's bathroom?   The NY Subway smells like roses in comparison....  First and last visit...  Don't like giving poor reviews, but this one is necessary...  Needs improvement

reviews.author: Nichole M.
reviews.description: I love this place! Cool vibe, amazing Mac and cheese, ice cold drinks. I wish I lived closer but I'd be in trouble if I did because I'd be a regular! Lol

name: Patio Dolcetto
accommodations: Street Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: Stacey S.
reviews.description: What a cool spot! Food and service was great. Everything was reasonably priced. Flight of cider was so good. Loved the blackberry one from a place in Sequin. Pizza was delicious but the recipe that I loved the most was the baked Brie! Can't wait to come back her and enjoy the very chill atmosphere.

reviews.author: Catherine I.
reviews.description: This place is absolutely amazing!!! It's so charming and romantic. The food is delicious. The drinks are great then the music is fantastic for the atmosphere. The staff are so sweet. I'd definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Shelby and Grace were great helps all night! Cider flight- problem the best idea i had other than ordering the pizza ! The blackberry mead was probably my fave cider! Also the cider flight is $10!  The pizzas are pretty good! I got the white blanc both times and added pepperoni and jalapeños to one and just jalapeños to the other!  Again, i place to stop by after floating the river( normal times) or shopping at the outlets!

reviews.author: Cydnee R.
reviews.description: This place is AMAZING. We saw it while driving around looking for somewhere to go and it caught our eye so we checked it out. We were a bit more casually dressed as I would've liked, but it's okay because it was our first visit.   The vibes here are amazing. Everything looks nice and sophisticated. We both had drinks, a couple of martinis and something else that I can't quite remember.   The Brie was something new to my boyfriend, and we really enjoyed it. My Margherita pizza was perfect and my boyfriend Chicken Blanc pizza was also sooo good. I think his was better than mine, lol!   I recommend this place to everyone I run into. It's so cute and the perfect date night

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: Obsessed with this place! I've been many times before but we went for my friends 22nd birthday today and loved it. The pizzas are AMAZING and our waitress, Kennedy, was so nice and patient. Everything on the menu is 10/10 !!!

reviews.author: Lilly V.
reviews.description: we loved Shelia!!! she was amazing. she took care of us and made us feel so comfortable   love pat dolc and love Shelia!!!!!

reviews.author: Lacey P.
reviews.description: We arrived around 10:30pm on Saturday, and we could sit wherever we want, minimal people there. Our order was taken quickly and the drinks/food were super fast as well. I highly recommend for a place to get drinks and talk with friends, but be mindful that the food is finger-food and limited!

reviews.author: Koral R.
reviews.description: Baked Brie and white sangria was a must. Order a flight of beer for the friend. We all enjoyed the ambiance and the fact that there was heaters outdoors for us.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: Tonight we tried out this quaint wine bar for the first time. For a tapas bar, they offer a limited menu. This is the only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars Bec we expected more selection. They have a few cheese plate options and small gourmet pizzas. I chose the pear and bacon pizza, which was delicious. my husband had a pepperoni pizza. I also ordered a sangria flight, which was quite nice. On Thursday nights they offer a free lava cake with the purchase of a flight. The lava cake was tasty. The servers were friendly and the decorations were nice.

reviews.author: Madeline C.
reviews.description: Pizza is amazing, definitely individual sized. Try the pear and bacon! Drinks were good priced and were amazing. Had a great night here! 100 would recommend. Loved our server! The lights were too cute on the patio!

reviews.author: Martha H.
reviews.description: Went here with a friend and it was totally lovely-- we sat outside, the vibe was perfect and the wine was good. Our server was great, she was friendly, had good recommendations and was super quick... we will definitely come back

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: Nice environment and atmosphere :)   Better service the second time around.

reviews.author: Laney E.
reviews.description: Service was excellent and the pear and bacon pizza is a must try!! Will definitely come back.

reviews.author: Brittany F.
reviews.description: Trendy spot in San Marcos for wine and cheese. Can get crowded if it's too hot for anyone to want to sit outside.
