There is overflow parking across the street, appropriately signed as extra parking for Patio Dolcetto.  Someone put a lot of effort and love into designing the space.   Alex the bartender was very friendly and our group had good conversation with him.   They have a Sunday Special right now: a bottle of wine (5 options) and a cheese board for $25. The cheese board had water crackers, Marcona almonds, dried apricots, craisins (?), jam, Olive tapenade, a smoked Gouda, a cheddar - almost like TJs unexpected cheddar, but more firm and reminiscent of Parmesan (not crumbly like UC), and a chèvre (I think). All very tasty.   We did the special twice. The White Zin was given to us on accident (instead of the merlot we requested) but they're very low key and friendly and we try to be easy going (especially about wine!) so we enjoyed the Zin.   I look forward to checking out other specials and enjoying the nice atmosphere outside when it gets a little cooler.

reviews.author: Kelsey B.
reviews.description: I stopped here with a friend on our drive from Austin to San Antonio and will definitely be making the trip back to San Marcos to visit again! I ordered the white sangria, which fair warning was very sweet but it was still delicious. The menu said the white sangria had ginger in it, although I didn't taste that specific ingredient I was hoping for, it was still a good choice. They do wine flights as well, and have a pretty good happy hour.  We ordered a cheese board and sat at the bar. The cheese board was generous and filling, the service was great, and the atmosphere was on point. It is a casual wine bar, and they had live music outside which would have been nice to watch aside from the cold weather. They have a lot of seating outside, and a good amount of community seating inside.  Overall, great experience here and will be hopefully going back!

reviews.author: Anna V.
reviews.description: Absolutely Amazing!!!! The pictures say it all, I would definitely recommend to all of my friends.

reviews.author: Mitch G.
reviews.description: A great place. Small indoor outdoor wine bar with small snacks and pizzas. Really well priced drinks and great tasting food! Would recommend the Pear and Bacon Pizza but maybe pass on the charcuterie board (it's a bit $$ and not very big) but overall great staff, service, snacks and drinks!

reviews.author: Kathleen B.
reviews.description: Love everything about the place. Excellent staff and very helpful when choosing a wine. One of the nicest bars in San Marcos. Love to take out of town guests here.

reviews.author: Caitlyn W.
reviews.description: Love this place! The girls that work there are super chill and background music is great.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: This place is delicious with a fantastic scenery. The only thing that I wish this place had was more food options to go with amazing wine and cocktails. I highly recommend going out for a girls night here or perhaps even a date night! Their wine flights are a must try!

name: River City Grille
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Kris V.
reviews.description: Good food, beautiful view. The outdoor seating overlooks the river. The dining room is all windows so you can sit in the ac and still have a view.  I'd imagine before covid the dining room held a few more tables.  The Paul's chicken is a large breast breaded in chips, topped with lots of hatch Chile and shredded cheese. I liked it better after asking for a side of white gravy.  The green beans are honest, not cooked to death, still green. The baked potato was typical, though not seasoned on the outside like I'm used to.  All in all, it's plenty.  The chicken fried steak was two pieces, actually seasoned in the breading, tender enough, and disappeared quickly. Gravy is good too.  The scratch cheesecake was good. I got plain, without toppings, which they offer a few. It's baked, not too dense, thick enough crust.  The bread pudding was a cereal bowl full of yummy. Pecans and raisins all smothered in a bourbon sauce, not an icing. Very good.  Prices are a smidge high, but expected for the area.  Staff was pleasant, quick to respond.  I'll come back next time we are in the area.

reviews.author: Chip L.
reviews.description: My wife's Cobb salad the chicken was COLD. My grilled chicken sandwich I have to ask why a cook would serve a piece of chicken that was that over cooked and burned??? Perhaps try flattening the chicken breast instead of cooking a big lump piece. My fault to have eaten it!  Fries were not fresh either. Guess I was hungry and the bartender was too busy to ask initially.

reviews.author: Alex Z.
reviews.description: Nice lake view restaurant in marble fall, the price is very good for the portion of food. Most of the food is about $10 unless you go for steak. There's outdoor seating as well as indoor seating with large window with beautiful lake view.  The service is very fast and attentive. I ordered calamari which are top with cheese powder which seems strange, it's also like a calamari fingers instead of rings. With cheese is not my favorite part. The fish taco came in three large pieces of taco with the two pieces of filet in each taco, huge portion. The green chili burger is juicy and has a good kick to it but the buns are soggy which needs some improvement.

reviews.author: Kevin S.
reviews.description: We were heading back to our hotel late and wanted something quick to eat. We decided to share the Fried Shrimp House Favorite with sweet potato fries and cole slaw. The shrimp were OK but cooked just a little too long for our liking. The sweet potato fries were just barely cooked and were just limp and tasteless. The cole slaw was actually pretty good. I doubt we'll return, which is a shame given the nice view they have.

reviews.author: Ried S.
reviews.description: I want to start by saying that the service here is probably the beat I've experienced since the pandemic began. In a world where so many restaurants are understaffed and waiters overwhelmed, the team here could not have been more attentive from the moment we sat down. There was no waiting for anything - they were incredibly intuitive and knew just when to check in with us and offer refills or bring extra napkins. 5 stars for the service.   The food was pretty good which is why I'm giving 4 stars. I had a delicious green chili burger, but the calamari fell flat for me. I don't know why they sprinkled parmesan cheese on it. My recommendation would be to offer this on the side.   Overall, solid option in Marble Falls with beautiful views over the lake. Sit outside when the weather is tolerable.

reviews.author: Heather T.
reviews.description: We stopped in here while on vacation to eat by the water and were not disappointed.   The food was great. I got the famous pork chop and green beans and it was delicious.   The atmosphere is great. We sat inside and still had great lakeside views. The parking was easy and even at prime time, we easily got a table.   The staff was friendly but the service was disorganized and slow. That is the only reason we aren't giving it 5 stars.

reviews.author: Rob H.
reviews.description: The wife decided to stop in today after I had grabbed some mounts from the taxidermist in town. We got there just as they opened and glad we did. We got a table on the balcony. Weather was perfect, staff was friendly, food was good and view is awesome. I had the fish tacos which I loved and she had the pulled pork tacos that she liked a lot. Portions were perfect as was flavor. My only gripe would be paying for salsa and chips. This is Texas! It should almost be a given to have chips and salsa at the table! We will most definitely be making a return trip.

reviews.author: Drew D.
reviews.description: This was one of the first places I ate upon moving to Texas.   Usually imma chicken fried steak kinda dude (which theirs is actually incredible) but recently I've been on a sandwich kick.  The fried catfish sandwich actually bangs. The flavor was on point and the bread was super soft.  If I was just a tad bit fatter I could finish this monster and the fries, but unfortunately even my sweat shorts waistband had enough.  L

reviews.author: Jennifer R.
reviews.description: Traveling with my boyfriend. We stopped with our well behaved dog and the host said we could eat on the patio. We ordered our food and shortly the manager came by and told us dogs are not allowed and we had to leave. Will not stop by again after the manager being rude to us. Our dog was tucked under my chair laying down not causing any problems.

reviews.author: Vince A.
reviews.description: I have always enjoyed having lunch here. The food is good, and the management and staff are incredibly service minded. The pork-chops, are bone in with a unique brown sugar and cumin glaze, cooked to perfection. Also as an appetizer try the loaded fried potatoes .

reviews.author: Brandon B.
reviews.description: Great spot to chill on the river and enjoy dinner drinks. Not the best food in the world, but decent. Big selling point is the great view and setting.

reviews.author: Garry H.
reviews.description: Considering the location of this restaurant, I was expecting some stupid crazy high prices. More on that later. I told the hostess this was our first time here and wanted to celebrate our anniversary on the patio. She immediately took us to the worst table on the patio. Thanks. The waitress had no problem putting us at one of the best tables on the patio. Your awesome! All staff were wearing masks. We ordered the Texas grilled Reuben and the Buffalo Chicken sandwich. Both were wonderful. Very seldom does Glenda finish a sandwich! Fries were good and the coleslaw was wonderful. I'm a huge fan of  Long John Silver's coleslaw, sweet and creamy. Very few places make it like that. River City Grille's was a perfect copy! Glenda stopped me from licking the bowl. Now, if your eating wonderful food on a wonderful patio at a wonderful restaurant facing a wonderful lake, your going to pay through the nose. Nope. Normal prices. That's why 5 stars. We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Ron K.
reviews.description: This is a nice place to grab a bite when driving through. We sat out on the patio and enjoyed the view of the river. The food was good but what stood out was the green chili and cheese potatoes, they were fantastic! The waitress was very nice , the food good and the view great. With a little more effort they could make this place epic. Either way, I recommend stopping here when your passing through , you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Katelin K.
reviews.description: Not great, not awful, just ok. The view carries the restaurant. Service and food were underwhelming, and prices weren't great for what was expected.

reviews.author: John F.
reviews.description: Here from Florida food was great. Paul's chicken  the onion ring super service very good. Patio outstanding thanks.

reviews.author: Tim K.
reviews.description: Nice local restaurant right in the water. They are socially distancing with masks for all so definitely felt very safe.   We started with the BK salad which was quite enough to share with a large amount of chicken.   I would definitely recommend the chipotle vinaigrette dressing. I had the Buffalo chicken tacos for dinner. The chicken portions were huge and tasty. The rest of the dish was plain but solid. My wife had the fried shrimp. Food quality was overall good. Price a little high for hers for what you got but not terrible. The salad and tacos were quite reasonably priced.   Our server had a trainee so not sure if the reason our service was slow but definitely slow service for how empty the restaurant was when we were there.   Overall still a solid dine at a local place and would definitely consider going back on a return trip.

reviews.author: Vincent W.
reviews.description: We have driven past here a few times, but never stopped until yesterday.  Location wise, this is a great stopping point for a pre-Fredericksburg wine tasting afternoon.  You'll be able to arrive in wine country after digestion has commenced with no hunger, ready to consume some good wine, mead or beer.  The service and food are decent.  The buffalo chicken tacos were excellent.  They have a well stocked bar, including some Fredericksburg wines.

reviews.author: Kelly R.
reviews.description: Outstanding service! The food was delicious and came out fast. The BK salad was amazing, the green chili pork tacos were right on... Kid says the Kids' Mac and cheese was "great." Look forward to going again!

reviews.author: Jaymie-Lyn D.
reviews.description: So this is our SECOND time here. In town for another golf tournament at Horseshoe Bay. I remembered this place from last time and figured we could give it another try. There are a few more things to note this time around... 1. Staff is underwhelming and not friendly. I mean, they're cordial enough, but for a small town, it doesn't seem like they try to get to know you.  2. The patio- so we were able to get a table out on the coveted patio. To re-use the word "underwhelming", the patio is such, super outdated and could use some TLC. Cobwebs beneath some of the metal mesh dining chairs should not exist if daily sweeping and wiping down of seats were being done. The floor could also use a major cleaning. Rails could use a new coat of paint and the patio could use an overall power washing.  3. No wonder the wait for patio seating was 45 mins long the last time we were out here. They only have about 8 tables out there. And being on the Colorado River, it's easy to see why people would just want to loiter and hang out, which means tables don't turnover quickly. Although we are in the "dreadful times of COVID-19", I believe they could easily place at least four 2-seater tables to dot along the patio rails and still maintain the appropriate/safe distance between tables.  4. I tried the pork chop tonight (the hubby enjoyed them so much last time). They are small, 7 oz. including bone, marinated in a brine overnight. Even found a few whole peppercorns on my chop. I'm used to a simple salt (or garlic salt) and pepper seasoning of my chops, so the flavor was off-putting for a simpleton ingrate like me. LOL! But the brine makes them very moist, so that was a plus and they are definitely cooked over an open flame. I had char marks for days!  5. Had the chips and queso/salsa appetizer again and enjoyed it. I'd recommend that.   Re-reading my first review, I realized that I was too generous with the 4 stars last time, so I'm down-grading to 3. My recommendations to management on this trip would be to spend a little money for a minor facelift and add some aesthetic appeal for the comfort of their customers who appear to be "regular" locals and visitors like us visiting the area.  This is for both the inside and outside dining areas of the restaurant. Considering the cost of the food here, I don't think this is too much to ask. Please also train your seating staff (hostesses) to be friendly and communicative. This is our second visit and the second time we've felt this area of staff were "cool" and unprofessional. Our server wasn't jovial and offering foot massages, but at least she spoke more than a few words to us and was professional and effective. The 3 females at the front hostess podium are just awkward, staring and make a strange impression. These are the first (masked) faces your customers will engage with and whom will represent your business, your brand and set the tone for your customers' entire dining experience. Take this seriously. I don't think we'll be back. There are other places to try out, but we wish you much luck and success.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: I just flew in from Atlanta today for work and was starving and craving a steak dinner. And this hit the spot!  It's a river side grill with a nice menu. I ordered the New York Strip with fried okra (yum) and macaroni and cheese, along with a "skinny" margarita. They had a bit of a snafu with a brand new busboy who cleared my drinks while I was in the restroom but they fixed it quickly!  I will probably drop in again while I'm here this week and try some different menu options!

reviews.author: Janet B.
reviews.description: We had such a good time at this place! It feels like a neighborhood pub filled with friends. The staff is incredibly friendly and so attentive. We never had an empty water (or beer) glass, and they were just plain nice. With so many restaurants struggling with staff and service, it was a welcome change. The food was top notch as well! I had the brunch burger and my hubby had the mango habanero wings, and we split the queso and chips. (And by the way, their queso was hella good, especially considering they aren't a Tex-mex restaurant!)

reviews.author: Cory O.
reviews.description: This was a nice place to stop on my way home from work. They has a ton of beers on tap and the bartenders were really nice about letting me try different ones before I ordered. Never had the food, but the atmosphere and staff is great!

reviews.author: Juliet J.
reviews.description: Me and my 3 year old were feeling hangry on a Sunday. I didn't want to cook, so we ordered for pick up from Chow Hound. I know there is a no children policy on the weekend. Waitress gave us water while we waited outside. Food was absolutely delicious and worth the extra 10 minute wait. We got the chicken and waffles and sunny side up eggs and home fries.

reviews.author: Joe D.
reviews.description: this has been my neighborhood to go place. My review would have been 4 star originally. I dined there yesterday after not visiting for maybe 2 weeks.    One reason i loved the place was their unique 'curly' french fries. Yesterday, i was quite surprised to see they switched the curly fries to the scoop shape that their sister pub, Brick, serves. Meh. Friends from north Austin would often ask when I was going to Vincent because they liked the curly fries. My friend with me yesterday, said the same thing, whaddup?  i know it's not earth shaking but it made Vincent stand out for me. BUMMER

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: Today we wandered into this pub while waiting for an appointment. It was lively with good cocktails and snacks. Their frozen margaritas were smooth and well-blended. I had two different vodka specialty cocktails that were well-crafted. We also ordered the. Shrimp and Poblano Quesadillas which were smoky, spicy and hit the spot.

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: Recently visited this venue for the 1st time - we are always happy to support bartenders or servers during this pandemic. As always we left 25%. The young lady was super nice, kind, helpful and provided info about the menu and venue. We will definitely return!

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a chill spot with better then average base food.... this is your place. It's a very casual vibe with a great drink selection. The only downfall is the lack of seating. This is not a big place and it stays pretty crowded. The food I've had so far has been pretty good for bar food. It's definitely a step up!

reviews.author: Nick P.
reviews.description: Great location and nice local bar and restaurant. Not so much! Been here a few times now and it's hit or miss with the staff. NOT friendly for the most part and definitely not attentive. There's maybe 1 or 2 of the girls servers that are good  but overall not worth over 2 stars. Management needs to look into there staff and lack of friendliness and service!

reviews.author: Steve A.
reviews.description: I like this place because of the proximity. The service is slow, but seems to have gotten better. They have a limited menu unfortunately, but nevertheless the food good. The wings are delicious. They were tender and well sauced. Nachos are  crispy and put together. All in all, this place is alright

reviews.author: Glen L.
reviews.description: Been several times. Service is normally slow, although today was a bit better. Overcharged on tab today because waitress lost track of tabs. Got cut off because we were a large group that had a large tab even though no one showed signs of having been over served. Don't plan on returning at this point. Wish something close had a late kitchen, but at this point I'd rather have Top Ramen than go here to get food after 10. Slow service and management that pretends to have people's best interests makes it a no. Food is good, but management that seems judgy makes it a no.

reviews.author: Deanna R.
reviews.description: Loved the vibe of this place. Had their Brodie Smash and Sierra Shandy -- Both great. Bartenders amazing and all ages present.

reviews.author: Brandon K.
reviews.description: Obviously, this is a sports bar--they have a terrific selection of brews and the atmosphere is fun. Service is hit or miss; the first time I came here and asked for a booth, the bartender became extremely frustrated when explaining their seating policy. They were busy, but still.  The food. It's good but not great--also, it's a sports bar, so it's on par with that cuisine. It's close to our house and nice enough, so we'll keep coming back for a beer and a game.

reviews.author: Myra E.
reviews.description: This bar has the best food ever!  The drinks are so tasty, very comfy place, but the menu is really good. Highly recommend. Nice wait staff too and prices are great. Love this place.

reviews.author: Michael L.
reviews.description: Total dump. Food was average at best. Added bonus: regulars who do not want  you there, and who are pretty clear about that.

reviews.author: Harley D.
reviews.description: Food was good. Staff nice. However my waitress was more concerned with flirting with the boys next to me than serving. Ended up closing my tab with her and just opening at the bar. I think maybe the manager saw it and called her out but still. Service is what sets a place apart. My service here was definitely not up to par at this night.

reviews.author: Kiara D.
reviews.description: This place feels like home to me! Cozy bar, with tasty food and always great company.

reviews.author: Kevin H.
reviews.description: So it's been 6 months or so since this place opened, I've been a handful of times since and thought I'd write a quick update. My first review came shortly after opening and we all know it takes time to get things in a good rhythm and sorted out, especially in the restaurant business.  The menu was a little odd to me when opening but has since won me over. They often have specials and have even opened up for lunch. Last weekend they had a crawfish boil at a very reasonable $7 lbs. The beer selection seems to be somewhat static, fortunately they have several to choose from, but it would be nice to have several rotating handles, given we are in one of the best craft beer markets around. I was a bit surprised to learn a local Pinthouse beer was $7. It's only a dollar more than at the brewery, but still, this isn't LA.  All and all, I like the direction this place is going, nice outdoor, dog friendly patio, food specials and hopefully some new local beers on my next visit.

reviews.author: Hannah P.
reviews.description: Was curious to check this place out because of all the reviews. WOW does not fail to impress. Wonderful staff (thank you  Victoria) and mouth watering food. The nachos looked like a mountain and they didn't skip on toppings. The wings and the shrimp quesadilla I heard are also top notch. Also, affordable! They employ wonderful staff. Look forward to being a regular

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Decent food, great beer and wine selection. My only complaint honestly? Both times I've been there wasn't much seating available! It gets super packed! I guess because we've been wanting a bar in this area for a long time, people are really excited ha ha but I wish there was more seating!

reviews.author: Billy V.
reviews.description: I have been having a tough time finding a place to enjoy an adult beverage and watch sporting events in Austin. Most places are these large indoor/outdoor spaces with music and food trucks. Or located downtown. Or you have to drive 30 plus minutes.  Vincent's Sports Pub is just down the road from home. It has plenty of TVs. I mean plenty. You can stand or sit anywhere in this pub and watch your game. AWESOME. A lot of thought was done here with the placement of TVs.  Service outstanding. A very friendly and nice Team. You like beer. You have choices. Lots of drafts and bottled beer choices. Great feel. Very welcoming pub. Plenty of tables. Great looking bar. Nice crowd. No jerks or muscle beer dudes. I judge a place if my wife would feel comfortable alone. Vincent's Sports Pub passes with high marks.  The food is very tasty. I had most of the apps and was very happy. Tasty. Great to share. Shrimp dish very good. Crispy. Wings have some pull and good. Nice pub menu. A scratch kitchen. I did not feel or taste it was a frozen product.  Vincent's Sports Pub will definitely be my go-to pub for drinks and sports on TV. It has a nice welcoming feel. Combination of design of the restaurant, the bar placement, the tables, food and most importantly the staff.  Plenty of parking. CC friendly. Union payment option.

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: This place puts every other beer store in ATX to shame. The variety of options here seems endless. The dude behind the counter knows more about beer than most sommeliers know about wine. That's just icing on the cake. They get every limited release and seasonal that drops. Prices can be a little steep but hella worth it.

reviews.author: Greg M.
reviews.description: Great place to try out a new beer then buy a six-pack or two. We had a couple beers each (they sell singles if you are hanging out) and then bought some to take home. Taco Truck pilsner was great, Mama Pisner, and there was a pickle beer that was probably a tad too pickley for me (go figure).  Great/fun selection, good prices, knowledgeable staff, and lots of picnic tables out to keep you spread out and safe. You can get snacks too, or play Starship Troopers pinball (Do You Want To Know More?!?). We had  a good time just chilling there on a Sunday afternoon.  Oh, and they recycle those plastic can holders that craft breweries use. Bring yours back to help out the brewers in town!

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: If you haven't been to The Brewtique in Cedar Park, you definitely should check it out.   Anytime you stop by, you'll meet either the owner or his wife and they are both nice and very helpful. You can pretty much buy anything they have in singles and they always have their inventory listed online along with the untapped rating for each beer, which I find very useful. They have a solid selection of local stuff and occasionally some more rare stuff as well. If you're immunocompromised, you can call your order in and they'll bring it to your car; they also have a very sanitary setup inside and require masks (of course) and make everyone use the hand sanitizer when you come in. We've been there about 5 times mixing that in with buying direct from breweries but I really love the diversity you can get while supporting local at the Brewtique

reviews.author: Philip J.
reviews.description: Really impressive beer bar and shop in Cedar Park. If you're a bit of a beer geek, head over here and you're sure to find some new stuff you haven't tried before. If you're more beer curious, head over and chat with these friendly folks. They know their stuff and helped me to pick out some new beers.  There's a good range of price points here too so you could find a good gift here.   Website is also really useful and lists out everything they have if you like to head in with some ideas of what to grab.   Good atmosphere in there too if you're drinking in.   Overall highly recommend and glad they are here.

reviews.author: Greg W.
reviews.description: Review time kids!! So the bride is out of town for business, what does any good husband do???? He meets some buds for suds!!   We all met at another place for happy hour when bud 1 recommend this place for some take home treats. I mean,come on, we know a beer-n-burger nut like me can't say no.  This place is totally chill with a few picnic tables to relax and converse with friends. There is also a couple of other chairs if that's your thing. Sampling on sight is totally cool too.  On to the selection of beers. All I can say is,if you can't find something here that you would like, go home,empty handed and admit you have no taste. That's right, I threw the blame squarely on you! Why? Because they must have better than 300-400 different beers to choose from!  Now go, prove me wrong and try that chocolate oatmeal stout or triple ipa !!

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: A craft beer lover's nirvana. Come here peruse their extensive inventory pick out a beer and enjoy either on site or grab a few brews to go. I could go on but that's it. Come here and drink good beer, but.  These guys got it goin (sic) on where else can you find a Maine Brewing Co beers or a selection of IPAs that will blow your mind.   Folks here are friendly and of course knowledgable and provide a high level of customer service. Case in point I was out of town and a pal informed me that they had a very hard to find beer available. These nice folks held my order until I arrived, almost at closing time.  Nice folks and righteous brews!

reviews.author: Meg K.
reviews.description: Such a cool spot. I don't live in Cedar Park but I'll be making regular trips here to check out the cool beverages!

reviews.author: Whitney B.
reviews.description: I really can't say enough good things about the Brewtique.  They have an amazing variety of drinks and they're always bringing in new items. The team is incredibly helpful, very knowledgeable about their products, and all around just a couple of really cool folks.  Just tell them what you're in the mood for, and you'll absolutely receive a satisfying recommendation.  They're dog-friendly both in and outside, and are super welcoming to well-behaved pooches. They also do some really cool charity events on behalf of some great organizations. There's almost always something going on in the evenings -- live music, comedy shows, football games, game night, beer tastings.  They also have some neat retro arcade games and board games on hand to entertain.  There's always a reason to pop in and have a drinks!

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Great place. Owner always remembers you and knows what you like. They keep an amazing selection that is always changing. If you want to try some beers they have tables inside and outside. Personally love the selection of Texas beers and sours they have.

reviews.author: Catalina M.
reviews.description: Welcome to cedar park the brewtique! Had the absolute pleasure of coming here today. Great atmosphere, awesome beer selection and such a friendly welcoming owner.  The bottle shop that lived here prior (RIP) was great, but the new layout and even better beer selection really sets this place apart! Such a plethora of great beers and a cool little shop you can crack one open and enjoy it right there! Looking forward to my next visit!

reviews.author: Short Fuse S.
reviews.description: Just a fantastic place. I had a friend come in from San Antonio and he kept saying he wished there was a place like The Brewtique in his neighborhood. There's a great beer selection, and the owner is a really cool dude. Plus, they carry my favorite beer even though I'm the only one who buys it. That's dedication to customers!

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: Need a beer? I mean a great beer? Do you want to enjoy it while killer music played? How about suggested by avid beer enthusiasts. Well, you're home. Enough said. This place hits all the check boxes. Fast WiFi for work, big tables for games. Endless beer.

reviews.author: Javier A.
reviews.description: What can I say about Brewtique that hasn't already been said? Great and various beers available here keep me coming back and back. Mgmt is top notch, friendly, and above all knowledgeable. I am always impressed with the ambiance. It feels like a great big community. Service with a smile and a laugh makes my trip there memorable. Also they have great events, live music, and  board games to boot! 3 cheers and a beer for Brewtique.

reviews.author: Jarod P.
reviews.description: Love this place. Great selection. Knowledgeable owners.  Fair prices.  If you remember this location when it was under previous owners, you'll find it's been nicely updated, more tables, chairs and such, even arcade games.  Keep up the good work Brewtique.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Cool little place, glad to see that the old bottle shop here was replaced by another. Owner(s?) seem to care a bunch, and have been available to point out new releases/limited beers, make recommendations, and take pics of my dog.   Prices slightly higher than other big retailers, but selection is much better (tip: check their Instagram for limited beers and new stock). Also, a good selection of CBD products for those interested. I have never hung around to drink there, but you can for a small per-beer charge if you want.   Hope this place keeps getting tasty limited beverages and doesn't turn into a vape emporium like the last one!

reviews.author: kenneth m.
reviews.description: The Brewtique has the best selection of fresh beer in the area. Prices are more than fare, and the staff tends to go above and beyond to answer questions.  Bathroom is always clean and stocked with soft and plush 2-ply charmin, they don't skimp on the good stuff! The owner was quite nice and helped me carry my order to my car, even sent me a nice wink and a smile while I was pulling out.

reviews.author: Luis P.
reviews.description: Craft Beer. Wine. Cider. A great neighborhood little store that always has something that the big stores don't carry. All you have to do is to ask, and they'll give a great recommendation. It's probably the thing you'll always want to do as they carry seemingly hundreds of brands of beer.   And it seems like they are trying to bring more cool events to the Cedar Park area like Comedy nights and Movie nights. Check it out and check out their vintage pinball machines!

reviews.author: Justin C.
reviews.description: If you haven't been here, please stop by. This place is absolutely wonderful. Every time I go in, always greeted and asked if I need anything. There is always something special for a random night of the week. The price to pop a top is great, individual cans or packs is really nice. Exactly what a bottle shop should be. Looking forward to the future of this place. Best of luck.

reviews.author: Marion W.
reviews.description: Absolutely amazing. Great selection of beers. Really fun to pick out singles and drink them there or take them home for later. They have a lot of fun events throughout the week like game night, comedy night, and brewer educational events. The passion is obvious with the owners, and they're super friendly to boot. They're building a great community in a cool location. We love coming here and are so thrilled to have such a cool place so close to home!!

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: I love this place!  The beer selection is amazing, and the owners are above and beyond welcoming!  Every time I walk through the front door to grab one of their new arrivals, Scott and Jana greet me like an old friend.  Also it has so much more to offer than just beer, everything from game night to comedy shows and little bit everything else in between.

reviews.author: Mariana B.
reviews.description: We came for breakfast. It's a nice and spacious place. They brew coffee and beer. We ordered breakfast tacos, chilaquiles, bowl and croissant. Tacos is good, chilaquiles are very spice, croissant is good and bowl is ok. The latter and the hot chocolate came cold. The coffee was hot is good.

reviews.author: Brian T.
reviews.description: Okay this is my favorite coffee shop in the Austin area period.  I love how big and spacious this new location is, but the coffee is WHERE IT'S AT.  Definitely come here if you're looking for the perfect date spot, study/get work done, or just to enjoy a nice morning coffee and breakfast.  We ordered a hand pour over, a Chemex, and a double espresso.  The double espresso came out first and this one definitely packed a punch - don't let the espresso size cup fool you.  If I was just here for the caffeine content, this one definitely would've done the job alone.   The hand pour over came out next and the presentation was super impressive!  They bring you the entire carafe with the dripper on top, so it's definitely a lot.  Considering this is only $4, you definitely get your money's worth!  This one was so flavorful and the fruity notes definitely stood out while drinking it.  Now the Chemex...just wow.  For $5, they bring the entire Chemex setup to your table and you pour our of it as you drink.  The fact that they trust their patrons with the Chemex really speaks volumes about how much they care about the presentation piece!  Looks aside, this coffee (I believe we got Ethiopian) tasted amazing and on-par with the pour over.  Don't let me forget the breakfast tacos.  This was such a treat.  I got the Migas breakfast taco and this one was stuffed FULL with eggs, tortilla strips, and pico.  It was delicious and filling and for $3, this one definitely hit the spot alongside the coffee.  I also bought one of their coffee beer stouts to take home...I believe it was the House United coffee milk stout.  If taking home, you either order beer in a Crowler (two pint cans) or a Growler (64 oz).  I can't wait to try their coffee IN THEIR BEER.  But most of all, can't wait to come back here every time I'm in the area!

reviews.author: Thao E.
reviews.description: OH ! High anticipated location! I've been waiting for this location to open since they announced it on their Instagram.   They are having soft openings right now. The space is airy, has high ceilings, and gorgeous.   Being the soft opening, it looks like they are training some new people but they are nice as can be!  They also have Tacomaye on site now for your taco needs. I can't wait to make this my new work spot!  Support your local businesses!

reviews.author: Ru L.
reviews.description: The only thing this location doesn't have from the original is the coffee roaster. Other than that the beer is fresh, the coffee is hot, and the food is good. Tacos came fully filled with protein and veggies with two sides of salsa, one green, one red. Two thumbs up.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: This new location is the bomb! Prime selection of craft beer, coffee, tea, fountain sodas too. Plenty of seating, GREAT service, and super delicious food menu -- our favorite so far are the  carne asada loaded nachos -- a must try! Perfect for sharing . The place is really open and bright. Big screen TVs with sports playing. Family friendly. We love coming here for game night, dinner and cold beers.

reviews.author: Shannon A.
reviews.description: They care about their people because they had no kitchen on Independence Day.  The beer flight is great if your fickle or just want to try all the offing's.  It's not on the menu, but it's great.  Also had a London Fog that was absolutely delightful.  Looking forward to coming back for the soft shell crab!

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Nice location. Very clean and inviting. Knowledgeable and friendly  staff. Not a beer guy but the coffees and teas are solid.  It's not on the menu board, but they DO offer beer flights.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Been to this location several times, for both the coffee and the beer. Both are really good. Breakfast tacos are good. The soft shell crab sandwich was also good. The space is great for either socializing with friends or getting a little work done. Staff is friendly. Yeah, this is goi g to be a regular spot for me.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: Coffee review only. I've tried both locations multiple times hoping each time was a one-off. The coffee here is not good. Like really not good. Service has always been fine. Just really bad coffee.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: Food is average at best and the same cashier always gives me an attitude when I order for whatever reason.

reviews.author: Christy M.
reviews.description: This location is great! Nice open space and a good selection of beer. Haven't tried the food yet, but the coffee is also good.

reviews.author: Eric F.
reviews.description: Great decaf coffee and tacos were awesome but be warned the bacon is thicker than normal but still good.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: This is another place when we come down for a visit we always stop at! The coffee, beer, and food are fantastic! Then there is even dessert coffee.

reviews.author: Teresa M.
reviews.description: 2 stars for the new location - the beer is just as good as the original location and the food isn't bad, but there is zero character and no covered seating  This is Austin - people have dogs. I'm totally ok with sitting outside with my dog since you have a kitchen but man at least buy an awning or umbrellas or something. 4 random picnic tables thrown outside with no shade is an afterthought.

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Great coffee and amazing area to meet with friends or network on Wednesday mornings.  Stop in and support local.

reviews.author: Laura N.
reviews.description: I love the new location, closer to my home. The food and drink selection is superb. Service was fast and friendly. It's a big open room - simple but nice. The outside could probably be served better with some decor/ awnings or umbrellas. It's a good vibe inside and I'll be coming back!

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: Spacious, clean, industrial decor. Friendly service. Delicious coffee and breakfast tacos. The only thing I don't like is that they don't have comfortable seating. It's mostly wood picnic tables. There's one table that has chairs with backs and there are a few counter height chairs with backs. I love to hang out and linger at a coffee shop. This has the space, but it's just not comfortable. Adding  some cozy areas would make this place off the charts amazing.

reviews.author: Bri L.
reviews.description: Great brews, solid grinds and good people! The perfect local spot. Would highly recommend!

name: Culinary Dropout
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Valet Parking
Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Chastitie A.
reviews.description: Culinary Drop Out is a good place to recommended for a hang out spot with good food and drinks. Very trendy place, and there's usually live music on the weekends. The outside patio "pre-COVID" had lots of games for guest to play. There's enough TV's to watch sports from anywhere you're sitting. I recommend ordering the fried chicken and homemade mash potatoes. I think it's their most popular dish. The dish is fried to the perfect level of crisp, and it's very juicy!  I also like their salmon!  As far as the drinks, if I'm not ordering my usual Austin Eastcider, I'm getting their jalapeño margarita! One of the best in town!   The vibes are always good here.

reviews.author: Samantha L.
reviews.description: This is one of the biggest bar/restaurants I've ever been to in America! They have indoor seating and half outdoor seating (it's "outside" of the restaurant but still covered on all sides - great for when it's cold out!   It's a cool bar with live music and games but my favorite part is the food!   We got the cheese fondue that came with a bowl of pretzels and it was nothing I expected at all - pretzels are okay at best usually and most places has cheese that taste gross but this was the best pretzel/cheese combo I've ever had!! The pretzel balls were pretty big in size from what I was expecting, they were warm and perfectly seasoned and delicious! And then the cheese - wow I could literally drink a jar of it if I wasn't my age and getting heartburn everyday as is. I haven't stopped thinking about the pretzels and cheese since my first bite! I definitely want to go back to Austin just for this dish.   And then for entree my boyfriend and I split the butternut lasagna and they were so nice enough to split the dish for us without us having to ask.   Oh yeah and for drinks (I forgot to take a pic) but we got the Smashed Irishman and it was so good we ordered 5 through out dinner.   The staff was really nice and the place was super busy so some things took a little longer to come out and we were forewarned before ordering anyway.

reviews.author: Brittney T.
reviews.description: Wow - this place is SO good. We were in town for the weekend and decided to eat here because it's dog friendly and right near our hotel. Place was very busy on a Saturday night - multiple parties out on the porch.   I still dream about their chopped chicken salad! - so good!    They have a big drink menu with cute cocktails. Staff was so nice and my dog loved all the loving he got from everyone there.   It's definitely a casual/loud/fun ambiance!

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: I originally discovered CD when I used to live in Arizona. It was always THE spot to hang out on the weekends with large groups. I was happy to see CD had an Austin location!  We came on a week night and it was still pretty crowded. Wait time was about 30 minutes, so that gave us some time to walk around and do some window shopping at the Domain. Once we were seated, we put it our order right away.  Pretzels and Fondue: The softest pretzels!!! Perfect for dipping in the provolone cheese sauce. We actually got 2 rounds of these as they were that good.  El Matador: tequila, elderflower, ginger agave, and orange bitters. This is my favorite drink here. Has enough of a fruit taste without being overly sweet. And the bartender made it with a lot of love. Lol. Only 2 drinks and I was finished for the night.  Our server was really great and kept checking on us throughout the night. Fun crowd. Fun music. And a really fun time.

reviews.author: Katelyn W.
reviews.description: Me and my friend wanted to go somewhere to have a drink and visit. This place had the best outdoor area and so we have them a chance. I love Brussels so I had to try their Brussels sprouts. They are delicious and super spicy. Next we ordered some pork belly nachos which were so tasty. However it was too much food for the both of us. You definitely need a large group for them to be worth it. Overall would go back to this place.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: I've been here a couple times now. My favorite thing about this restaurant is the outdoor patio area! It's open and airy but nice and shaded too. I've been here for brunch and got the breakfast burrito. It is huge and it's pretty good! I'd have to say my favorite menu item so far is the fried chicken! The breading is crispy and the meat juicy. The portion is pretty large so you get to take some home! Overall this place is a good go-to spot!

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: Originally was going to stop for a quick lunch but got ahead of ourselves when looking at the menu.   Brussel Sprouts (3/5): not crispy like I expected it to be but the flavor was solid and unique.  Salad (4/5): they made kale taste good. that's impressive!   36-hour Pork Ribs (3/5): very sauce-y and therefore, very messy. At least the flavor was decent. The ribs itself were are not very tender.   Steak Frites (3.5/5): not bad but also not great. The salad on the side was great tho.   Korean BBQ Skirt Steak (4/5): lots of flavorrrr. Better than the Steak Frites. The meats on these two dishes actually tasted the same but this one had sauce. I actually liked this main the most out of the ones that we tried!   Overall, chill spot for a nice dinner with friends. I would rate this place a 3/5 for the food but probably bump it up because of the ambiance. There's lots of space and a few games to play so the vibes probably make up for the food.

reviews.author: Nelli S.
reviews.description: Really good food, really hip atmosphere. My family enjoyed watching the food be prepared through the glass. We tried the burgers, the pork nachos, the salmon, and the kale salad. The Kale salad was incredible. I would have given a higher rating accept that it seemed our waiter forgot about us and we waited over 45 minutes for our food and appetizer. Otherwise, I think it is worth a try and the whole area of downtown Austin is great for kids.

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: 10-25-21  Quality/Quantity - Gochujang Brussels Sprout - I would have preferred the brussel sprouts to have been a little more crispy. Could not really taste the gochujang flavor, not spicy at all. Kurobuta Pork Ribs - My favorite, good flavor. Would have preferred more fries though. Spicy Vegan Curry - My daughter's choice, I guess it was good, but not something I would have ordered. Had a hint of lemon grass after taste, which is a little different from Indian or Thai Curry. Separated rice versus rice combined in the sauce is also preferred, so we can control the flavor.  Atmosphere - This is a very good spot. I like both the indoor and outdoor space. There were a few activities (cornhole, etc) for the guests. I like the choices of seating - regular tables, high top tables, bar seating, couches, etc. Additionally, your huge wrap around bar was nice. Lastly, I am always a fan of an open kitchen concept.  Service - Julia did a good job; she came back and refilled our water often. It was really busy and the entire team seemed to be working hard. I also noticed 2 employees picking up garbage as they walked back and forth serving customers, this is always a positive plus.  Price - $49.80 + tip  Owner Suggestion - Seems like you are very successful, owning quite a few restaurants. Congrats on all your success, and wish you many more. I look forward to trying your other restaurants in the future.

reviews.author: Erin S.
reviews.description: We had a party of 8 at 1:30 pm on the Friday of ACL weekend. It was pretty packed, but they were able to accommodate us. Service was great!  Here's what I tried: - Evil Jungle Princess ($13): This fruity rum drink was good! - Soft Pretzels and Provolone Fondue ($13.25): The pretzel bread was good. The cheese was good. $13.25 is a lot for what it is though. - Gojuchang Brussels Sprouts ($6): It maybe came with 5-6 total brussels sprouts. It tasted good, but super not worth it. - The M.A.C. Burger ($14.50): Their take on a McDonald's Big Mac. It was good!  Fun vibes. Convenient if you're staying in the Domain.

reviews.author: Candace S.
reviews.description: Our experience eating at Culinary Dropout was nothing short of perfection. We went on a Monday night with all three of our very young kids. It was busy but there wasn't a wait if we wanted to sit outside. I was concerned because of how cold it was outside, but they assured us that the heating lamps outside kept it pretty comfortable so we could check and feel it out if we wanted. They were correct; between the heat lamps and the heated seating (amazing!), we faired well.   Our server was very helpful and knowledgeable of the menu. He recommended his favorites to us and we took him up on them. I ordered the Spicy Korean Skirt Steak and my husband ordered the Prime Rib sandwich. They were both absolutely delicious. Like finger-licking good. I seriously can't wait to go back. I also love that they have a kids menu and are more than willing to bring the kids food out first if you ask! We will be returning to try the ribs soon!

reviews.author: Darris J.
reviews.description: This muthafucka is LOUD. You literally have to shout at a person 12 inches away from you. Just ridiculous. Food is alright nothing spectacular, can't comment on cocktails or mixed drinks. Wine and whiskey list is serviceable.   If invited again I'm definitely making up some sort of excuse to not go.

reviews.author: Savannah M.
reviews.description: This place was such a good vibe. We came for brunch, and it would have been an hour wait but open seating at the bar. To my husband and my luck there were 2 seats open.  It was Sunday around 2ish and there was a guy singing with his guitar.  The speakers were amazing you can hear him inside and out on the patio.  Friendly staff. The food was so good. My husband and I are some carnivores but today we both ordered vegetarian options  Don't let that fool you. Both dishes were packed with flavor. My favorite was the vegetarian spicy curry. Holy cow was it good. So good. Would definitely visit again!!

reviews.author: Allison C.
reviews.description: With its large patio, good food, and extensive drink selection, Culinary Dropout is a great place to come relax with friends. The restaurant is large and has plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. I arrived at around 5:45 on a weekday and did not have to wait to be seated.   I ordered the Fried Chicken and Between You and Me to drink. Both were delicious and definitely recommended. The portion sizes are large enough that I had leftovers. My friend ordered the Monkey Bread for dessert. It smelled delicious (and according to him tasted delicious) but I was too full for even another bite.

reviews.author: Taylor M.
reviews.description: The food at Culinary Drop Out never disappoints. Brunch or dinner, they have great options. I especially love the build your own charcuterie option. I recently went for brunch and we had cheeses, meat, and Brussels sprouts on ours. The Gochujang sauce on the Brussels is amazing. It's sweet and a little spicy. I could have eaten a whole order to myself, they were that good. I also loved the Wellness Retreat cocktail. It has a slight spice and it's a change up from just getting a mimosa.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: It's something about the atmosphere that continue to have my attention. The service is attentive and coming to CD for a good piece of fried anything works for me.   At this point I just need to wait for the games to return. The waitress shared that before Covid they had games for adults like png pong.  I'm ready!!

reviews.author: Alexis W.
reviews.description: The aura was nice. The salmon was meh. You really gotta be in the mood for that. The wedge was good just know that when they say maple glazed bacon, they mean it. It's really sweet. Chopped salad was great! As was "yesterday's soup". I sat outside on the long button tufted couch (very restoration hardware-ish) Favorite part about this place was definitely the energy, sitting outside in dim light, space heaters tufted sofas? Yes please!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: We've heard great things about this place and decided to give it a try for brunch. Made a reservation. Glad we did, as it filled up fast soon after we were seated.   This is a great place for large groups. More bar than restaurant.   Cocktails were tasty and reasonably priced. Large selection of beer on tap. The menu is a little thin, and our brunch items weren't anything special.   Service was top notch. We'd come back for happy hour, but probably not for a meal.

reviews.author: Tara N.
reviews.description: We had been trying to get here for a while and we're excited to finally make it in. Unfortunately, we probably won't be returning.   Food: We ordered the pretzel fondue, the breakfast sandwich, the breakfast burrito, and the hash.   The pretzel fondue was 'meh' at best. The bread that came with it didn't really have that pretzel texture and very little salt. Provolone cheese is a pretty light tasty cheese so it didn't taste great as a fondue.   The other food items were great but all came out lukewarm or cold. Which, relates to the...  Service: It took a long time for the food to come out and my guess is that's why it was cold. Because it has taken so long to get there, we were too hungry to send it back.   The server was forgetful and/ or missed the details. For example, we had to ask three times for a bowl for the dog. Many servers just bring one out automatically when they see a doggo but, even if they don't, it doesn't take three reminders.   Overall, service was slow and not, well, service-oriented. For example, my friend and I both had coffee and my friend asked for a refill. The waitress stepped away and I assumed she was getting the pot for a refill. Nope. She came back with a new cup for my friend and took off. So, I'm sitting there looking at my bear empty cup. As someone who was a server for many years, it seems so obvious to me that you should ask the other person if they'd like coffee as well especially when it's near empty. That's just one example of the just miss when it comes to great service.   Other details: - The ambiance and big open patio was great which *may* pull me back for a drink or something. Then again, you can get the same at other places in the domain.  - They didn't offer corn tortillas which I feel is really strange. My friend has celiac's and can't do gluten but corn tortillas are fine. Since they didn't have corn tortillas (or a gluten free bread option) it limited her options significantly. Granted, they said they could do lettuce wraps but let's not pretend like that's the same.   I don't think I'll be returning to Culinary Dropout.

reviews.author: Kristine C.
reviews.description: Popular restaurant located in the domain! They are usually pretty busy during the nighttime but not too crowded during lunchtime. They had one vegan option - the spicy vegan curry which tasted like Thai curry. It was pretty yummy but the portion was not super filling for the price in my opinion, so my only wish is that there was more! Overall solid place for vegans and non vegans to enjoy a meal in the domain!

name: Nate's
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Glenn P.
reviews.description: The best place to meet for drinks between Austin and San Marcos. Love their outdoor patio and the inside is great for warmer days. I would give them 5 stars if they had more of a food selection. They are worth 5 stars all day.

reviews.author: Glenn B.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a nightcap and stumbled into trivia night. Perfect. What wasn't perfect was the bartender. Husky Filipino/ Hispanic bruh with a gray shirt and backwards cap. Never got his name because he was too busy looking pissed off at the world and just couldn't be bothered. Ordered two drinks, a beer and a cocktail. He poured the beer then asked for my card. I said "Oh, I also had a whiskey". He said " I know". Pretty rudely. Asked if I was starting a tab. I said "No. I'll pay as I go". Then not a word after. Now I work in the airline industry and have really thick skin. But, his attitude did not set well with me. Especially since his job includes tipping for service. Why cut your nose off despite your face?    Told my wife what had transpired. She went in to see for herself. Even she said he was rude.   But he had time to chat up regulars and a cute girl sitting at the end of the bar.   The only thing that salvaged the experience was the host for trivia night and the waitress working the outside patio. She had lots of people out there. Took care of all of us with a great attitude and friendliness.   Probably will not come back. Too bad. The place had potential.

reviews.author: Rick Z.
reviews.description: After getting the frozen margarita flight next door at Los Olivos, we weren't quite ready to head home, so we walked over to Nate's where my bro and his wife got another alcoholic beverage, while my partner got an espresso and I got a hot chocolate. The hot chocolate is a bit pricey ($4) but it's prepared with the espresso machine to froth the whipped cream directly, so it gives it a nice smooth feel that's quite a yummy experience.  Their outdoor seating was pretty full, so we opted to sit indoors and take one of the corner booths where there were pillows to cozy up on. The outdoor deck is really nice, positioned under a grand oak tree with lots of string lighting, along with a long firepit for cooler weather! Get there early before dusk to secure yourself a spot, is my advice.  While there are a few deli sandwiches and the like to partake in, this joint is mainly a bar with a variety of drinks. Scan the QR code to view on your phone and order with the guy behind the counter.  The inside decor rocks the industrial vibe that's become so in fashion currently. Bathrooms are clean and well-stocked.

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is such a cool bar and it would be cool in Austin not just Buda!  The ambience is really cool and their signature cocktails are amazing! I definitely want to go back it is a fun place to hang out and the service is awesome.  They are taking all of the proper precautions and it is worth a drive from wherever you are to come visit this place and hang out either inside or outside depending on the weather.

reviews.author: Sophia L.
reviews.description: I love Nate's. It's cafe/bar is cute. The low rating has to do with the female bartender that worked tonight Saturday 02/20/2021. She is abrupt, rude and has a huge ego. She looked miserable and seemed to hate working tonight. I noticed over 10 people walk out of the bar due to her attitude. She was annoyed by everyone. When I gave our order she made an ugly face as if my order was a bother. She continued to get worse during the night. She doesn't belong in a career of customer service. Her sour attitude has cost the place to lose money and new customers.

reviews.author: Carter C.
reviews.description: Growing up, I had a best friend named Nate.  When I heard about this place, I assumed it was his.  Just like when we were kids, I burst through the door and scream "Hey Fart Face"! Everyone turned and looked but there was no Nate.  I asked everyone but no one had seen fart face.  Disappointed with not seeing Nate, I passed the time with some great drinks on the spacious deck.  I never found Nate.  I wanted to relive some of the great times we had growing up watching snowy HBO to catch a glimpse of something we shouldn't and seeing if his sister was still single.

reviews.author: Kay S.
reviews.description: Excellent service and amazing live band on the open patio. It had amazing atmosphere and best tequila mule I have ever had!

reviews.author: Kyndal C.
reviews.description: Nates is a nice spot to go to grab a drink on the patio and the patio is super nice. Unfortunately there is a bartender that works there that has the WORST attitude. She is super rude and I asked why she was being so sassy, and she said "because it's fun".  All of the other bartenders/servers were absolutely delightful and I hate for this to make them look bad.   Here's the thing, I have worked in customer service and in the industry for a long time, I get it, some days SUCK, but the way that this young lady was acting was unacceptable and I agree that she does not belong in customer service. I also agree that Nates is losing money and customers because of her.   I hope that she finds another industry that she enjoys, because clearly this isn't it and her tone clearly states it.

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: Who knew this quaint bistro type place existed in "Bubba land"?  Great cocktails, coffees, pastries/ desert and sandwiches. This establishment also lets pizza deliveries arrive too. What a wonderful place to stop and share with friends!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: We approve of Nate's. Buda deserves a great neighborhood bar. Like the industrial decor. Great seating inside around the bar, at tables, and outside on the patio. An abundance of Misters and fans make even an August afternoon comfortable outside.   Great selection of local craft beers on tap and nice happy hour prices.   The real reason we came and why we'll come back: the Bartenders. They are friendly and know what they are doing. Well crafted original and classic cocktails. We threw a few obscure requests their way and they made perfect drinks without having to consult the "googles." That will always get my crowd to become loyal repeat patrons.

reviews.author: Keyana S.
reviews.description: Nate's is great and love their live music on certain days. I'm hoping to bring my friends here again whenever they do open the patio again.

reviews.author: Kyra H.
reviews.description: I can't believe I hadn't been to Nate's before now! It was less than 10min from my apartment off of Slaughter previously and now 5min from my house. So you could say this will definitely be my new home away from home (watch out Target).  Their deck is the huge selling point for me! It is huge with a beautiful tree for shade. There are all sorts of seating arrangement options from comfy outdoor chairs and couches to metal chairs and tables and the bonus of the long gas fire pit. At night, there are beautiful light up stars hanging from the tree that adds to the ambiance. I love that it feels like you are just hanging in your backyard with a couple of friends. Every time I have been, I have left with new friends. It might be the small town feel that makes everyone nice. The drink prices are another reason I keep on coming back! Their beers are such a great deal. I love that I can go out with a couple of friends, have a couple of beers, and not break the bank.

reviews.author: Vince A.
reviews.description: I really like Nate's, they always have great spins on craft cocktails, a really fun atmosphere, and great themed parties.

reviews.author: Amy Q.
reviews.description: I'm saddened to say that I don't think I'll ever go to Nate's again.  I have lived in Buda for several years and make an effort to support local businesses but I have tried Nate's 3 times now and every single time the same bartender has the WORST attitude and has ruined my night out for the last time.  The first couple of times I just brushed it off but he seriously is so foul and unwelcoming that I can't stand going there.  He not only has been rude to me, but also my family members, and most recently friends visiting from out of town.    Management- if you want people to frequent your business, get rid of staff that obviously hate their job.

reviews.author: Jenny E.
reviews.description: Nice place to hang. Very comfy, and good music. Employees seem rushed and uninterested.  The owners' investment in Nate's well-appreciated ambiance is ruined by its lack of staff engagement. EASY FIX!

reviews.author: Melanie F.
reviews.description: Nate's is a craft cocktail lovers dream come true in the slim pickins town of Buda!! When I first moved here from south Austin I was very worried I wouldnt have a bar close by that could meet my high standards. The staff at Nates really know what they are doing. The drink specials are fantastic and creative. They make an amazing Sazerac, which is really hard to come by in these parts. I also really love their Mexican Martinis, The Last Word, and house made Lemoncello! My only critical feedback is that sometimes the guy bartenders aren't very friendly and welcoming. But the ladies are always super sweet.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Cocktails and bartenders were not so strong when it first opened but each year has improved dramatically! Went for Maddie gras this past February and it was crowded and still tons of fun. Great event-themed cocktails and great bartenders that know what they're doing. The cuvée coffee isn't my thing but it appears to be a big hit with other people! Had some cake balls while enjoying my fruity cocktail that was delicious and beautifully decorated. Nate's is a solid local bar for hang out time with friends, casual trivia game playing and for unwinding after a stressful day.

reviews.author: Lysa T.
reviews.description: Amazing cocktails, atmosphere, music, and even pastries! Haven't had the small selection of sandwiches they offer.... I've seen some people bring pizza on the patio from an outside restaurant but not sure if that was technically allowed.   I get the drink special every time and so far I've never been disappointed. Been about 3 times and I'd say the only thing "bland" is the service. I hate to say it but my service experience every single time was less than friendly. Not rude but.... just not welcoming. Which is sad since this place is so awesome. It's not bland enough to keep me coming back, just hope they see this and take it as constructive feedback and hopefully improve!!! I think the girls have been more friendly than the guys.   Either way, 4 stars! YUM.

reviews.author: Ruben C.
reviews.description: Linda listen.  You have ATX. You have SAT. Each great in their own right in terms of culinary and mixology prowess.  Enter Buda, TX.  Nate's could be described as country chic meets 21st century industrial look.  The 3-4ish times I've been have been exceptional. Not only is the staff fantastic but if you ask nicely, the staff will share their beverage and beverage history with you.  Nate, Shelly and Clarie are personable and what the ideal bar staff should be: professional,  knowledgeable yet friendly and engaging.  If anything, their old fashioned is a must; best I've had.   While they do not have a kitchen, they do offer snacks.  These are brought in daily from local businesses  (sandwiches, salads, etc.) They do have meat and cheese trays they make there which are made with quality meat and cheeses. The selection changes daily so check the counter (immediately as you come in) for what they have available.  18 craft beers on tap and craft cocktails? Buda, you're soon becoming my favorite non metroplex destination.  Muah!

reviews.author: Thao E.
reviews.description: This place is adorable!! I was in the area and needed a place to hang out for a few hours. There's a big parking lot. It's, I guess, considered to be in downtown Buda. I'm not familiar with the area but this place is gorgeous. It has an outside patio area that is really nice. The place was crowded outside. It was busy inside too but there was lots of seating available.   I had a drink Knights of Ni and it was delicious!! I'm glad I listened to the recommendation and gave it a try. Next time I'm in the area, I will definitely hang out here again!

reviews.author: Mattie I.
reviews.description: There is a lot of breweries in the area but Celis is one of my favorite. They are family and women owned and very receptive and kind to their customers. They have reposted my pictures on social media and allowed a close friend to film a short film there for free. The beers are unique and delicious, with lots of options on tap! They have nightly specials and events, all of which are fun! For example trivia on mondays and Thursday, and they have little long horn saloon come do chicken shit bingo once a month there as well. At one point I was going every week for the Tuesday 99c east coast oysters. Among many other specials. There has been some miscommunication in the past with showing games but the manager working at the time is always very quick to help out. For example none of the TVs had sound on when they advertised they all did, there was confusion inside but the manager was outside and apologized and immediately turned on the sound inside and changed to social media to reflect inside. I also noticed that someone had paid to play the juke box and he paused their songs and gave them a free beer for rhe inconvenience. The dog park is also very nice and spacious and the new beer patio is very well put together! I am looking forward to live music!   Unrelated to Celis itself, but Black draft pizza truck is good there but overpriced. I am excited to try the new con todo truck!

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: Average spot for some beers  Came through on a weekend afternoon. had some drinks at the inner tap room. overall, the place was a bit meh. the beer didn't really stand out, and I am not really sure why, but the vibe of the place just seemed off. It wasn't a terrible experience, but I probably won't see myself back here in the future. Overall: 2.5/5.

reviews.author: M P.
reviews.description: Solid beer, beautiful taproom, nice beertenders. I continue to not understand why they pump their music so loud. This place should be pretty chill - there's nine people here either chatting (or trying to) or working as I type - but they're blasting the music as always. It's kind of bizarre, doesn't fit the vibe, but they always do it. Thus I knocked off a star.  Look for oyster nights, a real highlight here.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Love the beer and bartenders are awesome! There's a giant fenced area for dogs to play. They also have a huge beer garden with a stage for live music and two different food trucks. Got to randomly enjoy oysters here too. Definitely a go to brewery.

reviews.author: Ken Y.
reviews.description: I recently visited Austin after quite a few years, and maaaan... has it changed.  Aside from all of the gentrification and inflation, there are some pretty positive things happening here.  Food joints and breweries are everywhere it seems!   That said, Celis is one fine brewery.  My Austinite friend and I stopped through for a few cold ones.  Great service, chill atmosphere, huge drink selection.

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: The outdoor lighting drew us to this place.  There are seats outside and inside and they serve delicious craft beer.  There are also daily specials that we want to return for, such as, oysters on the half shell for $1 each served on Tuesdays.    We brought our craft beers outside and enjoyed them immensely. The customer service you get is above and beyond! Thank you!!  They have good prices and you get what you pay for. This is a must place to try and I recommend it to anyone that loves a good dark - or light - craft beer. You will not be disappointed you came.

reviews.author: Sasa S.
reviews.description: We didn't like most of the beers on our flights. Perhaps we aren't the right audience, as this brewery specializes in the sweeter Belgian style beers, but we tried beers across the spectrum and although some were ok there were none we felt we'd go back for a pint of. The atmosphere was cool and medieval feeling inside though and it looks like they have tons of weekly events like trivia etc.

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: The front of house versus the back was a big contrast. Front of house was a nightmare. They were blaring music so loud - outside - that we couldn't have a conversation across the table. Every customer looked like they were only there for Instagram pictures and the perfume was so thick you could see it hanging in the air. The waitress inside is ummm... dressed to get big tips. Ahem. Then you go back to the outdoor concert area, and it's a lot of families with kids and regular people. Weird. Beer was okay, but after the cloud of perfume I was honestly too sick to drink. Maybe someday I'll come back and avoid the front entirely. Then I went to cash out and the walking cloud of perfume was in front of me in line.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Love love love the new outdoor area at Celis! This has always been a super dog friendly brewery but now there's even a dog park! Beer is always good here. I'm normally an IPA person, but found their Mexican lager to be great on a hot day. Lots of outdoor seating and a couple of TVs to catch the game. There's some food trucks on site too. Definitely turning into the new go to spot with the pups

reviews.author: Jocelyne V.
reviews.description: This is officially my favorite Brewery for happy hour in North Austin. Their selection is amazing and the atmosphere is both relax and inviting.  I highly recommend the raspberry beer and the sour cherry one, I can't wait to go back and try their tropical fruits and lime!  They have a taco truck with very good braised Tacos and que so as well.

reviews.author: Brittany L.
reviews.description: One of my all time favorite breweries. Their Raspberry beer is incredible. I stock up every-time I'm in Austin! Go check'em out and their awesome food truck outside.

reviews.author: Veronica H.
reviews.description: Great place to have a good drink and date night. Great atmosphere. I will be back! My friend love the beer.

reviews.author: Bill K.
reviews.description: Staff not wearing masks, Backdraft Pizza staff not wearing masks, patrons not wearing masks. That makes us feel safe and secure that all is now well.....  Nice space, good music with a casual atmosphere where you can even bring along man's best friend, both inside and outside.  Backdraft Pizza OK, nothing great nothing bad.... Celis Hazy; tasted like cardboard, and the Raspberry Beer, not so good.

reviews.author: Caitlin G.
reviews.description: Lots of parking Outdoor and Indoor Seating  Really appreciate Celis hosting a vegan pop-up over the weekend! We came for the food and decided to check out the brewery as well. The music inside was pretty loud, but I'm also an old lady.  It was pretty easy to find a seat indoors and out. I only wish they had a non-beer/gluten-free alcoholic option like cider or wine. Please add this to your menu in the future!

reviews.author: Amanda D.
reviews.description: Great place. Beer is tasty (I really liked the Mexican lager) and the staff are very friendly. I also liked that there were two different food trucks for options. Can't say much else other than I would go back for sure.

reviews.author: An T.
reviews.description: The outdoor beer garden either corn hole set up is such a gem! The food trucks are tasty too. I highly recommend the Neapolitan pizza! My friends and I love coming here for the drinks, especially right before an Austin FC game. It's not too crowded and there's plenty of seating inside and outside!

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Super chill place with great people and two new fantastic food trucks, family run Neapolitan style pizza and delicious Hawaiian plates (shrimp is fantastic).

reviews.author: Abigail G.
reviews.description: Went to this brewery for their Tuesday's $1 oyster special, and had a great time! The brewery is easy to get to, has plenty of parking, and tucked away in a low key part of north Austin. Perfect place to stop by after work on a weekday. The oysters were outstanding, the price is awesome for east coast oysters. We also tried some of their beer, the Raspberry flavored beer is a must, absolutely loved it.

reviews.author: Mercedes R.
reviews.description: Recently moved to Austin. So scooping out great hangout spots. I have to say this will become a regular spot. My boyfriend and I aren't even beer drinkers but we enjoyed the drinks! I tried the strawberry lemonade seltzer and was hooked. He tried the raspberry beer and grand cru, definitely great choices. We also grabbed some pizza and that was delicious as well! We'll be back!

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: How and why have I not reviewed Celis!?! I'll put it down to old age.  Celis, as y'all know, is an Austin institution- steeped in history, the first craft brewer to bring Belgian beer to the craft world in ATX (I think), so y'all can rest knowing that their wheat beers are AWESOME.
