The tap room is large, airy, albeit a little dimly lit. There's patio seating outside and get this- DOGS ALLOWED INSIDE AND OUT!   They also welcome kids! Actually I think everyone is welcome here. It's one of the friendlier breweries in ATX IMHO.  We've visited almost every Sunday during covid and I can say that they're taking every precaution. There's live music on the weekends from 6-9pm.  Beer wise - I like the options. If you're a sour beer connoisseur, you'll enjoy the raspberry sour. Light beer? Lo Lo Lager. Safe, easy drinking? Celis White.  I know this place has had its ups and down but as Austinites, we need to show support to our local businesses and just be cool with each other.

reviews.author: Bryon T.
reviews.description: Visited for the 1st time on Friday 6/25/21.  Had the pleasure of meeting the owners who were very friendly, helping serve customers.  The gentleman who served us our beers was also very friendly.   The beers were all very good and we enjoyed our flights.  Sometimes new breweries take time to develop a good list of beers, but I was impressed.   The setting was nicely laid out and decorated.  Indoor seating with AC for those hot days, as well as outdoor seating.   Check out Vacancy and support local independent breweries!!

reviews.author: Tina N.
reviews.description: New brewery with lots of seating inside and out and dog friendly! Also has a food truck on site and is down the street from St Elmos, Austin Winery etc. The beer was good and I imagine as more people hear about it, the vibe will pick up!

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: We came here what I believe was opening weekend! They had 5 beers on tap, with the option to get a flight (3 pours- $7), beers to go, or full pours to enjoy. They  had staples like a Pilsner, or you can try something a little different like the sparkling golden ale (IMO heavy on the brut flavor). They have seating inside as well as outside, and they're dog friendly! They also had some cute shirts/apparel with their logo on it for purchase. I'm looking forward to coming back and trying this place once they expand their selection a little bit, but overall it was good! It's also right down the way from St Elmos Brewing, so add it to your list and hit them up when you're in the area/getting your beer fix.

reviews.author: Jeff W.
reviews.description: Spectacular!  Taps are unreal top to bottom. If you miss the Juicy Lucy or the June, you're mistaken.

reviews.author: Steven A.
reviews.description: Add this to your list! The beer is great and so is the vibe. There's seriously not a bad beer on tap, so try them all. They've got Indoor/outdoor seating and are dog friendly. To top it all off the staff is really friendly!   P.S You'll thank yourself for trying the food truck   Cheers!

reviews.author: Amanda B.
reviews.description: Not inclusive at all. Felt really uncomfortable after walking in and asking some questions. Implied I was old and didn't know about beer. Kinda weird since I am a brewer from another state and I didn't realize there was an age limit on beer.

reviews.author: Martin P.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! Great selection of beers, great atmosphere, seating inside and out, and dog friendly. The food truck was good too and it was nice to get to chat with the owners a little bit - good luck to them!

reviews.author: Russell B.
reviews.description: Great beers especially loved the IPAs space is really cool and well designed. Will be back again soon.

reviews.author: Brenda G.
reviews.description: Crafter's Cocktails is a great business providing quality drink mixers for great value!  I love that delivery is provided with each order in the Austin area.  They release their weekly mixers during the week so make sure you're on their list serve.  I was able to get a holiday drink mix that I paired with some liquor I already had.  The mix paired really well and each drink would be the equivalent of a $16+ cocktail if I'd had it at most Austin establishments.  You can also recycle the bottles they use by placing them outside during your next delivery

name: Gourdough's Public House
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Late Night, Dessert
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: Gordough's is a MUST TRY for any sweet lover! The warm fresh donut with delicious toppings is my family's favorite for dessert. My best friend was visiting from out of town during the holidays,. We took her there and she fell in love with the Nutty Valentine (extra pecans). She requested that we go there a second time before she was going to fly back. We of course, happily obliged! My go to is the nutty valentine with a topping of pecans, my son loves the black out, and my husband loves the black betty with icing on the side.  We hope to try the savory donuts the next time we're there, it's just so hard to decide between sweet or savory!

reviews.author: Jim S.
reviews.description: I really wanted to love this place.  The place is cool and the vibe is great - loved the 90s music and TVs playing lots of great random stuff. The wait staff was super nice and helpful.    The menu is also amazing - so many thing we wanted to try. We went for the fried green tomatoes, the Buffalo chicken sandwich and the country fried chicken. When our food arrived everything was beautiful. Really great presentation. But unfortunately when we tasted it we were in for a big disappointment. Everything just tasted like salt. The flavors of the toppings and donuts all just blended together with nothing interesting or any pops of fresh flavor. I will say everything was cooked to perfection, but the flavor was just off/missing.   Bummer.

reviews.author: Micah R.
reviews.description: First experience there.  Waitress really woke up on the wrong side of the bed. We didn't get a phone signal inside for the contactless menus, so we asked for three physical ones, and she came back with two and said "is two okay"? She only had three tables total to work, and we saw her on her phone quite a bit. After waiting about thirty minutes to order, she finally came up and as we were ordering, she rolled her eyes and walked away. It was clear she wanted us to leave, so we did.   I understand being short-staffed, but again she only had three tables to work. All in all, terrible.

reviews.author: Minly L.
reviews.description: There is nothing I like more than mixing sweet with savory. It is extremely satisfying when executed successfully, so shout out to Gourdough's for doing it extremely well.   I was actually expecting the doughnut to be sweeter on my dish, and I'm happy it was not. Everything really paired well together.   The vibe is very Austin-esque and the staff was super friendly. My friend asked for no cheese on her burger, they put cheese, but the waitress happily got it fixed up for us.   I can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Ken D.
reviews.description: Gourdough's answers the questions that you didn't know you had. And the answer is always donuts!    How do you make mozzarella sticks better?   Wrap them in donut dough, aka The Big Cheez.   How do you make a breakfast sandwich better?  Serve it on donuts.  The McGourdough is maple sausage, egg, and cheese (on donuts, of course) with maple on the side (opted not to have the pour-over). There's plenty of maple flavor in the sausage so I never used the side of maple syrup.   Once again, how do you make Kolaches better?  You guessed it, use donut dough, aka Gotchie Yo Kolache  And finally, is it even possible to make a Cuban sandwich even better?  Yup! The Cubano, a Cuban sandwich on donuts.   I'm shocked that they didn't figure out how to serve me my beer in a donut!  That's right, a full-bar to go with all that doughy goodness!  Donuts and alcohol, what more do you need?

reviews.author: Trevor L.
reviews.description: This was my first by time here and was sort of disappointed in what I received; I guess my expectations were higher. The description state "crispy fried fillet chicken breast smothered in honey butter."  I did request to have the honey butter on the side. I got two chicken tenders instead of a chicken breast (not to be too critical but the description should be updated if chicken breast = chicken tenders). The honey butter sauce was not what I was expecting; (not a fan). On the bright side, the donut was pretty good. Even thought it wasn't a chicken breast,  the tenders were tasty and had a good crunch.   I did order the miss shortcake and it was pretty good. But nothing special I suppose. Maybe I'll try a sandwich instead so get a full experience. I'll try them again and see if I get a different experience.

reviews.author: Lia F.
reviews.description: my dad worked here when it was a food truck then they decided they were so cool and wanted a restaurant. it was fun while it lasted. i used to make my own donuts. shh don't tell anyone lol. also that guy from wilfred came there once and i saw him. pretty cool. ok bye.

reviews.author: Brandon A.
reviews.description: Unique food, happy energy. The food here is comfort food on steroids. You're probably gonna want to prematurely call an ambulance if you go all the way with donut meal+drinks but it'll definitely be worth it.

reviews.author: Mechila B.
reviews.description: I came here with a couple of friends yesterday and there was something off abt this place. The food was AMAZING, don't get me wrong, but off vibes.   1. Smells super weird in there Idk if I'm smelling old oil or what but it's weird.  2. There are lots of people working here, yet getting service or someone's attention was hard. We were approached when we first walked in and then after that, it was half assed.  3. I got the cucumber mint drink and it's like a mojito but with rum and cucumber instead of mint. Wasn't my fave, wasn't sweet enough, just tasted like cucumber water and lime juice.  4. Our donuts were really good but I was told by my friend that they were smaller than the donut food truck which is disappointing.  I got the sin a bomb and it tasted just like a cinnamon roll. My friends got the cherry bombs and peach donut and we all enjoyed it!  5. Vibes were just off and my friends agreed. If you're looking for good food, sure, but if you're a vibes type person like us, you'll feel weird here lol.

reviews.author: Aurora M.
reviews.description: From a small food truck to full blown restaurant, Gordoughs still has it! Lots of variety and still the tried and true Gordoughs doughnuts they're known for. The menu is entertaining and interesting to say the least! We got the saucy cock (LOL) which was amazing! I was looking forward to the Count Gordough Cristo, but it flopped in my opinion. The sandwich arrived cold and the ham was colder so I don't recommend this dish. Other than that, lots of TVs to watch the game and great drinks of all kinds!

reviews.author: Kim L.
reviews.description: Was super excited when I heard about Gourdough's and they did not disappoint. We were seated pretty quickly and our waitress was super nice in getting us situated and being patient with us when we were figuring out our order.  There's plenty of seating both indoors and outdoors with additional bar seating. Lots to offer in terms of a drink menu with beer on tap too. Since it was the middle of the day, we opted not to drink though since there was still plenty on the menu for the day.  For food we got the GPH Mother Clucker (not pictured),  Blue Balls (front), Son of a Peach (middle), and Granny's Pie (back). Would hands down come again for the Mother Clucker. The fried chicken was cooked to perfection and it paired so well with they honey and donut with it. Between all of the donuts, I think the Blue Balls were my favorite because the blueberry sauce wasn't all that sweet and more on the tangier side so it wasn't like I was getting a total sugar high like I did with the other two. I did love all three, just the donut holes a little more. As a side note, the menu says those donut holes are supposed to be blueberry filled but ours came with a blueberry sauce on top. Nothing wrong with that, but for future customers looking to try, it's worth knowing.  In terms of price, everything may look expensive, but the portion sizes that go with those prices are definitely reasonable. Plus, the donuts are made fresh and cooked to perfection, so (again) the prices are justified and reasonable for what you get. Almost everything on the menu is also shareable if you're interested in trying a bunch of things without a singular price tag.  Definitely recommend if you're in the area and looking for a place to eat all your calories and try a bunch of different donut dishes. Will be coming again the next time I come to Austin!

reviews.author: paul m.
reviews.description: Absolutely delicious start to finish and very filling! Enjoyed a brunch on the patio this weekend with perfect weather. A very reasonably priced $12 carafe of mimosas for the wife and I, before indulging in the Rise and Shine. Hand breaded chicken tenders atop a fresh donut, covered with scrambled eggs and smothered in queso. Finished off with pico and candied jalapeños. So full of flavor!! Queso was on point.

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: The donuts here never disappoint! They are so good and delicious. I usually get the black out but this time I got the miss shortcake which was delicious and wasn't too excessive like the black out can be. Excellent dessert spot for sure. The reason I'm giving it four stars is because we had to wait roughly 40-45 minutes to get three donuts? That seems a little excessive especially since they did not seem to be understaffed. And when the donuts came out they felt lukewarm like they had been sitting out for 10+ min which is a bit disappointing. Maybe there was something extra going on which is why I'm willing to give them the benefit of the doubt. Great taste which is why I recommend it but maybe just go to the food truck next time?   Overall: 3.9 stars

reviews.author: Des J.
reviews.description: Country Clucker was delicious I wanted more!! The patio area was nice and has good shade for when it's sunny! Our waitress was so nice she even complimented my perfume !  The boss hog was definitely different I loved the potato salad concept that went on it!

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: This place was a dream come true.  They have coffee cocktails and donut based meals.  We tried the fried kolaches and the triple dipper and they were both a hit.  The chips were kinda not enough for the dip but it was good cause if you got a meal you could use the dip as little kick it up.  The coffee cocktails were the bomb dot com.

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: One of the must do's in Austin. Came here for brunch on a Saturday morning, arrived at around 11:30am and did not need to wait for a table. The place has a fairly large outdoor seating area that is super dog friendly. Parking however, is limited. They have a small lot in front of the restaurant for maybe 10 cars. Otherwise, it's street parking, which is also limited.   The food was 10/10! Tried the Rise and Shine, which is one of their most popular brunch items. The chicken is thick and crispy. The egg and quest were perfect. And I am a huge fan of the pickled jalapeños (on top) too. The El Diablo was delicious too, not spicy at all. Also appreciated the huge portions.   Overall, loved my experience here and will certainly come back to try more!

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: The donuts here are delicious mmmmm! Highly highly recommend the Freebird. Sooooo good. They also have a good truck in another location, but the menu is more limited (and they don't have the Freebird sadly).   There's plentiful patio seating so if you prefer sitting outdoors, they've got you covered.  They serve both sweet and savory donuts, and they also have a big selection of drinks (although I've never ordered any of them).

reviews.author: Ryan G.
reviews.description: This is a sold brunch spot.   Their donuts are the bomb dot com, and a cool atmosphere.   Wake up call was amazing, had more alcohol than should be legal. Gonna get this every time.   Their food portions aren't the largest, maybe since it doesn't come with an automatic side. However the food was insanely good. Not a place to go while on a diet.   Mimosa Carafe is the move at $12

reviews.author: Haley G.
reviews.description: Made a stop here for Happy Hour while visiting friends in Austin this weekend and was so glad we did! We came mid-afternoon and were seated immediately without reservations. We started with drinks. I had the Losoya Street Lemonade, and I loved it! It was sweet and tart and not overpowering at all! We also ordered a Water Moccasin Fishbowl. Fair warning, this one was  very sweet! Good but sweet - reminded us of a blue sour patch kid.  After we made a small dent in the fishbowl, we ordered our doughnuts. We tried the Sin A Bomb and the Heavenly Hash. The Heavenly Hash definitely took the trophy between the two. The doughnut itself was amazing (tastes like funnel cake), but the toppings were even better - fudgy chocolate brownie icing, rich chocolate chips, marshmallow cream, brownie batter drizzle... oh my.... It was so sweet and chocolatey, and we finished it QUICK!! The Sin A Bomb was good as well, but the butter on top was a bit too much for us. If we had ordered it with just the cream cheese topping and not the slew of melted butter, I think we would have liked it more. Not bad by any means, just not our cup of tea.  We never felt rushed and sat their enjoying our doughnuts and drinks (and attempting to make it through the fishbowl) for several hours. It was a super laid-back atmosphere and the perfect place to catch up with old friends. In fact, we were there so long that we got hungry again and ended up ordering mac and cheese - which was also amazing! You can see we are the picture of health going from doughnuts to mac and cheese, ha! I wouldn't come here if you are on a diet... everything on the menu is either a rich dessert or a loaded Southern dish. Would love to go back and try some of the food items like the Chicken Pot Pie or Burgers. Everything that the people around us were ordering looked delicious.

reviews.author: Dan N.
reviews.description: Skylar is an awesome Bartender. Her service was five stars, we were blown away by her attention to detail and friendliness.   The Cuisine was to die for.  BIG DAN APPROVES!

name: Black Star Co-op Pub and Brewery

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: A shady porch, games for everyone, inside and out, family friendly, dog friendly and oh so yum!  This place has it all.  The food is outstanding, particularly the avocado club. During May, they sponsor Barks for Beers supporting Divine Canines Therapy dogs. You buy a Pawsport for about $30 and get a free draw at over two dozen local craft brewers! Miss Sophia will be around to greet you most of May, and whenever else her human wants something good to eat!  One of Austin's hidden gems

reviews.author: Gurpreet L.
reviews.description: I tried some of their veggie options, including the impossible burger, and would say their food is average. However, their range of beer selection is on point. There is a little something for everyone - from sours to stouts. I had one of the sours, a cider, and split a beer flight of beers I can't remember. Loved all of them!

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: I've been here twice and both times were pleasant visits. Last time I tried the "Wish You Were Queer," which is a hoppy, floral beer. I loved it! I also ordered the avocado club sammy. The fries were thick and salted. I'm sure I'll be back!

reviews.author: Wes O.
reviews.description: One of the best "better" burgers in Austin.  Plain and simple.    It's a bit hard to find from Lamar because it's semi-hidden in the Midtown Commons apartment complex.  Like the Triangle and most other new Austin developments, there's retail and restaurants on the ground floor.  Decided to drop in here tonight because the burger came highly recommended.  I'm definitely glad I tried it.  The burger is deceptively small.  It looks like a smaller burger, but the density of the high quality burger patty combined with their bun makes it more than a meal.  Don't forget their fries, which were described to me as English style chips.  The fries look like flattened steak fries and are exceptionally crispy.  I'm not sure what the seasoning is, but it's strangely addictive.  Black Star has a huge variety of beers for the drinkers.  For the non-drinkers, they have a variety of canned and bottled soft drinks, although no fountain drinks.    Being a co-op, the service is friendly and obviously takes a lot of pride in their pub.  The quality of the food and the service both show that.

reviews.author: Alex C.
reviews.description: I seem to enjoy the Black Star Co-op more every time I visit. There are good selections on tap in the food menu is pretty extensive. The people are friendly and seem to have pride in the establishment. Everything from burgers, sandwiches and bar snacks have always been well received by people I've brought and I will be bringing more in the future. Currently the Covid protocols are very good. There's plenty of space and tables outside and easy to park bicycle racks.

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: Vulcan IPA and the best fish and chips in Austin. It's a bit pricy, but tips are included in the price and people there are paid a living wage. If I lived closer, I would be a member.

reviews.author: Danielle R.
reviews.description: Checked this place out for the 1st time today and LOVED it! Very good beer and delicious food too. Had their house hazy IPA and Oktoberfest beer, wonderful! Sundays and Tuesdays are the best for great $$ deals too. Their burgers, fries, wings, and  chicken sandwich was very good and the staff is incredibly friendly!! We are definitely coming back again soon :)

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Brewpub: dog-friendly, veggie options, friendly staff and strong wifi! SCORE!  Came through with a good friend and my pup. We loved it. Pups have to stay outdoors, but you're allowed to bring them indoors to place your order. They have tons of beer options, great in-house brews. I was floored by their options! I always go for the flight when I try a new brewery to get a better taste of what they offer. I loved pricing: 4 for $10, and my favorites were the Island Baby (pineapple what!!) and juicy Fructis hazy IPA. They had a bit of everything, so that's always nice for beer geeks. Quench my palate, Black Star! They have their beer menu overhead--super easy to read. They also have great happy hour, but we arrived later after it was over. The food menu is on the paper menu that they have at the front of the line. Grab yourself the menu while someone stands in line for ya!   They also offer food specials for that day. It looked good--I think it was some sort of tofu (veg) tacos, but I wanted fries...so went with their avocado club. It was a bit heavy on the mayo, but it tasted great. Their chips...crisps...fries whatever you want to call em were the REAL WINNER. Y'all. Fries are so crispy and uneven...wedge-style. BUT not dry or lukewarm. They are delicious. I would go back just for their addictive fries. Trust me. They also offer the impossible burger too for veg folks, and other options like grilled cheese. I just love how veg-friendly they are. THANK Y'ALL. Grilled cheese gets old for us who don't eat meat.   The atmosphere is very chill and with a darker ambiance. It seems like the perfect spot for group hangs or a relaxed date. Parking was easy, especially since there's a customer parking structure that's free. It's also close to public transportation if you choose to take it. I love this spot--I can see this becoming a new favorite.

reviews.author: Kimber G.
reviews.description: I adore this place!  Cool (ABD humble) people, great beers, ciders and such delicious food!  Right now menus are limited but I hear they are getting more beers next week for Octoberfest!   Thank you BlackStar Coop!  We LOVE you!

reviews.author: Esther S.
reviews.description: I cannot emphasize my love for this place enough!!! Usually I am not the type of person to seek out breweries/pubs simply because they are loud and not too clean. I make an exception for this location due to the fantastic service I am given every. single. time. (NO TIPS HERE!! They work and treat you well because thy are paid good/decent wages!!!!!!)  Atmosphere: 4 Pretty big, can get crowded on evenings (cause it's freakin great). Lots of indoor seating and ample outdoor seating (covered)  Food: 4.5 Most of the food I have had here has been pretty decent. I knock off half a star because I've noticed a slight inconsistency in the servings (read about fish and chips) Fish and chips: my go-to food. Usually comes with 2-3 strips of fish and the potato wedges/strips are always well cooked, and come it's this out-of-the-world sauce!! Addicting af but wish they would consistently give 3 strips of fish ): Fried avocado tacos: awesome!! Sounds like it would be plain, but came with these giant thicc bacon strips on it that really added the savory taste Cheese board: nice variety, definitely love that the cheese is locally sourced from Antonelli's! Good mix for everyone's taste buds and really liked how there was plenty of bread too. Ice cream: seasonal flavors but I tried the pecan and regretted only having one scoop.  Service: 5 The servers here are always!!!!!!!!! SO cool and nice and helpful. Whenever we need drink recs, or anything at all, they are there to help! Even called in to ask if they were playing a game before, and offered to put down the big screen to have us come by and watch as we ate.

reviews.author: Nikki A.
reviews.description: I've always seen this place and been curious to try it. So, when my friend was visiting from Vermont, I decided it was the perfect time! I always like to eat locally. We split the tofu tikka masala and buffalo cauliflower (we added bleu cheese). I'm sure I could've eaten the whole bowl of of buffalo cauliflower by myself. It was super tasty. The sauce was just a little bit vinegary and the cauliflower soaked up all the flavor. Get it with the cheese, if you aren't vegan. It gives it that extra sharpness. The tikka masala was a bit spicy. I was surprised by that. We both liked it. The tofu was perfect with it. You have to know how to do tofu just right, and this was it! Everything was gluten free, for my friend. I can't wait to go back after I have my baby so I can partake in the adult beverages. I had my eye on some that they made there.

reviews.author: Condescending K.
reviews.description: My fav brewery in town! Deeply wish they would bring back the island baby and the wings w/ spicy bbq (?) sauce.

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: Black-star Co-op is cool, but the food isn't all that. They brew their own beer and rotate other craft brews, but I always get their Vulcan, a rye IPA.  Foodwise, the only things I've liked are the chicken snack, and the seasoned chips. The burger is just okay, but the fish for the fish and chips needs salt and let's get some dang tarter sauce. They serve it with an aoli, which lacks seasoning. A side of coleslaw would go a long way too.  I'd be back, primarily for a cold one, and I would not not go for food again, but not by my will.

reviews.author: Nikkita F.
reviews.description: Great spot for post work drinks. I think theres only beer so keep that mind.   Pros: easy to find a spot inside or outside (although Texas so nothx), easy parking (lot or garage), delish fries and cheese boards and fried avo tacos, you can get flights of house beers for only $10, I believe they have board games too   Cons: I think only beer available (fine by me but depends on your group)

reviews.author: Shawn P.
reviews.description: This place was legit delicious. Had the buffalo cauliflower and it was amazing! The atmosphere is great and the beer was yummy. Lots of options veg and beef options

reviews.author: Goretti A.
reviews.description: Good for takeout! Fish and chips was so good and the wait time for pickup was mot super long at all. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Nathan F.
reviews.description: Great local brewery and co op that pays their staff a liveable wage and benefits not to mention a great kitchen, fantastic selection of beers and in house brews! Also great location and plenty of parking

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Chill beer garden style hang out spot, having passed by a bunch of times it never seems crazy busy and on a beautiful Saturday night we were able to get a table outside without any issue.   Their beer selection is great, with a wide variety of beer made in house and other local breweries. The food selection leaves a little bit to be desired. The season chips were delicious, they reminded me more of steak fries if you put them in a broiler to give them a nice crunch. Besides the chips nothing on the menu really stood out to me as too interesting, and most of the reviews I read were pretty disappointed with their other food.   They also seem to have events  and good happy hour deals pretty frequently during the week. Overall, it's a good place to grab a beer in the area and enjoy a nice night outside, but I wouldn't come here too hungry.

reviews.author: James T.
reviews.description: This is the best local pub in North Central Austin. Consistently great food and house beers, don't sleep on this wonderful neighborhood favorite

reviews.author: Lyndsay W.
reviews.description: Cute dog-friendly spot with plenty of good beer options. I really enjoyed their hazy IPA on tap: fructis. Lots of tables inside and then a shaded outdoor picnic table are. Would come back!

name: Odd Duck
accommodations: Street Parking, Validated Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking
Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Chris J.
reviews.description: Visited Odd Duck after months of waiting for a reservation, and was met with food and service that went above and beyond expectations. A local farm to table establishment with an elevated twist, I highly recommend Odd Duck as a go-to spot in Austin.   As many other Yelpers have surely noted, Odd Duck's menu is seasonal, so I'll spare you the details regarding the food I ate, as the menu has most likely changed. Feel free to sit back and trust your waiter's suggestions, as they are veterans of their craft.   One thing that I would like to commend Odd Duck on is their extreme attention to detail, which was immediately noticeable to me. From their unique plates and cutlery to the maintenance of their restrooms, this dining experience made it well worth the price point. Additionally, our waiter made it a point to clean our table throughout the meal, which was awesome.  5/5

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: 1,000x yes, go eat here.  Odd Duck was a "must eat at" stop on a specially curated visit to Austin. It is a fun, quirky, farm to table, seasonal and special menu kind of place, with a lovely team of staff and cooks. A team running a dream.  We sat at the bar and our bartender/waitress was super friendly and attentive - we were chugging water since Austin heat is ridiculous compared to New York heat, so she kept us hydrated as we waited for our food. She helped us work through our order and recommended some items and how much food to order since the menu is set up in a specific way with some featured small and shared plates.   As each dish was served, the server explained the dish, which I loved. It made the experience that much better to know the unique aspects of each dish like where the ingredients came from or how to enjoy it best.  Everything was delicious, and yes, the rave reviews of the cornbread are totally accurate.  10/10 stars for sure

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: Pictures of menu on August 17, 2021. Reservations are strongly recommended as this place is quite popular (rightfully so though)! We picked the tomatoes, quail, and cornbread and everything was 10/10. I don't typically eat cornbread but theirs is MAGICAL and a must do! Their service was also A+, they were kind enough to mark the menu with vegetarian options, they even provided ways to alter some of their dishes to make them vegetarian (see photo). The French Toast dessert was also a delight. I'm a big fan of their rotating menus and will happily return to try more.   There is complimentary valet parking. You can also find street parking by the restaurant. They have happy hour 5-6pm daily with drink specials only.

reviews.author: Tiffany H.
reviews.description: Odd Duck is an OG in ATX's food scene; I've known about it since undergrad (10+ years now!) but haven't had a chance to try it until I was in town recently for work.   Before local/farm2table was cool - Odd Duck was doing it. It still feels great to support local farmers and producers though.   The food here was OUTSTANDINGLY flavorful -- bringing it to that edge but showing finesse and balance. I also appreciate that they made vegetarian versions of certain dishes so there are some options for Vegs!   My only regret? Not coming here sooner!   The menu will be different when you visit, but we thoroughly enjoyed each dish! We had the:  *Redfish Ceviche (leche de tigre, persimmon, cucumber, potato chip) *Cajun Pork Rillette (apples, pickles, Sour Duck Market sourdough toast) *Dry-aged wagyu burger (pimento, BBQ sauce, beer battered onion ring) - like an EXPLOSION of flavor.  *Wagyu Sirloin Cap (beef fat papas bravas, soubise, green bean salsa verde)  *French Toast (Vanilla Ice Cream, Cajeta, Apple, Pecan, Brown Butter Cereal) - yes, we had French Toast for dessert! So good and I recall just a pinch of salt from keeping it from being overly sweet!

reviews.author: Callie M.
reviews.description: A gem in Austin for their authenticity and willingness to explore.   I loved dining at Odd Duck so much that I'd say it's now one of my favorite restaurants in Austin (first time was earlier this month). I'd go through all the dishes but that wouldn't be helpful because the menu changes seasonally (since they are a farm-to-table restaurant +1). First, I love that it's tapas styled (+1) because it means you get to try more dishes and nottt feel like you're over ordering!   What stands out to me about this restaurants is their sauces. The ones that I had with the heavier items (the red meat dishes) were rich and dimensional. Some of the flavors were unique because it had some aspects of familiar tastes mixed with ones that were foreign to me. I loved being able to try all the dishes because I knew I was tasting a unique dish that was created (or crafted) by a talented chef.   From a bar seat, I could tell that the servers and chef love what they're doing (trust me, it doesn't go unnoticed). I love knowing that my meal was made by people who are exploring, learning, and having fun! I honestly think it's hard to NOT want to support a restaurant like this..   Every foodie's must-try for sure.

reviews.author: Comyar Z.
reviews.description: We had a fantastic dinner at Odd Duck. We had a large-ish group of 6 with various dietary restrictions and our waitress was really amazing about catering to everyone! She created customized menus for each person indicating what they could/could not eat and even came back with variations of dishes the chefs said they could do. The service here is excellent, as was the food.  Food is tapas style, so we were ordering tons of dishes for the table. Their menu changes frequently, so what you get really depends on when you go. Overall, we had a great time here and would love to come back!

reviews.author: Grace K.
reviews.description: Odd Duck is definitely a must-visit if you are in Austin!  This restaurant supports the local Austin community, so it is neat seeing the various sourced goods within the innovative dishes here. It started in a trailer but transformed into what it is today with its farm to table creations.  We found street parking luckily, which was right on Gibson Street W. I did notice there is a private parking lot with valet included in it. I highly recommend making reservations. I found my reservation about ~3 days prior to the date. There are bar top seatings and outdoor seatings available. It's great for dates, friends or family (more for adults).  FOOD: Cajun Pork Rillette (4/5; Apples, Pickles, Sour Duck Market Sourdough): The cajun pork rillette was decent but enhanced with the addition of the veggies. The pickled veggies brought life to the dish. It was my first time trying rillette though, which is pork meat that is submerged in fat then cooked at an extremely slow rate. Another important note was the sourdough (it was baked perfect).  Mushroom Chorizo Tostada (5/5; Squash and Pepita Butter, Radish, Pickled Onions): This tostada was something else! It is very unique, and I loved all of it (including the texture of the tostada). There are 3 pieces, but I ate 2/3. I could have ordered another one for myself. The squash and pepita butter had some flavor, which helped bring another part of the taste element into play. Nothing overpowered another.  Apple Salad (4/5; Smoked Squash, Lavender, Chevre, Black Pepper Pecans): This is a lighter dish. I am not a big fan of apples, but I can assure you that I ate them in this salad! Great flavors that burst in your mouth... even the black pepper pecans.   Wagyu Sirloin Cap (5/5; Papa Bravas, Soubise, Green Bean Salsa Verde): My date loved this. He is an all time meat-lover, and he raved about this. The wagyu was cooked perfectly at medium-rare. It easily became one of my top 5. I also have to mention the pickled veggies with the papa bravas because they were delicious. I did not try much of the soubise (white onion sauce), but it was not overpowering. It added a nice, subtle savory taste with the wagyu.   Service was great and attentive. Everything came out on time. Our drinks never touched bottom.  Would I come back!? Definitely!!! They change the menu pretty often too. I am a fan.

reviews.author: Elizabeth Y.
reviews.description: Great place to eat at while in Austin!   Even when it's hot, the outdoor patio has shade and fans. the inside was blastingly chilly!   We were greeted immediately by the hosts and taken inside. The drinks were amazing. we ordered cornbread to go since we heard such amazing things but I wanted to try so many things on the menu and there were only 2 mouths to feed.   Unfortunately no duck egg for the dinner menu.  We got the wagyu beef which was slightly a bit more raw then I would have liked it.   Drinks were pretty good with the Cucumber Daze and a watermelon drink (can't recall it was one of their seasonal drinks)

reviews.author: Anni D.
reviews.description: Do yourself a favour and just make a reservation here. Odd duck is spectacular.  The happy hour drinks are a steal - $6 for some awesome cocktails. We tried the in house sodas as well and they were really unique.  Our server was super attentive and designed a tasting menu for our big group. Every dish was *fantastic*. My personal highlights were the scallop, zucchini salad, and French toast.

reviews.author: Phuong D.
reviews.description: The food was very good and creative. We love our grilled quail, Aged Pork Loin and Chocolate Fudge pie with a chilli hint. Great presentation too. The kale beignets are not so good

reviews.author: Edgar R.
reviews.description: Celebrated my friends birthday and had a pleasant experience. This is a sharing dishes type of restaurant rather than ordering your own plate.  Service: they offer complimentary valet parking, the valet person was extremely nice, and our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.   Food: LOVED the cornbread (totally recommend it), scallops were tasty, ceviche was ok, and nachos were ok too.  Drinks: were great. Recommend the Nice, Bryce.

reviews.author: Drew O.
reviews.description: Been here a ton back when I lived in Austin and was at Barleyswine when it opened too.   Our waitress completely ruined the night for our family gathering.  Not making any suggestions just telling us how to eat and order.   "Plates are too be shared so you need to order two of everything."  Never asked us if we wanted a second round of drinks.   Worst experience ever and a $400 check no less. Worst customer service and outright rude waitress.   We won't be back.

reviews.author: Casey T.
reviews.description: The praise for this place is well deserved - the food was just as memorable as the quirky name. I had the pleasure of trying the ceviche, cornbread, scallop, and wagyu steak dishes here and each dish blew me away with the creative fusion of flavors.  The pacing that the food was brought out was perfect, leaving just enough time to digest and converse between bites. I honestly was expecting the place to be a bit fancier on the interior given the price point and exterior, however, the quirky decor meshed perfectly with the spirit of the restaurant.  Our server was very attentive and made sure that we were taken care of, and carefully explained each dish, and gave suggestions for the best way to consume them. My personal favorite was the ceviche - although it wasn't traditional, it was one of the best that I've had - the flavors were phenomenal! Please get this if they have a variation of it on the menu.  I'm so excited to come back here again as they change their menu every month so there is always something new to look forward to!

reviews.author: Made B.
reviews.description: This place is not worth the hype! The only thing good was the cornbread.The wagyu sirloin Cap, in the January 2022 menu, was horrible and disgusting! The meat was stringy and hard, not at all what wagyu meat should be.The ceviche was a bite size with what looked and tasted like Lays barbecue potato chips. The worst experience in Austin. The lemon dessert was not tasty even for a dessert lover. It  was just like a bowl of sugar. The lemon cake was dry and the sorbet was just ok really no satisfaction. So disappointed because it had great reviews, but don't waist your money!I was so looking forward to supporting local restaurants especially farm to table, but after telling my waitress Rochelle that the wagyu was not great and seeing how she did not care makes me not want to try a different local restaurant tomorrow!

reviews.author: Ashley B.
reviews.description: Amazing food and amazing service.  The quality is top notch here.  Portions are small and meant for sharing.  Ingredients sourced from local farmers and menu is seasonal.  Great cocktails too.

reviews.author: Edward A.
reviews.description: In town visiting Austin and landed here for our first night out for dinner. After booking I was super excited to hear my colleague confirm that it was a great choice.   We sat at the bar as it was the only thing available a week out when I booked. We took our servers recommendations for the most part. We tried a little bit of everything. Staff was super friendly and even more knowledgeable about every dish. A random runner, manager, chef would deliver a plate and explain in great detail. Watching the cook work the live fire oven was fun and seeing the Waygu sirloin caps getting seared made the mouth water.   Sadly, I'm coming off COVID snd my taste wasn't there as I would have liked but my foodie friend said everything was a 10!

reviews.author: Adela M.
reviews.description: The food and drinks were phenomenal.  The ceviche was by far my favorite item on the menu.  The type of food served here is very eclectic, a fusion of tex-mex, southern and Latin American.   The atmosphere is great for a first date, it's cool, casual, and stimulating to the eye.  The staff is very well versed on their menu and from my encounter with my servers, they are passionate and educated on the food and drink they serve.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: What a unique gem! Love this place because it's farm fresh to table but also just really unique dishes with unexpected ingredients like peach kimchi in the pork loin dish or green chili in cornbread with green garlic butter. Even the drinks have unique ingredients and nice twists.   We made reservations same day on our want to Austin. We sat at the bar and the bartenders were so nice and even made us some special cocktails not on menu.   We had: -cast iron cornbread. Seriously the best corn bread I've ever had. That green chili was such a unique and pleasant touch and the butter was amazing. It was so moist and the salt bits at the bottom were heavenly.  -the pork loin was so tender. I've never had pork a medium or light pink and got a little scared but was reassured this is normal way to cook pork so it's not too dry. Wow I've had pork all wrong all these years. It was so good and the little touches like kimchi peach, the mushrooms and the mole sauce were all just amazing.  -panna cotta was so unique because it had a torched marshmallow on top, graham crackers, mint, and rose petals. So delicious and great "light" way to end dinner. There's always room for dessert no matter how full you are, right?   Make reservations especially if you want a sit down table and not bar top. Love this place, now on my list of recos.

reviews.author: Gabriella G.
reviews.description: What a cool spot! We came here looking for a place with atmosphere, good drinks and good food and YES! This fit the bill!  We were seated at a bar-side table height space where we enjoyed the show of the busy kitchen- and it was a very interesting experience! If you are 2 and up to something different and into cooking: this is the one table for you!  So I posted a couple of pictures of the view of the kitchen... but here is the drink and food review!  We got 2 cocktails : The prickly pear margarita had a bitter after taste that I just had to work through (lol yes I finished it) and the other one was a (something in the bag) sweet and delicious vodka concoction: Reccommend! Then we got 2 appetizers the babaganoush and the nachos..: the babaganoush was green. It was interesting but... mostly tasted of a pea purée. It came with pickled squash that was sweet and delish and some pickled okra that was unexpectedly good! The bread was incredible. The best. The baba was different... Then we got the chicken nachos that were 4 very loaded and flavor nachos. They were very good- it was beautifully stewed or braised or whatever they did to the chicken was lovely! Lol. We were full after but had to had to taste this specialty I've cream we were privy to: an off the menu scoop of vanilla milk tea ice cream served with peach compote and brown butter cereal crunchies: our favorite part! Over all we had a great experience and the table by the kitchen offered us an intimate view of each dish as it was prepared and presented before being sent to the table!  What FUN!! Ask for this table! Apparently they take reservations and we just got lucky today  Enjoy.

reviews.author: Jin C.
reviews.description: I wanted my final meal in Austin to be an amazing one, and I did not regret making giving Odd Duck that honor. The menu here rotates monthly with whatever ingredients that might be in season, and flavors are punchy and inventive. All the dishes I ordered were excellent, and I only regret that I could not have tried more  The restaurant itself has a few different seating configurations - you can sit at the bar and watch the chef's in action, or do individual tables.  The cast iron cornbread was an excellent starter with crunchy, caramelized edges and the leek butter gave it a bit of a fresh vegetal touch. The marinated cucumber and watermelon salad with fish sauce and cashews evokes Thai papaya salad flavors.  I really liked the delicacy of the fried whole quail, but especially the creamed corn sauce that came with it. The aged pork loin was stellar - it made pork taste like high quality beef, and all of the little garnishes topped off the dish, the black garlic pecan mole was so flavorful.  I had the Dewberry Lane cocktail, which was very smooth, but a little bit too sweet for me.

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: Great little hangout in an unassuming area.... with great coffee and beer! I was a little surprised when we pulled up here. The building was nice, but wasn't what I was expecting.   The vibe here is great. A lot of young professionals clearly "working from home" but needed to get out of the house for a few hours. Very friendly customers and staff.   I ordered a vanilla latte and it came out wonderful. They had an awesome selection of beers on tap if that's your thing.   If I am in the area I will definitely be back for a visit.

reviews.author: Taylor S.
reviews.description: Great spot to grab a good coffee and get a little work done.  The coffee is legit good and they have beer on tap if you splurge toward the end of the day.  Parking is ample as well.  This is my go-to spot to meet my local rep while working in Austin.

reviews.author: Lilan N.
reviews.description: Love this coffee bar. Going here on a lunch break is the best! There's plenty of seating indoors and outdoors. It's a great place to go get some work done. The drinks are delicious too, I've gotten the Mexican spice mocha latte and it was so good! I want to go back and try the cold brew. The workers are sweet and there is plenty of parking!!

reviews.author: Westin P.
reviews.description: I had to actually spit out my coffee. It was a simple cold brew. Wife also trashed her vanilla latte.

reviews.author: Cyril G.
reviews.description: Cute coffee shop with plenty of places to sit and work. I got their coconut cold brew which was really good and not too sweet. They have some food options too but I wasn't hungry so I didn't get anything. Would recommend!

reviews.author: Olivia V.
reviews.description: Not a fan of leaving a bad review for a nice place, but I think I may have been served slightly off dairy milk here today (I'm not sick, but the taste was bad). I've been here a few times over the past years and it's a really cute, quiet spot for working. Today however I was served a matcha latte with a really funky taste to it. It seemed like the matcha powder used just sat in a thick later on top of the (1%) milk, without being well combined, and the milk tasted a little off to be honest. I regret not saying something but I think I attributed the taste to the matcha mixing issue at the time. The person I went with had a coffee which tasted fine, but used a different (dairy) milk from mine. Really a shame since my drink was so bad from the first sip, we just ended up leaving. Sorry stouthaus!

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here on a weekend afternoon and tried a local hefeweizen, the rose latte, and a brownie. The beer was tasty, and the rose latte was super smooth. The brownie was decadent and rich, with a crisp exterior and chewy interior. I like their patio space, but their inside space could do with more comfortable seating. Overall, service was good.

reviews.author: L P.
reviews.description: This is just the best lowkey coffee shop/hangout place. Every single staff member I've interacted with there is kind and accommodating and seems to genuinely like what they're doing. I'm not usually a flavored coffee drinker but they have a homemade cinnamon sugar syrup that is SO GOOD. I wake up craving it, lol. The golden milk latte is also a favorite of mine, and great for having later in the day when I don't want caffeine.

reviews.author: Magen D.
reviews.description: Stouthaus is such a cute spot! The vibe is very relaxed. The coffee and pastries are above average in taste, the staff were incredibly kind, and they had a ton of seating (indoor and outdoor). There were a lot of people, but it didn't feel overly crowded because of how large the space is.  They followed Covid protocols and everything was very clean!

reviews.author: Kate Z.
reviews.description: A nice open cafe by the highway.  There's a number of seats with surprisingly heavy chairs. The outdoor seating is very spacious but it's pretty loud with the cars zooming past us.   The pumpkin spice latte was okay. Not amazing. My friend says her cappuccino is just like any other.  The WiFi is solid. There are real and fake outlets (literally a sticker on the wall lol). It's a nice place to work or study. I like the temperature and the music is an okay volume.   I'd come back!

reviews.author: Krista H.
reviews.description: I came in on a Saturday afternoon and the whole outdoor patio was occupied so I was expecting there to be a line inside. I was pleasantly surprised when I was able to order right away! I got an iced cinnamon sugar latte with almond milk which came out to about $6.25. The price is a little steep, but the flavor and milk substitute added about $2.   The coffee came out relatively fast and was pretty good! The cinnamon was subtle, but the coffee was smooth and rich. My fiancé and I both enjoyed it! I don't know if I would come out of my way for this coffee, but if I was in the area I would definitely stop by again!   The location is convenient and there are other businesses on the same strip to try out as well. I would recommend coming here and getting some coffee to go!

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: We went to stouthaus on Friday early afternoon, they have few tables outside and few inside with socially distanced, lady who took our order was kinda robotic.  we ordered cappuccino, coffee and cinnamon roll, post covid we are mostly doing takeouts but while we were waiting for the order we saw staff sanitizing table and chairs in between each customers so we felt comfortable to sit and enjoy the coffee there itself.  Cappuccino was good but little thin, coffee was pretty good, cinnamon roll was just ok.  Overall, definitely worth a visit and really appreciate the way they're handling the business in pandemic!

reviews.author: Bobbie L.
reviews.description: Cute little spot where you can drink coffee and beer. I would recommend the nitro coffee/iced latte. I wish there were more seating indoors and outside.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: I know Stouthaus is an Austin favorite, but I was pretty disappointed by my experience. They don't have a ton of seating indoors, but they do have a nice outdoor patio area. My friend and I both ordered an iced vanilla latte, and it was pretty meh. Nothing to come back for.

reviews.author: Elizabeth V.
reviews.description: Delicious coffee, friendly service, dog- and work-friendly patio seating. Pro-tip: Stop circling the crowded first parking lot in the daytime, and head past the front of the building to the wide-open north lot! *Masks required for ordering inside as of 9/2021, and there's a box inside the door if you need one.

reviews.author: Warren D.
reviews.description: Covid and Snowvid had me feeling creatively tapped. Coffeeshops have always been good to me but there are very few open for staying inside. Stouthaus was my muse! The coffee is really great and if I'm able to get some good work done I'll have a beer. The selections are priced right and curated well. The views aren't spectacular but that helps me focus on work for a little while. The staff and ownership seem to care about the work they are doing.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: I dig what Stouthaus is trying to do, it's a hip little joint that has coffee and beer which are both things I like.   It's pretty small inside, so if it's cold outside I wouldn't plan on finding a seat, but their patio is a nice addition with a beer garden feel. It is right off the highway though so don't go expecting a nice view of trees, but with the right company I don't think that really matters.  When I went the coffee didn't blow my mind, and they also didn't have any brewed at 1pm on a Thursday which was kind of strange to me for a coffeehouse so I had to wait. But that did mean it was fresh which is always nice.   They have fake outlets (they're stickers) which is kind of funny I guess but wasn't funny to me when I found a seat and my laptop died... they also have real ones though so don't worry.   All in all a cute little place and worth checking out if you're in the mood for a new local coffee shop. Or a low key place for a beer.

reviews.author: Christine C.
reviews.description: This is one of my favorite coffee shops in Austin! Friendly staff, good coffee and a casual, welcoming vibe.  They have a dedicated parking lot that makes visiting it so much easier and less stressful than many of the other coffee shops in the area. It has a decent number of plugs and space to get work done as well as a covered outdoor area. The one thing I don't like is that their chairs are not very comfortable when you're sitting in them for several hours getting work done. Even so, I think this is one of the best coffee shops in Austin!

reviews.author: Cindy W.
reviews.description: I loved how much room there was for people to grab a table to do work or hold meetings. They have really good coffee and pastry selections. We ordered the vanilla rose latte but I didn't really get any rose flavor which was disappointing, but the drink itself was still pretty good.

reviews.author: Heather D.
reviews.description: I come here a lot, to think, to work, to hang. It is my top 3 places to study. I love that they have Kampuchea on Tap. Their coffee really is THE BEST! They focus on Austin Coffee companies, I like that. Note, they close fairly early, 7/8. My only "complaint", the benches...the seats...my booty does not really love the hard flat wood. But, that is a minor problem.  Thanks, Stouthaus!

reviews.author: Adriana G.
reviews.description: Great GF pizza crust and a GF vegan crust option, as well.  The pizza's great.  Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Jacob G.
reviews.description: PHP is a fun place to grab some beer, pizza and watch some football. Great family friendly atmosphere

reviews.author: Marta S.
reviews.description: This place is super amazing with great great customer service! I love the ooo- lala and the staff is more than happy to accommodate me and make me feel comfortable. The ambiance is fantastic and I just love basking in these vibes. I don't ask a lot, but this place goes above and beyond.

reviews.author: Claudia E.
reviews.description: I live PHP. Very good pizza and beer!  People is always cordial.  Pizza is always good! Love their variety of IPAs!

reviews.author: Linda M.
reviews.description: I'm happy to post this follow-up to my previous review:     Stopped by today for lunch, and there's a great lunch special:  $12.50 for a personal sized pizza, small salad, and soft drink!  You can select from any of the pizzas and salads on the menu.  I had the margherita pizza and classic house salad.  The salad came out quickly and was really good:  crispy veggies, the house-made ranch dressing is delicious, and no skimping on the cherry tomatoes or parmesan!  Even though it is served in a small bowl, there is a lot of salad packed in the serving.  Loved it!  It wasn't too long before our pizzas were delivered (not sure if this is the normal pace, we were there about 1:30 p.m. after the lunch rush).  The pizza was good, too!  This was more food than I could eat; a really good lunch deal, imho.      The restaurant itself is pretty casual with picnic style tables placed end-to-end in rows and a few picnic tables around the perimeter of the large room.  Great for big groups!  The staff was unfailingly friendly and welcoming.  This location brews its own beers, none of which I tried so I cannot comment now.  Guess that means a return trip is in order!

reviews.author: Thomas M.
reviews.description: Picking up pizza from this location is super easy with plenty of curb-side pick-up parking. Also a good spot to catch a game and have a few beers inside. The outdoor patio has potential, but it seems to have been neglected. The few times I've sat outside I think the wait staff forgot about us. Not a huge deal, and they made it right with a feee pizza voucher.   All their pizzas are good and worth trying, but my go to is the pepperoni and basil.

reviews.author: Jiyoon S.
reviews.description: A fun spot that's perfect for families on a casual weeknight or large groups due to the ample seating. While it's certainly not the best brewery selection/pizza in Austin, it definitely more than hits the spot! Pizza is a tad on the roughies/chewy side, not too much of a char or crisp as I'd like but some people might prefer that! Fun topping varieties, although I'd stick to the classics, our cauliflower pesto pizza fell a little short flavor wise.

reviews.author: Pranav A.
reviews.description: Pros: - Lively ambiance - Lots of seating - You get your food pretty quickly - Pizza is cooked really well, the crust is as soft as a cloud on the inside with a nice, not too chewy or tough exterior - The classic pies have great flavor and ingredient combos, definitely try them even if something seems out of your comfort zone  Cons: - Might be hard to find group seating since the tables inside are bench seating, similar to long picnic tables - Parking may not be available  If you are going on a typically busy time and day of the week, call ahead of time and ask about the wait time

reviews.author: Ashley B.
reviews.description: Love this place! The bahn mi pizza is my absolute favorite.  I always take friends and family here when they're in town.

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: Salad, pizza, brownie delivered by Favor. Everything was delicious and delivery was fast and easy.

reviews.author: Chris J.
reviews.description: dank.   The Honey Pear pizza is a must try if you've never had it. The subtle sweetness of the honey and pear matched perfectly with the house cheese blend that Pinthouse uses. With some caramelized onions to top it all off, it was a great medley of flavors that paired nicely with the prosciutto.  Personally being a fan of meat-lover pizzas, we ordered the Cannonball as well. Typically, I find these types of pizzas to be a little heavy when it comes to oil and grease, but this wasn't the case for Pinthouse. The pizza was sparing with the oil, but still contained the substance you would be looking for. After eating 6-7 slices myself, I somehow didn't end up in a food-induced coma and even managed to shoot around for a bit afterwards.   Overall, great experience. 5 stars - will be returning

reviews.author: Craig S.
reviews.description: If Candace Owens would dip a Pinthouse pizza crust in a ramekin of house-made ranch, she'd realize the world is a beautiful place and shut her yapper for once. Pinthouse Pizza is the common ground for a polarized world. It's where men with beards, and men with longer beards can come together and poorly explain Bitcoin to each other over a delicious glass of Electric Jellyfish. It's where women with wide-brimmed hats and nose rings can talk trash about Nicole. Grab a friend and go to Pinthouse. Support local businesses and tip well.  You a thiccc boi get yourself a thiccc beer.

reviews.author: Becca R.
reviews.description: The pizza here is phenomenal. It really never fails to be delicious, no matter which one you get. I personally like the Honey Pear pizza as I am a prosciutto lover. The Suspiciously Good IPA was also suspiciously good. I've only gotten to go from this location so I can't comment yet on the ambiance but other locations have a nice vibe and a good amount of seating.

reviews.author: Ruth Y.
reviews.description: A great place for a casual get-together for unique pizza and drinks!  FOOD: Their "El Queso" (basically chips and queso) was delicious and a hearty appetizer for 2-3 people. My friend and I also ordered small sizes of the Banh Mi and Shroomin' Goat pizzas to share. The Banh Mi was alright - not amazing, but perhaps that is why Banh Mis are meant to be sandwiches. Beware: the Banh Mi has jalapeno slices on it that make the pizza very spicy, unless you're into that. The Shroomin' Goat is a balance of mushroom, salty goat cheese, fresh arugula, and garlicky goodness. Smalls are 10 inch and would probably be the perfect portion for 1 person to finish. Since we also had an appetizer and shared pizzas, we only ate about half of each. I would be remissed if I didn't also mention the huge selection of beers on tap. Since I'm not a beer person, I got myself an Austin EastCiders Sangria which was pretty good.  SERVICE: Not sure how to feel about the service because there wasn't too much to it. I was a little confused because there seemed to be separate counters for food and drinks, but apparently both have to be ordered at the bar. The server brought the food out to us and when we asked for water, he said that there were cups inside - this would not have bothered me if I wasn't finding myself filling cups of water at the same drink station where the server was filling up my friend's root beer float...The server also brought us to-go boxes for our leftover pizza. Overall, the employees were friendly, but I also wondered if they needed that many for so little to do.  LOCATION: The front is already inviting with a beautifully lit outdoor seating area. The host greeted us in front of the restaurant and takes you to a seat - we sat in their other outdoor patio area which ran along the side of the restaurant and connects to the inside. Unlike some other patio dining, there is plenty of space and tables. Inside, the restaurant is nice and spacious with lots of seating, although they seemed to be sticking to the booth seating for COVID precautions. We came here on a Thursday night and it was fairly busy, but not crowded by any means.  PARKING: Plentiful since it's in a shopping area.

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: First time visit last Thursday - we stopped by for a quick bite and drinks.  Upon arrival we were informed there was a waiting list - no prob. I added my name to the list and went to the bar to get some drinks. Within 20mins or so we were promptly seated outdoors. The outdoor area was pretty busy but nonetheless, food and drinks were served in a timely manner. I went for the small margherita pizza which was actually a lot for me but I ended up finishing the pie by the end of the night.   Overall pleasant experience - good food, good drinks at reasonable prices - I do recommend!

reviews.author: Clarisa J.
reviews.description: 10/10 would come here again, and I will! One of my favorite pizza places.  not to mention Pinthouse has an amazing alcohol selection.

reviews.author: Dominique E.
reviews.description: I love this place! I can't eat eggs or gluten and this is one of the few places I can eat pizza. Their vegan/gf crust is so crispy and delicious. Its so great pizza with a fun atmosphere and a huge selection of drinks. I Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Craig B.
reviews.description: I had business in south Austin which meant I was in the area of the South Lamar location at lunch time. I ordered a Pinthouse Salad and the "Off the Map pie " which this month is the All A' Sprout. As usual, the pizza and salad were both excellent. The only bummer is that I was still at work and couldn't enjoy a beer. Oh well. Great job as always. Please, please, please consider Lakeway for your next location

reviews.author: Ryan L.
reviews.description: Great food, good price, pepperoni with a side of queso is my favorite! Plus they have an awesome beer selection if you're into that kind of thing

reviews.author: Nadine S.
reviews.description: The Service was exceptional! The staff was very friendly and helping as well as accommodating! The Brownie with ice cream is a must have!!! Thank you for the experience will definitely be back!

name: Wright Bros Brew and Brew
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Christopher R.
reviews.description: We were debating where to go for breakfast, considered several options, many chain restaurants but wanted domething more unique and community based. Brews and Brews is all that plus great food, coffee and atmosphere. Top that off with people behind the counter who were authentically friendly and you get a neighborhood jewel. We'll stop in again whenever we find ourselves in Austin and hungry for great food, drink and fun.

reviews.author: Sara V.
reviews.description: I only eat here when I'm hungover, otherwise it's just ok.  Pro: That aioli on the breakfast sandwich deserves 5 stars all on its own.  Con: If you order a triple shot iced latte, they'll just make a cold brew with milk to save time. I almost stopped coming here after that experience until my next hangover called for a breakfast sandwich.   Do: order breakfast Don't: order coffee

reviews.author: Janelle L.
reviews.description: One of my favorite local coffee shops. I love coming here for a quick breakfast bagel and a coffee on the weekends. The staff is always really friendly and do a good job of making sure that you're taken care of!  My favorite thing to get here alongside a cold brew is breakfast bagel sandwich. They serve Rosen's Bagels, which is the closest thing you can get to an NYC bagel in Austin (not an exact replacement, but close enough).  It's definitely one of the coffee shops that you need to cross off your Austin list!

reviews.author: Kayla S.
reviews.description: Kind of obsessed with this place. I've only been for breakfast because it's BOMB.com! They have dishes for everyone; meat eaters to vegans! I have ordered 2 versions of their breakfast sandwich S.O.B. And I have to say both are delish in their own way.  Vegan SOB made with beyond breakfast sausage and a house made cashew cheese. It's just stacked with flavor. Then their original SOB you can get a few different meat options I went with sausage - there some kind of aioli, avocado and taters! Such a mess but worth it!   They have craft beers you can take to go- I love that they carry the brand Untitled art. It's a traveling craft brewery that makes incredible flavors!   Dog friendly and just a must stop spot! GO!

reviews.author: Andrea R.
reviews.description: What a cute spot. Made multiple trips here during my stay in town. The coffee was great. The flavor options, milk accommodations, outside seating, to go options all made it really inviting. Bagel with lox always a favorite and being from NJ it's a staple I usually judge pretty harshly on but was happy here during my stay in Austin. They also have cute merch, some CBD and beer items too. Local, small business. Would happily come back on my next trip.

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: Nice location, the service was amazing. I ordered the honey lavender latte, made perfectly..it was like a hug in a cup!

reviews.author: Rob B.
reviews.description: Super nice people and a great location. My coffee was good, I think this place has some hidden greatness covered in Covid shroud

reviews.author: Jennifer J.
reviews.description: Fantastic drink menu and friendly staff - we'd definitely stop back in based on the craft beer selection alone!

reviews.author: C R.
reviews.description: I visited on my last morning of vaca in downtown Austin due to craving a hearty bagel. It was easy to find from my hotel and primely located across from target on 5th street. The signage only says "brew and brew" so I was confused but soon confirmed that I was at the correct place. I know I desired the bagel with smoked salmon so I ordered it but was not impressed. The bagel was cold, flavorless and the smoked salmon was flavorless. I love a good culinary concoction but this just kissed the mary. It was pretty yet did not taste amazing. Presentation was nice however and service was good.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Typical Austin coffee and beer spot. Seating is very limited and wraps around the building leading to good people watching. Street parking is available, but limited. Cold brew was one of the better ones I've had in a long time! Beer selection is average, glad they had some local beers available.

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: I actually think I was here the time Ivan down there is talking about. He was being a dipshit about his mask (like acting like he was wearing it, but then intentionally wearing it wrong so the staff had to say something). He took a call and didn't wear it and that woman said something so he got all in a huff and walked out. It didn't seem like anyone threw him out, to me. I did kind of want to toss him myself but guys like that always have some virus. Don't want to get close.   Anyway I've been home to Texas a few times lately. A friend told me to try this place and I've gone every time I'm home. The food, beer (I don't like coffee) and staff have always been really good. Made me feel welcomed home. They do it right. Ivan does it without his mask on.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came here to do some work on a Wednesday afternoon. There were a good number of people hanging out, but plenty of available seating with large tables and ample outlets available. The noise level was perfect, not so quiet that you'd be uncomfortable having a private conversation, but quiet enough that you can get work done.   Coffee drink offerings were pretty standard in terms of options and prices. They have a really wide variety of beers available, as with most spots in the area most of them are localish. They could expand a little bit on their food options, especially on their non breakfast items since they seem to lean more towards the happy hour crowd.   I went for the cold brew which tasted great- super smooth and didn't need much milk to get a nice creamy taste. Be warned it is super strong, it takes a lot for me to get a caffeine rush from coffee and this really did the trick.   Overall I think it's a great place for a date spot, to get some work done, or hit a casual happy hour. I can definitely see myself coming back here in the future

reviews.author: Isaac T.
reviews.description: I stopped by here for cold brew today - nothing too exciting about what I drank. I do like the concept of this place offering beer and coffee.

reviews.author: Sama C.
reviews.description: Very unique concept with different types of coffee and microbrew. You can have a boost of some strong pick-me-up coffee made fresh to order by the barista. You can also have a wide range of local craft beers.  This place has plenty of seating; indoor and outdoor. It has a chill flow feel to it so you can unwind, pregame or bring your laptop and do some work.

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: A local biz that I've frequented many times over the years. They help to keep Austin weird as they say.  Surrounded by many new construction projects is a small coffee and brew joint nestled on the corner - you might pass it if you drive too fast - please don't!  I came in recently for breakfast and I was saddened a little as the menu had changed from my last visit. I'm normally chill about this however my wife was excited about the breakfast offerings I described only to realize they trimmed the menu down a bit.  I went 4 stars solely due to the reduced menu from the past. I just wish they did more breakfast on the weekend.  The coffee is great (FlatTrack) and beer even better I'd say. I find going over to FlatTrack gets me a little more for breakfast vs here although the venue is larger.  This isn't a diss but a request to improve is all. The mainstream is coming and I want my local to stay.

reviews.author: Sparky H.
reviews.description: While staying in eastside Austin on vacation, I made a point of visiting every independent coffee house in walking distance.  I made it to five in all.  Wright Bros. Brew + Brew was the clear winner!  They had an extensive menu, with lots of choices -- a very big factor for me.  My vanilla latte and my everything bagel were delicious.  The staff was warm and friendly.  Of course, there's no indoor service right now, but you can sit and eat outside on the patio.  And it's conveniently close to Target and Whole Foods.

reviews.author: Ivan C.
reviews.description: The food, coffee, drinks, are great, but I was treated very poorly twice. The first incident I slightly lowered my mask so that I could use ApplePay, and the lady yelled at me to never do that again.  The second time, I sat down to have a 5 minute call with my boss, and Audrey yelled at me that I had to leave if I wasn't going to order anything. I was literally going to order something as soon as my call was over, but she kicked me out.   TERRIBLE customer service. As someone who comes in every day and lives right across the street, I will never be coming back.

reviews.author: Anthony L.
reviews.description: Honestly this was one of the better pulled shots of espresso that I have had in a while. It was from Burundi. It was lovely! Clean, fruity, acidic. Perfect sip for sitting outside and people watching  I didn't get any pictures of the espresso or store itself.   It is across the street from Target and Whole Foods. What an enjoyable experience! The staff was super helpful and willing to answer all my questions about their beans!

reviews.author: Catherine H.
reviews.description: My favorite coffee shop in Austin.  The baristas are fab, they know me by name and are always happy and friendly.  The coffee is delish and the breakfast SOB sandwich is excellent.  If in the neighborhood, just go.  You'll love it, too!

reviews.author: Farrah A.
reviews.description: Deeeelicious coffee, cold beers, big ass breakfast bagel sandwiches, fast wifi, plenty of seating and cuuuute baristas. What else could any remote employee ask for?  Wright Bros BandB is in a great East Austin location. People are constantly filtering in and out, ordering coffee, cold pressed juices, and beer. I like seeing people drink beer at 11am on a Thursday morning. Makes me wonder what they do for a livin'.   The breakfast bagels are filling, and apparently the breakfast tacos sell out fast. My bagel had way too much dried rosemary on it, but that seems to be a popular bagel trend, so I guess I gotta deal with it or scrape it off (which I did).

name: The League Kitchen and Tavern
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Michael Q.
reviews.description: Came here for lunch with a few of my coworkers and it was pretty good.  Lunch was solid service was good but I think that was partially because there were only 4 tables occupied when we were there but the service was attentive.  Menu is pretty large and has breakfast items during lunch so no complaints there because I do love me some breakfast for lunch or dinner.  Overall solid place would come back if I'm in the area not making a special trip here but if I'm here I definitely would come back.

reviews.author: Kasti K.
reviews.description: This place wildly exceeded my expectations.   We are in from out of town, it's a perfect Sunday spot for lunch and to watch football. The Sunday crew in the bar was super fun, our server Aaron was really kind   Their Sunday drink special is $3 mimosa and bloody Mary's.   Their gluten free bun is the best I've had at a restaurant, it is nice and chewy and stays together.   The chicken sandwich was great, a huge chicken breast with lots of bacon and avocado. They do a "first timer" complimentary dessert of their chocolate dump cake, my husband said it was great!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Very unassuming from the outside but walk in and you find a upscale gastropub style restaurant.
