We came at lunch and though I was initially hesitant to bring in kids, there ended up being plenty off other families in there. The menu was upscale American. Given it was lunch time, we went with hamburgers and sandwiches. The main dishes were all really good and a decent portion (not too big, not too small). The sides we got were a bit under seasoned though. Lastly, there should really be a hamburger on the kids menu.   Overall, really enjoyed this place. Will come back for dinner to try more of the menu.

reviews.author: Ken D.
reviews.description: The League is part neighborhood bar, part gastro-pub and I love both parts!    The bar and dinning areas are separated.  Despite both being relatively small, there's plenty of seating.  Choose from high-tops to semi-circular booths to high-back swivel bar stools.  And they have an outdoor patio as well, but not much of a view.   The League is a great place to meet a friend for drinks, a casual date, weekend brunch, watch Sunday football, or to just to ride the bar solo.    Excellent food with new, weekly specials, including a burger-of-the-week. On Mondays they have 2-for-1 burgers for dine in - can't beat that!  They also have cocktail specials to go along with their food specials (in addition to their menu and drink standards).  I wish they had a bigger beer wall, but the selection is serviceable.   The League is one on my regular spots and I've yet to be disappointed with their food, drinks, or service.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: I was so pleasantly surprised when we stopped here for a quick lunch. Friendly service and helpful staff members greeted us at the door and I loved the Prohibition era style and decor. Lots of variety on the menu. I tried the Society burger which was tasty and my husband had the club sandwich. $3 mimosas and they sent us home with a complimentary dessert- can't beat that.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Overpriced bar food.  Fries were soggy. Burger needed basic salt and pepper to give it flavor. It was medium rare.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: This place is our most visited restaurant since moving here thirteen years ago. As a former restaurant owner / operator, I appreciate the consistency and quality of the menu offerings. The facility is always clean and tables are cleared immediately when a party leaves. They have some really good deals, like burger Monday where you buy one and get one free. They also have a mouth watering prime rib special on Thursday that we can't wait to try.  One more attraction is , if you are into science or astronomy, you might be waited on by Galileo.

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: We have been going to The League for a couple of years now. I get my hair done around the corner so it's convenient for my husband to hang at the bar. Sometimes we eat here and sometimes not.   Upside; Bartenders are always friendly and welcoming, they have great happy hour prices on drinks and apps. Also weekly food specials.   Food can be hit or miss. Between the two of us we've had everything on the menu. Club sandwich is always as hit and so is the spinach artichoke dip. Burgers sometimes a bit dry. The salmon is usually perfectly cooked. Fish and chips over battered and greasy. Prime rib sandwich is hit or miss.  Burger of the week this visit was Frito Pie Burger. I had the garlic butter grouper, which was a huge portion, but lacked seasoning on both the fish and couscous. Garlic butter was on the side, but was just melted butter with a chopped garlic at the bottom. No other seasonings.   We will continue to come hang at the bar and eat here occasionally.

reviews.author: Carl H.
reviews.description: 7/4/21 1st visit.  Already a crowd at opening.   Waitress : Kenza - very attentive, paying attention to details. ( even asked about allergies ) There's definitely a spirit of cooperation- every employee was eager to help out.  Drinks : Bloody Mary's delicious and at $3.00 a bargain. Arron the bartender jumps in to help out in the dining area. Great guy !! Food : Pot pie (basically a biscuit with gravy with a fried egg on top - WOW filling and Delicious!! Wife had the steak salad - steak cooked exactly as she ordered it.  Mother in Law had a breakfast anytime.  All of our food was delicious!!  All and All we had a GREAT experience!! Definitely will come again.  A quality restaurant ! Absolutely nothing negative to report.  As a treat on your 1st visit - we'll show up and ask about it.  Prices were VERY REASONABLE!!

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: The service was great, and the food wasn't bad, it was just meh. We tried several items on the appetizer menu, as well as one dessert.   The beer selection also wasn't very impressive, but it wasn't bad.  Gets the job done; doesn't impress.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: 5 stars for service and 2.75 stars for food. My 4 stars are on the generous side.  We dined here this afternoon. The server was very nice and took care of us. I'd give her service 5 stars.   For our food we ordered the chicken fried pork chop, the full rack of ribs, the southern burger, and the kids Mac and cheese.   Our little guy loved the Mac snd cheese. It was decent and definitely not out of a box. It didn't come with anything else but was only $5.   Hubby had the Southern burger with truffle fries ($2 up charge). The burger was solid. It could have been a slight bit juicer but it was a good burger. The "truffle" fries were not. The fries were limp and soggy and sprinkled with Parmesan but had no truffle flavor at all. Actually when you picked up a fry the cheese all fell off too. Pretty bad fries to be honest.   Older son ordered the baby back ribs and enjoyed them. They were your standard fair. Similar to what you'd find at Chili's but they cost $30 and come with a side of mashed potatoes.  I had the  chicken fried pork chop. It was very over cooked and dry and was topped with jalapeño gravy but there was no heat or jalapeño flavor at all. The gravy made the pork chop less dry though. I subbed Brussels sprouts instead of mashed potatoes ($2). They lacked seasoning or flavor. I like the taste of Brussels sprouts so I ate them but they had no other seasoning that I could detect.   The food was all fine. Not bad but at their prices I would definitely not run back.

reviews.author: Amari H.
reviews.description: Food and drinks were delicious! Tried it out for the first time and I will definitely be back. The food is quality for sure. I had the prime rib sandwich with truffle fries, and OMG! Every aspect of it was amazing and paired well together. I will say I was underwhelmed with the salmon deviled eggs... it just tasted like eating cold eggs with no signature flavor.

reviews.author: Gaye J.
reviews.description: Really good hamburgers and fries. They have a full bar so you can have the drink you want. Great neighborhood vibe

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: Give this place a try!! It's a little hidden gem! They have interesting burgers and I have tried a couple of their dishes and didn't have one that I don't like.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: The League is a cool watering hole and sporting some excellent food for the denizens of Avery Ranch.  Two for One burgers on Mondays is a great deal.  We usually pop in for a late lunch early HH and sit at the bar. Check out their small bites menu the meatloaf is pretty darn good. Fish n chips are AOK there are better fish n chips in the area but you can easily split this bountiful dish.   The League pours a good cocktail and their bloodies, according to Plus 1, are right up there with the best. There are rotating taps for you beer snobs (like me).  There is a patio off to the side and a good-sized dining room. It does get crowded hence our late lunch HH visits.  Pro tip during football season Friday nights are packed pre-game.

reviews.author: Barry B.
reviews.description: I took the family there tonight and was looking forward to having a good hamburger.   It was not to be!    It all started with a very aggressive an unkempt server with a bad attitude. We ordered the burgers which came under cooked and had soggy buns on the bottom.   The server was very rude when we asked to have the burgers redone and later literally threw a to go  box at me !  The manager got involved and was very gracious to comp the meal ,but i will not go back again because of the bad experience with a terrible server!

reviews.author: Jeanette H.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed our late lunch there, delicious appetizers and drinks. Great patio. Right as we we're done eating, a truck pulled up behind the building visible from patio and there was a strong sewage smell, it must've been some kind of clean out. Horrible. Thankful we were done or we wouldn't have been able to finish our meal. The smell was horrible.  We'll be back and hope that won't happen at the very moment we're there.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Stopped in for lunch on a Friday. Noticed the outdoor seating was pretty full but indoor wasn't busy at all. Service was good and the place was small but cozy and clean.   We ordered the fish n chips and a burger with onion rings. The burger was fine, very average and a little bland. The fries that came with the fish were also ok but a little cold. The onion rings and the fish is the part I wanted to love but didn't. Taste wise they were good. However, they had so much batter on them it made me feel sick after just a few bites. I know these were heavy items to order for lunch, but the ratio of batter was just too much.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Really clean feeling place with a great bar staff. Bloody Mary was solid and $3 on Sunday. Beer selection was on the better side for restaurants in the area. Lots of TVs. Burgers were tasty and I highly recommend ordering a side of the jalapeño gravy to dip everything into it.

reviews.author: Brad T.
reviews.description: My last visit the banana pudding was off, like spoiled milk off. Ordered the cobbler, it should be called a jam as there is no cobbler.  Poppers weren't really cooked, maybe they were just uber cold because they sat out, see below.  Order was to be ready at 6:58 and brought to my truck. I though ok they are behind...at 7:10 I went in and saw it just sitting on a table next to the door.  No clue how long it was there. They said I could just grab it and go.  Disappointing Brussels spouts we're amazing, the only reason they get two stars.   The last visit they brought it to my truck but the food was mehhh.

name: Sean Patrick's Irish Pub + Texas Grub

reviews.author: Kyle S.
reviews.description: We're visiting the area to prepare for a future move, drove past and decided to stop in. So glad we did. My husband had the Texas Philly and I had the chicken pot pie. The pot pie was so good. The crust and gravy were perfect. I wish there was more crust. I had the lunch portion. I'm not sure if the regular portion is bigger but I definitely wanted more.

reviews.author: Shawna L.
reviews.description: We had 7 in our party and everyone loved their meal, especially the pulled pork. Atmosphere was great and so was the service. Vic was great at recommendations and was patient while we made our decisions. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: Gave this place a try and was impressed. Ordered Mushroom burger and fish and chips for delivery. Very good.  The menu has a great selection to choose from. Prices are very reasonable. Great place to order from a bit to eat.

reviews.author: G G.
reviews.description: Specials were crazy good today. Cod for the fish today and app special was an excellent irish egg roll (corned beef and cabbage)

reviews.author: Jeff P.
reviews.description: I've been here for the last 3 fights and I'm watching the last one I will watch here. 15 bucks to watch on half the really poor quality TVs. Though that is just the tip of the iceberg. Got here 2 hours before the fight and they would not turn any of the TVs to the prelims out on the patio. We asked 3 times and the 3rd time they said they could not cause people wanted to watch the soccer game that wasn't even on yet, also we are the only people at the time watching on the patio. Next is there was no cover when we got here, walked in sat down been drinking and eating and they are coming around telling us we have to go buy 15 dollar tickets at the door. On top of that the food is not high quality but the most expensive on the square and the service just isn't really there.   Also half the TVs are the fight and they are small TVs! Like super and low quality  Just ripping regular people off cause they are the only people on the square that show the fights. Bad business.

reviews.author: Karin P.
reviews.description: WiFi password is Guest2018...  I haven't been to Sean Patrick's since I graduated from Texas State in 2011... Not much has changed and I'm glad for that. It was nice to reminisce.   Meet a couple for dinner while going through town. They recommended this place because they have "The Incredible Burger", a vegan burger option. They have driven to San Marcos a couple of times from Kyle just for that burger. One got it on a Patty Melt and said the Texas toast was the perfect addition. The other got it on a regular bun. Both with fries. Both disappeared quickly! They also had a Bloody Mary each. The staff was very accommodating in regards to one's request for extra olives.   My husband had the fish and chips Irish style, so a Guinness based batter. I had the fish and chips Texas style, so a corn meal based batter. Both were fantastic. I tried some of his. His better was crunchier and crisper than mine. Both were very good.  My husband had the Solid Gold lager. He said it was pretty light but good.   The overall noise got a little loud quickly but it's a Saturday night in a college town so that's not unexpected. There are a couple of pool tables and several TVs. It's a great college hang out place.   Lots of beer options.   My husband said there was a trough in the men's restroom... The ladies could have used some attention but mostly well maintained.

reviews.author: Connor B.
reviews.description: Two stars only for the food. Service was trash. Have to wait in line due to "Covid" yet no real Covid restrictions. Can't order another beer without getting back in a long line. Won't come here for at least another year until they fix some things.

reviews.author: Brandon K.
reviews.description: I've been going to Sean patricks for a couple years now regularly with my girlfriend and my service dog. Every time we go someone always makes a comment to me about how well trained and well behaved my service dog is, and this evening was no different in regards to that. I always had a great experience with nice employees who were very welcoming.  I've never had a worse customer service experience in my life as I did today. The manager on duty Marshall Wyatt or Wyatt Marshall kicked me and my service dog out because he didn't have a vest for show that says service dog on it from Amazon. I explained to him more than I legally needed to in regards to my service dog. He at first turned me over to his manager under him, who was very nice, as employees usually are at Sean Patrick's. I compromised with sitting outside as they were busy on the inside anyways, and I didn't want to cause any issues. Then we were getting stormed on outside with winds blowing everything off our table and getting rained on while we ate. We only needed to have their coverings for the outside patio rolled down, but they took forever, and after asking multiple times for someone to come take care of it, I began taking care of it myself when finally Marshall Wyatt or Wyatt Marshall comes out and attempts to take care of it, but the covering just kept flying into our table and hitting my girlfriend. While we are getting pummeled by their outside seating covering. I pointed at it while making eye contact with Mr Wyatt, he makes eye contact, but continues being fixated on a tv while he leisurely walks over to assist. He walks back inside after putting a chair in the way. Well, the chair blows back on us with the crazy winds. We walk inside and get harassed by a bar back because Marshall Wyatt instructed him to in regards to my service dog. After explaining the law to the bar back we sit down, and I determined it was time to talk to someone about the experience I've had tonight. I spoke with the manager under mr Wyatt. Again, she was very nice, welcoming, and apologetic. After speaking with her mr Wyatt comes over to ask me how he was "rude" to me. I explained to him my experience, and he proceeded to argue every detail to defend and deny his lousy service. I thought he would come over to take responsibility as a manager and apologize, so I was caught off guard and told him that I didn't want to hear his argument, he then snatched everything off our table and kicked myself and my girlfriend out, saying that my service dog was in there "illegally," even though I tried to explain to him that he can simply refer to the ADA website. I cannot say I will be coming back until Mr. Wyatt is gone.  Owner Brian Jeffrey, please make this right, and reach out to me. I will miss going to Sean Patrick's, but who my money goes to is a huge thing for me.

reviews.author: Alex N.
reviews.description: So the waitress said my buddy was good to bring the dog inside to order, but when he did the bartender told my buddy that he had to get the dog out of there since it didn't have a service vest on, and my buddy said sure and was telling his girlfriend the order then the bartender cussed him out saying did he fucking hear him, and to get the fucking dog out of there. He was the tall bug eyed one

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: If you are looking for some hardcore authentic snooty nosed Irish pub...don't come here (lad or lass).  You're NOT in Ireland!  This is Texas!  If you are looking for a place with some great food with an Irish flair, you are good to go.  If you like cold beer, and a great selection of it, again, you're good to go.  If you like good service, yep, good to go.   Lots of TV's.  Great place to take in a game.  Wonderful place to hang out in a college town and pass some time.  They've got pool tables, shuffleboard, a nice outdoor patio for you and your dog.    Overall, great drink selection.  Great beer selection.  Tasty food.  One of my SMTX faves, and certainly my GO-TO when I am in town!

reviews.author: David M.
reviews.description: Love the food here, good drink selection too. Great place to watch a Texas State away game.

reviews.author: Mari B.
reviews.description: 1st time here and we were beyond thrilled with the food, drinks and service. We were made aware of the specials immediately and offered lunch portions. Bangers and mash was excellent!  We will be back!

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: I've been here before and previously would've probably given 3-4 stars , but they have definitely stepped their game up!!!  Me and my boyfriend came in to watch the World Cup game because I remembered this place had tons of tv's, and the most seating out of pretty much any bar in San Marcos . We ordered drinks , chili cheese fries, and a DELICIOUS 2$ scoop of pistachio almond ice cream in a waffle cone . All the food was awesome ( which I can't remember saying in past experiences .)   After the game we opted for some shuffle board and darts , which was a great end to an awesome World Cup game . Couldn't have asked for a better place/ environment for watching , enjoying great food, and hearing a lively crowd !!!

reviews.author: Kim C.
reviews.description: My husband and another couple came in to have a few drinks and some food. The other couple ordered fish and chips. When their order came out the fish and chips were awful, breading was soggy and the 'white' fish was grey in color, they were refunded the meal, but didn't want to take a chance on anything else. Later I went to use the restroom, only to be in a stall that has no toilet paper. Very disappointed as I was from out of town and looking to try something local. Very disappointed.

reviews.author: Ben S.
reviews.description: Love coming here this is one of my go to places in San Marcos. They have great food I recommend always getting a triple play for an appetizer! The beers always cold plus $6.50 mini pitchers on Fridays can't beat that!

reviews.author: Christie - Matt R.
reviews.description: This place is far from being like an Irish pub with Irish food. Any Non-American visiting would tell you Shepard's Pie is made with lamb and not beef.  It's ok to make it with beef but one must correct their menu as it's correctly called "Cottage Pie" when made with beef.   Blackjack Burger - Pretty Good Philly Cheese Steak - No Flavour (yes, there's a damn U in it) Smithwicks - Ran Out (pronounced incorrectly... don't say the W)  As a immigrant this is far from Irish, in fact so far removed from anything Irish it's an insult. No offense, but an American would never know the bloody difference! In addition, the bathrooms are named "Lasses" and "Boyos".... the ladies is a SCOTTISH name and the men's is WELSH name; no S at the end. This damn place needs to learn some shit really quickly, because they look like fuck'n idiots to everyone out of county.  Skip this shit-hole and get a decent beer and food at Aquabrew down the street... you were warned, so go ahead regret it at your leisure!

reviews.author: Stacy L.
reviews.description: My husband and I had drinks and dinner here last night. He ordered the pork sliders and they were horrible.  The meat tasted like it had been cooked for a week.  The BBQ sauce was gross.  I had the pretzel and it came from a box. I paid $9 for it. The drinks barely had a shot in them and were over priced. We won't waste our time going back.

reviews.author: J D.
reviews.description: Pros: Good draft beer selection; good pork chop; amazing in-house Guinness BBQ sauce; pretty good BBQ bacon burger (pro tip order BBQ sauce on side so you get a healthy helping); very good onion rings  Cons: Can be very loud; small dipping sauce containers (may charge extra for BBQ sauce)

reviews.author: aimee r.
reviews.description: Tables are more like 4 feet apart not even close to the 6ft  suggested by CDC!  It's fine on the off hours but by 5pm, all the non science believers show up  and ignore social distancing. I suggest coming early and leaving by 5pm so you can  avoid community spread. IMO.  Otherwise the staff , and food are fantastic! If it wasn't 2020 pandemic this place would be awesome. But the crowds were out of control.

reviews.author: E. A. J.
reviews.description: First time at this bar, good atmosphere and good deals on beer. Server was okay, nothing special but that's not why we came. First off we ordered fried jalapeños and got fried pickles, but didn't say anything because it wasn't that big of a deal. The issue was at the end. We tried to tell him separate tabs, handed him a 20 and a credit card for the two tabs. He kept the 20 and didn't bring back any change, and charged all of the drinks on one tab- never saw him again. We were in a rush so couldn't track him down to correct it. Needles to say, a little disappointed...

name: The Dig Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Drove by here today and thought I would check it out and I liked it! I ordered a Peacemaker Beer, an ale that tasted good. The next time I want to try the Blackberry beer. The name itself is appealing. Since it was close to dinner I figured I should order food instead of going home and cooking. I got the fish and chips. You can order the 2 piece or 4. I got the 2 piece with cut fries. It was cooked good. The fish was flaky and not oily. The pubs tarter sauce was good.. the fries were very good too..   The service was very good. There was a sign to sit yourself which I did and within 1 or 2 minutes my server stopped by to get me started. She showed me the ropes and got my beer and food quickly. I was really surprised at how fast my food came out. I can say it was just under 10 minutes but I was still surprised at the promptness. There was quite a few customers but the servers were on top of it. They talked to the customers as if they were family.   The place was clean and there was good parking. The beer menu had several types of craft and IPA beers. I'm  pretty sure I will return when I have time. My total cost including the food and beer was only $14, amazing! Thank you Dig Pub for being in Cedar Park and giving up another place to get a beer and some grub in a friendly way!

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: Evening in the suburbs and the dining options were dwindling. I was getting hungry and being out with my buddy meant that I'd have at least one more beer. My friend went through his mental list of places and came up with The Dig.   We arrived there and fortunately got there in time, it was a slow night and the kitchen was about to close so we quickly made our choices. I saw that they had Scotch Eggs and I'm a sucker for Scotch eggs, but unless you're a vegetarian/vegan what's not to like about an egg wrapped in sausage that's then deep fried?  I also ended up getting their Buffalo Chicken Sandwich because...actually why do you need a reason?  The egg was good, a little thin on the sausage side but the mustard dip added a little more savory. The sandwich had a good amount of spice but the sauce was pretty runny so it was messy but otherwise good.  They do have a lot of taps and I appreciate that they try to have a little bit of everything and focus on locals. I get that they have to strike a balance between locals who want a beer that's cold, yellow, fizzy and domestic and crazy whale chasing beer nerds that are into barrel aged, wild/lacto, hopheads but for my visit it was a little more on the tame side. I had a sour from Prairie and a local mead which was great and at the time, that was about it.

reviews.author: Krista L.
reviews.description: In their left side room with 2 booths, the first booth was propped up to look like it was stable, but it collapsed when I sat down ...  my butt literally hit the floor! And I've broken my tailbone twice while playing sports. My wife and I reported this to several staff and received shrugs!! We stayed long enough to finish our beers and while we were drinking, staff propped the booth bench back together. I disassembled it twice but they kept putting it back. This place is just begging for a customer to get hurt and get a lawsuit!  If someone does, then I'm willing to testify.   I've posted photos of the bench c

reviews.author: Will S.
reviews.description: The Dig is a great local place in Cedar Park to meet friends and try out some really tasty brews, or wine if you prefer.  Lots of good seating both inside and out for  those who want a more open environment. Their pub grub is excellent, Scotch eggs to die for and some really tasty cheese offerings as well as some standard fare. The whole staff is friendly, honestly, never had a grumpy server and I really like sitting on a couch...one of the seating options depending on where in the pub you are. Check this place out, you might find that you....DIG it too.

reviews.author: Rainey B.
reviews.description: So...for those who believe that The Dig is run by snotty brats, perhaps you should have some consideration for the amazing service industry folks who have gotten us through the last almost 2 years of Covid he!!. Erik, Sage, Miles, Kayla and the rest of the crew have been considerate and friendly throughout and the food quality has always been outstanding. The beer selection now is better than it has ever been (coming from an Austin beer snob who used to live on Rainey). Don't pass this place by if it is on your radar!

reviews.author: Chris R.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable staff about beer options. Friendly staff. Good food. Plenty of indoor and outdoor sitting.

reviews.author: Lucky N.
reviews.description: This place is interesting. The right side of the restaurant looks pretty nice and lively and the left side of the restaurant looks like they gave up or ran out of money on decorating and just put a few tables out. They also have an outdoor area but no shade so I didn't want to sit out there unprotected, otherwise, it would have been nice because I had my dog. It was a bit busy so unfortunately had to sit on the left side (maybe everyone else there agrees the right side is better and that's why they all preferred to sit there). It didn't look or feel particularly clean and I'm a clean freak so I didn't particularly enjoy sitting there.   The service was fine; the waitress was nice. The food was pretty decent, but nothing outstanding or memorable where I feel I have to come back again. It was fresh though and I appreciate that for comfort food, it wasn't soaked in oil. I think the ambiance had already turned me off so I didn't enjoy my food as much as I would have it was clean.   They are known for their beer but I don't drink beer so take my review with a grain of salt. Clearly I'm not a dive bar kind of girl (unless it's out for drinks and bar hopping) but plenty of people are fine/really like those types of places so if you do, you'll enjoy this place. I'm not knocking this place and I would come back if friends wanted to go but I like more of an ambiance when I go out to eat.

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Ordered a two meals and drinks  They brought one meal out and forgot about the other..... asked twice.... they said they didn't want one to get cold. It was clear they forgot... wasn't till we went to leave the brought out the other...  asked for it to go, didn't even do that brought it out plated, we had to ask for a box.  what a joke. Honestly party of two how hard is it to make two meals.  Don't go here

reviews.author: Gregor M.
reviews.description: Wow.  Some rude, snotty young people working at this place.  I don't expect great service from a dumpy joint like this, but I do expect civility and respect.  I am sure it's not easy to find good help these days, and perhaps it's a particular challenge to find young people who display a modicum of tact and dignity these days.  Nevertheless, in that case the owner shouldn't depart and leave the bar to let it be run by insolent brats.  My friend agreed with me as we left that we would never set foot him The Dig Pub again.

reviews.author: Kelsea K.
reviews.description: Good selection of various beers! Lots of tap options. Grilled cheese might have well been on the kids menu, pretty flat and boring... but my 5 year old liked it!  The adults got the Thor's Hammer and BLTA with fries and the table shared scotch eggs and pickle chips for apps. Sandwiches were straightforward and tasty and the fries were thick but crispy outside and soft inside.   Scotch eggs were better than Renaissance festival... but could have more sausage.  Pickle chips were average bar food. Overall, good meal and fair prices!

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: What a great evening at the Dig Pub! We took our dog and enjoyed sitting outside in the casual picnic area. Ben and Ashley provided the best service we've had in quite a long time. The food was fresh and quite tasty. Many choices for beer on tap...wine and cider, too. We will be back soon!

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: Food - Acceptable Service - So-so Friendliness - Poor Chance of a return visit - Zero, mostly due to the unfriendliness of the waitress. Perhaps some training in the area of making your guests feel welcome in your establishment would help alleviate this problem.

reviews.author: Nicki T.
reviews.description: They now have Sunday brunch! It's fabulous and delicious with craft beer. Who doesn't love eggs Benedict? Wonderful. The new owner's getting serious with the menu! Love the beer selection as always. The outdoor area greatly enhances the Dig Pub experience. Can't wait for game nights and dinner club coming up next year!

reviews.author: Howdy B.
reviews.description: Nice place with relaxed environment. I'm not a beer drinker but I saw lots on tap. It's dog-friendly and the food is yummy. Alexander was super friendly and accommodating. We will be back!

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: Very good food. Wings on Tuesday, fish and chips on Friday. Erik does a REALLY GOOD job. Good beer selection too.

reviews.author: Jim O.
reviews.description: The place to go in Cedar Park for a brew. Wife and I went for our anniversary night out to grab a bite and a brew. We had a blast. Service was exceptional with four different staff asking if we were good or needed anything. They were prompt and courteous and just plain nice. Food was served quickly and was delicious. Wife had the patty melt and I had the monte cristo; both were exceptional. The poutine as an appetizer is also on the to do list. We will be back.

reviews.author: Brian M.
reviews.description: We have been craving some loaded fries so we did a search and found this place. Recently they started offering delivery so we decided to order loaded fries, fried pickles, and a few beverages. The order was done fast and delivery was fast as well. Delicious food for a decent price. Support your local restaurants!

reviews.author: Carson C.
reviews.description: You know, I just wanted to come here for a quick bite to eat and a beer after playing disc golf in the area. What I left with was the best, most attentive staff  I've experienced since COVID. The food was underwhelming but filling so, no complaints from me. But again, the staff! I'll come back for them!

reviews.author: Julia Elizabeth Brack C.
reviews.description: Been checking this place out online for months now and finally got an opportunity to go in person today. Wow. What a superior waste of time! It makes sense now why it was so empty when we went in.  You would think that as we're just coming out of a pandemic, pub and bar owners would be over the top happy to have people show up to eat and drink their food.  Well, not this owner! I'm still in shock how rude he was to me and in so little time of me being there! His bar waitress was super sweet and answering questions as it was our first time there. The plan was to order some grub, and craft beer and go sit outside on the picnic tables on this beautiful Sunday.  I was into my second question about one of the brunch items, when he rudely interjected himself into our conversation by trying to answer my question for the waitress where he clearly had not actually heard my question at all. I then corrected him by repeating what I actually asked. He then tried to defend his ignorance by stating something else about the food they serve that was a complete contradiction to half of the menu items. You should of heard the way this guy talked to me, there was absolutely no reason for it, completely unwarranted.  Plus he made himself look like a total idiot in front of everyone and it was so obvious. The more obvious thing was that he didn't want our business. When I say our, it was my husband, 2 yr. old and me. Maybe he felt threatened by our kid? He wasn't misbehaving or doing anything crazy. The nice waitress was chatting with him and everything was totally fine. And then out of no where the owner was just a total dick to me!! So of course we left, I mean who would stay!? But that's exactly what he wanted, for us to leave. With pleasure, Asshole!  I felt bad for the nice waitress, she seemed to be in shock also. Sure hope she finds somewhere else to work since I can bet she gets treated like garbage.  Funny thing is that I can't even comment on the food or beer which is all I was yes to try. This guy should do the world a favor, sell the place to someone who actually wants business and go take a class in The Important of People skills in the food and bev business. Mean people suck and they need to learn how to be nice or just grow the F up.

reviews.author: Jesse C.
reviews.description: First of all, not family friendly. Took my daughter here for a dinner with our dog ... sat outside, and ordered a couple of burgers, and after a long day I wanted a couple of cold, craft beers. Perhaps I shouldn't have expected a family friendly atmosphere, but I honestly didn't think I had to think it through too much. So, a group of men in their 30s-40s began arguing about a patron sneezing , dropping "f bombs". The patron went in to get the owner. I thought "ok cool, the owner will take care of this." Instead, of calming the situation, he comes out dropping "f bombs" of his own, bragging about how he's going to kick all their asses, and how big of a Texan he is. I asked if he could watch his language in front of my family, he ignored me. So, I took it as a way to teach my daughter that this is the definition of a bunch of men that are nothing but losers. I told her, this is not the way men that have any class should act in public. There were also plenty of other women around that didn't need to hear all of this male drama while they are trying to have an enjoyable evening with their families. The guy that actually started the whole thing apologized. Owner, Eric, you should be ashamed of yourself. Dude, have some awareness ... no one cares about how cool and tough you think you are while they are trying to have dinner and spend some time with their friends and family. The people next to me just got up and left, too. You were so caught up in your own ego, you didn't even notice. I spent $42 and still left your staff a 20% tip, mostly cuz I felt sorry they have to work for such a loser. Not sure what Texas you claim to have grown up in, but not the one my family has lived in for 6+ generations. We all make mistakes .. and I rarely leave reviews or waste any of my precious time on this kinda thing .. but this needed to be said.

reviews.author: Sergio S.
reviews.description: Tasty brews provided by friendly folks (and a people-loving pup).  Josh provided wonderful recommendations on what to taste based on my likes, and some great conversation for an out-of-towner like me. I was even greeted by Roman, a large unshy black lab.  This is a place I will always come back to whenever I'm in Austin.

reviews.author: Margaret L.
reviews.description: So we've been on the road since last May and this is a place that I'm inspired to review. Great beer. Great space. Great food. Good people. As a nomad from Austin's little sister city (Asheville, NC) we give you a hearty 5 stars!

reviews.author: Dan G.
reviews.description: we were exploring various breweries, wineries and distilleries on our trip to Austin and came across Nomadic Beerworks by chance.  We loved their beverage offerings as well as their food.  The staff was welcoming and friendly and we stayed for a while just chatting at our table and nibbling on snacks after lunch.

reviews.author: Jen P.
reviews.description: Beer on point, staff awesome, jalapeño cheddar pretzel...delish!!!  Brice and team have an awesome thing going on here, highly recommend swinging by and checking out their brew.  Porter and Saison were our favorites!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: We've tried to stop by a few times on weekends but it was always packed. Now I know why - this place is great! Swung by for a weekday lunch and it's almost deserted. Plenty of seating inside and out. Mutt friendly. Beer was pretty good. Not very hoppy IPAs but good nonetheless. I like places that don't have pretentious attitudes towards food when food is not their primary business. Paninis are perfect for a brewery - low fuss, easy, fast. And tasty! Had the Reuben and the turkey/pesto. Now that we know this is a midday weekday kinda place, we'll be back!

reviews.author: S J.
reviews.description: Well the sandwiches are bomb, the beer is bomb, but after a year of requesting a changing table.. speaking to the owner and him promising a changing table .. coming back multiple times and no changing table .. I'll have to just go to every other brewery that Can accomdate mother's... sorry of our neighbor booth that had to smell shit next to us but we had to change in the booth ‍

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Neat little brewery tucked away only about a block from Congress Av. Got a flight of 5 beers including the tropical haze, cider, PBB Stout, BBA Stout (11% but still very smooth and wouldn't be able to tell it's that high with how easy it is).  Enjoyed all the beers but went back for 2nds with the BBA Stout, comes in a 7oz pour due to the higher abv.  They serve a variety of diff sandwiches, we tried their Hartie Artie, basically a crispy sandwich with artichoke and tomatoes in it, real crunchy and satisfying! Whole heartedly recommend coming to check this place out yourself!!

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: COVID-19: Open! Order by calling in OR you can also order in person. I called in.  I've been here pre-pandemic and during, and I gotta say...I'm so glad they're here to grace the South Austin beer community with their presence. When I visited the first time they had just opened and their taproom was still a work in progress. They still had a good selection of board games, self-serve water and beer/cider in a dog-friendly taproom. Yes, I repeat...bring yo dawgs.  Most recently, I ordered a trio of their 32 oz crowlers. There was a deal going on, and I GOTTA SAY THE SEVEN STILLS OMG. That scotch ale was deliciously dark and creamy without being overboard. I was afraid it would be burning on the throat and too infused with that liquor aftertaste. BUT it was so deliciously decadent. It had a dark chocolate feel with a full and steady mouth feel! Deeeeelish. I hope they brew it again. Their Peak Season IPA was also SO yummy and refreshing. I just checked out their tap list and there are so many creative and interesting beers right now. SO GET ON IT Y'ALL.  Pro Tip: check out their instagram page because there are usually cool deals or posts (like one time they gave free warm pretzels to the first few customers)!

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: Much thanks to Simon for listening to my preferences and letting me taste Call Me Sir. I liked it so much I brought some home. The parking is spacious and the bathrooms clean. Service is excellent and lots of seating inside and outside.

reviews.author: Neal N.
reviews.description: My new favorite brew pub,  the IPA I had yesterday was splendid. I bought a Barks for Beers... for a friend.

reviews.author: Charles W.
reviews.description: These guys, you just have to root for them.  I was here one time while in town for vacation.  If im back in Austin, im back at Nomadic.  Great people with great beer and unsuspecting great food.    Peak season is a top tier hazy IPA.  Radberry was a great sour that was sweet without being fruit juice.  I think it'd satisfy both the tart lovers and Kettle sour seekers.  I was saving my appetite for a BBQ heavyweight but after tasting my girlfriend's turkey pesto I totally regret my decision to not get food.  The whole thing was a delight.  The flavors and texture all come together to deliver one heck of a Sammy.   Definitely a destination to stop at!

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: This was a wonderful experience!  We had the sunrise get down and the stay classy beers - both great!  I had the Turkey pesto panini which was to die for!  It's on easy tiger sourdough bread which I love too!  It was hot and melty - so delicious!  The BF had sweet prosciutto panini which he loved too!  But I liked mine better!  The staff was really friendly and helpful. We're will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Kate C.
reviews.description: A wonderful local business! I am not much of a beer fan, but they were able to recommend one closer to my preferred taste and let me try some other samples as well. Dog friendly, but only a few picnic tables outside. They also have great coffee, if you go during the day it is nice and quiet! Friendly staff as well.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came here to hang out with a large group on a Saturday afternoon, they have a sizable space with plenty of tables, space to stand, and games to play while you're there. There was a lively bunch of people throughout our time there, but it never got too crowded.   Their beer selection was fairly limited, but it's understandable given they're quite new to the area. The bartender was super helpful and let my friend and I sample a few of them. Being indecisive I still chose to have a flight after.   My personal favorite beer I tried was the dry hopped wheat, but the hazy IPA and the raspberry milkshake IPA also stood out! Their menu was quite IPA heavy, so hopefully they'll continue to branch out, but it does look like they rotate their menu quite often.   There's also a fantastic Korean food truck out back that I highly recommend checking out while you're here.   Overall, I think the combination of good space to hang out, tasty beer, and delicious food is well worth checking out.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: This place is great! We tried a few beers and really liked all of them! Super cute space- really open and fresh :) Definitely gonna go back to try their coffee!

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Beer. Cheers for beer! And cider. South Austin brewery location that's brightly lit inside and clean with several tables and a bar. They serve their brews in a relaxed environment. The porter was very good!  Picnic tables available outside when the weather is nice. Also has Kimchi Jon's food trailer if you want a bite.

reviews.author: Robert E.
reviews.description: Great selection of beers and AWESOME sandwiches. Great service. Simon is very helpful. Lots of seating and parking

reviews.author: Lyndsay W.
reviews.description: Very pet-friendly-- there seemed to be dogs everywhere and they even have a bin of free dog treats. Good beer and good vibes. Indoor and outdoor seating available.

reviews.author: Sarah B.
reviews.description: Nomadic Beerworks is such a hidden gem!! Their beers are hand crafted and taste AMAZING. We were on a brewery tour and we started with a flight. Everything we tried was so mind blowing we had to stay!   The peak season and south swell beers were some of our favorites. In addition the food is a great balance between freshness and greasiness which is perfect for buzzed eats.  I will be taking beers home with me for sure!

reviews.author: Isso T.
reviews.description: Great place for beers. They have live bands When I went . The corned beef was awesome a few months ago. 3/4 to an inch of meat. But these last months, the meat is 1/4 inch . The turkey pesto sandwich is still good.  Friendly staff every time.  The Dessert menu is lacking.

reviews.author: Trudy L.
reviews.description: We hosted an event at Brewtorium. Their event room was perfect for our private gathering.  It was amazing! Our guests raved about the food selection, beer, cider, and mead. There truly was something for everyone. Carolyn did an incredible job taking great care of us, and we received excellent service. If you are looking for an event space, we highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: This place is fine.   The whole seating situation is confusing. You're supposed to get assigned a table at the bar, but the sign is hard to see and if the line is long it seems like groups tend to seat themselves and send a person to the line. Then, the food menus are only at the bar or at a table with a QR code, so it's confusing how you're supposed to look to decide what you want, and you have to decide on the spot at the bar. After all that, our table was actually taken and we had to be reassigned, which isnt a big deal but the whole thing seems unnecessary.   Regarding food and drink, our pretzel was good but my Cobb salad was pretty bland. It was a solid burger with a good pickle but the potato wedges or whatever they are supposed to be are mushy and not like fries or chip. They were sold out of brats.   My beer was tasty, I got the Confabulator, but my partners beer was terrible. He got the "Mark It 8, Dude," which is described as "toasty, smokey and not out of line." It tastes only of artificial smoke and caramel. I drinkable in my opinion. Probably won't be back.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: nothing particularly bad about it, but doesn't really stand out from the noise.   First off we will start with the beer. I had a flight, which come with 5 beers. I had the Dr. Doctor, the Skee-Ball champ, Electric Lederhosen, the Hopheaded strangler, and the barrel aged shadow tower. They were all pretty good. And in most markets it would have been a good lineup, but in Austin, it was nothing more than average, and they didn't really have anything that helped differentiate them from the competition.   The food falls victim of much the same problem. I had the Beer-Belly burger with German Potato Mashers. It was good. Nothing really to complain about it, but there was nothing that made it pop. It was a hearty heavy dish and delivered what it promised too.   The service was fantastic. Everyone was nice and polite, and I really had no issues with it whatsoever.   The atmosphere was so-so. The place was clean, well spaced and decorated, but the inside is essentially a large hall with a bunch of individual tables which gave the place something like a cafeteria vibe, which is the exact opposite I want in a beer garden.

reviews.author: Logan G.
reviews.description: Pizza was not very good, and we tried 3 different ones. The pretzel was tasty, the hot dog was okay.   The selection of beers was decent, and the prices were a little high for a brewery. (Brewpub)

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: Spacious and super cool eatery and brew house in an industrial area of Austin. Cool Spanish music playing and really interesting bar with knowledgeable staff on alcohol. We had a burger with pork belly on it that was delicious...pork belly could have been a little crispier and burger a little less cooked, but that's just a personal preference. Flavor was spot on! Hummus was fantastic, and curried tomato bisque was AMAZING. Salad was okay too, but I don't think that's their selling point. Overall, great Austin eatery.

reviews.author: Brianna E.
reviews.description: This place is great! All of the food is amazing and average price. The beers are great and change seasonally. I really love some of the summer beers here with tropical hints. Service is also good every time. Plenty of space. I highly Reccomend the pretzel and beer flights.

reviews.author: Sunita S.
reviews.description: I almost don't want to review the brewtorium because I don't want a ton of people to discover this amazing place. The brewtorium has a wonderful patio/beer garden that has a lot of space even during a time when all bars with an outdoor patio are over crowded with people. We usually always go here for the beer and soft pretzels which are amazing, but I tried the Joe vs the avocado bowl today and it was incredible.

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: If you go for the food, this place might disappoint. The sandwich and burger I have had were decent but severely overpriced. I enjoy a lot of the IPAs here and that's why I continue to go back. It's a great place to take a dog and visiting friends. I love the guy who works in the outdoor section -- he's a hoot.

reviews.author: Javier E.
reviews.description: [Pro's]  It is a very spacious area, plenty of tables and seats. The restaurant seems very clean, it feels great for dining alone, drinking alone, with friends or family. The staff are very friendly. The food options are very interesting.   [Con's]  It can be quite pricey for the amount of food you receive. If you do not like pickled/fermented dishes or German-inspired foods, I recommend you skip out on this one.

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: As a very German person, this place rocks. The Euro style beers are spot on. The wurst and the kraut are amazing. Excellent German experience, and it's a brewpub too. Prices are higher, but it's a brewpub not a Denny's. I like it.

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: We stopped by after picking up shirts from Kong. They offer a good selection of beers and snacks. We had the nachos, which I highly recommend. The space is large and good for groups. The also have an outdoor patio. Overall we enjoyed our visit and I'd definitely go back.

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: Great place to grab a beer and some snackity snacks. The indoor space is large with plenty of seating and there's also a patio in the back.   Food and drinks are ordered at the bar.   The menu is German inspired with items such as delicious and fluffy pretzels to flammkuchen (flatbread). The vegetarian flammkuchen is really tasty with the cashew pesto. I usually order the Stay Golden beet salad, which has quinoa and yummy toppings. I pay a little extra for chicken on top.  The beers are consistently good and the tap list is a good mix of styles. Chris, the owner/brewer (also former homebrewer), has always been great at German beers and he continues to do so on a larger scale.   If you're a non-beer drinker, there are wines and ciders available as well.

reviews.author: Chi V.
reviews.description: I've come here a fair few times with friends after bouldering next door. Just to be clear, I'm not into drinking, so I can't say what the quality or character of the alcoholic drinks are like with confidence.  The atmosphere is consistently warm and welcoming, with cool, helpful staff and actually great food. The mac and cheese is amazing (which is notable because I normally don't go for that dish), and the pizza, specifically the Pearsciutto, is scrumptious. The wait times can get a little hefty if you come during peak meal hours, and food tends to run out on Friday evenings, but otherwise, it's a great spot to chill at with friends in the area. Expect to see leashed dogs and tired but happy boulderers enjoying a cold glass of beer and hot food with their friends after a solid session. Overall, one of my favorite places to be after bouldering.

reviews.author: Kip S.
reviews.description: I had a couple of Dad Jokes and shared the pretzel and currywurst.   A Mexican lager, the beer was cold, crisp and refreshing. Hard to beat that. I feel like the lime wedge could've been more substantial, but that's pert near splitting hairs.   Buttery, chewy inside, baked to a golden brown and kissed with salt, the pretzel would please even the most cantankerous German tastebuds.   The currywurst consists of sliced bratwurst slathered with tangy housemade curry ketchup served over German potato mashers. It seemed ambitious and I was skeptical, but it turned out to be great.  And of course the patio is dog friendly.

reviews.author: Jessica B.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere outside with greenery and music. Allows dogs as well. We loved the food variety, the beer was really good, and service was nice!

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: Not the best first impression.  We ordered the brat nachos. The chips were so stale that they were literally not cracking (see video!). They were also a bit stingy on the toppings.   We had the farmhouse pizza and the one with prosciutto, pear and arugula. They were both unique flavor wise but the crust was odd to me.   I'm sorry I just didn't care for it. The bill was over $50 and the food was not worth it.

reviews.author: Jessica A.
reviews.description: We hosted a private party at Brewtorium yesterday - husband's retirement.  5 stars all the way: Service (Carolyn) was exceptional,  food was good and plentiful, and the private room space was just what we needed.  Recommend for a private party.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Having lived in the neighborhood for almost two years now Brewtorium has become my go to spot to hang out and grab a beer. It's a pretty popular spot but the space is so big I've never really had difficulty finding a comfortable spot, both during and before covid.   Their staple beers aren't my type, the Kolsch and Vienna lager seem to be their biggest hits, but they do a great job of mixing things up on their rotating beers. They consistently nail it with their IPAs and stouts, and I love how creative they get with their other offerings, but resist the urge to have them get comically ridiculous like some breweries in town. If you're looking to try something a little different that won't be a total shock to your palate I'd highly recommend the Schwarzbier. While the dark color might scare some off it's pretty light with a nice coffee taste in the background. If you blindfolded me I certainly would have guessed it was a much lighter looking beer.  The staff is super friendly and on has been on top of cleanliness and distancing protocols. When larger social events and meetups were a thing this was a great spot for them. They have a big collection of board games inside that I'm hoping will make a return some time in the near future.  The one area I will say I'm not a big fan of is the food. Most friends of mine will say go for the pizza, but the spoiled New Yorker in me sees them as an okay vessel for toppings.   Overall I couldn't be happier to live in such close proximity to a great spot like this. Highly recommend giving them a try!

reviews.author: Tim D.
reviews.description: I went to the Brewtorium and will never return based on my experience. After placing an order outside, I waited ~45 minutes for my food before going to check on it.   The cashier told me the ticket was lost because their outdoor system didn't connect, so I would have to re-order the food. She apologized and said she'd comp some items to make amends for the error. I didn't end up having anything comped on my tab, which was fine by me, but then I saw a charge come through for my original order as well.   I tried calling 5 times over the course of 3 days before finally getting in touch with someone. After explaining the situation, he told me to just dispute the charge with my credit card company and that there's nothing they can do.   Truly abysmal customer service.

reviews.author: Craig B.
reviews.description: Shiizer was wunderbar  Went with the recommendation which is usually a good move.   Joe vs the Avocado Bowl and the OG FLAMMKUCHEN  Oh yeh and they can can beer on the spot.   Didnt know german pizza was a thing

name: The Beer Plant
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Michelle B.
reviews.description: Great plant based food in the heart of Austin. Versatility and creativity in the menu with an array of beverages, including zero Proof and cocktails.  Would highly recommend and when back in town will definitely return.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Awesome restaurant! We came here for my birthday and it was great. We loved the buffalo cauliflower. Chocolate cake was great. I enjoyed the chicken and gravy dish, but the seitan was slightly too salty and chewy. If the seitan was a bit better, easily 5 stars.  Drinks were delicious - definitely try the cocktails.

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: Read a bunch of restaurant reviews on Yelp before deciding on this place. There are so many great eats in Austin and this one is definitely worth writing about.   I went in on a Sunday evening around 8:45pm. There was hardly anyone inside so I decided to eat at the bar. The bartender (Laura Lee!) helped me dwindle down my options. I had read about the tomato and nectarine salad, but was worried that it would have a mustard flavor in it. She assured me that there wasn't and admitted that she, too, wasn't a mustard fan. SO glad I ordered it! It was such a perfect balance of flavors and I finished the entire thing.   Next up - should I get the eggplant parm or the "crab" cakes. She thought about it and says "go with the crab cakes." Holy moly!!  These were INCREDIBLE! So flavorful and the sauce that came with it - just perfection! Highly recommend!!  Check this place out if you want something a little away from 6th street. It's just a few minutes away and so, so worth it. :)

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: Third visit to this upscale plant-based restaurant and were not let down. Recommend making a reservation especially if you want indoor seating. We enjoy the dimmed ambience, but sometimes large parties do make it loud inside. Our favorite starter: the Buffalo cauliflower with blue cheese. Favorite entree: the spicy "chicken" sandwich with oyster mushroom (nice that it isn't cauliflower). Not a huge fan of their Mac and cheese or loaded fries. On our most recent trip, we tried The 'burger' which was delicious especially if you like arugula. They serve upscale cocktails, beer, and wine. Pricing is pretty fair: $6-$12 for a drink and $13-$20 for an entree. Huge bonus: parking has never been an issue!!!

reviews.author: Katie G.
reviews.description: I had been here once before, right when they opened, and was less than impressed. However, I'm so glad we gave them another chance!!! Portions are very generous and we were happily stuffed. The cauliflower and Brussels sprouts appetizers are amazing. We split the kimchi grilled cheese and I crave it now! The cocktails were also great. A lot of people mention its pricy, but we really didn't think so compared to other restaurants in austin and for the portion size. We'll be back soon!

reviews.author: Allison C.
reviews.description: I went on a weekend for dinner and I can definitely understand why it was packed. I ordered the burger with loaded fries and was impressed with the flavors in both. I also tried a lot of the shareable appetizers such as the Buffalo cauliflower wings and those are also worth a try. The cocktails are also very creative. I loved the Nightwing (pictured below) which visually is very cool due to the activated charcoal.

reviews.author: Hira S.
reviews.description: The food was average. The seasoning and flavor was good but I was expecting more based on the reviews. Service was pretty slow. Atmosphere is nice inside.

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: This place is pretty good for all vegan options. The food was flavorful and the service was good. We ordered the Nashville hot chicken sandwich and the hill country chicken and gravy. There was a lot of breading on both "chicken" dishes which was a bit much but the flavor was pretty good overall. The mac n cheese was a little bland, but that was the first vegan Mac n cheese I've had. We ordered the loaded fries as an app. Those were my favorite of everything we ordered. This is a pretty loud restaurant, but isn't always a bad thing if you get seated next to the right guests! Overall, I recommend at least trying this place out! There's an extensive drink menu, so it would probably be good for happy hour!

reviews.author: Carrie M.
reviews.description: Had my first vegan restaurant experience here for my friend's birthday. We had the loaded fries and sriracha-glazed brussels sprouts for appetizers. The brussels sprouts were SO good. I was very surprised because I usually do not find brussels sprouts particularly appetizing. I had the Hill Country "chicken" and gravy. The fake chicken was really good, and it definitely didn't taste like chicken but like something close enough. The potatoes and gravy tasted weird. The Beer Plant curry had a strange taste. They had a lot of beers on tap, and we sampled around 10. The ciders were decent. I did not enjoy the "when doves cry" cocktail because it was bitter, but everyone else liked it. The atmosphere inside was really nice.

reviews.author: Tracey Z.
reviews.description: A really fun concept. I love that everything here is vegan so I don't have to worry!   Starting off with the Sriracha Brussels - very tasty. I wish there was more glaze on it though and that it packed more spice. It's pretty mild but the sprouts were still quite tasty. The Carolina was a very interesting sandwich. I was expecting them to use jackfruit in a pulled pork sandwich but they used banana blossom instead. The flavor was there especially with the bbq sauce but the texture was definitely weird.  My favorite from this place is the kimchi grilled cheese! Being no dairy I have not had a grilled cheese in AGES and it was definitely something I really craved. This grilled cheese hit the spot. I love that they added kimchi and pear to give it more depth. The kimchi was pretty overpowering though. But overall the sandwich was so delicious.  Great food, slightly pricey.

reviews.author: Swati G.
reviews.description: This may be my favorite vegan restaurant in Austin. The cocktails and food are great, moderately priced, and the ambiance is just intimate enough to enjoy your meal with your group without feeling too pretentious. Even if you don't have any dietary restrictions, I'd recommend trying this place out and enjoying an evening in this quiet neighborhood. No reservations required either

reviews.author: Claire G.
reviews.description: Great spot- friendly, cozy atmosphere with a really outstanding staff and tasty vegan food. Our server went out of her way to bring us samples of the sauces for our food so we could choose our favorite (and they were so good!) The burger and the heart of palm "crab" crakes were delicious, but our favorite was the seasonal AMAZING tomato peach hazelnut salad.

reviews.author: Blake I.
reviews.description: First visit so here are the parts experienced; Seating:   There are indoor seating options and some options in the breezeway.  Not quite outdoor but it did provide fresh, moving, outside air which made me feel more comfortable eating there. I can see this seating as advantageous during rainy weather  where you could eat "outside" and remain dry.   The food: looking at the other plates, I want to go back to taste what I saw. I ordered the chicken plate. Everything on the plate was well seasoned.  What I would suggest is if you like gravy ask for extra. I didn't have enough for both the potatoes and the chicken.  The chicken was super crispy, you definitely need the heavy duty knife that comes with it. It was great!  Would return for a meal to try other options.

reviews.author: Mansi D.
reviews.description: Some of the best vegan food I have ever had. I am not normally a fan of fake meat or vegan cheese, but this place did it perfectly! Came here on a Saturday for brunch and was really pleased with the service. We got the pimento cheese dip as an appetizer, and dare I say it was better than real pimento cheese! We also got the honey butter chicken sandwich, carrot lox, and stuffed french toast. All were delicious! I will be back to try the dinner menu.

reviews.author: Prasiddha H.
reviews.description: My best friend whose vegan was raving about this place since I landed in Austin and I knew I had to give this place a shot! We came by a few days before and unfortunately this place was packed so I decided to swing by before heading back to Cali. We ended up going for brunch and luckily I was able to call and snag a last reservation. Not gonna lie I was pumped! Once we got there we were promptly seated and ended up ordering:  *Fried chicken and waffles: I loved the chicken here because it was super crispy and it had like hot chicken seasoning which was BOMB! I literally kept eating it off my friends plate. The waffles in my opinion were too crispy and not sure how to describe but they were really bland. Like I have had waffles before and I understand they are light on flavor but this literally had no flavor whatsoever. Had to eat it with chicken to taste something  *oyster and grits: me and my friend were sooooooooo excited to order this not gonna lie but this was  the most disappointing. This was grits with chili oil and grilled mushrooms with seasoning. The grits was one of the most bland things I have ever tasted and not gonna lie I couldn't eat much. Usually I still scarf food down but this just tasted like nothing. Chili oil made it too oily. My friend tried mixing it up to eat it but still flavor was lackluster. I would not order this again.  *Kolache: this was a pastry like thing with impossible meat inside and again did not LOVE. The meat inside was lukewarm - cold. I liked it overall but needed more stuffing and more warmth since its a pastry!!  Overall, the food was okay. I don't know if I would try again unless I came for dinner. Service was great though and really enjoyed the help!

reviews.author: Elissa S.
reviews.description: Fun place to grab a beer and hangout with friends the food truck has good tacos .   Cool vibe and unexpected location inside and outside seating , I liked the music

reviews.author: Laura G.
reviews.description: I made a reservation here and ended arriving late. I called and they were very understanding. The food is absolutely delicious and the environment is awesome as well. Our waiter was very nice and the food was out in a timely manner. I am so happy I got to try this place out on my visit to Austin. I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Elyse M.
reviews.description: The Beer Plant was open for dine in eating and they have take out options as well.  The food here is delicious! I got the "chicken" platter which came with green beans, mashed potatoes and gravy, and 2 pieces of fried "chicken".  My goodness the flavors were amazing! The green beans had good seasoning and were uniformly cooked, each being a bit crispy. The mashed potatoes and gravy were savory and had a really good flavor profile. The fried "chicken" was a little dry and the texture was slightly different than what I've had at other places but it all worked together. Whatever seasoning they used in / in the "chicken" was phenomenal! Each bite was a burst of flavor in my mouth it was soo good.   The less great aspects of thia place are the food took a really long time to come out from when we ordered. I think it was like 40 minutes, maybe an hour? They also have a system where you put a card on the table to indicate you'd like a waiter to come over and it took 25 minutes for someone to stop by even though there were multiple staff that passed us before that point.   My friend I was eating with also didn't enjoy their gyro as much as I enjoyed the "chicken" platter. She said it was cold and ok but not super great but she liked the fries and cheesecake.  I would definitely order from here again but maybe do takeout instead of dine in.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: The most amazing vegan fried chicken ever!!!! I ordered the Nashville hot and crispy, Mac and cheese, I suggest you do the same. I've been obsessed with Nashville hot vegan chicken since going to Nashville and not finding any options there. It tasted like chicken. The perfect combination of crispy, fried perfectly and they shredded the mushrooms to mimic the texture of chicken. I loved that they had options that are soy and gluten free. I ordered a drink and dessert as well, everything is crafted with love here  can't wait to go back. It has limited hours.

reviews.author: Cara C.
reviews.description: Delicious food and great service. Loved the "chicken" and waffles. The mimosas were really good as well.

name: Abel's On the Lake
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Hermes P.
reviews.description: I came into use the restroom since Mozart's next door was beyond capacity. I was told customers only. That's fair. I asked if I could just pay for something so I can use the restroom. I was told the cheapest thing was an $18 shirt. Upon checking the menu online, I can see that that was a lie. I would have gladly paid for $12 nachos to eat but nope..the cheapest thing was the shirt. Gotta keep people from not using the bathroom.  I can understand the policy. But lying and turning away a transaction to hold a principle? It deserves a Yelp review.

reviews.author: Nikiba J.
reviews.description: I would really like to give Abel's their 5 stars which they probably deserve but the Restaurant sits at the bottom of a hill. This is not ok when you're bringing in a bus loaded with passengers. Shell passengers at that (Shell has a zero tolerance for unsafe practices). Cars on every side of the street so a bus would have to unload in the street. Luckily for me this time Heaven was on our side by allowing us to get our buses up from the hill. Going down the driveway was just as challenge because we had to turn just right to make the turn to drop the passengers off at the door.  The OS came when we had to turn the buses just right to get out the drive and up the hill onto the street. What makes this even more dangerous are the pedestrians walking in front of the bus, to the side of the bus and in the back of the bus.  It takes a skilled driver (like myself) to be able to get out of the mess I was in. This was the perfect time of all the times I should told my clients dropping them at the door was unsafe. But there I went.  If I didn't position the bus just right getting up that hill a tow truck would have to be called to unstick me. That's what we call bottoming out the bus, when the axil is stuck on concrete enabling the bus to move.  Now my coworker trusted me and followed me right down that forsaken hill and tried to get up the hill as I did.  Now mind you, if we get the buses stuck it will take a tow truck at least 2 hrs to be dispatched and out to our location. It's cost $$$ for a bus pull out, the restaurant is located in a neighborhood so they would have to use an alternate to their homes, patrons inconvenienced, our passengers stomachs full they ready to go to get to their hotel. Shell most definitely will report us for an unsafe practice and we would have to answer for that unsafe practice....just a mess. Anyways, I got my bus out and the other bus as well. There was no bus parking not enough curb parking so we were unable to dine at the restaurant. I forgot about that so I change my rating to 1 star. J/k

reviews.author: Aleric H.
reviews.description: Absolutely amazing Experience! Great Food, Great Views and Rob my waiter has been fantastic the couple of times I've come so far!  I have to say that I almost didn't go because of the reviews here, but my experience was totally different. And it was absolutely a 5 star experience.  Overall the Views are objectively great right off the water, the food has been very good both times - I had a really good Salmon dish most recently. But more importantly the waiter Rob has been incredibly kind and attentive - even offering Iced Tea "to go" both times.  I'd recommend you judge Abels for yourself and come to the restaurant -- I actually asked them about previous reviews and they did say they've been really shifting all of their service to be the best and that's what I've seen first hand.  I can't speak to how they were in the past, but today the experience is 5 stars!

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: Great spot for a local craft beer by the water.  Not too many vegetarian items on the menu, but they are willing to adjust on request. The items I enjoy are very tasty.  This spot is extremely puppy friendly, so enjoy your doggie date! The Christmas light show is also amazing!

reviews.author: Karyn C.
reviews.description: We went for dinner with 3 kids and 3 adults. Food was good.  Came out fairly quickly. Our server was nice as well.  Beautiful view and had a nice time.  We got there early and thankfully got right in. :) wish they had crayons and coloring pages for the kids.

reviews.author: D S.
reviews.description: I would give this 20 if I could. Visiting from San Diego, we found Abel's on an idyllic Sunday afternoon.  Although there was a wait for a table, Johnny, the BEST bartender/server EVER, found a couple of barstools and made room for us at the bar.  Johnny makes a GREAT host, and GREAT Bloody Mary!  World class. Perfect blend of spices with other ingredients.  I had the Texas burger (YUM) and my husband had Abel's Tex-Mex twist on a Philly steak sandwich. "Absolutely delicious!" The open air bar on the lake is a beautiful setting, the weather was perfect, multiple football games on big screens, and a great vibe.   Fabulous food, and not at all expensive.  But Johnny made our experience superb.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Each time I come here I'm more and more disappointed. I used to come here frequently when I was new to Austin but I think my standards were lower and theirs were higher. First of all, it's a pain to get parking around here. Once you're parked, you're better off going to one of the neighboring establishments. The food is so mediocre and overpriced, and I've nearly tried it all. It's not bad, but I'd say it's on par with many chain "bar and grill" type of restaurants. The view of the lake is the only asset that draws crowds.

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: My son held his wedding here !  The staff was extremely nice and polite! The food they catered was delicious! The views are great ! It's was extremely cold this weekend but I will be back when it warms up!

reviews.author: Kim B.
reviews.description: I came here for my graduation dinner (NOT on graduation weekend - so it wasn't that busy) and it was honestly one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. It was embarrassing for me because I picked the place. Thank God that my friends and I are pretty chill people, so we just rolled with it.  However the service was abysmal, the Mexican Martini was not drinkable, bathrooms were filthy and there was not a manager in sight the whole night. Well, at least not until we left and saw them all chatting on an unoccupied patio to the side of the restaurant. I guess it was socialization time while their servers are outside floundering. The girl who served us was seemingly taking care of the whole patio (although failing) and said it was her first week. Wild.   Two people from my party didn't get their meals until everyone else finished. We had to basically beg for our drinks. And the food was honestly 2 stars at best...  Only good thing about this place was the ambiance

reviews.author: Amber R.
reviews.description: Bad customer service, I felt like I was being discriminated. Drinks are pricey and don't even taste so great!!!

reviews.author: Alicia R.
reviews.description: I've been to abels three times now and had Carrie as a server every time, she is extremely helpful and attentive every time! She's made very good suggestions for food and drinks and always makes sure we have everything we need! Next time you're in texas come visit Carrie at abels!

reviews.author: MIchael P.
reviews.description: I've been coming to Abel's for years but hadn't been back since the start of the pandemic. I went tonight and I am so happy I did!  Abel's will be in my routine rotation from here on for dinner and drinks.   They have always had a strong kitchen for an affordable bar and grill - so much better than the place next door. Tonight, I was taken care of very well by two affable gents at the back bar, Stuart and Eric. Stuart told me I should try the blackened redfish. He shared it was a new rotating special. I was amazed how perfectly it was seasoned and cooked.  One of the best redfish dishes I have had in months. I immediately asked what I need to do to convince them to serve this on the regular menu.
