They said let our management know online so here it is.  I was texting friends about how good it was and that we need to come back soon. Please keep this dish on the menu - as often as possible - and give your chef a raise.    Another fun plus - Stuart and Eric know their sports. We had a fun smart conversation about all current sporting events.   Bottom line.  If you are a sports fan, go here. eat the redfish, ask for Stuart and Eric. drink, have fun and repeat. Also, brunch on Sundays for early fantasy games is another great call.   Five stars on this visit. See you soon.

reviews.author: Viviana R.
reviews.description: First time here... and yeah the food was not good at all. Ordered chips and queso, chips were stale and queso was clumpy. I had the chicken sandwich and it was bland. A person of color definitely did not make the chicken, because if they did it would have been seasoned. Best part of the whole thing was the Dos xx.

reviews.author: C A.
reviews.description: Bad costumer service they take 20 mins after u seat just to take u order and drinks are so expensive that they still have no shame to ask for tip and if u say no I want my change back they get all with a attitude and they don't even come back to ask u what else u need and they really racist they were acting like we weren't going to pay so after they brought our 1st drinks they brought the check right away what kinda costumer service is that I'm pretty sure I'm making more money then them and they don't even know it y'all need to work in a lot of things in this place cause that's why it's empty all the time cause of y'all service have a nice day!!

reviews.author: Molly G.
reviews.description: Sweet waitress. She was clearly slammed. That's not the issue here. Sweet potato fries were delivered to the wrong table by someone running food. Pancakes were burnt. Both out of her control. She got them both taken off rightfully so.  The BIG ISSUE was ours and two different tables cards were wrong up wrong, mixed up, and delivered to wrong tables. Our credit card went to someone else's table and we found it ourselves. Still not mad at that sweet girl at all for the record. Our tab came out cheaper and we signed it and got out. Forgive us of our sins. What was EXTREMELY CONCERNING is the manager approached my father IN THE BATHROOM and chased him out the front door. My father explained that a transaction was made and there was a signed document, end of story. Argue that with anyone especially when we were on the street walking to our car. What does the manager do? He THREATENED to call the cops! My husband, who paid the tab suggested to the manager that we go inside and talk privately. The manager proceeded to discuss this private matter  in front of customers IN THE PARKING LOT! Legally, we did nothing wrong. Transaction was made between the establishment and our family. Signed document. Off the property. Boom. If he would have came up to us and started with excuse me, we messed up, can we fix this please- would have been the start to a better approach. Chasing my father. Threatening to call the cops. Discussing in front of customers after we left. We could have sorted it out had he not been so aggressive. I was in the service industry for 8 years, he was 1000% out of line. The scenery is pretty nice though. One star fir that.

reviews.author: Aubrey A.
reviews.description: Have no idea what the food is like because I didn't get to try it. Came in with a few friends and sat for about 15 to 20 minutes, after waiting I had told the hostess that we hadn't been helped yet, she then said someone would be out shortly to help us. Waited there about another 10 minutes and still no help. They were not understaffed by any means, in fact there were people standing around doing nothing which was why I was so irritated. I had read the bad reviews and decided to dismiss them and try this place for myself, wouldn't recommend.

reviews.author: Jeff L.
reviews.description: Please don't come here. The managers are rude, servers are 45 year old men who think they have power and are so rude. Don't come here waiters are rude and food takes minimum 1 hour to come out.

reviews.author: Customer S.
reviews.description: Wouldn't recommend this restaurant. Grilled oysters weren't good. Raw oysters were poor quality. Fried shrimp basket wasn't good.

reviews.author: Emma E.
reviews.description: Didn't even get to eat here sat at the bar for 10 mins and no one helped 3 bartenders stood on there phones and didn't even bother to help us. I'm a bartender so this literally pissed me off. It was dead too just simply ignored so they can sit on there phones smh

reviews.author: Tracey T.
reviews.description: I don't know why the 2.5 star average here, we have been to this place three times now and it has been great all three. Service has been fantastic all three times, drinks have been good and food has been fine. What more could one want than sitting on the patio enjoying a cold one here with friends/family, while taking in the lake views?

reviews.author: Evelyn R.
reviews.description: Food is good and the atmosphere of the place even better. The tacos are huge, we didn't realized until we got the order that maybe 1-2 are more than enough.

reviews.author: Jeri T.
reviews.description: My mom and I were looking for a new place in San Marcos. We come here often from Kyle and tire of the places right on the interstate. The establishment is adorable - informal seating inside and out.   I first got some pappadum and a few chutneys-tamarind and mint. They were spicy! Caught me off guard but delicious for sure.    My mom ordered the Curry Trio with chicken curry, paneer tikka masala, and saag paneer. I ordered  a beef kabob curry taco. Every bite of every dish was delicious. While I loved my taco, I highly recommend the Curry Trio because you get a great choice.   When we first got there, I was like meh. Only a few tables were seated outside and the inside was empty. But right after we ordered, the place quickly filled up! Wow.   The service was superb. I couldn't have asked for a better server. I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Andrew R.
reviews.description: I came here to meet a friend for drinks and a light lunch -- we both got appetizers since we were planning heavier dinners later that night -- and when it comes to the food and drinks, I was not disappointed.   I got the vegetable samosas, and the samosas were nearly perfect, with the potato and pea filling having just the right level of seasoning. They came with beautiful mango chutney whose chunks were visible and a lovely green chutney. Both were so delicious I was hard put to decide which I wanted to put on each of the three samosas.  For drinks I had two of the Wasatch Polygamy (a nitro porter), and it was fantastic. It had a hint of sweetness, but wasn't as overwhelming as a milk stout, but also the delicious flavor of a porter.  The patio dining was great, with plenty of shade.  The only reason I'm not giving five stars is that service was... slow, with respect to both drinks and food. Otherwise, the whole thing was outstanding.

reviews.author: Maribel D.
reviews.description: Visiting San Marcos and North street popped up on my Yelp top restaurants.  Restaurant is in a renovated older house with super cute outdoor patio seating. We sat inside it's smaller but very cozy. They have a bar with many draft beers, wine and specialty drinks.  We started with the vegetable samosas and it came with side of mint sauce and mango chutney that was so tasty. Both complimented the samosas in a wonderful way. The flavors were amazing.  I ordered the tiki masala taco that was filled with so much flavor and very filling.       A must try!! And hubby had the trio which he choose tiki masala, curry chicken and butter chicken along with coconut rice. All three were fantastic.  Service was good and food was fantastic and very reasonably priced.  I'm excited to come back and try something new on the menu and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND North Street!! #supportsmallbusiness

reviews.author: Irma D.
reviews.description: Ok. Here comes another Indian restaurant review. But wait! Its TexMex Indian!  Went to lunch with coworkers on the first day of fall, so we got a table outdoors, never stepped foot inside. Service was slow, but it seemed it was only one waiter, so no points taken away for that.  Server was detailed in explaining what everything was and the level of spice and comfort. We had one vegan and one spice sensitive guest in our group, so he pointed out what would be best for the group to order. I ordered chicken nachos, and paneer tacos, wanting spice and meat. Other guests ordered samosas with mango chutney, vegan nachos, and spinach paneer. It was filling enough with a beautiful presentation! The jalapeno cream mixed with tamarind on the tacos mixed perfectly with the Indian spices.  The curry on the shredded chicken and tortilla chips (couldn't tell if they were made in house or store bought) had me trying not to lock the bowl. Will definitely go back to try more items on the menu!

reviews.author: Josh Y.
reviews.description: Hilariously good Tex/Indian fusion. The chicken Tika and curry tacos are out of this world. The queso is ok. But seriously, if you're not already in San Marcos, come here. And eat this. It's that good. If you think you're a foodie and haven't tried this, fix that. So incredibly good. And for $9 per taco that's basically a meal and a party in your mouth, it doesn't exactly set you back much. They have a great beer selection too and cool ambiance and attentive service. But the tacos are the draw. Come here. Eat the Indian style tacos. 5 stars.

reviews.author: Rachel M.
reviews.description: This is my absolute favorite spot in San Marcos for dinner! I take all my friends here when I get the chance. It's a must any time I'm in the area!

reviews.author: Akhilesh B.
reviews.description: Hidden Gem! I have never had so much authentic flavors of North Indian food in the whole of US until I tried this small Indian place close to Texas State University. The food is great, the staff very friendly and the ambiance makes you feel you are in India!

reviews.author: Lily L.
reviews.description: I ordered the butter chicken and tiki masala tacos and everything was amazing!!! Definitely will be back when I'm in town.

reviews.author: Dylan Z.
reviews.description: Food is good but the rice portion is super weak.  I even ordered an extra side of rice half way through our meal and it still wasn't enough.  Curry is only good with that harmonious balance of rice.  Kind of a deal breaker.

reviews.author: Catherine I.
reviews.description: I got a to go order here. The place was super cute with a nice ambiance. The food was amazing! I'll be back to dine in!

reviews.author: Jillian J.
reviews.description: Delicious food albeit a tab pricey for what it is. Super sweet service staff. Slow ass kitchen but the food is worth the wait. Chill atmosphere.

reviews.author: Rebecca P.
reviews.description: Unique spot with a mix of great options of drafts and curries!  We enjoy having different types of beers and this place has a good unique assortment of drafts to try.  I was able to get some lavender cider since it was pretty early in the day, but the porter and stout options were very tempting (some at over 12% alcohol).  The dogs were with us so we settled outside in their spacious yard that has a lot of shade and a fan blowing.  We ordered curry fries as an appetizer and they were wedged exactly like chic fil a fries seasoned in a curry mix powder.  These were good, but can do with a pinch of sugar and lots of extra spice.  I had the chicken Tikka masala plate and my husband got the chicken 65 taco.  The taco looked more like a wrap and wasn't as filling as what he expected, but tasted pretty good.  Fried chicken seasoned in sauce inside the taco had a good kick to it.  My chicken Tikka masala plate was delicious, but a little extra spice would help.  Also, I think the restaurant can do better by adding naan! Great concept to check out!

reviews.author: Larissa S.
reviews.description: The Katz brothers have done it again. Delicious food, y'all. The trio is worth ordering the first time you go, just to familiarize yourself with the place. And the tap menu is phenomenal (shocker ).

reviews.author: Arundathi R.
reviews.description: One of the best restaurants that serves Indian Fusion food. Everything was so delicious  All the flavours are perfect, very Indian. Would love to come back!!

reviews.author: Justin B.
reviews.description: Have gone twice. Service was good both times and the food is fantastic. I enjoyed and would recommend the curry trio; it allows you to try a little bit of multiple items to decide which is your favorite. Good vegetarian options as well.  Definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Adrienne E.
reviews.description: A Gem. Concept is to sit outside under the big pecan tree, eat great Indian food, watch the dogs play in the "dog park"  seating area, drink lassis or craft beer, enjoy great service and listen to their fun music selection. So relaxing and satisfying.

reviews.author: Liam G.
reviews.description: Food is low A tier, high B tier, however they don't serve naan, and their rice to entree portions are embarrassing, would recommend this place ONLY if you have your own NAAN and have a coupon for a free side of rice

reviews.author: Jo O.
reviews.description: We couldn't believe that we've lived in the area for so long and had never found this restaurant. The variety on the menu and flavors were incredible. We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Lacey P.
reviews.description: Loved this place! The ambiance is so cute, whether you sit inside or outside. It's not *as* good as authentic Indian food, but it's pretty good! I would highly recommend getting the curry queso, it was delicious!

reviews.author: Stacy S.
reviews.description: I have ordered take out and dined in person and have had a great experience every time!! Pizza is delicious and customer service is top notch. We love a local place that cares about their customers!! Definitely will be back.

reviews.author: Mary M.
reviews.description: I am not a thin crust person. I'm just not. Aviator's pizza crust is the perfect thickness to me, where you can enjoy the bread as well as the toppings. Their garlic pizza is one of my favorites, but the cheese burger and south Austin are also solid choice.   We always have to get their mozzarella bread because the cheese/garlic/butter/crust combination makes it one of the best things on the menu.   They have a huge rotating beer selection and plenty of seating if you're wanting to eat there. I've taken pizza to go a few times too and it transports well.

reviews.author: Sean Matthew L.
reviews.description: Aviator Pizza was solid, not amazing, but okay. We grabbed togo and picked it up on our way home from the gym so we could just collapse and eat some pizza. We got one white pie with arugula on top. It tasted like the greens weren't washed, and they were all wilted and slimy by the time the pizza got home 10 minutes later.   The other pizza was better with a variety of meats and veg on top. But overall the dough felt a little undercooked on both and generally was a bit chewy.   I'd be willing to try this spot again and likely sit down to eat it in person and hope that it's better right out of the oven, maybe it just doesn't travel well? But pizza is a notoriously delivered food item, so I would hope that's not the case.   All in all, i'm not that impressed but willing to give them another go.

reviews.author: Luna J.
reviews.description: The dough need a little more salt but overall there are good pizzas!!!  A little to bright inside. They should dimmer the lights a little.   Great for take out!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place! Variety of pizza choices. All are delicious! Plus beer  Service is friendly. Great date night.

reviews.author: Dan M.
reviews.description: So ... views of photos over past 90 days at record high: 197k, but views of reviews down to 10.5k from 32k over past 90 days. I think this means I should write about pimps and gangsters in purple Cadillacs.   No ... there were no purple Cadillacs here. Sorry! And I was the only one there. But I got me a pizza and a salad (no beer). Then went next door and dropped $300 in a cash game at Shuffle 512 because a Facebook friend/fan sat right next to me and we were having fun and gambling.   If I had gone in to Shuffle 512 first, I might have won. Therefore, theoretically, this was a $300 pizza and salad. I'd leave a woah emoji, but not sure if it will show up on Yelp. I mean, the emoji comes up but I have tried it before and it was just a weird space. And I don't want you to associate me with pimps, gangsters, and weird spaces (purple Cadillac okay).   As far as the pizza goes, traditional bar pizza. Good not great. Salad pretty solid. Atmosphere very good but I was there early so not 100% sure.   Overall, recommended as a feeler to see if it's for you.

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: First time here recently; we had planned on 'waiting' here while our daughter got a haircut next door but it turned out we were hungry so we ordered ceasar salads and a large meaty pizza.  I ordered Dem Berries beer and my honey ordered a mic ultra.  The pizza was a-m-a-z-i-n-g!!!!! The bread was out of this world.  The toppings were fresh and had delicious flavors.  The staff were nice however we asked for her to change the TV to the TX/OU game but she kept forgetting.  We asked her again and finally tried to locate it however the cable they had didn't allow the game so we had to watch it on our phone.  We wished they offered nicer plates and flatware; they gave us paper plates and plastic forks but we aren't fancy people so it was all good.  The place was super clean and relaxing.  I would definitely recommend this venue.

reviews.author: Sergio V.
reviews.description: Saw $3pints 7-9PM Tuesdays, on their online menu.. the bartender said that wasn't a thing. When I asked available deals, he also said happy hour ends at 6, when the menu also said 7-9PM. I ordered a 12in/ 3 topping and 2 beers, $30. I saw the tip auto generated to $12, so I lowered it due to false information and frustration w the employees. Today my Aviator transaction is $50 for a 12in and 2beers Definitely felt ripped off.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: I mean their pizza is amazing!! Chicken bacon ranch! The el nacho Mexican pizza too omg my favorite. Everyone at our table kept wanting a piece of it. It was that good!  We also got the South Austin, the one with prosciutto and arugula which was good but next to the chicken bacon ranch and the El Nacho... it's was just good not GREAT

reviews.author: Stefano S.
reviews.description: Order 2 different meals and receive one food and another one with empty without any grease (pepperoni pizza) and called the store manager, Gerardo and express about what was happened. Suddenly Gerardo felt so lousy and decided to sacrifice his time to make delivery to my apartment personally.  So I must be say this what this is Good Samaritan and I'd recommended this place

reviews.author: Amy-Michele M.
reviews.description: Food is great quality! Has many choices on draft. The staff have been friendly and hard working. The food comes out in a quick pace. Will go again.

reviews.author: William W.
reviews.description: Ate here with my sister and nephew. First off the pizza is great and love the beer selection BUT after ordering I used the restroom and there was a crew member that used the restroom at the same time and didn't wash their hands. I brought this up in comments about how they were doing when I had my receipt emailed. It seems whoever answered back did a half ass apology by saying maybe they were washing their hands in a different sink or were intending to wear gloves. I'm sorry but I don't wanna eat at somewhere where a higher up thinks it's appropriate for a worker to use the restroom not wash their hands put on gloves and touch my food.

reviews.author: Eric E.
reviews.description: We just arrived in town on Sunday night and needed dinner. We called and ordered a specialty pizza for pickup. It was ready super fast. The price was reasonable. The staff definitely appeared to be on top of COVID precautions.   The pizza was so so. The crust didn't impress. Sort of like a grocery store premade crust from a bag. The toppings were just kinda blah. The pizza didn't feel incredibly hot for being just out of the oven.   There was nothing wrong. It just wasn't all that. Maybe it was an off day.

reviews.author: Garrett O.
reviews.description: Enjoyed our first visit to Aviator, and we'll plan to try it again on another day.  We grabbed a few beers ($5-7/each) and ordered a caprese salad ($11) to start. Unfortunately, it came out late and exactly with our pizza ($25 for a '18 pie with pepperoni, mushrooms, and roasted garlic toppings).  The beers were great, and they had plenty of local selections to choose from. I would not get the caprese salad again because it's overpriced for the small portion size. The large pizza was great size, and with the salad, we had half to take home. While the ingredients and toppings were fresh, they didn't bake the pizza to order (disappointed because we asked for well done, but it still came out a bit doughy).  Overall, it's a bit of a premium price point, but likely worth a shot at a few other menu options.   Last note- the patio area is perfect for sitting outside on a nice afternoon/evening, so hope to bring a few more friends next time.

reviews.author: Patricia D.
reviews.description: We love this place! The staff is extremely accommodating and helpful. One lady (I'm sorry I don't remember her name) tried three different propane heaters before giving up and calling out her manager Angel, who switched tanks and expertly wrangled the fickle device to make sure we were nice and toasty.  The food is excellent. I particularly like the cinnamon dessert. Best. Crust. Ever. The constantly rotating selection of alcoholic beverages is perfectly splendid. I would recommend some great beers but you likely will not make it in time; you can never tire of the same old selection! (I recommend the Pineapple IPA and the Cherry Sour). I highly recommend gracing this fine establishment during these trying times, and enjoying a great atmosphere with wonderful people and excellent food and drink. Bonus: all this while staying safe with their proactive pandemic protocols.

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: I can't tell you how many times I've thought about this place after eating here last weekend. They have a great selection of craft and local beers. (They even had the amazing electric jellyfish hazy ipa- one of my al time favorites). We ordered the basil and goat cheese breadsticks that came with ranch and marinara, and went straight to the pecan cinnamon breadsticks. The dough here is amazing... it's light but manages to have that slightly chewy texture. It's seriously SO GOOD. And the toppings/garnishes are great quality. You know the food is amazing when I forget to take a single picture because I'm too busy stuffing my face. Definitely can't wait to come back.

reviews.author: Claire P.
reviews.description: We went in with high expectations and those expectations were met! Absolutely delicious pizza and focaccia. Came out fresh, hot, and full of flavor. Draft beer was super cold and a plus was we could bring our pup on the patio! Our waitress was super sweet and service was quick and efficient.

reviews.author: Lary K.
reviews.description: Want to give it 3.5 but isn't an option. Love the Pizza when it's consistent.. like the service when it's consistent..  luckily it's been tasty more than it hasn't...

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: Our first time here.  We were looking for a new place for Happy Hour and I remembered reading some great things about Aviator Pizza from some fellow Yelpers.  They were spot-on!    Beer selection:  Awesome!  Huge selection.  They even had a sour, Red Bud Ale, and it was the perfect degree of tartness with enough smoothness to accompany a pizza.  Happy hour is until 6:00 pm and is $1 off all beers.  Sadly, nothing off pizzas.  Pizzas: Where do I start?? Long list of specialty pizzas and so hard to make a choice!  We decided on two small (9") pizzas to share. We selected the Pepperoni and Basil and The Lazy Goat.  We loved them equally and would order both again.  Crust was a perfect thin texture.  Staff:  Super friendly and quick service.   Decor/ambience: Typical brew pub.  Lots of long tables and benches and an outdoor patio area to bring the dogs to. ( Apparently the outdoor area is also where all the parents with babies and toddlers gravitate to)  Suggestion for management: Erect a small privacy panel between parking lot and patio, OR move the "pick up only" parking spots to the right, away from the patio.  People pull into the parking spots and leave their bright headlights on while one person goes in to pick up order.  It is blinding for people sitting on the patio. This happened repeatedly.  *Spots in front of eyes*

reviews.author: Trinity M.
reviews.description: We ordered through door dash, and unfortunately they forgot our beer with our order. When calling the pizza place they couldn't refund us do to purchasing though the app. The repeatedly apologized and the manager brought us our beer herself and gave us an extra one!  Not only was the food 10/10 but the service was AMAZING. We are not from here and are going back home soon but have to say hope this review brings more customers to this 5 star place!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Hahne Estates Winery Tasting Room is located in downtown Johnson City next to the Pecan Street Brewery.  The tasting room has been open for about four months, but owner and winemaker, Gary Hahne, has been making wine for a lifetime.  Gary is a Texas Hill Country Native and his family roots date back to his great grandparents who immigrated to the Stonewall area from Germany.  His parents were close friends to LBJ and Lady Bird. The Hahne surname in German translates to the English word rooster, which ties to the colorful rooster found on the winery's logo.  There is no tasting fee to sample the four dry wines, and one sweet Sangria style wine on the tasting menu.  Each bottle of wine tells a different story of the Hahne family and the surrounding hill country.  As you sip and savor the flavor of the well balanced, delicious, palatable wines. You can walk around the winery and enjoy the historic pictures of the Hahne family, and hear about the family and area history.  I had the great pleasure of being able to talk with Gary himself about his amazing family heritage.  I enjoyed all of the five wines.  My favorite was a bold; well balanced, red blend (Tempranillo, Cab Sauv, and Nero D'Avola) entitled Texas Tapestry.  I also loved the Texas styled Chianti appropriately named Texanti.  This was a softer red, fruit forward, but well balanced with lingering notes.  I also very much enjoyed the dry rose that is named after Gary's grandfather, Opa.  The Viognier blend was also surprisingly good, with interesting peach like notes.   My visit here was delightful, and I hope to return soon.  Gary is passionate about making quality wine to enjoy with us, and to pass down his story to be remembered for years to come.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: This winery is either completely closed or moved. Another business is here now. This makes second winery today I found on Yelp that was closed down.

reviews.author: Carolyn S.
reviews.description: This was my very first winery to attend. I did not have a clue what to expect but whatever it was Mr. Hahne exceeded all my expectations. Mr. Hahne seemed a little rough around the edges until he started spilling out all the beautiful memories him and his family made through the years. We talked about cars, churches, presidents and of course, wine. I couldn't have been anymore impressed with the knowledge he has acquired. Mr. Hahne's winery was clean, filled with old music and had the perfect ambience of the Hill Country. Thank you so much for making my first experience one to remember!

reviews.author: Bre V.
reviews.description: Such a nice wine tasting experience. Owner and winemaker is fantastic. So much history in this winery. If you're in the area please stop by and support this local family owned winery. Cant wait to come back

reviews.author: Jill L.
reviews.description: Saddest little winery. Wines are not good - the sweet option is awful - but they could be better if the inside of this venue didn't smell like moldy vomit. Not good. Owner shares historical tidbits about his family's service to LBJ and seems nostalgic for the "good ole days". The good thing is that there is no charge for a tasting, but we'd gladly pay for a better experience.

reviews.author: Claudiana C.
reviews.description: This was by far the BEST winery we visited in the area. The owner and winemaker, Gary was just as fabulous as the wines. He welcomes you like family and we listened to all of his great stories. We wanted up staying for two hours and enjoying a bottle of the Texanti, it was difficult to decide which one we enjoyed the best. The wine tastings are at no charge and all five are the best we tasted in the area. We have never gone to a winery and enjoyed every tasting we had, but here we did. We would not only go back but, this would be the sole reason we would visit the area again. Thank you Gary for the wonderful wine and visit. We will definitely see be back soon.

reviews.author: Monica F.
reviews.description: Such a sweet spot! Good wines, simple and kind winemaker that loves to share his sweet history and family stories. Check it out.

reviews.author: Mike And Robin C.
reviews.description: If you've never met owner Gary Hahne before, then you're in for a real treat. Besides his wine making history, he always has great stories to tell about the Hill Country and LBJ Ranch.  His family has good history to one of the states famous politicians, Lyndon B. Johnson.  Gary has many tall and true tales that makes a good story telling experience while sipping his wines. You can also view much of his family's history with the Johnsons as can be seen with some unique photographs that are displayed on the wall.  Besides the family history, he has a good selection of wine to try out.  Right now, he's getting his grapes from just about anywhere he can.  In Stonewall, he is planning on planting a vineyard starting with an acre of Nero d'Avola.  This is one of the hot and dry Italian varietals that has a potential to do well in the Hill County's climate.  There are currently five wines available in his new tasting room that opened up back in July.  For the whites, you'll start off with the Blanco.  It's a Viognier blend with nice intense favors.  The Blanco River artwork on the label is quite spectacular.  The Opa is a dry Rose` that is a blend of Riesling, Thurgaw, and Spatburgunder (aka Pinot Noir).  A very nice chilled Rose` to have for those extended summer fall months in Texas.  The label depiction is a pencil drawing version of Gary's grandfather on a horse.  The actually picture is on the wall.  Yes, his "Opa" actually did what you see on the label and, of course, there's a good story Gary will tell you about that one as well.  The Texanti is Gary's take on Chianti style wines - good fruit flavors for this Sangiovese blend.  Gary's take on a Bordeaux style wine is called Texas Tapestry.  It's a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Tempranillo, and Nero d'Avola.  It's quite bold, has good tannins, and well balanced.  The addition of Nero d'Avola is his unique take on this classic red blend.  He might be on to something here.  The last wine is Armadillo WH.  The WH stands for World Headquarters.  It's a sweet Cab, but with only 1% residual sugar - quite nice to have in the afternoon.  It's a real treat to have a true local making wine in the Texas Hill Country.  The great and interesting stories Gary tells just adds to that unique experience that you won't find elsewhere.  Stop by his shop along Johnson City's square on your next wine trek thru these parts. You'll have a pleasant time here sipping and chatting with Gary. Enjoy!

name: Pour House Pints And Pies
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: I've been passing up some awesome food and beers for years.  Don't make the same mistake I did.  I Yelper plead with you!  I also learned two things I've been missing in pizza, too.  I've passed this place dozens of times.  It sits on the fringe of a west Austin neighborhood and several apartments/condos between them and 183.  I believe it is affiliated with a restaurant that has a place in Fort Worth, too, but I might be wrong.  What I'm sure of my first visit there was killer!  I'm planning on going back when I can eat and drink a whole day away!  They have a great outdoor area with plenty of umbrellas and we chose a table.  The server acknowledged us right away.  We QR'd the menu and by the time we'd made a choice of food our beers were on the table and cold (good pour on the Guinness, btw).    We ordered a pizza of our own:  Sausage, mushroom, green peppers and spicy marinara sauce.  Okay, first... You know how some chain pizzas you have the ingredients all coming off together leaving you with less than even a cheese pizza?  Not here.  Every thing is chopped into small pieces and spread evenly over the entire pizza.  Every bite comes with a mouthful of exactly what you ordered.  Second, put some of that marinara on a piece of canvas and I'd eat it.  The spices brought everything together.  We got wings too.  Golden Buffalo.  Perfect heat! Crispy.  Meaty. Those wings were gone so fast I was looking at other tables to see if someone had snatch a couple off our plate LOL  We were licking the hot sauce off the plate.  I'M DOUBLING THE ORDER NEXT TIME!  Great service, cool vibe, good food!  Did I get lucky or find bar food Nirvana?  I dunno.  I'm going to rock a five star and adjust as I need to, but I'm not going to deprive myself of another visit here for sure!!

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: Fun Neighborhood joint.  This feels like a place where you'd walk in and they'd say, "Norm!"...if that were your name and you were on an episode of Cheers.  The beer was deliciously cold served in a thick glass to keep it that way. The pizza was generously embellished with toppings, and the crust was above average. The service was timely and courteous. I really liked the outdoor patio. Part of it is covered with fans, and part was uncovered with tables with umbrellas. The only drawback is there's a lot of road noise. We sat at a table as far away from the road as possible, and it was acceptable noise-wise. When our world health situation is better, I hope to see all the tables filled with large groups of friends enjoying pints and pizzas. For now, come check it out with your close friends and/or significant other.

reviews.author: Mickey W.
reviews.description: Visiting from Seattle and went here with my son this week.  We both ordered pizza which was excellent. Tasty crust on the pie and toppings were top notch.  Tried their "West Coast" IPA, not to hoppy but well balanced.  I'll be back!!

reviews.author: Ralph S.
reviews.description: This pizza here is really good!  Ask for Kate! She is the BEST!!! She always knows what we want and is so friendly!...

reviews.author: Russell B.
reviews.description: Still absolutely wonderful after all these years! They remember our order and pay good attention to our table. Will be back soon and often.

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place. It was way more laid back then I expected (place is always popping outside!!) which was great, I'm not for the "pay twice what it's worth because we are fancy pants".  Everything was very reasonably priced, and freaking delicious! We tried a few of the drinks (I tried a few of the beers) and it's safe to say I left tipsy and happy! Can't wait to visit this place again and try some new pizzas and beer!

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: I hope they open earlier again soon. I miss going there at 1 or 2 after work.   The parking lot area on the right is awful. So park in the back for you don't get hit.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: My friends like this place, but I don't see the draw. The pizza is mediocre. Fortunately tonight I discovered their sandwiches are good. I got the Pourboy, with Fries. Everyone else in our group who wanted food ended up being in a sandwich mood, so the Chicken Parm sandwich got good reviews from two of the guys. The fries were well-seasoned and looked promising, but were a little cold and soft. Other times I liked the Fried Pickle Chips, but could only eat a few pieces before they got overpowering. It's not like we'd eat that many pickles out of the jar in one sitting! I think the server mixed up my friend's beer order. The final blow to this spot is that their outdoor chairs are wildly uncomfortable. I even brought my own seat cushion the last few times I came! This time it saved my butt, but my back still hurts. I'd give Pour House a 3.5 but I'm in a generous mood so I'm rounding up.

reviews.author: Darrel R.
reviews.description: This place has RATS. It's a shame because I love eating here, but after seeing a rat scurry across the dining room floor I will NOT be coming back. This isn't even the first time this has happened. On another occasion, I saw a rat running out from the KITCHEN and into the parking lot. It was disgusting. The owners of this business need to have pest control come in so that their patrons can eat without worrying about rats, and so their kitchen staff doesn't have to cook with pests. I've worked in the service industry and know this is no ones fault but the owners. Do better by your employees and your customers and get rid of the rats.

reviews.author: Loren B.
reviews.description: At first glance, the interior of Pour House looked a little un-maintained. But, then of course, Austin. Where everything is underground. I was excited about the local beer list, though the stout selection was a bit thin. I went with Redhorn, a coffee stout that was a little short on stoutness for me. But, the flavor was good.  We ordered three 8" pizzas to share: El Supremo, Hawaiian, and a Veggie pizza, providing plenty for two adults and two children. The pizza was quite good, as in Austin-good. I couldn't put my finger on it, but there was something unique about the flavor.    Our server was very good, personable and informative. We ate a late lunch, during which a growing number of what appeared to be regulars gathered mostly around the bar. The location is a bit secluded from the rest of Austin. But, it's near the technology district, where I was working for the day.  Parking was a little confusing because we approached the building from a side where the entrance wasn't visible. It's a private parking lot with plenty of space. Outdoor seating is available. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Karan P.
reviews.description: Pour house is a pleasant open patio brewery serving delectable pies and the best garlic bread in Austin! I prefer an afternoon visit to enjoy the sun on the patio. The garlic bread has a nice char and is brimming with heavenly garlic flavour!

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: Wow, what a comeback from Corona this place has had. I've never been happier to see the wait staff and bartenders (especially Justin) return to their jobs. They're really into sanitizing every space that has been used and I've never had a vegan pizza like The Spock. Couldn't be happier with this place's redemption. Come support them, especially at the beginning of the week!

reviews.author: Marcus R.
reviews.description: This was the first trying out this place. My guys from work and I were in training this week so we thought about trying it out. The environment was chill and not too busy during lunch time so that was a plus for us because we needed to be back for training within the hour.  Three of us ordered the Cubano and it was so tasty! I definitely enjoyed the pickles and pork amongst other fine ingredients they packed on that pizza! One of guys ordered the regular pepperoni pizza and he said he liked it a lot. The crust and dough of the pizza was cooked perfectly thoroughly.  There salads were delicious and portioned perfectly. When you arrive the parking is all in the back area pretty much, and you enter through the patio area. They have signs for you and that guide you to entrance.

reviews.author: Lynette B.
reviews.description: The outside patio is nice and has a good vibe.  Unfortunately, Jollyville is busy so you have to speak loudly to each other but there's not a lot Pour House can do about that.  At first, our waiter seemed like he was going to be a lot of fun but we quickly realized he was all show and no action. He forgot to bring one of our drinks the first time around and then we very rarely saw him after that until he was ready for us to pay the bill. We had to find a different waiter to order a second round of margaritas.  The margaritas themselves we're nothing to get excited about and seemed like they had very little alcohol. We ordered two orders of the fried pickles, though, because those were great! (And even here we had to flag down our waiter to place a second order and get extra ranch dip).  We will go back because of the convenient location and nice patio but we will have our expectations set appropriately.

reviews.author: Rachel T.
reviews.description: I just really love this place. Great patio. Absolutely delicious pizza. Good drinks. Great service. Located in an area that really needs restaurants like this and frequented by people who obviously feel the same way we do about it. Comfortable and consistent.

reviews.author: Will W.
reviews.description: My partner and I have been coming here about once a week since we moved to the area(early May). The service is consistently great(shoutout to Kate), the food is awesome(some callouts: fried mozz, chicken parm, veggie pizza, cheese bread), and the seating is wonderful too. They have a large outdoor patio and with how they have it set up, I've never felt too hot in the summer or like there's too much noise from being seated near the road.

reviews.author: Shannon G.
reviews.description: Update. Another amazing dinner here. Hawai'i 50 8inch pizza. Crust is amazing. Thick and light. Cooked to perfection. Flavor in the sauce, and the fresh basil. The Canadian bacon, all so good. Also got a pita bread house made bruschetta. Wow, is that good. Diced tomatoes, with small cubes of mozzarella, and fresh basil. Deliciand shareable. Again I had the cherry limeade drink. It's perfect. The whole meal was fantastic. The waiter we had was super nice. This place is packed. So get there early. It's loud inside, but they have a large patio, but tonight it was chilly. No heat lamps. Parking lot is tight too. Been here twice and I think I took the last parking spot both time UPDATE: I've never been here for brunch, so today is the day! Chicken and waffles it is! I find chicken and waffles such a Southern thing, and I can't get enough of it. If it's on the menu, I'm ordering it. Their waffles are amazing. It's two small waffles with pockets of like brown sugar maybe? They have some kind of crunch to it. I didn't even use syrup because they just had a great flavor already. Chicken is tender and juicy. And it's a big piece of chicken breast. Bartenders are so Southern with their "yes ma'am" and hospitality. I always had a drink in front of me and I was checked in to make sure everything was to my liking. Pour House on Jollyville Road is such a great place to go alone or with a group. Their patio is outstanding, service is Southern as Southern can get. Always had a great meal, an even better cocktail, and the service is hands down Southern and hospitable. You have a great team here, this is my go to place

reviews.author: Priyakshi K.
reviews.description: The pizzas here are simply amazing. Been to pour house several times just for drinks, but every time I couldn't stop myself from ordering a pizza. Very chill ambience and their service is pretty quick.   Their draft beer collection is good too !

reviews.author: Robert R.
reviews.description: This place has a great selection of beers for real beer drinkers.  Great pies also.  Bartender is very good at recommending good beers.  Nice neighborhood pub.

reviews.author: Randyf V.
reviews.description: Always on the look out for new pizza spots. Of course you always take your chances. Unfortunately this was one of the bombs. Picked up 2 pizzas for myself and office manager. Her first response was that it seemed to be frozen pizza. I agreed. Pepperroni was sliced so thin it was almost tranparent transparent. Sauce and crust definitely seemed directly from the frozen section. My large greek salad was equally disappointing - very much so.  Counter staff was very friendly and courteous though.

reviews.author: Emily M.
reviews.description: I've been to P6 for several dates and the food and cocktails are absolutely fantastic, not to mention the beautiful view over looking South Congress bridge. This is one of my go-to date spots!  My recommended dishes: - Patatas Bravas (a classic Mexican street food, the potatoes are crispy, yet fluffy on the inside. Served with a spicy aioli) -  Roasted Mushroom Fettuccine (very fresh) - Charcuterie Board (if you're a cheese fan, P6 offers a high quality selection)  I've had the chance to try all of the cocktails here, and none have disappointed me.

reviews.author: Rebecca W.
reviews.description: Visited P6 for happy hour with a friend while visiting Austin and had a good time! We arrived when they were just opening, and luckily we had a reservation - it filled up really quickly after a bit. The space has a great vibe and a great view - even though it's not on the roof, the space offers a lovely view of the city and river and the open concept of the bar makes for a perfect environment to relax and enjoy some sunshine. The space is filled with countless plants and pink decor, which I truly appreciated - it felt quite posh and eclectic yet incredibly put together at the same time.   For drinks, I opted for the ladybird spritz, perfect for a refreshing afternoon cocktail. Featuring rhubarb, aperol, and cava, it was light yet flavorful, really being able to taste the rhubarb throughout the entire drink. Quite good! My friend went for the sundown cobbler, which she also really enjoyed. Since it was happy hour, we snagged some food too. We both split the pita bread with chimichurri and the hummus. We were given a bunch of pita bread, which was much appreciated! The pita was good, but not the best I've ever had (a little dense for my liking). The chimchurri was OK - the ratio of oil to spices was a bit off so it felt like it was swimming in oil. The hummus was quite nice and featured a nice touch of cashews and chili oil. I appreciated the inclusion of various veggies in addition to the pita for a change of pace! The hummus overall was good, but again, not the best I've ever had, but still filling and delicious and balanced our drinks well. While the prices of the cocktails were quite discounted from normal, they were still a bit steep, but to be expected when you consider the ambience of the place.   Overall, we enjoyed our HH at P6! I really enjoyed by spritz and the hummus / chimichurri was a nice balance. The prices are a bit elevated, but to be expected in relation to the space. If you're looking for a nice HH spot for visitors to Austin, I would definitely suggest P6!

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: We came here as soon as the restaurant opened because we knew it would be packed. This place has such beautiful decor and is on the rooftop/patio, so there is a beautiful backdrop of Lady Bird Lake. You will definitely be taking tons of photos here.  We made reservations just in case, but we pretty much had the whole restaurant to ourselves for the first hour P6 was opened. Everything looked delicious, so we ordered quite a bit:  Vegetable Frittata: This was perfect for a light meal. Lots of veggies and the eggs and butter lettuce was perfect.  Shrimp and Grits: Soooo bomb. Every bit of this tasted great. Just wished they would have removed the shrimp tails as most other places do.  Patatas Bravas: The potatoes were great for a side/appetizer.  Sourdough Garlic Bread: I love a good garlic bread, and this totally delivered. And I like that fact that it was pull-apart bread.   Everything tasted amazing and we really enjoyed our time brunching here.

reviews.author: Teah R.
reviews.description: Stop 2 of the night with our group of 9 for a bachelorette party. We made reservations ahead of time and were seated indoors. But we convinced our way out to the patio early in the night which was better (but a little chilly). Why would we want to come to a rooftop bar if we can't be outside, ya know?!  The servers were nice - we had multiple throughout the night. They occasionally came and checked on us. The place was packed on a Friday night.  We all had a lot of fun here and the drinks just kept coming! They were tasty and swanky.  There weren't many parking options other than valet that I saw but I can't remember how much that was. We had to walk through the hotel to get to the rooftop. The hotel looked very nice with mood lighting and modern decor touches.  Overall though, P6 was great - moody and fun!

reviews.author: Angela R.
reviews.description: Came here for a bachelorette brunch. The food was SO FRESH and tasted bomb. The views where we sat was also breath taking. The weather was perfect and our waiter was so nice. He gave us tips on what to do and where to go. I've been recommending this place to everyone that visits Austin!

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a good spot to watch the sunset over the river then this is the spot to check out. With this being downtown it's in a good location to catch the sunset and then adventure parts of downtown. This is a popular spot so being able to get a good seat or table before the sunset may be difficult. The crafted cocktails are very good and the waiting staff does a good job at helping you pick a drink

reviews.author: Dave B.
reviews.description: Hidden away in THe Line hotel is P6.  It used to be a bar and restaurant.  The bar is now all assigned seating, so make reservations to assure a stay.  If you like sunsets, book a seat that can see such.  It's worth it.  Service was good.  Staff was friendly, and when the outside got chill, they kindly reseated us indoors.  Props for that!  You can get a meal or just get drinks.  Just book before you go or pray for the one table free, like we found.

reviews.author: Deborah W.
reviews.description: Rating: 3.5 stars  My friend and I decided to stop here for brunch on Sunday. We didn't make a reservation ahead of time but were able to be seated right away indoors. (If you are interested in sitting outdoors - we were told reservations book out 1 week in advance so make sure to plan accordingly)  Even though the indoor space did not have the same ambience as outdoors it was still very nice and well decorated.   Service was very friendly and efficient.  For our brunch we decided to order:  --PATATAS BRAVAS: Well fried with a great flavor. Definitely a great brunch item to order! My only complaint would be they didn't really give us many potatoes since the portion covered less than half of the bowl it came in.   --FRITTATA: Ours was a veggie frittata that was filled with flavor and topped with a great tomato based purée. It did come with a giant handful of lightly coated romaine lettuce which seemed a bit mismatched. Additionally the portion of the frittata was slightly too small for the price.   --PICKLED PEARL ONION HUMMUS: Really good portion of food. The hummus is just bursting in flavor. There was also a ton of bread and veggies it comes with to dip into the hummus. Definitely a solid order!   All in all, a nice brunch option for the weekend if you are staying at The Line.

reviews.author: Elizabeth L.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped by P6 for appetizers and cocktails while we were in town and we had the best time!!  The cute, Instagrammy interior is only topped by the incredible backdrop of the balcony view over the river. We got a shady table by the edge and kicked back with a rosé and carpaccio. The plating of the carpaccio was gorgeous, and it had a beautiful mix of salty and fresh flavors. The pita chips that came with it were perfectly crispy too!  This was the best view we were able to get while in Austin, and can't wait to come back! But next time - we'll make it in time for their amazing happy hour deals.

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed brunch the other day here on their patio that overlooks Ladybird Lake. Had a reservation for 6 and the hostess was able to accommodate my request of sitting outside, which I really appreciated. The ambiance is very pretty and totally Instagram worthy with their pink overhangs and colorful couches/decor. They also had semi-large fans for each outdoor table which was much needed in this Texas heat.   The food was really delicious and not too overly priced. For brunch, most of the plates were pretty small so, if you're hungry I would recommend ordering 1-3 plates and sharing if you have the ability to do so. We tried the Greek Yogurt Parfait, Patatas Bravas and Hummus and it was all sooo good! Will definitely be returning here.

reviews.author: Christy V C.
reviews.description: I came here with a couple of friends and we had a blast! The ambiance is incredible and I just loved the view! We came during happy hour, which is literally one hour, 4-5pm, and I ordered the Sundowncobbler and Homemade Pita bread. Im not a huge drinker, but I really enjoyed my drink and loved that there was fruit in it. The pita bread was incredible! I loved how soft and warm the pita was. It was perfect with the chimichurri.  Parking- You can park in the garage for the hotel, but they only validate for the first hour I believe, which is only $5. Luckily we found street parking next to the garage which isn't nearly as expensive.  Payment- I actually really loved that you paid online! It makes it very easy to split the check amongst friends without bothering the servers!

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: Views are excellent... IF you even get a table anywhere near them. This restaurant is poorly executed in my opinion. They have beautiful views of the river but there is no guarantee that you will even be able to see it from your table (even with reservations) and yet you're still paying "fancy view prices".   My experience: - Arrived at The Line Hotel (which is way cool btw) to find that there are no signs on how to get to P6.  - The elevator is super sketchy and in the back corner without any airflow at all (seemed like an afterthought or service elevator). - Originally was sat at a "table" (their seating are little vignettes of couches/patio furniture that is NOT comfortable AT ALL and really impractical to eat at) nowhere near the view. The tiny view that we did have was completely obstructed by a shade they rolled down. - We asked to be moved to a "table" with a view and were finally re-seated but still had a difficult time seeing the view as we were further back at a SUPER low to the ground vignette.  - The staff was friendly but the drinks and the menu items were overrated. - Stayed for an hour and a half, took some pictures, and went somewhere else to eat more food.  My order: - Sundown Cobbler cocktail - Yummy, but tasted mostly like sprite. - Paper Plane cocktail - Yummy, smooth, easy drinker. - Whipped ricotta - Way more food than we expected but the olives and the nuts were better than the ricotta. It lacked a lot of flavor and mostly just helped to fill me up.  Long story short - NOT worth the hype.

reviews.author: CJ M.
reviews.description: We were out-of-towners on a dining experience. Seeing the bats was a recommended activity from a colleague. P6 was the venue of choice. The menu is petit and this venue is built for drinks and small apps. However, dinner was good and the views breathe taking. The evening was an overall success and the service was helpful. Strongly recommend for a predinner or after dinner spot.

reviews.author: Jaslean A.
reviews.description: Had a blast at this rooftop!! We went at 6;30pm and it was HOT so I recommend going a little later in the evening when it's cooler- we loved the live music, amazing views of the lake, the cocktails, but mostly our server Cammy (I think that was her name) but she was amazing and really spoiled our friend for his birthday! Giving this 5 stars for the service- I highly recommend ordering the summer Sandie it was delicious!

reviews.author: Mazen A.
reviews.description: A beautiful rooftop space overlooking Town lake and the south Congress bridge. Somewhere I'd recommend for anyone looking to enjoy an intimate moment with some of the best drinks in the city. The view is spectacular, just stunning. The food options are a little limited due to their kitchen size, but we were still able to find a few suitable options. I'd recommend the place mainly for the beautiful view.

reviews.author: Liz S.
reviews.description: A gorgeous location with alright service, ok drinks, and meh food. I have a severe dairy allergy, which they worked with, so they automatically get at least a star. The location is worth another star. But, the drinks and food left much to be desired. My girl friends got the charcuterie board and said it was the worst one they have ever had! Such a bummer, we had high hopes.

reviews.author: Dina C.
reviews.description: Even though this place is not technically a dining spot their food options are delicious! We got some mock tails that tasted great but I don't really like paying alcohol prices for non alcoholic drinks haha. Food comes in small plates so we ordered a few and shared. The potatoes were a hit for the whole table! Definitely bringing my friends back here again

reviews.author: Ralph T.
reviews.description: Came here during the week after work with some coworkers.  They were fully booked on opentable but I called ahead and the hostess kindly reserved us a spot right by the water.  If we're being honest you mostly come here for the view and the ambiance.  However, everything I ate and drank was also really great.  Pro tip: try to arrive between 4-5 so you can order your first drink off their "happiest hour" menu.  My only complaint here is parking.  You can self park for up to 3 hours in the parking garage of The Line hotel and get it validated for $10, or you can find street parking yourself.  I personally don't mind hunting for street parking, but if you're coming with a group make sure your party knows what to expect.  It is downtown after all!

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Beautiful, enticing, mysterious is how I would describe the interior of P6, but that's where the compliments stop. P6 is beautiful for snacks and light drinks, but there was absolutely nothing I would return for (except the views). Each dish is shared with the table. For a table of 3 ladies, we ordered the Riviera Pastry Basket, Patatas Bravas, Spanikopita, the Seasonal Vegetable Frittata, and a pitcher of White Sangria. The Pastry Basket, Patatas, and the Frittata were incredibly dry and bland-- overcooked. I love a good crisp, white sangria, but this sangria tasted like water mixed with fruits...   Stay for the views, stay away from the menu.

reviews.author: Elise G.
reviews.description: This place was so cute! Perfect place to take a girlfriend visiting.  Pros: -Amazing views, perfect for a brunch or sunset happy hour. You're paying for the vibes and views, FYI. -Good pastries - loved the pastry basket -Friendly staff - shoutout to Gabriela (I hope I got her name right, the hostess!) who was so kind -Fun drink options / quick service  -Tables felt spaced out well   Cons: -You have to pay $10 for self-parking, and that's the validated price  -There's an automatic gratuity regardless of party size (not a big deal) and 3% "Covid surcharge for health and safety measures" which none of it goes to staff.  I'd be great with it if it included hazard pay, but considering they were all wearing their own masks and they were only spraying down tables, it seemed pretty shady to me.   Overall, good for a special occasion I'd say.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: We came during peak time on a Saturday evening. This means we are seeing them at their most challenged time. And I was a little "hangey" having to wait a half hour to be seated. But it was worth it. The waiter checked back with us every few minutes (mandatory for a good restaurant). And our order was delivered hot and fresh in a reasonable amount of time (a little slow because they were very busy - but in a reasonable amount of time).  We had chips and queso as an appetizer. The chips were the thick, homemade type. And the queso was their own recipe with ancho cili drizzle, crema, some sort of pico de gallo, etc. Really good - exceptional.  I had a chicken sandwich. It had a lot going on (in a good way). It was not just a run of the mill chicken sandwich. And the sidewinder fries are fresh and homemade.   My wife had the watermelon, which she also said was really good.  Overall, some creative foods that were well executed, and on point service  Definitely give this place a try.

reviews.author: Leena N.
reviews.description: I didn't love this place. I totally understand that with COVID, many restaurants have had to cut back their menus.   With that being said, it seemed like breakfast-y food definitely prevailed during our Sunday afternoon visit. Seeing that they do a Sunday brunch, I get it, but always pictured that included a few other options not focused around eggs or waffles.   My husband ended up ordering their burger (which isn't even obviously advertised as a burger), and said it wasn't anything to write home about. My mother-in-law had their chicken sandwich and seemed to be okay with it. Not much fanfare from my husband's stepfather or his girls.  I ended up ordering the chili and didn't have any major complaints. I would've loved to see more in the "siesta" part of the menu that wasn't a salad.   My other complaint was the noise. The music was so loud that we could barely hear each other across the table, which pretty much awkwardly split our party in half. At first, we tried to get past it by borderline yelling, but that got old.   In between waiting for condiments, I asked our waitress if there was any way to knock the volume down by a click or two. She mentioned that she would see what she could do, but that it wasn't guaranteed since "people pay for it". My brother in law ended up seeing the jukebox in the corner, and while that's fantastic, I don't think it's too much to ask to keep music at a reasonable level in a place where you'd expect your guests to socialize at their table.

reviews.author: Meagan H.
reviews.description: My family and I ate here on Friday. The food was good. I had the special which was a fish. My husband had a shrimp po boy. The kids had chicken strips and mac n cheese. The beers were good and cold. I love how they bring the beer in icy glasses.   We chose to sit outside but soon discovered the flies were way too many to be able to eat in peace. We couldn't stop waving our hands or the flies would land on the food. I'll go back, but sit inside next time.

reviews.author: Tara M.
reviews.description: The atmosphere here is great. Everything seemed good at the start. Then we went to order food. Out of steak. Out of salmon. Out of wings. Out of shrimp. Out of some Cabernets. They were out of everything we went to order. The server could not have been more kind and sweet. She said it was because they run out of a lot of things on Saturday nights so Sundays they're just out. Well, I did a quick review of the comments on this restaurant and this is apparently a running theme. 1. Shame on me for not checking the comments before we came, 2. Shame on them for not resolving this clearly on-going issue. I know times are tough, but just close on Sunday nights if you cannot have more product delivered. We finished our drinks and left without ordering dinner at all.

reviews.author: Kate R.
reviews.description: Great food, great service, great atmosphere, love this place! Been here many times and have never once been disappointed. Great outdoor and indoor seating. Love sitting at the bar!  One recommendation only: maybe put chive tv or something else on just one (of 7'ish) tv instead of just sports

reviews.author: Jeff B.
reviews.description: Sorry this is a little late but I wanted to give a review. I stopped by here a couple weeks ago for dinner. The place was full, but they squeezed me in at the bar. I asked for a menu and a beer. The bar tender let me sample one of the beers on tap. I liked it so I ordered one to drink. I also ordered a patty melt with tater tots. The burger was think and made to order. I had to cut the burger because I did not want a big mess from trying to get a bite into my mouth. The burger was juicy since I ordered it medium and very tasty. I can say it filled me up. The beer was cold, nothing better than a cold beer, well almost nothing.  The atmosphere was as most sports bars are, a little noisy but people seems to know each other and they were friendly. The bartenders were busy but kept getting those drinks. The servers were also busy taking food and refilling cups of the patrons. There is outdoor seating but it was one of those HOT Days so I was glad I was inside. The parking is decent but they share with several other businesses. It was not too far away from the entrance so no need to wear the sneakers unless you want to.  Thank you Republic Kitchen + Bar for being a good neighbor and giving us another option to dine in Leander, Texas.

reviews.author: Polina W.
reviews.description: It was easy to grab a spot indoors. I had the salmon dish- it was spicy and salty for my tastebuds. I must not have read the description very well.  The Kids corn dog was tasty. The chicken steak dish was devoured, as was the watermelon salad.  All in all it was a good afternoon lunch.

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: Decided to try a new place tonight, and glad we did! I had the patty melt, it was good. The only complaint I have about it is that they put the bread on the grill to get grill marks, but all I tasted was burnt toast. They do the top if the burger bun the same but it's not as grill marked. So next time I will ask for them not to do that, I hate black charred burnt toast. My husbands burger was good as well and both the tots and fries were tasty and perfect portion. They have a big bar with a good variety. I had a Hell or High Water to drink, and will definitely order that again. Delish! And last but def not least the service was great! Our server Kelsey was attentive and very sweet. Definitely looking forward to the next visit...word is they have a good weekend brunch, so we'll be checking that out.

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: The chicken fried steak needs seasoning. It was missing some salt and the sauce over it was so much it took off the breading. But the mash and veggies had great flavor and tasted good!  Texas Smash is good if you like a honey whiskey, I don't.  But the old fashion was just how I like it!  Overall good place to try, the service was good. They have tvs on but I'd recommend that they put subtitles on all of them so since we can't hear them we can at least read and know what is going on.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: Great food. Great drinks. What more do you need? I absolutely love the barnyard fowl chicken sandwich. It's seriously delicious. All of the drinks I've tried are solid and they have a great beer and wine selection. Republic is a great option for anyone in the Leander area looking for a nice, trendy restaurant without driving all the way in to Austin. They also have a solid kids menu. We'll definitely be back.

reviews.author: Lora O.
reviews.description: First time here. Ethan, our server, was excellent. He did the best he could with working with so many items out of stock. I mean you're  out of Jack Daniels? And steak? And Salmon? Yikes! We had chicken fried steak and the chicken sandwich. Both very good! Pictured is a yummy dessert! A brownie on top of graham cracker crumbs topped with a toasted marshmallow. Along side comes vanilla ice cream drizzled with caramel and dark chocolate with a drizzle of raspberry coulis and fresh raspberries.  We will try you again.

reviews.author: Andrew S.
reviews.description: First time visiting. The drinks and location drew us in. The 3 okra dish ( it's Okra prepared 3 ways) was an instant hit. This was a quick first review and I want to come back for a meal. The Drinks are interesting and a good mix.  Pro tip - parking can get challenging in the evening. This strip mall has a lot of customers, early helps or enjoy the walk :-)

reviews.author: Elaziel R.
reviews.description: Hiding gem in the area, the food is surprisingly really good. They have very unique combinations for most of their meals like spicy ranch and the ambience is great. I will say the staff needs a little bit more guidance because they always look lost or confused about their duties. Beside that it's a great small bar with food options for everyone!

reviews.author: T N.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time and was ecstatic about visit. Ordered a salad and asked for ranch. Said salad arrived drenched in something I thought was ranch. Tasted said salad and immediately my mouth was on fire. Asked waitress to verify if it was ranch and she says... "oh we don't have regular ranch, just a spicy one..." that would've been nice to know. I CANT EAT SPICY FOOD!! She proceeded to suggest I use another dressing to bring down the heat. Word of advice to owner... put the dressing on the side. I was sick all day from this incident.   Partner got French toast and it was amazing. Sadly we won't be back..

reviews.author: Carrie Q.
reviews.description: This was our first time here and we will definitely be back. The queso was delicious and unique, the entrees were very good, and the wine on tap was great! I had the special (shrimp linguine in a pesto sauce) and my husband had the chicken sandwich. Everything seemed scratch made, which we really appreciated!

reviews.author: Donna C.
reviews.description: This was one of the worst experiences we've had in a restaurant in a long time.  The server was rude, the manager condescending (strangely, I don't remember him being so rude at Texican) and the place was dirty.  The table was sticky, and they knew it, even said there was nothing they could do about it because it was "resin"...it wasn't.  We ordered four entrees, and they came out in stages. The first ones to hit the table were cold.  The third followed five minutes later, and mine didn't show up for another five minutes, at which time I told them to just keep it.  The "hash" was runny and not at all hash, the scrambled eggs cold, bacon underdone, and no condiments available; when we asked for them, they acted like it was an imposition.    $92 worth of bad food and crap service.  Very disappointing considering the executive chef was wearing a Fox Hole chef's coat, and Fox Hole is one of my favorite places in this area; I assumed from the get it would be extraordinary after seeing that...I guess not.  Oh, and word of caution, when the server handed my fiancé the mobile payment device, she selected the 20% tip option.  Make sure you watch out for that...there is no signage indicating there is an automatic gratuity so the servers have NO business choosing their own tip amount.  Update: while we were out of town, we discovered my fiancé's debit card had been hacked.  Oddly, the odd charges started AFTER using the mobile payment device, which was WiFi powered.  I cannot stress this enough...BEWARE!

reviews.author: Lisa M.
reviews.description: I finally tried this place and so glad I did! Went with some girlfriends for some much needed quality girl time. This was the perfect place to sit back, chill and enjoy great food and company. I really like the ambience of this restaurant. It boasts a laid back feel with the dim lighting, yet has an open atmosphere. I ordered the Grilled Atlantic Salmon and everything was cooked to perfection. The salmon was cooked on the medium side to my liking and request to the server. We also ordered the James Bowie Nachos. Keep in mind these are not the typical Tex-Mex nachos, but they were still delicious and flavorful with a hint of robust BBQ flavor. There is an option to add chicken or steak and we opted for the chicken...great choice! If you love spicy (I sure do), they have a kick to them, as they are topped with freshly sliced jalapenos. Our server was excellent! She was so friendly, accommodating and checked on us frequently. She alone deserves a 5-star recognition! Try this place that offers locally-sourced, high quality food with its own, unique flavor.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: The Republic Kitchen + Bar is a great place in Leander off Parmer/Ronald Reagan. It has been around for about a year and I'm mad that this was my first trip. I guess that means I'll have to make up for lost time. We got the Brussel Sprouts as an appetizer. There was a sweetness to it with the apples and honey and candied pecans. So good! For dinner, I got the Pan-Seared Chicken and had to say yes to that when I saw that the chicken was on top of risotto, my favorite. The chicken was a small piece but very flavorful. I got the tots and also some chili which was spicy! Thanks The Republic, great place. I gotta get one of your large cocktails next time too.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: Oh mannnn I thought I took a picture of my drink! Darn it. Get the Pineapple Express! It was taco Tuesday, the shrimp taco was fabulous. They were out of fried salmon (odd bc they had the other way?) or I would have gotten that since you can basically get a shrimp taco anywhere. I'll definitely be back for taco Tuesday again. It was a little cold, I like my food room temperature so it was perfect for me, but I could see someone being disappointed in the temperature of the food. But I'm not knocking off any stars for that since that's how I like my food.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Came here for dinner on Tuesday night 6/15/21 with some family. I ordered the El Cesar Chavez salad with salmon and when they food came out the first bite I took I was fishing a bone out of my mouth from the salmon. So I started to inspect the rest of the fish and found 3 more bones. I informed our waitress and she kindly had it re made but when the second salmon came out I once again found 2 more fish bones inside.   At this point I did not receive an apology nor did a manager come by to check in to if everything was okay so I asked to speak to one and inform him. The gentlemen came over and apologized but really did not seem genuine about it after I explained how dangerous it was that I found a total of 6 fish bones that I could have choked on. He also attempted to blame the chef for not cleaning it right and saying "I always tell him to make sure all the bones are out."   Coming from the restaurant business myself and having my husband be on the corporate side of a big restaurant chain - I was very disappointed in how this place dealt with the issue.   Please check your seafood at this place - they clearly are not ordering boneless seafood or properly cleaning they're fish.

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: I love Texas Sake Co.  All the sake is fantastic, the sparkling sake is super fun.   The food trailer out front serving teriyaki bowls is slammin.   I've gone here and watched Sumo a few times and its an amazing experience. Sake tastings and Sumo just put me in a happy place.   Dont skip, go to Texas Sake and you'll have a great time.

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: I love this place! Like most people I know, I'm not a huge sake drinker, but I appreciate it for what it is. As soon as we walked in here, I was drawn to the huge mural and the Japanese-style seating. I love that they have flights to really give you a chance to try some different flavors. Ordering at the bar was easy, and the bartender explained things well and gave us good explanations. We even purchased some snacks to eat with our sake. Although I probably won't choose this place as a destination in itself, I hope to be back when I am over in this complex (which has so much to offer!).

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: I'm not a big fan of Sake, but I took a chance. We had a flight of both sake and sparkling sake. My favorite was the lime and ginger parking sake. I even bought cans to go.  For the sake flight, you get four tasting and the for the sparkling, you get three.  The tasting room is big. Plenty of seating.  If you're hungry, there's a food truck right outside.

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: The Sake here is only out done by the amazing food truck. Texas Sushiko has some of the best Sushi Rolls we have ever had. Worth the trip here alone.

reviews.author: Zachary A.
reviews.description: This review is for 3.5 stars.   As far as a unique experience goes, Texas Sake Co hits the marks. Random Japanese centric spot in the middle of the Yard. Sumo on tv, umbrellas hanging from the ceiling, and sake galore. Nice outdoor seating area out front adds an Austin flare.   But the sake was just not good. Ordered the flight and only finished 1 of the 4 5oz pours. About $20 for high quantity, but there was so much oak and smokiness that it didn't resemble any type of sake I've had in my life. The cloudy unfiltered sake with yuzu on special for the day was edible but the rest were actually off. And on top of that, the booths are just impossible to get in and out of. Supposed to be the old school Asian variety but they're not built for people with long legs and there's zero room to scooch in.   Experience was fine and love the vibe of the Yard, but just couldn't get down with the drinks or seating.

reviews.author: William I.
reviews.description: Love this place; definately one if the friendliest bars I've ever been to. The personally think the sake taste great and the decore inside is a refreshing change frim you normally find in Austin. There is also a sushi tryck out front that is a perfect way pair your sake with. Definately a must to stop for anyone in Austin.

reviews.author: John C.
reviews.description: Really awesome concept, great selections and people! Make sure to check the address here as they are on the south side not the north!

reviews.author: Amy F.
reviews.description: My husband was thrilled with his flight! I'm not a big sake drinker, but I enjoyed the snacks that came with the drinks!

reviews.author: Americus A.
