reviews.description: Enjoyed the flights of sake! Great space and atmosphere. Enjoyed the Japanese snacks with my sake. Great place to wind down after dinner.

reviews.author: Kimmie D.
reviews.description: This place was cool and located in an area that seemed like it had lots of potential. I realized though that I do not like sake. My hubby and I shared a small flight and honestly couldn't finish them because we just did jot like the flavor. Also, it was quite warm in the space which made it a bit uncomfortable to stay for a long time. Basically given it 4 stars for the experience.

reviews.author: Brenda R.
reviews.description: Very relaxed setting with plenty of different sakes to pick from. The bartender was friendly and informative. He gave us great information about each sake and even talked about his fave. It was a bit warm inside, but it was tolerable. They had a front outside area with a few games to play and misters to keep cool. I can not forget to tell y'all they have snacks as well. Chocolate cookie pandas that were delicious and I took home some dried up edamame that I want to go back for more lol   They also sell their sake to take home any of your faves you tried and they are also very reasonably priced.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: A small batch sake distillery in Texas?!?!?  YES!  I really wanted to like this spot, but our visit was just OK. The staff didn't know where their rice was sourced and seemed disorganized.  Surprisingly, there are rice farmers in Texas along the lower Colorado river (https://stateimpact.npr.org/texas/tag/texas-rice-farming/).  They started farming rice in the 19th century.  Unfortunately, no one was knowledgeable enough to confirm or deny the rice's source.    The spot is hard to find. Just drive to the back of all the strip mall (behind Book Women), and you will finally get there.  There is plenty of parking available.  The tasting room is small, dingy, and dark.  You can peer into the production facility in the back of the tasting room.  There are only a couple of seats around the tasting room bar, and some standing tables.  Thankfully there was a makeshift outdoor seating area in the parking lot area with tents and picnic tables.  You can select from a tasting flight, Sake cocktails, or a shot glass size of their sake.  Bottle purchase are also possible.  We tried their clear, and milky white sake. It came with a bowl of pretzels. The clear sake was OK.  The milky white sake was unique, and actually better than the first.  But, both were subpar to other sakes that I have had.    We were supposed to take a tour. They offer tours at 7pm, 8pm, and 9pm on Friday and Saturday.  We showed up in time to attend the 7pm, but as it got closer to 8pm, we asked about the tour.  There is only so long you can nurse an OK glass of sake. They said it would happen in 3 minutes.  By the time 8:16m rolled around we peaced out.    The one thing that we learned was that the ownership had changed a couple of years before, and it was now being run by the same people who own StrangeLand Brewery.  Wonder how that changed the experience and quality.  Was surprised to see this place rated so highly.

reviews.author: Dmitri J.
reviews.description: Super excited we have a south location. Sadly they opened the same week of covid-19 restrictions. They are taking carry out sake and food truck orders. The staff is there and ready to help you out. The location is beautiful and the people are amazing. I'm so ready to patronize this spot.

reviews.author: Caitlin M.
reviews.description: This place was awesome!  I'm an out of towner and I've never had too much sake aside from ordering a "hot sake" from sushi restaurants, which I've always enjoyed.  When I heard about this place, I couldn't wait to try.  We got there at dark, and it looked unassuming aside from some lights hanging overhead, a few picnic tables, and a cornhole set up, and even the inside isn't too different from what you'd expect from a basic distillery.  I ordered the sample flight of sake so I could try a bunch of different things and actually learn something about sake while I was there.  The staff that was working was super friendly and great about answering any questions we had.  When he brought out the flights, he explained what each one was like and what to expect from it.  Despite my five star review, I didn't like all of the sake on the flight, but the point was to try a bunch of different types!  The sample flight came with four different types of sake - Junmai, Nigori, Nama, and Oak.  My two favorites were the Junmai and the Nigori, with the Junmai being most similar to the basic "hot sake" I'd always had before and the Nigori being a really smooth sake.  The Nama, in my opinion, was really strong, so it wasn't really for my tastes.  The Oak also felt a bit strong, but it was tempered by the oak-y taste that came with it.  We were also offered a taste of their Blood Orange CBD infused sake, which had really intrigued me.  It didn't taste like I had expected any sake to taste like, but I really enjoyed it!  I would definitely love to come back the next time I'm in town and try the tour to learn even more!

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: This was my first time coming here.  I was so excited as I've not heard of any sake places anywhere I have lived.  I approached the bar and the bartender came up to me.  I told him that it was my first time here and what should I do - order at the bar, sit at table, wait to be seated, etc....  His reply, "Buy sake".  That was rude to me.  I ordered a flight and sat down annoyed.  Then, the sake.  It was VERY watered down.  I did not taste well.  Great space but that's all it's got going for it.

reviews.author: Dana P.
reviews.description: I think the previous reviews are fair.  It was fun for the experience; staff super cool and knowledgeable; the actual sake nothing was a stand out for me.  It is definitely a unique experience in Texas and worth the adventure.  We did the groupons but didn't get souvenir glasses. But then again, we didn't ask.  They did have some flavored ones- this one was coconut sake.  Bitter at first sip, nutty on the back.

reviews.author: Katie W.
reviews.description: We had a very nice experience at Texas Sake! My husband tried the "White Walker" and loved the fruitiness of the drink. I had the "Rose" Sake and liked the crispness of it. The atmosphere is laid back and inviting. They have an outdoor space as well for guests to enjoy.

reviews.author: Shannon B.
reviews.description: My first visit to Texas Saké Company (TSC) was such a delight I could not wait to share it. I had no idea we had our own secret saké brewery (or kura) here in Austin!   While originally founded in 2011, the place re-launched in December 2015 under new ownership (including some of the guys behind Strangeland Brewing). Since March 2016, they have been serving happy customers in the onsite TSC tasting room, as well as selling bottles of its small batch productions to local stores, restaurants, and anyone else who enjoys the diverse world of saké. If you shop at Central Market, HEB, or in.gredients, you can pick up a bottle or two there, too.  I was fortunate to recently attend a special event at TSC (Thanks, Amy D. and Our ATX!) in which we were able to taste a flight of 4 different types of saké (each one more delicious than the last), as well as to tour the brew room. Toji (brew master) Jeff explained the TSC brew process and schooled us all in Saké 101. A surprise to me was the oak-aged junmai, which immediately had me thinking of smoke and bourbon - I'd love to show up to the next BBQ picnic with this one. If you are new to saké, don't be scared! The flavors of the TSC brews are intended to appeal to a wide range of palates and adventurous drinkers are sure to find one to like.  FYI, TSC is a local, small biz, craft operation, so retail hours can be sporadic (or have been during the recent transition to new owners and processes). Current tasting room hours are Fri-Sat, 6p-11p, but it's always best to call 844.438.8392 and/or check social media for any scheduling changes and special tasting events onsite and around town. https://www.facebook.com/txsake https://www.instagram.com/texassakecompany/ https://twitter.com/txsake  Finding the place is a little tricky. Follow your map to Book Woman on North Lamar just south of Koenig. Turn onto Nelray Blvd and park on the street or in the lot just behind the Book Woman building (next to Travis County Strength gym). The small door into TSC is right next to the number 115 on the wall of the large, tan warehouse-looking structure.

reviews.author: Steven B.
reviews.description: Texas Sake Company is a neat concept insomuch as domestically brewed craft sake is a rarity.  I got a texas flight of 4 sake varieties.  Junmai- Smooth. Not much depth of flavor. Off finish. Not enough alcohol content.  Junmai Nigori- Milky mouthfeel. More alcohol content. Slight sweetness. Smooth.   Junmai Nama- Some effervescence. Not very sweet. Not much flavor. Lacking nuance.  Junmai Oak Aged- Sweetness is odd. Taste almost smokey. Caramel note. Oaky finish.    The nigori sake was definitely the standout for tasting like sake, and having the proper milky feel and alcohol taste one expects from sake. The nama is also a satisfactory take on sake, Again, I appreciate having a domestic sake producer that wants to take a craft approach. However, I am sad to say the sake comes off as amateur. The classic junmai is missing an alcoholic undertone, which is a common symptom of homebrewed alcohol. The oak sake is ambitious but really needs to be aged in an oak barrel. Adding wood chips makes is a shortcut that makes it taste cheap.  If you visit Texas Sake Company, I recommend sticking with the nigori and nama sake.

reviews.author: Ysabelle S.
reviews.description: I love this place and I fully support this establishment. I've only been here twice but I've bought their saké at grocery stores several times. I just really enjoy the taste of saké and I love the variety that they have at the distillery. Additionally, they have a ton of fun cocktails and everything is fairly priced. It is a pretty small and chill place and there is only 1 bartender so please be patient when waiting for your drinks. Last night I had the peach junmai and the oakey old fashioned. I love me a good old fashioned and this one is pretty good. They also have an apple pie cocktail and matcha cocktail on the menu. You can also get a saké flight so you can try 4 different types. They do distillery tours but I've never been on one. Definitely give this chill place a shot and support this business!

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: This pandemic has taken us all for a ride. The folks at Better Half had a nice and cozy building then a worldwide pandemic hit that required you to avoid that.exact.environment.  And they rolled with it.   On several occasions, we used their pickup and it was great. They were efficient, considerate (all the utensils and napkins) and the food was always good considering we would eat it while parked at Zilker.  Well, we finally decided to eat there this time. They have an awesome covered...tent or something, that fits up to 60 folks. They even had a heater blowing in that thing!!  And the food, whew. The grilled halloumi plate was so creative, we loved the mix of flavors. The spicy chicken sandwich was different than at other places, in a good way. I left trying to place all the flavors and can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.  A cool bonus is the view from the parking lot. I was able to take a quick picture.

reviews.author: Patrick H.
reviews.description: Possibly the rudest customer service I've experienced in Austin. There was a drink mixup and instead of accommodating us, they were rude and accusatory of us, as if we were trying to steal drinks from them. When in reality, the mixup happened because their waitstaff doesn't know what their food and drink items are by looking at them. They would just put the items down on the table and walk away. Instead of remedying the issue, eyes were rolled at us, and we were told if we want something else we needed to come inside to the bar and "pay for it ourselves".   We also had brought a birthday cake. It's an outdoor coffee shop and bar with a super casual atmosphere. When I asked if we could use some utensils, they told me that I shouldn't have a cake on the premises (which is "standard for restaurants") and that it would be $15 for us to use their forks and/or consume the cake on site. They said I should have called ahead. If it was a nice sit down restaurant and not a bar that has a Sunday brunch, I would have.   Again, this is an OUTDOOR coffee shop and bar. We had a big group of 20 people who all bought a ton of food and drinks, and we were treated like we were taking advantage. We were super patient (I've worked in customer service and know how awful people can be, so I always treat waitstaff with respect. But this is not that).   Never coming back.

reviews.author: Zach Y.
reviews.description: This place is really good! I really appreciate the outside seating. Coffee is a little pricy but really good. Great place for outside chilling, pet friendly, cabanas for shade.   The inside is really modern and really fast. They get you your drinks and will walk and deliver them to you outside. Great place for a morning coffee with friends!

reviews.author: Shahrzad Y.
reviews.description: The cauliflower tots are a must! Delicious! The coffee is great! Staff are very friendly. I wish there were more pastry/sweet options on the menu. I was not a big fan of the donut balls i tried, though they were hot and possibly freshly made. They were a little dry and dull for my taste . The breakfast sandwich was amazing too and they had a vegan meat option which is wonderful. Plenty parking, which is a plus in Austin and great outdoor seating too. Will go back again!

reviews.author: Tracy K.
reviews.description: We were in Austin for my daughter's 30th birthday and her being a Coffee shop owner herself, she brought us to this place. It did not disappoint us. All the food was amazing... Try the cheeseburger with an egg on top... You'll love it!. Another fan favorite among the group was the spicy chicken sandwich. It definitely has a lot of zing to it. Overall highly recommend the place. Great outdoor space as well.

reviews.author: Karen Q.
reviews.description: Great place to come for light eats and drinks- my friends and I came here in a group of 6 around 8pm on a Friday and found it easy to grab a table on the patio. Parking was also relatively easy since they have their own parking lot. They have happy hour Tues-Fri and Sunday 3-6pm, with $6 burgers! They also have reverse happy hour 9-10pm daily (also $6 burgers). The patio is very dog friendly and there is a self-serve water jug as well to help yourself. The food was delicious and a good portion for the price.

reviews.author: Arianna L.
reviews.description: Came here for brunch with a friend on a Sunday! They were relatively busy but we got served quickly.  I ordered the waffle iron hashbrowns. The portion was smaller than expected but the food was really good - the had browns were crispy and the Parmesan with the sunny side up egg paired really well with their gravy. I liked how the pickled onions added a sour kick to the gravy, but preferred the dish without the onions.   Would definitely come again and sit outdoors, if the weather permits!

reviews.author: Shelby L.
reviews.description: This is truly one of the most enjoyable meals I've had in a while. We went on Labor Day so it was quite busy and took probably a good 40 minutes to get our food, but it was absolutely worth every minute of the wait.  The Pastrami Sandwich had the best, smokiest pastrami I've ever had and everything from the mushrooms to the bread to the berbere horseradish sauce was just so well executed and damn delicious.   The Big Springy salad was a nice healthier contrast that still tasted interested and decadent (okaay, we added fried chicken, that might not be the healthiest). It was a little light on the cojita-chimichurri dressing so we got some more, and I just wanted to jello shot that condiment cup straight into my mouth it was so good.  I started off with the chagacinno and while it was a tad sweet for my preference, it was still absolutely delicious as well.

reviews.author: Kandice S.
reviews.description: Took a birthday trip to Austin and was looking for a place to have a nice breakfast before I left. I had heard this place was one of the best breakfast spots in Austin and it did not disappoint!   I ordered the chicken biscuit and completely cleaned my plate not a crumb left! I will say the chicken was slightly salty but nothing i couldn't handle. The chicken tastes like it might be brined that would be my guess as to the extra salt (not sure if they use a brine or not). The cocktail was pretty good too went well with the sandwich.   From the description I was thinking there was going to be a spicy marmalade sauce on the side to dip the biscuit in which would've been amazing but nonetheless still a very good breakfast sandwich will definitely be going back the next time I'm in Austin!

reviews.author: Carlson Z.
reviews.description: One of my go-to coffee shops in Austin! I always take my friends and family here on the weekends for brunch. I absolutely love the backyard patio vibes - seems like a very chill spot to just hang out and chat.  I don't really recommend coming here to study or do work as this place can get quite rowdy. The same owners also opened a brewery right next doors called Hold Out Brewing, so you can slowly transition from productivity to drunken stupor if that's your thing.

reviews.author: Ami A.
reviews.description: Delicious food! I came for brunch and loved my meal! The fall salad with fried chicken was an orchestra of flavors! Every bite was an explosion of textures, flavors and a visual masterpiece. Sweet potatoes, pumpkin purée, pistachios, greens, radishes, apples and more. Definitely up there with top ten salads!

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: Better Half Coffee and Cocktails belongs in the book of Austin AF restaurants. What does that even mean? Innovative menu using fresh ingredients with high prices.   Our table of 3 split the entrees and shared as easy apps to get the full experience of the brunch AND lunch menu. For brunch, we ordered the Waffle Iron Hashbrown, which was literally a plate of overcooked hashbrowns, topped with coffee and cream gravy, cotija cheese, an egg, pickled onions and scallions. Sadly, this was just basic to me (or as Gen Z calls it Cheugy). Nothing that I would die for...  For lunch, we ordered the Vermicelli Salad, the Chilled Ramen, and a side of the Cauliflower Tots. I could not get enough of the Vermicelli Salad and strangely the Cauliflower Tots! The Vermicelli Salad was refreshing and light, and I enjoyed the Pineapple "Fish" Sauce substitute they use to make this dish vegan friendly!! The Cauliflowers admittedly looked like burnt bite-sized toast when it arrived, but as soon as I dipped it in the beet ketchup, I couldn't put my fork down.   BEWARE! If you order any of the Frozen Sloppee Frozen Cocktails, this thing will mess you up (in the best form possible). I would advise ordering with caution! The Spicy Peach'arita was my poison of choice, and though delicious, if you add Texas heat, it will melt fast and have you only tasting tequila!

reviews.author: Bri D.
reviews.description: Mmhmm.  Better Half was gudt eatin.  There was a line out the door on Sunday morning but it moved quickly.  Parking was easy.  Shout out to my guy, Dylan, the coffee program manager for my latte.  It was slammin, just like he used to make em in HOU.  For eats, I got a biscuit with avo and the cauli tots- like the cauliflower, not the beet ketchup, but I'm not a beet girl.  Great space.  Great color scape.  Plenty outdoor seating to spread out and catch up with ur folk.  I'll be back.

reviews.author: Tiana W.
reviews.description: Ordered for pick up. Got the cauliflower tots and fall salad with shrimp.  Cauliflower tots were crispy and tasty, beet ketchup was good.   Fall salad, tasted good overall. I enjoyed all the flavors. Was a bit disappointed on the size of the shrimp though.

reviews.author: Melanie P.
reviews.description: Love this place!! Great casual date night spot or a place to bring visitors! Such a fun austin experience with the picnic tables. And the food is amazing! Get the cauli-totes and thank me later

reviews.author: Katie S.
reviews.description: A hidden gem for food.   $6 cheese burgers (shockingly good) $7 cauliflower tots (so good we ordered two!) $6 sangria at Happy Hour

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: First time visit on Sunday and I had a pleasant experience. This place is cute and cozy with a decent food and drink menu.   Everything we ordered was spot on, from the chips and queso - the big salad with steak - to the burnt cheesecake with cherry. I am not a huge fan of cheesecake but this one was just right. The pink sangria was delicious - perfect summertime drink.  We'll definitely be back again - I do recommend.

reviews.author: Auston P.
reviews.description: Where do I start?? First off let's just say... yes come here and no it's not like a traditional coffee place. It's a full on restaurant and cocktail bar more than anything and I love it.   Food: I haven't had a bad thing here yet.   The Smoked Pastrami sandwich is absolutely off the chain. Flavor is everywhere in it and it's smoked to perfection. 100% must try.    The burger is off the chain as well, super fresh and clearly made with care and intention.   Service: ASK FOR Kyle, he's seriously the bomb.   the people here are super friendly and after my second visit they knew me by name. Very welcoming and give great menu advice.   Drinks: they have some fun drinks here. Zero complaints.   All in all this place is bomb. I come here at least once a week!

reviews.author: Talitha C.
reviews.description: I forgot to take pictures as I was enjoying myself at this cool restaurant. It has a cozy indoors but plenty of seating outside. We started off with a brunch drink that I can't remember the name of, it had champagne and vodka, but it I was really good.   I was eyeing their creamsicle latte, but I wasn't in the current mood for a coffee drink, so sorry I can't tell you about it. It looked good though. They have some very interesting selections for coffee that I'd love to come back and try.   Food- we ordered the cauliflower tots with beet ketchup. It comes out looking like tofu and the taste is very good. The beet ketchup is a nice addition. My husband got the hash browns topped with Cojita gravy. The gravy was so good, the hash browns were cooked to hard, but a easy fix for next time. For the table we got the Pastrami Chips and Queso, that tasted like a brisket. I got a summer salad which was probably the only thing that we had that was meh. My friend had the chicken biscuit in which she said was really good. All in all I would like to come back again as their menu had some interesting items on it, a good looking happy hour and for the most part the food didn't disappoint.

reviews.author: Ryan G.
reviews.description: What a great outdoor brunch spot. Carafe Mimosa is the way to go if are out with friends.   Chips and Queso are a must. Honestly one of the best chips and queso apps in Austin thus far. Both elements were fantastic.    The breakfast burrito isn't the largest thing in the world so if you're hungry make sure to get a side or an app along with it.   Will definitely come back.   There was a time limit on our table which wasn't preferred and the tables themselves weren't amazingly comfortable.

name: Perla's
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Validated Parking, Private Lot Parking

reviews.author: Obed F.
reviews.description: Every time we come to Austin we stop by Perla's no matter if its for Breakfast, Lunch or dinner. This time we stopped in for lunch. We got there an hour before our appt and host was very accommodating and sat us early. Not to mention we had our 4 month old in a stroller. We took the option to sit outside because the weather was great and they have an awesome patio. The waiter was very nice and very knowledgeable on the whole food menu and drinks. We wanted get something light since we have been eating so heavy on our vaca.   We split 3 dishes a ceviche, the lobster bisque and the wedge salad. All the 3 were very light, tasty and delicious!! It was exactly what we were looking for.   I would absolutely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Gigi B.
reviews.description: Food was decent, but the parking situation ruined our experience and we likely won't return as a result.   There is a parking garage behind Perlas where they supposedly validate your parking. Apparently there is a new system in place in the parking garage that requires you to scan a QR code to pay for parking then somehow you get it validated at the restaurant. However, when you pull into the garage there is no QR code. So I walked to the restaurant to ask how to validate parking. They gave me the QR code but I had to have my license plate. So I had to walk back to my truck to get license plate. By the time I got back to my truck there was already a parking ticket on my truck!   I reached out to the manger of this parking garage, Travis, to explain the situation, but he refused to waive the parking ticket even though I showed him a copy of my receipt from Perlas which proves that my parking should have been free not to mention the confusing process.

reviews.author: Kevin M.
reviews.description: Service was professional and prompt. The server, Donovan, was quite excellent at providing suggestions and information without need to go back and consult a chef or manager. What this says is that the restaurant (and chef) ensure the employees taste what they serve so they can provide info to diners. This is one mark of excellence.   The setting is beautiful. Since it was a pleasant autumn day, we opted for outdoor dining and enjoyed our decision. It's hard to write about the vibe but this is closer to a low-key fine dining. It isn't fancy but the food and service make it close.   We had grilled (or broiled) oysters and they were as good as the ones I had at Felix's in the French Quarter. We also had a sampler of oysters in the half-shell and we were guided by Donovan who knew the types of oysters and sources and showed us that by flipping the shell, the underside gives clues as to the waters they originated from.   Tuna Tartare was excellent (I've only had it as good in Aspen, Co for 3x the price).  Then smoked octopus and grilled red snapper. Both of those were outstanding too.   Price is reasonable for the quality but our bill was over $175 (we ate a ton and didn't care) this restaurant is right on price considering the quality on the plate and from the staff. We will definitely go again.

reviews.author: Mel E.
reviews.description: Erin, GM, was amazing from pre-arrival, arrival and departure. What an amazing young lady! Thanks Erin, for the reservation accommodation and delicious bite.  Jacob, my server, was incredible and every dish he recommended was beyond amazing! It was totally worth the flight. This is huge for me because customer service in my opinion, has declined drastically, so when I rave about an experience such as Perla's, it's #facts! This evening I enjoyed some glasses of Chenin Blanc, from South Africa, some delicious oysters (Jacob chose all of them), fried okra, crab cake and the famous potato crusted sea bass and a sea salt dessert! Thanks Perla's for the amazing experience! Thanks for the warm welcome from the staff outside and the lovely hostesses inside. I'll certainly be back and cannot wait! Be safe. Be blessed. Be kind and enjoy good food! Perla's

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: Been waiting a while to go here, and finally got to make it while it was still nice out; We thought there was supposed to be a happy hour, but it turns out/doesn't seem like there is one anymore unfortunately.  Naturally, we got a few appetizers, oyster shooters and oysters, plus the octopus that came with a savory sauce and potatoes. I'm not a fan of bloody mary's so the shooter wasn't my favorite since that's how they were prepared, and kind of spendy at that. The oysters were a small bit still good; again,  no happy hour pricing.  The octopus was my favorite, grilled perfectly, same as the potatoes, covered in herbs and a butter/mayo sauce that paired nicely.   We both got fish, mine had a bit of spice to it, and the ahi was very nice and fresh; Overall, pleasant meal, more expensive than we would've liked but glad to have tried it. Personally, I think it's better to just get some appetizers/drinks and save the entree for somewhere else; while it's definitely good, I think it's overpriced and could make something comparable for a fraction of the cost.

reviews.author: Nada S.
reviews.description: Beautiful place .. was visiting Austin for the first time and I was extremely hungry and could not wait for a barbecue place. Stopped by this and it did not disappoint

reviews.author: Alan J.
reviews.description: Our first time here for an occasion with my wife's second cousins. Two guests split a dozen oysters and loved them. We split the calamari and it was among the best we've had in Texas. Top two, maybe top five ever. My wife had the redfish on the half shell and loved it. I ordered an oyster Po Boy but was disappointed in the size of the oysters and was very salty. The shoe string fries were fine by my tastes despite what some reviews state. Kind of high price for what we got for lunch but that's what you get now with the CA invasion of Austin. Seafood seemed fresh which is rare in Texas.

reviews.author: Jessica K.
reviews.description: Love love love Perla's! We always try to come by whenever we are in Austin. Most of the time, they are very busy and there will likely be a wait. The last time we went was for lunch on a Tuesday and we waited about 30 minutes for an outdoor table, but it's always worth it! The place has a really cool vibe and the staff is very pleasant and we appreciate the mask policy. The oysters are delicious! We usually get the calamari, octopus and fries as well. I will say the octopus is a tad too salty for me, but otherwise the food is good.

reviews.author: Kelsey B.
reviews.description: What a delicious, elegant meal.  The pricing is really steep even for seafood, possibly because we enjoy their sister oyster bar restaurant a bit more.  Sit outdoors for a more casual vibe and indoors for more formal.

reviews.author: Shaunna S.
reviews.description: Yep loved every minute of this meal. We came for my birthday and had originally reserved for indoor seating. However, it was really nice outside so the sweet staff moved us out there upon asking. We came for my birthday dinner and it was a very relaxing, chill, but a little upscale vibe. We all wore jeans and it was totally acceptable. The food was 10/10. The calamari was light and crispy at the same time- just perfect. The creole oysters were packed with flavor, and the main dish lobster bucatini was literally the best dish I've ever had. It was delicious and that alone is enough for me to return. We split it which I think was perfect because I could barely finish my half after the appetizers.  We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Elaine L.
reviews.description: Rhee did not have a reservation when we arrived for lunch but the hostess sat us within 30 min of arriving. The food was delicious. Gumbo was a little salty but it was not shy of meat. Will be coming back!

reviews.author: Sherrill J.
reviews.description: Perla's is just wonderful to visit. We enjoyed Seared Maine Scallops and Semolina Fried Texas Gulf Prawns on our visit. Gulf shrimp have a wonderful sweetness to them not found in cold water shrimp. Margarita's Yes!  Enjoyed the staff greatly!

reviews.author: Hira S.
reviews.description: Lots to say about this one! Really lovely atmosphere - trees shade the top of the outdoor seating so you will never get too hot in the Texas summer. Service is good and quick and the patio is just a great place to go with a group. Some items on the menu are incredible - like the ahi tuna tostada. Others are good but not wow - the redfish sandwich. Overall, really really expensive place to eat but a cool spot to eat it.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Love the patio- Superb oysters and ambience. I have always enjoyed the service.  I so wished the had blue cheese - salad dressing and for blue cheese olives!

reviews.author: Lynn N.
reviews.description: Delicious, comfortable, dog friendly, great service. Andrew was such a great server! I brought my dog Sawyer with me; the staff was so lovely to her! She even made it on their Polaroid wall of doggies!!! I had Brussels, crab cakes, tomato/watermelon/burrata salad, and pot d creme. My new fav place in Austin!

reviews.author: Ange R.
reviews.description: I really wanted to like this place more especially after it was recommended to us and we waited 45 minutes for our table.  First, I wouldn't recommend dining with family. It is too expensive and there's not a lot to select on the menu for the younger ones. It's definitely a date night or girls/guys night out vibe.   Red snapper dish was ok. Brussels sprouts were good, had a sweet taste. The prawns were good and I do recommend the calamari for an appetizer.  Complimentary hush puppies were a nice treat, too.   Cocktails were a little watered down for the price. Wine was decent.   Loved the outdoor seating area. If I go back, it will be for a glass of wine and calamari on the patio.

reviews.author: Ebtisam M.
reviews.description: The food here is way overpriced for the quality of food they offer. My family (including the kids) love seafood and enjoy going out. We ordered a wide range of meals and were less than impressed. The sauces were either very bland or very rich...nothing in between. We ordered the sea bass(bland), scallops (scallops and mushrooms were good but sauce was very thick), salmon (bland), tuna tostados and a few sides. I wouldn't waste your money eating here. It's a fun trendy place for drinks and apps but nothing more.

reviews.author: Zia L.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places in Austin! I love outdoor dining and this place has an awesome outdoor space. The king crab grits and little gem salad are two of my absolute faves along with the grilled oysters. It is a popular place so make your reservations early especially for dinner!

reviews.author: Vandesha L.
reviews.description: As someone who is just now getting back to dining out I really wanted to be outside but not at a place that was too busy. Perla's delivered! Parking wasn't easy for the area and I wish I had known the restaurant validates. I could have saved $10. Overall the service and atmosphere was satisfying. The brunch menu is not huge but the few items available still left me struggling to decide. I chose the lobster omelette and it was one of the fluffiest omelette's I ever had. Each bite was full of crab. I initially thought the lettuce was a garnish but took a bite and it was a salad with some of the best dressing I ever had. Oh and the grilled oysters are a MUST! I plan to return to try other menu items.

reviews.author: Shelly L.
reviews.description: Disappointing!!  Good but not great seafood considering the prices. And we waited over an hour to get our food which was lukewarm at best when it arrived. Shoestring fries? Hardly! Just an example of how misrepresented this place is. And then to be subjected to a 20% gratuity since we had more that 6 people. Frankly not worth 10%. Crawl, don't run to Perlas. Grab a slice nearby and save a ton of money.

reviews.author: Sierra R.
reviews.description: We went here for our anniversary and had such a beautiful experience. First we were sat ALONE in the outdoor patio which we really enjoyed, we then had a wonderful waiter who was very funny,super helpful and gave us some great recommendations on flavor combinations for desserts. The food was insane and each course was brought out at the perfect time. We both get full very quickly and the time in between each course gave us enough time to digest a bit but we were never hungry. We were super full by the end of the night and spent $230.78 including tip and we ate a good amount of food(We got the Japanese milk rolls,grilled octopus, the Halibut, the NY Strip, Brussels Sprouts, crushed potatoes, 2 apple frangipane tarts, the sticky toffee pudding and the chocolate caramel Breton. We also got 3 cocktails). Thank you for making our day so special, We will 100% be coming back!!

reviews.author: Dana T.
reviews.description: Nice place near Zuckerberg Park.   We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. They checked all the boxes.  Service was great. Everyone working there contributed to make sure we had what we needed.  Cocktails are a star attraction. Lots of interesting twists on classics.  The food was very interesting. I had the short ribs which were fantastic. My wife had the harissa chicken which she loved.  Topped it off with dessert and coffee. The apple tart was great. The only part of the evening that was a disappointment was the coffee. I'd definitely pass on this.  Can't wait to go back and try more options.

reviews.author: Kayli P.
reviews.description: Eberly is an eclectic place with a menu full of great food. Everything we ordered was amazing.   Ignore the other reviews complaint of "collard greens" being on the southern Benedict, the Benedict is amazing and the greens are listed on the menu so I'm not sure what their complaint is.   The short rib hash was mouth watering and I highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Cynthia W.
reviews.description: The restaurant is BEAUTIFUL!!  The atmosphere, fantastic!  Service was good.  I was so looking forward to having brunch here but was thoroughly disappointed.  In a haste, I chose my usual brunch fare, Eggs Benedict, without reading the ingredients and questioning what exactly was in my meal.  Prior to my going,  I did see many favorable reviews regarding the Eggs Benedict however, none mentioned Braised Collar Greens.  Yes!  Eggs Benedict with Collard Greens.  I'm a HUGE fan of vegetables but let's just say that after trying it at Eberly, I'm NOT a fan of Eggs Benedict with Collard Greens.    I'll be back, Eberly.

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: Went here for NYE Galactic Rodeo event! It was super fun! The whole place is enormous. They had multiple seating areas and a bar when you step in with plenty of space to walk around. The whole restaurant is designed elegantly and has wood features on the bar. I am really curious to see what it's like functioning normally.  The event had a lot of food, they served us BBQ with a full spread. The brisket, Mac n cheese and potato salad were my favorites. I have no idea if it was catered or if the restaurant made it, but it was really good.  They had a DJ downstairs with awesome decor and lights. Upstairs is Cedar Tavern, which I think maybe partners with Eberly or is owned by the same people? It was a good drinking area, with games and a mechanical bull. They had Symply Courtney hosting the mechanical bull rides and he was very entertaining. We talked to him after the show and he was super nice as well.   There was also a guy doing lasso tricks with a rope! I did not catch his name but, he was very talented.   The rest of the staff was really awesome too.   Overall 10/10 event, would definitely do another NYE here and am super curious to try the restaurant on a normal basis.

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: This is a brunch review only as I've never been for dinner. But breakfast was delicious. I've never thought to add cranberry to my avocado toast before but I will have to try that at home. Breakfast potatoes were perfect - crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The restaurant is beautifully decorated. Great space for a dressed up brunch.

reviews.author: Aarti P.
reviews.description: In person, in dining room, reunion dinner!!! Yes!!  After a long 15 months of not meeting in groups, my original core ATX friends decided we needed, nay, had to meet up.. Eberly was unanimously chosen out of 4 options.  I have always loved the interior of this location, yet to nab seats in the Atrium :(, one day it will happen.   Our evening was just perfect, from the Service, Meal - Starters to Dessert, Wine to Post dinner drinks at the bar.   The reason for 4 stars not 5, the vegetarian pasta entree didn't deliver, the menu description had potential, what I was served paled disappointingly in comparison to everything else that graced our table.   I just noticed that the menu has changed just like our season has. Dinner date anyone? :)

reviews.author: Jessica L.
reviews.description: Love this place!! Great food, yummy drinks, and lovely atmosphere!! Will definitely be coming back here again!!   We started with the beef tartare, good but I would be open to other starters (not a must have for me). My husband had the wagyu for dinner and I had the mushroom mafaldini...which was amazing!! Loved it!! We finished with the chocolate caramel Breton...strong flavors that paired together very nicely!! Such unique dessert!!

reviews.author: Kimberly C.
reviews.description: We got there and the venue is beautiful. They have a huge bar with craft cocktails and the waiters are amazing. My water cup was never empty and they continuously checked in on us to see how we were doing. The short ribs were so tender and melts in your mouth. The crispy potatoes were huge and more than enough for two people. Overall this was a great experience and I can't wait to go back and try the pasta.

reviews.author: Vivian M.
reviews.description: This review is for a previous visit (June/2021)   It was my husband's birthday and they went above an beyond - excellent service! The food was delicious, the place is beautiful. Great selection of wines.

reviews.author: kelsey w.
reviews.description: This was my birthday dinner so I was super excited. The service was awesome and personal. I want to say I loved the atmosphere and liked the food but it honestly didn't blow my mind. I will definitely one again for that poke app though!!!! And the short rib is yummy for sure.

reviews.author: Leena J.
reviews.description: Fabulous pick for dinner and drinks. Super nice and swanky inside, loved the vibe. Great decor and amazing service.  The rolls were buttery, hot and fresh- check them out for an appetizer.  I had the halibut- so delicious but pretty expensive for one piece of fish.  I would definitely go back for the sweet service and amazing vibe.

reviews.author: Anne S.
reviews.description: We came here for a special occasion, and I will say the service side of things was fantastic for that. We were given a card signed by the entire staff (and printed with today's date so we knew it hadn't just been pulled from a stack) and two free glasses of champagne that we could tell was nice quality. At the end of the meal, they also brought out two small plates of dessert on the house, and it was delicious! Tasted sort of like an apple crisp, and really beautifully plated. I'm kicking myself for not having taken a picture of it.  I also really have to compliment our waiter, who said he had some level of sommelier training and had contributed to the wine list. He pointed us to a bottle of 2016 "Sucette," a grenache from "An Approach to Relaxation," a small vineyard in Australia. I'd never had a pure grenache and had never been a fan of GSM blends, but this bottle was absolutely lovely. It's hard to find online, and I love it when I can get a bottle at a restaurant that I can't just pick up at my local liqueur store...makes it more worth the mark-up.  So, service was five stars, all the way. Really nice.  The letdown was the food. First, they were out of the short rib. Guys...this was a special occasion, and I came all the way from Dallas for the short rib. Don't do me like that! I mean...the thought of walking out honestly crossed my mind. Instead, I took the waiter's suggestion and ordered the halibut. It was...fine. No short rib. We also shared the Wagyu sirlion, which honestly wasn't all that remarkable either. For sides, we did the asparagus (very nice) and the shells and cheese (also nice). Oh, and we started with the octopus, which also was nicely prepared. And then, yeah, heck, we went for it and ordered a full dessert in addition to the free mini desserts they gave us. The Chocolate Bar was...eh. Chocolatey? Nothing memorable, really.  At the end of the day, our bill was as sky-high as you might expect with a bottle of nice wine, two entrees (one being Wagyu steak), two sides, and a dessert. However, we both left feeling as though the food really hadn't lived up to the cost. We agreed that if we were going to drop that much money on a meal, we would have much rather gone next door to Uchi...and that's just not a great feeling.  I really do have to compliment the staff and their phenomenal attention to our special occasion. They earned those three stars all on their own. I wish the food had supported a higher rating, but it just fell short of expectations.

reviews.author: Shelby C.
reviews.description: We are always so impressed with the food every time we come to Eberly. If you're looking for a nice restaurant, cool vibe, great food and don't mind the price tag that comes along with it, this is a great place for a date or dinner with friends.   Our group of friends went to Eberly most recently for a birthday celebration and we had the Japanese milk rolls, salmon poke, grilled octopus, short rib, wagyu steak, and shells and cheese. Everyone loved their entree! The grilled octopus and salmon poke blew us away - great starter dishes that I would highly recommend to any group going here.   The dessert was also great, we had the shortcake followed by a round of espresso martinis.   Great food, great vibe, great service. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Julie C.
reviews.description: I am honored to have experienced dining in at Eberly. This restaurant is simply amazing. All their food is fresh and high quality.   For appetizers, I would recommend all the starters. Although, if you have to narrow your choices, my top picks would be the Japanese rolls (dinner rolls), the steamed mussels, and the croquettes. Honestly though, everything is so amazing here that you won't be disappointed.  As for the main course, the short rib with polenta was incredible. The meat was fatty, soft, and full of flavor. It melted in your mouth.   Our server for the night was really great too and took their time to ensure we had all our dining needs met.   Unfortunately, what's preventing me from giving this restaurant a 5 out of 5 is that around 1030 after finishing our meal we wanted to go to the bar in the restaurant for some drinks and we were unable to do so. The bar was basically empty and the bartender told us we had to ask the host if we could sit for a drink at the empty bar. We went to go ask the host if we could sit and they said they would find out. We stood at the front waiting for 15 minutes for them to come back with an answer and they said "you can sit at the bar but can only have 1 drink because we close at 11."   It took them 15 minutes to basically say no to sitting at their empty bar. Also, why would you tell us there's a drink limit? What if I can drink more than one drink in 15 minutes? I am disappointed I didn't get to finish my night at Eberly's bar.   I do recommend their restaurant but probably not the bar since they don't like to seat people at their empty bar.

reviews.author: Krista B.
reviews.description: I have been dying to go to Eberly for over a year and I must say, I will not wait much longer than a month to come back! It reminds me of Mad Men meets a speakeasy and I AM SO INTO IT.  My group's order: Cocktails: - Brooklynite - So smooth and delicious! Little tropical escape in a glass without the sugar punch. - Tristessa - Deliciously smokey and sweet, oh so good. - Sixteen Jackies - Favorite drink of the night! So pleasant and gentle you can barely taste any alcohol! - Autumn Rhythm - Classy, sophisticated, and the ice even has Eberly etched on it!  Food: - Japanese Milk Rolls - Its not hard to make bread absolutely divine but this really is something that I am now craving everyday... - Potato Leek Croquettes - Crispy but smooth on the inside with a pack of flavor in every bite. - Agnolotti - Vegetarians rejoice, these tiny pasta pillows are so delicious and tons of veggies to pair with it! - Asparagus - Sides can feed 2 people so share with the table! Cooked to perfection and so juicy. - Halibut - Fresh, moist, and every bit as healthy as you want it to be! - Braise Short Rib - Slightly dry unfortunately but otherwise epic flavors and the polenta was cooked to perfection. - Sticky Toffee Pudding - Wow this really was a perfect way to end the night! Please try this!  Long story short, GO TO EBERLY.

reviews.author: Tom V.
reviews.description: The space is very nice and service was excellent. Definitely a place to have a date. We never had to wait for anything and the server was friendly and courteous.   The reason I give it only 4 stars, is the the food was just good, and not great. When you are paying almost 100 dollars a person including drinks, you expect the food to be excellent. We had the fish and the wagyu sirloin. There was nothing wrong with the food, but it just didn't wow us. The wagyu tasted like a normal filet. Very lean but tender. It wasn't any tastier. I would have much rather have a prime ribeye for the same price.

reviews.author: Ralph T.
reviews.description: Eberly is one of those spots in town I always want to love but seems to fall short.  The interior is gorgeous, especially if you are seating in the glass enclosed room.  10/10 for ambiance and design.  The cocktails are also great!  I've never had a drink here I didn't like.  Unfortunately, the food is where things go a bit south.  The portions are quite small and I find the quality to be inconsistent between dishes.  The price is also pretty high compared to other restaurants in the area.  That being said, the service has always been exceptional.  I think this place would be a lot better if they knocked a few bucks off their food prices (or improved the food).

reviews.author: Ellen G.
reviews.description: TLDR: This is a great spot for a celebratory evening, but is overpriced and shouldn't be your "go to date night".  We went to Eberly to celebrate a friends job promotion. The ambiance was great. We sat in what felt kind of like a beautiful greenhouse. Plants everywhere, cute decor, and perfect lighting. The service was also great. Our waiter took great care of us the whole time. Everyone enjoyed the cocktails and drinks they ordered too.   The menu is not huge and every entree is over $21 a person some going up to $42. This price was okay for a celebration dinner, but it felt like a lot for the portion sizes.   Also, we ordered a side of the crushed potatoes and they were covered in mint. I personally dislike mint and the menu did not say the potatoes would be topped with it or I would not have ordered it. I was surprised and disappointed by my side order.

reviews.author: Lydia A.
reviews.description: Had the best experience here! The food was amazing, service was spectacular and ambiance was on point! Great place to go with friends or co workers!

reviews.author: Joshua M.
reviews.description: In the latest wave of gentrification in this town, it seems like all I can find are hipster breweries that serve "craft" beer and overpriced food served on rectangular plates. If you like that kind of crap, go to aqua brew, you animal. If you want to go somewhere with cheap drinks and cool people (and if you live north of campus like this guy), look no further than Treff's. Some highlights.  You call it nights and you call it week:  Every Sunday, Treff's does $2.50 you call its, and $2.00 you call its on Tuesday. In addition to that, Treff's picks one week out of every month to be You call it week. That means $2 you call its all week. Going there, getting piss drunk, and stumbling back to my apartment, is among my fondest memories.   Atmosphere:  This place is dirty and divey in the best of ways. I used to go here with my friend from work all the time, and I always enjoyed seeing the bartenders and regulars. Really interesting people. Another upside is the patio, which allows filthy smokers like myself to smoke, drink, and have interesting conversations with other people. Another thing to mention, though, is that Treff's is much more of working people's bar. If you're a frat bro or sorority girl looking to blow mommy and daddy's money on a night of partying, you probably won't have a lot in common with the people here.  The glasses: This is just a little nitpick of mine, but I always hate going to the square and getting served drinks in a plastic cup. Treff's gets ridiculously busy some nights, and they still manage to serve all of their booze in glass, which is something I like. On another note, the bartenders here are absolute rock stars, and they don't take shit from anyone.   I haven't gone in a while since I don't have anyone to go with, but you can bet your ass the first place I'm taking my girlfriend when she turns 21 is gonna be Treff's.

reviews.author: Todd B.
reviews.description: I wandered around the square and didn't find anything besides frat boys doing brunch. Found my way to this place and it was great. Not for everyone but if you want a local crew and a few cold drinks and shots this is your place. I loved it and it will be even better when the upstairs is open. Not for children. Adults only in a drinking sense.

reviews.author: Kick I.
reviews.description: Patrick T. is full of BS- he did not open The Tavern when he was 25.  It was in existence way before he blew into San Marcos, and was known as the coolest, anti-frat bar in San Marcos.  That's why he bought it from Andy and Ben Linn, original owners.  He has expanded, added alot of TV s and updated the interior, but it will never be the place it was in the late 80's.  Keep blowing smoke, Patrick, - the Green Parrot is calling your name.

reviews.author: Enrique T.
reviews.description: They obviously water down their liquor. Had 7+ shots and only felt buzzed. We are not heavy drinkers in general.

reviews.author: Janeisy S.
reviews.description: Treffs is a nice casual spot to hangout, drink, play games and have a good time. It's a nice gem away from the square. They have $2 you call it week once a month! Can't beat it. Karaoke is also offered on Sundays, which is my favorite day to visit. Different events are hosted just about every day of the week. Although they don't serve food, they allow you to order at the restaurants near by and enjoy it there while washing it down with a cold alcoholic drink. Pretty awesome!

reviews.author: Estefania Z.
reviews.description: I loved Treff's until they kicked out my brother.ñ for some lame excuse. One of the bartenders is racist af and he should be kicked out.

reviews.author: Re'Ven S.
reviews.description: I love the $2 you call it weekalthough not all drinks are $2 and they fail to inform you of this before ordering it. I was willing to look pass this until I went in around 12am and had a few drink and was allowed to order a drink at 1:52am and they close at 2am. At 2:03 they bouncer was stand at our table demanding that two of my girlfriends and I chug our drinks and leave when we stated we'd like to not get drunk and drive the entire bar staff proceed to attack us and demand we finish our drinks, that we had just got and paid for, and leave or they'd take them. I felt very uncomfortable and attack so my friends and I just left. It was not a good way to end my night.

reviews.author: Eva R.
reviews.description: The bouncers and bartenders are always so friendly and have always enjoyed going to get a drink and chill. 10/10

reviews.author: Travis M.
reviews.description: It's Treffs.  Great owner and bartenders. It's got a ton of $2 you call it weeks and every Tuesday.

reviews.author: Lee W.
reviews.description: 3 stars because the ratio of ADULTS to college kids was surprisingly good. i.e. greater than 3:1. Im 48 and looking to not be around college kids every time I go grab a beer. Im kinda done with that nonsense, ya get me? I'll know more next time. Cool place.

reviews.author: Alyssa C.
reviews.description: My friends and I were here this past Friday with other work friends and we ordered a round of drinks. A few minutes later another friend met up with us and brought a round of shots. Within 10 minutes of being there a bouncer came up to us and told us we need to leave because we were "too drunk". I told him we weren't and we hadn't drank at all before we got there, we had all just been at a work function. He told us the bartender saw us walking to the bathroom "looking drunk". He wouldn't let us finish our drinks that we had just been served and only made the 4 people with shots out of my friend group leave. I think the staff there is racist just like other reviews are saying. Won't be coming back.

reviews.author: Anon A.
reviews.description: Well liquors were $2 tonight, and we were served well vodka and charged $6 a shot! The bartender who is also manager and share-holder DID NOT MENTION TO US  that well vodka in the form of a pickle shot would be $6. As a longtime bartender being served by a long term bartender, when I'm told "wells are $2" I trusted that Chad would be honest with us. Instead, he took us to the cleaners. If I could give no stars I would. I have been in San Marcos for over 10 years. About 6 years ago I was man-handled by a door guy for no reason. I did not return to Treff's for almost 4 years. Since then, I have gone back a handful of times in hopes that it was just "one bad apple", but now I see that the employees at Treff's are out for nothing more than money. Even the door guy tonight was short and smile-less. I have received nothing less than awful service at this bar and I will not be returning.

reviews.author: Taylor M.
reviews.description: I would definitely love to give Treff's more stars but to myself it is a solid 3.5.   This was my second visit to Treff's because the first time i had been there i did not have a great experience. However, I am a big fan a second chances because who knows what might had been going on that night.   The drink prices are very reasonable. Whiskey Sours only $3.50 and then they have some killer drink specials during the week I believe on Sundays and Tuesdays they have -You - Call -  Its- for only $2!!   The upstairs bar area has a bunch of darts to play and even a pac-man arcade game to entertain with.   As for this little dive, I would return.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: As a graduate of Texas State, I lived up the street from Treff's and spent moderate amount of time and money here. Great little place. A toss between "dive" and "college bar", this establishment has cheap drink specials and the students know it! Beer selection is moderate, but for a college hangout there's a few local and craftbeers in the mix of domestic "moneymaker" beers.  The bar gets super busy, especially during "$2 Tuesdays" when everything is $2 and I mean EVERYTHING! With other various specials during the week, this is a must if you're a student looking to have a good time and stretch you're student loan/ scholarship/ college fund/ or emergency credit card that mom gave you just a little more...

reviews.author: Karson E.
reviews.description: Cheryl is great. Prices are good. Happy hour deals are fantastic, and games are available to play upon request.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: Monday: $5 Pitcher Beer Night  Tuesday: $2 You Call It  Cool joint, cheap drinks and usually always pretty full inside. Oh yeah, and Happy Hour starts Early @ 2pm.  Parking is a little limited but there is more behind Grins.   Good place if you just wanna get away from the Square or try something different.

reviews.author: Mindy N.
reviews.description: Awesome bar with a great, casual, cozy environment. It's perfect for nights where you just want to be in the comfort of good company and drinks. The people are what really makes this place! Brandon, our bartender that night, was a blast to get to know and talk to. Excited to come back!

reviews.author: Alicia D.
reviews.description: Love this bar! It is fun and down to earth. Great drink specials! Best nights are 2 dollar u call it Tuesdays and Sundays! Sundays also has karaoke and they play all the football games!

reviews.author: Lindsey H.
reviews.description: So I went here on a Saturday.  The inside was wayyyy too loud, and very little people were inside. Their selection of beers was so/so, although I had heard that they had more than what they actually had.  The parking lot was awful. Construction going on and one way in and out. Only about 10-13 cars could park and you can forget it if you're driving a truck, as the guy driving a f250 found out after hitting the parked Mercedes.  Not a great place for a huge group of people, but not bad for a San Marcos bar. When visiting just be wary of the parking lot and crazy drivers.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: So I'm usually at Treff's on Tuesdays for $2 you-call-its (best deal on the best night to go) but tonight was a friend's birthday and she wanted to have a few drinks there before heading to Austin.   Well, as usual, we squished into a parking spot in the front of the tavern, walked in and sat at an open bar stool. I ordered an Ace pear cider and started chatting with friends while the jukebox was going with a vast array of music choices! Thats the beauty of a jukebox and I love the diversity!  Okay so I decided to check in (via Yelp) and saw that they had an offer for $2 drinks which really excited me because it wasn't a Tuesday and I still could get some $2 drinks? HELL YEAH!  WELLLLLLL.... it was more like a HELLLLLL NO because the bartender didn't allow me to redeem my deal. He even said he texted the owner and that the owner had no idea what kind of deal I was talking about? Well, the offer is still open on my Yelp app and I plan to find the owner next time I'm at the bar and ask him about it because that offer didn't magically come to be!!!  Anyway, yes Treff's is a super chill, casual and cool bar but they lost some points with not accepting my Yelp offer (I mean that's what the offers are there for hellloooooo)!! Guess I'll stick to only going in on Tuesdays...

name: Loro
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Great spot for m-f 2-5 happy hour! Large outdoor area so bring the pups! Heaters and fans were throughout the outdoor area.  $5 happy hour boozy slushees are a must. The gin and tonic was more like a margarita and the Vietnamese coffee was really delicious. Smaller beer selection but there's something for every type of craft beer lover.   Hh chicken sandwich was HUGE. It kind of had a fried fish batter on the chicken. Nommm chicken karaage was pretty good and made a great shareable. Tomato and cucumber salad was so refreshing and had a bit of a spice kick. Got some type of bbq beef that was a bit pricey but tasted good.

reviews.author: Victoria K.
reviews.description: Happy I finally took the opportunity to stop by! A few co-workers of mine suggested Loro's when I first moved to Austin, and after dining here - I can see why!  My sister and I both ordered a chicken sandwich, and crispy potatoes! Wow, we were not disappointed. Both the sandwich and potatoes were delicious. We will back very soon to try more!

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: I've only been here twice but, have enjoyed it both times. I think I need to explore the menu more to figure out what my favorites are. I will say that with it being the new year, I have been trying to eat lighter and one thing I like about Loro is that they have plenty of healthy options on the menu.   I ordered the salmon rice bowl. The salmon was tender, flaked off easily and was seasoned well. It was quite tasty. It came with white rice, cilantro, red onion and a sauce. I thought the sauce/rest of the bowl could have been a bit more flavorful. I honestly think this was because I ordered salmon and salmon doesn't have a lot of fat like pork belly, etc. I took a bite of a friends bowl that had ordered pork belly and of course this was a large flavor difference. Not really any fault of Loros, I just think I will order a little extra sauce next time  if I choose salmon. It definitely checked off the health part though, ha!   We got an appetizer of pickled veggies, which were awesome! They had a variety of vegetables and they all packed quite a taste punch! Very good.   Also tried the Mango Sake Slushie and it was so good! My friend said this is what they're known for. It wasn't overly sweet and tasted natural but, still had alcohol in it! Definitely would get this again.   Giving 4 stars because I simply haven't tried enough of the menu yet, but look forward to trying more of what they have and enjoy knowing they have a variety of foods to pick from depending on my mood or calorie limit of the day!

reviews.author: Leah S.
reviews.description: TL;DR; Really quality food; cocktails are solid; service is nice with an interesting concept; cool vibes. Get the chicken karaage.  My husband and I came here for a date night on Saturday and had a great time. Seating was surprisingly easy (we got there around 6:30pm? We're seated at the bar within 5 minutes). We sat at the bar, which was nice because we didn't have to go up and order food/drinks (which is what you'd have to do if you are seated at a table). Bartender and service was nice and attentive, host was friendly but not annoying.   Originally, we came for drinks and try a few dishes to share, but everything sounded so go that we stuffed ourselves with too food to get to the drinks. I did try the Typhoon, which was pretty good. The frozen drinks looked good, but was too full of food to get one.  Would DEFINITELY come back for the food. We both got rice bowls (husband got the chopped smoked brisket and I got the char siew pork belly), the corn fritters, and chicken karaage. DO NOT SLEEP ON THE KARAAGE. So delicious--the sauce they drizzle on top is *chef's kiss*, the jalapeño aioli was a perfect pair, and it was super tender, juicy, and crisp all at the same time.  Corn fritters tasted great, only critique is that the sweet corn was SUPER sticky/gummy (stick to your teeth in every aspect).

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: A hit Loro was with my out of town family visit. Always happy I am when making the right choice. Nice and easy atmosphere. A taste of this and that with our family style lunch spread.   Each dish was popping with flavors, including their tantalizing "Cucumber and Tomato Salad"; beautifully spiced "Malaysian Chicken Bo Ssam"; and, scrumptious "Loro Cheeseburger". A lunch my family will long remember!  CHEERS!

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: LOVE LORO!!!  This is a restaurant that embodies the vibe of Austin. So laid back and casual but also trendy! And the food... omg so very good! The cocktails are pretty amazing too. Our go tos are the bowls... salmon or chicken if you want something lighter and the brisket if you want something more filling. The karage and crispy potatoes are must tries! The quality of the brisket here is phenomenal. It's not always on the menu but if it happens to be on the menu when you go, do try it out!

reviews.author: Elizabeth J.
reviews.description: Great food!!! Omg the food is amazing !! I would give It 5 stars if the service and cocktails were better. Waited an incredibly long time for our order for the server to finally realize we still hadn't gotten It and then finally reordered It. Cocktails aren't that great. Watered down and basic. But 100% the food was delicious! And the ambiance

reviews.author: Michelle T.
reviews.description: Happy happy happy hour, spiked Vietnamese coffee , mango slushie , best crunchy fried chicken, freshly fried wonton wrappers with amazing sauce, friendly staff, popping music, beautiful outdoor, chill vibe. These are all the things I would associate Loro with. Did you know that Loro is a fusion from the famous bbq of Austin TX - Franklin  and amazing sushi chef from Uchi? This birth child mix of Asian fusion bbq is not to miss or else you'll regret it.  Let's begin with how satisfy I was with the fantastic happy hour price. Don't forget to catch it on weekdays 2 pm to 5 pm. The drinks are to die for and that fried chicken was so crispy and delicious , I'll be content with just eating it for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.   Definitely a must go to for one of the best happy hour deals in town !

reviews.author: Jessie C.
reviews.description: I haven't been this wowed by a restaurant in a LONG time!!!! Picture THAT dish that knocks you off your feet in a big meal....now imagine every dish you have is THAT good. I'd haul it back to Austin just for the bavette!!  Must try's when you come: - crispy potatoes: every potato was crispy on the outside yet flavorful and soft on the inside. I could drink the yuzu aioli  - crunchy sweet corn fritters: the best corn fritters I've ever had??? Again the sriracha aioli was PERFECT to pair with it (overall Loro had mad sauce game) - chicken karaage: perfectly fried and plenty of juicy, slightly mala meat. Def need to get if you like chili oil  - smoked beef brisket: it's so tender, it's difficult to pick up and literally melts in your mouth  - char siew pork belly: the sauce is hoisin with a twist, and it's so savory and cuts the fatty pork belly in the best way - smoked prime bavette: oh my god? How have I never had bavette before this?? This was one of the best cooked steaks I've ever had. It was the most perfect medium rare and literally so tender I couldn't comprehend  They also hit it out of the park with their drinks - the mango sake and Vietnamese coffee slushees were AMAZING (the viet coffee will WAKE you up). Overall an amazing spot to grab a bite with friends or for a date night. Heard they're opening up in Houston and you bet I'll be first in line to check it out!

reviews.author: Piyush A.
reviews.description: Now that is what you call an Austin spot. The outdoor setup is absolutely gorgeous with multiple different types of seating to match your mood. My wife and I usually go for their happy hour and the Yuzu Spritz is our favorite. The food is really delicious too but wish there were some vegetarian food options in their happy hour menu.  This has definitely become our go to Friday happy hour spot.  Couple of recommendations - 1. Parking can get full so you may have to lurk around a little  2. Food and drinks ordering is a little fast food style where yo I go inside the restaurant to order and then the servers will come find you   Overall, a must visit !!

reviews.author: Jonathan C.
reviews.description: The food was sooo good! My friend suggested this place since I was in town visiting. I was confused when I entered because I didn't know if I needed to check in, but it's pretty much self seating and you order your food and drinks at the bar.   Since I was only here to grab a quick weekday lunch bite, I ordered the Chicken Karaage and the Smoke Prime Bavette. They were both so good! The chicken karaage was well battered and just fried perfectly, on top of that, the chicken was topped with their version of a sweet chili sauce and some cilantro and Thai basil. The smoked prime Bavette was delicious! The steak was obviously the tasty star of the dish, but I also that they did a really good job with their coconut rice. The sides, like watermelon radish and red onion. help cut the richness of the rice and the smoked prime. Lastly, my only drawback was the sauce that came with it as it was a little too sour for my tastes, so to anyone who is sensitive to sour, take it easy with your pour!  Overall, I would definitely come back with friends to try their drinks and enjoy this delicious food again.

reviews.author: Darla A.
reviews.description: If I could give them more stars, I would. Not sure why I have not reviewed Loro until now. I was likely trying to keep them to myself. Loro is the brainchild of Aaron Franklin and Tyson Cole and it does not disappoint. They call themselves an Asian smokehouse. The menu brings the best of both worlds to all those who dine there.   Happy Hour is from 2-5. They sell $4 Ty Ku Sake plus Stemmari wines on tap (Pinot Grigio, Rosé, and Pinot Noir). I love the Rosé. They have a cheeseburger that has shredded brisket with red onion jam on top! It is only available during HH or until they run out.  Pro-tip. Order it to go and enjoy it the next day.   Other favorites include the chicken Karage, corn fritters, beef tostadas, crispy potatoes, pickled vegetables, pork belly, and the smoked Prime bavette. The brisket is delicious, but only available after 4 pm. Everything comes with an Asian flair (sriracha aioli with the corn fritters, chili aioli and Thai herbs with the Karage, miso mustard and yuzu aioli with the potatoes, hoisin sauce with the pork belly, and shishito salsa verde with the bavette).  They have a nice large outdoor patio with a combination of picnic tables and smaller tables with chairs. They also have ample indoor seating. You order at the bar and they bring the food to your table. They also offer curbside service - which was my go-to option during the lockdown.  The parking gets full quickly, but there are spaces just south of them in the lot behind the building next door.

reviews.author: Jeff N.
reviews.description: It's about the bold flavors for me. A colleague referred us here. He said it was his favorite restaurant in Austin. I agree! Service is different than expected but we appreciated how it worked out. You order drinks and food at the bar. They give you a pager tracker to put on your table. Runners bring out the food. They have a large outdoor seating area and a large dining room. Great collaboration of BBQ and Asian  flavors. Most are weird  combinations but what else would you expect in Austin? Solid 5

reviews.author: Brandon A.
reviews.description: Great food, atmosphere, and drinks. Franklin and Uchi couldn't complement each other better.  One of the top spots in Austin if you're a human and you eat food.

reviews.author: Iris H.
reviews.description: What can I say that's not been said already? Loro is great! Been here so many times and liked everything we've gotten here. Amazing flavors and fun combos of ingredients. Always good vibes so we don't mind waiting. Happy hour here is the best, highly recommend!

reviews.author: Jennifer T.
reviews.description: The atmosphere of the restaurant was super casual. You seat yourself and then order food at the bar. The outdoor dining patio area had spacious picnic tables with some sections covered with tent coverings.  Smoked Prime Bavette ($18.75): The medium-rare steak was tender and sliced thinly. There were some rich flavors from the shishito salsa verde and the natural smoke.  Loro Cheeseburger ($12):  When I bit into the thick beef patty, I knew right away how high quality it was. The burger had a southern flare with the slight barbecue sweetness from the brisket layer.  The red-onion brisket jam added some more  dimension.  Crunchy Corn Fritters ($7.75): An appetizer with an Incredibly crispy outer battered shell and soft sweet corn tidbits inside. The sriracha aioli dipping sauce cut through the heaviness from the fried batter.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: I'm sorry, but I will never get the hype with this place. I've been here three times, and every time I wonder why it is that people recommend Loro. Fusion Asian food is always a huge hit or miss, and Loro definitely misses out every single time.   My friend and I ordered their chicken karaage, cold noodles, and corn fritters. All of the dishes were incredibly mediocre and left us wanting more out of the dish. The corn fritters were only edible with the sauce that they give, the cold noodles were not worth the price tag attached, and the chicken karaage was a mess. The only redeeming items we ordered were their gin and tonic and mint mojito. Those were absolutely delicious.   For some reason, their workers always seem like they don't want to be working there and I almost feel bad for going up to them to order my food. I've never come across a kind server at Loro.

reviews.author: Damaris C.
reviews.description: This place is perfect for date night or for trying a different type of food! Loro is a Asian bbq meat meets texas taste! The environment is amazing and the decor is worth seeing. If you have a dog it is dog friendly outside and have plenty of seating area.

reviews.author: Chris J.
reviews.description: Came to Loro for a friend's birthday, and as per usual, was met with a great experience. We stopped by Friday evening around 7:30pm and waited a little over an hour for a table, but the time flew by with great company and the ambience. The waiting area was equipped with an outside bar, elevating the atmosphere and allowing us to get some drinks in while we waited.  In terms of food, we ordered the crispy potatoes, chicken karaage, smoked brisket, and the malaysian chicken bo ssam (not pictured, sorry ate too fast). The potatoes were delectably crispy and were paired perfectly with the creamy aioli sauce. Needless to say, they were destroyed within minutes.   Moving on, if there's one thing you'd have to get at Loro, it would definitely be the chicken karaage. One thing about Loro is that every single ingredient and flavor you can tell is thought out and placed for a reason. Not only do the flavors of the ginger and cilantro complement the sweet glaze of the chicken wonderfully, it also add layers of flavor that bombard your taste buds in the best way.   I would also highly recommend the malaysian chicken bo ssam which was unfortunately demolished before I could get a picture. It came with lettuce wraps, pickles, pickled radish and chicken. The chicken was tender and topped with an authentic Malaysian sauce that was smoky and had curry-esque flavors. I really enjoyed how light/clean this entree was, whilst still providing a great variety of volume and flavors.   Finally, we also ordered the smoked brisket. I feel like the only thing needed to be said is that you can tell Franklin's was involved in this establishment.   To sum things up, Loro continues to be one of my go-to spots here in Austin. I always walk away feeling beyond satisfied in terms of quantity, and happy knowing the quality is similarly as great.   5 stars.

reviews.author: Spencer S.
reviews.description: Very popular spot from my experience as a tourist. Seems like you'd be lucky to get a table without a wait during prime dining hours. Indoor, outdoor and bar seating. Place your order at the bar, get a number and they bring it out to your table. Asian fusion. Upscale casual atmosphere. Turned into more of a bar atmosphere as time went on - lots of people standing around between tables. Extremely fast service. Friendly staff.
