I had a frozen margarita, the frozen was out after that and I switched to a hibiscus margarita. I know your thinking hibiscus flower, yea it was even pretty like the flower. I also had the huge Heldarado as well. Man let me tell you now have a few people would help you finish but it was good.   It was just great company we had fun there I met a couple cool people there and it was rememberable. It's kind of what we are looking for when we go out to eat or something. The server was good even when they switched out for shifts, the only thing I will get you don't want us they could use a few more extra service. Great experience I definitely go back.

reviews.author: Gabriel P.
reviews.description: A friend came from California to 6th street and this is one of the places that I took him to. The drinks and music were good, but it was really crowded. Other than that we had a great time. Don't forget to get a picture on the Jackalope!

reviews.author: John H.
reviews.description: This place was really unique.  Came here on a Sunday night. Sandwich was great.   Place had a fun vibe and seemed like everyone knew each other.  A cool stop to make in Austin.

reviews.author: Mike S.
reviews.description: Pretty cool place.  Drinks are weak, music is not really my type, but friendly service!

reviews.author: Britta M.
reviews.description: This bar is located on 6th street and is a solid stop to make on your bar crawl. The giant jackalope inside is very insta-friendly, they tell you to feel free to hop on and take a pic.   Our bartender was really friendly and funny, and served us right away. He gave us a few suggestions, and we ordered drinks and a round of shots. They were all good and mid-priced. The only downfall was they didn't shake the pineapple chaser, so it was lukewarm.   Overall, a solid and memorable bar experience!

reviews.author: Gillian W.
reviews.description: Come on who doesn't love this place? I love coming here when I'm downtown and to/from the airport, always love getting on the jackalope and taking a pic. The menu is limited now, but still good. I love the atmosphere and who you meet here. You never know, you might just find a life long friend. Staff is fun, personable and friendly. Always a regular stop for us when we can! Stop in if you haven't.

reviews.author: Ernest H.
reviews.description: Food was good when it came out correctly but had to send back what was put in the computer versus what I asked for.    Tonight October 30, 2021. I put a food order in for honey jalapeño wings, an order of waffle fries and a dos xx draft. Total came to 22 and was given order number 80 around 8:00 Pm. Order came out as a burger and side of fries which after checking your menu, should've only been 14$ plus what ever the beer was which I'm sure isn't 8$ for a draft beer in a plastic cup.   I informed the food runner it should've been wings and he showed me where the food was rung in as a burger instead, no harm no foul a simple misunderstanding or so I thought. The bartender who rang it in informed me I ordered a burger when I "shouted" my order at him and said I like that with fries. By my calculations, if I did intact order the burger with a side of fries it should've been 11.5 for burger plus 2.5 for fries. Not almost 16 I'm assuming plus 6$ for a dosxx.   I get it it's Halloween weekend. But if you can't fully hear the order then just make sure with customer before finalizing and putting order in and over charge them if in fact you thought I ordered a burger. But also don't give attitude when customer asks for the wings and believes the wings only come with 8 like you PDF menu states. Not from Austin but will not be back anytime soon. Unfortunately I paid in cash or I would ask for a refund for the difference because I'm entitled to that I believe. I understand customer isn't always right. But food costs can't be that high that you need to argue about the wrong button being pressed on your end.   And yes this is the exact same review I sent to the contact us for on the website, I'm sure nothing will change with how orders are put in on busy nights, but just make sure you get your itemized at this establishment so that you know before you walk away from bar.

reviews.author: Rich R.
reviews.description: Very cool bar with an excellent vibe.   Check it out if you are in Austin.  The bartender was great and made the experience even better.    There was an outdoor section in the back of the weather is nice.   I didn't try any food.

reviews.author: Ryan H.
reviews.description: The bartender Tay pulled us off the street to give us a gigantic cocktail!! Great Guy, Good Music and Good Vibes

reviews.author: Alex D.
reviews.description: If you must go to 6th Street in Austin, this is a must stop. Cheap shots, a giant jackalope statute and food that is actually good. Burgers are some of the best in a town with alot of good burgers.

reviews.author: Terry P.
reviews.description: Our bartender "Happy Hour" aka Justin, was the bomb. Just enough rough and sparky. Loved him. He also pour a really good cocktail.   Try the fried pickles. They are yummy and hit the spot.

reviews.author: Tamrynn H.
reviews.description: I used to love this place..the drinks are cheap and the food is good.  It was actually the first bar I went to when I turned 21.  However now, the bald bartender that is on the heavy side is a TOTAL DICK.  HE PRACTICALLY YELLED AT ME!  He seems to always be there too.  I gave a card tk hold and I was going to pay cash at the end...well, during shift change he said he doesn't do that and I need to pay each time.....umm, u have my card, idiot.  I still tipped him but he is an asshat.  I won't go back if he is working.

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: Pretty good burger on Sixth St!   The place is a fun bar at night, with a big Jackalope Statue you can climb up onto. However, I also came earlier in the night to grab a bite. I had a bacon and Brie burger, but I substituted the patty for an impossible patty. There was plenty of cheese and lots of pickles on it.

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: This place was absolutely empty due to the cold weather but the atmosphere was modern and inviting. I loved the jackalope that i was able to climb and sit on the most . I would go back, but on a warmer night !

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: IF I COULD GIVE THIS PLACE ZERO STARS - I WOULD.   DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU ARE TRYING TO HAVE A GOOD TIME.   We came here during a BACHELORETTE.  I understand circumstances are weird due to COVID-19.  I get that. We ALL get that. We are in Austin visiting for our best friends bachelorette and on our second night here we decided to take the advice from our waiter at Caroline's and go to The Jackalope.  We went there at 9pm just to check it out and our bartender, Bart, gave us complimentary drinks. We were so thankful, we paid for the giant mixed drink and went next door for a few hours and then went back to The Jackalope because the bride requested it. We sat down for 20 minutes even ordered some drinks (which they never brought) and they were playing the jams -- so naturally we started dancing around our table.   Even the other bartender, Dimitrius, was hitting on one of our bridesmaids HEAVILY and hanging around with us while we were dancing - not even one whole song went by before Dimitrius told us we couldn't be dancing and that we needed to be in our seats. We said okay, that sucks but sure. So we sat down and made sure our butts where planted -- next thing you know some random came up to us and started twerking at our table then on jumped on the couch and started twerking and spreading her legs in the air. Again - SHE WAS NOT WITH US. None of us even knew who she was. Immediately, some angry bartender (that clearly needs to get laid) with a ponytail ran over to us being loud and demanding that WE get out meanwhile Twerker conveniently slinks on back to her table    I can understand if we were the ones doing THAT and you wanted to kick us out - FINE.  But that was not the case. No one wanted to even hear us out, one of our bridesmaids does not drink and she was very civil in trying to explain to Ponytail Bartender but he literally was non-stop raising his voice to us. He even yells at Bart to come over - and this fool just straight up decides to "go with his boys on this one" and preceded to gesture us to get out  Ponytail could not WAIT to kick us out, let me tell you. Like there's some underlying issues there  He yelled at us saying "You're not even ordering drinks! You're not even ordering food!!!" NOPE. Wrong again, Ponytail.   We DID order food and drinks but your stubborn hating ass didn't accommodate us  Meanwhile Twerker (aka THE PROBLEM) is still running rampant inside the bar   Also, the pink haired lady was GOD AWFUL. Not helpful whatsoever.  Bart you were the biggest disappointment, and Ponytail -- you just suck. Thank you for ending our night horribly and giving us a HORRIBLE first trip experience.   I do not recommend this place whatsoever for anyone who is looking to actually have a good time.

reviews.author: Max M.
reviews.description: Great bar, fun service and a good menu. Bartender was super cool and drinks were cheap. Highly recommend

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: Great food, good location, good portions. The only thing that was not great was the bar tender, not the friendliest person. But he didn't ruin the experience and the food

reviews.author: Rosalind C.
reviews.description: All I can say is don't judge a a book by its cover. I needed to run away from Houston just to get a different view so I came to Austin for the day. I wanted to get a drink and I was hesitant to order something to eat. This place looks old and it has a funny bathroom smell but aye so many good yelp reviews so why not. I got the wings and the fries and was super impressed. The mango jalapeño I think was really fresh and good and the fries where hot. I would go back and im sure once this Covid is over it would be a live bar as well.

name: Vigilante Gaming Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday

reviews.author: Alejandro D.
reviews.description: Well, since I wrote my last review, I've played a lot of board games, been to lots of board game bars, and new places in Austin have opened up.  And for a minute, I thought: the competition is getting tough... There are cheaper ways to go out and play board games now, and there's always tons of places to eat in Austin   But honestly, Vigilante still deserves five full stars because they provide a unique experience you can't get anywhere else. The service is EXCELLENT. The wait staff is always extremely friendly and makes you excited to be there. The game masters are truly that, and can teach you a game as fast as possible. The food is also much improved and truly enjoyable. While also staying out of the way of the real focus: playing games with friends!  By always innovating and keeping the experience top notch, Vigilante will always have a spot in my rotation.

reviews.author: Wayne N.
reviews.description: If you're ever looking for a place to just hangout in the evenings, play some board games with some friends, or try some board games that you're thinking about buying, Vigilante is where it's at. It's got everything you could want for a nice fun evening.  Ordering system is pretty simple - just tell your server what game you want and they go fetch it. Once you're done, flag someone and pick another game.  Food is pretty simple and if you order three things all at once, it's a little cheaper. I wasn't particularly hungry the couple of times I went but the pretzel bites are decent with queso. The sandwiches and milkshakes also don't look bad though I can't vouch for it. They got a lot of drinks on tap too.  Sit back, kick back and relax!

reviews.author: Eve R.
reviews.description: So much fun!!!   We just left this restaurant and had the best time! If you are looking for something fun but something chill this is for you! The food is so good! We got the dumplings, pretzels, gyro , burger and cookies. They have so many games to choose from and have "game masters" to help you pick a good one. We stayed for 2 hours. It's been a long time since I've laughed so much. No one was on their phone, no one even wanted to leave the table to go to the bathroom. Oh Drinks were great too.

reviews.author: Kendall D.
reviews.description: For NYE we rented the wizard private room and spent hours eating, drinking, and playing games. The room really made our night special with the insanely detailed decor, Bluetooth speaker to customize the gaming vibe, and remote controlled fan for comfort. The waitresses were also so kind and we all felt right at home. We ordered almost every drink and small plate on the menu. I recommend ordering an old fashioned and the dumplings - the sauce was so good! In the main area, they had a nerf gun war planned to end NYE along with a champagne toast. Everything they do is well thought out - definitely give it a try!

reviews.author: Kyla S.
reviews.description: We had a great experience here! My advice is GET A RESERVATION! It's much smoother that way! The food was okay, most of it we liked, but when we ordered the Gyro and we didn't eat it our waiter noticed and was kind enough to take it off our tab! We have an excellent waiter! The bartender was great, and the hostess at the front door was super cool! I'm very glad we got to experience Vigilante! And when we are back in ATX. We will be back :)

reviews.author: Ellen G.
reviews.description: We loooooove vigilante. This is one of my favorite spots to take my friends whenever they come visit us in Austin. I know covid has been hard on them, but they've handled everything with grace and care.   The staff is awesome and will help you pick out the right game for your group if you are unsure.   When you go, order the Thai fighter. It's my favorite thing on the menu.

reviews.author: Marcus Q.
reviews.description: Dropped in today glad I did! First time here and Chris was awesome welcoming and friendly! Did the 3 course where you pick three awesome food items on the menu! Chicken tenders light and crispy and Mushroom burger amazing! Started with Brussel sprouts and it makes you realize you definitely were wrong as a kid they are awesome! Board games drinks and video games at the bar you just can't beat it! Management and staff are amazing!

reviews.author: Katherine C.
reviews.description: I really can't speak highly enough about the team at Vigilante. They are so professional, helpful and friendly. We celebrated a birthday party and had a fantastic time. Everyone loved the food, drinks, and games. We can't wait to visit again!

reviews.author: Katrina S.
reviews.description: Game and drink selections are great, staff is fantastic, but the food portions are stupid small. I understand they want to keep it snack size so you can focus on gaming, but when you make things gluten free, i.e., take away the buns, the portions get reduced significantly, but the prices don't get reduced at all.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: This is such an amazing concept and we had a blast!  Our group of 4 came here for an adult game night and were not disappointed.  They have a huge variety of board games to choose from.  These game range from easy to hard, long play to short play.  We ordered several different appetizers to share as a table and we each had a burger.  The appetizers were decent and the burgers were very small but pretty good.  This place is definitely not about the food but about the games.  It is good for the snackable items, but I wouldn't plan your dinner here.  The drinks are good and very reasonably priced.  We had a reservation for two hours, but we ended up staying there for about 3 and a half hours and we were not kicked out or asked to leave.  The staff was all super friendly and helpful.  This is definitely a spot that we will be back to.

reviews.author: Colton L.
reviews.description: I've been here many weekends since moving into the Crestview neighborhood. It is easily the best bar in walking distance. Cocktails are amazing. Bar food is delicious and perfectly snackable. You can never have just one plate. The staff is always friendly.   By far the most unique and best part is the extensive bored game library. This makes it the perfect gathering place for parties small and large to get together for some wholesome and competitive fun. The thought put into this aspect is also plain to see. The design of the tables, the food choice, and the atmosphere makes this the perfect place for the next role of the dice or grand strategic victory. For large parties and special events, ask about the hidden rooms.

reviews.author: Marley R.
reviews.description: My family and I had an excellent time at Vigilantes on our trip at Austin, TX! Our server was super attentive while we were playing games. The food options are super cheap and they are all SO good! You can choose from 60+ board games on the app too- we played Clue and Bad Medicine. Overall it was a great experience and I highly recommend if a group is looking for something to do at night time!

reviews.author: Amanda G.
reviews.description: Best time ever. Great vibes, decor, and ambience. I also love the delicious food that is easy to eat while you play games! And I love that the game selections are so well organized by type, difficulty level, #of players, etc. If you've never heard of a game or are unsure of what to pick, the staff is super helpful in recommending or explaining game options. For one occasion we reserved one of the private rooms for playing some DND and it was super cool! It's hidden behind a bookcase! Also, the bathrooms are nice. Just saying.

reviews.author: Victoria X.
reviews.description: Super fun board game bar! All boardgame boxes have been replaced by custom wooden boxes.  You can check out one box at a time. They do split the check individually since it's a handheld POS system that they use.  Majority of your party must be there in order to be seated, otherwise you can just wait at the bar. If you choose not to play board games, you can hangout at the bar and they'll give you switch controllers so you can play smash on their projector screen.  I saw that there was 1 hidden room, behind the bookcase, which I can only assume people can rent out for private parties. There is free parking out front in the garage.  -1 star because service was painfully slow.

reviews.author: JR L.
reviews.description: Man what a gem this spot is! If you haven't been, you mos def need to go. From groups of 2 to about 8, you're gonna have a great time from their lengthy list of board games, small and easy plates, plus brewskies or cocktails! Came here with three friends on MLK night and it was busy! But we were able to get our gaming in. FYI, at night it's a bit tough to see the store sign, but it's right at the corner/entrance of the apartment complex it's near!  Inside - 5/5 The left side of the spot has long benched tables with booths lining the wall/corner. If you sit in this at area, the staff give you a cool plasma-esque lantern so that you can call them over for food, libations, and games. The back of the left side is a bar with a projector in the behind. But what really sets the inside are the four person tables on the right side that are outfitted for perfect board and card games. Each side of the table has compartments where you can put your personal items, a cup for rolling dice, and a slider for cards. There are swinging sections at each corner to put your drinks or other items. Lastly, each side has a button that turns on a light right above the table to let the staff know you need something! P legit.  Food - 4/5 There are two pretty cool three plate deals you can order for $12 as you partake in the games. So far I've had the tacos, fries, and rolls and they weren't that bad. Nothing to write home to, but would be nice with larger portions. If ya don't do the deal, the  plates a la carte are of course a bit more expensive. Also, they can gluten-free most, if not all options! The beer and cocktail selection is pretty nice. Again, nothing out of this world, but cool you can really spend hours here.  Games - 5/5 The best part of Vigilante is of course the games. As several of the menu photos depict, they have a full menu of categorized games (e.g. adventure, party, cards, board). They also break it down by how difficult the games are to learn, set-up, and play. They of course have your staples - Settlers of Catan, Cards Against Humanity, Exploding Kittens - but there are plenty of more games that you can try with your friends! For example, we tried Sushi Go (a quick card dealing game to get the most points) and it has now become one of our go to games! The fun part is that the games are placed in a protective wooden box, which makes you feel like you're accessing a side quest of some sort.  Tips! Like a night club, it's $5 per person to sit at a table and play! And it's unlimited games all night. Your group can only one game at a time. Sit at the 4 person tables I described above! You won't regret it! You can order per person - the staff have mobile card readers  Overall - 4.5/5 I don't think any place is perfect as I believe it's always fun to continue building and making something better. Nevertheless Vigilante is a must go place for a date, a "night in", or what have you among other game loving fellows. It has everything you need and you're not risking yourself in the crazy scary world out there. Don't do yourself a disservice and go go go (Power Rangers)!

reviews.author: Catalina L.
reviews.description: Overall poor customer service. Visited for happy hour today with friends, and ambiance initially was nice. Their system of notifying staff with flicking lanterns only however encourages neglect for tables; we were never notified that apparently staying for more than 90 minutes meant EVERY guest at the table was charged their game fee, despite us never using any of the games.  Poor communication. We weren't even told of this option by any staff. Once we asked for our checks we were each notified of the surcharges, which honestly felt like I was being scammed because there was no communication given to us. No itemized receipts for me to prove this either, just electronic signatures on a page where the default tip was the highest amount percentage. Bad service but I still tipped 18% because there weren't any other options. Seems like Vigilante is just sneakily after your money, doesn't sit right with me.   Extremely small portions of sides and appetizers. Beer and cider was average selection and price. There are better places for happy hour that don't try to scam you with hidden fees.

reviews.author: Swathi J.
reviews.description: My friends and I visited Vigilante on a Saturday night to grab food and play some board games. I liked the ambience and how they have set up the games. You order games from a menu (they have an amazing collection) just like you would order food. They have some good vegetarian options. I felt that portions are small when compared to other restaurants. But if you are here to spend time with your friends, that should be ok. The "choose your own adventure" was $12 for 3 items ok the menu. It costs $5 per person to play the games if you are sitting in the general seating area.  This could be a really good place to just hangout with your friends and have a good time. They are also open until super late!

reviews.author: Courtney E.
reviews.description: Terrible experience! We decided to go here last night after dinner (group of 4) and we called ahead to see if we needed a reservation. We were told no, they keep some tables available for walk ins. When we arrived it was 8:55 and the host told us we were 3rd on the list because there were some 9pm reservations coming in. Ok, no problem we waited outside. Slightly confusing to us though because the place was half empty. The host said it's because they're still operating at 50% capacity. Um...why? Texas opened 100% back in March. Anyway, waited outside. 9:00 comes and goes, 9:10, 9:20...so we go inside to ask what's up? No people ever walked in while we were waiting. We were told that if the 9pm reservation doesn't show then they call and text them to ask if they're still coming and give them time to get there. This was ridiculous! We had been there 30 minutes..the only people waiting on site..we had money to spend there..and we had to wait just in case someone decided they wanted to show for their reservation 30 minutes late. So back outside, there's an open table that's just been sitting open so we decide to seat ourselves. We ask a server if we can get some drinks and he says he'll be back. A few minutes later another guy comes outside to tell us we can't sit there, they're waiting to see if the 9pm folks are going to show. It's 9:30!!! At this point we are fed up and argue with the guy about this "policy". We finally said we would just leave because it's obvious we weren't welcome, our money wasn't needed (although idk how since 50% capacity isn't good business for anyone). To top it off, as we are getting up to leave the man who I assume is some kind of shift lead tells us NOT TO COME BACK! Great business you're running here. Such a disgusting experience.

reviews.author: Julie S.
reviews.description: I have been to vigilante a handful of times now and I love it. I LOVE their regular menu, really nothing that isn't straight up delicious. Mainly wanted to write this review because I noticed there were no pictures of the brunch menu anywhere I could find online. Saturday and Sunday, 11-2, if you come and do the pick 3 for 10.50 brunch they waive the $5 game fee. My table tried every dish and there were no misses. Here are a few notes: -Loved the mini smoothie bowl (it's more like a little cup) -Taco is great just be sure to add bacon and you may want to ask for extra hot sauce  -Bacon pancakes come as stack of 4 and they are baseball sized, so pretty good deal -Hash-browns are also a pretty decent portion   I don't really need to speak to the game menu; they have a vast and varied collection and there is multiple things for everyone.   A must go for a low-key brunch option :)

reviews.author: Alex H.
reviews.description: I came here with a group who rented out "The Wizard's Office," one of the private rooms available. They state the capacity is 12, but I can't even imagine how uncomfortable that would be. Not only would there be little room to maneuver yourself around, but it would be swelteringly hot. Even with our party of 8 it became stuffy. Service was the biggest issue: waitstaff were unresponsive to the push-button service request, often taking 10 minutes to come in. Waitstaff also had to be asked over 4 times to bring additional water until it finally arrived.   There's a good selection of games, although it can be hard to find what you want given the proximity of other tables to their game selections, and that they are all in their own custom boxes, making it more difficult in some aspects to locate a game, as they're not as easily identifiable.   I'm trying to find a good way to describe their food, and the only descriptor I can think of is, meh. I'm happy we went to Top Notch before coming in, as the food is small, and they didn't "course it out" as described. Instead the food came within minutes of one another, clogging up the table. Not to mention, one of the people in the party later ordered a burger, for it to take over 40 minutes to appear.  Will I come here to play games again? Yes. Will I come here to eat or drink? No. Best you stop off at any of the other numerous restaurants in the area beforehand.

reviews.author: A M.
reviews.description: Staff is always great- its a bar with munchies NOT a restaurant- pretty drinks exceptional service - clean, nice, comfy - whats not to love - just don't go expecting to eat a meal :-)

reviews.author: Cameron D.
reviews.description: Found this bar via reviews when doing an online search. Don't let the fact that it is a hotel bar fool you. Tony is an expert in making drinks. He is super cool and really everyone here is at the hotel as well. We live in the area and will come back for the famous brown sugar old fashioned and margaritas!

reviews.author: Jonathan B.
reviews.description: Come see Tony - had the brown sugar Old Fashioned. Yum!  Cool little place. Have some sweet and savory bites.

reviews.author: Joe R.
reviews.description: Was welcomed immediately. Friendly, attractive bartender. And most importantly, a good drink!

reviews.author: Edward C.
reviews.description: This is a hidden gem in Cedar Park. Tony the bartender is great. A real mixologist.  You MUST try this out.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: | Food |  Excellent!  I had the rainbow trout with brussels sprouts and that is some of the best trout I've had in a long while!  It was perfectly done.  The brussels spouts were tasty too.  My friend had the pastrami sandwich and she kept raving about it; the pastrami was high quality.    | Cocktails |  Again, a big win.  They were doing a bartender drink contest with several whiskey cocktails and I went for the Peach Tree.  Although petite it packs in taste and was not light on the whiskey!  | Atmosphere |  The patio is typical strip mall-ish.  It's nice that it is dog friendly.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Service here was good and loved the bar area. Brunch cocktail selection was above average. The Vietnamese espresso drink and Bloody Mary were great.   Food is what knocks this down a bit. I got the biscuits and gravy which was wayyyy to much biscuit for the amount of gravy given. Getting the chicken added is a must.   The carnitas poutine was super salty. I get that both things are meant to be like that, but this was just too much. I wish there was more pickled onions and jalapeños to balance it out.   The happy hour menu and times looked pretty good, so I'd definitely return to try that out.

reviews.author: Aaron G.
reviews.description: First, this place is perfectly nice and probably worth going to again if I am back in the area but would easily be convinced to try something else.  My evening began with the Ancho Margarita.   Unlike some places this chili inspired drink isn't like drinking hot pepper juice and is delicious.    The fried cheese curds with ranch dressing were tasty but nothing particularly gourmet as a novice home cook could prepare this with the same results.     The disappointment came with the main meal.  The French fries were cold.   From our vantage point we could watch the kitchen workers.  They kept a big bowl of French fries that the kitchen leader would use to place portions on out going plates.   They rarely sitting it under a heat lamp, so they were cold and unmemorable.   This is probably the easiest and cheapest thing on the menu to prepare well.  The rest of the meal was perfectly ok, but noting that stuck out as particularly special.    The ambiance is nice, but extremely loud when there's a full house so you have to raise your voice to be heard across the table.

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Wife and I decided to try this place out for late afternoon brunch on the patio. We had the Bacon Beignets, Reuben, and Pimento Burger. We had a little difficulty finding good selections on the menu. Citrus pancakes sounded good, but they were out of them. The Bacon Beignets were the highlight, warm, freshly made and tasty. Reuben was good, with nicely salted corned beef and delicious German slaw. Pimento burger was too rich for my taste. Service was good. Overall experience was good. Would be 5 stars, but menu was not great for us. If you find things you like on the menu, then you should try it out.

reviews.author: Keilon L.
reviews.description: The meal was much more attractive than it was delicious. Everything was fresh but lacked flair in the flavor department. This is the kind of place I would come to for dinner but I wouldn't bring anyone here to impress them or to treat them. I only say that because the impression of this place I got from the ambiance and the menu was that I would be in for a stellar meal. I ordered the Brie Burger believing the brie and the flavor profile would offer pizzaz but I was not razzle dazzled. It was just the feel of eating a better than average burger.  The carnitas poutine got me a little eager to taste more flavors as I had that to start.  It could have rivaled a couple of poutine offerings that I've had in Montréal aka the poutine capital of the world (sorry Quebec City).  I am happy that all the greens were fresh to round out the meals well.  I felt like portions and servings were well balanced.  If I lived in the area, I'd dine here again.

reviews.author: William Z.
reviews.description: Stopped by last night wi5h friends. After putting in our name we sat in the bar and ordered beers while waiting for a table. We were in no hurry so we had another beer and looked over the menu.  It was obvious that Oast was short staffed and everyone was doing double duty. Thank the pandemic!  Nevertheless, tHe staff was very friendly and the service was adequate.  However our burgers were not very hot and my pretzel bun was stale. The fries were very good. In better times, this will probably be a very nice dinner option.

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Went to brunch here with some friends. This was a great atmosphere for brunch. I have been for Dinner which is lovely as well. However, it's laid back, chill atmosphere, and modern feel makes it a great spot for almost any occasion.  The food was pretty good. I did get something i could make at home. However everything was cooked nicely apart from the bacon. It was a little bit too charred for my taste. Potatoes were tasty, eggs standard, and the rye bread tasted more like a sour dough. But still good.   Mimosas were a good deal as well!   Overall we had a great time and most likely will return again!

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: Can't believe it's been a while since someone gave this place a review.   We came here because we found some good reviews on Yelp, but have to say I was a bit apprehensive about how long it's been since the last review posted for this place.   This restaurant seems to be a family go to place where people just eat and never care to leave a review.   This place a gem! We came in for an early dinner and were surprised by how good their food and drinks are.   I wasn't really found of the butternut squash soup but we were in the mood for trying so we did it.   I do recommend this place for anyone.  Specially if you are looking for food away from Downtown like us.   Enjoy!

reviews.author: Flora T.
reviews.description: A hidden gem! Great food, interesting drinks and friendly and attentive staff. We loved everything we ordered. Food is fresh and tasty. Good atmosphere for either friends' hangout or romantic outing. We had a great time there and will definitely recommend it! We arrived after 9 and could take advantage of their reverse happy hour. We were surprised how small our check was!

reviews.author: Ru L.
reviews.description: Gastropub is what this place is, a place for food beer and good food! The pimento deviled eggs.. oh my were they great and served on a slab of rock, too. I had the beer braised pork and spatzle with a side of coffee rubbed carrots. The food was really good and service was friendly.

reviews.author: Carrie T.
reviews.description: Came here for brunch after church on Sunday. I must shout out Henry because his service was awesome. He was personable, friendly and efficient. His service gets 5 stars (and we made sure his tip showed it). We started with the bacon beignets which were not really like beignets. They were crispy on the outside and more like cake donuts on the inside. Only got like two pieces of bacon in the whole serving.  The food came to the table very room temperature. My father had to send his biscuits and gravy back to reheat (no one wants congealed gravy). My mom and I got the boring breakfast plate. I asked for my eggs over medium and they definitely came fried hard. Also the house cured bacon was bland and extremely dry. My Aunt's chicken cacciatore pasta tasted good and we liked the strawberry pancake we ordered for the table a lot.  Overall, service was the highlight but the brunch options are not worth a second visit.

reviews.author: Nathan F.
reviews.description: Have been to oasthouse before, but not for brunch and there was something for everyone. The service was really good (and timely/efficient) and we enjoyed the covered seating outside. They had a great beer/cocktail/wine selection and had several drafts i had never seen before. The chicken and waffles were really strong, and the chicken was almost like hot chicken which was a pleasant surprise and carried the dish but no complaints there. The carnitas poutine and the Cubano were certainly enjoyed as well

reviews.author: Allison P.
reviews.description: Oasthouse has been my periodic GrubHub treat when my standbys on another delivery service aren't available for several months. What more does one need in life when brie pimento burgers and coffee rubbed carrots with green peppercorn ranch are on the menu? I don't even mind that my average order for one meal is at least 35-40.00 with delivery. Sometimes it's just worth it for something so yummy.   I was excited tonight to share an Oasthouse experience with my daughter and was pretty disappointed at both a mediocre meal and pettiness on my bill. Even though I was happy to spend the 45.00 plus 20.00 delivery charges and tip to reward ourselves after a strenuous and stressful day of work, I felt shortchanged pretty quick when I couldn't even see the pimento on my burger, got an overly dry bun and was charged 2.00 after the fact for some perceived "extra" change to my order.   Whether this was an upcharge because they were out of mashed potatoes (usually substituted for fries since I'm gluten free) and gave me the more expensive brussels sprouts. Or maybe they changed me for the extra pimento I always ask for (#swoon) but didn't get. Since they didn't say what it was for I'm left wondering.   All in all, my highly anticipated Oasthouse indulgence fell kind of flat on a day when I really needed it. I guess nobody's perfect.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: My girlfriends and I met up here for brunch. They have quite a few patios to choose from, a nice inside section, and a full bar. Cool atmosphere and decent prices for food and drinks. We ordered 2 carafes of mimosas for only $8 each, which I thought was a great deal. They bring out your champagne and orange juice in separate carafes so you can measure out how much you personally want of each, which I appreciated.   I was not blown away by the food, but everything we ordered was still solid. Two of us ordered the all day breakfast plate that came with eggs, uncured bacon, a slice of toast, and breakfast potatoes. Everything was good, simply nothing stood out. The other two people in our party enjoyed their eggs Benedict and strawberries field salad. Good service and she stayed attentive the whole time we were there catching up. Overall, good experience.

reviews.author: Kayla B.
reviews.description: We've eaten here twice for dinner and really enjoyed our meals both times! We also had the same waiter, Henry B., and he was excellent! He was able to give great suggestions for food and drinks. We've had the fried mushrooms (featured) and the Reuben egg rolls for appetizers which were both amazing! For entrees we've had the chicken schnitzel, cheesy meatball sub (featured), and the strawberry fields salad which were really tasty. My personal favorite is the chicken schnitzel. Other reviews mention the drinks being so-so but every drink I've gotten has been quality with the alcohol. The hotter melon was recommended by Henry and was very refreshing. We plan to be back and would recommend!

reviews.author: Juan G.
reviews.description: First time here and to start we were welcomed with amazing staff members.   Our waitress Kayla really made the ordering experience truly as smooth and delightful as possible!!   The food definitely brought a smile to my face with the Bacon beignets, pancakes, salad and poutine as our entrees.   Can't wait to be back next time in Austin!

reviews.author: Adriana O.
reviews.description: First timer here and everything was great! The bacon beignets are perfect... nice flavor and crispy outside crunch. The mimosa carafes are great to share with friends! I love that the juice and alcohol are separate so you can adjust to your liking. I had the strawberry greens salad with chicken and it was refreshing and delicious.  I would recommend for a chill brunch spot on a Saturday! Not too crowded at all and we were seated right away at 11:30. Our server Kayla was great! Service was prompt and they easily made us a mocktail for our non-drinking guest! Will be back next time I come to Austin. :)

reviews.author: Helisse F.
reviews.description: We love Oasthouse! The food is always excellent and we have tried many items on the menu. Henry B was our server and did a fantastic Job. Come eat here and you will NOT be disappointed, in fact, you will want to make this your night out restaurant.

reviews.author: Joyce B.
reviews.description: This is my favorite place near my house in Four Points. The food is always very good and made to order with great ingredients. The service is always excellent, even when they are packed.   Today our server Kayla was engaging and took great care of us.  I'll be back.

reviews.author: Jeanne G.
reviews.description: My husband and I were, once again, delighted with the delicious food and competent service via Megan at a the Oasthouse Kitchen.  I ordered the Truffled Prosciutto Bruschetta, consisting of creamy truffled ricotta, argula, mission figs and local honey topped by a generous dollop of prosciutto.  It was a dreamy combo of textures and flavors.  On the side I had the seasonal tomato soup, thick and creamy.  My husband was briefly disappointed when Megan reported that the ribs were sold out.  However, she recommended the Wagu steak and frites.  The steak arrived warm and beautifully sliced with a giant side of shoestring fries, delicate and just fried to perfection.  We topped off the meal by splitting a peach crumble adorned with vanilla bean ice cream - a desert to die for.

reviews.author: Annie T.
reviews.description: My family rode the North Pole Flyer, not so much for the Santa stuff since we have no children under 10, it was more for family fun. And it was a fantastic experience. The train was actually pretty cool, I've never been in a proper train before, I mean, it was old fashioned but still just a really really cool experience. We paid for the private suite and it was worth it, we also walked throughout the train which was a bit old west feeling. My favorite part was walking between cars to see the view unencumbered by windows.   We walked through all the cars (like most people on the train did) to see what the other cars were like. The giftshop car was the nicestest with big windows and plenty of room to walk around while balancing yourself on a rocking and rolling moving train.   Some of the private rooms give you an idea of what is was really like to ride a train across country with a sleeper car, teeny tiny shower, and narrow hallways. It was such a great experience.   Not sure why people complain about the views because mine were fantastic! I mean, c'mon. We live in Texas not Denver. I know what the hill country looks like. There's no mountains but where the hills meet the sky is expansive. It was beautiful.

reviews.author: Christina O.
reviews.description: Booked a sunset train ride for my husband and I and it was such a fun experience! We loved all the fun facts the volunteers had to share about the train cars and lifestyles of some of the riders back 100+ years. The sunset was magical and the night portion of the ride was really neat, having the moonlight illuminate the tracks in front of us. One of the cars is a dedicated gift shop/concession stand with a variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages to choose from. Everyone we came in contact with was so kind and made the experience that much more memorable. Overall such a great time - we would definitely book this experience again!

reviews.author: Roman H.
reviews.description: Their North Pole Flyer is like a joke. Don't waste your time and money, it is not worth it. Dirty cars, dirty seats, dirty windows with bleak scenery outside and Santa who gives a broken whistle. That is all for 2 hours trip. Even an obsessed with trains 4 years old was bored.  If you decide to go don't forget to take a mask or a respirator, it's hard to breathe inside because of dust.

reviews.author: Candice D.
reviews.description: We had a great time on the Beer Train last night that was advertised as a sunset tour that was 2.5 hours long.  Note that you have about 45 mins moving time, then 40 mins stopped for the engine to be brought from the back to the front and then 45 mins back again. You don't really see much of the sunset, and you aren't moving for 2.5 hours. They also assign seats ahead of time, some of the cars were nicer and louder than others, so just depends what you're looking for. The association was responsive on social media when I had questions, staff and crew on board were all very friendly. They dont really follow any of their own posted rules about masks, no personal coolers, etc. so just something to be aware of- but I think this also varied by car. Overall we had a great time and would go again!

reviews.author: Daniel P.
reviews.description: I'm pretty sure this is the tourism equivalent of chicken-and-waffles: another empty promise meant to separate me from my hard earned monies. Fortunately for me the plague was in top form. Was in the area looking for sustenance and 'Steam Train Association' showed on the map so I figured to pop in for a quick viddy before lunch. pulled up on a nearly empty lot, a shackled gate, and a locked door, the sign had the now common 'Closed for Plague' message which softened the blow of discovering "...that the train and rail yard are not open for public tours or photography" which meant the entirety of the museum was contained in the double-wide corner space in the strip. There's nothing inherently wrong with scenic train rides on vintage rolling stock, I've done it before and it's OK but that's just not my cup of meat. I was here for a bit of museuming but there was no museum to be had - nor postcarding nor touchable cars nor engines :-( sad face

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: My husband and I went on the Hill Country Flyer for our anniversary weekend and we were in the "Rippling Stream" train car. The Train itself is quite impressive and was my first time on a real train not subway. The First Class Coach option was really nice and the seats were spread out along with social distancing, we felt really comfortable. My only complaint was it was VERY cold outside and though they are climate controlled, it was really cold the first half of the ride - coming back was much more comfortable. I also wished the lay over time perhaps had been 3 hours to provide a little more browsing time in Burnet. It would be cute to do music in each train car from the era the train was made. Ours was built in the late 30's so it would be a nice little touch that's simple to do! They had complimentary snacks and drinks which was a plus. Can't wait to do it again in a private suite!

reviews.author: Rebecca O.
reviews.description: Was a waste of money from Cedar Park to Burnet....was suppose to be Hill Country Flyer...saw no Hill Country...just a lot of brush blocking scenery....but not much of that either...Burnet was quaint...but will drive next time...big disappointment..

reviews.author: Allegre N.
reviews.description: This was an excellent experience. We took the train from Bertram to Burnet for one of the special events (Wedding Oaks wine trip). The staff was friendly and seemed very knowledgeable about the history of each train car. If you have a chance to walk to the very last car and look out the back, I definitely recommend taking in that view. I would have loved to take a longer trip and will look for other chances to ride.  The website is a little hard to use. We would have really liked a private cabin for our trip but didn't see how to book that on the website.   I wish the volunteer in our car would have been a little less Chatty Cathy when we weren't talking about the ride. It was a bit of a distraction from our enjoyment of the ride. Also, riding during COVID was a bit out of our comfort zone already so we were sad to see at least two volunteers wearing their masks covering only their mouth, not their mouth and nose. The website goes into great detail about precautions and that is a basic one not being taken. (That being said, they did a great job with social distancing and I felt like the train was very clean.)

reviews.author: Mike H.
reviews.description: Enjoyed my first ASTA experience today.  Here's my recap:  - Purchased a First Class Lounge ticket so I had my own room in Rippling Stream  - Train left the station on time, arrived at Burnet on time, and left for Cedar Park on time.   We were only an hour late reaching Cedar Park because a car thought it could outrun the train, but it could not.  Once the accident reporting was complete the train resumed.   - Personal note:  I am a train nerd and love riding trains, so my threshold of being annoyed on a train is higher than most.  This will affect my review below.    THE GOOD:  - clean cars, fun to walk in between them, and if you're without children, the adults only first class cars are a must - Rippling Stream and Nambe.   Otherwise with kids, I would recommend the Maurice Beckham or Eagle Cliff.    - the trip itself is smooth and the volunteers are friendly and helpful.  You can tell they enjoy being there, informing and helping others.     - Burnet has an abundance of antique shops if that's you're thing.  Also the soups at the downtown coffee shop are wonderful.     - The shootout show in Burnet, while not having a worry about winning any acting awards, is fun for the kids and has a good ending.  They could trim some of the fat from it, and make it a more concise / engaging story - there were a few too many awkward pauses.  But I applaud the folks who are likely doing this for free.  And the kids loved it.     THE NOT SO GOOD  - The scenic ride - if you're from the area this should not come as a shocker - is not that scenic.  There's a great bridge over the San Gab river but otherwise it's unremarkable trees, backyards, roads, and strip malls.    But again, none of this bothers me that much because I'm on a train relaxing.    - Burnet:  This is a sleepy, very conservative town.  One sign to deter thieves in a store said, "We got an alarm.  We got video.  We got guns.  DON'T BE DUMB."    While the downtown is a short walk from the train station, 2.5 hours here is way too much time unless you love antiques.   There isn't much else.   And as far as lunch goes, I highly recommend walking a bit farther past the first couple restaurants or else you'll have long wait times.   I went to a deli just a couple blocks away and it had no line.      - Announcements:  there are few.  Nothing along the way to alert you to landmarks or scenic opportunities (there is really just one, the bridge over the river).   But it would be nice to hear more than the pre recorded departure / arrival ones.    - The warm soft drinks:  no one wants green tea or apple juice at room temp.  There was literally an ice bucket next to these (but for scoping ice).  A second one to put these beverages on ice would go a long way.    - Lack of variety in snacks:  for a first class experience, at least more than the mini lemon cakes and mini cinnamon rolls would be nice.  Some savory, perhaps?   - chairs in the RS lounge car are what you'd find at your local dentist's waiting room.  I expected something that would at least remain comfy for 1.5 hours at a time.      OVERALL. - for the price I paid, it's 4/5 stars.  I knew the scenery wasn't going to awe, so most of my ranking is based on the train experience inside.  The quibbles above are all minor; chill the drinks, add some pretzels, get someone to donate an old leather chair or 2, and be a bit more chatty with us.    Those who really ranked their train ride low usually fall into the following categories, so please take them with a grain of salt:  - a/c sucked because it was Austin in the summer (hopefully fixable but not all that surprising) - solution is to go when it's not hot, the 60 days out of the year it's under 99 degrees.  I also think they have ironed out most of the a/c issues by now.    - Burnet was terrible, Burnet food was terrible, etc.  It's Burnet.  There's a reason it's not as well known as Fredericksburg.  You walk a bit father to get away from the crowds, you cross check their list of lunch spots they give you when you board  with a quick glance of Yelp reviews and you roll the dice.    - scenery sucked, super ghetto, etc.   Maybe because I grew up in St Louis, but using the word ghetto here is laughable at best.  It's junky, yes.  Unkempt, sure.   And truly, if you live in the region, you should know better than to expect breathtaking views.  You've driven on 183 east of 35?.  Same views.   If you're from out of town I could see valid point here since the website pushes it hard that it's scenic - but us locals know how much lipstick you can put on this pig.   So go check it out!  But go First Class if possible.  And be flexible about being home on time; like with any train, delays can happen.

reviews.author: Lori Ann L.
reviews.description: We rode the Hill Country Flyer which departs from the Cedar Park station and goes to Burnet, Texas,  where there is a two-hour layover so that passengers can disembark, do some shopping or grab some lunch or both.   Before leaving, the Burnet Gunfighters put on a show which is free to passengers, although they do accept donations.   The scenery leaves a lot to be desired, however that is not something that the Steam Train Foundation can control, they have a designated track and can not control who builds subdivisions or places gravel pits along the route.   If you are looking for a beautiful scenic ride, this probably isn't for you.  However, if you want to experience riding on a passenger train, and learning about the history of the railroads, it is a great experience.     They are very careful with social distancing and we felt completely safe riding the train.  I spoke with a couple of families that had young children and they loved it!   All in all, I would recommend it as a very enjoyable way to spend the day.

reviews.author: Peter D.
reviews.description: I rode the Sunset Express on 5-29-21 with my family, while on a trip to visit Austin. I'm from Southern California (this is important later). The scenery was certainly nice in some spots, but not enough. The sunset was awesome, but the experience wasn't that great. We paid for first class and rode aboard Eagle Cliff. Some basic drinks and snacks were provided, but the train was understaffed. No attendant for our car. One very sweet elderly volunteer was doing her best to handle two cars at once. I decided to offer to help, which she was very appreciative of. She said it was great that I wanted to help and so I did. I helped stock drinks and snacks as well as stocked ice to keep the drinks cold. Later on, a female volunteer who looked to be in her 40s came up to the counter said "Sir, you cannot be back there, what do you need?" I explained the situation, and she kind of had an attitude. I was informed in a rude tone that I had to be a member to help, and was given no thank you. Being that I live in Southern California, there's no way I could really be a member. While all this was happening, the AC in the car was doing a very poor job at keeping the car cold. It was unbearably hot in there, and everyone in the car was complaining. The excuse given was that the car is vintage and has a lot of runtime. The car was very original, and you could tell. That roughly translates to "we don't have the money or people to keep this car in tip top shape, and we don't have the money to upgrade it".  Eventually, my family was re-seated to the Rippling Stream. That was much better, but it didn't change the overall experience. Cherry on top was we were over an hour late returning to the Cedar Park station.   Not worth the money.

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: We also did the Xmas Polar Express train ride. Tickets were about $50 each. We also went with a friend and their kids too.   I'll give this train ride 4 stars. The kids were excited to see Santa and the ride was slow at times.   To start, one of the first things was a balloon guy. Ours was awesome. He was funny and overall entertaining. He had me laughing my @ss off.   Next came hot chocolate... it's hot chocolate.   After that was, singing Christmas Carols. They had 2 girls from McNeil high school. I felt sorry for them. They were nice, but they couldn't just get our car interested in singing.  A few of us sang, but overall it was a failure. I'm sure adult beverages if allowed/served would help the spirit. Great job to them but our car was mostly interested. It probably didn't help that they gave us a cookie just before they arrived so everyone was stuffing their face.   After that was story time, the lady reading the Story was animated and funny. Kudos to her.   She visited just before Santa.   Then Santa came. We were in one of the last cars so his visit was a bit rushed. He was nice and gave everyone a wooden train whistle.   ***********The entire operation is run by volunteers. So I'd like to thank all of them for their time!*******  This was he first time my son was not afraid of Santa:-)

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: This was a great little adventure from Cedar Park to Burnet Texas. Super We stayed in the Turquoise Room, which consisted of 2 tables, 8 chairs and two smaller windows. Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable...Once the train started the conductor came in to room to announce that there we several open seats in the main car...everyone got up and left leaving the wife and I in peace...Not that we are anti social, but it was peaceful to say the least...Good to catch up with each other, as we both work different hours...Truly not much to see on the way up...but it was a great ride....AC did work, not great but tolerable...I see in other reviews there were issues...You have freedom to roam Car to Car once the train gets rolling...and the train does turn around in Burnet...hard to explain, but it does...and we were able to see the other side of the tracks on the way home...Plenty to see and eat in Burnet...Our Car/cabin also came with free snacks and drinks...which is a great perk..as the snacks in the concession stand were quit expensive...The trip was worth it for us and will do it again next year with the granddaughter..

reviews.author: Liz I.
reviews.description: This review is based on my customer service experience with Zena, not the train ride itself (although I may come back and give an update!)  Zena is a lifesaver. Not literally, but she has made my train experience 2x as good. I bought a Groupon because I didn't even realize there was a train experience in Austin. After the headache of scheduling, our trip got canceled. Zena came in to save the day. She mailed me another gift certificate that expired in a year (vs the next week per my Groupon) AND she gifted us a little extra!  Sounds great, right? Unfortunately, the GC could not be redeemed online. After multiple tries of calling in (and getting a forever ring - no pick up), I was getting irritated.   I emailed Zena back asking for her advice. She wrote back in 24 hours and apologized for their phone service. She even offered to reserve me herself. After a few back-and-forth emails, she answered all my questions and got us all squared away.  Our train ride happens this weekend and I can only hope that the experience is similar to Zena's customer service.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: It's such an adorable idea - volunteers running a historic train line on weekends to give people an authentic experience. But the train is slow - really really slow. The view is simple and unmemorable. The FandB in the first class is simply a cinnamon roll and lemon cake with tea. They do have apples and oranges as well. The trip back was painful - we stood in the concession cart the entire time because the A/Cs didn't work and it was triple-digit hot on a September Saturday. Even my 5-year-old nephew, who is obsessed with trains and knows all there is to know about them, wasn't engaged in this ride much. Thankfully, we had carried board games and our own food so the ride to Burnet was okay but the ride back was really terrible.

reviews.author: James A.
reviews.description: I organized a group from Meetup.com to try this excursion and it was fun!  It's a laid-back trip to the Hill Country. My friends and I were in an Adults-Only car, the Rippling Stream, and we had a great time with each other and looking at the scenery.  I highly recommend this trip!

reviews.author: Katherine V.
reviews.description: The most horrible rip off of an experience I have ever had. I bought 4 tickets for the VIP lounge which included treats and drinks and a nicer car, it was none of those things. The food offered were store bought generic cookies and the drinks were either warm apple juice or water. The car lost the A.C. capacity on the return from the small town with nothing to offer and did not even have the gun fight reenactment due to the extreme heat, now imagine that extreme heat inside a metal sardine box. I invited my 72 year old father and I was genuinely worried we would have to rush him to the emergency room upon arrival. I chewed the place out for their false advertisement and putting the elderly and children at risk in the extreme heat without AC.   In summation, do not buy tickets to any of the events this was a horrible experience. I got my money almost a month later, and I will never return and I will warn anyone thinking about ever going to one of these fiascos.

reviews.author: Tim H.
reviews.description: As recent residents to the Austin area our 15 y/o son wanted to experience a classic train. We fortunately found the Austin Steam Train Association. We booked tickets on the Sunset Express trip. The Staff was all very friendly and knowledgeable.   You are able to bring your own drinks (non alcoholic) and snacks which is a plus. They do have a concessions car which is nice.   To us the trip was not as much about the scenery as it was the experience of a mode of travel long since gone.

reviews.author: Umeko V.
reviews.description: If you are going to the BlueBonnet festival, this is the way to go. Sit back, relax and enjoy the scenery, and when you get to the festival, no looking for parking.  Just jump off the train, and there you are.  Each train car has it's own characteristics, but take my word, spend the extra money for the air conditioned cars.  We had a chance to walk through the other cars, and even on a beautiful spring day, you can tell a big difference walking into the cars without A/C.  We rode on the City of Chicago, in a table for two, which had great views.  There was complimentary water, tea and snacks on our car.  The volunteer, Barbara, was informative about the train, wildflowers, and announced points of interest on the route.

reviews.author: Matthew H.
reviews.description: My family and I took a ride on the Hill Country Flyer and this a brief overview of our experience and I recommend you heed this review well.  ----------------------------  I visited and rode the September 7th 10:00 am to 5:00 pm ride to Burnett going out of Cedar Park Wirth the Austin Steam Train Association and I'd like to share my experience that day.   To begin the train left 20 minutes late from the terminal when it was communicated the train would be leaving promptly and on time consistently. Which is fine although it did negatively impact the quality of time spent in Burnett and exploring the town which was a key experience in the advertised outing. Another large disappointment was the lack of the advertised western gun fight. We saw no mention of it, nor display of it. Apparently that was another misrepresentation of the trip. It was advertised we would have two hours to explore downtown Burnett and have lunch. This was barely enough time to visit a local restaurant flooding with business from both local lunchtime and other passengers. With barely an hour in Burnett without enough time to eat we actually had to leave the restaurant we were at in a manic frenzy without eating, apologize to the staff at the restaurant for our rush due to this,and return to the train. Then upon returning at the specified time we still not even begin the process of departing until nearly 30 minutes past the time we were told to return! The. On the return trip we didn't even get above 10 mph on the speed making for a grueling and arduous journey back creating an atmosphere on complete misery on the entire train. On top of all of that the trains expected time to return was 5:00 we did not return until after 5:30! This is insane it officially help derail our entire vacation plan and helped out more of a strain on our time off. Meaning we had to rush and adjust our original plans.   Another issue with the experience was there little to no a/c in rear car named Rippling Stream on a day with temperatures rising above 95 degrees! Although the next car over had perfect a/c with a lower priced ticket. Paying for six tickets @55 dollars to sit in the heat in pool of our own sweat was not the idea of a luxury car provided by marketing materials. We actually had to use the pamphlets provided to make fans in order to be comfortable during the ride and continuously go into the other cars for refuge from the sweltering heat. Upon informing staff of the issue we were told once the train is moving we can go to other cars and stand in the cool air to gain some reprise from the heat.This is insane as we bought out the entire private room to have a bonding family experience we certainly were unable to enjoy. Also this car represented itself as a purchase of an adults only car ticket and children were running through the car. We wanted an experience that would supply with a relaxing adult atmosphere that was negatively impacted by this not being enforced.   Another major concern of mine is lack of communication from staff with the private areas of the train. Announcements regarding safety, departure time, arrival, landmarks etc were unheard in the private room and no effort was made by train personnel to inform us of anything. We were left alone with no information about anything given without having to seek out an attendant regularly. To mention with sound there was also an almost constant excessively loud screeching noise as we moved along at a slugs pace that I feel each passenger will hear in their nightmares of this ride for years to come.   This experience wound up being more stressful due to the previously mentioned circumstances causing our trip to be unenjoyable. Due to the dishonest representation of a truly climate controlled car, and times for departure misrepresented. Unfortunately this is not an outing that we would attended again or recommend to others visiting the Austin/Hill Country area. This is not something we would recommend for anyone trying to relax or enjoy a vacation.

name: Radio Coffee and Beer
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Julianna M.
reviews.description: This is one of the first places I stopped to get coffee at in Austin. The inside is so adorable. The coffee is strong and delicious. I was so shocked that you were able to bring dogs inside, there were dogs everywhere.   There are food trucks outside with the most amazing breakfast tacos - my friend had the pro tip, that you can order your tacos from the food truck online so when you get there, they are already ready for you!  When I think of Austin, I think of this place.

reviews.author: Jennifer T.
reviews.description: I absolutely adore this place and try to visit when I am in town. The whole establishment just screams Austin.   I love that it is in its own section with food trucks outside in case you are hungry. I was lucky enough to have came about an hour before sunset so I was able to enjoy the Austin heat, Sunset, and then nightlife of Radio Coffee and Beer. And just as you would imagine, you can get coffee and Beer. I know that sounds like a stomach ache but I was absolutely fatigued and got a thai tea upon arriving. We didnt plan to stay long and I needed a caffein boost. As I finished my drink, a band was getting ready to set up and the sun was setting and at that point I had all the energy I needed to get a cocktail.   Their beverages and atmosphere is great for an after work happy hour.

reviews.author: Darla A.
reviews.description: I love to meet up with friends here for breakfast and a coffee. They are packed on weekends, but don't let the tiny front parking lot fool you. They have a back parking lot with the entrance located just north of Radio Coffee, past the small house.    Once inside of their large indoor coffee bar, their baristas will whip up anything within their power, using their house RCB Roasters coffee. From experience, they make a mean macchiato and iced espresso.   Radio Coffee is not just for coffeetotalers, they also serve libations. For weekend mornings - that means mimosas! They will mix up one of their signature Cocktails, with local spirits like a Sotol Silver 'Rita featuring Desert Door and a Paris, TX mixed up with Still Austin Gin. More into wine? They have a small selection of respectable wines that will satisfy an array of palates (2 reds, 2 whites, 1 rose, 1 sparkling-Stella di Notte Prosecco, and 1 Sake). If beer or cider is your jam, you will be pleased with the 14 they have on tap, including appearances from 512, St. Elmo, and Austin Beerworks.   If sitting indoors is not your style, grab your beverage of choice and an outdoor table in their massive kid- and dog-friendly outdoor courtyard with plenty of options for sun or shade and large or small tables.   Hungry? They have three food trucks surrounding their outdoor courtyard including Vera Cruz All Natural and Briscuits. Vera Cruz is always busy. Pro-tip, get there before 9 AM on a weekend, and order your food first to avoid a hangry long wait.   Radio Coffee is that perfect slice of Austin showcasing the best of Austin's relaxed quirkiness, coolness, and eclectic local vibe. So grab an outdoor table and relax while enjoying the Austin ambiance only Radio Coffee can provide.

reviews.author: Robert H.
reviews.description: First and foremost, don't let the parking situation scare you. There's two other lots around the property--don't ask me how to get to them--and on Sunday you can park in front of Tire Man (cool guys, btw).   As soon as you walk onto the premises you realize it's about twice as big as it looks from the street. The coffee aspect was simple but efficient and the food truck selection was perfect for a Sunday morning, biscuits and tacos, what else do you want!  The people watching was great and the everyone I ran into was nice and friendly.

reviews.author: T. D.
reviews.description: Fine coffee, but way, wayyy crowded on Saturday morning. Parking was limited, even in the back lots.   Parking is free if you can find a space, though there wasn't much room by 10AM.   Cashier refused to heat up the almond-buckwheat cake and mushroom-chevre tart I ordered. Understandable since there was a big line, but she didn't even give me a plate. The tart and the cake both turned out to be really tasty even unheated.  Probably a better bar than a coffee shop

reviews.author: Kaeleigh S.
reviews.description: I've been going here ever since I moved back to Austin  5-6 years ago. I've been through it's ups and downs but am glad to leave a new/updated review of 5-stars.   Yes, this place gets busy, especially on weekends. The parking, the wait times, the lines--you should expect it. But I don't see it as a lack of service, it's just because this place is so good! They have tons of space and staff, it's just always full of customers. So prepare yourself for that ahead of time to have a better experience.   Anyway, I love this place. There is tons of outdoor seating with gorgeous trees for shade, a tented area, a covered area, and inside seating as well. There are three different food trucks to choose from, Veracruz being the biggest and most popular. The coffee bar itself is great with lots of drink options, both coffee and alcoholic. They also have some baked goodies!   I've had spotty customer service in the past, but it seems to be a thing of the past! Everyone working the register and bar were super friendly and helpful. Like so kind and made a killer mimosa and dirty chai. So glad to report that!   They got gf/df options, the ambience is great, and the service is sweet--what more can you want for your saturday morning?!

reviews.author: Sam T.
reviews.description: Went here for breakfast and coffee. Really awesome vibes! There was a lot of outdoor seating and they provide water bowls for dogs, so super pet friendly. There were two food trucks open at the time - Briscuit and Veracruz All Natural, but we got Briscuit. As for drinks, my partner got their kombucha on tap and I got a cold brew. Here are our thoughts:  Briscuit - brisket sandwich -- my partner really enjoyed this flavor combination of a buttery biscuit that sandwiches brisket and peach jam. He said it wasn't too greasy and was refreshingly unique take.  Briscuit - tomato, egg and cheese biscuit sandwich  -- I thought the sandwich was very good, but what makes it is the great soft egg scramble and the smoked strawberry jam I ordered on the side. Great option for vegetarians!  Kombucha on tap - my partner says it was refreshing and not as sour as other kombuchas he has had, and recommends it!  Cold brew, black - I thought it wasn't anything special. Definitely had better cold brews in the past that tasted good and had stronger caffeine effects. It tasted kinda watered down.  Ambiance - looks like a great place to just hangout, study and work. Again, love the vibes!

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: TLDR: some really awesome vibes and a great tap wall.  Came here with some friends for the weekly trivia night. The back patio area was really nice. we got to enjoy it both before and after the event. it's really well spaced and has good lighting for an outdoor area. I didn't get to try any of the coffee, So I can't testify to that. however, they do have a great tap wall, mostly local, with a lot of variety. I also got to try a couple of the cocktails, and they did a pretty solid job with them.   all in all, a great place for a low key couple of drinks. 4.25/5.

reviews.author: Julia C.
reviews.description: A friend mentioned bluegrass night at this place, so we came to check it out. Purchased tic through Eventbrite, pre-ordered some tacos from the Veracruz taco truck (bummed the Cajun and Thai trucks weren't open that evening), and got drinks from the bar.   We checked in, told to find a socially-distanced-table with the number of chairs we needed, then sat back and enjoyed. The music and ambiance were fantastic. Will be back!  Parking was a little crazy, but I think some of the shops next door allow you to park in their lots after hours.

reviews.author: Keay A.
reviews.description: This was my second time at Radio Coffee and it was even better than the last time! The owners have truly built something special; I love their outside area with the seemingly unlimited amount of seating, fairy lights strung above and just the overall vibe that I get here. The staff are super cool which is always the first thing I take note of, I appreciate when someone has great people skills.   Parking isn't too bad, they have space out front, as well as behind the building. However, on really busy nights, prepare to find street parking.   The drinks? 10/10. I'm really picky when it comes to mixed drinks and the bartenders and Radio Coffee definitely understood the assignment; every drink I've had here tasted amazing and was 100% on point.  It was in the high 90's when we went but luckily there are tons of fans spraying mist everywhere, it was AMAZING.   Honey Made played for a couple of hours on the stage outside and it really tied the experience together nicely for me. Radio Coffee is definitely somewhere I'm excited to visit again.

reviews.author: Jane R.
reviews.description: Very cool venue! If you're looking for a place to chill outdoors in a big group or small, this is the place for you! They also have the indoor option, but limited space and only small group tables.  I tried their coffee and it was good! I didn't try anything at the bar, but it was very busy on a Friday afternoon, lots of people in line for both bar and coffee.  I was a little disappointed that only Veracruz taco truck was open, but I presume that's not radio coffee's decision. I was looking forward to a variety of options from the other 2 food trucks.  I think overall radio coffee and beer is a good vibe for any occasion, such as social, business, study. The parking is limited so just pray that a spot opens up when you arrive!

reviews.author: Jorge U.
reviews.description: By far and wide the WORST Old Fashioned I've ever had. It was the worst diluted wells Whiskey combined with the most basic B**** stirring ever. Save your money. And the food trailers are mediocre.   They are ok. They are centric, but their drinks are made by people who've never served people who aren't trying to impress their dates.   You can do much better.

reviews.author: Claire H.
reviews.description: Sometimes these coffee-shop-by-day, bar-by-night spots can feel off-kilter or forced. The dim-lit bar vibes throwing off a morning coffee buzz or the smell of espresso disorienting for night-time drinkers. Radio sway between both outfits seamlessly. What works for daytime, works for drinking time.  The espresso coffees are great and I love that they do soy milk - a rarity these days.   There's also a few different areas you can get work done or get some downtime. An outside beer garden for sunny days or a cozy indoors spot that's perfect for coffee dates or remote work.  It would be remiss of me not to mention the very good taco truck, Veracruz parked outside. Another operation that can satisfy morning, noon and night.

reviews.author: Garrett O.
reviews.description: Visited Radio Coffee and Beer for the first time while on a short break, awaiting a family member pick-up from nearby St. David's. I only grabbed an Iced  Americano (~$3), but I was very impressed with the extensive menu of beverage options!
