Take for example the "Chopped Cheese" sandwich served at Frazier's. A New York staple famed for its low cost at local bodega's. Finding one as authentic as the one served here (at least in Texas), is as far as I know impossible. They also continue to respect the heritage of the sandwich's low cost and sell it for only 5 dollars.   The staff at Frazier's is the most amazing and friendly group of folks you could ask for. Service is fast, friendly and delivers that everyone knows your name local bar feel that so many places strive for and never achieve.   Frazier's deserves nothing less than a perfect score, I cringe when I read reviewer Concerned C.'s review that refers to Frazier's as "Hipster". I cant help but imagine that for him to make such a misnomer he must not be hip enough to even identify what "Hipster" is. His statement that the TV's are never on only continues to reveal his ignorance (see attached photo of TV's on showing the game) shame on you Concerned C.  So I give Frazier's Five glowing stars, I'd give them six if it were an option and I look forward to spending many days eating chopped cheese and drinking from giant frosty mugs. Kudo's Frazier's Long and Low may you live long and prosper.

reviews.author: Shane C.
reviews.description: There are many restaurant/bars in Austin, but Frazier's is the best.   I wouldn't go anywhere else.   Just go home afterwards and sleep.

reviews.author: Conner S.
reviews.description: These guys are huffy and butt hurt cause I left a bad review so they refused to serve me. Suck it up and get better, also maybe stop cutting off your shirt sleeves to washed up metal bands. You look like a sad sack :/

reviews.author: Cale R.
reviews.description: Fantastic joint! Great old school dive bar feel, but more importantly, the food, drinks and service are outstanding! Seriously, seriously, best 3$ burger you've ever had.

reviews.author: Ishmael M.
reviews.description: This place was awesome! Tommy is a cool cat! The bartender in the afternoon was so great! The bluest eyes I've ever seen. Can't remember her name. I was visiting and they treated me great!

reviews.author: Matt S.
reviews.description: What a fun out of the way cool hipster bar. Drinks and food are on point the menu is very inexpensive! I had Vinnys chopped cheese which was delicious and it was only five bucks. I also had their frozen margarita which is a nod to the locations past being a Mexican restaurant it was delicious. Watched the after work crowd slowly trickle in to enjoy ice cold beer and a game of pool. This place is a great chill during happy hour or grab a quick bite to eat.

reviews.author: Blake B.
reviews.description: Place is awesome. All the food is amazing, I love a drink chopped cheese or patty melt. The decor is awesomely curated and the jukebox is one of the best in towns. It's a great place to cozy up with a cheap beer and smash out some food with a pal while still being an awesome place to sip a cocktail with a date. Definitely one of my favorite bars in Austin and I can't wait until they're able to safely reopen

reviews.author: Malisa H.
reviews.description: The chicken sandwich has so much flavor from the fresh herb slaw, but is the single most painful thing I've ever eaten. If you love painfully spicy sauces then this is up your alley. I made it halfway through before I started crying. I mean, I'm still gonna finish it but I may need another beer and a hug after. Also, order the pickle spears.

reviews.author: Mac E.
reviews.description: My friend and I stopped by for a couple drinks and did not have a good experience with the bartender. It was a female working the 3pm shift on 1/22/20. My friend and I both ordered the same two drinks, vodka sodas yet we were charged differently (my friend being charged more). Was also told not to use the bar napkins to dry my hands after using the restroom, yet there were no paper towels in the restroom. After informing her my friend and I would be paying separately she responded with, "yeah I figured." Overall a bad first experience, will not return.

name: Cannon + Belle
accommodations: Good for Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Valet Parking, Garage Parking, Street Parking

reviews.author: Candice K.
reviews.description: This place has super nice staff and we're open on Christmas.  I think the food was really great! I'm stingy with 5 stars so 4 they get but that's high in my book! Great turkey club and cheeseburger.

reviews.author: Yoko C.
reviews.description: We really appreciate that this place was available in the last minute when everywhere else open for Christmas Eve was fully booked. We ordered assorted cheese, chicken wings, Caesar salad, hummus, margarita pizza, goat cheese pizza. We also ordered some liquor including Cuban, Prosecco, Pinot noir, etc. All their food items we ordered were shareable, great for a group of five. The food quality is not the top tier, but the place is great for just getting together and enjoying each others company (3 star).

reviews.author: Shelby S.
reviews.description: Ate dinner here last night while staying at the Hilton on vacation. We had to sit outside of the restaurant because they were so busy (and it was a Monday night)- definitely recommend making a reservation. The waitress was so friendly! We started with the chips and dip, which were great. My husband and I split the roasted chicken and steak. Everything was so tasty. The kitchen was totally happy to modify their pepperoni pizza to be half cheese for the kids we had with us. Really great! They have a great cocktail menu as well. Just a note, the menu listed on their website right now doesn't match what they are serving.

reviews.author: G T.
reviews.description: Staff was looking tired and their face showed it. Food was good. Ordered the burger and a club sandwich. As soon as I checked in yelp offers free appetizer. Asked waitress and she came back manager said that expired.  Service was very slow i believe they are understaffed. Had breakfast next morning. Everything was good staff still looked tired and unhappy.

reviews.author: Steffy N.
reviews.description: I came here for my sister's graduation. We had reservations made ahead of time which made it a lot easier. The staff is so friendly and attentive. We had a large table dedicated for our party. We had the option of doing a buffet brunch or just ordering meals from the menu. It's a lot of food, and so tasteful. I think 1 person of our party of 7-8 people totally was able to finish all their food haha. We definitely took our leftovers to-go.  This restaurant is located inside the Hilton hotel. Super nice!!

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: 5 stars for an excellent staff! Genuinely friendly and focused on great service.  We went here not once but twice while we stayed at the Hilton in Austin.  For dinner, I highly recommend their handmade pizza (we tried pepperoni) and their salmon entree. Scrumptious!  We tried a few of their desserts and I'd rate them in the following order - chocolate cake (decadent!!!) , bourbon bread pudding (served with ice cream!) and their cheese cake (served with fresh peach slices).  Great ambiance and a lovely bar as well. I didn't try any alcoholic beverages but they make a mean virgin mojito!

reviews.author: Angel G.
reviews.description: My husband and I decided to have dinner here since we stayed at the Hilton, the decor was very cute, drinks were good and that's about it. We ordered the pepperoni pizza and brisket mac andcheese it was blah. Service was okay.. the bar got crowded around 6:30/7pm and it seemed to go downhill from then, we finished our drinks and it took about 20mins for our other drinks to come.. the bar took up more priority over the customers at the tables. Over all it was decent. If you're staying at the hotel and don't feel like driving, its convenient, better than fast food.

reviews.author: Diane O.
reviews.description: While it doesn't state it in the description, this is the hotel bar at the Hilton. We arrived at around 5:30 pm. It's loud and crowded during happy hours, but then tapers off. The menu is limited. I enjoyed the grilled salmon with veggies and my husband had an excellent club sandwich.

reviews.author: Debbie M.
reviews.description: Reservation for 3 and they tried to but us at a 2 top, then a table for 10.Slow service, told 1 waiter in full restaurant. Didn't clear table until asked, after empty plates sat for 20 minutes while we waited to order dessert.  Food just ok

reviews.author: Carlos H.
reviews.description: Hands down the best old fashioned I've ever had. Had it as a nightcap two nights in a row and they were both as good. Our bartender Jonathan is a craftsman. I highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Linh Q.
reviews.description: I absolutely loved the food here ! of course the restaurant is inside the Hilton hotel , and just FYI you'll have to pay for parking every day that you're here , which is about twenty five to forty dollars . when we got to the restaurant I believe it opens at five o'clock to ten o'clock or eleven , and everybody was really nice . because of Covid you must have your mask when you arrive , however when you sit down you can take your mask off . we got to sit actually anywhere around the vicinity of the restaurant , so we sat further away from The inside seating and sat a little bit across from the restaurant. The waitress was really attentive, she informed us of different things on the menu, please see my pictures of the menu. I really enjoyed the tomato soup, this is not your regular Campbell's tomato soup, it was so creamy I love the croutons that was added, it was definitely very savory and sweet. I also enjoyed the apple cider wings, they were cooked to perfection, the meat was falling off the bone. I also enjoyed that they had hot tea and gave you a little bit of honey with it, and the honey is like a new jar That you can take home. Overall I would deathly come back here to try some more food, they also do to go and they will deliver to your room if you stay in the hotel.

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: In town for a conference and staying at the Hilton...needed a place to do my fantasy draft and Cannon and Belle was perfect. Secured a corner spot on the bar, grabbed a margarita and hung out for 2 hours.  I got the brisket Mac and cheese and the cornbread to go and both were awesome! The pizzas looked good too.  They have a bourbon bar which seemed to be pretty popular as well!

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: I've hit this place a few times en route to events at the hotel.  The pizzas are very good.  The meatball pizza has fantastic, seasoned, tangy meat.  The crab cakes are very good, tasty but lacked a little zing in the sauce.    But, perhaps most importantly, the drinks are outstanding lol.  On my last venture there, I was suffering from a stuffy head and relied on the bourbon bar magicians to doctor me up.  The drink was citrusy, rich and healing.  Thanks Doc!  See you next time!

reviews.author: Roxy S.
reviews.description: This restaurant never disappoints! The selection and flavor is amazing! Their shrimp is phenomenal and tasty! I love the customer service and how timely they are. Easily one of my favorite restaurants!

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: This place was a life saver!  My family and I were displaced due to snow storm knocking out our homes power, we were forced downtown for an overnight stay.  This seemed to be the only location open to get a meal, and although they were under staffed and overwhelmed by patrons they  handled the rush like champs and still provided a quality meal!! I had the CandB Burger and wasn't disappointed, flavorful, juicy and cooked to perfection.  I'll be back under a less stressful situation to text other items on the menu.

reviews.author: Shani S.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a quick breakfast before our tour that depArted right next door at the Austin Visitor Center.   Located in the Hilton lobby.  They have a full breakfast buffet at $22 per person. We didn't have a lot of time so we chose to order off the menu.  Good selection and good prices.  Mostly business attire as it was people staying at the hotel. But you can come as casual as you wanted. It literally is in the lobby of the hotel.  One block from visitor center.   Super fast service so go even if you are in a hurry!!  I got Just a side of pancakes for under five dollars, it was the perfect size and the butter is mixed in with cinnamon. Yum oh

reviews.author: Mira P.
reviews.description: Ugh. Below mediocre food. We ordered what seemed to sound amazing sun choke artichoke hummus.  Lacked flavor ... but the pita bread was yummy and doughy.  The charcuterie board had boring cheeses and fatty salamis. We ordered the short rib pizza, too sweet and not enough meat.   They had decent wine but you also pay for the markup and they didn't have decent wine glasses.   The bartender was dry and seemed like he didn't want to be there.  I would definitely recommend venturing out of the hotel for food and wine.

reviews.author: Mike Z.
reviews.description: Breakfast Review: ate here on a Thursday morning before leaving for the airport.  It's located in the lobby of the Austin Hilton.  Just a few other people there do not busy at all. They offer a buffet or a menu.  I had the omelette and you can choose up to three items to have in it. Comes with a large side of potatoes and choice of toast.  It's an open kitchen so you can see and smell everything being made. The bacon had a real nice deep Smokey flavor to it .

reviews.author: Ken P.
reviews.description: I've been to many Hilton's all around and the food is hit or miss, however you have got to eat here.    I started with the most scrumptious crab cakes that had many pieces of lump crab.    Follow that by pan roasted chicken on top of risotto and roasted carrots. You have a wonderful meal!!  I will say that the chicken was a bit gamie for me but it paired well with the corn, cheese risotto and roasted carrots.   I would definitely come back and try another entree on the menu.

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: On a day to pick up our SXSW badges at the Austin Convention Center food was on our mind since it was lunchtime. Since we were located next to the Hilton Austin I remembered reading Cannon + Belle was very good.  So we walked inside and had no problem getting a table.  It was near 11:00 AM and our waitress notified us breakfast was ending and gave us two menus. I did not feel like eating eggs so I ordered a Grilled Chicken Sandwich and my wife got the Brisket Pizza from the breakfast menu.  The place is nice and uses gold ware.  It's bit of fanciness to match elegant drink ware.  I reminded me of my grandmother's with her luxury dinnerware.   Soon our food arrived and my chicken sandwich came with creole potato chips. It was a bit spicy, but my sandwich was very good and the chicken was fresh, soft and juicy.  I enjoyed the sandwich very much.  I looked over to my wife's huge pizza where it was covered with diced bbq and scrambled eggs in the center. I tried it of course and the bbq had a smoked taste, and the eggs were farm fresh.  I pretty much ate her eggs and some of the pizza crust which was very crunchy.  Our server was excellent and kept our drinks full.  This place definitely meet and exceeded my expectations.

reviews.author: Jamie H.
reviews.description: Native Experience did a great job planning and executing our two day, custom tour. Michael is incredibly knowledgeable about Austin and the surrounding area. He has a lot of options that will work for any occasion. For our group we had a certain set of things we wanted to accomplish and Michael put together a custom experience for us that 100% delivered.   Michael is fun, knowledgeable and professional. He was prepared with anything we could have asked for and when we asked for an audible he was able to accommodate with zero problems.   I think it's also worth mentioning that his bus is immaculate, new and comfortable. That's a big deal when you spend a couple days traipsing around TX.   Highly recommend Michael and Native Experience for your Austin adventures.

reviews.author: Joel S.
reviews.description: Went on a four-hour Austin tour with Michael and cannot recommend highly enough. Michael - a history buff - was born in Austin and is highly knowledgeable of all things about the area. If you are in town, do yourself a favor and book a tour. Looking forward to coming back and doing a brewery tour with Native Experience soon.

reviews.author: Caitlin S.
reviews.description: Such a great experience!  We were with a large group that hired Native Experience for a full day wine tour.  Michael picked us up at our airbnb in Austin and drove us out to Fredericksburg for the day.  This was such a great alternative to staying a night in Fredericksburg because we didn't need to drive.  We went to a couple of really unique spots and had a couple of hours to explore Main Street in downtown.  It was a fully custom tour based on what our group wanted to do.  Michael really made the experience - he was a super entertaining driver and had a ton of local knowledge about the area.  I would highly recommend a tour with Native Experience and would definitely do it again.

reviews.author: Diana S.
reviews.description: Booked a river trip for a friend's birthday, and I still can't get over how easy and affordable it was!  Mike was a great guide with extensive knowledge of the area. It was so nice to not have to worry about parking or driving home. Will definitely book again for any event with travel!

reviews.author: Glenn E.
reviews.description: Michael was a great tour guide -- we got to see three breweries up close, sampled many great local beers, and had a behind the scenes tour at one of the breweries.  A fun afternoon, with personal and personable service in a clean, comfortable van.

name: North Italia
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking

reviews.author: Lee R.
reviews.description: Ordered some take out from here.  The burrata dish was very flavor full, I wish it would've come with some type of bread or crostini, I ordered it in the side and it definitely elevated the flavors.   The braised short rib was delicious, the flavor of the polenta was to die for, will certainly order again.   Strozzapreti was sadly incredibly oily and bland, it is advertised with 'Parmesan cream' which if the massive amount of oil was supposed to be that, that is sadly a miss.   All in all a pretty good experience, will attend in person next time!

reviews.author: Philip B.
reviews.description: It was okay.   Had a terrible time sourcing ingredients from what I can tell.   Easily half of what our table ordered was not available.   Very long wait for food despite having multiple open tables.  Server recognized this and brought over some meatball appetizer after a while (without prompting- kudos to him!)  When food did come out the pasta was hot and the steak was cold.     Would I go back again? No.   Could it be a good restaurant with a little work - likely.

reviews.author: Krushita K.
reviews.description: This restaurant has an extremely weird policy with walk ins. You call in for walk in wait times and they would tell you 45 mins and then when you go to the restaurant they would not let you sit. While relaying this information, the maitre d' is talking as if she is doing us a favor and yelling 'IT IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE' - (oh like this is something we would not know) So we called 5 mins before going over to the place and they told us its 45mins wait and 5 mins later (when we reached the place) - they were no longer taking walk-ins.  If that wasn't enough- another maitre'd says they are no longer accepting party larger than 5.  Btw half the restaurant is empty visibly so. I would not recommend this place to anyone I know just on the basis of the attitude of maitre d' coz if you get such a service at the door - god knows what's happening inside the restaurant.

reviews.author: Hammond H.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful lunch with the family at North Italia today.  The dishes were all well prepared and the pasta was freshly made. BTW...It is fun to watch them make the pasta in their kitchen. I had the Spaghetti and Meatballs with a large mixed greens salad ( see picture). The others had chicken pesto, Squid Ink Malfadine and shrimp over pasta and shrimp scampi over pasta. It was one of the few Italian restaurants that is open for lunch on Sunday. They also have a small Sunday Brunch menu ias well. I highly recommend North Italia at both locations. The food is always fresh. The wine was pretty pricey by the bottle but, that is to be expected.

reviews.author: Dee S.
reviews.description: I ordered delivery and both pastas I ordered were great. The squid ink was slightly spicy, which I love. It was my favorite. I ordered it for my bf who is more picky, and he liked it. The spaghetti and meatballs were good. The meatballs were seasoned well.

reviews.author: Aurora C.
reviews.description: Girls night out. Sunday dinner. This place was great. We made reservations and was seated right away. They have indoor and outdoor seating. Inside is very clean and I love the decor!  I got the Sicilian margarita and spicy rigatoni vodka. Both very delicious. The bowls are filling.

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: I don't even know where to start because it was all wonderful. From the Pomegranate Mule, to the Italian meatballs, to the prosciutto pizza and followed by Tiramisu. It was all so good. Later that night I was lying in bed craving more of those dang meatballs. For me you know it's good when you want more and a day hasn't even passed. The white truffle garlic bread is also a must. So much flavor! Service was great. The only thing that's weird about this location is that there isn't really a place to sit while waiting for a table unless you want to stand outside... which is fine as long as it's not freezing outside. It's not enough to take away a star because the food and drinks were fabulous.

reviews.author: Laura C.
reviews.description: Just stopped in before heading back to San Antonio for a drink and aperitifs and are keen to try out their food options on a repeat visit. We had the classico charcuterie to nibble on and and we found it comfortably suitable for two with drinks. It was tasty and well balanced. Give it a try when in the 2nd district.

reviews.author: Shannon H.
reviews.description: A decent Italian fare.   The drinks were somewhat terrible, but the food was quite good.   The pizza and the meatballs were the best.   The minestrone soup tasted truly mediocre.   Bolognese was salty but tasty   Carpaccio could have used more dressing and taste.   The hazelnut torta was quite excellent

reviews.author: Damian P.
reviews.description: Beautiful restaurant with a friendly staff. Love coming for a light meal and day drinking! Perfect for anytime of day. Tried both the breakfast and lunch/dinner menu.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Pizza and salad delivery was on point. It's definitely an expensive order for the portions but the execution meets expectations.  The Pig was oink oink and the salad was very hail, Caesar!  I would order again when laziness prevailed over budget.

reviews.author: Megan S.
reviews.description: Have been going here for a while now and we always get the same thing. The grilled beef tenderloin, Tuscan kale salad and the Classico charcuterie board. These make the perfect meal. Everything on the charcuterie board pears so nicely with one another. The salad is crunchy and sweet, I didn't like kale before I ate this and now I'm obsessed, it's made just the right way. The tenderloin is always cooked to perfection. It pears amazing with the polenta (underneath beef in the photo) and the veggies that comes with it. I will recommend this place to everyone who comes to visit. The staff really takes the time to explain the menu and provides excellent service. I have had an enjoyable experience every time I've come here.

reviews.author: Sandra Y.
reviews.description: Ugghhhh this is one of my favorite places of all time to dine at. Some items are hit or miss but I typically order an app, pizza, and pasta to share between 3 and have enjoyed everything I've ordered after trial and error.   The Calamari is arguably the best appetizer they offer. It's cooked perfectly and sooo good with the lemon squeeze and arugula salad on top. Any pizza has always been delicious and my favorite pasta has probably been the Strozzapreti although it is super heavy and filling. I think the location at the Domain offers larger portions at the same price point so I would recommend that one over the Downtown location tbh.   Also, they do free birthday desserts! My friend ordered the butter cake and it was divine. We love their sangria as well and a pitcher is great for a table of 3 to share.

reviews.author: Theresa G.
reviews.description: Reservations at 5:15 got there a few minutes early, seated at 5:30. It is now 6pm and we are still waiting on the appetizers......the Domain location is run a lot  smoother. It seems that they may be under staffed however people seated after us were getting their food. Really bummed out about this location. Not coming back. UPDATE: it is now 6:20 pm; Apps came at 6:05 pm. Update: We got the rest of our meal at around 7:00 pm. They probably shouldnt take any reservations or as many people if they are understaffed. All in all the food was good. The waiter did apologie and was professional about it-but again it was frustrating seeing people being seated before us with no reservations and getting our food before us. They should at least give people bread to fill up on while waiting.

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: We had a great night sitting at the bar.  Service was spot on as was food (pasta and meatballs), drinks along with espresso! Lovely sitting...

reviews.author: Alex N.
reviews.description: This is one of my favorite Italian places, and YES, I know it's a chain! I used to live in LA, where it was highly recommended, and my experience there did not disappoint. Neither did it here in Austin either. All their food is local, so the menu items at each location are different. I learned that when I found that my favorite dish from LA wasn't on the Austin menu! It wasn't a problem though, because the other dishes I had here were just as good, if not better. This is one of those rare places where you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Throw a dart anywhere, and you'll be happy. We ordered the Glazed Short Rib Cavatelli, Garlic Bread, and Margherita Pizza, and all three were out of this world. If you're craving Italian, this is your place. 100%.

reviews.author: Dan M.
reviews.description: What's with these Chicken Parm People? I always ask if they have good Chicken Parm, and they always say, "Yes! It's so good!"   They're always wrong. The only place it's safe to order Chicken Parm is a place where you don't need to ask if it's good.   So ... don't order the Chicken Parm.

reviews.author: Luna J.
reviews.description: I called to make a reservation and they didn't have anything available for the time that I need it. So we risked and went there. The place was almost empty. Weird that we couldn't get a reservation but happy that they take walk in... Good to know!  Very nice place. We really enjoyed our appetizers. Pastas and entree were good. Our service was very professional and patience. Great wine suggestions.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: From the service to the food--this place could use some serious improvements.  This was my first trip ever to Austin and I'd heard from almost everyone I know that Austin is known for the friendly people there, but this restaurant seems to be an exception to that.  We sat down here on a Friday afternoon and there were a few people at the bar but it was pretty empty overall. We seated ourselves at one of the many empty booths and proceeded to wait about 15-20 for someone to come take our drink order.  We saw a number of employees walking around talking to people at the bar, delivering food, but for whatever reason nobody came to us for some time after we sat down. That should have been the red flag that made us get up and leave but it didn't. We stayed and will likely never return for another meal.  I ordered the spaghetti that didn't come with spaghetti noodles which is fine typically but everything from the sauce to the meatballs was very bland and just not at all what I expected.   My partner ordered the meatball sub with fries and the fries are really the only thing saving this review from one star. I love a good French fry and theirs were perfect. They offer homemade ketchup which had a little kick to it and it wasn't bad. However, the meatball sub was just as underwhelming and bland as the spaghetti.  Our friends ordered cesar salad and pizza and some other sandwich (I can't remember which one, sorry). The salad had very dry chicken but everything else in it was fine. The pizza had prosciutto and arugula and figs on it and it was way too sweet for my taste buds and nobody else in the party seemed to really enjoy it either.  Food is pretty standard price--typical for a meal in the California where I live and I guess downtown Austin as well. $18 for the plate of spaghetti I got and it was not worth it at all.  If you want to spend $20 on one plate of food, go somewhere else.

reviews.author: Ryan G.
reviews.description: The price taste ratio for these pizzas for downtown is great. If you're here to play. The Burrata App is a must and you won't regret.   Seasonal Veg Salad is filling especially if you had a protein, that and a shared app and you will definitely be satisfied.  Margherita Pizza can definitely be shared and is a great bang for your buck.   Great lunch or early dinner spot, make sure to get a table outside!

reviews.author: Veggie L.
reviews.description: I live about an hour away from Coffee Shark but every single time I'm in North Austin I'm giddy because I get to go to Coffee Shark. My family has food allergies (celiac disease) and everyone is so kind and informative. The coffee is so smooth and absolutely divine. I actually bought a shirt awhile back because coffee from coffee Shark brings me so much stinking joy! I don't feel this way about any other local coffee shop! So grateful you are a part of Austin and I wish this business ongoing abundant success!!!

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: Pretty nice for a hidden coffee shop in a large commercial complex. Would not notice it from the road or walking past unless you know what you're looking for, as it blends in with the rest of the modern building architecture. Not the warmest building from the exterior, but they've done a good job trying to make it welcoming indoors. A variety of seating with one high top table. Most of the seating is 6+ capacity tables, so if you don't like sharing, this is not the place for you to study/sit alone. There is bench window seating, but with two walls of windows I imagine those seats might get warm in the summer. Some outdoor seating as well, for those who prefer that.  I got the grilled cheese and apple sandwich. The flavor combination was well done, but I was a little disappointed by the ratio of filling to bread and felt the sandwich could have been fluffed out a little more in terms of filling. The chips were neither amazing nor terrible; pretty standard fare.   I also got two different hot chocolates. One regular with almond milk, one Mexican hot chocolate with oat milk. Of the two, I'd recommend the first one. Good flavor and nice quantity of whipped cream if you ask for it in a mug. The default seems to be to-go cups, so make sure you're clear if you want to sit and stay a while when ordering. My friend got the Mexican hot chocolate with regular milk and the spices smelled fantastic, but with oat milk they got overwhelmed and it was mostly an oaty flavor.   Welcoming and friendly staff. Would definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Elizabeth M.
reviews.description: I ran into Coffee Shark for a quick pick me up during my lunch break and was pleasantly surprised. First of all, the place is huge. I don't think anyone would ever have trouble finding a seat and it seems like a nice quiet place to work for an afternoon. I appreciated the fact that they had a lot of flavor options. I decided to get a Vanilla Rose Iced Oat Milk Latte and it was so good. The flavor was subtle and it was perfectly brewed. The only reason I knock it down to 4 stars is because it's definitely on the pricier side. I would expect to pay minimum $7 for a latte when you go in. While it may not be an everyday stop, I would still go back for sure.   COVID Precautions: Masks required for employees and customers.

reviews.author: Ace L.
reviews.description: Clean and quiet local coffee stop with a great menu. Coffee's really great but a wait over ten mins for two cups ain't it!

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: Great little spot with a big menu full of coffee and treats - lots of outdoor seating. Covid precautions are the best I've seen in and around Austin! Check them out!

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: Probably one of my worst coffee shops in Austin I've been to. It seemed so promising, but my friends and I ordered three different drinks, and each one was incredibly medicore. The chai latte was almost bland, vanilla latte tasted worse than an instant version I could buy at a grocery store, and even the normal latte lacked flavor.

reviews.author: Ivan C.
reviews.description: If you're not Indian or white you'll get bad service. Also they shut off reviews on google so there's that. There's better coffee out there.

reviews.author: Kim K.
reviews.description: I miss pre COVID times because Coffee Shark was a great place to study and have some coffee and a light bite.   Coffee is good, food is even better. Most recently I ordered online - wanted a scone but got a muffin, but no bother, muffin was still good.

reviews.author: Sara O.
reviews.description: We've come here several times now so we must like it.   I have ordered a breakfast sandwich that's good. There's a pretty well endowed breakfast menu, not huge full breakfasts, like pancakes, but for a coffee shop there's a lot of offerings.  Our coffees are consistent.  It's definitely not my favorite, but it's always good. Consistency is hard, which is why I don't have a favorite coffee shop.   The outdoor area is great bc we always have my kids in tow and sometimes there's another kiddo out there for them to mingle with.   The details: It's an older, white, crowd. The industrial decor is neat, but the chairs are really loud when you move them.  There's plenty of parking. Staff is friendly.   It's always relatively quiet. *the reason i noticed the loud chairs *

reviews.author: Shashikala P.
reviews.description: We went late morning, it wasn't  crowded but for weekday and late morning, there were more people than I expected. We went to this place to try the steampunk coffee as other fellow yelpers have mentioned but I dint see option of steampunk coffee on their menu. There was only oNe person behind the counter for taking order and  making.  We ordered  blueberry scone, cranberry muffin, cappuccino  and house coffee. Muffin was huge, both muffin and scone wasn't  fresh at all, tasted like, when you leave them for couple of day on  top of the counter and take a bite. cappuccino  and coffee was good, service is ok, they  have ample seating. Recommend  cappuccino and cOffee not baked goods though.

reviews.author: Judah J.
reviews.description: Coffee is good. I have nothing negative to say about that--just the absolute worst customer service I have ever encountered in a coffee shop to date. The owner, or whoever he was, was so terrified of people I wasn't even sure if I was supposed to be there. Pictures look great, I'm sure the place can be a lot of fun if it weren't for COVID-paranoia. Seriously, I went all over Austin that day and NO ONE was halfway as petrified as this guy.  My brother tried to take a sip of his coffee but was soundly rebuked for exposing his nose and mouth for 10 seconds. I understand we need to be careful, and we were, but if you go to a coffee shop you should at least be permitted to make sure the thing is edible before you leave!! BTW, we wore a mask and were very careful the entire time being there.  Won't be back. There are many other decent coffee stops in Austin.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: Quaint little place, convenient if you live or work nearby. Good food, excellent desserts, and consistent coffee brewing skills exist here.  4 stars because while everything is good overall, the nitro cold brew coffee on the other-hand well to honest...sucks! Its just weak cold brewed coffee, it doesn't pack a punch of caffeine like other cafes that offer it on their menu. If you're gonna do something, do it right or do it better!  But great little place. Indoor and outdoor seating. Good lighting inside and fairly quiet environment if you're working out of the office.   The staff is friendly but not super helpful.

reviews.author: Juliana H.
reviews.description: Such a cute little location. Iced mocha coffee was amazing and the baked goods are great too. Patio is large too and you get a view of the mountains.

reviews.author: Lil P.
reviews.description: This place is amazing and the customer service is stellar except when the new tall thin guy with the backwards cap is working. He overcharges and fails to deliver. Literally....Doesn't make your drink. I've had this happen twice now. Not sure if he's a new manager but each time I walk in and see him, I want to walk out. Today was no different. Even the young kids working there have better customer service than he does. I'm a little peeved he's really screwed with the friendly vibe the others have mastered.

reviews.author: Steph R.
reviews.description: Nice spot close by that had really flavorful drinks. We got a flat white and chai latte. I love coffee but I'd honestly would get the chai next time - it was absolutely delightful. We also sampled our fair share of pastries including a blueberry muffin, pumpkin bread, and croissant. The muffin and bread were really moist and delicious, but the croissant was very bready and not a flaky, buttery croissant I was looking forward to. I think they get their pastries from a local bakery so that was cool and I would definitely try out their other pastries. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Steve R.
reviews.description: Have been going here since moving to the area last spring. Service is always great and friendly, and enjoy the selection of pastries. Appreciate the COVID-19 mitigation measures in place--super prudent and considerate. It has become my go-to weekend stop for a takeout coffee and pastry.  Hoping to one day perform there (acoustic guitar and sing).

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: I've only been here once but absolutely loved it when I went in. Great beer selection, that's all we went there for, but their menu looks amazing for coffee and small plates. Very relaxing environment saw lots of people there working or just catching up with friends. The staff was incredibly sweet as well. They have a fun little outdoor area with games to play, and a few games inside too. If you're looking for a relaxing getaway with both amazing beer and coffee choices this is the place to go!

reviews.author: Bonnie T.
reviews.description: Occasionally I work nearby and I have always found Coffee Shark convenient any time of day. In the morning I can grab coffee, pastry or even a breakfast taco. For lunch they have a great selection of sandwiches, soups, salads and pizza. They even have bar service as well.  It's always clean and the service is nice. It's a great place to have in the plaza.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: This place is interesting...it is going for a the laid back coffee house vibe and beer bar in a kind of odd at first glance location, but I dig it.  They have a patio w/seating and cornhole outside and inside seating ranging from tables, to hi-tops, to bar top, to couches.  They have local beer offerings as well as wine in draught and the par for the course coffee choices as well as some food and pastry options.  They had a surprisingly reasonably priced pastrami sandwich which came accompanied w/chips and a pickle for $8, and though tasty enough, there was way more spicy brown mustard than meat on the sammie, making it a bit rough to get through initially. After removing most of the invasive spread from the second half of the sammie, it was much more palatable.  The doppio I got was actually a revelation! It was perfectly strong w/just the right amount of robust flavor and astringency and even came a small side of palate-cleansing mineral water. Needless to say, this was my fav part of my visit!  I did like that they also offered board games and books to entertain yourself while there.  It is counter service, but the barista waa exceptionally nice and helpful in navigating me through there menu.   If ever in the area again, I will def pop in for a doppio and a little pastry nibble.

reviews.author: Erin S.
reviews.description: Lots of space to study, free WiFi, and outdoors games (corn hole, etc). Good coffee and about 10 flavors. $4 for bottomless coffee!

name: The Park on South Lamar
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Allyson L.
reviews.description: Overall, a good place for a large group to grab drinks. I went to happy hour here with 8 of my coworkers and the outdoor seating was really spacious and well distanced from other tables.   Highlights: Their frozen margaritas (pretty strong especially for my low alcohol tolerance lol), the free tequila sampler my group received (:, the service, and the fact that they are really flexible with splitting checks for large groups!  Needs to be improved: The food was way too greasy and there weren't any plant based options for my vegan coworker. It would be nice if they had a smaller selection of dishes that were better quality and with half the oil added.

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: I was surprised about this place. The food is quite delicious. Whether you go for chicken fried chicken, a burger, or the mac and cheese, The Park delivers. Their menu is quite broad, with many good options.   Good selection of beers, a very large covered patio, and good service. Recommended.

reviews.author: Rose D.
reviews.description: A great, always reliable spot! They have a ton of outdoor seating with lots of shade, and excellent deals on drinks + food. Definitely a sports bar vibe, with lots of TVs, but never gets too loud (at least when I've been there) as it's really spread out. They seem to have a nice separate outdoor space that people sometimes use for private events, which I love!  The food is good -- typical burgers, sandwiches, salad, tacos. I love that they have the option to get any time of burger/sandwich on a gluten free bun or a lettuce wrap. Their lettuce wraps are huge and keep everything together! I got the Hippie with grilled chicken and loved it -- the chicken was blackened and spicy - yum! My boyfriend got the Fat Chick (not what he ordered..whoops, but still was delicious). Fried chicken with gravy, mashed potatoes, and sautéed veggies. They have a "Hot" (adobo) and "Skinny" (grilled) version of this. Nice to see some healthy and more indulgent options.   Definitely recommend if you're looking for good food, strong drinks (and some fun cocktails), and a nice place to hang with a friend or a group!

reviews.author: Courtney K.
reviews.description: Ordered the southwest egg rolls and my order was delivered to the wrong table. The waitress handled it all really well and apologized, the manager came out to tell me it was on the house and again apologized for the delay. I think it says something about the establishment when they handle mistakes with integrity and is 100% a place  I would go back to!

reviews.author: Jeremiah G.
reviews.description: Actually really good, chill spot. At first, I was thinking I was going to be walking into an Applebee's and I don't think I was that wrong but where The Park separates from Applebee's is the fact that The Park is actually has good food. Well at least their burger was amazing.   Friendly staff. Good, really good, drink happy hour. We sat outside and while a normal outside sitting decision is dangerous in Texas heat The Park actually made the sitting experience enjoyable.   If you are confused on what to get, as I was, may I suggest The Rebel burger. A good sized, well done, burger with fried pickle chips on it. My thinking is this. I'm going to get pickles anyways, I might as well get them fried as well.

reviews.author: Kathryn A.
reviews.description: I ordered the calamari as an appetizer and they gave such a big portion that I almost felt like I didn't need an entree, lol. It was super good! I would definitely recommend. The atmosphere was very chill and the service was good as well. Definitely going to come back

reviews.author: Xavier C.
reviews.description: What kind of ship you running? Humble yourselves on a weekday ... not going back cuz they played me

reviews.author: Kristi M.
reviews.description: Let me tell you what- those sliders were amazing and the $5 frozen mojito's on the happy hour menu HIT and did not miss. It was the perfect late afternoon snack to unwind from the day. We had the sweetest waitress that gave us great customer service.   P.S. there's plenty of parking :)

reviews.author: Robin W.
reviews.description: We went there today, just because so that you could actually sit and enjoy your food instead of it being all to go!   The service was very friendly and she gave a great suggestion on the mushroom burger.  The fries were perfectly crispy and not to large of a serving that I was overly stuffed.  I love that their burgers don't come with mustard and mayo and will only add them if you request it.   The hubby had the park burger with onion rings, which he enjoyed buy nothing extravagant.      I did like that they were playing old music videos.

reviews.author: Crystal Y.
reviews.description: Really amazing waitress, great service, yummy food, huge screens for watching baseball.  Very good sports bar. Tons of outdoor seating. Stick to the burgers here, y'all. I got the veggie, which had a delicious flavor and texture, it was black bean. My bf got the grilled chicken. We both loved out burgers and they have great topping choices too. Huge drink menu. Great mac and cheese and sweet potato fries too. Waitress was the nicest person.

reviews.author: Brandon T.
reviews.description: The Park Has always been my go to spot to get a great food and great service. I love the Sunday Brunch it's amazing and the service is always good big thank you to our server who was amazing. The food was cooked fresh and also prepared well. If you ever come to Austin please stop by.

reviews.author: P C.
reviews.description: Our waiter was really good. Pleasant and prompt. That was the extent of good. The restrooms were "rough" and smelly. The food was average.  Admittedly we were not there for sports and booze.  Have driven past it for years and finally went in.  Not glad we did.

reviews.author: Bo B.
reviews.description: Came here for the Happy Hour menu. I had the Mahi mahi tacos with broccoli and sweet potato fries that were delicious. The works pizza was also very good.

reviews.author: Renae B.
reviews.description: The Gm came up to our table after their host had already sat us and our 3 kids down. She apparently felt the need to make us aware that their back patio was 21 and up only. She told us she'd let it go this time though. The problem we have is that we had no idea. It was her employee who sat us there. It was unnecessary for her to tell us, unless she was planning on moving us of course (which she didn't). It most certainly was unprofessional on her part. It sounds like they need a team meeting to address their issues with seating. We did nothing wrong but felt embarrassed and in the wrong when we had NOTHING to do with where they seated us. Also, we have sat on that same patio with kids many times prior to without consent from a manager...My husband tried to speak with her about the situation but instead of handling it professionally, she automatically banned him from the restaurant.

reviews.author: Alexis B.
reviews.description: The park is reliable and their brunch is on point. We used to frequent the one on south Lamar but now tend to go to the domain location. Personally, the one on south Lamar tends to be better, but they both have the same menu!   Their chips and queso is to do for. Reliable and we always get this.   My hubby always always always gets the angry chicken penne. It's amazing. Probably horrible for you but it's what dreams are made of. This week I got the Works flatbread which was delicious! I honestly think I have tried everything on the menu. I loveee the garlic fries and the Mac and cheese too.   On sundays they have an all you can eat brunch buffet. Covid and just buffets in general make my weary of eating communal foods but they were handling it smartly. Don't skip out on their happy hour too!

reviews.author: Mohan J.
reviews.description: Mediocre service and mediocre food!  Nothing to distinguish this place at all.  The waitress had half her butt sticking out of her shorts, and an unexplainable and unjustified air of superiority (which always sucks).  She asked us what we would like to drink as we were walking up to our table and what we needed to eat, soon after!  Being seniors we don't intuit such answers and actually have to look at the menu.  The food was equally unimpressive although the drinks were ok because beer is hard to mess us)!

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: Update: I've returned a few times and service has improved - it's a great find near home.  --------------  Stopped by today for a quick lunch with hubby. It's a Monday so I figured in and out rather quickly but boy was I wrong. We placed a simple order and my husband's food arrived within 5mins while my chicken tenders/fries took forever. Not sure what happened in the kitchen but our server, Jennifer, was sweet and super apologetic - took the item off our bill. My order arrived after my husband finished his plate - took my food to go.  Kitchen/cook staff needs to be more alert on orders - especially on a slow day. Otherwise, the frozen mojito was amazing.

reviews.author: Steve A.
reviews.description: Came for lunch on a Friday afternoon. Our waitress was attentive and had a great personality. The food was just okay. I've avoided this place in the past because I've never had a great experience with their food. Once again, food was cold. The chicken fried chicken was tough. The mash potatoes were cold and a little hard to the touch. The gravy was cold and not very very well drenched on the mashed potatoes. Slightly disappointed, but like I said we really enjoyed the company of the waitress. And the bloody Mary!

reviews.author: Hamilton L.
reviews.description: Moved from Washington DC for work and the South Lamar location is my local sports bar. Wanted to highlight that I've never had a bad meal and that the beer is always cold. I'm a huge soccer fan and Marshall has always been kind to change the channel, even on a busy Sunday.  The waiters and staff have always been friendly and enforced the Social distance rules, which has made me feel safe about returning to restaurants. Please give that team a big shout out!

reviews.author: Jonathan W.
reviews.description: Alexis is amazing !!  My phone died and she offered her phone charger as manager without me even bringing up to her.  She is very proactive and always walking around checking on all the customers.  Very impressed with her!

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: I've found Long Play to be a good reliable hangout spot if I'm looking for a non-brewery casual environment in the neighborhood. They have a wide array of drink options that should keep any group satisfied.  There's lots of sizable tables on their patio. Enough so that even though they allow smoking outside I've never had to sit close enough to a smoking table to be bothered by it.  The bartenders are all really friendly and happy to make suggestions. If you're there on a less busy night the indoor seating has a nice intimate atmosphere, but can get crowded fast on the weekends if the weather isn't great outside.   The Korean food was super unexpected the first time I visited, and while I haven't made it part of my experience most times I've come here, I can't remember myself or any friends having a bad experience with the food.  Overall I'd highly recommend giving them a try if you're looking for a casual bar in the area!

reviews.author: Misha S.
reviews.description: Y'all, I  think this place is delightful.   Extremely chill vibe, great north-central location, and a big, beautiful patio. They have old fashions on tap for $5, which I think sets them apart - as well as assorted Korean food, including dumplings.   This place reminds me of eclectic, old Austin, and I absolutely love it. I could see it being an institution in 20 years like Lala's is now.   Can't wait to go back :)

reviews.author: Beth E.
reviews.description: We found this place on google by chance and I am glad we did. Love the theme of the bar. Love the vinyl records that they were playing on the turntables . We discovered new music. We enjoyed a couple of Christmas cocktails. We enjoyed the vibe of the bar. We will be back!!

reviews.author: Nancy C.
reviews.description: Moving into the neighborhood and so happy to have this spot nearby! Awesome happy hour with $5 old fashioneds on tap. Cute patio picnic tables are frat for casual groups and our pup! Can't wait to come back to try some food.

reviews.author: Alejandro D.
reviews.description: I loved this place in my new 'hood.   Great, reasonably priced cocktails. Outdoor seating (a must during pandemic). Friendly, welcome service.  Great food (new Korean menu-- try the Korean pizzza). And walking distance to my place.  What's not to like?

reviews.author: Kip S.
reviews.description: Long Play may be the best neighborhood bar in Austin. The cocktails are outstanding, especially the Pinkerton. They serve Korean food, which is out of sight. I had the fried chicken, which was crispy, juicy and just a little bit spicy. It was served with a radish salad, I think. My friend had the bibimbap, which was also excellent.  It's kind of small inside, but the patio is pretty spacious and dog friendly. And the best part is they play full vinyl albums over the outdoor speakers. They've got great taste, and I would definitely be a regular if I lived closer.

reviews.author: Kaia K.
reviews.description: This spot has become our local neighborhood favorite. We love the proximity to our home. This place is the perfect relaxed atmosphere to enjoy a savory bite and a great drink. Great playlist, outdoor and indoor seating. Overall very friendly place.

reviews.author: Joe M.
reviews.description: Very chill vibe reminded me a lot of an NYC/Williamsburg bar. Inside is small but has an awesome decor setup. Very romantic good for a date night. Bartenders were very kind and helpful/funny as well. Had old fashions on tap which I've never seen before. Also has a big parking lot which was a nice touch

reviews.author: Zach I.
reviews.description: I loved this little bar! Great ambience with the classic music. They also have a fairly large patio outside with tables and chairs. Small on the inside; however, it's extremely cozy. Went here for happy hour and had a cocktail - strong and delicious at an excellent price. Will most definitely be back'

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: I love this place, their happy hour is great and the pecans from their pecan tree are delicious

reviews.author: Kent R.
reviews.description: First time here and truly truly enjoyed the experience. Super calm vibe. Great vinyl selection. Only had cocktails. No food. Cocktails were reasonable and crafted well. Overall very good first impression and we will be back.

reviews.author: Jed P.
reviews.description: Super smart liquor selection and quality choices on draft. Record selection is impressive as well.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: I liked the vibe of the old spot, Royal Jelly, so it was a relief to find Long Play is very much a worthy successor.  Stopped by for a margarita and a bowl of meat chili while running from point A to B on Sat eve.  The chili is indeed delicious - no beans, with a good amount of heat inherent - I'd place it as one of the best bowls I've had in all of Austin.  Good liquor selection for cocktails, and a goodly amount of picnic tables out front to soak up the sun.  They were spinning Herbie Hancock and Specials records, which hits some sweet spots for me.  Added bonus that I easily nabbed one of their adjoining parking spots.  Hoping this one sticks around - it definitely has the makings for a great neighborhood bar!

reviews.author: Javier E.
reviews.description: Drinks are interesting, food could be a LOT better! I find the record/vinilo aspect of it endearing but not practical.

reviews.author: Teresa A.
reviews.description: We went on a mixed winery and brewery tour and had a great time! Our host, Woody, was personable and entertaining, and he knew all the good places. It was very cool to see the inner workings of the brewery and we actually learned a lot about the wine-making process and different types of wines. Getting a little tipsy while being driven around in a limo just can't be beat!

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: We took the 6 pm sightseeing tour on a Saturday. This was a sunset tour in good weather. When we waited, there was free Wi-Fi from the nearby Hyatt. Great trip! We sat at the front for the best view. Quiet electric barge, no spray. Could not hear commentary; boat may need Bluetooth speakers at the front. Good views of downtown buildings! We saw two groups of egrets settling in for the night. We saw some bats flying out of the Congress Ave bridge! Not many bats because this was in November.  We missed a few bats because the boat returned to the dock to drop off some people who needed to use the bathroom :( The tour guide could have stated that the boat had no bathrooms. It is obvious to the guide but not to the first-time visitor. Tip: go to the bathroom before you board the boat.

reviews.author: Jonathan D.
reviews.description: I called Capital Cruises late afternoon a few days ago to inquire about the dinner cruises and spoke with Britney. She was very courteous and took the time to share more about the boats and pricing options, but proceeded to share with me that they weren't able to book me officially at the time because it was after hours. She shared that they only had one boat left for the date I requested but they would put a soft hold on it for me and I could call back to officially book with a credit card. No problem -- I completely understood that and was also very happy with her customer service orientation.  Today I reached out to follow up, and spoke with Tony. I shared my name and that I called a few days ago about booking a boat, and he asked what date I was looking for. I shared the same date and he said they were booked until a week out from that date. I let him know that I had spoken to Britney about this earlier in the week and she placed a soft hold for me. He was clearly annoyed with this and shared that that isn't their policy but yes, they actually did have a boat available. He then immediately asked for my card info -- didn't bother to share more, didn't bother to see if I had questions, etc. I asked him directly if this would be a problem booking (since I noticed from his tone how annoyed he was). He said no and that I could call back when I was ready to book. After that experience I do not plan on booking this cruise anymore. I was prepared to spent over $500 for this package with the boat and the meal options I was considering and will gladly spend that money elsewhere. Disappointing customer service.

reviews.author: Tracy B.
reviews.description: I've been on a few of these cruises and every time we have so much fun! Staff are courteous and let your crew just hang out and have a fun time under the lights and stars of downtown while cruising town lake. It's especially fun during bat season! Highly recommend for bdays, wedding parties or client events.

reviews.author: Karen M.
reviews.description: We used Capital Cruises for my daughter'w wedding reception 12/11/21 and cannot say enough wonderful things. The communication throughout the process was exceptional. Service, staff and food were wonderful.  Everyone enjoyed the event! We also had the caricaturist on board and she was delightful. We were looking for a different wedding experience and this fit the bill.

reviews.author: Beka H.
reviews.description: We had a great time on the sunset tour! It was beautiful and the guide (Captain Molly) was very knowledgeable and entertaining. Would strongly recommend!

reviews.author: Taylor L.
reviews.description: We did the bat tour, and it was lovely! A nice, long, educational tour of the city and the buildings from the river during sunset...ya can't beat it! Another person on the tour said she thought it'd last around a half hour, but we were on the boat for nearly 2 hours! Watching the bats was incredible. We went in early November, so we weren't sure how many bats would be left, and there were TONS! It's truly an experience I'll never forget. Thank you to the employees and captain!

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: My daughter was visiting and wanted to rent the swans  parked at the Hyatt and easily found our way out to the dock was informed  about rules and how to move the swan ride around the lake  What a fun time my daughter and I had. Was a bit hot in the sun but brought water sunblock  and snacks  such a good time can't wait to do this again ! Thank you agaIn !

reviews.author: Jane O.
reviews.description: My family took the bat cruise and it was perfect. The tour included city views with running commentary followed by the bats flying out from under the bridge for a very long time. Our questions were addressed and we saw many unusual birds and other sights. It was a real highlight for me. My only concern was that my GPS took me to the bus entrance and I was almost late trying to find my way to the parking garage and then through the hotel to the boat dock. The rest of my family got there in plenty of time but they were more familiar with the area. I got a great video of the bats so it was totally worth the hassle.

reviews.author: Claire L.
reviews.description: Swan boats $40/ 2 hours for 4-person swan.   Great service and overall awesome experience.   We visited at almost 7pm and were able to enjoy the laid-back waters without too much of sun. Loved seeing the sunset. The breeze was warm and nice.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: Such a wonderful experience for our family!  You cannot reserve their Swan boats (first come) but the day we went, the four man boat was available.   We spent about 45 minutes paddling around Ladybird lake and had a great time.   The people working at Capital Cruises wore masks and offered our children life jackets.   We will definitely return!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Not sure if this is a winter thing, but the two times I've been on a self-captained boat (it's electric) with them in the last couple months it's only been $75/hour. We've always had 6 folks, so it's a super economical outing and it's BYOB and snacks. They have a little thingie for you to plug your phone in for some tunes, too.  Very little interaction with staff beyond checking in, getting the quick lay of the land, errr, lake, and when they help you dock at the end, so super COVID safe, in that respect.

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: Great experience especially for the price. Lorrie our tour guide was knowledgeable and funny (and we had a bit of a weird situation with a passenger being disruptive which she and the other employees handled quickly and professionally). There was a neat boat tour of some major buildings before getting a good spot and seeing/learning about the bats. Will definitely go again when I have visitors in town.

reviews.author: Kristen R.
reviews.description: Don't be fooled by their website page. There dock is ran down. Besides one donut boat everything else needs to be cleaned. They don't validate park but tell you to park at the Hyatt, which was a unexpected expense. I called the day before arriving with many questions and was told several incorrect answers, according to the employees at the table. I asked about the swan boats, specifically about the 4 seaters. I was told they had plenty but they were FCFS. We arrived the only 4 seater they have was broken. I also asked about the donut boats, "they go out every hour and you have to reserve them in person". That was incorrect again. I don't recommend using this company. It was a waste of time.

reviews.author: Anita Y.
reviews.description: It's my second time visiting Austin and I found out my mom has never been on a pedal boat so I made a last minute decision to rent a swan boat. I'm glad I got there at the time I did because there was an even longer wait time for all the people who came after me. It was $18 total for us to rent a two-seater for up to an hour. Totally worth it. We saw Austin from a whole different perspective. Also, it was quite a workout - a nice one though.

reviews.author: Alexandra M.
reviews.description: Very sweet tour. Nice to see the city from the water. Captain had some good trivia about the city lovely way to spend an hour.

reviews.author: Monique H.
reviews.description: I have rented from Capital Cruises several times. Twice was for bat cruises and once for paddle boards. All of which were a great experience!   They are open right now and a friend of mine and I rented stand up paddlebords recently for an hour on the lake. We went mid morning (they opened at 10am on a Tuesday) and it was glorious. Hardly anyone was on the lake. The staff is super friendly. They have a tent outside and a touch less payment system. Prices are reasonable and their equipment is good too. They have some outside cubbies for your stuff should you choose to leave anything at the dock. The pics are from the bat cruise in October 2019. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: My wife and I never take the time to write reviews but the superior level of service we got from Capital Cruises demands we do this.  We decided to have the rehearsal dinner for our son's wedding on one of their boats and they were super responsive throughout the entire process from our original inquiry all the way through to the end.  On the day of the event, they were there for us for whatever we needed which really helped calm our nerves.  We were fortunate to have great weather and our guests were thrilled with the evening.  We had 50 people attend and they were all thrilled with the evening and the fact that we did something a bit different than the typical sit down at a restaurant.  Definitely recommend them.

reviews.author: Tom T.
reviews.description: It's a very entertaining cruise. Our Captain, Alec, guides you though the lake with interesting information and jokes. But the Bats were great to watch. Highly recommend the the Bat watch.

reviews.author: Caroline H.
reviews.description: Our tour guide Michael was informative and humorous. The tour left on time and we got a nice ride up and down the river with some Austin facts before the main event. And what a main event! What an amazing sight! Millions of bats streaming out from their roost in the Congress Street Bridge. Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Kim T.
reviews.description: Capital Cruise was a delight ! The tour guide of my tour was very knowledgeable and took his time to tell the stories about the different landmarks and Austin history along the  tour. My cruise was the Sunset Bat Cruise. I highly recommend Capital Cruises to first time Austin Vistors as well as locals. The price is right for the cruise  $10bucks! On the tour we were allowed to bring snacks and beverages.

name: The Park At The Domain
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Gregory S.
reviews.description: The Hostess was very nice and our wait person was  very nice    The review on the food  we came in for the Happy Hour Burger and my dad got the Park Original - Chicken with Fries which was a upcharge i believe 2.00 for the fries   they do not give you enough fries for having a 2.00 upcharge   I ordered the El Juanito - Burger with Fries  the Burger was a good size burger    The inside of the restaurant seems very nice  and the outside seating area was very nice we both enjoyed our meal  On a side note  all the servers were not wearing a park logo'd shirt except for a bartender if they have a Park Logo Shirt you would think all employees should be required to wear one

reviews.author: Bethany A.
reviews.description: I ordered one of the burgers. It was subpar bar food. It was super heavy and greasy.  The service was slow. The waitress was nice, but not very helpful with answering our food question s. Next time I'll go to the Irish pub or one of the other bars around the corner. I feel like I'll have better luck.

reviews.author: Christina H.
reviews.description: The Park is so god awful, I tried erasing this from my brain... unfortunately, I was reminded the other day when driving through the Domain. The Park demands to be seen, it's located on a busy street where it's not hard to miss.   I came in to meet a few friends for The Park's Sunday Funday, where they boast about a ~$20 Brunch Buffet and 5 different flavors of Mimosas. Everything tasted dry and bland in the ingredients. But, what more do you expect for such a low cost? The typical breakfast is served (eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles/pancakes) with handful of lunch entrees (fried rice) and a variety of desserts (pudding, cookies).   Would not return.

reviews.author: Zoly N.
reviews.description: Have you try out those steak at this place? It's so satisfied! Their drinks is a A+, the waitress is so friendly and attentiveness( that's i would give 5 stars for this place)

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: I've frequented The Park on many occasions, but finally did a Sunday funday brunch w the buffet and $2 mimosas. Not exactly anything to rave about but a really good variety for what you pay for and the atmosphere more than makes up for it w versatile seating options and plenty of tvs to watch sports on. Mimosa flavors are great and the buffet had plenty of options to appease everyone at the table, even the picky ones. It is obviously a go to for many as the line was wrapped around and down the sidewalk by 11am when they opened. It's usually my go to in the domain when I want to have a quick catch-up w someone.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: They did a good job accommodating our monthly happy hour group, both outside and inside. We found that our server/s kept track of our orders and drinks all evening with few hiccups.  The happy hour specials are great, so if you're curious about The Park, come check it out then.

reviews.author: Shernell H.
reviews.description: This was my second time visiting this place. The only thing I remember from the first visit was that the mimosas were good. Well, this go around, everything I had was really good.   We did the brunch buffet, which was about $16... a win. The food was really good. The French toast, the eggs with veggies, potatoes, fried chicken, and the macaroni hash *mouth waters* was all cooked with love and seasoned well. The mimosas during brunch was $2.  I had a pineapple basil or something and that was very tasty.   Our waitress was very attentive and gave good recommendations.

reviews.author: Samantha M.
reviews.description: I thought I had heard good things about this place and I will give you my Mahi mahi tacos had good flavor. Biggest complaint would be the occasional long black hairs in my food and the filling felt a bit scrimpy (pic attached)- there just wasn't much meat, mostly cabbage in the taco, and the tortillas were just too large. I honestly chose this place because of the sign out front advertising the frozen mojitos, and that was the first thing I inquired about and they didn't have them. I got a regular mojito and it was honestly made alright but a horrible experience consuming it because instead of putting mint leaves in, they were finely chopped up so I got pieces of mint in my mouth every sip I took. Probably won't be back.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: Can I say eat good! I had such a amazing experience eating with my small family today. My first time in a while out and the service was on point with the continued mimosa which there are 8 types. My favorite thing about the park is eating outside and given gloves to make my plate each time you go to the buffet for brunch. The chicken enchiladas are on a point as well.   Recommendation: go early to avoid long waits

reviews.author: Marissa T.
reviews.description: Stopped in for happy hour and I was rather sad! I think they are understaffed at the moment and couldn't provide the best service.   They have a great happy hour menu that I will have to stop by again to give another try! However parking garage is right across the street and it's free so that's always a plus! I had their margarita and chips and dip, nothing to rave over but nothing to "complain" about. I know they have more potential and quite possibly caught them on an off day. Will update this review when I revisit!

reviews.author: Brandon T.
reviews.description: The food was indeed amazing I love eating here and being in this atmosphere. I love watching the game and being I this spy it's nothing like being here watching the game and eating.

reviews.author: Isaac E.
reviews.description: Thanks to Yelp we were able to join the waitlist. It was a long wait with lots of people ahead of us, so make sure you check in early.   The place is lively and has a dark, rustic feel to it. Seating inside and out!   I liked the fries the most. It was unlike any fry I've ever had. It was fluffy and addicting!   Based off of how good our burgers tasted, I'm sure any of the other choices are just as good! They were so large, we could hardly finish it. Tastes just as good for leftovers.   Don't skip the fried pickles! They're a good starter.   Mac and Cheese was good, could've been a little more cheesier, but it was creamy and it had an adequate amount for what it's worthy (lots of people get skimpy when it comes to adding a side of Mac and Cheese)   Our server was friendly and attentive. Great at memorization--he didn't have to write anything down with no mistakes. And those who dropped off other food at our table were nice as well!

reviews.author: Marcy C.
reviews.description: Came for dinner: ordered the 20 piece wings, Parmesan  fries, Cesar salads and Cobb salad. Fries and wings were good but the salads were another story. Now I know why you should wash your lettuce! Both salads had grit in them making them inedible. I have a pepper mill at home and use Himalayan rock salt so I know the difference. This was not that-it was like sand. I'll probably come back for the wings or a drink but I definitely won't be ordering a salad;)

reviews.author: Mattie I.
reviews.description: The food and the drinks are mediocre to average but the happy hour is one of the best in the area and the staff is attendant, especially in the outdoor bar section. Not as great service in the outdoor seating to the left. Lots of outdoor space.

reviews.author: Jasmin M.
reviews.description: Came here for brunch very sad buffet hardly had anything in it .. after waiting 2 hrs to sit down had to wait 20+ min to order  By the time we got our check one of the people in our party still hadn't even gotten her food(pasta) she got the bill for her food before she even got her food

reviews.author: Hira S.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere. One of the few sports bars at the domain that is not totally packed and you can get a good view of the TV. Watched the Austin FC there and got seated pretty quickly. Got the chicken Veracruz with mashed potatoes and rice and it was absolutely delicious. Prices not so bad either.

reviews.author: Andy J.
reviews.description: I don't know what happened to this place.  It was a great place pre-COVID, but my last visit there was terrible.  I visited The Park on Sunday for their brunch and with the hour long line, I had high expectations.  For starters, it took +15 minutes for our waitress to come to our table to take our drink order.  I wanted coffee and the waitress warned me that their coffee is "terrible."  I was amazed that she said that but I wanted coffee nevertheless.  I should have listened to her - the coffee is TERRIBLE.  Moving onto the food - the buffet was well stocked with the usual breakfast foods; eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits, waffles, pancakes, etc.  What annoyed me though was when the platter of churros (they are delicious) was not restocked and I asked the employee handing out plates and latex gloves when more would be coming out, and all I received was a shrug and she went back to looking at her phone.  The Park is a well liked place and I hope that I just caught them on a very bad day.  I do recommend that they do something about the coffee - I'm not a coffee expert but what they were offering was well below standards.  Due to this experience, I won't be having brunch there again any time soon.

reviews.author: Johnny E.
reviews.description: Came to The Park for the popular Sunday brunch, however just decided to order items from the menu and not partake in the buffet due to Covid-19.   Table for two and we got seated immediately. To start I ordered a Habanero bloody mary, followed by a pickle zing bloody mary. I should've stuck with the habanero bloody mary, it tasted so much better than the pickle zing.  For food I placed an order for Parmesan Fried Calamari and Spinach Artichoke Dip. The calamari was great, just had a few bad bits in the batch. For the spinach dip I did enjoy, but the chips were more a crunchy biscuit. As a mexican I need basic tortilla chips haha. The spinach artichoke dip alone was delicious once you get past the chips.   After consuming these two starters I wanted something more filling, so I order the Slider Trio that comes with a jalepeño slider that was my favorite of the three. Second slider had mushrooms and grilled onions. I don't care for the mushrooms so I take those off and the slider was decent. Last slider had a fried pickle on it. The crunch of the fried pickle on this one was delicious.   To wash all this food down I then order their great variety of mimosas for only $2 on Sunday's! I'd say my sunday brunch was a breeze at The Park.

reviews.author: Katie P.
