reviews.description: I was excited to get out of the house for a a drink on the patio. Before leaving we called to see if we needed a reservation and if they allowed dogs on the patio (yes). The hostess who answered the phone was very difficult to understand and didn't understand what I was asking leading to me asking the same question a number of times.   When we got to the restaurant the same hostess didn't understand that we may have a 3rd person joining us and was again, difficult to understand. Some of this I will leave up to masks but I also saw her walking to seat a table while talking on her cell phone... come on.   We also saw waiters with masks below noses and one even served a drink with no mask at all.   Our waitress Nicole was great, very attentive and responsive. Food was pretty good but nothing very special and the drinks were good though a bit weak.   There are better spots in the domain to choose from. I was overall disappointed in the experience.

reviews.author: Dika M.
reviews.description: Stopped in on a Saturday afternoon before Christmas shopping for a late lunch.  We sat on the patio.  It was a little chilly next to the sidewalk and the my were gracious enough to move us to the bar.  The bartender was very attentive and friendly.  My husband's beer was never empty and our food came out promptly and they were pretty busy too.  My pizza was delicious, but definitely too much food for someone with an average appetite.  It's enough for two people to share.

name: Workhorse Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Clint S.
reviews.description: When we went earlier today for lunch and cocktails, we were, as always, welcomed by the same amazing team. We had a Bastrop Burger, a BL sandwich, both with Parmesan fries, some margaritas, a Paloma and a Pimm's Cup. Everyone and everything keeps us coming back.

reviews.author: Will C.
reviews.description: I can't comment on the bar itself since I didn't get the chance to drink there, but it's decent burger at a great price.  The burger itself was overcooked and dry; I don't know if this is normal, if the kitchen was having a bad series, or if the customer can request medium-rare.  Something to consider for next time.  And there should be a next time too, because this is still a great deal: burger + side for under $10.  Sure, it'd be nice if cheese wasn't an upcharge, but that's really a minor quibble.  Inside, the décor is funky and vibey, much like the other restaurants and shops in this North Loop neighborhood.  What stands out most inside is the massive album art print from Stone Temple Pilots's Purple.  Thanks to this, I haven't been able to get "Interstate Love Song" out of my head for the past four days.

reviews.author: Henry Y.
reviews.description: Came here with the coworkers on a Friday right after work. This is a great spot with an outdoor seating area in BOTH the front and the back (which I didn't know at first).  Their drinks are pre-California exodus cheap, so grab a beer or two or three. They also have grub. There's plenty of burgers to choose from, a coworker said their portobello burger is bomb. I got the burger special, which was arugula and blue cheese. My burger was slightly overcooked and a coworker's was well-done, so you'll have to be mindful of that; if you like yours med-rare or medium, I would call it out. I thought they were pretty generous with the blue cheese, but the burger itself could have been slightly larger; they're thick but relatively tiny. Buns are toasted. I think next time I'd go with one of the classic burgers since I felt the burger special was really heavy, the arugula doesn't bring enough balance for the funkiness of the blue cheese. The parmesian fries were alright, a tad too salty for me.  The guys behind the bar were nice, a bee got stuck in my bottle and they kindly replaced it.  PARKING: there's a few spots out front, but there's plenty of parking around the corner in the residential area.  Come for the drinks, stay for vibes.

reviews.author: Junus A.
reviews.description: This place is STILL GREAT. Only ever had one bad burger here (was a bit dry).   I am just going to affirm that this is my favorite bar in Austin. I have lots of drinking experience in Austin. Workhorse nails it. Anyone can come here, feel comfortable, enjoy super-solid food, a great beer selection, and walk away with an affordable tab. It's just perfect..  LOVE the new COVID sidewalk space. PLEASE keep it. Probably 90% of the patrons here smoke cigarettes and the back patio only barely sufficed.

reviews.author: Andrew J.
reviews.description: It's a good dive, with tons of beer on tap and surprisingly good food. Lots of vegetarian options too. Service is pretty decent considering how grungy the place is.   However: I definitely got at least one drink in a dirty ass glass, and the kitchen staff is, shall we say, pretty casual about food hygiene. And yet I still liked it somehow. Maybe because so many other places in present-day Austin are just gentrification normie hellscapes-- this is a nice change of pace.

reviews.author: Endy L.
reviews.description: Quick service, food, drinks, price. Only thing is merch designs seem lazy. Will be back!

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: Great bar and grill across from vintage row. BLT and fries were great. Good music too not to mention a lot of beer on draft to pick from  we will be back

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Try the pretzels, you'll thank me. Great neighborhood spot for beers and burgers on the outdoor patio out back.

reviews.author: Mason M.
reviews.description: Amazing food. Definitely get a burger and the Parmesan fries! Tables and atmosphere are a little awkward if you aren't there for the bar part. I would highly recommend it as a bar/burger place.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Was I just transported to a mountain town where everyone just got off their shift on the slopes? Oh, nope. Still in Austin.   This is a cozy, neighborhood bar. The seating is a bit hodge podge cabin lodge so you might find yourself standing if it's crowded, but as is the case anywhere that's solid. All the drinking options for all the drinking types. The burgers look legit, but I didn't have one.  Bundle up and throw 'em back.

reviews.author: Jenny L.
reviews.description: this used to be a hipster bearded ax throwing dude bar.   it's now a whitewashed college kid bar, and packed af.

reviews.author: Shawn M.
reviews.description: The place is a cool dive and seating outside but the drinks aren't dive bar prices and the cooks never wash their hands before preparing your meal.  I guess they don't care about this pandemic at all.  I watched the cook scratch his head, grab his phone and text then started to assemble a burger without a care in the world or concern for cleanliness.  So if I were you I would eat before I go to this establishment.

reviews.author: Kayla H.
reviews.description: Good food. Not great service.  I was excited by all the vegetarian options on the menu. My mac n cheese was good. The fried pickles were soooo good. Definitely recommend those.  We came midday, and I'd have preferred there be a few more non-alcoholic beverages. It seemed there were usually quite a few choices, but they were out of most things. Not sure why.  We'd come again.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: We visited this place last week and are so sad that it hasn't been our go-to all along. It's located in such a chill part of Austin, so it's perfect when you feel like going out, but not going out (if you know what I mean)! They have a ton of beers on tap and handful of yummy sounding cocktails. We didn't eat here, but when we saw their blue cheese bacon burger with huge azzz onion rings on the side we were wishing we did! It was totally embarrassing, but my husband accidentally spilled his first beer on the bar and the bar tender did a great job at not acting completely annoyed at him, although he was. He even poured him another which we were not expecting at all, so that added to our great experience here! Highly recommend, but only if you're not a high-maintenance little princess because it definitely has some grunginess to it ;)

reviews.author: Tiffany P.
reviews.description: This is the epitome of a dive bar so it's not really my scene, but I will say the food looked and smelled delicious and they have the cleanest bathroom I've ever experienced for a bar of this caliber.

reviews.author: Kelly N.
reviews.description: This is a great bar! The food is really delicious and there's a lot of different options for everyone. You can order everything from burgers to mac and cheese to sandwiches. There's even veggie options for those of you who are vegetarian! The fries are great. The beers are awesome and there's a big selection.  It is pretty hot here here though, especially outside during the summer. I love the location and sometimes it's hard to find parking but it's a great spot for a beer and some food. It does get crowded but the service was still quick.

reviews.author: Sylvain B.
reviews.description: It's a dive bar so I'll keep my review short: - extremely cheap beers: down to $1 a bottle and $3 a pint of draft beer - amazing selection of great (local and non-) beers - super friendly bartender who knows his products and gives great advice on the beers to choose form. - great ambiance, nice patron, fun atmosphere and great music.  So it goes in the 4 stars dive bars!  Note: They have an outdoor patio in the back.

reviews.author: Nickie B.
reviews.description: I have been to the Workhorse Bar three times before yesterday, and those experiences were all 3-4 stars.  But this most recent visit was teetering on between 2-3 stars.    I ordered the White Manhattan, which has always been awesome!  This visit it tasted like they poured me a glass of watered down Moonshine and added a twist of Orange.  I ordered a second one just to make sure it was just not a bad pour.  Nope the second one was as bad as the first. The odd thing is they bartender who made them both, was the same bartender who has made them for me on my prior visits.     We were also quite bothered by the loud group behind us slamming their cards on the table as they played some unknown card game.  They were overly loud and obnoxious.  We were not the only customers who were annoyed.  The other pet peeve I have is when large groups of people stand at the front door of an entrance to smoke cigarettes.  On this visit there was always a group of 3-7 people puffing away well within 15 feet of the front door.  People...please go smoke out back on the patio.  The upside of this visit was the music from the jukebox.  For $2 we were able to select 8 tunes.  Music selection is random, but good.

reviews.author: Tina M.
reviews.description: Workhorse is the perfect little neighborhood bar. It has a fairly large and very affordable selection of drinks, an all-around-the-clock "happy hour", great bar food and a nice staff! They also have a jukebox (select 4 songs for a dollar) and a patio in the back.   In the food department, they've got a good selection of sides and appetizers, as well as burgers, salads and fries. Vegetarians will be pleased to find out they have several veggie options, including two types of veggie burgers and many sides. The food is cheap and tasty. I don't know about you, but for me that's getting pretty close to my definition of heaven!   If you want available seating space for the duration of your stay, I recommend visiting between Monday and Thursday. Friday and weekends are very popular nights and you might not be able to find a cozy spot to sit, although that goes for most bars.  If you pass by the North Loop strip one evening, you should definitely drop by and have a taste of Workhorse.

reviews.author: Bill G.
reviews.description: This is a great neighborhood bar. I don't live in the neighborhood but I do love this hangout. Friendly staff and patrons, genuinely Austin. Food and drinks are definitely in the affordable range. Cool art on the walls and an awesome jukebox. Enjoy!

name: Lavaca Street Bar At Rock Rose
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Valet Parking
Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Santiago R.
reviews.description: Ate here awhile back but forgot to leave a review. The food here is decent. Giving it 4 stars since it can be a good venue to watch sports at and it is a nice venue overall.

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: Beers a little pricey but bartenders super nice. Fly rite popup is a nice addition, and seating is plentiful.

reviews.author: Anna G.
reviews.description: No bad experience just wasn't impressed by the grunginess and casualness of the bartenders. The beers were also pricey for Austin and considering the place isn't anything special. I got boneless wings at Flyrite inside. It was fine.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: For flyrite only:  We stopped in here when they first converted over to fly rite and ordered the chicken quesadilla, buffalo chicken sandwich, kale slaw and tots. In my opinion the best things were the tots and the quesadilla. The quesadilla had A LOT of veggies, more than it had chicken. The kale slaw didn't have much flavor and the sandwich was average.   Overall, it is a little pricey for the quality and with so many options nearby, we probably won't be back.

reviews.author: Julie B.
reviews.description: LAVACA STREET BAR YOU OFFICIALLY RUINED YOUR PLACE. The real reason we even came here was for the fantastic poboys, seafood sandwiches. We haven't been to your place in a while due to the pandemic. We walk in excited and salivating and walked out disgusted to learn it was like Fly chicken or something like that. Seriously? You had a perfect blend of affordable high-end food and now,,,, wow you offer such exiting fare as chicken sandwiches?! How is this something anyone looks forward to? Such typical bar food.  I told all my neighbors this and they were shocked. GET BACK THE OLD RESTAURANT. Guys, *that's what made you special and memorable. Your bar isn't that exciting or enticing without it.. think about your Rock Rose Street competition. We were sooo sad to see these food items go. I hate to say it, but we will NEVER be back. Why did you ruin a good thing?!?

reviews.author: Preston W.
reviews.description: I was visiting from out of town and stopped in with a friend of mine today. The bartender seemed annoyed with us because we were taking her away from her friends on the other side of the bar. I had to call her to come over after our one drink to close my tab. We would have stayed for more drinks but she wasn't in the least bit friendly. There are too many other places to choose from in this area. Save yourself the trouble

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: After a long day walking around the Domain our last stop was to find a place to relax and have a drink before returning home so selected Lavaca Street Bar. From the outside it looked like a sports bar and it was. When you enter you can order food from a full menu of mostly seafood cuisine. We just skipped this and headed straight to the bar where located right in the middle of this establishment.  This place has lots of flat screens showing a wide variety of sports entertainment. The beer choices was excellent and enjoyed the one I had. Staff were nice and tended to our needs very well.  Fun atmosphere where there was an adult birthday party going on here. Another nice design is very open to the outside even if sitting inside unless way in the back. We enjoyed it and next time pick something off the menu.

reviews.author: Patrick P.
reviews.description: Stopped in here Sunday when visiting friends and walked around Domain for a bit. We decided to eat lunch and find a place that had some of the NFL games on. We ordered food through fly rite chicken, and I ordered a Bloody Mary from the bar. Pretty tasty food, Bloody Mary was tasty and enjoyed that on a warmer afternoon.   Lots of cool places to visit around this area. I suggest trying the Buffalo chicken sandwich with a side of tater tots.

reviews.author: Nathan B.
reviews.description: March 9th we walked in and zero safely protocols. Bartender not wearing a mask and not able to answer why she wasn't wearing one.  What a joke

reviews.author: Leland J.
reviews.description: Pay cash bar tender is thief and management sides with the crook.  Told me I had 10 drinks like I'm some super human now all of a sudden. If I did then they don't pour drink worth a $ht. Sad but pay cash everywhere thieves are scamming and trying to get an edge especially when u start a tab at some places.

reviews.author: Jaclyn V.
reviews.description: Just reviewing the vibe bc we left in search of seafood. cool place with plenty of patio seating on busy rock rose, but we were bummed that they have done away with their variety of oysters.  We specifically went down there to get oysters bc we heard that they were full of flavor. Not sure if the limited menu is just during COVID or if it is to stay.

reviews.author: Casey L.
reviews.description: AVOID THIS PLACE AND DO NOT ORDER FOOD HERE! I came here expecting a restaurant, but it turns out that they added a food truck to avoid the COVID shutdown. Almost an hour and a half wait (88 minutes!!) for a set of wings and a sandwich, and it came out cold. Not worth the $20. The best part? When I asked the Lavaca Street Bar folks about how much longer it would be, they said that it wasn't their problem and offered no help. I also tried to go to the food truck, but there's no one at the window to help (you have to order through an app)!!   The beer was fine.

reviews.author: LaRon E.
reviews.description: As elite yelper I have to keep it 100% so let me start by saying that the spot itself is on point, alot of people friendly staff and the environment was relaxing....  Now my reason fornthe 3 stars is because of the food. I ordered the 12 oz Ribeye medium rare but it came out well done and the red beans and rice was drowned in grease.. Other than that I would come back and chill..

reviews.author: Carla C.
reviews.description: Excellent customer service! Great drinks!!!!!! Wings were awesome .  I can't say enough about the customer service it's really top notch

reviews.author: Kathleen M.
reviews.description: Was in the mood for a late night meal and decided to hit the Domain for Lavaca's 30th Anniversary Party to grab a bite to eat. An absolutely phenomenal decision as the food was delicious! Neither of us ordered drinks (I was a little disappointed - didn't see any special anniversary drinks available!) but the food was great.   There are several locations for Lavaca Street Bar, but we visited this one because it's closest to my house. As it is also a bar, you will need to bring along an ID because they do card to enter. This location, as with the others, features both indoor and outdoor seating. We opted for a closet table because I'm on crutches so mobility and accessibility were a main focus. Be advised, you order at the front and they will bring your food to you, but you cannot order anything from your table. Instead, when you place the order they give you a numbered placard to place on the table of your choice.   In perusing through the menu, there were several items that caught my eye, but when I went up to order I noticed a special on blacked tuna tacos for the month...of course this was what I ended up selecting based on the recommendation of the cashier. WOW! My tacos arrived to the table deconstructed as they do not have any suitable corn (gluten free!) tortillas so I couldn't actually eat them as tacos. (This was not the hill I wanted to die on with my celiac disease) It was a beautiful display and they were delivered by the nicest man (super friendly, very accommodating, etc.) but I was quite disappointed that I was unable to enjoy them as tacos because of the tortilla situation.   Despite my disappointment in this....they were amazing!!! The seasoning/rub used to blacken the tuna was probably the best I've ever had and I absolutely have to try it on other meats as well. My friend ordered the chicken quesadillas and also loved it, but I think mine was better.    We came at a pretty busy time (I mean there was a party going on for goodness sake!) and our food was still on the table in the blink of an eye. I will say that this isn't the place to go if you expect to be waited on hand and foot, because this is not that type of establishment, but the service was stellar and entirely met my expectations.   The only reason I'm unable to give a 5 star is because I was unable to enjoy my meal as it was intended and I honestly can't believe they didn't have corn tortillas I could use instead. They did get creative in deconstructing it a d it was still beautiful and delicious, but I really wanted those tacos and I'm sure the tortilla would have changed the flavor as well. Hopefully next time they'll have something suitable as I definitely intend for there to be a next time!

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Great staff. Cute environment. Plenty of choices for everyone.  I attached photos: Shrimp tacos, rockafeller oysters and shrimp and grits

reviews.author: Alanna J.
reviews.description: FOR FLYRITE    I usually visit the location on 7th street bc my bf is obsessed with this place. We went to the location at the domain bc it's closer to his place and it was probably one of the worst meals I've had in a long time. I already took a risk going to the domain which is like a scene from Mad Max as it is (no one wears a mask and acts like they don't know what 6ft apart means)  We decided to redeem our free sandwich promo from the app. Both our meals were incorrect and the tater tots were soggy. No, it wasn't from waiting to get home. I snuck one out of the bag at the restaurant when my bf wasn't looking and already knew dinner was going to be a no go for me. But I gave it chance. I had a long day and waited to eat until I could have a nice dinner with my lovely partner. After a hangry drive home I popped open my little box of incorrect disappointment and was instantly sad that my food was wrong. I powered through about two bites to find a long overly dyed hair in my chicken sandwich :(. I was tired and ready to end my night that I just pounded down my tots which later gave me a stomach ache.   I felt a call to rectify my order was unwarranted since it was a free sandwich and I still wouldn't eat there again anyway. My bf loves this place and it's a shame that we won't share that experience again. Oh well, onto finding the next chicken sandwich.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: The food is delicious! However is super overpriced. We got a steak poboy, ceviche, and dozen Rockefeller oysters and it was well over $70 with tip... we haven't even ordered drinks yet which is a separate process. Bartenders are usually slow and talkative to people they know and who seem to also work there. The place itself is open, has tons of tvs, and dog friendly which is why we've continued to come back. I just wish we got better service for the prices we're paying.

reviews.author: Teresa B.
reviews.description: Y'all!!!! This is honestly my favorite place in all of Austin!! Everything I have tried is incredible, but my absolute favorite is the ribeye nachos and cajun fried corn. The ribeye is charred just right and the nachos are covered with a layer of black beans and cheese that just speaks to the heart. Instant fulfillment! The dirty rice is amazing as is the fried porkchops - and I am from the south so I know my fried y'all!

reviews.author: Victoria W.
reviews.description: I am a huge fan of Lavaca Street Bar food! However, I write this with the caveat that both times that I have eaten here I may or may not have been in a complete sober state of mind.  What I love are the HUGE portions! After a night (or day) of drinking, this place will satisfy! On our most recent outing, I got their chicken fried chicken special. It was definitely the best value on the menu. For $16, I got a huge piece of chicken, fries, side salad, and a side of gumbo. I was very happy. My friend spent $16 on boneless wings and all that he got was a pound of boneless wings. Probably equally filling, but I'm a girl who likes variety and they get you because to order a "side" of fries, which they claim is 1 lb of fries, costs $8. My husband got the shrimp po-boy, which also looked amazing and is big enough to share.  The downside is definitely the prices. Because normally their food doesn't come with sides, you'll pay $16 for an entree and then another $10+ for sides. I highly recommend taking a more family style approach when eating here so you can try a variety of foods without breaking the bank because honestly, their portions are very gigantic.

name: Billy's on Burnet
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: C C.
reviews.description: Love this place.  We were looking for a place to watch the UT game and have a bite to eat Saturday morning and stumbled into Billy's. Great beer selection included our current go-to Electric Jellyfish.   For food we started with the cheese curds. Incredibly crispy. I'd put theirs up against Any I've had in Wisconsin.  Finished up with a cheeseburger and fries. Both were Shockingly good. Not just good for a dive bar, flat out legit.   Can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Roland D.
reviews.description: Review for Billy's on Burnett  TLDR: a perfectly above average dive bar  For the food: I ordered Billy's "The Shults" burger. The wait time for the food was perfectly reasonable. The burger was well seasoned and well constructed. The only real complaint was the pickle on top was rather small and lackluster. The fries were fresh and crisp, and also well seasoned.   For the drinks: Billy's offers a more than ample beer menu with the common stock, as well as a decent selection of local breweries.   For the atmosphere: Billy's certainly fronts the image of a dive bar, and does so very well. Dimly lit, slightly crowded, and a prominent bar situated directly across the entrance all help establish the environment they want. The patio in the side is well shaded, and has much less road noise than I initially expected. The only complaint is the flies on the patio are out of control.   For the value: Given the location, I can't really blame Billy's for the prices. I feel like I payed a bit more than what I would have wanted for what I got, however, that feeling isn't uncommon in Austin in general, and especially Burnet.   Everything else: there's virtually no parking at Billy's, however there is some street parking within easy walking distance. And yet again, the flies on the patio are on another level.

reviews.author: Susie H.
reviews.description: Good food, quick service, but only have beer and wine. We didn't stay to see what it was a good packer crowd. Lots of packer ppl probably coming but we left because of drink choices.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Really good burgers and sammich's.  Need a beer and a burger then look no further. Support local!!

reviews.author: Mike C.
reviews.description: Austin is at Stage 5 (the highest stage for contracting Covid-19) and Billy's continues to get my order RIGHT!!! They offer curbside delivery and walked my order out to me at my pickup time.  Once I got home I discovered they did everything I asked... Grilled onions-yes Lettuce, tomato, and Mayo on side-yes Burger cut in half-yes  The folks at Billy's pay attention to detail and have earned 5 stars and I will absolutely keep going back!  Thank you to the staff at Billy's for getting it RIGHT!

reviews.author: Tom P.
reviews.description: Aaron Franklin has long touted Billy's on Burnet as a superior restaurant for the best in burgers, and once again, he is correct about food.  The folks at Billy's did confirm that the James Beard Award winner is a regular.  The menu's, order source and pickup is at the bar.  We were clearly the only "non-regulars" there that day.  But, we were warmly greeted and walked through the extensive menu of burgers, sandwiches, and yes, beer options.  We will definitely be backed to try many of the other options.  The prices were very reasonable as fries come with the burgers.  The burgers were delicious, juicy and HUGE.  The burgers are served open faced.  If you like to cut your sandwich in half, the basket makes this a bit difficult.  The only downside, I gained a pound.  There is plenty of parking, the inside is much larger than we expected, and yes, it is a classic dive.

reviews.author: Bill M.
reviews.description: Billy likes Billy's on Burnet. It's a dark, divy beer bar with a solid food menu including many fried appetizers, from wings to okra, and myriad burger and sandwich options, even hot dogs and an entire column of veg-head choices. I myself enjoy the indulgence of a cobra burger w/fries and a fine Texas craft beer, of which there are many. The burgers are pretty darn good and the beer is cold, so what else do you need? Entertainment? Billy's has you covered with a pool table, darts, several TVs and some arcade games in the back. Other notes: there is a patio and a small parking lot, but there is street parking nearby.

reviews.author: Melissa D.
reviews.description: This is a good spot for trivia and food. Limited parking, so navigate yourself to Lynnwood to find a street spot. Service was really fast, even when all the trivia people arrived/ ordered all at once. If you are coming for trivia/ an event, you need to get there really early for a table. If you are coming to just hang out, double check that there is not trivia/ an event that day. A few folks walked in, saw all of the tables packed and left.   Food reviews!  -Veggie burger: solid patty, hefty amount of avocado. Not the most interesting veggie burger, but definitely solid.  -Turkey Rueben: yum, devoured quickly -Chili cheese fries: Also yum, also devoured quickly. An excellent topping to fry ratio.  -Roast beef sandwich: The person who ordered this said it was good, but wasn't going to order it again. Said it was a little too greasy/ soggy.  - Fries: They are really well seasoned but they are also really unevenly cooked. One fry is perfect, the next one seemed almost raw.

reviews.author: Auntie P.
reviews.description: Very disappointed by our experience for takeout tonight. My husband wanted a patty melt and I wanted a club sandwich. The online ordering and curbside pickup were easy and user friendly. The food, specifically my club was a big let down. I was expecting a traditional triple decker on toast style club. It was on a hoagie and even worse, there was a dark hair in the lettuce on my sandwich. Needless to say, lost my appetite after that, I tossed it. I added, in advance a 25% gratuity because that's how it works ordering curbside and during COVID19 I've been wanting to support local businesses and their staff. Won't be ordering takeout again.

reviews.author: Benson C.
reviews.description: I went to Billy's for the first and last time on Sunday afternoon. They said they allowed dogs on their patio, so I figured I'd bring my well trained 3 year old pit/bulldog mix. Everything was great for 45 minutes. My dog met 3 other dogs and got some puppy rubs from about 5 patrons on the patio, and then everything changed in the blink of an eye.   An intoxicated man holding his toy dog stepped up onto the patio and immediately zoned in on mine. His dog growled at mine while my dog whined and wagged her tail because she just wanted to meet another dog. The intoxicated man sternly asked me if she was a rescue to which I replied "no, I've had her since she was six weeks old." To which he replied "Your dog is aggressive." I told him he was aggressive and he went all in and said "if yOur dog touches my dog, I will slit it's throat." This quickly turned into a heated altercation where I knew something bad was going to happen if I stayed, so I removed myself from the situation.  I went into the bar to let them know that there was a disgruntled patron out on the patio that threatened to slit my dog's throat and the bartender asked who it was. I pointed him out through the window and she said "Oh. He's a regular, that's so weird, he never acts like that....." and just shrugged.  As soon as I took one step out the door, this regular of yours, Stefan, got right back in my face, chest bumping  me, trying to rile me up by calling me insults and slurs. He went over the top and came out with the statement "I can't wait for you to throw the first punch, so I can sue the shit out of you."  I'm a General Manager of another local restaurant and I understand the value of a regular customer, but sometimes if a regular oversteps their boundaries they need to be handled. Y'all are an establishment that's main priority is providing a safe environment for ALL of your customers, not just your regulars. Y'all could have prevented this whole situation from escalating and chose not to. I'm honestly more disappointed in your staff than I am with the situation with Stefan.  Out of my four years here, this was the worst Austin experience I've ever had. You guaranteed the fact that my friend and I will never return to be a potential regular for you because we shouldn't have to question our safety.

reviews.author: Laura O.
reviews.description: You will not regret this burger at all! I hadn't been here in a long time, and it was sooo good. The burger was juicy, and just the right size. The bun was soft and fresh. The burger and fries were piping hot. Fries were well seasoned. I feel like I've found an Austin treasure!

reviews.author: Ashley V.
reviews.description: I was very let down by my experience here. My friends raved how good this place was.   I walked up to the bar and explained it was my first time here and how did it work. The two people behind the bar, a heavily tattooed dude and a middle aged lady, were less than hospitable. I forget his exact words but something along the lines of what you see is what you get. I was waiting for my friend and just wanted to get a starter while I waited. I ordered the chili cheese fries. Lady says no, we don't have that bc of the water boil issue. I said ok. I asked if they just weren't doing appetizers. She said they were only doing fried things. (Correct me if I'm wrong but fries are fried, right?)  I said can I get queso and chips? - no.  Mmm ok can I get a blue moon- no.  I made a joke at this point bc it was awkward and like what the hell. I said I'm really striking out here. She said they had something similar and went to get it. Then this guy standing next to me orders chips and queso from the dude bartender. When the lady brought me my beer back I mentioned this and she freaked out on the dude bartender. I ruined the other guys opportunity to get queso and they made him order something else. Oops. Then I hesitantly asked if I could get frito pie. Finally I got a yes. But that yes makes no sense. I couldn't get chili cheese fries but I could get chili and cheese on Fritos? I walked away confused and put off.   My friend showed up and we decided to split a burger, we didn't even want to ask the employees what they recommended because of their foul, unhelpful, annoyed attitudes. Even my friend was like what the actual F. They were straight rude. We ordered a burger. The bun was soft and that's about it. Nothing special at all. Food was a 2, service was a 0 so as much as I hate to leave reviews like these, they get an overall 1.   Customer service, a smile, a friendly demeanor go a LONG way. Won't be giving this place a 2nd Chance.

reviews.author: Cynthia N.
reviews.description: So I know this place is supposed to be about beer and a good pub to come watch sports or something but I don't care about beer or sports. What I do care about is The Uptown Burger.  Have you ever watched that one How I Met Your Mother episode where Marshall spends the whole episode looking for that one spot where he had the best burger of his life? Well, The Uptown Burger is that burger for me. LOL I came here on a whim just to meet up with my cousin and I was hungry so I ordered a burger at this lowkey spot not expecting much however, this burger blew my mind! I forgot what this place was called so I can have that burger again and just found it. I don't really love the other burgers here but I'm telling you, ORDER THE UPTOWN BURGER

reviews.author: Cassie C.
reviews.description: Had always wanted to try this place and I'm so glad we did. Burger was amazing and the fries were too!

reviews.author: Dao T.
reviews.description: This is a little hole in the wall bar/ restaurant but I love it! They have an outdoor patio if you want to bring your fur baby. We ordered the Uptown Burgers and it was delicious. The size and the fixings was perfect for the price and was reasonable. A sweet marmalade, avocados and bleu cheese - #nomnomnom  If you're looking for great burgers and beers, I recommend visiting Billy's!

reviews.author: Megan S.
reviews.description: This is a nice neighborhood bar with a good selection of beer and food.  As basic as it sounds, the basket of french fries was my favorite. They are mildly spiced and go well with the beers. I used to go here occasionally for the trivia nights.  The bar is divided into rooms/sections. One of them has a pool table and dart boards. There is sufficient patio seating as well. The downside is there are limited parking spots.

reviews.author: Danny B.
reviews.description: My favorite neighborhood bar, grille. Excellent food, wings, burgers, especially the ruben

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Why Billy's? Let us count the ways; great burgers, daily drink specials, a pool table, cool patio, eclectic music selection (blues to beach boys), and TVs for sports. How bout two bucks off any Real Ale draft on Thursdays. Here take your 4 stars Billy. Minus one star for being a Green Bay Packer Bar (kidding).   Billy's is a chill neighborhood bar to grab a bite and have a beer or two. Their draft selection is awesome with all your favorites plus a few that will surprise you. Checkout their burger menu it's pretty extensive. I opted for a boring cheeseburger with fries. Burger was cooked perfectly and served on a bed of spiced up fries and it paired perfectly with my pint of Real Ale amber. Will definitely return but not on a Packer game day (Go Pats!).

reviews.author: Anthony A.
reviews.description: After a couple rounds of Chicken Poop Bingo we stopped by to watch some of the Super Bowl and get a quick meal. We were blessed to find this joint. We had some locals being so polite to us and the atmosphere was enjoyable. Loved every bite if my simple dish beans and cornbread. My wife had a Burger and the quality was amazing. Good spot to support and stop by!

reviews.author: Patricia W.
reviews.description: This is my place. 1.8 miles from my house. Burgers are good and they have food for a vegetarian too! Beer is always cold. Service is friendly. It's a little dive burger and beer bar with charm. What more could you ask for? It's a meet up after work on a weekday joint. It's a watch the game together joint. It's a just wanna eat fried food a chill with a beer type of place. It's not fancy. If you want fancy then don't head to Billy's. Billy's is keeping it real!

name: North Italia
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Devin O.
reviews.description: While I'm not much for downtown locations. This is in a great spot!  Love the pizza!  The atmosphere os also very nice and chill for the location. Plenty of space so your not crowded up.  But beware of the windows. Or you'll have allot of people starting at you as you eat the delicious food.

reviews.author: Kelsey S.
reviews.description: Is North pricey? Yes. Is it worth every penny? Yes! North is our go-to birthday celebration restaurant because of their pet friendly closed patio, amazing food that will satisfy everyone at your table, and just such a pleasant staff.   The reason for the 4 is mainly because when we sit inside, although beautiful, it's so loud because the space is packed pretty tight.

reviews.author: Erica O.
reviews.description: Let me say start with how amazing the staff are! We were greeted immediately. Our waiter is a Rockstar! As busy as they were, she came and checked on us frequently.   As you can see in my pictures we ordered a lot, lol. We created our pizza. The pesto was perfect. The crust on the pizza was crispy and soft. Great flavor overall.  I ordered the squid Ink. It was great spice and delicious. Only negative was the shrimp and it needed some type of veggie. The shrimp didn't hold flavor well in the dish. I think Argentina shrimp would be a better pick for this dish rather than basic shrimp.  My little one of course with her sweet tooth ordered the glazed Italian donut french toast. It actually was really good. The wild blueberry, honey lemon ricotta, hazelnut and mint combination was actually a really good combination. This dish is super sweet so make sure you have some milk or water to drink.  My other child ordered the breakfast sandwich. She loved it. She really enjoyed the hint of spice it had in it. And my oldest child ordered the Pollo fritto and asked for over easy egg. We also ordered one too so we all could try. Let me say how they cooked the perfect cut of chicken. Normally you order chicken like this and they give you a dark meat cut thigh. Not here! It was a juicy white cut. The crust was perfect! The hash brown balls were yummmmmy! We all enjoyed those.  Overall, great atmosphere, great service, great food! We definitely will be back!

reviews.author: Natalie G.
reviews.description: North Italia is such a gem.  The appetizers are amazing (see the bread with ricotta). This bread is such a wonderful portion for two...we had leftovers!   The pizza blew me away. I ordered thinking "eh, that doesn't sound good but I'll branch out" and WOW am I glad I did! The Pig was amazing. I was blown away by the meats! The sausage was incredible (this is coming from someone who HATES sausage on her pizza). The meats had so much flavor. Also, the service was incredible. The first time we came by, the wait after being seated was absolutely insane. We were so hungry! However, the waiter was so attentive to this and gave us a free dessert!   ....which leads me to how good the dessert is here! I am not a caramel fan, and this caramel ice cream was insanely good.   Please come to north italia. Trust me. It's our new fave!

reviews.author: Tom L.
reviews.description: An amazing experience with awesome tasty food. I may not be an Italian food expert but all I tasted was freshness, bold flavors, and great tasting meats.   The charcuterie board has figs, different types of meats such as salami and prosciutto. The char bread is awesome, nice char, mix of oils, and the crunch really helps break up the saltiness from the meats. The white looking sauce is actually cheese spread, I wasn't too much of a fan but it was ok. The best part of the board was the little Italian almonds, soft and firm yet nice crispy shell.   The beef carpaccio is yummy, tasty, and just look at the dish? You eat with your eyes and the dish appeals to your vision. Must try.   The zucchini chips are additive, nice crispy, salty, chips, a bit too oily but it's what is expected, very nice house chips.  The spaghetti and meatball dish is good but I wasn't blown away, I had a better elsewhere. The spaghetti tasted a bit too Al dente, too firm, just missing flavor. I would of spun the spaghetti in olive oil, salt, and black pepper then placed the sauce on top. Sprinkling parmesan cheese helps,

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: Can't wait to do a second visit with someone special. I really enjoyed my time along with the flavors of food and kind service providers.   Happy Birthday to my wonderful son!  He loved this place.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Love this spot :) beware- it does get super crowded and sometimes, a reservation is a great idea! I've had quite a few of their dishes and I've only ever had one thing that I wasn't a huge fan of (strozzapreti). The salmon on pesto farro is amazingggg! And the Prosecco is a favorite of course.

reviews.author: Kyle H.
reviews.description: Wanted an Italian dinner the first night we were in Austin. Found this place about a mile from the hotel and take a chance. Pretty busy but it was Friday night around 6-7pm. Had about a 45 minute wait however we were able to sneak into a table around the bar (first come first serve).  Wife got the chicken parmigiana. Probably the best option on the menu. Crunchy chicken with great sauce and amazing noodles on the side. She also tried the bread as an app. Very crispy and fresh.  I got the Caesar salad because I wanted something lighter. Not bad but it's a salad. Also got the meatballs. Pretty delicious.  Server was very nice and we had a great time. The domain area was very fancy with plenty of shops and stores to roam around in. Worth the visit.

reviews.author: Madi M.
reviews.description: Food is great, service is prompt and location is perfect for hanging out with friends. I really liked their Funghi pizza. Just perfect!

reviews.author: Century S.
reviews.description: A brand name with mediocre food but great service (5*) I'm really not sure how the food ratings for this place is high. I've tried so many Italian restaurants including ones where they make fresh pasta and this place was truly a miss. We had a large table so we had a lot of food to be able to properly judge. Short rib hash had literally 2 pieces of chewy short ribs, deep fried potatoes soaked in oil, etc. overall hardly any taste. Truffle butter had no taste or smell of truffle. Pesto Pasta was good taste wise, but chewy. Veggie pizza was dry. We also ordered banana coffee cake for table. We asked the whip cream on side and the cake came soacked in caramel sauce. Honestly cake would have been good if it wasn't for additional overwhelming sugar added from caramel. Top of the cake was super dry and hard. Zucca chips were good. My friends also had market scramble and Avocado toast that they really liked.

reviews.author: Jaelin M.
reviews.description: Last night i visited North Italia for the first time. It was a decent experience, primarily because the service left quite a bit to be desired. Our server rarely came by, and we actually had to ask for him to remove dishes from the table.   The sicilian margarita was okay, but the ginger blossom marg was absolutely delicious. I ordered the grilled bread, which was also very good but came out borderline cold. For dinner, I had the short rib cavatelli which was quite good.   It was a bit pricey, for the portions - but it was filling. Overall, the food and drinks were enjoyable but the service could've been better.

reviews.author: Michael L.
reviews.description: THE BIG: Located in the Domain with big seating area indoors and outdoors. Very nice wine selection.  THE BLACK AND WHITE: I came here for lunch with my team from work (since we're located in the Domain). It's nice having a great Italian restaurant closeby to get your pizza cravings in.  The waiter came by and announced the soup of the day (lentil pork soup) as well as the pizza of the day (pepperoni w/ corn). I also had the same reaction when they mentioned corn. So....I had to try it! Fortunately they are able to have half and half pizzas. I chose the Funghi and the pizza of the day.  The Funghi pizza was delicious! Rich and creamy with the white sauce. Corn on pizza on the otherhand...questionable. Love the fusion thoughts though.   THE FINAL BAMBOO: Overall, the damage done for a half/half pizza was around $20 which is not bad. Delicious pizza and I definitely want to come back to try out the pasta!

reviews.author: Wes O.
reviews.description: This is a great option for Italian, especially at the Domain.  North has something for everyone, whether you're wanting a more Italian-American red sauce option or a something a bit more authentically Italian.  To add to it, they provide these options with impeccable service and in a beautiful atmosphere.  Today's review of the dining options.  First, the appetizer of crusty bread and olive oil was good.  The sprinkled cheese on top of the bread and the olive oil and balsamic vinegar already applied to the bread were surprises, but not unwelcome ones. (I'm always a fan of a separate plate of olive oil for dipping.)  The Bolognese pasta was exceptionally hearty and meaty and not the usual red meat sauce over spaghetti.  The hearty, rustic, meaty sauce combined with the flat tagliatelli pasta was both sophisticated and satisfying -- and quite possibly my new favorite for dinner as the weather in Central Texas cools. My dining companion also enjoyed her Caesar salad and the margherita pizza.  I tried the pizza and found the ingredients to be high quality.  When you combine the taste and quality of the food with the superb service, it's little wonder that North will merit a return visit soon.

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: The food and service at North Italia is wonderful. I love that there are multiple seafood options, and that the spicy dishes have some real heat! We like North Italia and the variety of its menu so well, that this is where we ordered our very tiny wedding's meals from. However, the experience of dining in is a little rough - when the dining room is at full capacity (which it is mindbendingly at right now, omicron be damned?) the noise makes conversation difficult. All the surfaces in the restaurant reflect noise, which makes it more than just fun-bustling... it's ear splitting. It's got wonderful food, but don't expect this to be an intimate dinner or a place to quietly chat.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: I traveled to Austin for a work meeting, and the start up to that event was lunch at North. I've never been, and while I'm not a huge fan of dinning outdoors for a variety of reasons that include bugs and heat, the overall experience was lovely - until I was ruthlessly pursued by a bumble bee that appreciated my lemonade as much as I did and then by a fly that wanted it's share of my delicious meats and cheeses. Eventually, my coworkers helped rescue me as I was the only one the bee and fly targeted. While I didn't eat the Zucca chips, it was a favorite at the table. I could have ate the crispy calamari and arugula for days! For the seasonal salad, it had a great flavor, yet I felt the salmon was grilled to perfection. The texture was perfectly paired and was still juicy and flavorful. I can't wait to return to North, although I may opt for an indoor seat.

reviews.author: Alan H.
reviews.description: Sometimes it pays to ask for recommendations from your waiter. We did just that and he recommend the Funghi pizza but adding spicy sausage. It was probably one of the best pizza I had in my life.

reviews.author: Braden J.
reviews.description: North Italia, appropriately or coincidentally located in the northern part of the domain, a spot that's been on my mind but just never got around to it. Glad though this past weekend I had the perfect excuse to go for a friend's birthday. So I thought, italian fusion to celebrate a birthday? Okay I'm in.  Atmosphere: Top notch for the atmosphere here. I will say again the location helps it a lot with a nice patio dining outside and modern vibe on the inside. The location is a perfect spot to people watch and/or enjoy a nice drink or two with friends in a shaded area. The theme overall has a modernized upper casual dinning experience.   Food: My party enjoyed a variety of food, stand outs for sure were any appetizers that have bread included. Cheesey Garlic or Shrimp with bread, you name it, all were so good and sharable too. As for myself as an entree I was caught between the bolognese or short ribs. The server was kind enough to suggest one, so the short ribs will do! Tender with just the right amount of potatoes and veggies made for a great combination of flavors when put all together.  Service: As stated above, our server was beyond friendly. Since it was a birthday our group may of been having too much fun, but the service gladly played along and still made us feel welcome and helped us with any questions.  Overall: With the impeccable service and variety of courses North Italia has to offer, I'd easily recommend it as another spot to take a few friends out and/or to explore some great Italian options. I look forward to return to explore the other pasta-bilities they have especially again the bolognese.

reviews.author: Sarina Z.
reviews.description: Highly recommend placing a reservation as this place is always busy! If not, you can always go shopping while you wait.   Solid Italian food that doesn't disappoint. They have something for everyone - salad, pizza, sandwiches, pasta, and also a big selection of starters, desserts, and drinks. I got the strozzapreti (chicken, roasted mushroom, spinach, toasted pine nut, parmesan cream) and it was delicious. The lunch portion was huge and lasted me 2 meals :)

reviews.author: Cindy W.
reviews.description: North Italia is always a great option for Italian food in Austin, definitely recommend this place! The atmosphere both inside and outside the restaurant is really nice and the staff are very friendly.  My go-to dishes are either the Chicken Pesto pasta (huge portion with a good amount of chicken and plenty of sauce to cover the pasta), the Funghi pizza (super flavorful and unique taste from the mushrooms), or the Cacio e Pepe pizza which is super creamy.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: It food it's amazing! I come here all of the time. Each dish is a wonderful surprise. Definitely worth the wait!

name: San Jac Saloon
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: If my husband and I are downtown we usually stop in for a drink here. Brian behind the bar is always fun to talk to and Johnny is always nice. I like this place because the bathrooms are decent for a bar, they have live music, there is a ring/hook game, and they serve cider.  Upstairs the other night they were having a comedy show which we sadly had to miss due to having other plans that evening. I believe they are doing more events up there but haven't been since during reopening after covid.

reviews.author: Helen C.
reviews.description: TLDR: Matt and Steve saved our Bachelor/Bachelorette party from complete ruin on Labor Day weekend. We owe them a great deal of gratitude for the UNFORGETTABLE, FIRST-CLASS EXPERIENCE in Austin!   I happened upon this bar when my friends and I were walking around downtown Austin for a combined Bachelor/Bachelorette party. From first glance, it seemed like a typical Austin bar. Later in the night, our party was moved from the roof top bar we booked at the Marriot Hotel to the crowded hotel lobby due to a severe thunder storm. Needless to say, our large party of 30+ was broken up between random groups of party goers, diminishing the original experience.   It was recon mode time! I called every available open bar in Austin to see if they were able to help our rowdy group. Denial after denial, only ONE bar was able to step up to the challenge: San Jac Saloon!! Matt was updating me prior to our arrival. He was friendly, respectful, and accommodating. When I first arrived at the bar, I was so excited to see the large space with a full bar and lounge area. I couldn't have asked for more! The party goers AND bride and groom were VERY impressed with everything San Jac Saloon provided in ways of atmosphere, drink variety, and ability to have a safe, fun celebration.  Steve was our outstanding bartender; he livened up the night with his humor and antics! It was such a wonderful experience that words cannot fully describe the sincere gratitude we owe to Matt and Steve!!   If you want to support an authentic, passionate, and all around AMAZING bar, please support San Jac Saloon. I'd like to think we got a nice, hearty slice of southern hospitality as guests and I would 100% go back again for more.   My sincerest Thank Yous to Matt and Steve! You two are superheroes.

reviews.author: Jane M.
reviews.description: Love love love the live music at this place! Such an awesome vibe. We had a fun night with friends while bar hopping in Austin on 6th Street. San Jac Saloon was definitely our fav. The beers op tap were great too. This place was super crowded on a Thursday so I can just imagine how packed it can get on a weekend. There is a speakeasy type quiter spot on one of the higher floors if you dont want live music. Either ways a great spot to have fun in Austin. Must visit.

reviews.author: Jennifer H.
reviews.description: First time in, but not the last!!  Great dive bar. Bartenders friendly and attentive. Live music was awesome (Chris Ray and the Nine Pound Hammers).  Great place to be yourself and chill out. Love it!

reviews.author: Karen M.
reviews.description: Absolutely amazing! Great live music, company's and vine. Dublin Johnny made our day by serenading my best friend in her birthday. If you are coming to Austin this is absolutely the best bar. Cannot wait to come back!

reviews.author: Marc S.
reviews.description: Cool place.  Stepped in for an hour for some live house band music 3 piece with the guy running his own drum set with his feet.  Bartenders were friendly, various seating types all over the place.

reviews.author: Margarita S.
reviews.description: Racist vibes ! If you are a POS or women in general this place isn't where you would like to be . Super unsafe . I've been sitting on these experiences for the last couple of months ago  and decided to write a review to prevent any other person from going though a experience like mine . Back in March I was uncomfortably sexualized by the bouncer Colton . When I explained to him that I felt uneasy with his remarks he decided to smack my ass in a "playful" way and laugh. I walked in grabbed my friends and left . Until this day it's really disturbing to me to think a individual like himself can still be employed in a high risk environment. Please stay safe

reviews.author: Jim W.
reviews.description: Weakest drinks of anywhere I've ever been. I've seen them pour 1/2 Oz shots.  Do not go here!!!!!

reviews.author: Cristiano D.
reviews.description: If you don't want to come here for the incredible live music, or the great drinks, or the great atmosphere.. then come here for Johnny. He's not Irish, he's from fucking Dublin, and he has been the star of our Austin trip. Wish we could bring him back to LA with us. So glad we decided to stop into this place.

reviews.author: Edward S.
reviews.description: San Jac Saloon was the perfect location for the final night of my group's bachelor/bachelorette trip to Austin. After unexpected lightning forced us to leave our original outdoor venue, Matt and his team were extremely helpful and provided us at the last minute with a private upstairs part of the bar to host our event. Even with very short notice, Steve the bartender gave us great service and ensured everyone was having a blast. Great drinks and great people in a fun space, I'd absolutely recommend stopping by!

reviews.author: Kristi W.
reviews.description: We were in town on a Monday night and heard the live music coming from inside. Went back to our place, Lyfted over and proceeded to have such a fun night. Great music- NCAA finals and the best part was STEVE!!!!!  We made a new friend in the friendliest and best bartender ever!  This place is not to be missed for a great live music/bar experience in Austin!

reviews.author: Tammy V.
reviews.description: Customer service is amazing. Live music is great. Drinks are strong. People are happy.

reviews.author: Kerri S.
reviews.description: The music was good and that's why I dropped in one evening a week and a half ago. However, they have this angry Irish bartender that was picking fights with several customers. Additionally, he sat at the end of the bar ignoring customers while he visited with friends. He complained when the customers gave him smaller tips and was rude the entire evening. You couldn't say anything without him yelling at or arguing with you. Not sure if this is the vibe the place is going for, but I will not be returning. I also spoke with a few of my local friends and family about my experience and they will be avoiding the place as well.

reviews.author: Tracy T.
reviews.description: We are so thankful that they were open when we visited a few weeks ago  AND they had live music. They practiced social distancing, wore masks, and even have plexiglass between bartender and patrons. We really needed a shot of live music and we got it. Thank you.

reviews.author: Victoria K.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! So we heard Jared was part owner and so we stopped by. We went earlier in the day  and we had a puppy with us. We met this amazing man with a beard (We think Brian?) he was so welcoming! He had us take a group photo AND he let us bring our puppy inside. I bought a couple shirts and we weren't planning on returning for the night since we had a reservation at FBBC at 6:00 PM. However unfortunately our two transgender friends had a bad time... It's a long story and we left a review on their page hopefully to fix the issue but we were so upset from the bad experience. So we told ourselves hey! Let's go back to San Jac they made us all feel so welcome and Jared and the other owner know how to run a bar. ID checks TOOK 2 SECONDS FOR EVERYONE We went back inside and the process was easy and we went back inside and walked upstairs. We spent 70 dollars on an Uber just to come back!! Brian was gone which made us sad because we wanted to tell him how absolutely incredible he is. But we met this very nice Irish man upstairs and he was incredible! He fist bumped one of us and we handed him a tip and man he was such a gem. The music in both areas was rockin and we felt so welcomed and at home at this bar. You see... we had some charity shirts for Jensen and Jared because I run an organization called Castiel's Angels and they needed updated t-shirts with their new television roles and charity organizations. We were told by Brian to bring them to brewery but after what happened we were like ... no let's bring it to San Jac. They took the shirts and we are confident Jared will get them without an issue. We will be back when we come back to Texas. We are originally from Nevada, Oklahoma, and California and this road trip was supposed to be special. San Jac made up for our trip and we were treated with such respect! Best bar ever!!!

reviews.author: Tonya W.
reviews.description: Our last night in Austin and we strolled down the street to San Jac''s Saloon and went upstairs and meet Dublin Johnny who made our evening ! Got the best drinks, great laughter and wonderful music !!!  Dublin Johnny is da best ever !!!!!!!!

reviews.author: Neena J.
reviews.description: Typical cowboy-ish western themed bar with live music. And this was on a Sunday night!! Full bar with open seating even a higher level with tables overlooking the live band area. The band played remixes of songs with a southern touch. There is a small dance area filled with energetic people!  The drinks are average priced with beers on tap.  Definitely had a good time and would surely return!!

reviews.author: Joe O.
reviews.description: If you are looking for a calmer 6th street experience, then I'd recommend heading for the upstairs bar as its more of a lounge than bustling bar.  Selection of whiskey, bourbon, and beer was solid. Nothing that will blow you away. The environment is mostly what makes this place a solid score.

reviews.author: Charles G.
reviews.description: Great service m still trying and always great live music. You can come any day of the week and crazy good music . So much talent. Decent beer selection and liqouy

reviews.author: Betty B.
reviews.description: San Jac Saloon is one of my favorite places to visit when I come to Austin. Great staff, awesome drinks, excellent live music, and Jack's Upstairs Lounge. Don't miss out on a great experience.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: The food here is simple and delicious.  We had the half chicken which was fried in beef fat but no batter. Very crispy skin but tender on the inside. The spinach and mushrooms were well seasoned and delicious.  The Caesar salad was amazing. The dressing was delicious and the chicken on top was perfectly grilled. The flavor tasted like it has been brined for a while--perfectly salty and tender.  The brown butter cake was not very good and the fries were just alright.  Overall, food: 4.5/5 Service: 4/5  Very pricey but you pay for high quality ingredients.

reviews.author: Maddie B.
reviews.description: I was seriously disappointed by my experience here at salt and time which had been highly recommended to me by a friend. They missed pretty much every mark in terms of a good dinner experience. Let me elaborate.  We got there an hour before closing around 8pm, and were going to try to get in and out quick and didn't want to make them stay too late after closing. Well, we didn't have a choice because right off the bat we had to wait for menus for probably five minutes, waited another 10 for the waiter to come take our order, and when we finally placed our order probably 20 minutes had gone by so we put our whole order in at once.  We ordered the little gem Caesar-type salad, a ribeye (MR) and Teres Major (mr).  We waited (literally) 45 minutes for our salad!!! Waiter kept telling us it was coming and at the 40-min mark he asked "you guys still haven't gotten your salad?" Seriously!!!? It's your job to bring it to us and we've asked you about it three times now!  Keep in mind the restaurant was nearly empty by now. When we finally got it there was minimal apology and he seemed very nonchalant like it wasn't a big deal and turns out it wasn't even little gems. I grow little gems and serve them at the restaurant where I work and was super excited for them but this was just a regular iceberg wedge. After 1.5hrs of waiting at this point, steaks came out. Sauces were all wrong and not what we ordered and my steak was over cooked! Clearly medium and not medium rare since my partners was cooked correctly, there was an obvious difference. But at this point, being checked on by our waiter was a ten minute affair so we just shut up and ate it because it was getting late. There were no apologies, no comps, and the waiter kept trying to push us on dessert when we clearly were ready to leave. Dropped the check and proceeded to say "there's no rush!" ... yeah no sh*t I can tell that's definitely a motto here. And on top of that there was automatic 20% gratuity. I usually don't mind that, because most restaurant that do auto-grat have good service where I would've tipped 20% anyways. but it should not be a motivator for the servers to not give a crap about their tables like it is here.   The steaks tasted good but for the price, the horrible service and the inability to get orders right, this place was a total wash. You can get better steaks elsewhere for a cheaper price, where you actually enjoy your dining experience. Maybe in the future if they got new staff or management this place could be a really nice restaurant but for now, I can't recommend it.

reviews.author: Keith C.
reviews.description: Pretty miserable experience. There were at least 5 open tables when we sat down so they were not busy. It took 10 minutes for the waitress to give us a menu and immediately ask for our drink orders. 20 minutes later we get them. We've been here for 30 minutes and haven't gotten to place our order yet.   I order the $52 filet as did my friend. I ordered mine medium rare, he ordered his medium. His looked well done but he likes his meat well done so he didn't care. Mine however was completely raw on the inside. Not "cooked rare" raw. This thing was seared for maybe 10 seconds. It was also very tough. The waitress just dropped off our food and we were waiting for steak knives for 10 minutes until I walked to the hostess and asked for them.   I sent the steak back and it took at least 25 minutes to get it back. At this point so did not want to pay $52 for a reheated steak so I asked another waitress to grab me a burger instead so I could get the hell out of here. They come back with my steak, which was missing a piece, that had clearly been thrown into an oven or microwave to increase the internal temperature.   If you're coming here expecting an artisan or holistic steakhouse experience, go somewhere else. If you're looking for some $15 cocktails to drink in a gentrified strip mall butcher shop, this is the place for you!   My experience was so bad that I considered contacting my credit card for a refund. It was that bad.

reviews.author: Amy M.
reviews.description: One of the best butcher shops in town. Quality pork chops and steaks. Well priced for the quality. Have not seen a NY strip as well marbled as what they have and the pork chops only needed to be seasoned with salt and pepper they were so good!

reviews.author: Ken K.
reviews.description: Great pitcher shop as well as restaurant. Service is a little slow but worth the wait. The burger meat is fantastic. A perfect blend of fat and meat. It is incredibly flavorful. The fries they have are also wonderful. Super crunchy and yummy.

reviews.author: Jinhyung K.
reviews.description: Came here on a burger recommendation. It was a nice little place for brunch. I don't if I was just bad at finding it, but apparently they only have the brunch and dinner menu on the weekend. The lunch menu is only offered on weekdays so if you're wanting to come here for the lunch menu on the weekend, you are out of luck.   But their brunch menu still does offer a burger, the Butcher's Breakfast burger to be exact. It's pretty much the normal Butcher burger but with eggs and bacon added on, and i think cheaper too. I got it medium and it was a nice, hearty burger. It was a juicy, steak-y patty and the brioche bun was quite soft. I probably should've just taken the bacon and eggs out and eaten it separately though. It got a little to big for me.   Beef fat fries are a must try though. Nice soft potato filling, with a slight crisp. I might be wrong, but I tasted a hint of cinnamon and it had a quiet deep fried donut flavor that I am all too familiar with. Very addicting.   Came here on a 1PM Saturday and there was no wait, but I do here it does get crazy busy during dinner times so make sure you have a reservation. Our server was really sweet. The place overall had a calm and chill atmosphere and felt very clean.

reviews.author: Kelly F.
reviews.description: Great Prime Rib for Christmas, we selected the Wagyu beef and it was amazing! Easy ordering system and our order was ready right on time, easy pickup.  We get a little credit for the rosemary and salt rub but honestly you need the top quality beef to start. Thank you and we will be back.

reviews.author: Wayne N.
reviews.description: Best burger in town without a doubt. My friend was singing it's praises for a while and so a group of us showed up all ordering it. Go figure. But it lives up to the hype for sure. It's basically made from trimmings from the butcher shop, so it's ground pretty fresh, seasoned well and honestly tastes almost steak like from the cuts, so highly recommend medium rare or medium on the burger. It's also massive, so no chance you'll leave hungry. Some fresh veg and a nicely toasted bun round off the sandwich. I would also recommend adding some bacon at least to your burger, as it's crisp contrast and who doesn't like bacon.  As if that's not enough, the sides there are also A+. The beef fat fries have a lot of flavor, but also thick enough that you can appreciate the pillowy potato inside. The what I assume house made ketchup adds some needed acidity to all the food but jives well with everything. The shishito pepper app is also really good if you can tolerate a little bit of burn.  Service is a bit on the slow side at the restaurant, so I would definitely recommend getting a reservation if you can but also being patient and just enjoy the decor and conversations with people. The appetizers came out same time as the food too, so waiting an hour for food at 1pm on a Monday afternoon sounds a bit long, but good thing we had good company at least.

reviews.author: Lisa S.
reviews.description: Everything on the menu is tasty (our group got a wide range) but it's the reverence for the meat that makes this place stand out. Every steak fritte from here on out will be compared to this one. Also butcher shop on one side and wine store on the other. Perfection!!!

reviews.author: Keith K.
reviews.description: Wasn't overly impressed. Actually, we were a little disappointed. We expected much more. The server spoke too softly and mumbled a lot. It was very difficult to hear what she was trying to tell us. Even the younger guest with perfect hearing said they couldn't understand her. Then the food came. It was like the Goldilocks story. Some food was cold, some was overdone, and some was just right. Austin is a big place with many other places to try before we'll attempt to return here.

reviews.author: Jesus Y.
reviews.description: Two stars cause food taste good, my experience the place takes advantage and price everything possible, they charge me in my burger the tomatoes the lettuce, the ice tea 3 dollars and the refill 3 dollars and the small glass of no more then 12 oz has 60% ice .... They charge me the fries and they add a service fee of around 20% on a 2 person 2 meals .  I feel sorry for the waitress I can see she was hesitant about bringing stuff to the table probably cause she knows they charge for everything.... Btw the lobby is close and we had to eat outside with tons flies joining us

reviews.author: Brad G.
reviews.description: They served me a sirloin instead of a ribeye. Lol. Having worked in the industry I politely asked two people if I had been given a sirloin by mistake and they both said no. OMG.  All the servers were in a bad mood ... probably because of something happening with the restaurant. I thought outside would be charming, but it was full of flies.  The catchup was great, though.

reviews.author: m k.
reviews.description: Wine shop staffed by people who know almost nothing about the wine on the shelves and are there to ring up a register that also doesnt take cash.....what a joke.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Brunch today allowed me to check another big name off my list. I heard their Butcher's Burger is the best in Austin, so with nothing else calling to me off the menu, I had to try it. It was ok, I think? It was so tall and hard to eat that it was hard to really process and appreciate the flavor. They cooked it right, but the runny egg made the bun slide everywhere and mayo seemed like overkill. The Beef Fat Fries were pretty good, but not so good that I felt compelled to eat the whole serving. My favorite thing was the Charcuterie Plate that we split before the meal, especially the summer sausage, mortadella, and unidentifiable pink pickles. My friends loved their Steak and Eggs. I tried a bite of a friend's French Toast and would have gladly eaten more! While we were waiting for our food, browsing the butcher shop was interesting, and I liked seeing what products exist even if I wasn't in the market to buy anything. Service was attentive. I'm already planning on coming back again sometime because I know other carnivorous friends will love it. But now it's time for an afternoon nap!

reviews.author: Steven X.
reviews.description: Absolutely loved our meal at Salt and Time. I got their burger and it was fantastic. Cooked perfectly medium rare, juicy as can be, and with a bun that really held up. The reviews don't lie. GET THE BURGER. Oh and the fries were bomb too.   My wife got the BBLT (beef bacon), and I have to say, it was the best BLT I've ever had. On top of favor, the portion was ginormous. Though, it didn't hold up as well as a leftover.   All in all, highly highly recommend, especially once they open dine in. The patio seating is nice but way too hot during the summer

reviews.author: Mary Jane C.
reviews.description: I love look and feel of this place. It's very welcoming. I ordered the butcher's burger with fries and Swiss cheese. The first bite I almost fainted! The flavor was amazing! Wow! I have a favorite burger place in Hawaii called Teddy's and so far I haven't had anything tipped that until today. I normally don't get my burger med rare but damn it was good! From the ketchup and the fries to the burger! I loved it! My first experience was great! Too bad I'm an out of towner! I'd make this a regular spot!

reviews.author: Tatiana T.
reviews.description: Went last night for quick dinner and was absolutely blown away. First and foremost the Beef Tartare is probably one of the best beef tartares I have ever eaten in my life - the mix of flavor was just incredible, and the steak was perfectly diced! I could eat this everyday. Absolutely superb.  We also got the Cesar salad to start which was another hit. For the main we shared the Wagyu NY Strip, side of fries and broccolini, and the sweet corn agnolotti. My ONLY complaint was that there wasn't a larger portion of the agnolotti, delicious stuffed pillows of creamy sweet corn. Service was friendly and hospitable, will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Barbara P.
reviews.description: Salt and Time, in east Austin, is a wonderful butcher shop, as well as a great restaurant.  Covid brought the addition of the upscale butcher shop, complete with many house-made items, terrines and fine meats...very impressive selections.   During Covid they also expanded into a new patio for dining, complete with large overhead fans, which made a very pleasant setting on a warm evening.   My daughter and I enjoyed a really great Charcuterie Board, that included 4 wonderful house-made meats, accoutrements and sauces. We shared it and both loved it.  We also shared their absolutely delicious Butcher Burger, made from steak trimmings. It was cooked perfectly and served on a brioche bun with all the trimmings, and the best French fries we've had in a long time.    We will definitely return to this east side neighborhood gem!!

reviews.author: Abby A.
reviews.description: Best butcher shop in town! If you're looking for a specialty cut of meat, give this place a look. They'll likely have it or be able to source it for you, with enough notice. Whenever I'm craving a wagyu ribeye or NY strip, this is my first stop.

reviews.author: Robert R.
reviews.description: Amazing! Great local grub. Best Berger I've had in a while. I'll definitely be back again.

name: The Tavern
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Lazar V.
reviews.description: From what I'm told, The Tavern is one of the first restaurants in Austin to get air conditioning. That history fact alone should make you want to check it out.   I showed up on a Saturday evening to catch a big soccer game and could barely find a spot at the bar to grab a beer and some food. The bartender was awesome and fun to talk to.
