No "here you are" or anything. In a hope to support a business during this time I would have expected a little courtesy. Let alone when you are operating at less capacity. Yikes, unfortunately next time I will be taking my late night orders from somewhere else.   I did add a star because there was a second bartender who was friendly to other patrons, but I had not interacted with her.

reviews.author: Tatiana T.
reviews.description: Love Jack and Ginger's, great beer selection and they have hands down the best Fried Pickles in Austin. They are super dog friendly, and love their large patio space. Their Crispy Chicken Sandwich is also REALLY good. It was our go-to when we lived at the Domain, and stop by now anytime we're there shopping.

reviews.author: Cara C.
reviews.description: Ordered togo Bangers and Mash, so good!! Always wanted to try it but I've never found a nearby place that makes it. The meat was AMAZING and the potatoes were so good

reviews.author: Jeremy E.
reviews.description: I was pretty shocked at how awful one of the bartenders was towards me for absolutely no reason! I mean really... I'm not someone who's trying to play as a victim here. I literally never had an issue with her until I was closing out my tab for the night where she proceeded to ask me what my F**king problem was! ...no joke! I mean completely out of nowhere.   I was so surprised by it that my initial reaction was to say" its probably not the best time to to talk sh*t while I'm filling out the tip section"  She proceeded to tell me how she "doesn't want my tips " and "management would back her up on that! "  The other bartender was great so I didn't feel I should punish her for this woman's actions. I tipped my standard 20%  and left a not so mature message on the recipe. Not my proudest moment.   Funny thing is I still have zero clue why she was upset. Maybe she mistakenly thought I was someone else??  Either way, I'm now conflicted if I should give them another shot as this interaction was completely uncalled for.   NOTE- if the manager or owner cares to look into it, I'm sure you can find the interaction at the very end of the night on your camera system 11/28/2020

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Excellent selections. Clean, open floorplan. The place has Big Brooklyn Energy - the decor is nice + minimal (raw wood anyone?), the employees never bug you, the music is always fantastic, you're in and you're out. The way I like it.

reviews.author: Joshua M.
reviews.description: Chill liquor store in a good location, it's really the only one around. They have a good selection of just about everything including a solid bourbon selection. Staff was friendly and very helpful. If you're in need of something unique swing on by.

reviews.author: Scott A.
reviews.description: The owners are wonderful people and have provided a local convenient option with excellent selection ! Thanks Zeke's!

reviews.author: Bill H.
reviews.description: We visited to buy some fifths of whiskey as gifts. Tucked into a new-ish, small strip mall in what seems to be a thriving part of East Austin. Our friend Chris (who we know from other hospitality ventures in Austin) was managing- and helped us navigate the various boutique brands- we wound up with a good selection at not crazy prices. Immaculate floor displays, well organized, nice vibe. While we were there, several customers came in and made purchases. Shop could use a more prominent sign, but isn't hard to find, with plenty of off street parking.  Did I mention Chris? He's the best. Great guy with a lot of knowledge, patient and thoughtful (also knows music!)

reviews.author: Zulaikha B.
reviews.description: We were on the hunt for shot size, plastic bottles of liquor and we definitely found it at this place. This quaint place had a large selection of the popular liquors as well as ones that I have a hard time finding in big cities (like Dallas). The cashier was super helpful in helping us with out selection and gave us his opinion on some choices we weren't sure about. If we are in need of more alcohol and we are in the area, this would be our first choice.

reviews.author: Cait T.
reviews.description: This place will do very well. Good selection, nice team working, and great location. The shop is clean and well organized. Love that there isn't too much clutter, but a great range of local liquors and mixers, too.  Welcome addition to the neighborhood!

reviews.author: Eddie A.
reviews.description: This liquor store in the heart of East Austin is just the place to go for deals on all your liquor,lemons and limes.The employees are nice and helpful and the store is nice and organized." W'ill be back"

reviews.author: Brad S.
reviews.description: Very clean establishment with a fair selection of every verity. Prices are the cheapest I personally found in a 15mile radius. Great customer service!

reviews.author: Becca R.
reviews.description: Disappointed in their customer service.  I bought 2 bottles of wine and a bottle of bourbon.  One of the bottles of wine was bad upon opening.   I went to take it back to the store and the employee's response was "Sorry but we don't take returns."   He told me restock their wine regularly and there was nothing he could do.  Obviously, I will not be going back to a store that doesn't stand behind their products or take responsibility.   So much for buying local.

reviews.author: Chris H.
reviews.description: I live a few streets over and have been eyeing saw Zeke's for the last few weeks.  I got a craving for a margarita so I decided to use that as an excuse to go check out Zeke's to get the ingredients for a margarita. The store is nice and modern inside and has all the essentials that you need.  They also have a very nice stock of Hops and Grain beers from the brewery a few streets over.  It's a welcome edition to the neighborhood and I'll be back again soon!

reviews.author: Julissa O.
reviews.description: Visiting from Houston and stopped here just bc we wanted coffee and Boy oh boy are we glad we stopped. So good and really cute place. The music was like they were literally playing music from my playlist. We got the Lemon poppy seed bread and blueberry scone were delicious. My hot cocoa was served with marshmallows and was so smooth. Mexican mocha was spicy but good. Chaga chino was good too

reviews.author: Chandan K.
reviews.description: This place is real good. The best coffee in Austin. I like caramel latte. They have tacos too but those sell out pretty quickly. Their everything pillow is really good and must try.

reviews.author: Tracey Z.
reviews.description: Cute little coffee shop in East Austin!  The coffee in my opinion is ok. Not as strong as I would normally prefer.  Not a good place to study either, the music is very loud and makes it difficult to concentrate.   I know that have beer and wine though, so I think this would be a fun place to come chat.

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: Stopped by this morning before leaving Austin for some coffee.  The male barista that took our order was so rude and snooty that it really took away from the experience.  If there was a coffee shop that defined snooty, intimidating, and snobby this would be it.  He just stared as we tried to figure out what to order, and made us feel like we were more in his way than wanting to help us.  Aside from the service, the coffee itself was pretty disappointing.  We got: -Texas Teddy (do not recommend at all.  It tasted like iced creamer with a splash of cold brew) -Vanilla Latte (this was a pretty standard vanilla latte) -Nitro Cold Brew (basic cold brew)  There's way too many great coffee shops in Austin than to waste your time here.  Do not recommend.

reviews.author: Natalie R.
reviews.description: Meh, it was just okay. They don't have many special espresso drinks to choose from, so I got a latte. They have a ton of coffee beans in small and large (5 lbs) bags on shelves for sale. It wasn't crowded, so that was nice. The baristas seemed nice. But I'll stick to Summer Moon instead.

reviews.author: Gregory H.
reviews.description: Not worth the money, sorry trying to support small businesses but this is one case I wish I would have just got Starbucks. No flavor at all!

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: Another coffee shop down! I've also had Cuvée in my Austin coffee bookmarks for a while, and I had pretty high expectations given the high rating. However, it's definitely one of those forgettable coffee shops. I ordered my classic vanilla iced latte, and I had one sip and threw it away. It was probably one of the worst iced lattes I've gotten in Austin. It tasted almost watery. I definitely won't be back, but I am disappointed to say that Cuvée did not meet my expectations.

reviews.author: Christine K.
reviews.description: Simple but good coffee! They have a nice, spacious indoor space set up as well as their outdoor space.   Parking: private lot but may be difficult to find depending on the time of day   Free wifi, dog friendly

reviews.author: Reza Z.
reviews.description: Love Cuvee and their coffee. We always have a great time. Unfortunately, today the cashier lady was rude and snappy. We all work hard during the day and this kind of behavior is the last thing anyone needs.

reviews.author: Vivian H.
reviews.description: Overall: Hipster joint with a good creamy latte.   LATTE: Ordered two almond lattes, with their homemade vanilla syrup. Foam was okay, and it had mediocre art. Taste was nice and creamy. Pricey for lattes, almost 13 dollars.   SERVICE: the lady who took our order was helpful and friendly; AMBIANCE: gives off an industrial like vibe  I do like their cup sleeves - cute and artsy

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came here in the late afternoon on a Wednesday. There were a good number of open tables, but it was around the holidays so I might've caught them on a quiet day.   The service was really friendly and I went for their recommendation of a Texas teddy. It's their nitro cold brew with some vanilla and your choice of one of their milks. With nitro cold brew being creamy on its own this took it to a whole new level by adding the milk, I thought it tasted great with their oat milk.   The two main downsides are that their drinks are fairly pricey compared to most other coffee shops in the area, and the seating isn't conducive to spending much time there. There are a good number of tables, but most of the seating isn't too comfortable and the tables are all pretty close together.   Overall, I think it's a good spot if you want to grab something quick and you're near by, but I wouldn't go out of your way to try them.

reviews.author: Clara T.
reviews.description: The nitro cold brew was ok, definitely not as good as Starbucks. I sat at Cuvée for about 2.5 hours to do work and the shop made me officially hate Doja Cat by blasting her music loudly the whole friggin time. My clumsy self dropped 8oz of my sour coffee on the floor before leaving so I was scrambling around the shop to find enough paper to clean up the mess. 2 employees just completely ignored it like nothing happened even though I was the only customer in the shop. I'm happy to clean up after my own mistake but would love to have a mop instead of ten tons of tissues / paper towels used. I guess it's hard for coffee shop employees to care these days when unemployment benefits are bigger than their paychecks.

reviews.author: Don L.
reviews.description: What's not to love? I can walk to this place. The coffee is superb and beer is great when you may not be feeling a coffee.  I'm a morning regular here and I grab a Large Drip Coffee and a TacoDeli Vaquero almost every morning. Thats how much I like this place.  Do I own some of their swag? Of course! You have to represent your local businesses or else it will all go commercial.  I love the team here - so quirky and knowledgeable about coffee. I never heard of a Texas Teddy before and they have them so there's that if you like those.  The wife always gets an Almond Milk Latte and a Zucchini bread.  Have they messed up our order before? Yes, they are humans after all. Have they righted it times 10? Absolutely, we always leave happy.  I've worked here a few times refilling coffee and listening to some great music here. I just love the vibe here. A great place to experience!

reviews.author: Emily H.
reviews.description: Twice now I've been here and they are so rude.  Will not come back.    If you don't ask if a customer wants cream and sugar (like every other coffee bar in town is doing), then when the customer asks for politely cream and sugar, you shouldn't snap back at a customer that the CUSTOMER should have told you.  And then when you bring the cream (but forget the sugar), you shouldn't muffle something as you're walking away, and then YELL at them "WHAT DID I JUST SAY!!??", as if the customer is a child, when they don't follow the instructions you muffled at them.  WTF is wrong w you.  This man was also asking me just 90 seconds prior if I wanted to leave him a tip on a $2 coffee.

reviews.author: Tony N Rob P.
reviews.description: It's great when you're new to a city and you get to explore and find your new spots!  Well this isn't one!  Total attitude!

reviews.author: A E.
reviews.description: The barista needs an attitude check. Asked a couple questions about the types of coffee and she was snippy and rude. Also she didn't know the answers to my questions. I would think if you work as a barista at a craft roaster you'd actually know something about, like, COFFEE. Having said that, the coffee is pretty good which is a shame because it'd be a regular spot if they weren't so damn rude. We will spend our money elsewhere. Officially our first bad experience since moving to Austin last week. Boo.

reviews.author: Merritt V.
reviews.description: Good coffee and a nice indoor and outdoor seating options. My son and I visited on the patio area and enjoyed the nice weather. Fun, clean, and good coffee.

reviews.author: Aalaya K.
reviews.description: We were visiting Austin and stayed close to this coffee shop. Since we needed coffee in the morning we just walked to this bar since it was the closest. I must say their coffee is simply amazing. The people are so nice too. Since it was our first time they asked what kind of coffee we like, how we'd like it to taste and suggested the perfect coffee. Ended spending an hour there, had 2 coffees and picked beans to bring back home.

reviews.author: Claudia W.
reviews.description: Remember to check-in if you come! You can get a check-in offer of $1 off beer or wine!  If you're coming here to catch up with friends or something it might be a good place to go but I would say that Cuvee is not good for work at all.  coffee: latte - really good latte art - very average tasting, especially for the price - would definitely rate lattes from greater goods and merit coffee better  atmosphere:  - seats inside or outside - outlets are hard to find - free wifi - no problems - dark - loud music  studying: - not good for studying - music makes it hard to concentrate and there were other people around talking loudly - lots of table space - dark, makes it hard to do work if you need to hand write stuff  parking: - small lot that's shared with a neighboring business, but I didn't have any trouble parking

reviews.author: Alaina L.
reviews.description: This is my fave coffee shop in east Austin!   Not only do they serve spectacular quality coffee, they also sell their product by the pound...and have a very nice selection of beers (mostly local) on tap!   I no longer live in TX, but as a flight attendant, every time I layover in ATX, I make it a point to visit CCB and stock up on a few pounds of their whole bean coffee!!! The Colombia, Brazil and El Salvador are my personal go-to's. The flavors really come thru in my French press. #cuveeallday

name: Hyde Park Bar and Grill Central
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Romy G.
reviews.description: I've been coming here almost 20 years and never reviewed this place?!  Here's a fresh look post-COVID. Since the pandumbic, HP has pared down their menu a bit, and it seems like the prices also went up - par for the course. I admit that at first I was upset that the fried egg sandwich was removed from the menu, that really hurt. However! The few times I've opted to visit since COVID have all been seriously five stars. The salads are way better than before, the pan-roasted chicken was mind blowing, and the black and bleu burger is easily the best I've ever had. Plus, the fries, of course.   Today we ventured out for a rare outdoor family dinner and it was top-notch. Although the menu seems smaller in ingredients than it used to be, the execution has really stepped up. The service has been great too. Can't wait to return.

reviews.author: Karen H.
reviews.description: This restaurant has really gone downhill! It's been 3 years since I frequented this central Austin restaurant weekly. We order from a wait person, I order dumplings. I was brought fried dumplings expecting the steamed ones I always had in the past. This service person did not even ask if I wanted steamed or fried. She just assumed! Then when she brought it out, I had asked I think it was a she if they not have steamed and she said that they serve them fried if not specified!!really? So I ordered the steamed and told her I would take the leftovers home. We ordered Wom Kim peach pudding. Mine looked normal with beautiful crust and his looked like it came off another table they cleaned off. It was shaved off and only half of a serving.  I was thoroughly disappointed in the service and the quality of their food.  Don't know if owned by same people, Vic? I will not spend my hard earned money where my business is not appreciated. I feel they think they are entitled, very sad they think that way! K. Hawkins

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: This review is for before the pandemic. Only went here once but it was in my draft reviews.  Great wait staff and a pleasant atmosphere! My waiter was very good with timing and seemed to know the exact time it was best to come around. I enjoyed his service.  The dinner salad was served on a warm plate. It would benefit from some fresh color like from shredded carrots. The small grape tomatoes were delicious. For the entree, I ordered meatloaf because I was missing home. It missed the mark.. maybe it was because it wasn't my grandma's meatloaf, but I couldn't eat much of it. It was meant to come with this meaty brown gravy. Thankfully I got that on the side. There wasn't a baked ketchup layer on the top of the meatloaf, which is often my favorite part.   This isn't normally a place that my friends or I would visit because it seemed that most of the food is pretty expensive. I had a gift card.

reviews.author: Miranda C.
reviews.description: 2 stars but just for the avocado fries which were perfection-- I ordered this place with Uber eats because of a promotion. The entree I got was the pan roasted chicken and it was mediocre at best because it looked and tasted like cafeteria food. Not likely to order again.

reviews.author: Suzanne W.
reviews.description: Yum - yes, please!  Hyde Park fries - what else is there?  Oh yeah, there are lots of fab dishes, great brunch, too. Long time lover of HPG!

reviews.author: Dustin C.
reviews.description: Never disappointed with HP! Great for lunch or breakfast. We stopped in and had to get our fix in. Thanksgiving meal was on point two years ago pre covid too.

reviews.author: Shaan D.
reviews.description: This place is an institution. I see why the fries are rated so highly, they are just THAT good! My friends and I popped in for Sunday brunch, no reservation and we were seated within 5 minutes. You cannot beat $3 mimosas (and they were on the heavy side). The fries are so unique. Crispy but not greasy. We had 2 orders of the honey butter chicken benny which was fantastic, but filling. You might consider splitting that with someone. It was just an explosion of flavors. The chicken and waffles and french toast were well received too. We had a great experience and hope to return soon

reviews.author: Jordan N.
reviews.description: Good service  Ok chicken fried chicken Bitter collard greens  Good mashed potatoes  Good fries Good biscuit and gravy (comes with fried egg and stack of ham)  Nothing really stood out although the best thing was the biscuit and gravy

reviews.author: Teresa D.
reviews.description: I have wanted to try this restaurant forever!  So cute!  I wanted that painting on the wall w/ the roses!  My husband ordered the HP Classic Burger w/ caramelized onions!  Oh my goodness!  It was SOOOOOOOOO good!  Of course, we had to try their famous fries!  My hubby liked their Hyde sauce! I  ordered the Asian Chicken Salad and ate every bite!  It was so good also!!!  We had a friendly server in training (1440) and he made suggestions on what he had tried (Chicken Guacamole BLT) so maybe I will try that next time!   AND...very close to 37th Christmas Lights, so I know where I will go this Christmas to eat and see lights after!

reviews.author: Dylan T.
reviews.description: Thank you from the bottom of my heart. This Thanksgiving I didnt have the time money or energy to cook for myself. You guys made sure I had a thanksgiving dinner. It felt very homelike. The stuffing and pumpkin pie made my night.

reviews.author: Megan M.
reviews.description: Over priced for poor quality food. No side served with sandwiches or burgers.  Chicken sandwich dry. Wendy's would have been better.

reviews.author: Mateo G.
reviews.description: This food was simple and familiar, but done right. I can't give something like this a higher compliment. It's really easy to do okay, but to do very great is a skill. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Marcus H.
reviews.description: The fundementals of the food here is excellent.  In theory the recipes are great and the food should be very good.  I ordered some takeout here yesterday and got served a burnt chicken fried steak.  When you're charging 15 bucks for a plate stuff like this shouldn't happen.  The cook can see it's overcooked, make a new one instead of leaving me pissed off and unhappy with my decision to eat dinne here.  Felt ripped off.  Weather it's old oil in the fryer or lazy/incompetent cooks.. pay someone a little more in the kitchen who will give a shit.

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: Food was great !! I was craving a chicken fried steak and I'm so thankful for the reviews that lead me to Hyde park bar and grill. The other entrees that our party ordered were delicious as well. Simon was our server and his clear speaking and explaining of the menu being our first time here was part of this wonderful experience. Thank you Simon !

reviews.author: Captain C.
reviews.description: Atrocious service. One couple sat for almost a half hour, and then went and DEMANDED service. I finally gave up on my waiter bringing me my drink order, and I just went in and took it from the bartender.   I don't know what happened to the erstwhile fantastic waiters, but this new crop should be immediately fixed/fired/waterboarded. We won't be back for some time. Sad.

reviews.author: Skip S.
reviews.description: Loved the menu. Lots of really nice options. Had the Pork Benedict which was great. Salmon Salad looked great as well! Next time I'm doing the chicken fried steak. The fries were great.

reviews.author: Rolando N.
reviews.description: Austin institution that has been around forever. I'm giving this 5 stars on the strength of the burger and those wonderful fries.  The fries are as good as it gets. Lightly battered with seasoning and a dipping sauce that just won't quit.    The burger was perfect. Super juicy, melted cheese, grilled onions, special sauce and a wonderfully toasted bun. Just perfect.   Service was great.

reviews.author: Skyla S.
reviews.description: Always a great place to eat with friends and family. We ordered the delicious fries for the table as an app, and we had $3 bloody Mary's for brunch.

reviews.author: William W.
reviews.description: I got my first Trump virus vaccine yesterday, so I celebrated by having chicken-fried steak from Hyde Park BandG.  I also got a small dose of HPBG fries.  Both were excellent.  It was more than I could eat, so I am looking forward to tasty leftovers tonight.  I also had a bottle of Domaine de la Janasse Cotes du Rhone.  A substantial celebration in my view.    The pickup was COVID- safe and friendly.  I brought it home and popped it into a warm oven (225°F) to keep it warm.  I am a slow eater, so that keeps me from having cooled off food.  After I polish off my leftovers, I am thinking of HPBandG Hamburger.  With HP fries, of course.

reviews.author: Audra G.
reviews.description: Everyone that works there is super friendly and the food is really good! I appreciated all the vegetarian options. Would I go there again...absolutely!

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: We did a wine tour of the dripping springs area, with hawks shadow being our last stop- it was absolutely our favorite. The view is unbeatable, it's absolutely gorgeous. They also have a dug out cave under the property where they store their wine. Contact them about setting up a tour for a really unique, awesome winery experience. They wines were great and cheaper than if you go further down 290 to Fredericksburg. On another note- Sam took AMAZING Care of us. He was super knowledgeable, personable, and made sure our glasses didn't go empty. We absolutely will be back!

reviews.author: Mitch M.
reviews.description: Beautiful views nice building but did a tasting every wine tasted like vinegar and cherry juice. The service was great!

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: The wines here are really good. They are produced here - true production (not just buying finished goods). Some with a smokiness - delicious! Vineyards ON SITE. Lots of great photo opportunities here too. There's a cellar downstairs where they have the barrels. Get a tour to understand the careful decisions they made to make these amazing wines! Owners are also on site and so knowledgeable. It's hard to meet people that are so dedicated to high quality grapes and quality oak. I've been to a few wineries around lake Travis and this one is my favorite by far. The wines are dry wines. They are not sweet!  Definitely worth a drive here!

reviews.author: Camille L.
reviews.description: I echo other reviewers in that this place is a gem. They have a great selection of wines and even better views. The chenin blanc and rose had enough buttery and/or spicy notes to be enjoyed during the winter. Their reds are impressive as well. We liked the Temptation. They do tastings and will throw together a mean cheese board. The day we went we got a spicy pepper jack that was lovely. There's plenty of outdoor seating, abs that's where you really want to be to soak up the Hill Country views.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Perfect place to sit back, drink some amazing wine and enjoy the view. The staff was amazing, they were all wearing masks. There was plenty of sitting outside and pretty spaced out. I can't wait to make another trip here especially when the weather is nice.

reviews.author: Dustin T.
reviews.description: Have visited twice. Yep. The first one was so good we came back.  It is very remote and takes some time getting to, but that is a plus for me. The staff are laid back and not pushy. We usually enjoy one bottle on their awesome deck. It sports views of the hill country and on a nice day is tough to beat. They also allowed us to bring our own snacks and set up our own charcuterie board. This is a major plus for me as some wineries don't allow this. Don't change this please; for me it easily earns 2 stars on its own.  Really can't think of anything bad to say. Great experience and hoping to make a third visit!

reviews.author: Kristen W.
reviews.description: If I could give this winery 10 stars I would ! We had an amazing time there! Enjoyed flights of wine with our "sommelier" Sam telling us all we needed to know and more ! What a wealth of knowledge ! He gave us an impromptu tour as well which we all thoroughly enjoyed ! Amazing amazing time !

reviews.author: Kaitlyn L.
reviews.description: If you are anywhere in the area, definitely stop by Hawk's Shadow. We had just left a different winery and had a poor experience, but Chip and Sam turned the day around! Even though their patio was pretty full, they both were quick and attentive and made us feel like we had the place to ourselves. They have a variety of wines and each one was very unique and tasty! The patio is lovely and the 6 glass wine tasting is a must!

reviews.author: Courtney W.
reviews.description: We went on the wine makers tour and absolutely loved our time at the winery... I'd personally never been in a wine cellar like this and it's comparable those in Europe. Wine was delicious!

reviews.author: Chantal A.
reviews.description: My family visited the winery to celebrate my parent's wedding anniversary. They are wine lovers so my siblings and I wanted to take them on a wine tour discovering what the hill country has to offer.  We came across this winery after searching numerous lists and reviews, and can I say we were more than delighted by our experience.  From the start we were amazed at the breathtaking location.  The cliff side view evoked a sense of peace and tranquility that we thoroughly enjoyed while sampling the delicious wines. Chip had such an infectious personality introducing us to the different blends while also interweaving many funny anecdotal stories related to each bottle.  It was a very different experience from other tastings, where our guide gave a more dry delivery of the wine selection not invoking as much feeling toward specific blends.  Not only was Chip a great ambassador for your vineyard, but the pièce de résistance was Doug's tour of the barrel room.  Doug's breadth of knowledge and true passion for wines made us appreciate more not only the wine but the vineyard as well.  It is always so exciting for us when we encounter other individuals who have such heartfelt passion for what they do.  We were a captivated audience from start to finish, and truly felt like we were talking to an old friend about our love for wine.  The years of hard work and family incorporated into growing the winery shows and was so refreshing to witness.  We drove back home and couldn't seem to stop talking about the winery and how great of a time we all had. My parent's loved the trip and now have a wonderful memory for their anniversary.  We've already been discussing future trips to come and enjoy dinner in the barrel room, so we will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Dani S.
reviews.description: I don't know where to begin on how amazing this experience was. I was helping a friend propose to her girlfriend. They wanted a dream proposal as they are a dream couple. From the first interaction to the last, the Hawk's Shadow team was superb. They were friendly, COVID conscious, and just a delight. They allowed for us to sneak a projector and photographer into the right spot. They were delighted to take home some of their wine. My friends loved it and cannot wait to go back!

reviews.author: Shawn D.
reviews.description: My wife and I went here with a small group for a tasting yesterday and had a great time! Very nice selection of wine made from 100% Texas grapes. The Riesling was one of the group's favorites. Our server was very nice and did a great job explaining each selection to us. Highly recommend stopping here!

reviews.author: Don J.
reviews.description: They say getting there is half the fun! That's definitely true of Hawk's Shadow Winery, accessible only by narrow ranch roads that wind through some of the prettiest parts of Texas Hill Country.  The end of the drive is just as pretty - the patio offers plenty of shaded tables with sweeping views of the surrounding hills.  Since it was 100º when we visited, we opted to sit in the equally impressive, air-conditioned tasting room with high ceilings and glass doors that roll up in more temperate weather.   The premium tasting will set you back $14 for six wines.  I enjoyed the white wines the best.  The 2016 Juliette Riesling and 2015 Luna de Oro orange Muscat blend were both clear and crisp. The 2014 Temptation tempranillo was on the hazy side.  My server also gave me a bonus tasting of the 2013 Wild Child, a syrah blend that I really liked.  I ended up taking a bottle home.

reviews.author: Carolina R.
reviews.description: This is a beautiful winery with delicious wine! I went with my partner during the week right after Christmas and the owner and staff are excellent. Very knowledgeable and took time to explain and answer any questions. We tried over 8 different wines. Their tour of their wine cellar was very informative. It's also pet friendly and they have an adorable dog Emmett who greeted us. Definitely will return!

reviews.author: Shannon R.
reviews.description: Good variety of wines. Beautiful views and nice venue.  Great place to just sit with a glass of wine and relax.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: I wanted to visit Hawk's Shadow due to the highly rated reviews on Yelp. Could this place really be as good as they all say?! It is! It just may be my new favorite winery around Dripping Springs/Driftwood.  TASTING: Tasting menu offered good balance of 3 whites + 3 reds ($14 for 6), all distinct in flavor. All were high quality - smooth, dry, great finishes and easy to drink. I was impressed with every single one! The Cab Blend (Fortitude) was my fav. Pours were a decent size and several different people served us; each gave a detailed flavor profileandhistory on the wine, which I always appreciate. What I enjoyed here that is different from other wineries is that they give you time to enjoy your tasting and savor each wine. Not once did we feel rushed. It was relaxing to simply chill on the patio, feel the nice breeze, take in the view, and slowly sip while chatting.   ATMOSPHERE: 10/10. Its a bit of a drive and more secluded than other wineries in area, but SO worth! Views are top notch. You can enjoy the panoramic picturesque Hill Country backdrop from indoors (glass windows from top to floor) or outside on the covered shaded patio. You feel like you're out in the middle of the country on a nice retreat away from the hustleandbustle of the city.   SERVICE: From the initial email where I made a reservation to the minute I left the winery, I felt well taken care of. Hawk's Shadow offers excellent customer serviceanda warm family feel. Staff is really friendly, courteous and engaging. I loved the personal touch of the owners walking around to greet customers/chat- definitely tops other wineries in terms of service.   Everyone in our group loved Hawk's Shadow and I will definitely be back. They offer the same gorgeous panoramic views as Driftwood Estate Winery (arguably, even better), but have WAY better wineandservice. So, if you're thinking about checking out Driftwood Estates, skip the crowds and check out this hidden gem instead!

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: I want to move here. Really enjoyed this beautiful and secluded piece of property, where you can sit our and enjoy the views of the vineyard. Service was great, everyone seemed helpful and knowledgeable. The dog was hilarious, he kept coming by and looking for food. The atmosphere was relaxed and very conducive to enjoying a nice glass of wine. We enjoyed the Tempranillo and suerte rojo. They had a great selection of wines. Definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Joan P.
reviews.description: The greatest hospitality! Feel like I just allowed to get tips, education and experience without being put down. So many of the "wine road 290" wineries feel they are too busy or prestigious to speak common "wine" language. Not here! We called ahead, as recommended by website. The GPS was accurate. A beautiful hilly route- just trust it!!! We were greeted -Sunday afternoon-as the Hawk shadow team was just cleaning up after a grape stomp. They invited us in to the warehouse to see the 14 vats at different stages of processing. It was very interesting to see the D stemming and the foam on the top of the juice. Sam then gave us a tasting. $16 for 4 wines and $20 for 6 wines.  Very Good blends with the different combinations from regional wines and Canadian Texas grapes. I loved the " tuck under " cellar. You take the spiral stairs down to the basement to get the "barrel room" experience.  The name Hawk Shadow is very heartfelt as well. The winery is named after their horse, hawk shadow who passed away in 2007.  In addition to the very spacious tasting room they have two different levels of patios and you can have awesome events there as well overlooking the beautiful Hill country. It's really worth the drive from San Antonio. Thank you Sam and Hawk shadow. I wish more wineries would realize that your total experience is based on not only the taste of their wines but how you are treated! Thanks and we'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Melissa A.
reviews.description: Best wine tour ever! We loved Doug and all his interesting stories! Can't wait to get my fall box of wines! #wineclubmember #wob #girlstrip

reviews.author: J F.
reviews.description: My new BFF.  A friend suggested we stop by while we were in the area.  This vineyard exceeded all my expectations; what a wonderful experience we had. Perfect patio for sitting and sipping some of the best wine Texas has to offer. We sipped a good deal and it was all great. Had a hard time choosing what was coming home with us.  This just ensures that we have to come back to get the rest, and then some. Barbara was a gem, very knowledgeable and easily shared that knowledge.  Sam , another asset to the team; great enthusiasm for his craft.  Chip is a delight, and I must say best shirt award! If you are in the area, this is a must; you will be glad you visited

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: A great winery!  This is a beautiful winery and a great stop if you plan on visiting the other winery nearby or salt lick BBQ. Everyone is exceptionally helpful, they have a very comfortable tasting room, but I felt the tasting was way overpriced, so I decided to just buy a bottle of the Fall Creek Vineyards Tempranillo to drink while the rest of the group had their tasting.   They have an impressive operation and make some wonderful wines, definitely worth the stop. Cheers!

reviews.author: Chica B.
reviews.description: I visited this vineyards Dec 23 in the afternoon.  We were the only one in the winery.  We received good attention from the staff.  The wine tasting was really good.  Got to get one of the bottles for a present and an edged glass to keep.  I plan to visit Texas in a near future and this is one place that I plan to come back again. Wine first and bbq later.  Of all of the wines Mourvedre was our favorite.

reviews.author: Nicolle M.
reviews.description: TLDR: relaxing atmosphere with nice white wines. Good on the spectrum of Texas wines but not on the level of French or Napa wines.  This is a great spot right across the street from salt lick. Parking lot is gravel but there's plenty of parking available. Hostess was extremely friendly and great conversation.  The wines themselves are good- we especially loved the Chardonnay and reserve wines. Based on Texas wineries, I have to say this is hands down one of the better vineyards. That being said, I have a deep love for Russian river valley wines (especially green valley pinots and Chardonnay's) and Texas grapes just don't measure up. Is that an unfair comparison? Probably.  Overall highly recommend visiting and supporting local. You'll want this on your wine tasting list of stops for sure, and best of all it's fairly close to Austin.

reviews.author: Trenna H.
reviews.description: If you're looking to have a nice day trip from Austin, Fall Creek is a great spot.  I love coming out here for a wine tasting and enjoying the outside patio and having the vineyard to explore. The landscape is gorgeous and the staff are so knowledgeable and friendly.  Most importantly, the wine is delicious.    Pro tip- for an additional $8 you can add on an extra tasting of the ExTerra Tempranillo (usually a $100 bottle). It's amazing and a must try.

reviews.author: Sametra B.
reviews.description: The wine was amazing!!! Needless to say, we will be returning on our next trip to Austin. We are huge Cabernet fans and all of the wines were delicious. We took a few bottles home. When we tried the Tempranillo and it swept us off our feet. We have since found some of these wines in our local Houston Spec's.   The facility is clean and the grounds are well kept. The restrooms are also clean!!! Our host was simply amazing and went above and beyond to explain the process and enjoyed the discussion describing the notes we would/did experience. Really enjoyed the entire experience.

reviews.author: Kara G.
reviews.description: Fall Creek Vineyards totally exceeded our expectations! We have been super strict about staying home during COVID-19, but my #1 birthday wish was to get out ... in a safe way. With young children. My husband called Fall Creek ahead of time and was told that kids were allowed and that there was plenty of outdoor space.   We arrived around 2pm on a Wednesday afternoon and were greeted by a super friendly and knowledgeable gentleman. I wish I had grabbed his name, because he was seriously amazing. He let us know that a food purchase was required to be served on premise, which was not a problem at all because everything looked delicious (we chose a cheese platter), and gave us a wine menu as well.   We selected our own seats and were able to stay away from the party that came in after us. Our sommelier was so knowledgeable and provided everything in a COVID-19 safe way. He was also super sweet to our kids, even though our three year old was crushing crackers on the table (we cleaned up after him before we left but it was still so embarrassing).   All of the wines were delicious. We ended up leaving with their Tempranillo, their Sauvignon-blanc (vintners-selection) and two souvenir glasses.   We spent about an hour at Fall Creek, which ended up being the total highlight of my birthday, but could have spent more time there exploring their beautiful grounds  had we not had a dinner reservation.

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: Texas has great wines.  A short drive from Austin (right across from Salt Lick) you can spend a few hours in the vineyard, sit in the patio, or stay inside. Of course, there is wine tasting and a variety of bottles for sale.  Fall Creek makes wines in all price points. From the quite good inexpensive wines to award-winning bottles for people who really know their reds. I am a fan of their Tempranillo.  If you are in Austin, it's worth a visit!

reviews.author: Elise G.
reviews.description: TL;DR: Couldn't recommend this more for a safe way to spend the day with your friends during (and even not during!) Covid.  My mom's in town so I wanted to take her to a winery semi-close to Austin but not too far away. ENTER: Fall Creek. It's been recommended to me by several friends so figured I'd check it out for myself:  PROS: Seriously the nicest staff in the world. Thank you Daniel! Plenty of socially distanced tables and chairs in LOTS of different areas of the winery A bottle of their amazing Sauvignon Blanc - $22! Great snacks to accompany (I got Pimento cheese) They had live music on a Saturday with a full band. swoon! Across the street from Salt Lick if you want foods  CONS: Seriously none. Couldn't have asked for a more perfect day. Can't wait to visit again!   Pro tip: go to Desert Door nearby for more fun. :)

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: FCV at Driftwood is a nice little winery, with seating indoors and out. When we were visiting, there was only one other guest present (midday Tuesday). As a personal recommendation, if you're trying to social distance, I would suggest visiting here only during the weekdays when it's less busy, otherwise it may seem too crowded since the place is on the smaller side.  The food menu mainly consists of cheese and snacks that go well with wine but it's a little overpriced. The staff was nice but they were just there for the most part, nothing more to enhance our experience.   3/5 staff/service 4/5 nicely decorated interior and exterior 5/5 with the right company

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Good stop on your wine tour! We opted for two full glasses of their most standout wines and although it was much more expensive wine than I'm used to, we did get a generous pour. The backyard terrace is peaceful and has many seating options. I would've loved to see an option where you could do a wine tasting outdoors, perhaps the same way you order a beer flight. I saw this because wine tastings are only offered inside.

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: We didn't care for this place that much. The dining/patio area was nice but seemed like some of it was off limits (maybe party rooms). Wine offering was limited. We had a Chardonnay, Tempranillo and a Lescalo. They were just OK but it was the end of our day before heading to Salt Lick so that could have had an impact. One visit here was enough for us.

reviews.author: Me Y.
reviews.description: Entrance is nice yet when you go to the back it needs a little tending. Table tops were messy, landscaping needs a little touch up, I'm hoping it was just a little neglect we might try it again later.

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: The wine here is really delicious. They are only doing tastings inside. The tasting is a preset menu. You can order a glass and get food outside afterwards. The service is great and our waitress was very friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Erica G.
reviews.description: After 3 months of quarantine, two of us ventured out for a bff day of wine and views. Our 2nd stop was Falls Creek....it was so pretty with perfect sunny weather and enough seating inside and out. Covid is still among us so they offer hand santizers but you bring your own mask. Most patrons didn't have on of course once they had their wine in hand.   We opted to sit outdoors. Tables are 3-4 ft apart in some spots so choose within your comfort zone for social distancing. We grabbed a quick glass of wine and made our way to the next stop.   Looking forward to returning with the hubby this summer.

reviews.author: Tina M.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our tasting experience here! We will be back. Knowledgeable and gracious, this winery is a must do for anyone in the area that wants an amazing wine tasting experience.

reviews.author: Christina R.
reviews.description: Went to Fall Creek for a wine tasting prior to dinner at Salt Lick.  We were seated in the indoor patio which was extremely warm.  No water was offered.  We requested the tasting - 5 wines that are pre-selected, you aren't able to choose.  After the second (extremely small) pour, we had to request water.  Decided to order a couple of apps for the group..we were brought store made hummus and pimento cheese - still in the plastic container, propped on a plate with a wrapped package of crackers.  Had to request small plates, which seemed to surprise our server.  By the end of the tasting we were all sweating as the sun was beating down on us and there seemed to be no AC. The wines were okay, but the experience and service could have been much better.  I wouldn't return.

reviews.author: Roy C.
reviews.description: Wine tasting was $20 for 5 small pours.  Can't select wines to try, only had 5 bottles open and only one was what I would have wanted.  Food prices were also high.  Place was fairly full but I don't know why.  Wines we tasted were fair at best.  Too many good one in the area to waste your time here.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: This vineyard was a delightful second stop on our day drinking in the Driftwood area. The wine picked by my group was light , refreshing and the perfect compliment to have after we had made a lunch stop at a brisket place. We had been feeling stuffed but this wine was so light and enjoyable to help digest our food while we enjoyed their peaceful tranquil outdoor seating area near a cute little pond. We also took advantage of their photo opportunity landscapes.

reviews.author: Mariz V.
reviews.description: I've had my fair share of vineyards from local like Grape Creek in Fredericksburg then to Castello di Amorosa in Napa Valley. I was embarrassed after taking my family to experience the wine tasting here. Although, some of the wine were fairly tasty, but the serving was small compared to the vineyards I mentioned in the beginning. I had never been to a wine tasting with a pour stopper that was new to me. Mind you they charge $20 per person for wine tasting. We were observing a table near us that was getting extra pour from the pour stopper technique. We decided to order 2 cheese plates ($25/plate) that came in this container after we finished it, which was a small portion by the way. We noticed that the container said "Best By: 2/12" we visited 2/13. So we alerted our server she politely checked with the back she was told that it meant Arrived By, which to me was odd. If it was "Arrived By" I think that's what they would've put on the container but I guess just to shut us up.  As to COVID capacity the patio was full we couldn't wait to leave. This is my family and I's experience I wish it could've been better.

reviews.author: Manuela A.
reviews.description: Our favorite wine spot in Austin. Their Meritus is a winner every time. Cute and cozy spot, very picturesque and everyone who works here is super nice and knowledgeable.

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: Great wine and a great atmosphere! We joined their membership May 2020 and keep on making the drive out their for tastings and special events. We even purchased their wines for our wedding (white and red blend)!!! Highly recommend going out to do a tasting and hang out. Plus, there are tons of other places to check out for food, beer, and more wine nearby to make a day of it. Adam, the owner, has created a chill place to relax nestled in the back of the property surrounded by trees. Parking is super easy!

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: Semi new winery with very friendly staff and kids friendly. They have 6 wines to taste, 2 whites, 4 reds to include a table white and table red and a port. Favorite was the table white and the cuvée. The biggest reason for the 4 and not 5 stars was none were local grapes or wines.  Props for the kids toys and adult size connect four and Jenga.

reviews.author: Anthony L.
reviews.description: We added this place to the itinerary last minute and I am glad we did.   This location is not a vineyard itself. It's basically an outpost of the parent company in California. Based in Paso Robles, Graveyard Vineyards is a small producer. The wines offered are all grown and made in California.   We opted for the tasting. They offered 6 wines for $15. We enjoyed generous pours of 2 whites, 1 rose, 2 reds, and a dessert wine. All of them were very good! You can tell their not Texas wines (in a good way!).   The staff was incredibly helpful. They offered tastings outside and were very attentive! I would absolutely recommend stopping by if you're in the area.   If you can grab a Malbec, do it!

reviews.author: Andrea L.
reviews.description: Our family was in town from CA and we decided we would go wine tasting locally and try some Texas wines. The wineries prior, all staff wore masks which was nice since we had a couple high risk individuals in our group. When we arrived at Graveyard, the outside was not impressive, not exactly the winery ambience. Once we got inside, the male was not wearing a mask (ok... fine... mask mandate lifted.... ) but he then told me I could take off my mask standing about a foot away, and I told him no I can't, we have high risk individuals. He then said to go outside for the tasting which we did. But honestly, who tells people to take off their masks or suggest they take off their masks during a pandemic? He has noooo idea of our health conditions, concerns or even has the right to even suggest on the matter. I was definitely taken back.  Once we went outside the table was just covered in pollen and debris and leaves. We were all so itchy from all the leaves under the table. Just no grooming or landscaping or care given to the on-site property. It was not a relaxing atmosphere whatsoever, as mentioned prior, a parking lot view/feeling.  The female local staff member had superb customer service, but again, in our faces pouring wine with no mask on. Out of the wineries we went to that day, this is the ONLY place where they were mask free. Although the mask mandate was lifted, we're still in the midst of a major pandemic and felt other establishments honored that respectfully. We felt very safe at all the wineries prior.   Grapes not from Texas.   Pros: Wine was good.

reviews.author: Jon H.
reviews.description: This review is meant as an FYI to those people who are thinking about joining the Graveyard vineyards wine club.  Graveyard expects you to take three shipments and are unwilling to cancel your membership before you pay for, and receive three shipments.  I have received two shipments and did not want any more Graveyard wine.  When I reached out to the wine club, the response was "you are asked to received three shipments; you've had two.  Your third one is coming up."  I am going to be candid here.  I just don't care for the wines.  I know others like them very much.  My sister, who lives near the tasting room in Dripping Springs, loves the wine.  There is nothing wrong with the wine; I just don't care for it and I think two shipments is enough to make up my mind.  I conveyed my feelings to the wine club manager and her solution was to downgrade me from a 12-bottle shipment to a 6-bottle shipment.  I really don't mean to knock Graveyard.  But my suggestion is to buy a case of wine and try it before you join the club.  I want to emphasize that there is nothing wrong with the wine; it just does not align with my tastes.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Graveyard is a brand new addition to the winery community in Drip, having opened in late January. They are an offshoot of a parent winery in Paso Robles, CA. The wines they sell are all produced, bottled and shipped here from that operation. They do yet carry the entire CA inventory but do plan to increase the Texas offerings.   The wines available include a couple of Graveyard's more affordable blends - Paso Tombstone White and the red blend from that line. Both are pleasant, sippable blends at a very reasonable price point. The red was light slightly complex mix of common reds produced at the parent vineyard. They also stock Ascender, a credible Brut. Their estate Cab is actually very good- a lighter Cab with a nice effect on the palate.   The lounge itself is pleasant and airy without being pretentious. The staff, especially manager Adam, are all personable and informative.

reviews.author: Wendy B.
reviews.description: We had a great time at our spaced-out table outdoors. The trees there are gorgeous, but otherwise, the view and ambiance is more of the parking lot. It was a relaxing time playing checkers and sipping wine under the trees, though. Our server was wonderful and covid-safe. Unfortunately, one staff wasn't wearing a mask, even inside, but we didn't have to deal with him much. We really enjoyed the wines. I know they are based out of Cali, but it was still nice to get a decent sparkling wine at a Texas vineyard. They were all good, but that was a nice surprise.

reviews.author: Stephanie K.
reviews.description: Everything is stellar from the staff to the wine to the environment! You feel like you are at home in your living room drinking great wine and chatting with friends. Mindy, Caitlin and Adam are awesome! Scream has to be our favorite red!

reviews.author: Whitney B.
reviews.description: Epic wine! Very nice people! Great way to spend an afternoon. If you are looking for really good wine and a tasting this is your place!

reviews.author: Lindsey U.
reviews.description: Great wine and tasting menu! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be coming back soon!

reviews.author: Alyson F.
reviews.description: We were sadly under impressed with this new addition in Dripping. We were given a room temperature bottle of Rose and were told by the staff it was "the usual temperature they sold Rose." I don't know about you, but I crave a cold Rose in this Texas heat. They ship in all of their wines from California so you won't find any Texas wines here either. Without good customer service or outstanding wine, we won't be back.

reviews.author: Jeff K.
reviews.description: Not Texas sourced wines, but absolutely incredible! From their parent vineyard in Paso Robles, Adam and company have some stunning wines. Super nice folks, too! Our favorites are the Chardonnay ( not oaky), the red blend, and their insanely good Malbec. We've been back three times.... they're dangerously close to our home.

reviews.author: DeeAnn M.
reviews.description: Simply the best! Look no further for great wine. Graveyard has the best red wines you will taste in this region. The owners and staff are friendly and knowledgeable. The tasting room is comfortable and inviting. Do not leave without tasting the dessert wine that is like chocolate in a glass! It is all good here so just go !

reviews.author: Ruthie W.
reviews.description: In planning for our day trip, I thought about checking out an olive orchard. Years ago, I had read about Sandy Oaks olive orchard but never quite made it out to visit. On my search online, I found Texas Hill Country Olive Company in Dripping Springs. The timing might not have been the best since the arctic freeze affected the olive trees. We did see both mission and arbequina a year and a half old olive trees. Under the shade of the oak tree and a breeze, we sat to listen to Cara (one of the owners) share the history of how their family business started. With a brief visit with the resident chickens we headed indoors for the abridged version of the mill tour. Finally understood how extra virgin olive oil is made and not to ever buy light olive oil!  After the olive orchard and mill tour, we joined the tasting tour ($10). There were so many varieties of olive oil and balsamic vinegar and flavor profiles similar to wine tasting. I loved getting to combine the balsamic vinegar with the olive oil and tasting with the bread and apple.  It was fun shopping at the store. Goodness with making choices though! I knew I definitely wanted their olive-based products.  Next time we'll have to stay and enjoy some lunch.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: You know how back in the day folks had a milkman? Well, I wanted a piece of that nostalgia but don't drink milk. What I do consume a decent amount of, though, is olive oil, so I went about getting myself a mOOn (yes, I did just combine man and olive oil and no, I'm not ashamed of it).   Really, I was low on olive oil and missed my window for my grocery delivery so took the opportunity to support local and explore Texas Hill Country Olive Co.'s offerings.  The website is super easy to navigate and they have a wide variety of olive oil and vinegars, along with bundles of multiple if you don't know where to start. I received my order within a two-day window during the week from Xmas to NYE, without opting for any expedited shipment, so that was a lovely surprise.  I am a fan of anything chili or jalapeno, so I opted for their jalapeno-infused OO, along with two standard olive oils just to have on hand. The 100ml bottles run $12 each, not including shipping (my 250ml that I usually get from Imperfect Produce is $4.79), so a pretty stark contrast in price. I used the jalapeno on popcorn the other night, as well as toasted bread, and it didn't really have any kick to it, which was disappointing. I was hoping that for the price, it would be a boombastic flavor ball, so I could justify its purchase and continue to patronize from my mOOn.   I am so happy I could support local, and maybe if I visited the estate, I would have a better appreciation for the product, but as a stand alone, I most likely won't be ordering again.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: The place is really not worth visiting unless you're coming out for the tours. It's a gift shop where you can already buy mostly everything online to begin with. The restaurant menu is terribly overpriced for what you're getting on the plate. Think margherita pizza but at the size of a standard flour tortilla.  My recommendation is to save your money, go straight to the olive oil section in the store, buy in bulk, go home and create your own tray of olive oils and eat it however way you want to enjoy it.   The olive oils are exceptional by the way. Infused garlic, rosemary and sola stella were my favorite. If you're into balsamic, the strawberry infusion was a surprise crowd-pleaser in our house.   3/5 stars for the giftshop/restaurant location. If this was a review specifically for the olive oil, I would rate it much higher.

reviews.author: Jay L.
reviews.description: I don't understand this place. It is basically a gift shop and a small restaurant. I wonder where the olives come from to make their myriad of products? Doest seem like the olive tree orchard is producing enough olives for more than a few martinis! We were greeted kindly at the door but there is really nothing to see here. We were expecting an opportunity to sample some of the products before purchasing but no tastings were offered or on display. So we are back to the fact that you drove here to enter a gift shop. Hmmm  p.s. I see after reading reviews thst perhaps large trees died last winter which is sad. It also appears that tastings are offered here but the kind lady who greeted us did not mention them sonperhaps they are scheduled or have been stopped for covid so check before you come so you aren't dissapointed like we were.

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: I highly recommend trying their award winning olive oil set (my favorite is the verde) and different flavors of vinaigrettes: white lemon, prickly pear, fig, etc.! I bought several gift boxes for friends and colleagues; everyone was very excited to receive them. They also sell pesto artichokes in a glass jar packages with a cute wooden spreader. Shopping locally was a personal goal of mine this year. I thought this place was perfect! They gifted me a box of very delicious butter pecan cookies when they rang me up. I ate all of it in two mins... couldn't even remember what brand it was.

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: Beautiful property although the olive trees look like they didn't survive the snowpocypse. You can walk around the property. Staff are very friendly. Supposedly the owner picks the grapes and they have a few types of wine that gets made somewhere else. Can't tell you how it is since I didn't feel like purchasing a glass or bottle. They don't do wine tastings anymore although there is a sign out front.   Their olive oil and balsamic vinegar was tasty on fresh bread. The flat bread was just that... flat. To a crisp. The margarita flavor meant some cheese and basil but not really any tomato flavor. Wouldn't recommend the flatbreads. It was a good idea but poorly executed.

reviews.author: Hal F.
reviews.description: This place is heavenly!  You feel like you have been transported to Tuscany, the scenery, the smell of the food and olive oil when you enter the place is divine.  I am in LOVE with this spot.  I went last week for my Birthday with Brother and Sister-in-law.  It was wonderful.  The olive oil is probably the best I have ever had, I ended up buying a bunch of olive oil after lunch.  We sat for two plus hours, eating, drinking and just enjoying the scenery.  We were so incredibly lucky because the weather was amazing, and there was a beautiful breeze so it was cool and comfortable.  We had a variety of different sandwiches and anti-pasta...everything was to die for!  I can't wait to go back.  What an incredible GEM.

reviews.author: Ryan D.
reviews.description: We had a fantastic time! We were already in the area visiting a distillery. Lots of winding roads to get there from Cedar Park but worth the trip. We bought bread and olives and had a flight of olive oils to taste with small pieces of bread. They serve wine and beer too. The bistro had already closed but we will definitely be back. The staff was friendly and informative. We even walked into the olive grove to see the baby trees up close. The Sicialian olives with garlic are amazing. We also bough feta cheese olives. The caramel sauce we bought went great with Frederick peaches we bought on the way home. We also had some delicious Gelato which was cold enough to take to go.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: This was our first visit to Texas Hill Country Olive company. The employees were very friendly and explained the ordering process. We were able to snag a couple rocking chairs on their front patio and enjoy the beautiful weather. The Salumi plate was one of the more interesting charcuterie boards I've ever tried. The cheeses were on point, some sharp and others soft with herbs and spices. It could have used a bit more jam and crackers overall. The view off the porch was worth the stop itself. Would definitely recommend trying when in the area and I'm sure a tour would be fun when the trees are in season. I was disappointed they didn't have olive oil tastings going on due to Covid, but I also understand.

reviews.author: Madison P.
reviews.description: I attended the Rockwall farmers market today, and Texas hill country olive company had a stand there. All of the oils and vinegars sounds amazing, but decided to try the blackberry balsamic vinegar. All I can say is wow!!! The blackberry flavor is strong, sweet, and so natural. I can't believe how amazing it tastes. I can't wait to go back and get the basil infused olive oil and the strawberry balsamic vinegar next!

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here on a weekday afternoon and bought several olive oils. With the yelp check in offer, you get 2 half glasses of wine to taste. I had a red and a rose - both were excellent. Service was so friendly, and this shop is endearingly charming. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: A M.
reviews.description: Food was wonderful and great presentation! Management and team really want customers happy.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: Fun experience, not offering tours due to snow storm of 2021 there is no harvest/olives in the field. This is not a winery as listed but can be ordered.

reviews.author: Mallorie T.
reviews.description: This place was simply amazing! Everyone who worked there was so kind and the food and sangria were great! The views were very pretty and they have a cute little porch you can sit on with super comfy rocking chairs. We got the bread and olives / olive oil plate as well as the red sangria, both were phenomenal! I will be coming back soon!!

reviews.author: Hollie B.
reviews.description: FABULOUS. Great experience. Must go. We had the sausage pizza after our tour and tasting and it was PHENOMENAL. The crust was so good. Probably one of the best pizzas I've ever had. The tasting was great and the history of olive oil was super cool to learn. Definitely visit! They don't have many olive trees right now because they lost them in the latest ice storm.

reviews.author: Camille L.
reviews.description: Touring the olive orchards was so much fun and an unexpected stop on our visit to the area. We've always wanted to do olive oil tastings and orchard tours in Italy, so were happy to find this until then. Unfortunately, due to the pandemic they aren't doing tastings at the moment. You can buy all the oils, as well as many other foodie items in their store. They also have a bistro with a nice menu, we came after eating lunch so didn't get to try anything. We tasted a few wines and thought they were okay, a little too acidic for our palates. The highlight was walking through the orchard and seeing the olive trees. I'd like to come back before the olives are harvested.

reviews.author: Gergana S.
reviews.description: This was such a great outing for a Saturday morning! We did the orchard tour which was ~45min of walking around the olive trees and learning more about the process of growing and processing olive oil, as well as the different varieties. Our tour guide was great - very friendly and knowledgeable!  The tastings are cancelled due to the CORONA restrictions but we had a lovely lunch in their shaded outdoor patio. Highly recommend the olive oil and olives platter.  Speaking of COVID, great to see everyone wearing masks and the business itself enforcing the regulations. Felt very safe walking around and eating there.  And, of course, we couldn't leave without purchasing some of the delicious extra virgin olive oil and balsamic (which is not made there but commissioned from the special region in Italy).  Would highly recommend, especially if you have friends or family visiting in town. It's a short 40-50min drive from Austin.

reviews.author: Liz N.
reviews.description: We had the absolute BEST experience here this past week. We arrived for an early lunch and got their charcuterie board to split along with an egg salad sandwich that came with a salad. It was a cold day out, so I ordered a cup of the tomato basil soup as well. OH EM GEE this is the best egg salad I've ever had!! It was Mayo-free and used their garlic olive oil instead. I got a bottle to try and recreate it at home. The grounds were beautiful. There was a pumpkin patch along with all the vegetables they grow on site. The employees were all so friendly as well. If you're ever in the area, swing by and give them a visit! It's definitely worth the trip.

reviews.author: Mele F.
reviews.description: What a special spontaneous stop!  We were thrilled from the moment we drove up into the parking lot. The view of olive trees covered in fruits for an upcoming harvest, the cute shop with must-buy oils and breads and cookies and the super friendly staff set us up for great expectations. And they surpassed them. The focaccia was light and airy and flavorful- a combo of traits i wasn't expecting in bread. The side salad with its basil olive oil lightly coating the freshest greens left me longing for more. So i bought the oil. We split some Flatbread and a muffuletta and both were scrumptious. I tried to talk my husband in going back the next day but we had to get on the road. Make this place a stop. It is kid friendly too. I never knew how beautiful olive trees were but it made me want to grow

reviews.author: Dave H.
reviews.description: What a great little gem hidden in the hill country . Texas Olive Oil company has it all - The store/restaurant sits on an olive orchard. They offer tours of the orchard, many times hosted by their founder John. They offer a wide variety of merchandise including amazing oils and wines. They also offer light meals and drinks inside of the restaurant. We tried the flat bread pizza, the anti-pasta salad, and a grilled cheese. All of it was yummy. If you're in the hill country, give it a try. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Nicholas V.
reviews.description: Beautiful property, great wine, and equally awesome food + service.   First time here. We didn't have any preconceived notions.   Normally I'm not a fan of Texas wines but their wine was fantastic and unique. The Spot and Love Magick stole our heart.   The food was super fresh. Got the salami and cheese board. Excellent.   Good atmosphere. Good service.   Cant wait to come back!

reviews.author: Danielle H.
reviews.description: Beautiful peaceful spot to enjoy our afternoon after a hike nearby. Wine was lovely too!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: We loved our time at Hamilton Pool Vineyards. The wine was all delightful, the food was delicious, ambience impeccable, and the servers were all as lovely as can be. The drive out was absolutely gorgeous and it was a gorgeous was to spend our Sunday afternoon. (Live music was a great touch.) highly recommend checking this place out.

reviews.author: Keith L.
reviews.description: Great spot after heading to Hamilton pool, met with the owner and had a great experience. The chief and workers were all very nice. They have several Texas wines and a nice area to sit out and enjoy them paired with small plates.

reviews.author: Russ J.
reviews.description: Service was God awful. Our server acted like we were an annoyance to serve and recited his 'script' with a sing song voice. Dropped the bread on the way and then didn't replace it until we we had finished the cheese and fruit. We still bought two bottles. Tonight we opened the more expensive bottle and it had turned. It was like vinegar. So incredibly disappointed. Hard pass.

reviews.author: Pam F.
reviews.description: The grounds are beautiful!  What a great backdrop for engagement photos or a wedding!  Take a tour, attend a farm class, or volunteer!  Have some fun!

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Love this place! The sparkling rose' wine is awesome. Food is awesome. Service top notch . For sure a cool place to come . They for sure are respectful of the covid rules. We will be back!

reviews.author: Kimmie P.
reviews.description: Was so excited to check out this place today. Our server was okay, but describing our wine as tasting like an aquarium was a turn off. Also, there was a kid camp going on and children threw water guns at our table while we dined as well as crawled around by our table. Not the experience we'd hoped for. Our server ghosted during our meal and left us waiting over 30 minutes to pay so we could leave. Wanted to love this place, as it is a beautiful property with so much potential. With a few tweaks, it could be so much more.

reviews.author: Liz H.
reviews.description: Service was poor, but wines were good. We had the basic tasting and tried 4 wines. We enjoyed the wines. They were not very busy, and our sever was not attentive.

reviews.author: Melinda N.
reviews.description: I wonder if it's a new winery. The parking lot isn't as big as others but the space is very nice, benches and tables under trees. The inside is small because it's in a cottage so there's a sign saying one group at a time. The wines are from California. You can do a flight for $15 or a glass. We all chose a glass (8oz pour) whereas a tasting is 6 oz. loved our reds. There's a sculpture garden to stroll. Lovely place for convo. Also we tried the fat boy cheese spread w ritz crackers and it's so good!

reviews.author: April K.
reviews.description: We had a very pleasant experience at Parmeson! The wines are super high quality and very enjoyable. We had the Rose and the Sauvignon Blanc, both of which were outstanding. Tom and Katie are wonderful hosts and the garden setting is a delightful place to pause and relax. Highly recommended spot for fellow enophiles! We will be back for sure.

reviews.author: Natasha Z.
reviews.description: Charming little boutique place and a convenient stop on the way to Fredericksburg. However perhaps I will be a bit biased coming from California and having tried some of the best wines, the wine here is not something for a refined wine pallet. It's a cute little spot to check out and try out but not something that would leave you wanting more. Sauvignon Blanc was the best choice of the flight and the others did not leave me too excited.

reviews.author: Jeff A.
reviews.description: Stop by and see Tommy at Parmeson Wines!!!  Super wine at nice prices too...  all good but I really enjoy the red zin, Pinot and the rose in summer time!   The new Alberino is very good!! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Lauren C.
reviews.description: I keep meaning to post a review for this winery. My husband and I visited them a few weeks ago to celebrate a recent job interview. They have only recently opened up, so we had never heard of them before and were excited to try them out. They had a very cute tasting room with nice stone that also felt very homey. The tasting was $20 and you get to try 6 wines. $20 still feels a bit hefty for a tasting in Central Texas for me, but their pours were pretty generous and you're not being served by someone who looks like a teenager who couldn't care less about your experience (like what Becker has become). All of these wines are from Sonoma. Overall, we didn't love the tastings except for the Zinfandel and the Cabernet which were absolutely outstanding, but I don't typically love lighter-bodied red wines or most reds from Sonoma. The quality is great, but a few of the prices were just slightly higher than what we can personally justify - I absolutely loved the Cab but it was $60. The Zinfandel was more affordable at $39. Their Wine Club gives you 20% off purchases which is nice, but it is a 6-bottle quarterly shipment. The winemakers are the Parmesons themselves and we had the pleasure of getting to chat with them while we did our tasting. They are a wonderful couple who were very welcoming and lovely to chat with. We loved hearing their story of how they got into winemaking. I would highly recommend checking this place out!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Happy to find this little gem of a tasting room! We've enjoyed CL Butaud wines for a couple of years after discovering it at Antonelli's Cheese Shop. It's a shared space with Wine for the People, just off Fitzhugh Road, which is quickly becoming a brewery/distellery/winery Mecca.   Whether you like white, rosé, or red, CL Butaud has what you want. Light and clean white wines. Crisp, but not sweet rosés. Love the BIG, BOLD reds. The Grenache and Tempranillo are both awesome! My favorite is the Cease and Desist, a 50/50 blend of Syrah and Tempranillo.   We've been tasting wine for years near and far. This is the way it should be done. Best experience ever. Reservations encouraged. Get your own picnic table outside and enjoy your stay. The sommeliers are friendly and knowledgeable. The winemaker, Randy Hester, will likely visit with you and share his philosophy and insight into the process. 100% Texas grown grapes.   Dog friendly. Outdoor games and food trucks forthcoming. Did I mention I'm so happy they've opened a tasting room!

reviews.author: Ashley K.
reviews.description: I soooo enjoyed my wine tasting at Texas AVA, which is a shared tasting room with CL Butaud and Wine for the People.    First, the outdoor space is great.  There are about nine picnic benches, well distanced, and most of them are covered/in the shade so you aren't baking in the Texas sun.  There were also nice design touches and little decorations, such as  tablecloths and flowers on the table, so the space felt very picturesque.  Next, there are three options for tasting: all CL Butaud wines, all Wine for the People wines, or a "duo flight" so you can try wines from both winemakers.
