reviews.description: Really beautiful scenery here, and overall a good experience. We came here after a visit to The Grapevine on our way back into town.   Most of the wines are pretty sweet, which I wasn't surprised by, I think it's generally a Texas wine thing. The woman behind the counter was really friendly with us and was happy to engage and talk about wine. She was very well traveled and knowledgable on many different kinds of wines and not just Three Dudes.   It's dog friendly and kid friendly here. It used to be named Three Dudes and a Dog but I guess they had to drop the The Dog part due to some legality thing.   The wine was a little too expensive... we bought a box and normally places will throw in your tastings for free when you do that, but they charged us for it. It wasn't a huge deal but I was a little surprised when she tacked it on to the bill.

reviews.author: Jill W.
reviews.description: Any event with endless wine and a riverside deck is worth attending. At Three Dudes Winery, the rustic atmosphere is a perfect balance between classy and casual. The wine tasting room is open daily from 12:00-6:00 PM, and their friendly staff make it a fun and relaxing experience.  The guys behind the counter are extremely knowledgeable about each of the house-made wines, and you can sample four for five dollars. Our selections, from sickeningly sweet to normal sweet:  Texas Black Gold. A dessert wine so rich you almost can't finish it by itself. A bite of dark chocolate cuts the sweetness of the wine to make it bearable.  Texas White Zinfandel. Fruity and floral. A little too floral for my taste.  Texas White. This one is a customer favorite with a great balance between sweet and tart. Served chilled, it's light and refreshing.  Texas Red. Smoky and slightly chocolate-y. They say it pairs well with barbeque.  The only downside of the wine tasting is the size of the room. Any more than six people, and it starts to feel crowded. However, the Three Dudes (and their dog) are talking about expanding the space. You can also take a glass outside to the patio or the deck.  I left with a bottle of Texas White and a slight feeling of disappointment: I did not run into three dudes or a dog. But I wouldn't complain if I had to come back a few more times to find them.

reviews.author: Linda V.
reviews.description: In the town of Lockhart a lady recommend  we try this winery since we r exploring the area. It looks small from the road but once on the grounds it is bigger. They have the grapes sent down from the hill country. They have been in business about 12 yrs and do not mass product or sell commercially...yet!. The white wines I thought were better then the reds! They were crisp but not to sweet, the reds were to heavy for my taste! Apparently they have a deck on the river to sip wine on but today they had wedding and reception to prepare for so we couldn't go down there. Certainly worth a visit!

reviews.author: Janet N.
reviews.description: I thoroughly enjoyed Three Dudes Winery! I came here for a school project and this was one of the best projects ever!   My favorite wine was the black gold! They give it to you with complimentary dark chocolate! Who doesn't LOVE chocolate?!  I wish the ambiance was a little better because this is one of the only wineries in San Marcos. The seating is nice but it's very limited!   The service was great though! The lady that was serving us was very knowledgeable on the wines and the history of the place. There are obviously better wineries in Texas but you should definitely give five dudes a try if you're in the San Marcos

reviews.author: Lynn R.
reviews.description: Love love love!  We first checked out Three Dudes when my in-laws came to town. I instantly liked the wines, and the vibe. Then... my sweetheart started planning our wedding reception  (the ceremony had been out of state). Bit by bit, I fell in love with this place. It was raining on our first visit, so I hadn't yet  realized how expansive it was.  There are 2 levels of deck that sit right above the river. This provides an amazing view of sunsets and allows a nice breeze. The structure is partially covered, with a stage area (we plugged in and jammed no problem). They have tables to rent, and are super helpful with setup ideas and flexibility.  They provide servers for the wine, and totally allow you to bring your own beers (no kegs). They also offer catering suggestions. You can opt to have them do the clean up or not.  The best part: our gal, Angela! Angie is professional and communicative, but more importantly  (for us anyway), she was nice. She was wonderful in offering suggestions and patient with our changing needs. She's genuinely just a cool chica, and an asset to this backyard treasure.

reviews.author: Kaether C.
reviews.description: Let me start off by saying, anything to do with wedding planning can be stressful. I am so thankful that the winery helped pretty much do everything for our engagement party, and took away most of the stress.   We had our engagement party here and the package included setup and cleanup, tables, linens, wine, and food from a local bbq restaurant for 50 people. Overall, everything was great! The winery was very helpful and even stopped a meltdown from occurring. I would recommended this place to anyone! The wine was amazing and the location is perfect.

reviews.author: Hannah G.
reviews.description: We love this place.  Angie is amazing great service beautiful location and even better wine.  After visiting we decided to get married here in July, and the staff was amazing all out guest loved the wine to. But I can not speck highly enough of Angie and her team, she worked with us, so helpful and always has a smile even when it started to storm she mar everything still fun smoothly.  We have signed up for the wine club which is also a great price.  It is worth the drive to visit this amazing spot, and drink great wine!

reviews.author: Caroline N.
reviews.description: Love this dog friendly winery. Amazing and unique wines. Really love the white zinfandel and the Texas red. Also loved the clerks. Really friendly, attentive and informative. Will definitely come back again with our pup!

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: This is a new winery.   Hopefully they have plans to grow their facility and quality of wines.  Now their wines in their tasting list are mostly sweet.  Non-sweet wines are not that good.

reviews.author: Kathy W.
reviews.description: This is a lovely place outside of San Marcos. We had tastes of each of their wines. The woman who served us was very knowledgeable about the wines and the wine-making process. The wines themselves were generally a little sweet for my taste although I enjoyed the Merlot quite a bit. They also have a nice port. The river deck is nice, buy a glass of wine or a wine slushy and sit and enjoying life.

reviews.author: Holly W.
reviews.description: This winery is so great! It's has a rustic country feel and overlooks the San Marcos river. It's picturesque and is a great venue for a intimate party or wedding.   Now let's talk about the wine. No it hasn't been aged for decades but it suits the down home Texas atmosphere and the service there is outstanding. The Cabernet is dry and light and the Chenin Blanc is refreshing with notes of pear and green apple. They also have frozen wine daiquiris perfect for a hot Texas day!   If you swing by I hope you get Angie to help with the tasting or general service. She captures the sweet southern charm of Texas and knows her wine like the back of her hand. I would recommend this winery to anyone. It's reasonably priced, fun and a great overall experience.

reviews.author: Dwayne S.
reviews.description: Alyse was fantastic!!  What a great line-up of wine and even better customer service!  Great frozen Bellini for the patio too!  We will be back!!   Ask for Alyse!

reviews.author: Rachael C.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped in to three dudes on our 5 year anniversary. We were hoping to stay and enjoy a leisurely bottle of wine since the weather was nice and the winery has a lower deck that looks out onto the river.  We graduated from Texas State and have spent many afternoons at wineries around the hill country, and this area is near and dear to us. Unfortunately, our experience at three dudes left us both with a bitter taste. The lady who was conducting the tasting wasn't very friendly and even though we tried to engage her in conversation she just gave short answers that left no more room for discussion. She then told us that they were holding a wedding at the venue and that we weren't allowed on the upper deck and could only go to the lower deck. This could have been conveyed in a friendly way - the upper deck is reserved for the wedding, but check out our lower deck, there's a great view of the river! Or something like that. Anything other than just flat out telling paying customers that they were too busy to serve us wine on the upper deck.  To sum it up: we were so thrown off by how unfriendly she was, we just left, and likely won't be back.  They do have good peach bellinis though and the Cabernet is decent

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: We went to Three Dudes for a wedding reception on a day that was too hot to be outside. Despite the heat i thing everyone had a great time. They have a wonderful covered deck like area and a lower deck a little closer to the river.   The wines were good. The port was surprising, it was a big hit that night. There's enough space and areas that people could spread out and have a good time with out being too far away. They have a little stage were two bands played.   I never saw A dude, let alone three. There were two women serving the wine, Alex and Dara, who were pretty awesome. Super nice girls, helpful to the newbies and a pleasure to chat with. They did a great job all night despite the horrid heat. The manager was always around to keep things running smoothly. Super nice lady, Angie.   -100 imaginary stars for the heat but that's on Texas, not the winery.

reviews.author: Bonny F.
reviews.description: Had such a great time on the patio with a bottle of Texas Red tonight. Angie and Michael are fantastic and make it feel like home. This is definitely our favorite winery in all of central TX to hang out at on a beautiful afternoon.

reviews.author: Nicholas A.
reviews.description: This winery is a hidden gem! We enjoyed our tasting at the main building and then took a bottle down to the deck to relax while looking over the San Marcos river. Excellent service and great wines!

reviews.author: Diane S.
reviews.description: If you saw the pics online and thought you'd be sipping wine in an Adirondack chair by the lake, you will be disappointed. You have to be a member of their club to be enjoy that.   However, despite this, you won't be disappointed you made the trip. The suburbs are approaching but there is enough open area on the drive there to make it relaxing. They greeted us as new visitors with a tasting of their Cuddles Cuvée, light and refreshing. We decided to get a couple of glasses of wine and sit outside. They have cheese plates available too. Their Chardonnay and Red Blend were very good.

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: Ok, it's a little off the beaten path from all other wineries in the area, but well worth the visit. They do require reservations, so don't forget to do that! They have a beautiful set up with great views and allow dogs on the outdoor patio. The staff is friendly and the wine is really delicious. We left with a couple of bottles!

reviews.author: Jim F.
reviews.description: Be aware that these people do not do anything without a reservation. They were nice enough to seat us but it was obvious there would be minimal service. The staff present were quite nice, just busy. We were allowed to buy wine to self serve on the back porch and were welcomed to be inside the tasting room or outside which was near the vineyard - very nice out there.  Their vineyard was planted in 1999. That may be a little unusual for the immediate Austin area. The vines and the grounds are very well maintained.   As far as the place, it is beautiful. It has the feeling of Napa but with Austin-area live oak trees.  The property borders Lake Travis though it is barely visible from the tasting room area. There's an exclusive members only area that is on the lake.  We purchased the Claros Reserve which is a Norton grape (hybrid) and is the grape grown on the estate. The wine was surprisingly excellent and cost $35.   I think that, with a reservation, this would've been a superior experience.

reviews.author: Sabrina R.
reviews.description: Our visit to Stone House Vineyard was a true highlight of our anniversary vacation and and a delightful way to cap off our trip. The property is absolutely gorgeous - I mean you can truly just sit and relax for hours while you take in the stunning view. I had made reservations but we arrived a tad bit early and Liz was happy to accommodate us sooner. I'd like to take a moment to offer my sincerest appreciation for Liz as she made this experience so memorable for us. It was our first proper wine tasting and she truly took the time to explain every single wine to us - notes/scents to look for, best food pairings, explaining the difference in textures, where the grapes are from - I mean the whole nine yards. She even showed us the safer, beginner way to swirl the wine to really delight your senses before tasting. I had added a cheese board to our reservation which we thoroughly enjoyed! Liz was patient with all of our questions on the wine (and cheese), had a wonderful sense of humor, and just a lovely personality to deliver a phenomenal package of customer service. Every single wine we tried was delicious! We took home a bottle of Claros but we seriously wanted to take home one of each. If we weren't relocating soon, we would 100% have signed up for their membership. If we get to visit the area again, we will definitely stop in. I highly recommend visiting!

reviews.author: Gina F.
reviews.description: Had an amazing time visiting Stone House Vineyard! I wish I had known about it before. A short drive from Austin and well worth it. The wines were excellent with a lot of variety and worth the cost for the tasting. The property is stunning and did I mention the view of Lake Travis? They graciously let us sit in the members area and explore the property after our tasting and I'm seriously considering joining the club. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Natalie S.
reviews.description: DON'T COME HERE WITH KIDS. Can't speak of the wine, because we didn't have any. No tastings, just by the bottle. No glasses and no kids aloud anywhere on the grounds. Disappointing, because we drove out of our way and had our young daughter with us. Were hoping to have a nice little picnic. Waste of time. It would have been nice if it were posted on the website. It was a beautiful vineyard!

reviews.author: Shannon R.
reviews.description: Good wine and great people!!!! Went to a few wineries in the area and this one is definitely worth the visit.

reviews.author: Shannon F.
reviews.description: Absolutely beautiful and handling COVID well. You need a reservation but we found that there was plenty of space and it was quiet and we really enjoyed that. The wine is delicious!

reviews.author: Sherry W.
reviews.description: This vineyard has a nice view of the water. You get five wines for $20. Only one wine was from Texas. A few of the wines were very poor in taste. It is table seating inside or  they have tables  outside. I prefer Spicewood winery.

reviews.author: Nikita D.
reviews.description: Came here for wine tasting and was very impressed with the vineyard. We were staying at Horseshoe Bay Resort and were deciding between several vineyards to try in the area. I'm really glad we ended up trying Stone House. We decided to sit on the patio for our tasting. I tried the classic tasting and my dad tried the reserve tasting. The wines were mostly from Australia. They had one of their house wines on my menu. I thought the quality of wines was very average. We also got a cheese board which was really good.  The area was picturesque and we were allowed to go down to an area for wine club members. They had an enclosed outdoor area for members only with a view of the lake.  Overall, if you want to go to a vineyard with great views, this is the place to go.

reviews.author: Chassey W.
reviews.description: This is a fantastic little vineyard tucked away on the south shore of Lake Travis. Sit up on the patio or down by the lake. The employees were super attentive and very kind. The cheese plate a great compliment. And they let us have our fur baby on the patio too . The special reserve Pinot noir is excellent!

reviews.author: Kelli C.
reviews.description: A beautiful hidden treasure. The atmosphere is fantastic- views of Lake Travis and grape vines sitting under a covered patio with a blanket and fireplace. It is definitely off the beaten path, but that is what makes it so serene. We enjoyed our wine tasting, and purchased two bottles of the Shiraz.

reviews.author: Ben G.
reviews.description: To start - what an absolutely stunning property! The service and entire staff was incredibly warm, friendly, helpful and engaging. We came with our 2 dogs and had a truly special, romantic early evening on my fiancé's birthday. The wine and tastes were exceptional and we will definitely be back! Thank you!

reviews.author: Lindsay M.
reviews.description: Had such a great experience here with my family. We came on a rainy Saturday and they were nothing but accommodating. We had the best welcome with Jaramy, she was so informative and polite. We were greeted with a welcome drink then walked through their wine selection. We decided on a bottle to share with an amazing charcuterie board. The outside patio was covered with great views of the estate. Overall a great vineyard with great staff.

reviews.author: Amanda H.
reviews.description: This is by far the best winery around the Austin area.  Great staff and there isn't a wine they serve that I would drink.  That's hard to say for most Texas wineries.  They have beautiful lake views for wine club members.  I highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Annie M.
reviews.description: Excellent vineyard. The winemaker is from Australia and they have wines shipped from their Australian vineyard.

reviews.author: Amy K.
reviews.description: Champagne and Rose' Lake Travis views. Absolutely beautiful and relaxing. The service is friendly. Dogs are allowed. Lake views. Relaxing lounges. Champagne is delicious and rose is more on the dry side. Love this place.

reviews.author: Lisa P.
reviews.description: From the minute we walked in, Jaramy made this a special experience for our group, me especially. She welcomed us and gave us a nice toast of something bubbly and told us about the vineyard and its owner, Angela. The wine of the month was Angela's Wish. I was having a particularly emotional time with it at this point because my beloved grandmother, Angela, passed away recently and had wanted to visit this area. I, of course, had to get the wine of the month so I could keep that bottle. I told Jaramy of my grandmother and the significance of the name of the bottle and she listened with an open heart. My group also got a nice charcuterie board and sat outside. Though it was pouring down rain, we still had a lovely time conversing with others and enjoying the view.

reviews.author: Brittany A.
reviews.description: Warm atmosphere and welcoming staff. Andy was very accommodating of my family and I. The wines were delightful and the charcuterie boards were delicious and had a good presentation. They really made sure we had a pleasurable experience. I will definitely be back in the future!

reviews.author: T W.
reviews.description: The wine was wonderful and the view was amazing!! Bo was our sever. He was great! He took his time telling us about the place and each wine. We almost didn't come because of the reviews about the lake being blocked off , a benefit for members only. We asked and they let us go down and check out the place, no problem at all. We were there for hours!

reviews.author: Matouš P.
reviews.description: Great place. We have been coming here for years and continue to enjoy. We brought our dog with us this time and really enjoyed an outdoor tasting. The wines as always are tasty and reasonably priced. Beautiful property, plenty of room to space out, and following covid protocols.   We called to make a reservation but got their voice mail. Impressively, even though we did not leave a message, Doug called us back promptly and got us scheduled for an impromptu tasting.   Their tasting room manager was our host and we had a great experience.   We will continue to come back!

reviews.author: Erika S.
reviews.description: Carson was the best wine person ever! He was very accommodating and knowledgeable and friendly. We recommend this place to everyone that comes to the Texas Hill country. 10 out of 10!! Carson or bust!!! We bought two bottles of wine because of him. We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Stopped by this place right before closing time. We were lucky enough to  be able to do a tasting. The Rose and Tempranillo were the best out of the 4 we tasted. The tasting was $15.   They have a cute patio where you can bring your dog. You can also bring outside food to enjoy with your glass of wine. They do sell local bread. The tasting room smells heavenly with the fresh bread right at your side.   Staff was great. Would definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Dana S.
reviews.description: We came on a Saturday without an appointment and they accommodated us anyway. Took their time and treated us like friends. Deborah was the best! We truly appreciated it all of the ladies humor and kindness. The wines were also just as great. I bought the swim spot and friends bought several bottles also. The grounds ate very pretty and relaxing. We definitely will come back on our next visit to Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: Leaving 2 stars: one for the atmosphere, they had a nice patio area outside that allowed us to enjoy the shade and still social distance, and 1 for the server who was pretty entertaining. I didn't really care for the wines. They had a bunch of roses which were mediocre. Not sure if that was them trying to find their niche. The reds were okay but nothing I would pay for for the price they were charging. One thing we were disappointed in was they charged $25 for an online reserved "tasting with bites" but when we got there it was basically just a tasting and we had to pay extra for food. They had a sandwich that was pretty tasty but was out of their sourdough bread. There tasting included maybe about 7 wines but I'm not sure if that was also because our server allowed us to try a few more. Didn't think it was worth $25 so I was surprised to find that the tasting "without bites" wasn't cheaper. I can go find better tasting wines for cheaper down the road... like at signor. I'll pass next time and try a different winery.

reviews.author: Vee V.
reviews.description: It's beautiful and so cozy with picturesque view. We sampled a few glasses before deciding on rose wine, round mountain, and white wine, swim spot. Don't miss this hidden gem. Staff is so friendly too!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Doug Lewis and Duncan McNabb are among the younger wine makers in Texas, but are rising the bar in making quality, well structured, Texan wine.  Their tasting pavilion is now open and tastings are by appointment only.  The tasting pavilion is beautiful, open, and overlooks one of their vineyards planted in 2014.  They have several acres of vineyards on site.  You can taste the current releases for $15.  The tasting is refunded if you purchase two bottles.  The bottle prices here compared to other Texas wineries are decent.    They make wines sourced from 100% Texas grapes.  I like how their wines showcase terroir driven single vineyard wines.  They focus on Mediterranean varitels.  Lewis makes one of my favorite Texas white wines, Swim Spot.  I wish they would can that wine so I could drink it while floating on an intertube.    I also like that currently their tasting menu shows the different styles of Tempranillo from different Texas Vineyards.You can really taste how the different terroir influences the varietal.  This is a great way to experience how the nauances of a growing environment affects the wine.  The staff are friendly.  They are not 100% familiar with the production of the wine.  But, can give you some highlights while tasting.  Book in advance as they are well known and can fill up for weekends several days in advance.

reviews.author: Kathy M.
reviews.description: I loved this venue! It was so welcoming! They have a beautiful covered patio with a gorgeous chandelier. We stopped by on a Thursday afternoon and happened to be the only people there at that time. Jarod did our wine tasting and he was both personable and knowledgeable.  We all enjoyed their Swim Spot white wine and I appreciated the fact that if you bought 2 bottles of wine, you got your tasting free.

reviews.author: Courtney S.
reviews.description: This wine is good, not over the top amazing but it's good. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The patio is wonderful. Slightly overpriced for the quality but we got a glass and were happy with it. Will come here again.

reviews.author: R C M.
reviews.description: I hate to spread the word, but this place is great. One of the best Texas Wineries I've visited. Rose' wines were very good Chien Blanc was crisp, dry and a great choice. The Reds were all excellent as well. Several of the reds will need some time in the bottle to mature, or a good hour or more decant before drinking.

reviews.author: Texas S.
reviews.description: On a recent trip thru hill country we stopped to one of my favorite wineries.  Swim Spot is one of my favorites wines.   All wines are made with 100% Texas grapes.  You can taste the current releases for $15.  The tasting is refunded if you purchase 2 bottles.  We visited during a busy time when the cold temps arrived near Halloween and the staff were very friendly and  they made room in the tasting room so you wouldn't be outside freezing.  Thoroughly enjoyed our visit and will be back the next time we are in town!!

reviews.author: Trent G.
reviews.description: Hot damn, I love this winery! They've only been open a few years, and have moved from a small tasting room into a large covered patio with comfortable furniture, big fans, and lights strung about the porch and trees creating a great modern design meets Texas Hill Country ambiance.  We most recently went out for their Rose Release Party. The event was fantastic with a full patio, live music, and dogs playing in the field outside the vineyard. This winery is less than an hour from Austin, moderately priced, and fantastic for all occasions. Just make sure to call ahead to book a tasting, and you won't be disappointed.   They've been bottling grapes from around Texas for the past couple years, and I'm excited to see them finally get their vineyard matured and bottled soon!

reviews.author: Nina H.
reviews.description: Read 4.5 stars. I have only been here once, but I know this place is going to grow on me.  Stopped in 15 minutes before closing time on Labor Day without a reservation, and they were very sweet to allow me a tasting anyway.  $15 tasting for 6 wines, tasting fee waived if you purchase two bottles.  Which I did. One summery white and one Mourvèdre.  The prices were quite fair compared to competitors and the quality was there.  The Merlot was absolutely the star, but I was feeling too economical that day to buy it at $46-ish a bottle.   The patio is beautiful and feels secluded.  The hospitality was great and it was a very chill atmosphere.  It did not feel like a tourist trap, which is so valuable to me.  I'm so glad they treated me well on this inaugural visit because now they have a devoted customer for many years to come. Cheers!

reviews.author: Angela O.
reviews.description: We booked a tasting with Lewis this weekend through a tour service (their recommendation) and we were so pleased.  The weather was nice but cold, and we were immediately offered blankets and heaters.  Kyle was our server and she was a peach.  She gave a great explanation of the wines and excellent service.  This is a winery we had never heard about, and we are so glad we went!

reviews.author: Chuck B.
reviews.description: Lewis Wines has opened their tasting room since our last visit and it only enhanced the experience as they retained all of their other qualities from before. Servers are still knowledgeable about their wine and winery; wines are still very good; and now you have a very nice area (indoor and outdoor) to taste. As always, tasting is a unique experience so not everyone will agree about their quality of wines.   The best thing from all of this is there are more wineries popping up to challenge Lewis. Now everyone wants to raise the bar to deliver the best wine tasting experience possible. It is great to be a wine lover!

reviews.author: J S.
reviews.description: The wine is fine but I cannot imagine why the guy working the tasting room felt the need to comment negatively on the large party outside, to (us) members picking up wine. Did you just complain about the very thing that keeps you employed? Yes. Yes you did. This isn't the first time the staff has been less than stellar. I don't feel the membership is worthwhile anymore.

reviews.author: Tiffani D.
reviews.description: Not impressed !!!!  1- they  make you have an appointment unless you buy a glass of wine  SO BASICALLY NO BY 2- no very friendly I've been to over 500 vinyard All over the US never ran into this situation EVER Guy manager wasn't friend asked me were I've been because he's only have ever seen appointment his totally misguided !!!! Enough said won't be coming back !!! If you can't stop in to have a taste that's not a TRUE vineyard !!!!!  Also ZERO Music so very boring outside

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: Don't miss this place!  We were recommended to visit by a server at a wine bar in Austin. Wow! The winery and tasting room/patio is lovely.  We could have spent a couple of hours just enjoying the view and the great wines.  Kyle lead our tasting and was happy to answer questions as well as talk about the wines. We bought two bottles to take back to Missouri. :) Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Kristin P.
reviews.description: Favorite wine tasting of the day. Kyle was with us and she was great to chat with and made us feel so welcome. $15 per person but free if you buy two bottles. The best wine we had all day and only location we bought wine. Outdoor area is nice. Views aren't as exciting as some other wineries but the delicious wine beats the views.

reviews.author: Tricia W.
reviews.description: Found these folks via word-of-mouth from a few folks in the local wine business. In the last year, they've expanded their tasting room substantially, though they remain "by appointment" at present. The current wine lineup is very Tempranillo-centric, and while there's much to be said and appreciated about this varietal in Texas, don't expect to find a large variety of wines here (the other two on the current lineup are a vinho-verde style white and a Newsom Cabernet). I must mention here that their flagship Round Mountain wines (and probably some library selections as well) are available for bottle purchase. The servers here have all been knowledgeable and provide a bit of wine education along with the pours.

reviews.author: Brad G.
reviews.description: We have been to the Wine Castle a few times on our trips from Minnesota. The wine selection is great for tastings or for just a glass. The employees are always friendly and helpful. The view from the back patio is amazing. Their entertainment has been nice as well. Overall a great place to visit!

reviews.author: Gurpreet L.
reviews.description: My friend and I stopped by here after seeing it on our way to Fredericksburg. We had no idea what it was but were thrilled to find out it was a winery! We decided to do a tasting so we could sample a variety of wines. I wish this place had more food options (they have pizza but only F-Sun).   The patio was gorgeous and although most of the tasting are done inside, we asked to be outdoors so we could better enjoy the view. Personally, I enjoy tasting that are poured at your table but it didn't seem like that was the case here.    The wine itself was okay. I wasn't impressed by the sparkling wines but the Mythos red wine was delicious! I'll be the first one to admit that I don't like red wines but this one was special. The sweet wines a nice finish to the tasting

reviews.author: Sydney J.
reviews.description: Im not a  wine drinker but for my friend's bday we took a trip to Texas Wine Country.  She wanted to try this place mostly for the ambience as it does look like a castle. I've got to say that pizza was flipping amazing! Only downfall is they do have a very large furry black dog that kind of roams around, who is very friendly and sweet, but he decided to takeoff with half our pizza, however they handled it perfectly and brought us a whole brand new pizza. We also then moved from one of the lower chair tables, to the bar style seating. Being that I'm not a wine fan I drink the Prosecco which we actually ended up buying a bottle of when we left. Overall good experience, would recommend a stop if your passing thru Johnson City headed to Fredericksburg, but not my favorite stop we made. (Trip was in March so weather was perfect during day and a lil chilly at nite so bring a sweater)

reviews.author: Vedette V.
reviews.description: We (mom, sis, and myself) saw this amazing castle from the road on our way to Fredericksburg. We HAD to stop!! It is a really cool castle! Not much to offer food wise as they only make pizza on Friday-Sunday. We decided to order the frozen sangria after having a little sample and the lady who waited on us brought it out to us with the plastic cup barely filled. She seemed to be having a problem with the machine and getting sangria out. She said she'd bring us more out but never did. Since it was $9 a cup, I went back in and asked for more which she cheerfully obliged however she should have checked back with us on that. We got a cheese and charcuterie board and it was so good. We sat outside and really enjoyed the view. When we were about to leave, I asked could we look around the place and was told yes. My sister and I started to enter the "Dungeon" and another employee stopped us and said we couldn't go down there unless escorted but did not offer to escort us. Then close the door so patrons don't mistakenly enter that room.  Cool castle but employees need to step up their game.

reviews.author: Christine F.
reviews.description: Picked this place to stop while visiting TX. It has an interesting building, grounds and the interior is neat . We arrived a few minutes early and had to wait for the gates to be opened. We were greeted promptly inside and offered the wine tasting packages. While we tasted the wines we looked around at the decorations , I loved the dragons . They have  an inviting patio with a great view. Their wines were not really to our liking , but not everyone likes the same wines. That is the beauty of wine. I'm glad we stopped and got the castle experience.

reviews.author: Lora L.
reviews.description: Nice find driving along 290 ....  This is going to be a gem of a spot when the construction over  yonder is complete.    Sit on the patio and enjoy the view and fresh air while slurping a frozen sangria.   I double dog dare you.

reviews.author: Helen S.
reviews.description: Very nice winery with great views and amazing service!! We arrived at opening time. Around 11am on a Thursday I believe there was only one person working throughout the entire restaurant and she was great, very friendly and on top of it; she ensured that our wines were refilled promptly. I believe the wines are from Italy, France, Spain, and some Texas wines. If you're looking for local wines only this may not be your place but we enjoyed the environment and service. Definitely recommended.

reviews.author: Shannon B.
reviews.description: The views here are spectacular...BUT...the person giving us our wine tasting was not at all knowledgeable. We had pre-reserved our patio spot and was never asked for our name. They just applied our credit based on us saying that we'd made a booking. We split a tasting and got a pizza. I'd love to review the pizza but after waiting over 45 minutes for it, we gave up and left. The live music was loud and hard to hold a conversation over. The wine was meh.  There are so many other places to go in Fredericksburg- save your $ and go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Anthony N.
reviews.description: My lady made reservations for me and two friends at $20 each for a nice afternoon of wine tasting. We were seated on the patio and ordered the wine tasting, a half charcuterie board and their "wood-fired veggie supreme" pizza. Before I get into it, I'll list the positives: The bathrooms were very clean, views were nice, and the staff was very friendly.  For a wine tasting in Texas hill country, we expected more local wines to be showcased but were given an underwhelming spread to try out from different countries. There wasn't anything we tasted that compelled me to buy a bottle--but what really stood out was the advertised wood-fired pizzas.   Anyone who was paying attention to how the pizzas were being cooked would have noticed that they were NOT cooked by wood fire but instead cooked in their gas heated oven on the patio. Granted the pizza could feed four guests easily, (you'd hope so at $25 per pizza) the toppings on the supreme veggie pizza consisted of just a small dice of raw tomatoes, bell peppers, tomato sauce, and cheese. You would think someone in the kitchen might consider adding some spinach or artichokes or maybe grill the peppers or roast the tomatoes! I may be spoiled because I've had some great pizza in my life, but damn that pizza was sad! Here's a tip, 290 wine castle--look into overnight fermentation for your pizza dough. Can you not taste how bland your product is? I won't be coming back or recommending this spot unless medieval armor goes on discount.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Feel royal for the day. Come out for a couple glasses of wine. They off appetizers and individual pizzas.   Suggestions They don't have beer options for folks like me but, the venue is a bunch of fun and the view on the balcony is great. My wife,  mom and friends all enjoyed our time visiting.   Moose out

reviews.author: deb B.
reviews.description: Loved this Castle gem!!  Had a great time with their tastings and exploring the dungeon and the castle top too!  Beautiful views and great staff!  Thanks for all the hidden benefits of joining the club!  Looking forward to the special tastings and parties!

reviews.author: Cynde S.
reviews.description: Lovely building but a disappointment. Definitely try the vineyard next to it instead. Limited selection of not that great but overpriced wines from anywhere but Texas.   Just FYI, when you go to a vineyard you are presuming they actually produce wines. This place only had a couple of Texas wines and I'm not even sure they made them!

reviews.author: Amanda-Jeremy B.
reviews.description: This place is NOT family friendly. If you have children and you are looking for a place to hang out and enjoy a "date night" without hiring a babysitter....this is NOT the place for you. The owner/manager called my child a distraction...and I understand wanting adults only time, but say that...don't say that kids are a distraction and that's why you don't allow them....however, they do allow dogs because they aren't a distraction...Interesting. And for those who say "well keep your kid under control" let me tell you... I come prepared with toys, snacks, an IPad, and everything to keep her busy, so let me assure you, she is NOT running around being a brat. The owner/manager is just a SNOT!

reviews.author: Mosi W.
reviews.description: Khris was amazing and I loved the tour to the dungeon and the view from the balcony. The wines we tasted were awesome and I can't wait to come back for the party in the future! You guys have a great person in Khris she made the experience five star!

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: You get there and the title says everything...A Wine Castle. And that's what it is! Not only the inside decoration is amazing, but the inside is as well.  They have a great selection of wines and some snacks are also on the menu  The pizzas are to die for. They are thin,  crispy and the flavors just melt in your mouth. They are very knowledgeable about their wines. I ws there with other "regulars" and I was treated like I was one of them too. Inside the castle there are little cute places around it where you can sit and have a private conversation.  They also have a private room for parties. If you get tired of being indoors you can also enjoy your wine on the back patio, and enjoy the view.  I heard of a dungeon,  but never been there. I would definitely go back and hopefully I get an opportunity to experience the dungeon. www.290winecastle.com

reviews.author: Ryanne D.
reviews.description: It's a really cool building and decor, the patio is nice. Bathrooms are cool w fun fixtures. Upstairs is neat. The wine is good. They do a dungeon tour which is $35 and I wish I had time to wait for the next one to do it. Might have been a better experience.  Staff was oddly helpful. Pours were extremely small in comparison. Bottles were pricy in our opinion.

reviews.author: Morgan A.
reviews.description: My friends and I decided to visit wine country and 290 Wine Castle was our last stop on our tour. Best winery! Depending on the way you come, 290 Wine Castle is one of the first wineries you come upon and honestly, I'd just stop and hang out there from now on. The owner "Uncle Mike" was so hospitable! Becca did our tasting, and was so knowledgeable! This was an amazing experience, the wine was the BEST and the Castle was so beautiful!

reviews.author: Bret B.
reviews.description: Very cool environment, awesome castle layout with a private dungeon and turrets. Loved all the red wines we tried and became members, so we'll be back for sure. Great view off the patio, still have to try the woodfired pizzas!

reviews.author: Laura G.
reviews.description: Friendly staff with fun events. Always accommodating. Pizza awesome. Pet friendly. Enjoy the winery so much we joined the wine club. No regrets.

reviews.author: Julia F.
reviews.description: Went here on a wine tour. I work in the industry so I do not question their judgement to cut my aunt off as she was being loud on her birthday. What did not make sense was the OWNER deciding to cut off the entire group. Four of us did not and never did show signs of intoxication: I've been a bartender for 10+ years. We never challenged this even if we didn't agree, we did mention how the other owner never once was wearing a mask: a regulation by law that's still in affect. After that he threatened to call the police on our group.  During this interaction, I had left my jacket in the bathroom. I asked a bartender and the OWNER about the jacket and they immediately knew what I was referring to. I never described this jacket but they did on the spot, meaning they'd seen it. Yet, after we asked why the entire group was cut off and pointed out the owners lack of responsibility to wearing a mask... my jacket was never seen. I needed to leave the property. They and their staff felt confident enough to yell, scream and talk back to me without hesitation. I simply wanted my property which they had in their possession from the beginning.   Maybe they don't care about wine tour costumers but about 4+ of us intended on buying a bottle. Glad we didn't.   There are SOOOOO many other winery's in the area worthy of your money and time. Highly don't recommend this establishment, I have over 11 years in the service industry and I have never dealt with such unprofessional workers, especially coming from OWNERS.   Go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Haleigh P.
reviews.description: We came in on our makeshift wine tours of Fredericksburg- The grounds at this winery are beautiful! We sat outside and sampled some of their options. They had 3 options- dry, sweet, and ports. Mary, who was working that day, gave us a run down on their wines and was overall the sweetest lady! If you are looking to spend time outdoors with friends or family, this is a great location!

reviews.author: Matouš P.
reviews.description: For years, Texas Hills was our go to winery. They used to have a reasonably priced tasting and many reasonably priced wines that we really loved. We generally left with 6 - 12 bottles when we made our stop.   Last time, the tasting was up to $22, and very few of the wines were anything worth buying. Also, they claim to be dog friendly, but their off leash dog does not seem to like other dogs being there, probably better to just say you are not dog friendly.   Sadly, I don't see us coming back. Too many other great choices. I gave them a second star because of fond memories of what it used to be.

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: We went there to celebrate my friend's 50th bday. Luckily her bday was during their annual grape stomp celebration, which is done to honor the harvest season. This is done during the month of August.  She experienced the grape stomping and got a t-shirt. And we also had our feet in it! T-shirts are also available for purchase at this event. Since the day it was all about her, I can tell you that she had a blast. And so did we! We were treated like royalties and we were not in a castle. They have a tasting room, a small gift shop, indoor and outdoor sitting. Wine club is also available. Check their website for future events, and keep in touch to see what's going on.  They can also ship wine. Isn't that amazing! https://www.texashillsvineyard.com/

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: I went with my girlfriends for a wine tasting weekend and we stopped here to take a look. The wine tasting room can get a little crowded, but they do have outside seating if you plan to have a glass or a bottle. The tastings are fairly priced. The reds are $6 for $10 and the whites are 3 for $5. I had the reds since the whites were all considered sweet. My favorite red was the Sangiovese.   They sell the usual wine store items inside their tasting room. The day we were there, they had someone sampling their balsamic vinegar and oils.  For those wanting to take a bottle outside, they will place it in a chiller for you. You can purchase cheese and crackers from them, but they also let you bring your own food. They did have a food truck the day I went.   The property is beautiful and it has big trees that provide good shade. They also have a covered patio.

reviews.author: Cristina R.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this wine tasting, and our group even got a mini tour of the barrel room and mobile bottling station! My fave taste was probably the Barbera, which was very fruity and drinkable. If you purchase a bottle, the tasting (which is normally $10) is free. Since most bottles are only around $15, this is SO WORTH IT! We got a bottle of the Due Bianco to give as a gift. The shop and grounds are lovely, and we got to play with their dog. A great start to our wine tour!

reviews.author: Paula R.
reviews.description: We were excited to experience Texas Hill Country, tasting wine.. only to be hit with a $22 tasting fee each for small pours, unpleasant aromas and inexperienced wine sommelier. The wines were priced low to offset the tasting fee, but not worth the time. We were given our glasses.

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed the tasting! Went home with a bottle of Kick Butt Cab but all the wines were good. Super welcoming staff and kid friendly vineyard. Sweet lab Lily entertained my kids. Would definitely return!

reviews.author: Ryanne D.
reviews.description: I've been here before, definitely a repeat customer. The property is beautiful, the tasting room is cute and clean and the restrooms are VERY clean. The wine is a definite bonus. I'm a red drinker, however on this trip found that I love their 2015 Chardonnay. Custer service is always excellent. They are friendly and outgoing and chatty. I will always return!!!

reviews.author: Rosalind C.
reviews.description: 3 for the wine but it's for the wine only. The staff working there were so standoffish it makes you want to leave. We came here while visiting wine country and when we walked in it was complete silence. No welcome, nothing. I walked up to the counter where a lady was standing and still nothing. I had to say hello this is my first time here can you please explain how it works. She then proceeded to talk. My friend and I did the wine tasting and toward the end she eventually loosened up. It was like pulling teeth. I would not recommend if your looking for a fun interactive atmosphere. The wine was good  but man the staff was not.

reviews.author: Marjorie P.
reviews.description: We were charged $22 per person for a wine tasting which didn't even total a glass of wine.  This was after purchasing several bottles.  It was shocking so beware.

reviews.author: Jamie A.
reviews.description: On family vacation and wanted to buy some Texas made wine before we headed home. We are glad we found it here! A friendly chocolate lab named Lily greeted us out front and the owner greeted us when we made our way inside.  We enjoyed the tasting of 6 different wines and each one was very good. The knowledge and humor of the staff was on point. We very much enjoyed ourselves. Lots of cute things to buy in the store area. We had our young daughter with us and didn't expect it to be too kid-friendly, but they tried to interact with her which I appreciated.  Would be nice to have had a table with chairs or some sort of sitting area inside because we may have stayed longer and enjoyed a couple glasses. The outside patio was very nice, but we were not up for being out in the heat today.  We bought a few of our favorites and are considering joining their wine club.

reviews.author: Nicole Q.
reviews.description: The wine I tried in house was great! Bought two bottles to take home for holidays. Eeeck. Both smelled of vinegar when opened. I was excited to boast about local vineyard, but not today unfortunately. I have extra star for hospitality and gift shop experience.

reviews.author: LouAnn G.
reviews.description: This a true Gem in the Hill Country with amazing wine and the owners and staff are truly great people.  The Paella Dinner with wine pairings was amazing.  The Paella was better than what we had in Spain.  Can't wait to got to another event an help with the grape picking in the summer!

reviews.author: Beverly B.
reviews.description: I visited this vineyard as part of a bachelorette's trip. I've visited in the past and the venue has been updated. This time we were able to go into the tasting room, but it did get crowded. We were part of a large group and space was limited. We enjoyed a surprising 6 different wines! The restrooms were very clean as well as the remainder of the property. I'd recommend this vineyard to anyone.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Located on the drive to Pedernales Falls is Texas Hills Vineyards, just a hop skip and a jump from the 290 wine road.  As you enter the property you will be greeted by the estate vineyard, and the beautiful hacienda like building nestled back amongst the trees.    They use sustainable organic methods to grow the vineyard, and the tasting room was built utilizing environmentally friendly methods.  They used earth from the property for the building, utilizing an older technique called "rammed earth".  They utilize only Texas sourced grapes for their wines, except for one wine on the menu that is a collaboration with another winemaker friend I am told.  They were the first producer of Pinot Grigio in Texas, and we have them to thank for the 290 wine road being founded.    The experience here can vary based on who is serving you, and when.  The tasting room bar is small and can feel very cramped amongst the unique gift shop items they have.  I tend to stay away from Saturday's as you can just feel like you are being rushed through amongst the crowds. Also, not all the staff are as knowledgeable as others.  No matter what, I have never had an experience with anyone who wasn't friendly here.  I have always felt like this was more of a homey wine tasting experience.  For a more informative and intimate feeling, come on a weekday or Sunday.  However, for $5 for 5 tastings of your choice from the menu, that is a tough price to beat.  Plus, the bottles of wine are very reasonable with the majority between $12-20.    I find the price point matches the quality of the wine here.  Pretty good Texas house wine.  I find the reds to be better than the whites   My two favorites are the Moscato (great with spicy foods) and the Kick Butt Cab.

reviews.author: Carolyn S.
reviews.description: This was my second winery to attend, ever. I didn't really know what to expect because the first winery was very quiet and serene. This unfortunately was not. It was packed full of a large group of drunk ladies who were whooping and hollering where the wine seller were even squinting their eyes. Our seller was nice but was pretty concerned with the other ladies around the main table so we didn't get as much attention as we thought we would in this area. Though the wine options were delightful our favorite experiences were the nice area outside, on the picnic table while we sipped our wine and dined on cheese and crackers. We bought a couple of bottles to take home and would really like to come back and try the experience again.

reviews.author: Annie M.
reviews.description: Beautiful vineyard. Looks like Italy. Wines are combination or Italian wines and Texas grapes. Excellent Chardonnay and Cab. Friendly staff and great prices

reviews.author: Jeremy R.
reviews.description: Great Texas winery...offer many varietals and the staff is super knowledgeable and friendly. Prices are on point...especially if you buy a bottle after a tasting.

reviews.author: Paige F.
reviews.description: The good: Bob is fabulous and knows what he is talking about! DeeDee and Mary were also super nice and helpful! The wine is excellent too and the atmosphere was great! The unfortunate: Logan is troubling. Having an extensive background in the service industry, I know that dealing with groups can be frustrating. Especially bachelor/bachelorette groups, because everyone is typically more spirited than they might usually be. We were one such group, but we are a gaggle of teachers and young mothers, so nothing audacious was afoot. As some members of the group entered an energized conversation about football, the bride-to-be (ME) said "fly eagles fly". Logan felt that instead of speaking to Bob (their staff member handling our group), Nick (our tour guide), or any other member of our party that it was appropriate to walk up to me and tell me that he would "cut me off and start kicking out my friends if we kept using such language". My comment had been my only contribution to the whole conversation, because I had actually been speaking with Bob the whole time. I assume he misheard me, and assumed I was cursing, but my customer service background tells me that you give people a kind warning first, before launching in to the threats. We quickly wrapped up, as several members of our group had already bought a couple hundred dollars worth of wine there. On my way out, in response to me telling Bob that he was "so sweet, I wish everyone else was as respectful as him", Logan followed me out the door and yelled to our whole group that we could "just NOT EVER come back". Don't worry Logan, we won't be returning.

reviews.author: Tracy B.
reviews.description: You have to meet Lily. Just ask. :-) I'm a wine club member here and you have to know this means so much more than getting your luscious wine in the mail - don't get me wrong...I'm waiting for the FedEx guy like a stage 5 clinger. There are dinners held on their beautiful property, the FREE grape stomp, a gift shop, different wine classes (so you can act all fancy at your next dinner party) they do off site pairing dinners and of course Lily. Gary and Kathy are so generous to share their beautiful property and truly set out to make it a welcoming experience. So, go please your palette, meet Lily and embrace the fact they are 100% Texas.

reviews.author: Tom P.
reviews.description: Henry provides a great tasting experience. Friendly and informative. Very interesting varietals and make in very natural style. Definitely worthwhile to check out.

reviews.author: Elizabeth H.
reviews.description: What an amazing little winery!  We are visiting Austin for a month and wanted to do something fun for my boyfriends' birthday. Crowson came highly recommended from our friend who lives in Austin, so we made a reservation for 6 people on a Saturday for a wine tasting.  They are taking Covid precautions, everything was socially distanced, our tasting was outside (and thankfully they had heaters so we were quite nice and warm), and everyone was wearing masks!  The wine was absolutely delicious and we all loved the wine we had here. One of only two places in Texas that has natural wines (nothing added). This is a very cozy, homey, winery- they make you feel so welcome, are very gracious and just a fun time ! Henry and his dad were a delight.  Highly recommend this place!

reviews.author: Joy T.
reviews.description: Amazing dry reds!  Zero-zero wine so no sulfites, no migraines, and no hangover!  The wines are on the dry side, but acid forward so no cotton mouth!  The owner, Henry does a great job of describing the grapes and the wines.  75 % of the grapes are grown in the High Plains of Texas!  If you are in Johnson City, it's a great place to visit!

reviews.author: Lauren T.
reviews.description: We had the best time at Crowson. The owner and his dad are some of the friendliest people you'll meet, and they are knowledgeable, honest and passionate about their wine. Beautiful space, and the wine is excellent. Natural, light, complex, unique - hands down some of the best in Texas.

reviews.author: Angela M.
reviews.description: In town for a bachelorette weekend, staying at a friend's house that is normally on Airbnb, our hostess arranged for a Friday night tasting and tour at Crowson.    There are only 2 ingredients in this wine - grapes and love. Henry did an excellent job of sharing his knowledge and passion for minimally processed wines (nothing added, nothing removed).  Our group of 8 was seated at the table in the tasting room as he poured us taste from 6 wines and explained his process, grape selection, and philosophy.  He was patient and thorough as we asked question after question.  He then took us into the working part of the winery, showed us how he knocked down the cap, and let us do it too!  I ended up with a bottle of one of the rosés and one of the reds, taking home to share with my husband and entice him to plan a return visit.  2019 Reviews #37

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: Henry and his Dad are some true gems to our Texas winemaking community! These two are crafting some of the most unique, distinct and delicious wines I've tasted lately. They take a different approach to wine making. while still respecting the integrity of the grapes, wine and customers! If you want something unique Crowson wines will definitely be a treat!

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: Stopped by and met the owner.  What an awesome experience bought a bottle of wine and drank it across the street.  Will definitely be back.  Very friendly.

reviews.author: Greg D.
reviews.description: Crowson is such a unique wine tasting experience! Henry is so passionate about the natural wines he makes and is truly a joy to hang out with while learning about wine.

reviews.author: Alex C.
reviews.description: Henry and his wife Amy are the sweetest folks. We had an absolutely excellent time this afternoon, the wine was exceptional. It's a must visit if you're passing through J City.

reviews.author: Susan G.
reviews.description: We went on a wine tour and this was our last stop...our guide truly saved the best for last! The location, decor, ambiance (especially the Townes Van Zandt ), very educated and verbose host/vintner, and the most unique, aromatic, delicious wines all work in concert to deliver an experience that will engage all of your senses and create a pining that encourages resurgence. Henry and his family have a very bright and successful future ahead!

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: What a gem. Henry and his father partnered a handful of years ago, received federal and state permits, and are determined in unique wine making and serving.   From their storefront, they sell a small selection of natural wines. They are delicious and Henry conducts a terrific sit down tasting.   Appointments are appropriate; a must do while in town.

reviews.author: Mick M.
reviews.description: Superior attention to patrons for tastings.  Homey feeling, Hill Country friendly.  Recommend the Roses

reviews.author: Cynthia M.
reviews.description: We visited Crowson last weekend for my birthday.  We were on our way to Fredricksburg and are new to Texas so we didn't know the tastings were by appointment.  I gave it a shot and called anyway.  He was able to get there quickly and do our tasting so PLEASE call if you show up to the door with no appointment, he is very accommodating.  We are from wine country in California and have done many tastings.  The Crowson tasting was absolutely the best one I've experienced.  Henry is gently passionate, extremely knowledgeable and just a really nice guy.  You can tell that he is exactly where he is meant to be.  I can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Christopher R.
reviews.description: Exploring the Wine Country nearby and was recommended to check out Henry's Wine Tasting at Crowson. It is by appointment only, but so amazing. It's perfect! He makes sure you are well taken care of and hear all about how the wine is made, the subtle differences, and gives a great background story. The wine is also really really good and very unique. I hadn't tried anything like it. During the summer, he only had a selection of whites, and although 2 people in our group didnt like white, they both left buying bottles of them! I believe his current season (Fall 2019) is reds only, but he may have a few of both at the time of your visit.  Very tasty, very unique wines. Heading back soon, just to stop here.

reviews.author: Chloe D.
reviews.description: I'm in love with these wines. They are all so refreshing. Henry came in ON HIS DAY OFF to do a wine tasting with us since we drove in from Houston.

reviews.author: Carol J.
reviews.description: We visit the Texas wine country every year.  We have or favorite wineries, but always try to visit new ones.  Crowson was recommended by 2 other wineries. So glad we went.  Henry, the owner/winemaker, is passionate about wine. Not only were his wines great, but we gained more knowledge about wine and wine making. It is a super cute and intimate setting. Be sure to make a reservation-you'll be glad you did!!

reviews.author: Lisa M.
reviews.description: This was back in June but we had the best experience meeting and tasting with Henry and his dad.  Excellent wine and a very welcoming family.  We look forward to returning soon!

reviews.author: Erica M.
reviews.description: The way they craft their wine combined with their customer service is something I am will to drive 50 miles for. I have never had an experience quite like this and hope to do this again. The brothers sat down and told us the process of making the best Texas wines, while having a glass of what we were having and discussing the flavors. Thank you for an bonus to a great weekend!

reviews.author: April M.
reviews.description: Excellent service, great story and crazy good wine! Run don't walk!

reviews.author: Wes B.
reviews.description: This place is great.  It's in town in Johnson City in a quaint little house that makes you feel at home. Henry, the proprietor and winemaker and his father Kenny, also a proprietor were welcoming and authentic.  Henry is making some unique and delicious wines.  While it may not have a beautiful vista like some of the wineries along 290, it is definitely worth your time to drink some good wines and listen to Henry talk about his wine and the winemaking process.

reviews.author: Sara B.
reviews.description: 've been to places like this before (but for primarily beer rather than wine), and I love the setup - it's super fun. You get a card that's tied to your credit card to swipe or tap and then you have access to the wine you swiped for. Then you can get as much or as little as you want. It's a great way to try and explore new wines (and mead and some margarita inspired wines). Then you can load up on your favorite (what I did), or continue exploring. Really, two great options. Also, the guy working there was nice and very helpful. I've been telling people about how much I enjoyed coming here and recommending it.  Don't park in the paid parking next to Wanderlust if you can avoid it because it's stupidly expensive. Use that money on a Lyft or more wine.

reviews.author: Hillary S.
reviews.description: What I love: the music + aesthetic + the location    What I could live without: the flies + the prices + the customer service   I came on a Tuesday and it was incredibly empty. Like, I was thee only soul inside the establishment from 5pm-7pm. As a patron and especially a first timer, you'd think they'd have a little leniency if you order a 8oz of wine and ask to exchange. I understand you can taste your pours, which I paid for at least 5 of them averaging $2-$3 for each TASTE. After my fourth taste, I wanted to trust that I was getting a good one because most of them were and I promise to god it was the worst taste to my palette that I've ever had. And Lissen Linda, I'm not a bougie wine person. But for this 8oglass to be $15 I couldn't even stomach it and asked if possible to exchange. I said, "what's the policy if you get a wine that you absolutely can not stomach? Is that your own bad?"  She said, "yeah kinda. I'll call the manager but he's at another location"   Okay cool. 15 minutes later I find her and I'm like, "so can I exchange this wine or no? I don't need a refund"   "He said no"  I work in the service industry as well and look out for people all the time. I just feel like she OR the manager could have made an accommodation but maybe operationally that's not the way they run things. That's my bad for not tasting the nasty ass wine. That particular 1 oz pour was like $4 so I assumed it was good to be so pricy.   .

reviews.author: Yanira D.
reviews.description: Came in to buy a bottle of wine, bartender came from the back and did not greet us and told us "we're closed" although it was 9:25 and they close at 10pm on Sundays   I recommend updating the hours if you're going to close over half an hour earlier than listed

reviews.author: Chastitie A.
reviews.description: Okay, this place is super cool!  If you're into wine, and good vibes without having to feel so fancy... please come here! 56 different wines on tap. Cute inside decor with so much local art, and a bad ass patio in the back with a food truck that serves authentic Italian food! The food truck owner was extremely personable and kind! He even gave us the breakdown of the different methods of how to cook pasta in all regions of Italy.   FYI, even though this is downtown, there is a private parking lot.

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: Came, drank, conquered (ok stretch on that last one)  We came for the Yelp elite event and tasted our heart out! The original location off 35 is so so cute the moment you walk in. I will say the location at first struck me as odd - but the moment you walk through the doors you are transported into this little artsy wine oasis.   The wines on tap are so fun to browse and the wall art is so Austin it makes you think you can buy them (i mean maybe you can?!). The seating is ample indoor AND a outdoor to give you any desired vibe. Will absolutely be back!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Found this place by chance. Stopped since we saw it served wine. We were happy to see that it was a serve your own wine type of place. Wine on tap is such a great idea.   They give you a card that you use to get your wine. You get charged by the ounce. They do have happy hour. They have a good selection of wines. For those that don't like wine, they have a handful options (margarita, old fashioned)   The place is cute and they have a nice outdoor patio. They had a food truck the day we went.   Con:  - the wine comes out pretty fast, so you have to be careful as it can add up quick. If you want to taste first, be quick at closing it.  - there's no way to figure out how many ounces you are serving yourself.

reviews.author: Damaris C.
reviews.description: This is the perfect place to try a new wine experience. When you walk in you're give a wine card which lets you self pour from a variety different types of wines! I recommend going on Wednesday for 1/2 glasses of wine!

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: From the moment we walked in we felt welcome! They were very friendly showing us how the process works. You could tell they were glad we were new.  They truly have great enthusiasm for their jobs and this business.  A new product even arrived and we were informed we came at a terrific time!   It was so easy to tap my Wanderlust card and release the wine. There's a great variety of wines to choose from, including wines from France, Spain, some sangrias and hard lemonade. Warning: make sure all the taps are closed before you insert your card. I didn't see that one was turned a bit and wine started trickling and money ringing up on my card.  Because it's not very bright, I didn't see the wine flowing. Lesson learned!   There's an interesting room off the patio for private events.  I'm jealous I couldn't pop in!   Happy to see the food truck. Mmm: truffle fries and bruschetta!  You MUST come visit this location!

reviews.author: Xiao Z.
reviews.description: Have been here for the elite event and saved this great place to hang out with friends. We went there for some wine and found out that they also have a food truck in the backyard serving cheese board. Perfect! We had a great night talking and enjoyed the drink with snacks!

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: What a cool little concept and space to drink wine in downtown Austin. Came here during happy hour last weekend with some friends and was overall impressed with the wine tasting here. There whole gimmick is you you can try any of the wines on the wall tap and your charged by the ounces you drink. I will warn you use a light touch on the taps as I learned the hard way the first try. Most of the wines were half off during happy hour which makes for a great deal and I also liked that there was a range of wines from across the globe and wasn't specific to one region. They also had patio seating an Italian food truck in case you get hungry. The only downside like most places downtown is the parking but I heard that's less of an issue at their east side location which I'm excited to try next!

reviews.author: Christina V.
reviews.description: I love a serve yourself wine bar! Wanderlust charges by the ounce and although it adds up pretty quickly, if you're able to pace yourself, you can have a whole evening of fun. I got out of there spending well under $50 for two people, so we really didn't go all that crazy.  Try a million different wines and mixed drinks! they give you a card at the entrance and it just rings up your total, then they charge you on the way out. We had an issue with a bunch of cork settling into one of our glasses and they were able to remove that pour from our tab. The only thing is that it's hard to keep track of your favorite pours because there are so many options.  There is also a ton of space to sit. They have inside seating/lounge tables, there is outdoor seating and there's also an additional event space which you can sit in. We sat in the event space with a large group and it was so comfy. I would love to return!

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: Wanderlust is an ATX gem for sure. They have outstanding service and a great wine selection. I also really like their cocktails on tap, especially the lemonade seltzer that they have. Every time I have come in, Blake has always provided excellent customer service and understanding of the wine offerings. Overall, I will be back many more times to this place for their superb wine and service!  2 pro tips: Come in on Wednesdays for half off and make sure to try heal of the boot food truck.

reviews.author: Maurice H.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and great wine!! My go to on Wednesday's and any other day I want some good wine. The live performances makes my night I swear. If you're in the city and want some good wine, want to vibe with cool ppl and bob your head to some good music just stop by and grab your wanderlust card.

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: I love Wanderlust Wine Company! It's such a fun environment, and they have so many excellent wines to choose from! The downtown location is the perfect spot to hit up if you're transitioning your night from the east side to hanging out downtown. If you haven't been to the new Eastside location, it is seriously one of the coolest buildings in Austin. There is so much local art there!

reviews.author: Kerri M.
reviews.description: I love the wine on tap concept and enjoyed choosing between all of the different wines at Wanderlust! When you walk in, they give you a separate card that you swipe before each one of your pours. I liked it because you could pour as much or as little as you wanted and it gave you the opportunity to try different wines without being committed to a full glass. Honestly, it reminded me of those self-serve frozen yogurt places. I also really liked the outdoor area - it was a great place to hang out with friends and we had a great time taking photos at the photo booth.  The only downside was that it was more expensive than I was expecting. They give you the price per ounce on the screen, but once you start pouring, it adds up VERY quickly. I could have spent the same amount of money on a way nicer and fuller glass of wine.  Overall, I enjoyed the concept and fun vibes. Would love to come back during their happy hour or something when things are half-priced!

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: "Froyo for wine"; Fun idea, smooth process, nice spot, bit pricey.   It's a charge by oz place, like Froyo with all of the taps requiring an RFID card that you get by associating with a credit card at the front desk. Place the card on the reader and pour what you want into your glass. They have over 50 different styles, including mead, white, red, dry/sweet, and some wine-based cocktail style drinks.  They typically range from $1-3+ per oz so you'll probably come out with a $5-10 glass (4 oz) which is pretty comparable to most places.  There is both indoor and outdoor seating; interior is mostly couch seating and outdoor is patio/bench with faux grass. You can also bring dogs. The outdoor is a bit noisy, especially since it backs to another bar and is right under 35 so it was nicer indoors than out.  I don't usually drink wine because it gives me headaches and I certainly felt it the next day even after just 2 small glasses; possibly because of tasting so many different kind, so beware! Nice for trying something new but possible to get sick if you're mixing so much.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Stopped into this downtown location after already visiting the location on Shady ln earlier in the week. I definitely enjoyed both locations for different reasons. I appreciate the way the wines are labeled in clear groupings so it's easier to just walk up and find what I'm wanting more quickly. They also have an Italian food truck in the back patio area. The truffle Parmesan fries were great and the pasta dish was a good portion. Lots of cute photo ops and decent areas of seating. I will say this location is much smaller and literally off the busy highway but still the experience they offer is worth checking out.

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: I came here not knowing what to expect. I knew there would be wines on tap, but didn't realize you poured your own. When you come in you get a card with your name on it that unlocks the tap. As you fill your glass it shows you how many ounces and the cost in real time. I loved this idea because I got to try many wines before committing. You're allowed as many glasses as you want at a time so I recommend doing a flight! There's indoor and outdoor seating with a food truck out back. I signed up for their rewards program and will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Courtney S.
reviews.description: What a fun place! It's not every day you come across a place with wines on tap. Wanderlust has so many options of all different kinds of wine. Red blends, dry white blends, bubbly, mead, etc. You name it, they have it!  When you arrive they swipe your card and give you another card, something like a hotel key card. You use this key card and swipe it before each self serve wine glass pour. The screen next to the tap will show you how many ounces you've filled up your glass and how much for the whole glass. The screen also shows how much each ounce of wine costs. Maybe I'm getting old and outdated but this was some cool technology! Probably the coolest, unique payment system I've ever seen!   There is a food truck on site with some seriously good pasta and appetizer types.   I can't speak to the parking situation since I walked from my location but I do believe there was a small parking lot.

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: I came here for the first time and the hospitality of the (im assuming) manager was really worth writing a yelp! The energy and the vibes were immaculate and everyone was very accommodating for my dog!   5 stars :)

name: Farmhouse Vineyards Marketplace and Tipsy Trailer

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: I adore this place! I am on a mission to try out as many Hill Country wineries as I can, and I found this with my Christmas Wine Affair Passport. It ended up being such a favorite that I joined their club!   First, the setting is so much fun. Their main spot is in an old cottage, and they have turned it into part tasting room, part hang out, part shop, and it is oh so cute! Outside, they have a ton of tables, perfect for picnicking, and they have the lovely Airstream as well.   But the wines! I loved everything I had here.
