Inside the tasting room one will find tables and assorted cozy areas to sit and sip and relax as they enjoy their visit. There are also tables and chairs outside to enjoy the lovely warm fall temperatures of late.  There is new artwork on the walls for sale by local artists making the space even more inviting and interesting. All in all, the space makes you feel right at home. Stop by and check it out for yourself. You just might find some new wines you enjoy and make sure to keep checking in from time to time, because there are more wines planned to be released.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Mike B.
reviews.description: My wife and I went to Bella Vista Ranch for a 4th of July tour with lunch, and we found it to be terrific value for the money. There was a nice lunch from a food truck (the name of which eludes me, unfortunately) followed by an interesting talk about the history of olive oil and the origins of the Italian family farm dating back to the second century BCE. The owner explained how he established Bella Vista on the ancient Roman model and described the modifications he has made to make olives grow in Texas. Then we toured the olive orchard and learned about the different varieties of grapes grown on the property. We saw the processing room containing the "frantoio" or olive press as well as the vats where this year's wines are aging. We then tasted several oils as well as four glasses of wine per person. All this for $25 (the regular tour without lunch is only $15).  Oils, vinegars, wines and soaps are available for sale. These are pretty expensive (e.g. $18+ for 250ml of their basic Texas Blend oil), but I don't mind paying those prices for high-quality locally produced specialty goods. This is a fascinating day out, which I recommend wholeheartedly.  Pro tip: If you're coming from San Antonio, take I-35 instead of US 281 and the back roads. We were expecting a relaxing drive in the country, but construction and traffic made it a stressful trip. Coming back on 35 was a joy by comparison!

reviews.author: Ann S.
reviews.description: So, so rude. The olive oil and vinegar are excellent, but the experience was ruined by the lady--the one everyone complains of here. The hours on Sunday are until 4. I get there at 3:25, and she walks past me with her whiny, demanding voice telling me that they close at 3:30. Uh, wanna put that on your website as your updated hours?  I went in anyway. The gentleman doing the oil tasting was knowledgeable and helpful. He told the lady to close the gate.  You know, what a non-stupid person would do should they slothfully decide to close early since they dont work for a living.  My mother was incredibly upset by this lady's rudeness. When you run a service like this, you stay open until you no longer have a good flow of customers. Closing is at 4? Hi, if a bunch of people are coming in at 3:30 thru 4:00, you keep working. Lazy Texas people who inherited their property and think they work hard by paying others to harvest their crop and bottle it. Meritocracy, right? They are the class of people who make this state an impoverished mess.    Don't run a customer service business dependent upon people stopping by on a lark like a fascist regime. You don't get to do that. Then again, when you dont have a legitimate concern about how you pay your bills, i guess you can just work until you get bored with the whole work thing.   Go sell wholesale if you hate customers. Working for yourself does not mean you get any more freedom. You have are dependent on good will. And you don't have mine.  The lady tried to make up for her garbage attitude when i made my purchase. You know what? Have a blessed day, lady. A.BLESSED.DAY.  Tl;dr. There are other puveyors of Texas olive oil, particularly in south Texas. Do not waste your wine tasting trip here. If you want to support local, consider others who are hard-working enough to sell their products in Central Market.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: I will never recommend this place to ANYONE! The main older lady was very rude to my parents, as well as the other couple in front of us. I regret not reading the reviews before coming here because everyone is saying the same thing. We did a wine tasting (which was $10) and were barely served anything. My husband and I both left this place wondering how they are still in business. The wine was super expensive (not good at all), and they have horrible customer service. Listen to these reviews, people!

reviews.author: Teresa D.
reviews.description: Very limited services. I walked in to see if this facility was appropriate for sitting outside for a tasting. I was immediately met at the door because there was a "tour" in progress. There was no other option other to join the tour that was already in progress. The woman that met me right at the door was very un-hospitable.   The inside smells absolutely delicious, full of olive oil.  The grounds were beautiful.

reviews.author: Marina R.
reviews.description: Worst service ever. Mistreated. Was watched the entire time. Before I could even ask a question about the wine or olives, an employee firmly told me as she was finishing up with another set of customers that "I don't have time to answer your questions."  She then proceeded to hard sell our group to pay $10 for the "last minute" tour. And, to add insult to injury, as 2 of the 4 of us completed their purchases, both employees proceeded to exit the store and watch us walk to our vehicle and  drive off. I will never spend a dollar at your business.  Good luck to you.

reviews.author: Jennifer B.
reviews.description: Such a great tour. We failed to check the tour time and arrived a little late but they let us join the tour and tasting. It was terrific! The tour and history of olives was really interesting. Definitely try the balsamic and infused oils. The wine tasting was pretty brief compared to the olive portion but great none the less. The wines are dryer, not sweet. I thought they were great. A lot of the other local wineries wines are very sweet, but I really enjoyed these! You should absolutely plan to visit if in the area.

reviews.author: Krystle M.
reviews.description: Amazing olive oil. Wine was good but pourer was either grumpy or just to the point?! 5 samples, but we shared a tasting. Not worth the $10 as the pours were barely a "splash." You couldn't enjoy the swirl sniff taste ...

reviews.author: Kerry C.
reviews.description: We went here twice. The first time we went we had a group of 6 and showed up about 15 minutes before they closed. The guy there suggested we go to another place. He just didn't want to serve us so we left.   The second time we went there were 4 of us and it was in the middle of the day. While the wine is fine, the server was the single most rude person I've ever encountered at a winery. Just astounding how she could be that rude for the duration of the wine tasting. I will never go back and suggest no one ever go there. You cant drink the wine fast enough to over come they workers rudeness.

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: We liked the olive oil a lot.  However... I think the "thorn" of this place is the owner.  He seems rather joyless in making something that could ideally fulfill the soul.  His 1 1/2 hour (yes, it's long) "tour" is mostly comprised of the history of the Olive, snarky political opinions, braggary of his past career in Silicone Valley, and a hatred for Texas AandM.   Not a place to take a kid. Seriously.  We sat and listened to him for well over an hour then briefly stood under two olive trees, looked at another one that was hurt in a storm, looked at the press machinery, and then did a "tasting." Like I said, the oil was good. I got the impression that the lady helping in the gift shop/tasting room didn't want to be there either. Basically I was confused why this man (and his 5th wife...no lie) were running this business and opening it to the public.  I walked away a little sad that something so wonderful like successfully growing beautiful trees to make a solid product could be reduced to something so joyless.

reviews.author: Alana C.
reviews.description: We were warned at great length that we could not even look at our cell phones during the tour which seemed odd when people might have a kid or babysitter or be waiting on something important from work to come through--I mean we are all adults...but I soon found out why.  Far less than an entertaining traditional tour, you sit and listen to someone talk more like a college class lecture, but with way too many rabbit trails of information that eventually make you tune out.  Like what a certain blizzard is called in different parts of the world, how accounting dates back to the Romans, etc.  I am passionate about olive oils and wine but learned too much about history and every other subject to even focus on what I wanted to know about olive oil. Or feel entertained.  The group I was with concurred.   There are 3 types of learners: auditory, visual, and tactile and the class is entirely sit and listen to one man talk for half of it then stand and listen by a tree then a press for the other half. So only appealing to auditory learners. And no audience engagement during the lecture.  At the end you actually get to see and touch. But they had no bread for us so we had to drink an olive oil and talk about it for 30 more minutes so I left before I tasted the other flavored oils as it had already been a full day of just listening to way too much info to retain.  In a very strict manner rather than entertaining with audience engagement.  And strict rules.  Obviously people tune out and begin looking at their cell phones so that's why they don't allow them.  Rather than making the tour entertaining so you dont' want to--It was in the hot sun as well so it was pretty miserable.  The olive oil was good but I've had better, it was a bit weak to me, we did the wine tasting as well and those were not acceptable to me.  I actually would recommend skipping the tour and talking to the staff as you taste the olive oil because they knew all of the information given on the tour without the lengthy side notes of things that should be shaved off for entertainment value.  And that's really the best part.    I don't think they like people very much though to be honest.

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Who here likes an hour and a half talk ab everything I ever learned ever?? If you raised your hand then step right up, produce $15 and hold on to your hat!  It went on so damn long I wanted to ask for a hall pass just to sneak to my car.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: A hidden mecca of olives.  In central Texas.  The Bella Vista Ranch was designed as a traditional Italian family farm and features the first commercially grown olives in Texas.  And the olives I sampled are Texas size and Texas good.  Apparently the crowd favorite is the bleu cheese stuffed olive.  We sampled a garlic stuffed olive that was really good.  The ranch also offers delicious balsamic vinegars and olive oils which go for around $17 a bottle.  My lips slurped the Fig Vanilla Balsamic over and over again.  I am sure I was sample cheating but that stuff is incredible.     This is also a working winery that produces several red and white varieties plus a Natural Blackberry Wine!  Yum.  Wine tastings are $5/per person.  I think the owner has a great thing going for him and a beauty of a property. Tours of the orchard happen on the weekend and include a wine tasting for $10/per person.

reviews.author: Jim L.
reviews.description: I can't believe only 5 people have reviewed this ranch. I have been back four times now and each time come away with a little more understanding of the narrative that is offered. While I purchased my typical bottles of olive oil - some for myself, some for holiday gifts - I did also indulge in some olive oil based soaps.   The olives and oil are fabulous. I am not as great a fan of their wines. They are not awful, just not with the properties I care for, typically. The in-laws found a favorite to take home, though.  The tour is still $10 and includes the wine tasting, which is a good deal.  Bottles of oil range from $16-$27 each, depending on size.  Soap is $6.99 a bar.  They also feature balsamic vinegars (not made there) and jars of olives, which are delightful as well.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: The speaker was very very rude.  Very long winded.  Made a point to tell us about his great computer career in California.  Do not go with children.  Was quite disappointed with this trip.

reviews.author: Ashley F.
reviews.description: Do not judge a book by its cover. Take one look at Jack and the humble grounds here at Bella Vista, and you'd never guess that he has olive friends he emails with back in Italy or that he can tell you all you'd ever want to know about the science and technique behind growing and processing olives.  I would highly recommend the tour - while there isn't much walking involved in this tour, my husband and I found it to be highly informative. And with Jack's red-blooded Texan sense of humor, it was a very entertaining education. Be sure to note the times of the tour (Sat @ 10am and 1pm, and Sun @ noon) since it's a group setup.   After the tour comes a tasting of several types of olive oil produced on site along with some of their balsamic vinegar offerings. While they also have wine offered, I'd recommend sticking with the olive oil - clearly what they specialize in. If you're only interested in tasting the oils/wines (not the tour), it's probably good to avoid arriving at the tasting room about an hour after each tour start since the tasting room isn't overly large and tends to fill up easily with the folks coming off the tour.

reviews.author: Alison T.
reviews.description: Super disappointed in the customer service.  Both the lady and the gentleman that run the place were very rude and short with us.  Their products are not made by them in Wimberley and when asked about that they became extremely defensive.  Beautiful place that has a lot of potential if they were friendly and cared about the experience people want from that kind of place... but the vibe is anything but friendly and welcoming.   When they started to bash a particular presidential candidate it killed it for us. Keep your opinions out of your business. Don't bother would be my recommendation.

reviews.author: Shannon G.
reviews.description: While I thought it was pretty interesting to learn about and taste boutique olive oil (as I'd never been to an olive ranch before) $15 per person does seem a little high when the actual tour is quite short and obviously the intention is that you're going to buy some stuff at the end, and all that stuff is small batch and quite pricey (understandably so.)  So it ends up  being more like $100 for two people when you include the olive oil you will want to buy plus the wine you might want to buy (some people seem to think it sucks, we liked some of it.)  But you will leave with a buzz on and some delicious olive oils!  The owners were away so their daughter gave the tour; I thought she was pretty funny and personable but there were some questions she couldn't answer but it was really no big deal (and she wasn't super long winded like the owner seems to be  but of course some people like that and some people don't.) It's also probably better when there are olives on the trees but it was still overall pretty interesting to see the different trees different olives grow up and hear some history and facts about olive oil production.  I liked hearing about the process and seeing the machinery. And of course I liked tasting the fresh olive oil, which was indeed super tasty and surprisingly spicy. Most of their oils are made from all different olives smushed together but they have one variety that's just made with one kind of olive which we got to try. They also had a blood orange infused oil that I'm now obsessed with; we bought some and later made some asparagus on the grill that had been rubbed with the oil, it was the most delicious asparagus ever! We also enjoyed the wine; we are not wine snobs in any way but we enjoyed what we had and bought a bottle just  because it's the polite thing to do. We sat out on the bench in front of the tasting room and enjoyed our wines and just had a lovely afternoon.   I will say that it gets a little hectic in the tasting room when people come in just for a tasting after a tour- I would say if you want just a tasting, don't come between 1:30-2:30 because it's going to get confusing!

reviews.author: Lyra S.
reviews.description: The tour was all talking with a look at a tree or two and a look at some equipment. If you want to hear the entire history of olives then this is for you. Personally I was falling asleep. The tour guide was rude and narcissistic.

reviews.author: Kristen C.
reviews.description: Wine tasting is $10 per person,  and it is by far the smallest sample I've ever been given in many years of wine tasting. What a rip off. Also the lady that did our tasting was really rude to us. Then, she basically berated a guy when he politely asked where he could dispose of his child's diaper. She was an older lady. I didn't catch her name, but I have a feeling she receives a lot of complaints. It was very awkward and so unprofessional. Never ever going back.

reviews.author: Leigh M.
reviews.description: The couple who own this place are fantastic characters. The wife is sweet and talkative. She was delighted to hear that we moved out here from San Francisco (that's where she grew up but couldn't  stand the fog). The husband is an old curmudgeon, but delightfully so. He worked in high-tech in Silicon Valley and moved out his last company to Austin in the early 90s, eventually leaving to grow olives and make wine.   it's not always the case that you visit a winery and the owners pour for you, so that was a treat. They are a very small production and a bit off the beaten path, so it was pretty quiet there too. A small group arrived just as we were leaving, but it was nothing like the bustling tasting rooms at nearby Driftwood Cellars.  The blackberry wine is actually good--you wouldn't necessarily guess that it's made of blackberry not grapes. And the other three reds we tasted were also nice.

name: The OASIS on Lake Travis
accommodations: Garage Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: sara h.
reviews.description: We were happily suprised at the upgrade in the quality of the service and the menu. We went three years ago and we were so disapointed with the food. We remember saying that even the french fries were horrible.  We had not been back since. We went tonight and the food was fantastic! The service was spot on.  It is now on our list of favorites. Nice job on turning things around!

reviews.author: Jackie G.
reviews.description: The scenery 10/10. The food 10/10 even though there is not much variety, the food was SPOT ON! Melissa was our wonderful server and she made the experience 10x better! She even took the time to go find us outside while we enjoyed the view so our food wouldn't get cold! I will most definitely be visiting on my next Austin trip! Dishes we ate that were very tasty: Beef fajita quesadilla, shrimp quesadilla, the super nachos, and a cheese burger

reviews.author: Jenny F.
reviews.description: Paying for the view  Place: It's a good place for family trip or just get together. The restaurant is surrounded by shops like coffee, ice cream, clothes , candies, photo hub and a lot more. BUT the most magnetizing place here is the view of the lake and the sunset.   Food: The food was not that special but became one because of the view and people/person you are with. Honestly if only the food we rating here, I'll give 3 not bad but not good as well.   Also expect long wait/line for the restaurant. While waiting we roamed around so we didn't really got bored. There's lot of shops and artist that offer their services like, caricature drawing.

reviews.author: Terri B.
reviews.description: Oasis, oh how I love you.   I've been coming to the Oasis for years, literally my whole life. It has always been amazing, and they have expanded it considerably since the fire. The outdoor decks are sprawling, so many places to take in that view. And y'all, it had the absolute most stunning view of Lake Travis.   I just lost my father and was in need of an escape and some fresh air. Today I brought my dad's convertible mustang out (I MAY have gone kinda fast) to have lunch on this perfect blue bird day. I definitely felt his presence out here with me.   My server was so friendly and had the best customer service. I really enjoyed her serving me. I ordered a swirl margarita and chips and queso which were delivered quickly. For lunch I had a mixed fajita with steak and shrimp, refried beans and the fixings. Food was delicious.   I love the art they have installed around the restaurant. Really gorgeous bronze sculptures and we'll appointed gardens.   Thank you for a perfect experience.

reviews.author: Jim H.
reviews.description: The Oasis is great for outdoor dining and has an amazing view of Lake Travis, especially during a sunset.  A couple of weeks ago, I visited Austin for a quick weekend getaway.  A small group of us came out for lunch and we didn't have to wait long because it was an early lunch and the weather was a bit cold.    PROS:  Even though the water level was a bit low, the view of Lake Travis was AMAZING!  Make sure to sit outside to be able to enjoy the view.  During the summer, it's worth it to make reservations during the sunset to get the most out of your experience.  The wait staff are super friendly and are attentive to all your needs.  CONS:  I will echo some of the other reviews on here and say the food is mediocre Tex-Mex at best.  We ordered the shrimp tacos, fish tacos and beef fajitas.  The tacos are decently seasoned, but the rice and beans are a bit bland and the dish overall was a bit cold.  The fajitas did come out nice and hot and the meat was seasoned well.  I will definitely be ordering the fajitas for the next time.  The drinks and desserts we ordered:  an Irish coffee, the Fantasy Chocolate Cake (which is a flourless chocolate) and the flan.  The Chocolate cake was surprisingly delicious while the flan was a bit too thick for my liking, but the flavor is really good.  The area surrounding the restaurant also has eclectic artwork to look at as well as small retail shops to explore.  Due to Covid each store has limited hours so you may want to call ahead to see if they're open.  Overall, it's a great area to sight see in Austin.  Especially if it's your first time.

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: ON LAKE TIME!   It was my last day in Austin and my brother wanted t show me something a little out of the ordinary. We had just been going shopping oh and drinking. I wanted to experience the nature side of Austin.   The Oasis on Lake Travis was the place for us to venture out too. My brother said he had not been to it before, but wanted to try it.   To my surprise it was something grand. Absolutely gorgeous views of the lake and the more upscale houses Austin has to offer.   My brother and my parents had had a bite to eat prior to coming here, but I had not. I went shopping a the Domain and they had gone eating. From what I have heard, The Oasis is good for drinking, but not so good for eating. Their food is honestly sub par at best.   We ordered some drinks and chips and guac for the table. But I wanted something a little more in my stomach. I got the grilled shrimp tacos. They were good. But I have definitely had better. The only thing was that they were super spicy. I was not expecting them to be that spicy. All of a sudden my tongue was sweating and I was uncomfortable with that.   This is a must stop for the views. The views are outstanding. But the food was not the best. The mojito I had was strong. It was like one sip and I was already feeling it.

reviews.author: TJ H.
reviews.description: The Oasis on Lake Travis is one of those tricky places where you have to average out the good with the bad to get a good idea of the place.  The good:  No question about it, the sunset is second to none, awesome views, awesome picturesque scene, and just about all of the outdoor seating has a great view of the scene. An additional positive, is the parking.  Easy to get to, plenty of free parking for the complex they are in, and even has valet parking if you prefer not to walk the 100 yards to the restaurant.  The not so good: I don't want to say the food was necessarily bad, it was just mediocre Mexican cuisine with a relatively small selection compared to your normal Mexican place.  To go along with the mediocre food is a price of about 1.5-2x what you would typically pay, but again you are here for the view not the food. The service also was not bad, but I think "nonchalant" would be the best way to describe it.  So the real question, would I recommend it? Yes I would but just go into it with the right mindset that you are going for the view, you are paying for the view and you will not be disappointed!  I would probably not go back if I am in Austin, but I am glad we went once.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: I don't get the hate. Are the prices high? Yes, but you're paying for the view/ambiance, not necessarily the food. Having said that, the food quality is pretty good and the service has always been good for me (though we are admittedly only there for weekend lunch service since we always have kids).   My shrimp tacos were well flavored and a good (yet not overflowing) portion. Menu wise they could definitely work on their beer selection - need more craft beers and some varied selection of beer styles.

reviews.author: Kristina B.
reviews.description: My friends and I wanted a nice dinner on one of our last nights in Austin. We got to Oasis on a Sunday night about 45 min before sunset and were told the wait would be about 30 min for outdoor seating. We ended up getting seated in like 15 min. The views here are truly unmatched and pictures don't do it justice.  We went to Oasis with the mindset that we were mostly going for the views and not really the food, given the reviews. However, we were actually pleasantly surprised that the food wasn't that bad - overpriced, yes, but not terrible if you get things other than the tacos.  We got quesadillas and burgers. The quesadilla was very tasty and came with some guac, salad, and even queso! My one friend got the burger which was good but a little overcooked. The fries it came with were perfectly crispy and seasoned.  Service was good - our server was running late initially, but sent someone over to give us some waters. Afterwards, they were attentive checking in on us.  Overall exceeded our expectations, especially on a busy weekend. Would definitely come again!

reviews.author: Courtney P.
reviews.description: The place was eclectic and fun. Customer service was great, the view was great. The food came out quickly but it was bland, fries were old and kind of cold. Not really impressed. If you want to eat okay food with an amazing view then this is the spot.

reviews.author: Kristin L.
reviews.description: The views you get from this restaurant are incredible! I highly recommend sitting outside.  I've been here a couple of times, but for some reason today was extra tasty! I just ordered a cheese quesadilla, with all the toppings on the side, and some chips and queso. Both were delicious! Honestly, they were the best cheese quesadillas I've ever had, and this is coming from an extremely picky eater who lives off of things like cheese quesadillas and cheese pizza; I've tried a lot of different cheese quesadillas and these were THE best. Tons of cheese, and the blend of whatever cheeses they used work so well together. The queso was creamy and rich. I couldn't get enough of either!!  The service was super quick and I didn't have any issues with rude behavior, like I see a lot of in the reviews. I guess it just depends what day you go? I came on a Sunday at about 3pm, and there were plenty of tables along with fast and friendly service.  The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because I do agree with other Yelpers on the pricing being a little high. But only for certain items. (Check the menu out online beforehand if you're curious)  I definitely recommend you try this place at least once and judge for yourself on whether it's worth while or not; it definitely is to me!

reviews.author: Thao N.
reviews.description: The views of Lake Travis from The Oasis make the trip here worthwhile. Definitely seems like a touristy spot serving very average Tex-Mex. Our server was excellent despite the kitchen messing up our order and how hectic/busy it was even for a Thursday night. Food came out before the drinks, and the children's' food came out much later than the adults' food. The shrimp tacos were surprising good (4/5). The fajitas weren't bad (3/5) but due to the current onion recall, it was missing onions and just didn't feel the same. I had the frozen mango margarita which was strong and not too sweet.   Food: 3.5/5 Service: 5/5 Views: 5/5

reviews.author: Scarlett T.
reviews.description: At Oasis on Lake Travis the view is absolutely breathtaking and super relaxing to enjoy the Sun and view. First time here and this place is jam packed with people before dinner rush. I came here around 4:30pm and all of the outside tables were full. The wait was about 45 minutes. I went to get a strawberry margarita at the bar and walked down to the below deck to enjoy the view. It was so relaxing!!! (The strawberry margarita mixture was extremely sweet and over priced. Personally I wouldn't order that again.)   Skip forward to being seated to our outside table.... Everyone was packed in the area with tables and seats like sardines in a can. I had to be careful not to hit the person sitting behind me when fulling my chair out. It was not a comfortable setting at all. I ordered a cheese burger with fries and queso with chips and salsa. The salsa was pretty tasty and the chips were super crispy! The queso needed to be more cheesy. It's melty but oddly isn't cheesy enough. Very strange. The burger was a one star. Not well seasoned and lacking of everything. It was very very very sad. The fries were crispy but came out cold. Service was really great! Our waiter was top notched and provided excellent service. He was attentive and checked on us often. Five stars for service but the food was subpar for such a beautiful view. If you are a foodie and came here for the food.... You will be disappointed. If you don't care to eat and just want to get a over priced snack and drinks to enjoy the view ... this maybe your place.

reviews.author: Randi J.
reviews.description: Atmosphere was a bit chaotic so many tourist and was at change of shift. Very noisy. The service was slow at first then once waitress came was very attentive. Food was not bad, much better than expected and frozen margaritas were really good. Food came VERY quick which was surprising. Obviously a cool place to come being on the lake and a gotta try if in area. Food cost pretty pricey.

reviews.author: Anna W.
reviews.description: We stopped by here for lunch on a Tuesday afternoon. The mixed fajitas were amazing and they came out super fast after we had ordered. The view of the lake during our meal really made our whole experience beautiful!

reviews.author: Thomas M.
reviews.description: I have tried to reach out to the Oasis.  Via email, phone, voicemail, LInkedIn.  I have received no response, no acknowledgement over the past two weeks.  I will not go into details here, but I witnessed a very serious health and safety violation during my visit.  Cannot recommend.  Gorgeous setting, however, and I really, really wanted to write a great review for this place.

reviews.author: Lohgan S.
reviews.description: I'd give 5 stars for the view! Definitely worth visiting if you're in the area and want to feel like you're by the beach. The food isn't the worst but it's not the best. I'm sure time of day matters. We went earlier in the day so I'm sure that's the best the experience gets. The server was nice and attentive. The fries came cold which was surprising as they just opened less than an hour ago. However, the ambience is good and I know the pandemic tanked many businesses who are struggling to provide staffing which impedes service. When we visit restaurants we have to remember we are still in a pandemic and businesses are recovering.

reviews.author: Glenda W.
reviews.description: The place is absolutely stunning because of the view. Other than that, it really doesn't have much else to offer. The food was average, at best. The menu is small and pretty basic, similar to Tex-mex diner food. We had guacamole and queso for appetizers and shrimp tacos, classic burger and steak fajita for entrees. We also had drinks Tropical Depression and Margarita. I was not impressed by the menu, the taste of the food (lacked flavor) or the drinks (lacked liquor). The service was good and the view. I'd recommend only for the experience but I would not go back.

reviews.author: Jane M.
reviews.description: The only reason anyone would come here would be for the views! The restaurant was empty when we walked in on a Tuesday evening. The food dint look appealing and the drinks seemed over priced. The outdoor is really good overlooking Lake Travis. Awesome view but the food and drinks are not that great. Service is okay. It took them a while to realize we were seated and waited to be attended to. I would recommend skipping this place, bring your own food and enjoy the free views from the adjacent building!

reviews.author: Cristian S.
reviews.description: The place has amazing views to the lake and the food is ok. We had fun here at night.

reviews.author: Diana N.
reviews.description: Super cute, cozy, and clean BandB. One of the more reasonably priced places in Wimberley. Located right off the Square so easy walking distance to restaurants, shops, and the creek. I recommend Kiss the Cook (souvenirs, kitchen gadgets, coffee, etc) and Wimberley Cafe (good burgers and pie). The courtyard is beautifully decorated and relaxing. Plenty of FREE breakfast and pre-packaged snacks available even during COVID (cereal, Nutri-grain and Nature Valley bars, Chewy bars, muffins, coffee, orange juice, apple juice, pudding packs, fruit cups, yogurt, chips, milk and water for $1).  Stayed in the Maeson room. You have to exit the home into the courtyard to access this room, but I liked the privacy. Very comfortable king size bed, fresh linens, very spacious room w/ mini fridge, microwave, and tv, not much counter space in the bathroom though. Hosts were incredibly nice and welcoming. I would return!

reviews.author: Christina Z.
reviews.description: My sister got married last week in Wimberly, TX. Our family thought, "this is so random". Neither of the families lived there and most of us had never heard of Wimberly. Then my sister said she had booked us at The Square Inn and gave us room arrangements.   I had flown in leaving MD at 4 am then getting to Dallas and then drove an hour. It felt like it was 5 in the afternoon but in reality it was 11am.   We walk into the Square Inn and was greeted by the owners. It never even hit my mind from the crazy traveling, check in was at 3 PM. To be honest I didnt think about it till others said there hotels would not let them early check in.   When meeting the owners, it felt like family. It almost felt like we were all coming home. They were so great. They let us in early and was cool enough to say, "we need to run out before the others come, you are in charge."   The whole place was beautiful and amazing. Every room was perfect for single friends, to my other sisters and my crazy, but loveable nephews. Mr. Loyd one of the owners was like a natural grandfather with letting the boys run around but also telling them to close the door to keep AC inside. Lol  My favorite spot was the court yard. It looks like something out of a movie. Plus when it rains you can sit and watch the rain hit the roof. It's so peaceful.   So on top of a friendly, welcoming, beautiful space to stay and socialize, they also cook breakfast. Let me tell you it was the best food I have ever had at a bed and breakfast place.   We could smell the bacon at 6 am. Yum yum   So hands down this is place to stay in Wimberly. Its walking distance of all the cool shops and places to eat in town.

reviews.author: Ali R.
reviews.description: Cons: * There were mosquitoes CONSTANTLY flying around our room. We never left the door open, so I don't know how they kept coming in. (This was the biggest con) * When we placed the "service our room" card on our door, no one ever came to fix the bed or resupply fresh towels. We were gone for like the whole day, and no one came, so that wasn't nice * The water pressure in the shower was too hard * The bathroom floor would get soaking wet anytime we took a shower because the curtain wouldn't stay closed all the way to prevent the water from going outside the tub. * When they gave us the wifi password they spelled it with a capital T, but really it was all lowercase, so we had a hard time getting the WiFi to work until we called the front desk.   Pros: * it is within walking distance to all the little stores and Wimberley cafe. * the staff is friendly. * The price of the room is reasonable   They just need to fix all the cons listed, and I think they would have a fine place to stay. Very unique and quirky. Also, I do think it would be nice if they had cable television.

reviews.author: Chelsie B.
reviews.description: Really neat place, would love to stay here again. Very clean and friendly folks. Peaceful and quite. About a 3 min walk to nearby restaurants and bars.

reviews.author: Arnold G.
reviews.description: Okay. We ended up in wimberley on the coldest days of the year for my wife's 50th birthday. We arrived on Thursday and joined by our two adult sons. We were lucky to have made reservations at the Square Inn.  This place is quaint and hip at the same time.  Our room/suite was large and clean and really comfy.  The staff and owners were great and accommodating. We had to leave early due to the weather so we really couldn't enjoy all of the amenities, but we r definitely going to return. The Square Inn is a great choice for being close to the Square. Lots of great places to walk to and enjoy. Can't wait to go back and we will absolutely b staying at the Square Inn. Thx for making our short stay so pleasurable.

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: My sister and her husband stayed here while visiting from Spain. They loved Everything about it ,  especially the super comfy bed.  Breakfast was delicious

reviews.author: Peachy S.
reviews.description: Fun, quiet place to stay. Fantastic location. Owners were really friendly and the breakfasts were amazing. They even accommodated my dietary restrictions!! Definitely will be back!!

reviews.author: Kimberleigh S.
reviews.description: My man did very well finding this BandB for our short stay in Wimberley. I don't know which was better, the gracious hospitality of the owners' and their family or our very comfortable room. The breakfast, served from 0800-1000 is also awesome. We stayed in the "Lauren" room located by the back patio area. The entire establishment is quiet and clean and I loved having a mini fridge in the room. The Inn is centrally located and quaint shops and restaurants are right outside the door. We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.author: Chuck M.
reviews.description: Nice location just off the main square. Great location to explore the Wimberley area from.  Well kept, nicely appointed rooms. Owner is very attentive and courteous.  Excellent pricing, often lower than other BandB's in the area.  I stayed a night mid-week. If you want to stay over the weekend, make your reservations early. It often fills up on the weekend. My room was off the patio in the back, the patio was a nice place to relax.

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: The Square Inn was perfect for my husband and I's Anniversary Getaway.  The staff was very helpful and welcoming.  Wonderful breakfast served every morning with plenty of shopping steps away. Our room was warm and quaint - bathrooms with recent update and decor.  We loved that the BandB had 24 hour come and go as you need as we were attending a wedding outside of town. Each room felt like it had it's own private oasis as it faced in to a beautiful courtyard area to sit and drink your morning coffee or a glass of wine. We can't wait to visit Wimberley again and stay at this adorable little BandB!

reviews.author: Chris G.
reviews.description: Fantastic! Feels just like Wimberley: quaint and welcoming! The room was spacious, very clean, and well cooled even during the hot summer sun. All the details were great: towels were fresh and soft, wifi was fast, bed was comfortable, shampoo was even great!   But the location was amazing! Right on the square, so my wife and I literally walked almost everywhere! If we needed to refresh our drink, we simply walked back to the room. No problem!   Now the food. Breakfast is served daily and is delicious! In addition, they have a great selection of coffees, teas, and cocoas! Snacks like chips, pound cake, muffins, granola bars, microwave popcorn, etc. were available all day.   Can't say enough good things about this gem! Wouldn't change a thing!

reviews.author: Cindy M.
reviews.description: This is a great place to stay in wimberly. The couple the manage the BandB are charming and attentive. This place is like home and has a lovely covered patio. Short walking distance to shops and resturants. Very clean and tidy rooms with mini ref and microwave. A must stay at reasonable rates.

reviews.author: Stephaney G.
reviews.description: this is the worst service I've ever received at a bed and breakfast. They took 20 mins to show up at the front desk when we arrived. they are charging us for damages they refuse to show us documents of. i went back and forth emailing the so called staff there and she told me she didn't have time for my problems. when I asked for her bosses number she gave me her fiances number. which, big surprise was no help because he would only side with her. he said hes the gm and theirs no higher position then him which is a lit because every gm has a boss and while we were there a lady was talking to them about things they needed changed who i'm assuming is Marcilia B. the owner. also the couple who runs the place was arguing so loud while we were there we could hear it from our room, when i went to see what was going on i saw her yelling at him.There was NEVER anyone at the front desk the whole time we were there and they lied about their medicine variety they claim to have. I'm pregnant and can only have Tylenol which the claimed they had in their "large variety" which only consisted of off brand aspirin. when i emailed them asking for documents all they did was argue with me (a customer) instead of trying to resolve the problem. I don't recommend  to anyone to stay here or waste your money because you will only get horrible service. DO NOT GO HERE WASTE OF MONEY.

reviews.author: Renee G.
reviews.description: Loved this place it was perfect for our large family. The food was great for breakfast. The outdoor patio was so comfortable and amazing. Thanks for the lovely well decorated rooms and comfortable beds.

reviews.author: Stephanie H.
reviews.description: My mother and I spent one night at the Square Inn. They were extremely accommodating even though we could only spend one night when they normally have a two night minimum. The room was very spacious,  decorated perfectly and very clean. The inn was fully booked but you wouldn't even know it because it was so nice and quiet. We felt as though we had the whole place to ourselves. The owners are so very nice and informative. The inn is walking distance to many shops and dining options. We weren't able to stay for breakfast but it smelled delicious. We will definitely be going back!!

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: A girlfriend and I recently stayed here one night and had a really nice time.  It was super clean and the inn keepers Keegan and Meg were very friendly hosts.  It was very quiet at night and our beds were very comfortable.  Also, you can't beat the location for walking to the shops and restaurants.

reviews.author: Jon R.
reviews.description: Myself and my fiancee recently visited Square Inn, and were very pleased with our stay.  The Lauren Room was clean, with warm, rustic interiors and a fabulously comfortable king-size bed.  The patio located just a few steps from our door was spacious; nice place to hang out before venturing to either Marco's Italian or Cypress Creek for dinner (both restaurants, by the way..  wonderful).  Square Inn is walking distance from some truly amazing dining, along with quaint knick knack shops (soaps, candy, etc.)-- not to mention you're swimming the Blanco, or tasting at Wimberley Valley Winery, in just a few minutes' drive.  Can't beat that.  Which reminds me: amenities included a big-screen t.v. in the common area, a decent library of DVD'S, an Xbox 360 game console with games, and complimentary wine in the afternoon and evenings.  Really, really nice being able to wind down for the night with a movie, and a glass or two from Duchman Winery.   Marci, our innkeeper at Square Inn, was very friendly, and courteous, even during a fluke front-door locking mechanism malfunction which resulted in our having to wake her up.

reviews.author: Blanca G.
reviews.description: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay.  Very cozy, quiet and comfortable.  Loved that it was walking distance to all the shops. The owners were very friendly!  Enjoyed our *Cowboy Casserole*!

reviews.author: Johnny j.
reviews.description: This is a quiet little place with 6 rooms.  The innkeeper, Marci, serves breakfast every morning in the common area.  According to her, this place is a labor of love, and it shows.  The beds are comfortable and the atmosphere is peaceful.  I will definitely be staying again next spring.  If you are visiting Wimberly for the Square, the inn is literally a stone's throw away.
